Unit 1:
moment [n.] – soniya, lahza, on, zum
🔺>>A moment is a second or a very short time. >>Moment bu juda qisqa vaqt.

– I was only a few moments late for the meeting.
– Men uchrashuvga bor yo’g’i bir necha soniyaga kech qoldim.

clever [adj.] – aqlli, ziyrak
🔺>>When someone is clever, they can solve a hard puzzle or problem. >>Agar kimdir clever bo’lsa, u qiyin jumboq yoki muammolarni hal qila oladi.

– The clever boy thought of a good idea.
– Aqlli bola yaxshi g’oya o’yladi.

hunt [v.] – ov qilmoq, ovlamoq
🔺>>To hunt is to look for or search for an animal to kill. >>Hunt bu o’ldirish uchun hayvon qidirmoq degani.

– Long ago, people hunted with bows and arrows.
– Qadimda odamlar kamon va o’q bilan ov qilishgan.

agree [v.] — rozi bo'lmoq, fikriga qo'shilmoq
🔺»To agree is to say “yes” or to think the same way. »Rozi bo'lmoq biror narsaga "Ha" demoq yoki bir xil fikrda bo'lmoq.

— A: The food is very good in that restaurant. B: I agree  with you.
— A: Haligi restorandagi ovqat juda yaxshi ekan. B: Ha, fikringga qo'shilaman.

arrive [v.] — qaytib kelmoq, kelmoq
🔺»To arrive is to get to or reach some place. »Qaytib kelmoq bu biror narsaga yoki biror joyga yetishmoq.

— The bus always arrives at the corner of my street at 4:00.
— Avtobus doim soat 4.00 da ko'chamizning burchagiga qaytib keladi.

promise [v.] – va’da bermoq
🔺>>To promise is to say you will do something for sure. >>Promise bu siz biror narsani albatta bajarishingizni aytishingizdir.

– He promised to return my key by tomorrow.
– U kalitimni ertaga qaytarib berishni va’da berdi.

cruel [adj.] – shafqatsiz, berahm
🔺>>When someone is cruel, they do bad things to hurt others. >>Agar kimdir cruel bo’lsa, u boshqalarni jarohatlagani yomon ishlar qiladi.

– The cruel man yelled at his sister.
– Berahm odam singlisiga baqirdi.

bottom [n.] – tag, pastki qism
🔺>>The bottom is the lowest part. >>Bottom pastki qismni anglatadi.

– The bottom of my shoe has a hole in it.
– Poyafzalimning pastki qismida teshigi bor.

trick [v.] – xiyla, nayrang; focus
🔺>>A trick is something you do to fool another person. >>Trick bu biror kishini aldash uchun qilingan narsa.

– His card trick really surprised us.
– Uning o‘yin kartasi bilan qilgan fokusi bizni chindan hayratga soldi.

safe [adj.] – xavfsiz, behatar
🔺>>When a person is safe, they are not in danger. >>Qachonki odam safe bo’lsa, u xavf ostida bo’lmaydi.

– Put on your seat belt in the car to be safe.
– Xavfsiz bo’lish uchun mashinada xavfsizlik kamarini taqing.

finally [adv.] – axiyri, vanihoyat
🔺>>If something happens finally, it happens after a long time or at the end. >>Agar biror narsa finally sodir bo’lsa, u uzoq vaqtdan keyin yoki oxirida sodir bo’lgan bo’ladi.

– He finally crossed the finish line after five hours of running.
– U besh soatlik yugurishdan so’ng vanihoyat finish chizig’ini kesib o’tdi.

middle [n.] – o’rta
🔺>>The middle of something is the center or halfway point. >>Biror narsaning middle qismi uning markazi yoki yarimini bildiradi.

– The Canadian flag has a maple leaf in the middle of it.
– Kanada bayrog’ining o’rtasida chinor bargi bor.

attack [v.] – hujum qilmoq, hujum uyushtirmoq
🔺>>To attack is to try to fight or to hurt. >>Attack bu jarohatlashga yoki urushishga urinish degani.

– The man with the sword attacked the other man first.
– Qilichli odam boshqa odamga birinchi bo’lib hujum qildi.

pleased [adj.] – hursand, mamnun
🔺>>When someone is pleased, they are happy. >>Qachonki birortasi pleased bo’lsa u hursand bo’ladi.

– She was pleased with the phone call she received.
– U javob bergan telefon qo’ng’irog’idan mamnun edi.

hide [v.] – yashirinmoq, berkinmoq
🔺>>To hide is to try not to let others see you. >>Hide bu boshqalarga ko’rinmaslikka urinishdir. 

– The other children will hide while you count to 100.
– Sen yuzgacha sanaguningcha boshqa bolalar berkinadi.

well [adv.] – yaxshi
🔺>>You use well to say that something was done in a good way. >>Siz well ni biror narsa yaxshi bajarilganini aytish uchun ishlatasiz.

– The couple can dance quite well.
– Juftlik juda yaxshi raqsga tusha oladi.

reply [v.] – javob bermoq
🔺>>To reply is to give an answer or say back to someone. >>Reply bu birortasiga javob qaytarmoq degani.

– She asked him what time his meeting was. He replied, “at three.”
– U (qiz bola) undan (o’g’il bola) uning uchrashuvi qachonligini so’radi. U “uchda”, deb javob berdi.

angry [adj.] — jahli chiqqan, badjahl
🔺»When  someone is angry, they may want to speak loudly or fight. »Agar birortasini jahli chiqsa, u baland gapirgisi yoki urushgisi keladi.

— She didn’t do her homework,  so her father is angry.
— U uy vazifasini qilmadi, shuning uchun dadasining jahli chiqqan.

afraid [adj.] — qo'rqqan, cho'chigan
🔺»When someone is afraid, they feel fear. »Agar kimdir qo'rqsa, qo'rquv his qiladi.

— The woman was afraid of what she saw.
— Boyagi ayol ko'rgan narsasidan qo'rqib ketdi.

lot [n.] – juda ko’p
🔺>>A lot means a large number or amount of people, animals, things, etc. >>Lot juda ko’p sonli yoki ko’p miqdordagi odamlar, hayvonlar, narsalar va boshqalarni bildiradi.

– There are a lot of apples in the basket.
– Savatda juda ko’p miqdordagi olmalar bor.
Unit 2:
project [n.] – yumush, maxsus topshiriq; loyiha
🔺>> A project is a type of work that you do for school or a job. >> Project maktab yoki ish uchun qilinadigan yumush turlaridan biri.

– His afternoon work project was to paint the room green.
– Uning tushlikdagi ish topshirig’i xonani yashilga bo’yash edi.

loud [adj.] – shovqinli, baland
🔺>> If a sound is loud, it is strong and very easy to hear. >> Agar ovoz loud bo’lsa, u juda kuchli yoki eshitishga juda oson bo’ladi.

– The man’s voice was so loud that we all could hear him.
– Haligi kishining ovozi shunchalik baland ediki, hammamiz eshita olar edik.

laboratory [n.] – laboratoriya
🔺>> A laboratory is a room where a scientist works. >> Laboratoriya bu olim ishlaydigan xona.

– My mother works in a laboratory.
– Mening onam laboratoriyada ishlaydi.

chemical  [n.] – kimyoviy modda
🔺>> A chemical is something that scientists use in chemistry. >> Chemical bu olimlar kimyo sohasida foydalanadigan narsa.

– The scientist mixed the chemicals.
– Olim kimyoviy moddalarni aralashtirdi.

terrible [adj.] – juda yomon
🔺>> If something is terrible, it is very bad. >> Agar biror narsa terrible bo’lsa, u juda yomon holatda bo’ladi.

– The way he treated his classmate was terrible.
– Uning sinfdoshiga bo’lgan munosabati juda yomon edi.

kill  [v.] – o’ldirmoq
🔺>> To kill someone or something is to make them die. >> Birortasi yoki biror nimani kill qilmoq uni o’ldirmoq degani.

– I killed the fly with a fly swatter.
– Men pashsha o’ldiradigan bilan pashshani o’ldirdim.

scare [v.] – qo’rqitmoq, daxshatga solmoq
🔺>> To scare someone is to make them feel afraid. >> Birortasini scare qilmoq uni qo’rqitmoq degani.

– My uncle was scared by what he saw in the room.
– Amakim xonadagi ko’rgan narsasidan qo’rqib ketgan edi.

carefully [adv.] – e’tibor bilan, ehtiyotkorlik bilan
🔺>> Carefully means with great attention, especially to detail or safety. >> Carefully katta diqqat bilan degan ma’noni anglatadi, asosan xavfsizlik uchun.

– The baby carefully climbed down the stairs.
– Chaqaloq ehtiyotkorik bilan zinalardan pastga tushdi.

approach [v.] – yaqinlashmoq, yaqin kelmoq
🔺>> To approach something means to move close to it. >> Biror narsaga approach qilish u narsaga yaqin kelishni anglatadi.

– The boy approached his school.
– Bola maktabiga yaqinlashdi.

experiment [n.] – tajriba, sinov
🔺>> An experiment is a test that you do to see what will happen. >> Experiment bu nima sodir bo’lishini ko’rish uchun qilingan tajriba degani.

– The student did an experiment in science class.
– Talaba ilmiy xonada tajriba qildi.

secret [n.] – sir
🔺>> A secret is something that you do not tell other people. >> Secret siz boshqa odamlarga aytmaydigan narsa.

– The two boys were sharing a secret.
– Ikki bola sirlarini bir-birlariga aytayotgan edi.

laugh [n.] – kulgi
🔺>> Laugh is the sound  made when someone is happy or a funny thing occurs. >> Laugh bu birortasi hursand bo’lganda yoki birorta zavqli voqea sodir bo’lganda chiqariladigan ovoz.

– The sound of their laugh filled the room.
– Ular kulgisining ovozi xonani to’ldirdi.

nervous [adj.] – havotirlangan, havotirga tushgan
🔺>> When a person is nervous, they think something bad will happen. >> Qachonki odam nervous bo’lsa, u biror yomon narsa sodir bo’ladi deb o’ylaydi.

– The boy became nervous when he heard the news.
– Bola yangiliklarni eshitgandan so’ng havotirga tushdi.

create [v.] – yaratmoq, yasamoq
🔺>> To create means to make something new. >> Create biror yangi narsa yasashni anglatadi.

– She created an igloo from blocks of snow.
– U qorli bloklardan (g’isht) uycha yaratdi.

worse [adj.] – yomonroq
🔺>> If something is worse, it is of poorer quality than another thing. >> Agar biror narsa worse bo’lsa, u boshqa narsaga nisbatan yomonroq (bechoraroq) holatda bo’ladi.

– Business was worse this month than last month.
– Biznes o’tgan oydagiga nisbatan bu oy yomonroq bo’ldi.

shout [v.] – baqirmoq, qichqirmoq
🔺>> To shout is to say something loudly. >> Shout biror narsani baland ovozda aytmoq degani.

– My boss shouted at me because I was  late for work.
– Xo’jayinim menga baqirdi, chunki ishga kech qolgan edim.

smell [v.] – hidlamoq, hidlab ko’rmoq
🔺>> To smell something means to use your nose to sense it. >> Smell biror narsani his qilish uchun burunni ishlatishni bildiradi.

– The two friends smelled the flower.
– Ikki do’st gulni hidladi.

noise [n.] – shovqin, yoqimsiz ovoz
🔺>> A noise is an unpleasant sound. >> Noise yoqimsiz ovoz degani.

– The crying baby made a loud noise.
– Yig’layotgan chaqaloq baland shovqin chiqardi.

evil [adj.] – yomon, yovuz
🔺>> Evil describes something or someone bad or cruel, not good. >> Evil biror narsa yoki biror kimni yomon, yovuz, yaxshi emas deb tasvirlaydi.

– The evil figure scared us all.
– Yovuz siymo hammamizni daxshatga soldi.

adventure [n.] – sarguzasht
🔺>> An adventure is a fun or exciting thing that you do. >> Adventure bu siz qiladigan zavqli narsani bildiradi.

– Riding in the rough water was an adventure.
– To’lqinli (notekis) suvda surfing uchish sarguzasht edi.
Unit 3:
comprehend [v.] – tushunmoq, anglamoq
🔺>> To comprehend something is to understand it. >> Biror narsani comprehend qilish u narsani tushunishni anglatadi.

– Henry could not comprehend the message.
– Genri xatni (smsni) tushuna olmadi.

suppose [v.] – deb o’ylamoq, tahmin qilmoq
🔺>> To suppose is to guess. >> Suppose tahmin qilmoq degani.

– I suppose I should go home now.
– Menimcha, hozir uyga ketsam yaxshi bo’ladi.

ever [adv.] – qachon bo’lmasin; ilgari
🔺>> Ever means at any time. >> Ever qachon bo’lmasin degan ma’noni anglatadi.

– Going skiing last winter was the most fun I’ve ever had.
– O’tgan qishda chang’i uchishga borish qachon bo’lmasin ko’rgan eng zavqli kunim edi.

describe [v.] – tasvirlamoq
🔺>> To describe is to say or write what someone or something is like. >> Describe biror narsa kimga yoki nimaga o’xshash ekanligini aytish yoki yozish degani.

– They described their tree as colorful with gold ribbon and a star.
– Ular daraxtlarini oltin lenta va yulduzcha bilan rang-barang deb ta’rifladilar.

solve [v.] – yechmoq, javob topmoq
🔺>> To solve something is to find an answer to it. >> Solve bu biror narsaga javob topmoq degani.

– All the students could easily solve the math problem.
– Barcha o’quvchilar matematik misolni osonlik bilan yecha oldi.

grade [n.] - baho
🔺>> A grade is a score or mark given to someone’s work. >> Grade birortasining ishiga berilgan baho yoki daraja.

– I managed to get good grades on my report card.
– Hisobot kartamda yaxshi baho olishga muvaffaq bo’ldim.

universe [n.] – koinot
🔺>> The universe is the known or supposed objects in space. >> Universe osmondagi bilgan yoki tahmin qilingan narsalar.

– The universe is so large that it cannot be measured.
– Koinot shunchalik kattaki, o’lchab bo’lmaydi.

among [prep.] – orasida, ichida
🔺>> If you are among certain things, they are all around you. >> Agar siz ma’lum narsalar ichida bo’lsangiz, ular hammasi atrofingizda bo’ladi.

– There was a red apple among the green ones.
– Ko’k olmalar ichida qizil olma bor edi.

library [n.] – kutubxona
🔺>> A library is a place where you go to read books. >> Library – kitob o’qigani boriladigan joy.

– The library at school is full of books.
– Maktabdagi kutubxona kitoblar bilan to’la.

suddenly [adv.] – to’satdan, kutilmaganda, birdaniga
🔺>> If something happens suddenly, it happens quickly and unexpectedly. >> Agar biror narsa suddenly sodir bo’lsa u tez va kutilmaganda sodir bo’ladi.

– I was suddenly surprised by the cake my friends brought me.
– Do’stlarim sotib olgan pirog meni to’satdan hursand qildi.

cloud [n.] – bulut
🔺>> A cloud is a group of water drops in the sky. >> Cloud – osmondagi suv tomchilarining yig’indisi.

– The sky was filled with white clouds.
– Osmon oq bulutlarga to’la edi.

view [v.] – qaramoq, ko’rmoq
🔺>> To view is to look at something. >> View biror narsaga qaramoq degani.

– Michael likes to view himself in the mirror.
– Maykl oynada o’zini tomosha qilishni yaxshi ko’radi.

chart [n.] – diagramma
🔺>> A chart is a list of information. >> Chart bu ma’lumotlar yig’indisi.

– We used a chart to see how we had improved.
– Biz qanchalik rivojlanganimizni ko’rish uchun diagrammadan foydalandik.

several [adj.] – bir talay, bir necha
🔺>> Several is more than two but not many. >> Several ikkitadan ko’p lekin juda ham ko’p emas degani.

– He had to read several books for class.
– U maktab darsi uchun bir qancha kitoblar o’qishga majbur bo’ldi.

friendly [adj.] – mehribon, g’amxo’r; do’stona
🔺>> Friendly is behaving in a pleasant, kind way toward someone. >> Friendly birortasiga nisbatan yoqimli mehribon munosabatda bo’lishni anglatadi.

– The friendly animals came up to the girl.
– Do’stona hayvonlar qizning yoniga kelishdi.

planet [n.] – planeta, sayyora
🔺>> A planet is a large round thing in space. >> Planet osmondagi ulkan aylana narsa.

– Saturn is the planet with the ring around it.
– Saturn atrofida halqasi bor sayyora.

fail [v.] – muvaffaqiyatsizlikka uchramoq
🔺>> To fail means you do not succeed in what you try to do. >> Fail siz nimani qilishga harakat qilgan bo’lsangiz unda muvaffaqiyatga uchramasligingizni anglatadi.

– Since he failed to get the job, he was sad.
– U ishga kirishda muvaffaqiyatsizlikka uchraganligi sababli g’amgin edi.

alien [n.] – o’zga sayyoralik
🔺>> An alien is a creature from a different world. >> Alien – boshqa dunyodan kelgan mavjudod.

– The alien  came in peace.
– O’zga sayyoralik tinchlik bilan keldi.

instead [adv.] – o’rniga
🔺>> Instead means in place of. >> Instead o’rniga degan ma’noni anglatadi.

– He ate the carrot instead of the ice cream.
– U muzqaymoq o’rniga sabzi yedi.

report [n.] – hisobot, o’quvchi tabeli
🔺>> A report is something students write for school. >> Report bu o’quvchilar maktab uchun yozadigan narsa.

– Karen had trouble writing her report.
– Karen tabelini yozishga qiynaldi.
Unit 4:
patient [adj.] – sabrli, toqatli
🔺>> If a person is patient, they don’t become angry or upset easily. >> Agar inson patient bo’lsa, u osonlikcha hafa bo’lmaydi, jahli chiqmaydi.
 
– I had to be patient and wait until 5 o’clock to leave.
– Men sabrli bo’lishga majbur bo’ldim va ketish uchun soat 5 gacha kutdim.

content [adj.] – xursand, shod
🔺>> To be content is to be happy and not want more. >> Content bo’lish bu xursand bo’lish yoki bundan ortig’ini xohlamaslik degani.
 
– The baby looked very content sitting on the floor.
– Chaqaloq polda o’tirgancha juda mamnun qaradi.

stroll [v.] – sayr qilmoq, aylanib kelmoq
🔺>> To stroll means to walk slowly and calmly. >> Stroll sekin va hotirjam yurishni anglatadi.
 
– My dog and I strolled through the park today.
– Men itim bilan park bo’ylab sayr qildik.

appropriate [adj.] – mos, to’g’ri, muvofiq
🔺>> When a thing is appropriate, it is right or normal. >> Agar biror narsa appropriate bo’lsa, u to’g’ri yoki normal bo’ladi.
 
– It’s appropriate to wear a suit when you go to the office.
– Offisga borishga kastyum-shim mos keladi.

expect [v.] – umid qilmoq, ishonmoq, kutmoq
🔺>> If you expect something to happen, you believe it will happen. >> Agar siz biror narsa sodir bo’lishini expect qilsangiz, u narsa sodir bo’lishiga ishonasiz.
 
– I expect the bus to be here very soon.
– Aftobus juda tez orada shu yerda bo’lishiga umid qilaman.

avoid [v.] – yaqinlashmaslik, chetda turmoq, o’zini olib qochmoq
🔺>> To avoid something is to stay away from it. >> Biror narsadan avoid qilish u narsadan chetda turishni anglatadi.
 
– Avoid the broken bottle on the floor.
– Poldagi singan shishadan uzoqroq tur.

positive [adj.] – ijobiy, porloq
🔺>> If something is positive, it is good. >> Agar birortasi positive bo’lsa, bu yaxshu degani.
 
– She has a positive future ahead of her after finishing college.
– U kollejni bitirganidan so’ng uning porloq kelajagi bor.

behave [v.] – o’zini tutmoq, odob saqlamoq
🔺>> To behave is to act in a particular way, especially to be good. >> Behave biror taraflama o’zini tutmoq degani, asosan yaxshi taraflama.
 
– She always behaves well when her father is around.
– U otasining atrofida ekanligida o’zini yaxshi tutadi.

instruct [v.] – ta’lim bermoq; ko’rsatma bermoq
🔺>> To instruct is to teach. >> Instruct ta’lim bermoq degani.
 
– My teacher instructs us in several subjects.
– O’qituvchim bizga bir qancha fanlardan ta’lim beradi.

frequently [adv.] – tez-tez
🔺>> When something happens frequently, it happens often. >> Agar biror narsa frequently sodir bo’lsa, u tez-tez sodir bo’ladi.
 
– We meet frequently, either at the beginning or ending of the week.
– Biz hafta oxirida yoki hafta boshida tez-tez ko’rishib turamiz.

punish [v.] - jazolamoq
🔺>> To punish means to make someone suffer for breaking the rules or laws. >> Punish bu birortasini qonun yoki qoidalarni buzganligi uchun aziyat chektirmoq degani.
 
– To punish me, my teacher had me stand in the corner.
– Jazolash maqsadi o’qituvchim meni burchakka turg’izib qo’ydi.

shake [v.] – silkitmoq, siltamoq; silkinmoq
🔺>> To shake is to move back and forth or up and down quickly. >> Shake tepaga va pastga yoki orqaga va oldinga tez qimirlatish
 
– When people shake hands, it usually means they agree.
– Agar odamlar qo’l silkitsa bu ular rozi ekanligini bildiradi.

habit [n.] - odat
🔺>> A habit is a thing that you do often. >> Habit siz tez-tez qilib turadigan narsa.
 
– Smoking is a bad habit that can kill you.
– Chekish sizni o’ldira oladigan yomon odat.

spread [v.] – tarqalmoq; surkamoq, surtmoq
🔺>> To spread is to move quickly to more places. >> Spread ko’p joyga tez tarqalib harakatlanishni bildiradi.
 
– I like to spread butter on my toast.
– Men o’zimning nonimga yog’ surtishni yaxshi ko’raman.

represent [v.] – vakil bo’lmoq, vakillik qilmoq
🔺>> To represent is to speak or act for a person or group. >> Represent birortasi yoki biror guruh uchun, uning nomidan gapirmoq yoki harakat qilmoq.
 
– My lawyer will represent me in court.
– Sudda meni nomimdan mening advokatim (huquqshunosim) vakillik qiladi.

concern [n.] – tashvish, g’am
🔺>> Concern is a feeling of worry. >> Concern havotirlanish tuyg’usi degani.
 
– I was filled with concern after reading the newspaper.
– Men gazetani o’qiganimdan so’ng tashvishga to’lib qolgan edim.

calm [adj.] – hotirjam, jim
🔺>> When someone is calm, they do not get excited or upset. >> Agar birortasi calm bo’lsa, u hursand emas yoki hafa bo’ladi.
 
– A nice warm bath makes me feel so calm.
– Yaxshi iliq dush meni juda hotirjam qiladi.

village [n.] – qishloq
🔺>> A village is a very small town. >> Village juda kichik shaharcha.
 
– There are only a few houses in my village.
– Mening qishlog’imda bor yo’g’i bir nechta uy bor xolos.

none [pron.] – hech qancha
🔺>> None means not any of someone or something. >> None biror narsa yoki biror kim hech qancha ekanligini anglatadi.
 
– He spent all his money. There is none left.
– U barcha pullarini ishlatib yubordi. Unda hech qancha pul qolmadi.

issue [n.] – masala, muammo
🔺>> An issue is an important topic. >> Issue muhim mavzu, masala degani.
 
– The men spoke about issues that were important to the people.
– Kishilar odamlar uchun muhim bo’lgan masalalar haqida gapirishdi.
Unit 5:
belong [v.] – tegishli bo’lmoq
🔺>> If something belongs to you, you own it. >> Agar biror narsa sizga belong bo’lsa, siz unga egalik qilasiz.
 
– The blue suit belongs to Paul.
– Ko’k kastyum Paulga tegishli.

request [v.] – so’ramoq
🔺>> To request something is to ask for it. >> Biror narsani request qilish o’sha narsani so’rashni anglatadi.
 
– The little girl requested a special gift from Santa Claus.
– Kichkina qizaloq Qorbobodan maxsus sovg’a so’radi.

aware [adj.] – xabardor, ogoh
🔺>> If you are aware of something, you know about it. >> Agar siz biror narsa haqida aware bo‘lsangiz, siz uni bilasiz.
 
– I was not aware of the ringing phone.
– Men jiringlayotgan telefondan xabardor emas edim.

judgment [n.] – qaror qabul qilish, fikr
🔺>> Judgment is the ability to form opinions or decisions. >> Judgment fikr va qarorlarni shakllantirish qobiliyati.
 
– It’s good judgment to recycle your aluminum cans.
– Alyuminiy qutilarini qayta ishlash yaxshi fikr.

relax [v.] – dam olmoq, hordiq chiqarmoq
🔺>> To relax is to rest. >> Relax dam olmoq degani.
 
– The frog relaxed in the warm sun.
– Baqa iliq quyosh ostida hordiq chiqardi.

badly [adv.] – yomon; jiddiy
🔺>> Badly means in a severe or harmful way. >> Badly og‘ir yoki zararli ma’nosini beradi.
 
– He hurt his arm badly playing with friends.
– U do‘stlari bilan o’ynab qo’lini yomon jarohatlab oldi.

experience [n.] – taassurot, kechinma
🔺>> An experience is something you have seen or done. >> Experience siz qilgan yoki ko’rgan narsa.
 
– Rock climbing was a fun experience.
– Cho’qqidan sakrash zavqli taassurot bo’ldi.

roll [v.] – yumalatmoq, dumalatmoq
🔺>> To roll is to move by turning over and over. >> Roll aylanish orqali harakatlanmoq.
 
– You must roll the ball into the pins when you bowl.
– Bouling o’ynayotganingizda sharni pinga qarata yumalatishingiz kerak.

reside [v.] – muayyan joyda yashamoq, istiqomat qilmoq
🔺>> To reside means to live somewhere permanently or for a long time. >> Reside biror joyda doimiy yoki uzoq muddat yashash degani.
 
– My brother and his family reside in a lovely house on the beach.
– Mening akam va oilasi sohildagi ajoyib uyda istiqomat qilishadi.

since [prep.] – -dan beri/buyon
🔺>> Since is used to talk about a past event still happening now. >> Since o’tganda sodir bo’lgan voqea hozirgacha sodir bo’layotganini aytish uchun ishlatiladi.
 
– Since 1992, he has been driving that car.
– 1992-yildan beri u o’sha mashinani haydaydi.

hurt [v.] – jarohatlamoq, jarohat yetkazmoq
🔺>> To hurt is to do something that makes you feel pain. >> Hurt sizga og’riqni his qildiradigan biror narsa qilish.
 
– She hurt her leg falling down the stairs.
– U zinadan pastga tushib ketib oyog’ini jarohatladi.

result [n.] – natija, oqibat
🔺>> A result is something that happens because of something else. >> Result biror narsaning natijasida sodir bo’ladigan narsa.
 
– As a result of all the rain, the man had to climb on the roof.
– Yomg’ir oqibati sabab haligi kishi tomga sakrab chiqishga majbur bo’ldi.

normal [adj.] – odatiy, har doimgi
🔺>> If something is normal, it is not strange nor surprising to you. >> Agar biror narsa normal bo’lsa, u g’alati ham sizni hayratlantiradigan ham emas.
 
– It is normal for me to bathe every night.
– Har kuni tunda cho’milish men uchun odatiy hol.

rare [adj.] – kamdan-kam; noyob, kamyob
🔺>> If something is rare, you do not see it very often. >> Agar biror narsa rare bo’lsa, siz uni juda tez-tez ko’rmaysiz.
 
– It is rare for him to miss his flight.
– U uchun uning parvozini unutib qo’yishi kamdan-kam holatdir.

error [n.] – xato
🔺>> An error is something you do wrong. >> Error bu siz xato qiladigan narsa.
 
– I made an error on my report, so my boss was angry.
– Men  hisobotimda xatoga yo’l qo’ydim, shuning uchun xo’jayinimning jahli chiqdi.

visible [adj.] – ko’zga ko’rinarli, ko’rinib turgan
🔺>> If something is visible, it can be seen. >> Agar biror narsa visible bo’lsa, uni ko’rish mumkin bo’ladi.
 
– The moon and stars were visible in the night sky.
– Oy hamda yulduzlar tungi osmonda ko’rinarli edi.

likely [adv.] – ehtimol, balki, mumkin
🔺>> If something likely happens, it will probably happen. >> Agar biror narsa likely sodir bo‘lsa, u sodir bo’lishi ehtimol bo’ladi.
 
– I will  likely  stay at home and watch TV tonight.
– Men bugun kechki payt ehtimol uyda qolaman va televizor ko’raman.

field [n.] – keng maydon, dala
🔺>> A field is a big area of land. >> Field katta yer maydoni.
 
– The field of flowers looked so pretty.
– Gullar dalasi juda ajoyib ko’rindi.

continue [v.] – davom etmoq; davom ettirmoq
🔺>> To continue something is to keep doing it. >> Biror narsani continue qilish u narsani qilishni davom etish degani.
 
– She stood under her umbrella as the rain continued to fall.
– Yomg’ir yog’ishni davom etganligi sababli u soyabonining tagida turdi.

wild [adj.] – yovvoyi
🔺>> If something is wild, it is found in nature. >> Agar biror narsa wild bo’lsa, u tabiatda uchraydi.
 
– You should be careful around a fox, because it is a wild animal.
– Sen tulkini atrofida ekanligingda ehtiyot bo’lishing kerak, chunki u yovvoyi hayvon.
Unit 6:
community [n.] – jamiyat, jamoa
🔺>> A community is a group of people who live together. >> Community birgalikda yashaydigan odamlar guruhi.
 
– The kids from my community usually play together.
– Mening jamoamdagi bolalar odatda birgalikda o’ynashadi.

pet [n.] – uy hayvoni
🔺>> A pet is an animal that lives with people. >> Pet odamlar bilan yashaydigan hayvon.
 
– Out of all my pets, the dog is my favorite.
– Mening uy hayvonlarim ichida it eng sevimlisi.

reach [v.] – yetib bormoq, yetib kelmoq
🔺>> To reach means to arrive at a place. >> Reach biror joyga borish degani.
 
– I was happy to finally reach my destination.
– Men vanihoyat yetib kelganimdan hursand edim.

upset [adj.] – hafa, tushkun
🔺>> To be upset is to be unhappy about something. >> Upset bo’lmoq bu biror narsadan hafa bo’lmoq degani.
 
– She was upset because she broke her toy.
– U hafa bo’ldi, chunki o’yinchog’ini sindirib qo’ydi.

choice [n.] – tanlash imkoniyati
🔺>> A choice is the act or possibility of picking something. >> Choice biror narsani tanlash harakati yoki imkoniyati.
 
– I had my choice of five doors to open.
– Mening beshta eshikni ochish imkoniyatim bor edi.

follow [v.] – ortidan bormoq, ergashmoq
🔺>> To follow means to go behind someone and go where they go. >> Follow birortasining ortidan borish va u qayerga borsa o’sha yerga borishni anglatadi.
 
– The little boy followed his mother home.
– Kichkina bola uyga ketishda onasiga ergashdi.

weather [n.] – ob-havo
🔺>> The weather is the condition of the air: hot, rainy, windy, etc. >> Weather havoning holati: issiq, yomg’irli, shamolli va h.k.
 
– The weather can be sunny, rainy, or cold.
– Ob-havo quyoshli, yomg’irli yoki sovuq bo’lishi mumkin.

dead [adj.] – o’lgan, o’lik
🔺>> To be dead is to not be alive. >> Dead bo’lmoq tirik bo’lmaslik degani.
 
– A dead person is usually buried in the ground.
– O’lgan inson odatda yerga ko’miladi.

advantage [n.] – ustun jihat, foyda
🔺>> An advantage is something that helps you. >> Advantage sizga yordam beradigan narsa.
 
– Being tall is an advantage to a  basketball player.
– Basketbolchi uchun uzun bo‘yli bo’lish foydali jihat hisoblanadi.

fright [n.] – qo’rquv, vahima
🔺>> Fright is the feeling of being scared. >> Fright bu qo’rquv tuyg’usi.
 
– She was filled with fright.
– U qo’rquvga to’la edi.

face [v.] – duch kelmoq, yuzlanmoq
🔺>> If you face a problem, you deal with it. >> Agar siz muammoga face bo’lsangiz, u bilan shug’ullanasiz.
 
– My sister and I have to find a better way to face our differences.
– Opam va men o’zaro kelishmovchiliklarga qarshi turishning eng yaxshi yo’liga yuzlanishimiz kerak.

distance [n.] – masofa
🔺>> The distance between two things is how far it is between them. >> Ikki narsa o’rtasidagi distance bu ular o’rasi qancha ekanligidir.
 
– The distance between the Earth and the Moon is 384,400 kilometers.
– Yer va Oy o’rtasidagi masofa 384,400 kilometrdir.

ghost [n.] – rux, arvoh
🔺>> A ghost is the spirit of a dead person. >> Ghost bu o’lgan odamning ruxi.
 
– Many people are afraid of ghosts.
– Ko’p odamlar arvohlardan qo’rqishadi.

survive [v.] – tirik qolmoq; saqlab qolmoq
🔺>> To survive is to stay alive. >> Survive tirik holatda qolmoq degani.
 
– My dog survived her fall into the water.
– Mening itim uni suvga cho’kib ketishidan saqlab qoldi.

voice [n.] – ovoz, tovush
🔺>> A voice is the sound a person makes when they talk or sing. >> Voice bu odam gapirganda yoki kuylaganda chiqadigan ovoz.
 
– He used a microphone, so everyone could hear his voice.
– U uning ovozini hamma eshitishi uchun mikrofondan foydalandi.

cause [v.] – sabab bo’lmoq
🔺>> To cause is to make something happen. >> Cause biror narsani sodir etmoq degani.
 
– The cold weather caused her to get sick.
– Sovuq ob-havo uning kasal bo’lishiga sabab bo’ldi.

escape [v.] – qochib qutulmoq
🔺>> To escape is to run away from something bad. >> Escape bu biror yomon narsadan qochish degani.
 
– The butterfly could not escape from the cage.
– Kapalak qafasdan qochib qutula olmadi.

return [v.] – qaytib kelmoq
🔺>> To return is to go back to a place. >> Return bir joyga qaytib kelish degani.
 
– I was happy to return home to my mom after school.
– Maktabdan uyga onamning yoniga qaytganimdan hursand edim.

individual [n.] – individ, shaxs
🔺>> An individual is one person. >> Individual bu bitta shaxs.
 
– Only one individual could win the bicycle race.
– Velopoygada faqat bir kishi g’olib bo’lishi mumkin.

wise [adj.] – aqlli, dono
🔺>> To be wise is to use experience and intelligence to make good choices. >> Wise bo’lmoq yaxshi tanlovlarni qilish uchun tajriba va aqlni ishlatish degani.
 
– Many people believe that owls are very wise animals.
– Ko’pchilik odam ukkini aqlli qush deb o’ylaydi.
Unit 7:
beside [prep.] – yonma-yon; yonida
🔺>> When someone or something is beside you, they are next to you. >> Qachonki biror narsa yoki biror kishi sizga beside bo’lsa, u sizning yoningizda bo’ladi.
 
– The two brothers stood beside each other.
– Ikki aka-uka yonma-yon turishgan edi.

harm [n.] – jabr, jarohat
🔺>> Harm is hurt or problems caused to someone or something. >> Harm birortasi yoki biror narsaga yetkazilgan jarohat yoki muammolar.
 
– A hot iron can cause great harm if you are not careful.
– Agar ehtiyot bo’lmasangiz issiq temir katta jarohat yetkazishi mumkin.

expert [n.] – ekspert, mutaxassis, usta
🔺>> An expert is someone who is very good at doing something. >> Expert biror narsani qilishning ustasi bo’lgan kishi.
 
– The wizard was an expert at magic.
– Sehrgar afsun bo’yicha ekspert edi.

allow [v.] – ruxsat bermoq; imkoniyat bermoq
🔺>> To allow something to happen means to let it happen. >> Biror narsa sodir bo‘lishiga allow qilmoq sodir bo’lishiga qo’yib bermoq degani.
 
– Having a ticket will allow you to enter the show.
– Biletingiz bo’lishi shouga kirishingizga imkoniyat beradi.

contribute [v.] – xayr qilmoq; hissa qo’shmoq
🔺>> To contribute to something means to do something to make it successful. >> Biror narsani contribute qilish u narsani yaxshi qilish uchun biror narsa qilish degani.
 
– We decided to contribute money to the new hospital.
– Biz yangi kasalxonaga pul bilan o’z hissamizni qo’shishga qaror qildik.

announce [v.] – e’lon qilmoq; ma’lum qilmoq
🔺>> To announce something is to make it known. >> Biror narsani announce qilish uni ma’lum qilish degani.
 
– He announced to everyone his new idea for the company.
– U kompaniya uchun yangi g’oyasini hammaga e’lon qildi.

peace [n.] – tinchlik
🔺>> Peace is a time without war. >> Peace – urushsiz davr.
 
– A white dove is a symbol for peace.
– Oq kabutar tinchlik ramzi.

sense [v.] – sezmoq, his qilmoq
🔺>> To sense something is to know about it without being told. >> Biror narsani sense qilish u haqda eshitmasdan turib bilish degani.
 
– I could sense that he was watching me.
– Men u meni kuzatib turganini sezardim.

challenge [n.] – qiyinchilik; mushkul ish
🔺>> A challenge is something difficult to complete. >> Challenge bitirish qiyin bo’lgan biror narsa.
 
– It was a challenge to climb to the top of the mountain.
– Tog’ning tepasiga chiqish qiyin ish bo’ldi.

protect [v.] – himoya qilmoq, asramoq
🔺>> To protect someone is to stop them from getting hurt. >> Birortasini protect qilmoq, jarohat yetkazilishdan asramoq degani.
 
– Firemen protect us from fires.
– O’t o’chiruvchi bizni olovdan himoya qiladi.

difference [n.] – farq, tafovut
🔺>> A difference is a way that something is not like other things. >> Difference bir narsani boshqa narsalardan boshqacha qilib turadigan narsa.
 
– The biggest difference between the birds is the color of their feathers.
– Qushlar orasidagi kotta farq bu ular patlarining rangidir.

divide [v.] – taqsimlamoq, bo’lmoq
🔺>> To divide something is to make it into smaller parts. >> Biror narsani divide qilish uni kichik qismlarga ajratish degani.
 
– We divided the pizza.
– Biz pitsani taqsimladik.

lay [v.] – qo’ymoq
🔺>> To lay means to put or place in a horizontal or flat position. >> Lay gorizontal yoki tekis holatda qo’yish degani.
 
– Don’t lay your socks on the floor.
– Paypoqlaringni polga qo’yma.

claim [v.] – tasdiqlamoq, ma’qullamoq
🔺>> To claim means to say that something is true. >> Claim biror narsa to’g’riligini aytish.
 
– He claimed to know why the country’s laws were weak.
– U nega mamlakatning qonunlari zaif ekanligini ma’qulladi.

prince [n.] – shahzoda
🔺>> A prince is the son of a king. >> Prince qirolning o’g’li.
 
– The prince and the princess were married.
– Shahzoda va malika turmush qurishgan.

therefore [adv.] – shu sababli, shuning uchun
🔺>> Therefore means for this reason. >> Therefore shu sababli degan ma’noni anglatadi.
 
– He is fat. Therefore, he will go on a diet.
– U semiz. Shuning uchun u dieta tutadi.

famous [adj.] – mashxur, taniqli
🔺>> If someone or something is famous, they are known to many people. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa famous bo’lsa, ular ko’p odamlarga ma’lum bo’ladi.
 
– The Eiffel Tower in Paris is very famous.
– Parijdagi Eyfel minorasi juda taniqli.

force [n.] – kuch, quvvat
🔺>> Force is a person’s strength or power. >> Force bu odamning kuch yoki quvvati.
 
– He used all his force to try and open the door.
– U eshikni ochish uchun bor kuchini ishlatti va eshikni ochdi.

condition [n.] – ahvol; holat
🔺>> The condition of someone or something is the state that they are in. >> Biror narsa yoki biror kishining contition’i ular o’sha holatda ekanligini bildiradi.
 
– The patient’s condition was very good.
– Bemorning ahvoli juda yaxshi edi.

sudden [adj.] – kutilmagan, tasodifiy
🔺>> When something is sudden, it happens very quickly. >> Agar biror narsa sudden bo’lsa, u juda tez sodir bo’ladi.
 
– He felt a sudden pain in his chest.
– U to’satdan ko’krak qafasida og’riqni his qildi.
Unit 8:
attend [v.] – bormoq
🔺>> To attend something is to go to it. >> Biror joyga attend qilish o’sha joyga borish degani.
 
– My sister and I attend the same school.
– Men va mening singlim bir maktabga boramiz.

contrast [n.] – katta farq
🔺>> A contrast is the sharp difference between two things. >> Contrast – bu ikki narsa o’rtasidagi keskin farq.
 
– The contrast between my parents is very noticeable.
– Ota-onam o’rtasidagi farq juda sezilarli.

necessary [adj.] – shart, zarur
🔺>> If something is necessary, you must do it. >> Agar biror narsa necessary bo’lsa, siz uni qilishingiz kerak bo’ladi.
 
– It is necessary to have a passport when you travel to a foreign country.
– Chet davlatga sayohat qilganingizda, passportingiz bo’lishi zarur.

release [v.] – qo’yib yubormoq, ozod qilmoq
🔺>> To release something is to stop holding it. >> Biror narsani release qilish u narsani tutqunlikda ushlashni to’xtatish degani.
 
– She released the bird from her hands.
– U qo’lidan qushni ozod qildi (qo’yib yubordi).

balance [v.] – muvozanat saqlamoq
🔺>> To balance something is to keep it from falling. >> Biror narsani balance qilish u narsani tushib ketishidan saqlash degani.
 
– We saw an elephant balance itself on a ball.
– Biz ko’ptokning ustida muvozanat saqlayotgan filni ko’rdik.

require [v.] – talab qilinmoq, talab qilmoq
🔺>> To require something is to say that it is necessary. >> Biror narsani require qilish u narsaning muhimligini aytish degani.
 
– We require teachers to have a university degree.
– Biz o’qituvchilardan universitet (bakalavr) darajasini talab qilamiz.

pattern [n.] – uslub, yo’nalish, yo’l
🔺>> A pattern is a way in which something is done or organized. >> Pattern biror narsa bajariladiga yo’l.
 
– My pattern of brushing my teeth is the same as most people’s.
– Mening tish yuvish usulim ko’pchilik odamlarniki bilan bir xil.

tear [v.] – yirtmoq
🔺>> To tear something means to pull it apart. >> Biror narsani tear qilish u narsani ajratib tashlashni anglatadi.
 
– It is easy to tear paper.
– Qog’ozni yirtish oson.

encourage [v.] – ruhlantirmoq, ruhini ko’tarmoq
🔺>> To encourage someone is to make them want to do something. >> Birortasini encourage qilish uning biror narsa qilishini xohlash degani.
 
– My football coach will encourage us when we are losing.
– Mening futbol murabbiyim biz yutqazayotganimizda bizni qo’llab-quvvatlab turadi.

hang [v.] – osmoq, ilmoq
🔺>> To hang something is to keep it above the ground. >> Biror narsani hang qilish uni yerdan balandda saqlash degani.
 
– I drew a picture of my family, and my mother hung it on the wall.
– Men oilamiz rasmini chizdim va onam u rasmni devorga ilib qo’ydi.

purpose [n.] - maqsad
🔺>> A purpose is the reason that you do something. >> Purpose biror narsa qilishingiz uchun sabab.
 
– The purpose of exercising is to get into shape.
– Mashq qilishning maqsadi, yaxshi shaklga kirishdir.

grab [v.] – uzmoq; olmoq
🔺>> To grab is to take a hold of someone or something suddenly. >> Grab birortasini yoki biror nimani to’satdan ushlab olish degani.
 
– I grabbed a pear from the tree.
– Men daraxtdan nokni uzib oldim.

success [n.] – muvaffaqiyat, yutuq
🔺>> Success is doing something well that you choose to do. >> Success siz qilishuchun tanlagan biror narsani yaxshi bajarish degani.
 
– My daughter was a big success at school.
– Qizim maktabda katta muvaffaqiyatga erishdi.

accept [v.] – qabul qilmoq
🔺>> To accept something that is offered is to take it. >> Taklif qilingan narsani accept qilish uni olishni anglatadi.
 
– I accepted the girl’s very nice gift.
– Men haligi qizning ajoyib sovg’asini qabul qildim.

single [adj.] – bitta, bir dona
🔺>> If something is single, then there is only one. >> Agar biror narsa single bo’lsa u bir dona bo’ladi.
 
– I have a single key in my hand.
– Qo’limda bir dona kalit bor.

propose [v.] – taklif qilmoq
🔺>> To propose something is to say that it should be done. >> Biror narsani propose qilish u narsa bajarilishi kerakligini aytish degani.
 
– Santa Claus proposed that I try to be a good boy all year.
– Qorbobo menga yil bo’yi yaxshi bola bo’lishimni aytdi (taklif qildi).

theory [n.] – nazariya
🔺>> A theory is an idea about how something works. >> Theory – biror narsa qanday ishlashi haqidagi g’oya.
 
– We talked about Einstein’s theory of relativity in class. 
– Biz darsda Eynshteynning nisbiylik nazariyasi haqida gaplashdik.

huge [adj.] – katta, ulkan
🔺>> If something is huge, it is very big. >> Agar biror narsa huge bo’lsa, u juda katta bo’ladi.
 
– At work, my father drives a huge truck.
– Dadam ishda katta yuk mashinasi haydaydi.

arrange [v.] – joy-joyiga qo’ymoq, tartibga keltirmoq
🔺>> To arrange things is to put them in the right place. >> Narsalarni arrange qilish ularni to’g’ri joyga qo’yish degani.
 
– Please arrange the bowling pins in order so we can play.
– O’ynay olishimiz uchun bouling donalarini joy-joyiga qo’ying.

familiar [adj.] – tanish, qadrdon
🔺>> If someone or something is familiar to you, you know them well. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror nima sizga familiar bo’lsa, siz ularni yaxshi bilasiz.
 
– The two friends were very familiar with each other.
– Ikki do’st bir-biriga juda ham qadrdon edi.
Unit 9:
save [v.] – asramoq, saqlamoq
🔺>> To save something is to keep it from being hurt. >> Biror narsani save qilish uni jarohatlanishda (shikastdan) saqlash degani.
 
– I want to help save the world.
– Men dunyoni saqlashga yordamlashishni xohlayman.

still [adv.] – hali ham, haligacha
🔺>> Still is used when you say that a situation keeps going on. >> Still birorta hodisa sodir bo’lishda davom etayotganini aytishda ishlatiladi.
 
– They are still waiting in line to get tickets.
– Ular haligacha chipta olish uchun navbatda kutishmoqda.

beach [n.] – sohil, plyaj
🔺>> The beach is a sandy or rocky place by the ocean. >> Beach – qumli yoki qoyali ocean bo’yi.
 
– The little girl built a sandcastle on the beach.
– Kichkina qizcha sohil bo’yida qumli qasr qurdi.

pleasant [adj.] - yoqimli
🔺>> If something is pleasant, you enjoy it. >> Agar biror narsa pleasant bo’lsa, siz undan zavq olasiz.
 
– The character had a pleasant look on its face.
– Xarakter uning yuzida yoqimli ko’rinishga ega edi.

rock [n.] – tosh; qoya
🔺>> A rock is a hard thing in the dirt. >> Rock yerdagi qattiq narsa.
 
– I stacked rocks on top of one another.
– Men toshlarni birining ustiga birini qo’yib taxladim.

emotion [n.] – emotsiya, ruhiy kechinma
🔺>> An emotion is how you feel. >> Emotion bu siz qanday his qilayotganingiz.
 
– Anger is a common emotion that we all feel.
– Jahl – hammamiz his qiladigan umumiy emotsiya.

discover [v.] – topmoq, kashf qilmoq
🔺>> To discover something is to find it for the first time. >> Biror narsani discover qilish uni birinchi marta toppish degani.
 
– I discovered some new information in this book!
– Men bu kitobdan ba’zi yangi ma’lumotlarni kashf qildim.

identify [v.] – tanib bilmoq
🔺>> To identify something is to be able to name it. >> Biror narsani identify qilish uni nomini ayta olmoq degani.
 
– I used the file to identify his name.
– Uning ismini tanib qolish uchun qog’ozchadan foydalandim.

island [n.] – orol
🔺>> An island is land in the middle of water. >> Island – bu suv o’rtasidagi yer.
 
– Japan is a group of islands.
– Yaponiya – orollar birlashmasi hisoblanadi.

fix [v.] – tuzatmoq, ta’mirlamoq; hal etmoq
🔺>> To fix something is to make it work. >> Biror narsani fix qilish uni ishlatish degani.
 
– My dad has many tools to help him fix broken things.
– Dadamning singan narsalarni tuzatish uchun ko’pgina uskunalari bor.

frank [adj.] – ochiq, samimiy
🔺>> If you are frank, you are being very honest. >> Agar siz frank bo’lsangiz, siz juda vijdonli bo’lasiz.
 
– The teacher had a frank discussion with her students.
– O’qituvchi o’quvchilari bilan samimiy muhokama qildi.

taste [n.] – ta’m, maza
🔺>> A taste is the flavor something makes in your mouth. >> Taste og’zingizda his qiladigan ta’m, maza.
 
– The taste of the fruit was sweet.
– Mevaning mazasi shirin edi.

wave [n.] – to’lqin, mavj
🔺>> A wave is a line of water that moves higher than the rest of the water. >> Wave suvning qolgan qismidan balandroq ko’tariladigan suv liniyasi.
 
– The water was filled with large blue waves.
– Suv katta ko’k to’lqinlarga to’lgan edi.

damage [v.] – shikastlamoq
🔺>> To damage something is to break it. >> Biror narsani damage qilmoq uni buzmoq, sindirmoq, shikastlamoq degani.
 
– The car was damaged in the accident.
– Mashina to’qnashuvda shikastlandi.

step [v.] – yurmoq, qadam tashlamoq
🔺>> To step is to walk. >> Step – yurmoq degani.
 
– Be careful where you step.
– Qadam tashlayotgan joyingda ehtiyot bo’l.

ocean [n.] – ocean, ummon
🔺>> The ocean is all of the salt water that surrounds land. >> Ocean bu barcha yer yuzini qamrab olgan tuzli suv.
 
– The ocean can make powerful waves.
– Okean kuchli to’lqinlar hosil qila oladi.

perhaps [adv.] – ehtimol, balkli
🔺>> Perhaps is used when you say that something could happen. >> Perhaps biror narsa sodir bo’lishi ehtimoli bo’lganda ishlatiladi.
 
– Perhaps I will eat an apple for lunch.
– Tushlikka olma yeyishim mumkin (olma yeyish ehtimolim bor).

prevent [v.] – to’sqinlik qilmoq, oldini olmoq
🔺>> To prevent something is to stop it from happening. >> Biror narsani prevent qilish uning sodir bo’lishini oldini olsh degani.
 
– The handcuffs prevented me from moving my hands.
– Kishan qo’limni qimirlatishimga to’sqinlik qilar edi.

throw [v.] – irg’itmoq, uloqtirmoq
🔺>> To throw something is to use your hand to make it go through the air. >> Throw biror narsani havodan otish uchun qo’lingizni ishlatish degani.
 
– The pitcher can throw the baseball very fast.
– Beysbol o’yinchisi to’pni juda tez uloqtira oladi.

against [prep.] – ro’baro, qarama-qarshi yo’nalishda
🔺>> To be against something is to be touching it or opposed to it. >> Biror narsaga against bo’lish u narsaga nisbatan qarama-qarshi bo’lish degani.
 
– They both leaned against the wall.
– Ular ikkalasi ham devorga suyanib turibdi.
Unit 10:
separate [adj.] – alohida, ajralgan, bo‘lak
🔺>> If two things are separate, they are not together. >> Agar ikki narsa separate bo‘lsa, ular birga emas.
 
– New York and Los Angeles are in two separate parts of America.
– Nyu-York va Los Anjels Amerikaning ikki alohida qismi.

benefit [n.] – foyda, ustun jihat
🔺>> A benefit is a good thing. >> Benefit bu yaxshi narsa, ustun jihat, foyda degani.
 
– Being able to fly is a good benefit to birds.
– Ucha olish qushlarning katta ustun jihati, foydasi.

guard [v.] – qo‘riqlamoq
🔺>> To guard something is to take care of it. >> Biror narsani guard qilish u haqida qayg‘urish degani.
 
– The police officer will guard us from any harm.
– Politsiya ofitseri bizni har qanday xavfdan himoya qiladi.

essential [adj.] – juda muhim, zarur(iy)
🔺>> If something is essential, it is very important and necessary. >> Agar biror narsa essential bo’lsa, u juda muhim va zarur bo’ladi.
 
– It is essential to have oxygen when you scuba dive.
– Akvalangda suvga sho’ng’iyotganingizda sizda kislorod bo’lishi muhim.

focus [v.] – diqqatini qaratmoq
🔺>> To focus on something is to think about it and pay attention to it. >> Biror narsaga focus qilish u narsa haqida o‘ylash hamda unga e’tiborini qaratish.
 
– My mom always helps me to focus on my school work.
– Onam maktab ishlariga diqqatimni qaratishimga doim yordam beradi.

tail [n.] – dum
🔺>> A tail is a part of an animal’s body, sticking out from its rear or back. >> Tail hayvon tanasining orqasidan chiqib turadigan qismi.
 
– Our dog wags its tail when it’s happy.
– Itimiz hursand bo‘lganda dumini likillatadi.

effect [n.] – ta’sir, samara
🔺>> An effect is a change made by something else. >> Effect biror boshqa narsa tomonidan qilingan o’zgarish.
 
– The medicine had a good effect on the boy.
– Dori bolaga yaxshi ta’sir qildi.

certain [adj.] – ishonchi komil
🔺>> If you are certain about something, you know it is true. >> Agar siz biror narsaga certain bo’lsangiz, uning to’g’riligini bilasiz.
 
– I am certain that zebras have stripes.
– Ishonchim komilki, zebralarning yo’l-yo’l chizig’i bor.

far [adj.] – uzoq, olis
🔺>> If something is far, it is not close. >> Agar biror narsa far bo‘lsa, u yaqin bo‘lmaydi.
 
– It’s far going from the east coast to the west coast of America.
– Afrikaning sharqiy qig‘og‘idan g‘arbiy qirg‘og‘igacha uzoq.

chance [n.] – imkoniyat, shans
🔺>> A chance is an opportunity to do something. >> Chance biror narsa qilish imkoniyati.
 
– I had a chance to see the Roman Coliseum last summer.
– O‘tgan yozda men Rim Kolizeyini ko‘rish imkoniyatiga ega bo‘ldim.

primary [adj.] – asosiy, birinchi darajali
🔺>>If something is primary, it is the most important thing. >> Agar biror narsa primary bo‘lsa, u juda muhim narsa bo‘ladi.
 
– His primary thoughts are about money.
– Uning asosiy fikrlari pul haqida.

site [n.] – joy
🔺>> A site is a place. >> Site joy degani.
 
– We found the perfect site for our picnic.
– Biz piknikimiz uchun mukammal joy topdik.

image [n.] – rasm, ko‘rinish
🔺>> The image of something is a picture of it. >> Biror narsaning image’i u narsaning rasmi degani.
 
– The image of her eye was very clear.
– Uning ko‘zlarining ko‘rinishi juda tiniq edi.

function [n.] – funksiya, vazifa
🔺>> The function of something is what it does. >> Biror narsaning funksiyasi u nima qilishidir.
 
– The function of a flashlight is to help you see in the dark.
– Fonarning funksiyasi sizga qorong‘uda ko‘rishga yordam berishdir.

immediate [adj.] – tezkor
🔺>> If something is immediate, it happens quickly. >> Agar biror narsa immediate bo‘lsa, tez sodir bo‘ladi.
 
– An immediate response came from the pizza place.
– Tezkor javob pitsaxonadan keldi.

proud [adj.] – fahrlangan
🔺>> If someone feels proud, they are happy about what they have done. >> Agar birortasi proud’ni his qilsa, u qilgan ishidan hursand bo‘ladi.
 
– She is proud of the picture she drew of her house.
– U o‘z uyini chizgan rasmidan fahrlangan holda.

trouble [n.] – muammo, qiyinchilik
🔺>> Trouble is a problem or a difficulty. >> Trouble bu muammo yoki qiyinchilik.
 
– I have trouble working with my boss.
– Xo‘jayinim bilan ishlashda qiyinchilikka duch kelaman.

remain [v.] – qolmoq
🔺>> To remain somewhere is to stay there. >> Biror joyda remain qilish o‘sha joyda qolish degani.
 
– My sister had to remain home since she was sick.
– Opam kasal bo‘lganligi sababli uyda qolishga majbur bo‘ldi.

rest [v.] – dam olmoq
🔺>> To rest is to stop being active while the body gets back its strength. >> Rest tana kuchini qaytarayotgan paytda faol bo‘lishdan to‘xtash degani.
 
– I rested on the couch after work.
– Men ishdan keyin divanda dam oldim.

grass [n.] – maysa, o‘t
🔺>> Grass is the green leaves that cover the ground. >> Grass yerni qoplovchi yashil burglar.
 
– The grass looked so soft and green.
– Maysa juda mayin hamda yashil ko‘rindi.
Unit 11:
collect [v.] – to‘plamoq, yig‘moq
🔺>> To collect things is to group them together all in one place. >> Narsalarni collect qilish ularning hamasini bir joyga yig‘ish degani.
 
– I collected shells when I was younger.
– Yoshligimda chig‘anoqlarni yig‘ardim.

forest [n.] – o‘rmon
🔺>> A forest is a place with lots of trees and animals. >> Forest ko‘pgina hayvon va draxtlar bor joy.
 
– I love to go walking in the forest.
– Men o‘rmonga yurgani borishni yaxshi ko‘raman.

truth [n.] — haqiqat
🔺>> The truth is a fact or something that is right. >> Truth bu fakt yoki biror to'g'ri bo'lgan narsa.

— He was telling the truth about seeing a large green snake.
— U katta yashil ilonni ko'rgani haqidagi bor haqiqatni aytayotgan edi.

berry [n.] – malina
🔺>> A berry is a small round fruit that grows on certain plants and trees. >> Berry ma’lum o‘simlikda pishadigan aylana kichkina meva.
 
– The berry looked delicious.
– Malina shirin ko‘rindi.

anymore [adv.] – ortiq, boshqa
🔺>> Anymore means any longer. >> Anymore ortiq, boshqa degan ma’noni anglatadi.
 
– Her old pants don’t fit her anymore.
– Uning eski shimi unga ortiq loyiq emas.

compete [v.] – musobaqalashmoq
🔺>> To compete is to try to be better than someone. >> Compete birortasidan yaxshiroq bo‘lishga intilish degani.
 
– He will compete with very good athletes.
– U juda zo‘r atletlar bilan musobaqalashadi.

serious [adj.] — jiddiy, og'ir
🔺>> When something is serious, it is bad or unsafe. >> Agar biror narsa serious bo'lsa, u yomon yoki xavfsiz emas.

— The accident was very serious.
— To'qnashuv juda jiddiy edi.

spend [v.] — o'tkazmoq
🔺>> To spend is to use time doing something or being somewhere. >> Spend biror joyda bo'lish yoki biror narsa qilish bilan vaqtdan foydalanish degani.

— I like to spend my free time fishing.
— Men bo'sh vaqtimni baliq ovlash bilan o'tkazishni yaxshi ko'raman.

prepare [v.] — tayyorlanmoq, tayyorlamoq
🔺>> To prepare is to get ready for something. >> Prepare biror narsani tayyor holga keltirish degani.

— I prepared my speech to the class.
— Men sinf uchun o'z nutqimni tayyorladim.

introduce [v.] — tanishtirmoq
🔺>> To introduce someone or something is to say who they are. >> Biror narsa yoki birortasini introduce qilish uning kimligini aytish degani.

— I introduced myself to our newest co-worker today.
— Men bugun o'zimni yangi hamkasbimizga tanishtirdim.

creature [n.] – jonivor, tirik mavjudod
🔺>> A creature is any living thing. >> Creature istalgan tirik narsa.
 
– The creature we saw today was either a dolphin or a porpoise.
– Biz bugun ko‘rgan mavjudod yo delfin, yoki suv cho‘chqasi edi.

either [conj.] – ikkisidan biri
🔺>> Either is used with “or” to say there are two or more possibilities. >> Ikki yoki undan ko‘p ehtimolliklar borligini aytish uchun either “or” bilan ishlatiladi.
 
– You can choose to be either white or black when you play chess.
– Shaxmat o‘ynayotganda siz qora yoki oq bo‘lishni tanlashingiz mumkin.

ground [n.] — yer
🔺>> The ground is the top part of the Earth that we walk on. >> Ground Yer sharining biz yuradigan ustki qismi.

— The ground under our feet was dry and brown.
— Oyog'imiz ostidagi yer ho'l va jigarrang edi.

conversation [n.] – suhbat, muloqot
🔺>> A conversation is a talk between people. >> Conversation odamlar o‘rtasidagi muloqot.
 
– There were two conversations going on at once.
– Bir paytning o‘zida ikki suhbat davom etayotgan edi.

decision [n.] – qaror
🔺>> A decision is a choice. >> Decision bu tanlov.
 
– He made the  wrong decision.
– U noto‘g‘ri qaror qabul qildi.

sail [v.] — qayiqda suzmoq; suzib ketmoq
🔺>> To sail is to move a boat on the water. >> Sail qayiqda suv ustida harakatlanmoq degani.

— I love to sail my boat on the lake.
— Men qayig'imda ko'lda suzishni yaxshi ko'raman.

wake [v.] — uyg'onmoq
🔺>> To wake is to not be sleeping anymore. >> Wake ortiq uxlamaslik degani.

— He is always full of energy when he wakes in the morning.
— U ertalab uyg'onganida doim energiyaga to'la bo'ladi.

marry [v.] — turmush qurmoq
🔺>> To marry is to legally become husband and wife. >> Marry qonunan er-xotin bo'lish degani.

— Rose and Henry were married, and they lived happily.
— Roz va Genri turmush qurishdi va baxtli yashashdi.

asleep [adj.] – uxlayotgan, uyquda
🔺>> When a person is asleep, they are not awake. >> Birortasi asleep bo‘lsa, u uyg‘oq emas.
 
– The baby has been asleep for hours.
– Chaqaloq bir necha soatdan beri uxlayapti.

strange [adj.] — noodatiy, g'alati
🔺>> When something is strange, it is not normal. >> Agar biror narsa strange bo'lsa, u odatiy emas.

— Joe had a strange look on his face after he saw what happened.
— Jo nima bo'lganini ko'rganidan so'ng yuzi g'alati ko'rinish oldi.
Unit 12:
apartment [n.] — kvartira 
🔺>> An apartment is a set of rooms in a building where people live. >> Apartment odamlar yashaydigan binodagi xonalar yig'indisi.

— She has a nice apartment in the city.
— Uning shaharda ajoyib kvartirasi bor.

shape [n.] – shakl
🔺>> A shape is a simple form like a square or circle. >> Shape doira yoki kvadratga o‘xshash oddiy shakldir.
 
– The triangle is my favourite shape.
– Uchburchak men yoqtirgan shakl.

symbol [n.] – ramz, belgi
🔺>> A symbol is a thing that stands for something else. >> Symbol boshqa narsa uchun turadigan narsa.
 
– This symbol tells us that we cannot smoke in this area.
– Bu belgi biz bu yerda chekmasligimizni ko‘rsatadi.

magazine [n.] — jurnal
🔺>> A magazine is a regular publication with news, stories, and articles. >> Magazine yangiliklar, hikoyalar va maqolalari bor muntazam chop etiladigan narsa.

— She likes to read fashion magazines.
— U modaga oid jurnallarni o'qishni yaxshi ko'radi.

attitude [n.] — munosabat, muomala
🔺>> Someone's attitude is the way they feel and think. >> Birortasining attitude'si u his qilish va o'ylash yo'li.

— John has a bad attitude. He’s always angry.
— Jon yomon muomalaga ega. U doim badjahl.

article [n.] — maqola
🔺>> An article is a story in a newspaper or magazine. >> Article gazeta yoki jurnaldagi hikoya.

— Did you read the article in the newspaper about the soccer game?
— Jurnaldagi futbol haqidagi maqolani o'qidingmi?

space [n.] – bo‘sh joy
🔺>> A space is an empty area. >> Space bo‘sh joy degani.
 
– I don’t have much space for things in my small house.
– Mening kichik hovlimda narsalarga ko‘p bo‘sh joy yo‘q.

method [n.] – metod, usul
🔺>> A method is the way to do something. >> Method biror narsa qilish yo‘li.
 
– One method to remember things is to tie a string around your finger.
– Narsalarni eslab qolish usullaridan biri barmog‘ingiz atrofiga tasma bog‘lashdir.

judge [v.] — baho bermoq
🔺>> To judge something is to say if it is good or bad. >> Biror narsani judge qilish uni yaxshi yoki yomon ekanligini aytish degani.

— The boy was going to judge how his mother’s turkey tasted.
— Haligi bola onasi pishirgan kurka qanday shirinligini baholamoqchi edi.

neighbor [n.] – qo‘shni
🔺>> A neighbor is a person who lives near you. >> Neighbor sizga yaqin yashaydigan shaxs.
 
– I like my neighbor because he’s very friendly.
– Men qo‘shnimni yaxshi ko‘raman, chunki u juda do‘stona.

profit [n.] – foyda
🔺>> A profit is the extra money you make when you sell something. >> Profit siz biror narsa sotganingizda topgan ortiqcha pul.
 
– I made a small profit from selling my old clothes.
– Men eski kiyimlarimni sotishdan kichik foyda qildim.

alone [adj.] — yolg'iz
🔺>> If someone is alone, they are not with another person. >> Agar birortasi alone bo'lsa, u boshqa odam bilan emas.

— The boy wanted to be alone to think.
— Haligi bola o'ylash uchun yolg'iz qolishni istadi.

thin [adj.] – oriq, ozg‘in
🔺>> If someone or something is thin, they are not fat. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa thin bo‘lsa, ular semiz esmas.
 
– The man was thin because he didn’t eat much.
– Haligi odam ozg‘in edi, chunki u ko‘p yemas edi.

compare [v.] — taqqoslamoq, solishtirmoq
🔺>> To compare means to say how two things are the same and different. >> Compare ikki narsaning qanday bir xillik va farqlovchi belgilarini aytishni bildiradi.

— If you compare cats and dogs, you'll see that they’re both good pets.
— Agar mushuklar va itlarni taqqoslaydigan bo'lsangiz, ikalasi ham yaxshi hayvoligini ko'rishingiz mumkin.

material [n.] — material, xom-ashyo
🔺>> A material is what is used to make something. >> Material biror narsa tayyorlash uchun ishlatiladigan narsa.

— Brick is a good material for building houses.
— G'isht uy qurish uchun yaxshi material.

professional [adj.] – kasbiy; professional
🔺>> If something is professional, it deals with work that uses special skills. >> Agar biror narsa professional bo‘lsa, u maxsus qobiliyat talab qiladigan ish bilan aloqador bo‘ladi.
 
– If you want to be a pilot, you must have professional training.
– Agar siz uchuvchi bo‘lishni xohlasangiz, siz kasbiy tayyorgarlikka ega bo‘lishingiz kerak.

quality [n.] – sifat
🔺>> The quality of something is how good it is. >> Biror narsaning quality’si bu uning qanchalik yaxshi ekanligi.
 
– The quality of his car is very good.
– Uning mashinasining sifati juda yaxshi.

artist [n.] — rassom 
🔺>> An artist is a person who paints, draws, or makes sculptures. >> Artist chizadigan, bo'yaydigan yoki haykal yasaydigan odam.

— He went to Paris to become an artist.
— U rassom bo'lish uchun Parijga ketti.

meal [n.] — ovgatlanish payti; taom
🔺>> A meal is a time when food is eaten like breakfast, lunch, or dinner. >> Meal bu nonushta, tushlik yoki kechki ovqat paytida ovqatlaniladigan vaqt.

— Breakfast is my favorite meal because I enjoy breakfast foods.
— Nonushta men yoqtiradigan ovqatlanish vaqti, chunki men nonushta taomlarini yoqtiraman.

stair [n.] – zina, pillapoya
🔺>> Stairs are the things that are used to go up in a building. >> Stairs binoga chiqish uchun foydalaniladigan narsalar.
 
– You can take the stairs to the second floor.
– Siz ikkinchi qavatga zinapoyalarda chiqishingiz mumkin.
Unit 13:
lord [n.] – lord
🔺>> Long ago, a lord was a man in charge of a town. >> Ancha avval lord shaharga mas’ul shaxs bo‘lgan.
 
– The lord of the town was not kind.
– Shahar lordi mulozamatli emas edi.

spot [n.] – joy, makon
🔺>> A spot is a place where something happens. >> Spot biror narsa sodir bo‘ladigan joy.
 
– The kitchen is a good spot to eat meals.
– Oshxona ovqat yeyish uchun yaxshi joy.

cell [n.] – kamera (qamoqda)
🔺>> A cell is a small room where a person is locked in. >> Cell odam qamab qo‘yiladigan kichik xona.
 
– The jail cell was very small.
– Qamoqxona kamerasi juda kichik edi.

whole [adj.] – barcha, butun
🔺>> Whole means all of something. >> Whole biror narsaning hammasi degan ma’noni bildiradi.
 
– I ate the whole pie. We don’t have any more.
– Men hamma pirogni yeb qo‘ydim. Bizda boshqa yo‘q.

correct [adj.] – to‘g‘ri, bexato
🔺>> To be correct is to be right. >> Correct bo‘lish to‘g‘ri bo‘lish degani.
 
– All of my answers on the test were correct.
– Testdagi barcha javoblarim to‘g‘ri edi.

burn [v.] – olovda yoqmoq
🔺>> To burn something is to set it on fire. >> Biror narsani burn qilish uni olovga qo‘yish degani.
 
– I burned some wood in the camp fire.
– Men alangaga bir qancha o‘tin yoqdim.

structure [n.] – imorat, bino
🔺>> A structure is a building. >> Structure bu bino.
 
– They just built a beautiful new structure downtown.
– Ular shahar pastida yangi chiroyli bino qurishdi.

equal [adj.] – teng, barobar
🔺>> To be equal is to be the same. >> Equal bo‘lish bir xil bo‘lish degani.
 
– Both students are equal in age.
– Ikkala talaba yosh jihatdan teng edi.

crop [n.] – hosil, o‘rim
🔺>> A crop is food that a farmer grows. >> Crop fermer o‘stiradigan ozuqa.
 
– Wheat is a crop that is made into bread.
– Bug‘doy non tayyorlanadigan hosil.

responsible [adj.] – aqlli, mas’uliyatli
🔺>> If a person is responsible, they do the right things. >> Agar inson responsible bo‘lsa, u to‘g‘ri ishlarni qiladi.
 
– I try to be responsible and save money.
– Men mas’uliyatli bo‘lishga harakat qilaman va pullarni saqlayman.

demand [v.] – talab qilmoq
🔺>> To demand something is to say strongly that you want it. >> Biror narsani demand qilish uni xohlayotganingizni qat’iy aytish.
 
– The workers demanded to be paid more money.
– Ishchilar ko‘p pul to‘lanishini talab qilishdi.

owe [v.] – qarz bo‘lmoq
🔺>> To owe is to have to pay or give back something received from another. >> Owe birortasidan olingan biror narsani qaytarib berish.
 
– I owed him twenty dollars, so I paid him back.
– Men undan 20 dollar qarz bo‘lgandim, shuning uchun qaytaribberdim.

feed [v.] – ovqatlantirmoq, ovqat bermoq
🔺>> To feed is to give food. >> Feed ovqat berish degani.
 
– Mother feeds my baby brother every day.
– Onam chaqaloq ukamni har kuni ovqatlantiradi.

raise [v.] – ko‘tarmoq
🔺>> To raise something is to lift it up. >> Biror narsani raise qilish uni ko‘tarish degani.
 
– We had to work together to raise the last piece.
– Oxirgi bo‘lakni ko‘tarish uchun biz birgalikda ishlashimiz kerak.

blood [n.] – qon
🔺>> Blood is the red liquid in your body. >> Blood tanangizdagi qizil suyuqlik.
 
– I cut my finger and got blood on my shirt.
– Men qo‘limni kesib oldim va ko‘ylagim qon bo‘ldi.

position [n.] – pozitsiya, holat
🔺>> A position is the way something is placed. >> Position biror narsaning joylashish yo‘li, usuli.
 
– How can you sit in that position?
– Qanday qilib unday holatda o‘tira olyapsiz?

increase [v.] – oshirmoq, ko‘tarmoq
🔺>> To increase something is to make it larger or more. >> Biror narsani increase qilish uni kattaroq yoki ko‘proq qilish degani.
 
– They’ve increased the price of gas by 15 cents!
– Ular gaz narxini 15 sentga ko‘tarishdi!

hole [n.] – teshik; chuqurcha
🔺>> A hole is an opening in something. >> Hole biror narsadagi teshik.
 
– The man was going to jump into the hole in the ice.
– Haligi kishi muz teshigiga sakramoqchi bo‘layotgan edi.

sight [n.] – manzara
🔺>> A sight is something interesting to see. >> Sight ko‘rishga qiziq bo‘lgan narsa.
 
– I saw the pyramids of Egypt. What a sight!
– Men Misr piramidalarini ko‘rdim. Shunchalar chiroyli manzara!

contain [v.] – o‘z ichiga olmoq
🔺>> To contain something is to have it inside. >> Biror narsani contain qilish uni o‘z ichiga olish degani.
 
– The mailbox contained a letter.
– Pochta qutisi bir xatni o‘z ichiga olar edi.
Unit 14:
mail [n.] – xat, maktub; pochta
🔺>> Mail is letters and other things sent to people. >> Mail xat yoki boshqa odamlarga jo‘natiladigan narsa.
 
– I get a lot of mail because I have friends all over the world.
– Men juda ko‘p maktub olaman, chunki mening butun dunyo bo‘ylab do‘stlarim bor.

exam [n.] – imtihon
🔺>> An exam is a test. >> Exam test, sinov, imtihon degani.
 
– I did some practice questions for the math exam on the board.
– Men matematika imtihoni uchun doskada amaliyot qildim.

example [n.] – misol, na’muna
🔺>> An example of something is a thing that is typical of it. >> Biror narsaning example’i u narsaning na’munasidir.
 
– Cola is an example of a soft drink.
– Kola salqin ichimlikka misol bo‘ladi.

scene [n.] – epizod, sahna
🔺>> A scene is one part of a book or movie. >> Scene kitob yoki kinoning bir qismi.
 
– A movie is made up of many short pieces or scenes.
– Kino bir qancha qisqa qismlar yoki epizodlardan tayyorlanadi.

control [v.] – nazorat qilmoq, boshqarmoq
🔺>> To control something is to make it do what you want. >> Biror narsani control qilish unga nimani xohlasangiz shuni qildirish.
 
– To control the TV, just push the buttons.
– Televizorni boshqarish uchun shunchaki tugmalarni bosing.

silly [adj.] – ahmoqona, bema’ni
🔺>> If someone or something is silly, they show a lack of thought. >> Agar kimdir yoki nimadir silly bo‘lsa, ular fikr kam ekanligini bildiradi.
 
– I made a silly mistake of dropping mom’s vase.
– Onamning vazasini sindirib ahmoqona xato qildim.

poet [n.] – shoir
🔺>> A poet is a person who writes poems. >> Poet she’r yozadigan yozuvchi.
 
– William Shakespeare was one of the greatest poets.
– Villiam Shekspir buyuk shoirlardan biri bo‘lgan.

sheet [n.] – varoq
🔺>> A sheet is a thin flat piece of paper. >> Sheet qog‘ozning ingichka yassi bo‘lagi.
 
– I only needed a single sheet of paper to do my homework.
– Menga uy vazifamni qilgani bir dona varoq kerak edi.

direct [adj.] – to‘g‘ridan-to‘g‘ri
🔺>> If something is direct, it goes straight between two places. >> Agar nimadir direct bo‘lsa, u ikki narsa o‘rtasidan to‘g‘ri o‘tadi.
 
– The green path is a direct route to my house.
– Yashil yo‘lak uyimga to‘g‘ri yo‘nalishdir.

store [n.] – do‘kon, univermag
🔺>> A store is a place where you can buy things. >> Store siz narsa sotib oladigan joy.
 
– I picked up a few things at the grocery store.
– Men oziq-ovqat do‘konidan bir qancha narsalar oldim.

description [n.] – tavsif, ta’rif
🔺>> A description of someone or something says what they are like. >> Birortasi yoki biror narsaning description’i ular nimaga o‘xshashini aytadi.
 
– I gave a description of the man with the gun and hat to the police.
– Men qurol ko‘targan va shlyapali odam tavsifini (ta’rifini) politsiyaga aytdim.

technology [n.] – texnika vositasi
🔺>> Technology is new things made by using science. >> Technology ilm-fanni ishlatib yasalgan yangi narsalar.
 
– He loves technology such as laptop computers.
– U laptop kompyuterlar kabi texnologiyalarni yaxshi ko‘radi.

coach [n.] – murabbiy, trener
🔺>> A coach is a person who teaches sports. >> Coach sportni o‘rgatadigan shaxs.
 
– My coach gets very excited during games.
– O‘yin paytida murabbiyim juda hursand bo‘ldi.

local [adj.] – mahalliy
🔺>> If something is local, it is nearby. >> Agar biror narsa local bo‘lsa u yaqin atrofda bo‘ladi.
 
– The local market in my neighbourhood sells all the food we need.
– Mahallamdagi mahalliy do‘kon bizga kerakli barcha oziq-ovqatlarni sotadi.

print [v.] – qog‘ozga tushirmoq
🔺>> To print something is to put it onto paper. >> Biror narsani print qilish  uni qog‘ozga tushirish degani.
 
– Make sure that you print your name clearly.
– Ismingizni qog‘ozga bexato tushirganingizga ishonch hosil qiling.

limit [n.] – me’yor
🔺>> A limit is the largest or smallest amount of something that you allow. >> Limit siz ruxsat bergan biror narsaning eng katta yoki eng kichik miqdori.
 
– My mother put a limit on how much I could use the phone.
– Onam telefonni qancha vaqt foydalanishim bo‘yicha me’yor o‘rnatdi.

outline [n.] – reja
🔺>> An outline is the plan for a story or essay. >> Outline hikoya yoki esse rejasi.
 
– Before I wrote my essay, I made an outline.
– Esseyimni yozishdan avval reja tuzdim.

suffer [v.] – azoblamoq, dard chekmoq
🔺>> To suffer is to feel pain. >> Suffer og‘riq his qilmoq degani.
 
– Her headache made her suffer all day.
– Uning bosh og‘rig‘i kun bo‘yi uni azobladi.

novel [n.] – roman
🔺>> A novel is a book that tells a story. >> Novel hikoya aytuvchi kitob.
 
– He wrote a great novel about ancient China.
– U qadimgi Xitoy haqida katta roman yozgan.

magical [adj.] – sirli; ajoyib
🔺>> Magical describes a quality that makes someone or something special. >> Magical birortasi yoki biror narsani o‘ziga xos qiladigan sifatini tasvirlaydi.
 
– The fireworks made the night sky look so magical.
– Mushakbozliklar tungi osmonga ajoyib ko‘rinish berdi.
Unit 15:
consume [v.] — iste'mol qilmoq, yemoq
🔺>> To consume something means to eat or drink it. >> Biror narsani consume qilish uni yeyish yoki ichish degani.

— Jack consumed a whole plate of spaghetti.
— Jek butun tarelkadagi spagettini iste'mol qildi.

prize [n.] – mukofot, sovrin
🔺>> A prize is something of value that is given to the winner. >> Prize g‘olibga beriladigan qimmatga ega narsa.
 
– I won a prize for getting the best grade on my science test.
– Men ilmiy testimda eng yuqori darajani qo‘lga kiritganim uchun mukofot yutib oldim.

wonder [v.] – bilishni xohlamoq
🔺>> To wonder is to ask yourself questions or have a need to know. >> Wonder o‘zingizdan biror narsani so‘ramoq yoki bilishga intilish.
 
– The young mother wondered if she’d have a boy or a girl.
– Yosh ona qiz yoki o‘g‘il ko‘rishini bilishni xohladi.

realize [v.] – fahmlamoq, anglamoq, to‘satdan miyasiga kelmoq
🔺>> To realize is to suddenly understand. >> Realize to‘satdan tushunmoq degani.
 
– After I left my house, I realized that I left the light on.
– Uyimdan chiqqanimdan keyin to‘satdan chiroqni yoniq qoldirganimni angladim.

race [n.] – poyga
🔺>> A race is a contest to see who is the fastest. >> Race kim eng tezkor ekanligini ko‘rish uchun qilingan musobaqa.
 
– Paul is a fast runner, so he easily won the race.
– Paul tez yuguruvchi, shuning uchun u poygani osongina yutdi.

risk [n.] – xavfli tavakkal
🔺>> A risk is a chance of something bad happening. >> Risk birorta yomon voqeaga tavakkal qilish degani.
 
– I took a risk and climbed the snowy mountain.
– Men xavfli tavakkal (risk) qildim va qorli tog‘ni oshib o‘tdim.

yet [adv.] – hali ham, haligacha
🔺>> Yet is used to say something has not happened up to now. >> Yet hozirgacha sodir bo‘lmagan narsani aytish uchun ishlatiladi.
 
– We can’t go out yet; we’re still eating.
– Biz hali ham tashqariga chiqa olganimiz yo‘q; biz hali ham ovqatlanyapmiz.

excite [v.] —hayajonlantirmoq, hayajonga solmoq
🔺>> To excite someone means to make them happy and interested. >> Birortasini excite qilish uni hursand qilish va qiziqtirish.

— I heard about the school dance on Friday. This excited me.
— Men juma kungi maktabdagi raqs haqida eshitdim. Bu meni hayajonga soldi.

fear [n.] — qo'rquv, vahima
🔺>> Fear is the feeling of being afraid. >> Fear qo'rqqan holatda bo'lish tuyg'usi.

— I have a great fear of skateboarding.
— Men skeytbord uchishdan juda qo'rqaman.

opportunity [n.] – imkoniyat, imkon
🔺>> An opportunity is a chance to do something. >> Opportunity biror narsa qilishga imkoniyat.
 
– I had an opportunity to take pictures in the jungle.
– Chakalakzorda rasmga tushirish imkoniga ega bo‘ldim.

observe [v.] – kuzatmoq, ko‘rmoq
🔺>> To observe something is to watch it. >> Biror narsani observe qilish uni kuzatish degani.
 
– Brian observed the sun rising over the mountains.
– Brian quyoshning tog‘lar uzra ko‘tarilishini kuzatdi.

length [n.] — uzunlik
🔺>> The length of something is how long it is from one end to the other. >> Biror narsaning length'i uning bir joydan boshqa joyigacha qancha masofada ekanligidir.

— The length of the floor is three meters.
— Polning uzunligi uch metr.

characteristic [n.] — fazilat, xususiyat
🔺>> A characteristic is something that shows what a person or a thing is like. >> Characteristic odam yoki narsaning nimaga o'xshashligini ko'rsatuvchi narsa.

— One characteristic of tigers is their black stripes.
— Yo'lbarsning xususiyatlaridan biri qora yo’l-yo’l chiziqlarining borligi.

breathe [v.] — nafas olmoq
🔺>> To breathe means to let air go in and out of your body. >> Breathe havoni tanangizga kirgizish va chiqarish degani.

— We need strong healthy lungs to help us breathe well.
— Yaxshi nafas olishimizga yordamlashgani sog'lom o'pka kerak.

extreme [adj.] — keskin, shiddatli
🔺>> If something is extreme, it is in a large amount or degree. >> Agar biror narsa extreme bo'lsa, u juda katta miqyos yoki darajada bo'ladi.

— His workout was so extreme that he was sweating heavily.
— Uning mashqlari shu darajada shiddatli ediki, uni qattiq ter bosdi.

fortunate [adj.] — omadli
🔺>> If you are fortunate, you are lucky. >> Agar siz fortunate bo'lsangiz, siz omadli bo'lasiz.

— I was fortunate to get a seat.
— Mening joy olishda omadim keldi.

асrоss [рrер.] — narigi tomoniga/-da
🔺>> To go across something is to go to the other side of it. >> Biror narsani across qilish u narsaning narigi tomoniga o'tish degani.

— He walked across the board to the other side.
— U taxtaning narigi tomoniga yurib o'tdi.

mistake [n.] – xato
🔺>> A mistake is something you do wrong. >> Mistake siz xato qiladigan narsa.
 
– My boss always yells at me when I make a mistake.
– Mening boshlig‘im xato qilganimda doim baqiradi.

respond [v.] – javob qaytarmoq
🔺>> To respond is to give an answer to what someone else said. >> Respond birorta boshqasi aytgan gapga javob berish degani.
 
– When the teacher asked the question, we all responded.
– O‘qituvchi savol so‘raganda biz hammamiz javob qaytardik.

happen [v.] — nasib qilmoq
🔺>> If someone happens to do something, they do it by chance. >> Agar birortasi biror narsa qilishda happen bo'lsa, u buni qilishga imkoni bo'lgan bo'ladi.

— I happened to meet some new friends at school today.
— Menga bugun maktabda bir nechta yangi do'stlar bilan uchrashish nasib qildi.
Unit 16:
officer [n.] - ofitser
🔺>> An officer is a leader in the army. >> Officer armiyada yetakchilardan.
 
– The soldiers followed the orders of the officer.
– Soldatlar ofitserning buyruqlariga ergashishdi.

dictionary [n.] – lug‘at
🔺>> A dictionary is a book that tells you what words mean. >> Dictionary so‘zlar nimani anglatishini aytadigan kitob.
 
– I use the dictionary to learn new words.
– Men lug‘atdan yangi so‘zlarni yodlash uchun foydalanaman.

maybe [adv.] – balki, ehtimol
🔺>> Maybe is used to show that something is possible or may be true. >> Maybe ehtimollikni yoki biror narsa to‘g‘ri bo‘lishi mumkin ekanligini anglatadi.
 
– If I focus hard enough, maybe I can come up with the right answer.
– Agar men yetarlicha qattiq diqqatimni jamlasam, ehtimol to‘g‘ri javobni topa olaman.

clue [n.] – ashyoviy dalil
🔺>> A clue is a fact or object that helps solve a mystery or crime. >> Clue sirli narsani yoki jinoyatni ochishga yordam beradigan fakt yoki narsa.
 
– The detective found some clues on the sidewalk.
– Detektiv yo‘lda ba’zi ashyoviy dalillarni topdi.

academy [n.] – akademiya
🔺>> An academy is a special type of school. >> Academy maktabning maxsus turi.
 
– There are many courses taught at the academy that I go to.
– Men boradigan akademiyada juda ko‘p kurslar o‘qitiladi.

process [n.] – jarayon
🔺>> A process is the steps to take to do something. >> Process biror narsa qilishdagi qadamlar.
 
– Making a cake is a long process.
– Pirog qilish uzoq jarayon.

wealth [n.] – boylik, mol-davlat
🔺>> Wealth is a large amount of money. >> Wealth pulning katta miqdori.
 
– One of the most important things to some people is wealth.
– Ba’zi odamlar uchun muhim narsalardan biri bu boylikdir.

exist [v.] – mavjud bo‘lmoq
🔺>> To exist is to be real. >> Exist mavjud, haqiqiy bo‘lishni anglatadi.
 
– Do you really think that unicorns ever existed?
– Sen haqiqatan ham yakka shoxlar mavjud bo‘lganiga ishonasanmi?

century [n.] – asr, 100 yillik
🔺>> A century is one hundred years. >> Century yuz yil degani.
 
– Our company is celebrating a  century of business in London.
– Bizning kompaniya Londondagi biznesning 100 yilligini nishonlayapti.

flat [adj.] – tekis, silliq
🔺>> Flat describes something that is level and smooth with no curved parts. >> Flat egilgan qismlarsiz, tekis va yassi narsani tasvirlaydi.
 
– My parents bought a new flat screen TV over the weekend.
– Ota-onam hafta oxirida yangi tekis ekranli televizor sotib olishdi.

concert [n.] – konsert
🔺>> A concert is an event where you listen to people play music. >> Concert siz odamlar musiqa chalishlarini eshitadigan hodisa.
 
– I enjoyed the concert last night. The band was very good.
– Kecha kechki paytgi konsertdan roxatlandim. Musiqa guruhi juda yaxshi edi.

pound [v.] – urmoq, qoqmoq
🔺>> To pound something is to hit it many times with a lot of force. >> Biror narsani pound qilish uni bir necha marta katta kuch bilan urish degani.
 
– He pounded the nail with the hammer.
– U mixni bolg‘a bilan qoqdi.

county [n.] – okrug (AQShda)
🔺>> A county is the largest political division of a state in the US. >> County AQSh shtatlarining katta siyosiy bo‘linmasi.
 
– He wanted to represent the citizens of his county.
– U o‘z okrugi fuqarolariga vakillik qilishni xohladi.

gentleman [n.] – jentlmen
🔺>> A gentleman is a nice man. >> Gentleman juda ajoyib, yaxshi kishi.
 
– My grandfather is a kind and helpful gentleman.
– Mening bobom mulozamatli va foydali jentlmen.

theater [n.] – teatr
🔺>> A theater is a building where you watch plays, shows, and movies. >> Theater siz spektakl, shou va kino koradigan bino.
 
– We went to the theater to see a play.
– Biz spektakl ko‘rish uchun teatrga bordik.

ancient [adj.] – qadimiy
🔺>> If something is ancient, it is very old. >> Agar biror narsa ancient bo‘lsa, u juda eski, qadimiy bo‘ladi.
 
– I want to see the ancient buildings in Rome.
– Men Rimdagi qadimiy binolarni ko‘rishni xohlayman.

original [adj.] – asl nusxadagi
🔺>> If something is original, it is the first one of that thing. >> Agar biror narsa original bo‘lsa, u o‘sha narsaning birinchisi.
 
– This is the original painting of the Mona Lisa.
– Bu Mona Liza asarining asl nusxasi.

hidden [adj.] – yashirin, yashirilgan
🔺>> Hidden means to be not easily noticed or too hard to find. >> Hidden oson anglab bo‘lmaydigan yoki topish juda qiyin ekanligini anglatadi.
 
– The hidden camera recorded everything in the parking lot.
– Yashirin kamera avtomobil to‘xtash joyidagi barcha narsani yozib oldi.

publish [v.] – chop etmoq, nashr qilmoq
🔺>> To publish a book is to get it printed and ready to sell. >> Kitobni publish qilmoq uni qog‘ozga chiqarmoq va sotishga tayyor qilmoq degani.
 
– That company publishes daily newspapers.
– Haligi kompaniya kunlik gazetalar nashr qiladi.

board [n.] – taxta
🔺>> A board is a flat piece of wood. >> Board yog‘ochning yapaloq bo‘lagi.
 
– The sign was made of a few wooden boards.
– Belgi bir qancha yog‘och taxtalardan qilingan edi.
Unit 17:
fair [adj.] – xolis, adolatli, halol
