🔺>> Fair describes treating someone in a way that is reasonable or right. >> Fair birortasiga nisbatan xolis yoki to‘g‘ri munosabatda bo‘lishni tasvirlaydi.
 
– He sold me his car for a fair price.
– U menga mashinasini adolatli narxda sotdi.

determine [v.] – tanlamoq, qaror qilmoq
🔺>> To determine means to choose or make a decision. >> Determine tanlamoq yoki qaror qabul qilmoq degani.
 
– He tried to determine which one to eat first.
– U qaysi birini birinchi yeyishni tanlashga harakat qildi.

level [n.] — daraja
🔺>> A level is a point on a scale that measures something. >> Level biror narsani o'lchaydigan daraja.

— Please check the level of the temperature.
— Iltimos temperatura darajasini o'lchang.

else [adj.] – boshqa, o‘zga
🔺>> If you talk about something else, you talk about something different. >> Agar siz birorta else narsa haqida gapirayotgan bo‘lsangiz, siz biror boshqacha narsa haqida gapirayotgan bo‘lasiz.
 
– I wanted a bike for my birthday, but I got something else.
– Men tug‘ilgan kunimga velosiped xohlagandim, lekin boshqa narsa oldim.

flow [v.] – oqmoq
🔺>> To flow is to move easily and continuously in one direction. >> Flow oson va davomiy bir yo‘nalishda harakatlanishni bildiradi.
 
– The water flowed over the rocks and into the lake.
– Suv toshlar ustidan ko‘lga qarab oqar edi.

celebrate [v.] – nishonlamoq
🔺>> To celebrate is to do something to show that an event is special. >> Celebrate biror voqea o‘ziga xos, maxsus ekanligini ko‘rsatish uchun biror narsa qilish degani.
 
– We all celebrated when we heard the great news.
– Biz hammamiz katta yangilikni eshitganimizdan keyin uni nishonladik.

disappear [v.] – ko‘rinmay ketmoq, nari ketmoq
🔺>> To disappear means to go away or not be seen. >> Disappear nari ketmoq yoki ko‘rinmay ketmoq degani.
 
– The top of the building is disappearing in the clouds.
– Binoning tepasi, uchi bulutlar ichida ko‘rinmay ketyapti.

beat [v.] – yengmoq, yengib chiqmoq
🔺>> To beat someone means to do better than they do. >> Birortasini beat qilish biror narsani ular qilgandan ko‘ra yaxshiroq qilish degani.
 
– I managed to beat everyone in the race.
– Men poygada hammani yengishni uddaladim.

appreciate [v.] – qadrlamoq; ma’nosini tushunmoq
🔺>> To appreciate something is to understand its good qualities. >> Biror narsani appreciate qilish uning yaxshi sifatlarini tushunish degani.
 
– I can appreciate the lovely scenery.
– Men chiroyli manzaraning qadriga yetaman.

bright [adj.] – yorqin
🔺>> If something is bright, it shows a lot of light. >> Agar biror narsa bright bo‘lsa, u juda ko‘p yorug‘lik taratadi.
 
– The bright light from the explosion hurt my eyes.
– Portlashdan chiqqan yorqin yorug‘lik ko‘zimni jarohatladi.

season [n.] — fasl, mavsum
🔺>> A season is a time of the year: spring, summer, fall or winter. >> Season yilning vaqti: bahor, yoz, kuz yoki qish.

— Fall is a warm season, while winter is very cold.
— Kuz iliq fasl, qish esa juda sovuq.

available [adj.] – mavjud, bor, bo‘sh
🔺>> If something is available, it means you can get it. >> Agar biror narsa available bo‘lsa, siz uni qo‘lga kirita olasiz.
 
– There were many seats available in the room.
– Xonada ko‘pgina bo‘sh stellar bore di.

forward [adv.] — oldinga
🔺>> If you move forward, you move in the direction in front of you. >> Agar siz forward harakatlansangiz, siz oldinga qarab harakatlanasiz.

— When he saw his mother, the baby crawled forward to her.
— Chaqaloq onasini ko'rganda, u tarafga emakladi.

waste [v.] — behuda sovurmoq
🔺>> To waste means to carelessly use something all up. >> Waste biror narsani ehtiyotsizlarcha ishlatib yuborish degani.

— Turn off the water so you don’t waste it.
— Suvni o'chir chunki sen uni isrof qilma.

hill [n.] — tepalik, balandlik
🔺>> A hill is a round area of land. It is higher than the land around it. >> Hill yerning aylana joyi. Bu atrofdagi yerdan baland.

— The sun was rising above the green hills.
— Quyosh yashil tepaliklar uzra chiqayotgan edi.

whether [conj.] — -mi; yo bo'lmasa
🔺>> You use whether when you must choose between two things. >> Siz whether'ni qachonki ikki narsadan birini tanlashingiz kerak bo'lganda ishlatasiz.

— I could not decide whether to go left or right.
— Men chapga yoki o'ngga yurishga qaror qabul qila olmadim.

puddle [n.] — ko'lmak
🔺>> A puddle is a pool of liquid on the ground. >> Puddle yerdagi suyuqlik hovuzi.

— When the ice melted, it formed a puddle.
— Muz eriganda, bu ko'lmak hosil qildi.

solution [n.] — yechim, javob
🔺>> A solution is a way to solve a problem. >> Solution muammoni yechish yo'li.

— There are many problems. We need solutions!
— Juda ko'p muammolar bor. Bizga yechim kerak!

response [n.] — javob
🔺>> A response is the answer to a question. >> Response bu savolga javob.

— He asked if I was sad. My response was “No.”
— U mendan hafamanmi yo'qmi so'radi. Mening javobim "Yo'q" bo'ldi.

lone [adj.] — yakka
🔺>> If someone or something is lone, they are the only one of that kind. >> Agar biror narsa yoki birortasi lone bo'lsa, u o'sha turdagi yagona.

— A lone man walked along the street.
— Yolg'iz kishi ko'cha bo'ylab ketayotgan edi.
Unit 18:
empty [adj.] – bo‘sh
🔺>> If something is empty, it does not have anything in it. >> Agar biror narsa empty bo‘lsa, uning ichida hech narsa bo‘lmaydi.
 
– My gas tank was almost empty, so I couldn’t drive my car very long.
– Mening gaz balonim deyarli bo‘sh edi, shuning uchun men mashinamni uzoqqa mina olmadim.

offer [v.] — taklif qilmoq
🔺>> To offer is to present someone with something. >> Offer birortasiga biror narsani taklif qilish.

— He offered me the keys to his car.
— U menga mashinasining kalitlarini taklif qildi.

item [n.] — buyum, narsa
🔺>> An item is a thing that you buy or sell. >> Item siz sotib oladigan yoki sotadigan narsa.

— I have many items for school in my bag.
— Mening sumkamda maktab uchun juda ko'p narsa bor.

dish [n.] – likop, tarelka
🔺>> A dish is a plate. >> Dish bu tarelka.
 
– She put a clean white dish on the table.
– U stol ustiga toza oq tarelkani qo‘ydi.

exact [adj.] – aniq
🔺>> If something is exact, it is just the right amount. >> Agar biror narsa exact bo‘lsa, u aniq miqdorda bo‘ladi.
 
– Please use the exact amount of sugar for the cake.
– Iltimos, pirog uchun shakarning aniq miqdorini ishlating.

tool [n.] — asbob, anjom
🔺>> A tool is something that helps you do a task. >> Tool sizga biror ishni qilishga ko'maklashuvchi narsa.

— We used a tool to fix the window.
— Biz derazani tuzatish uchun anjomni ishlatdik.

purchase [v.] — sotib olmoq
🔺>> To purchase something is to buy it. >> Biror narsani purchase qilish uni sotib olish degani.

— I recently purchased a new car.
— Men yaqinda yangi mashina sotib oldim.

product [n.] — mahsulot
🔺>> A product is something that is made. >> Product ishlab chiqariladigan biror narsa

— My sister has many beauty products in her room.
— Mening opamning xonasida juda ko'p chiroyli mahsulotlar bor.

crowd [n.] – omma, olamon
🔺>> A crowd is a large group of people. >> Crowd odamlarning katta guruhi.
 
– A large crowd had gathered on the street to see the accident.
– Avtohalokatni ko‘rish uchun katta olamon ko‘chada yig‘ildi.

price [n.] — nаrх
🔺>> The price of something is how much it costs. >> Biror narsaning price'i uning qancha narx turishidir.

— What is the price of this item?
— Bu narsaning narxi qancha?

fresh [adj.] – yangi
🔺>> If something is fresh, it is new. >> Agar biror narsa fresh bo‘lsa, u yangi bo‘ladi.
 
– I just bought these oranges. They are very fresh.
– Men hozirgina uchta apelsin oldim. Ular juda ham yangi.

treat [v.] — munosabatda bo'lmoq
🔺>> To treat is to act in a certain way toward someone. >> Treat birortasiga biror yo'l bilan munosabatda bo'lishni bildiradi.

— The cats treated the mouse very nicely.
— Mushuklar sichqonga nisbatan yaxshi munosabatda bo'lishdi.

communicate [v.] – suhbat qurmoq
🔺>> To communicate is to give information by talking, writing, etc. >> Communicate gapirish, yozish yoki boshqa vosita yordamida ma’lumot berish.
 
– I communicated with Paul about his new ideas.
– Men Paul bilan uning yangi g‘oyalari haqida suhbat qurdim.

gather [v.] – to‘plamoq, yig‘moq
🔺>> To gather is to collect several things usually from different places. >> Gather bu bir qancha narsalarni, odatda har xil joylardan, to‘plash.
 
– Sam gathered some flowers for his mother.
– Sem onasi uchun bir qancha gullar yig‘di.

argue [v.] – tortishmoq, janjallashmoq
🔺>> To argue is to angrily speak to someone because you do not agree. >> Argue biror narsaga rozi emasligingiz sabab birortasiga jahl bilan gapirish.
 
– We argued about where to go for dinner.
– Biz tushlikka qayerga borish haqida tortishdik.

depend [v.] – qaram bo‘lmoq, muhtoj bo‘lmoq, bog‘liq bo‘lmoq
🔺>> To depend on someone or something is to need them. >> Biror narsa yoki birortasiga depend qilish shu narsaga muhtoj bo‘lishni anglatadi.
 
– Children depend on their parents for many things.
– Bolalar ko‘p narsalarda ota-onalariga muhtoj bo‘lishadi.

indicate [v.] – ko‘rsatmoq
🔺>> To indicate means to show, point or make something clear. >> Indicate ko‘rsatish, biror narsani aniqlashni anglatadi.
 
– He pointed to his eyes to indicate where he had hurt himself.
– U qayerga zarar yetganini ko‘rsatish uchun ko‘zlariga ishora qildi.

property [n.] — mulk
🔺>> Property is something that someone owns. >> Property birortasi egalik qiladigan biror narsa.

— The house is now my property.
— Bu uy hozir mening mulkim.

recommend [v.] — tavsiya qilmoq
🔺>> To recommend something is to say that someone should do it. >> Biror narsani recommend qilish uni kimdir qilsa yaxshi bo'lishini aytish degani.

— My doctor recommended that I get some exercise.
— Doktorim men mashq qilishimni tavsiya qildi.

select [v.] — tanlamoq
🔺>> To select something is to choose it. >> Biror narsani select qilish uni tanlash degani.

— I hope that I selected the right answers on the test.
— Testda to'g'ri javobni tanladim deb umid qilaman.
Unit 19:
injustice [n.] — adolatsizlik, nohaqlik
🔺>> Injustice is a lack of fairness or justice. >> Injustice adolat va haqqoniylikning yo'qligi.

— Putting an innocent person in jail is an act of injustice.
— Qamoqxonaga noto'g'ri insonni qamash adolatsizlik harakatidir.

lawyer [n.] — huquqshunos, advokat
🔺>> A lawyer works with the law and represents people in court. >> Lawyer huquq sohasida ishlaydi va sudda odamlarga ko'rinadi.

— The lawyer left the courthouse after the judge made her decision.
— Advokat sud hukmi o'qilgandan so'ng sud zalini tark etdi.

mention [v.] — suhbatlashmoq; ta'kidlamoq
🔺>> To mention something is to talk about it. >> Biror narsani mention qilish u haqida gapirish degani.

— The doctors mentioned the problems that the patient was having.
— Doktorlar bemorning muammolarini ta'kidlashdi.

however [adv.] – lekin, biroq, shunga qaramasdan
🔺>> However means despite or not being influenced by something. >> However shunga qaramasdan degan ma’noni bildiradi.
 
– She is a great cook. However, she never had professional lessons.
– U ajoyib oshpaz. Shunga qaramasdan, u hech qachon professional dars olmagan.

staff [n.] — shtat, jamoa
🔺>> A staff is a group of people working together in a company. >> Staff kompaniyada birga ishlaydigan odamlar jamoasi.

— My dad has a staff of four people to help him at the office.
— Dadam unga yordam berish uchun 4 kishilik jamoaga ega.

bone [n.] – suyak
🔺>> A bone is a hard part of the body. >> Bone tananing qattiq qismi.
 
– I brought home a nice bone for my dog.
– Men uyga itim uchun yaxshi suyak olib keldim.

foreign [adj.] – yot, begona, chet, xorij
🔺>> If something is foreign, it is from a different country. >> Agar biror narsa foreign bo‘lsa, u boshqa davlatdan.
 
– Mexican food is a popular foreign food.
– Meksika taomi mashxur xorijiy taomdir.

international [adj.] — xalqaro
🔺>> If something is international, it involves more than one country. >> Agar biror narsa international bo'lsa, u bir davlatdan ko'proq davlatga tegishli.

— The United Nations is a powerful international organization.
— Birlashgan Millatlar Tashkiloti kuchli xalqaro tashkilotdir.

policy [n.] — qoida, prinsip, qonun-qoida
🔺>> A policy is a rule. >> Policy bu qoida, qonun.

— He told us that his policy was to put customers first.
— U bizga uning qoidasi, prinsipi xaridorlarni birinchi jalb qilish ekanligini aytdi.

doubt [n.] – shubha
🔺>> Doubt is a feeling of not being sure. >> Doubt bir to‘xtamga kelmaslik tuyg‘usi.
 
– I have doubt that the story is true.
– Hikoya haqiqat ekanligiga shubham bor.

toward [prep.] — sari, tomon
🔺>> If you go toward something, you go closer to it. >> Agar siz biror narsaga toward yursangiz, siz unga yaqinlasha borasiz.

— Santa walked toward my house with a special tree.
— Qorbobo maxsus daraxt bilan men tomonga yurdi.

captain [n.] – kapitan
🔺>> A captain is the person who leads a ship or airplane. >> Captain kema yoki samolyotni boshqaradigan shaxs.
 
– The captain sailed his ship to Australia.
– Kapitan kemasini Avstraliyaga boshlab boshqardi.

wood [n.] — yog'och
🔺>> Wood is the thing that trees are made of. >> Wood daraxtlarda tarkib topgan narsa.

— I put the pieces of wood in a pile.
— Men yog'och bo'laklarini uyumga qo'ydim.

glad [adj.] – hursand, mamnun
🔺>> If you are glad, you are happy. >> Agar siz glad bo‘lsangiz siz hursand bo‘lasiz.
 
– I am glad you came to my party.
– Ziyofatimga kelganingdan hursandman.

conclusion [n.] – yakun, nihoya, xulosa
🔺>> The conclusion of something is the final part of it. >> Biror narsaning conclusion’i uning yakuniy qismi.
 
– At the conclusion of the race, the spectators cheered for the winner.
– Poyganing yakuniy qismida tomoshabinlar g‘olibni qichqirib qo‘llab-quvvatlashdi.

alive [adj.] – tirik, hayot
🔺>> If someone or something is alive, they are not dead. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa alive bo‘lsa, u o‘lik emas.
 
– My grandparents are still alive even though they are over 90.
– Mening bobom bilan buvim 90 dan oshgan bo‘lsalar ham hali ham hayotlar.

social [adj.] — ijtimoiy
🔺>> If something is social, it is about many people in a community. >> Agar biror narsa social bo'lsa, u jamiyatdagi ko'p odamlar haqida bo'ladi.

— People should come together and fix the world’s social problems.
— Odamlar birlashishi hamda dunyoning ijtimoiy muammolarini to'g'irlashlari kerak.

speech [n.] — nutq
🔺>> A speech is something said to a group of people. >> Speech odamlar jamoasiga qarata aytiladigan narsa.

— She gave a speech to the class.
— U sinfga nutq so'zladi.

bother [v.] – harakat qilmoq, urinmoq
🔺>> To bother is to make the effort to do something. >> Bother biror narsa qilishga urinish degani.
 
– No one bothered to wash the dishes today.
– Bugun hech kim idishlarni yuvishga harakat qilmadi, urinmadi.

explore [v.] – tadqiq etmoq
🔺>> To explore is to look for new places. >> Explore yangi joylarni qidirish.
 
– He wants to explore the world and see new things.
– U dunyoni tadqiq etish va yangi narsalarni ko‘rishni xohlaydi.
Unit 20:
advise  [v.] – maslahat bermoq
🔺>> To advise someone is to tell them what to do. >> Birortasiga advise qilish unga nima qilish kerakligini aytish degani.
 
– My mother often advises people about their money.
– Mening onam odatda odamlarga ularning pullari haqida maslahat beradi.

basic [adj.] – oddiy, sodda, oson, asosiy
🔺>> If something is basic, it is very simple or easy. >> Agar biror narsa basic bo‘lsa, u juda oddiy yoki oson.
 
– I learned some basic English skills in school today.
– Men bugun maktabda ba’zi oddiy ingliz tili ko‘nikmalarini o‘rgandim.

consider [v.] – haqida o‘ylamoq, o‘ylab ko‘rmoq
🔺>> To consider something means to think about it. >> Biror narsani consider qilish u haqida o‘ylashni anglatadi.
 
– Pete didn’t like his job. He considered getting a new one.
– Pete ishini yaxshi ko‘rmas edi. U yangi ishga o‘tish haqida o‘yladi.

destroy [v.] – vayron qilmoq, harob qilmoq
🔺>> To destroy means to damage something so badly that it cannot be used. >> Destroy biror narsaga shu darajada yomon zarar yetkazishni anglatadiki, natijada undan foydalanib bo‘lmaydi.
 
– The glass was destroyed.
– Oyna vayron qilingan edi (sindirilgan edi).

worth [adj.] — arziydigan
🔺>> If something is worth an amount of money, it costs that amount. >> Agar biror narsa pul miqdoriga worth qilsa, bu o'sha miqdorga teng keladi.

— Our house is worth a lot of money.
— Bizning uy ko'p pul miqdoriga arziydi.

vegetable [n.] — sabzavot
🔺>> A vegetable is a plant used as food. >> Vegetable taom sifatida foydalaniladigan o'simlik.

— Carrots are my favorite vegetable.
— Sabzi mening eng yoqtiradigan sabzavotim.

lie [v.] — aldamoq, yolg'on gapirmoq
🔺>> To lie is to say or write something untrue to deceive someone. >> Lie birortasini aldash uchun unga noto'g'ri narsani aytish yoki yozish.

— Whenever Pinocchio lied to his father, his nose grew.
— Pinokiyo otasini aldaganda burni o'sib ketgan.

reflect [v.] — aks ettirmoq
🔺>> To reflect is when a surface sends back light, heat, sound or an image. >> Reflect bu yuzaning yorug‘lik, issiqlik, tovush yoki tasvirni qaytarishi.

— Her face was reflected on the smooth glass.
— Uning yuzi tekis yuzadan aks qaytarayotgan edi.

war [n.] — urush
🔺>> A war is a big fight between two groups of people. >> War odamlarning ikki guruhi o'rtasidagi katta jang.

— Many young men died in the war.
— Urushda ko'p yosh odamlar o'lib ketdi.

extra [adj.] – qo‘shimcha
🔺>> If something is extra, it is more than what is needed. >> Agar biror narsa extra bo‘lsa, u keragidan ko‘proq bo‘ladi.
 
– The squirrel had extra nuts for the winter.
– Olmaxonda qish uchun qo‘shimcha yong‘oqlar bore di.

bit [n.] – bo‘lak, parcha, burda
🔺>> A bit is a small amount of something. >> Bit biror narsaning kichik qismi.
 
– I ate a bit of chocolate before I went to bed.
– Men uxlashga yotishdan avval shokolad bo‘lagini yedim.

serve [v.] — keltirmoq, tortmoq, xizmat ko'rsatmoq
🔺>> To serve someone is to give them food or drinks. >> Birortasiga serve qilish unga taomlar va ichimliklar berish degani.

— He served us our drinks quickly.
— U bizga ichimliklarimizni tez keltirdi.

goal [n.] – maqsad
🔺>> A goal is something you work toward. >> Goal siz uning uchun ishlaydigan narsa.
 
– Her goal was to become a doctor.
– Uning maqsadi doktor bo‘lish edi.

real [adj.] — real, haqiqiy
🔺>> If something is real, it actually exists. >> Agar biror narsa real bo'lsa, u haqiqatan ham mavjud bo'ladi.

— The handbag has a stamp on it, so it’s real.
— Qo'l sumkaning ustida shtampi bor, demak u haqiqiy.

entertain [v.] – hursand qilmoq
🔺>> To entertain someone is to do something that they enjoy. >> Birortasini entertain qilish u hursand bo‘lishi uchun nimadir qilish degani.
 
– The clown entertained the kids at the party.
– Masqaraboz bayramda bolalarni hursand qildi.

already [adv.] - allaqachon
🔺>> If something happens already, it happens before a certain time. >> Agar biror narsa already sodir bo‘lsa, u bir qancha vaqt ilgari sodir bo‘lgan bo‘ladi.
 
– It is already time for the movie to start. Let’s go in.
– Kino boshlanish vaqti allaqachon bo‘ldi. Kettik, ichkariga kiramiz.

meat [n.] — go'sht
🔺>> Meat is food made of animals. >> Meat hayvonlardan olinadigan yegulik.

— This piece of meat I’m eating tastes very good.
— Men yeyayotgan go'sht bo'lagi juda shirin ekan.

opinion [n.] — fikr, mulohaza
🔺>> An opinion is a thought about a person or a thing. >> Opinion odam yoki narsa haqidagi fikr.

— Meg told me her opinion of my story. She said it was not funny.
— Meg mening hikoyam haqidagi fikrini aytdi. U hikoyani qiziq emas dedi.

regard [v.] — deb hisoblamoq
🔺>> To regard someone or something is to think of them in a certain way. >> Birortasini yoki biror narsani regard qilish u haqida ma'lum shaklda o'ylash degani.

— The boy regarded the girl as a good friend.
— Haligi bola qizni yaxshi do'st deb o'ylardi.

achieve  [v.] – erishmoq, qo‘lga kiritmoq
🔺>> To achieve something is to successfully do it after trying hard. >> Biror narsani achieve qilish qattiq urinishdan so‘ng uni muvaffaqiyatli qilish degani.
 
– I was happy that I could achieve my goal.
– Men maqsadimga erisha olganimda hursand edim.
Unit 21:
effort [n.] – harakat, urinish
🔺>> Effort is hard work or an attempt to do something. >> Effort biror narsa qilish uchun qattiq urinish yoki harakat.
 
– He always puts a lot of effort into his studies.
– U doim o‘qishi uchun qattiq urinadi.

excellent [adj.] – juda yaxshi, a’lo
🔺>> When something is excellent, it is very good. >> Biror narsa excellent bo‘lsa, u juda yaxshi bo‘ladi.
 
– I got an excellent score on my school test.
– Men maktab testlarimda juda yaxshi natijalarga erishdim.

brain [n.] – miya
🔺>> The brain is the organ in your head that lets you think. >> Brain sizga o‘ylashga imkon beradigan boshdagi organ.
 
– You must use your brain to solve the problem.
– Muammoni yechish uchun siz miyangizni ishlatishingiz kerak.

base [n.] – asos, taglik
🔺>> The base is the bottom of something. >> Base biror narsaning tag qismi.
 
– The base of the table has three legs.
– Stolning pastida uchta oyog‘i bore di.

later [adv.] — keyinroq
🔺>> Later means after the present, expected, or usual time. >> Later hozirgi vaqtdan keyin, kutilayotgan yoki odatiy vaqtni bildiradi.

— She missed the train, so she’ll arrive a little later than expected.
— U poyezdni o'tkazib yubordi, demak u kutilganidan kechroq keldi.

various [аdj.] — turli-tuman, xar-hil
🔺>> If something is various, there are many types of it. >> Agar biror narsa various bo'lsa, uning ko'pgina turlari bo'ladi.

— She owned shoes of various styles.
— Uning xar hil oyoq kiyimlari bor edi.

hero [n.] – qahramon
🔺>> A hero is a brave person who does things to help others. >> Hero odamlarga yordam berish uchun biror ishlar qiladigan jasur odam.
 
– To children, the man in the blue and red costume was a real hero.
– Bolalar uchun qizil va ko‘k kiyimli odam haqiqiy qahramon edi.

career [n.] – ish faoliyati
🔺>> A career is a job that you do for a large part of your life. >> Career hayotingizning katta qismi mobaynida siz qiladigan ish.
 
– He was in the hospitality business for most of his career.
– U karyerasining katta qismida mehmonxona biznesida edi.

refuse [v.] — rad etmoq
🔺>> To refuse something is to say “no” to it. >> Biror narsani refuse qilish unga "yo'q" deyish degani.

— The dog refused to play with the cat.
— It mushuk bilan o'ynashni rad etdi.

operation [n.] — operatsiya
🔺>> An operation is when a doctor replaces or removes something in the body. >> Operation qachonki doktorning tanadagi biror narsani olib tashlashi yoki almashtirishi.

— The operation on my arm was a success.
— Qo'limning operatsiyasi muvaffaqiyatli bo'ldi.

inform [v.] — xabar bermoq
🔺>> To inform someone is to tell them about something. >> Birortasiga inform qilish unga biror narsa haqida aytish degani.

— I called and informed her about my idea.
— Men unga telefon qilib g'oyalarim haqida xabar berdim.

hurry [v.] – shoshilmoq
🔺>> To hurry is to do something quickly. >> Hurry biror narsani tez qilish.
 
– I hurried home on my bike.
– Men velosipedimda uyga shoshildim.

appear [v.] – dek ko‘rinmoq
🔺>> To appear is to seem. >> Appear dek ko‘rinmoq, tuyilmoq degani.
 
– She appeared to be sad. She was crying.
– U hafadek ko‘rindi. U yig‘layotgan edi.

pain [n.] — og'riq
🔺>> Pain is the feeling that you have when you are hurt. >> Pain jarohatlanganingizda his qiladigan tuyg'u.

— His head was full of pain.
— Uning boshi og'riqqa to'la edi.

leave [v.] — tark etmoq, ketmoq
🔺>> To leave means to go away from someone or something. >> Leave biror narsa yoki birortasini tark etishni bildiradi.

— He packed his bag and was ready to leave for home.
— U sumkasini joyladi va uyni tark etishga tayyor edi.

enter [v.] – kirmoq
🔺>> To enter a place is to go into it. >> Biror joyga enter qilish u joyga kirishni anglatadi.
 
– Two guards greeted me as I entered the front door.
– Ikki soqchi old eshikka kirishim bilan kutib olishdi.

nurse [n.] — hamshira
🔺>> A nurse is a person who helps sick people in the hospital. >> Nurse kasalxonada kasal odamlarga yordam beradigan shaxs.

— A nurse helped me get better.
— Hamshira yaxshi bo'lishimga yordam berdi.

though [conj.] — ga qaramasdan, sa ham
🔺>> Though is used when the second idea makes the first seem surprising. >> Though ikkinchi g'oya birinchisini hayratlanarliroq qilib tuyiltirganda ishlatiladi.

— Though he was overweight, he liked to be active.
— U oshiqcha vazinga ega bo'lishiga qaramasdan, harakatcha bo'lishni yoqtirar edi.

clerk [n.] – do‘kon yordamchisi
🔺>> A clerk is a type of worker. Clerks in a store help customers. >> Clerk ishchining bir turi. Clerk’lar magazinda haridorlarga yordam beradi.
 
– The clerk added up her bill for the groceries.
– Do'kon yordamchisi oziq-ovqat mahsulotlari uchun hisob-kitobni qo'shib qo'ydi.

locate [v.] — topmoq
🔺>> To locate something is to find it. >> Biror narsani locate qilish uni topish degani.

— I could not locate my keys in the house.
— Men uyda kalitlarimni topa olmadim.
Unit 22:
customer [n.] — xaridor
🔺>> A customer is a person who buys something at a store. >> Customer do'kondan biror narsa sotib oladigan shaxs.

— The customer put a few items in a bag.
— Xaridor sumkasiga bir qancha narsalar soldi.

mystery [n.] — sir, jumboq
🔺>> A mystery is something that is difficult to understand or explain. >> Mystery tushunishga va izohlashga qiyin bo'lgan narsa.

— The path on the map was a complete mystery to me.
— Xaritadagi yo'l men uchun butkul jumboq edi.

manage [v.] — boshqarmoq, olib bormoq
🔺>> To manage something means to control or be in charge of it. >> Biror narsani manage qilish uni boshqarish degani. 

— I had to manage the meeting myself.
— Uchrashuvni o'zim olib borishga majbur bo'ldim.

opposite [n.] — teskari, zid
🔺>> If A is the opposite of B, A is completely different from B. >> Agar A B ning opposite'i bo'lsa, A B dan butunlay boshqacha.

— The opposite of black is white.
— Qoraning zidi oqdir.

occur [v.] — yuz bermoq, sodir bo'lmoq
🔺>> To occur means to happen. >> Occur sodir bo'lishni bildiradi.

— When did the thunderstorm occur?
— Qachon momaqaldiroq sodir bo'ldi?

contact [v.] — aloqaga chiqmoq
🔺>> To contact someone is to speak or write to them. >> Birortasiga contact qilish unga gapirish yoki yozish degani.

— I contacted Sue about my party.
— Men ziyofatim haqida Syuga aloqaga chiqdim.

earn [v.] — pul ishlab topmoq
🔺>> To earn means to get money for the work you do. >> Earn siz qilgan ishingizga pul olishingizni bildiradi.

— He earns his living as a chef in a great restaurant.
— U katta restoranda boshliq bo'lib pul ishlab topadi.

actual [adj.] — haqiqiy
🔺>> Actual means that something is real or true. >> Actual biror narsa haqiqiy yoki to'g'riligini anglatadi.

— This is the actual sword that the King owned, not a fake one.
— Bu qirolga tegishli bo'lgan haqiqiy shamshir, soxta emas.

gate [n.] — darvoza
🔺>> A gate is a type of door. Gates are usually made of metal or wood. >> Gate eshikning bir turi. Gate'lar odatda metal yoki yog'ochdan yasaladi.

— We want to put up a wooden gate around our house.
— Bir hovlimizning atrofiga yog'och darvoza qo'yishni xohlayapmiz.

comfort [v.] — taskin bermoq, ovutmoq
🔺>> To comfort someone means to make them feel better. >> Birortasini comfort qilish uni o'zini yaxshi his qildirish degani.

— I wanted to comfort my friend after I heard the bad news.
— Men yomon xabarni eshitganimdan so'ng do'stimga taskin berishni xohladim.

reward [n.] — mukofot, sovrin
🔺>> A reward is something given in exchange for good behavior or work. >> Reward yaxshi hulq yoki ish uchun beriladigan narsa.

— He was given a reward for his excellent performance.
— Uning ajoyib qatnashuvi uchun mukofot berildi.

amaze [v.] — hayratda qoldirmoq
🔺>> To amaze someone is to surprise them very much. >> Birortasini amaze qilish uni juda ham hayratga solish degani.

— The news in the paper amazed Jack.
— Qog'ozdagi yangilik Jekni hayratda qoldirdi.

steal [v.] — o'g'irlamoq
🔺>> To steal is to take something that is not yours. >> Steal o'ziniki bo'lmagan narsani olish degani.

— The men tried to steal money from the bank.
— Haligi kishilar bankdagi pulni o'g'irlashga urinishdi.

thief [n.] — o'g'ri
🔺>> A thief is someone who quietly takes things that do not belong to them. >> Thief tez-tez o'ziga tegishli bo'lmagan narsalarni oladigan odam.

— A thief broke into our home and took my mother’s jewelry.
— O'g'ri uyga buzib kirib onamning taqinchoqlarini oldi.

deliver [v.] — tashimoq, eltmoq
🔺>> To deliver something is to take it from one place to another. >> Biror narsani deliver qilish uni bir joydan boshqa joyga olib borish degani.

— The man delivered Chinese food to my house.
— Haligi kishi Xitoy taomini uyimga eltdi.

set [v.] — qo'ymoq
🔺>> To set something is to put it somewhere. >> Biror narsani set qilish uni biror joyga qo’yish degani.

— Please set the dice down on the table.
— Iltimos, oshiqlarni (shishibesh) stol ustiga qo'y.

include [v.] — o'z ichiga olmoq
🔺>> To include something means to have it as part of a group. >> Biror narsani include qilish uni bir guruhning qismi sifatida qabul qilish degani.

— Does this meal include a soft drink?
— Bu taom salqin ichimlikni ham o'z ichiga oladimi?

plate [n.] — likop
🔺>> A plate is a flat round thing that you put food on. >> Plate siz unga taom soladigan aylana yupqa narsa.

— I put my plate down so I could put some food on it.
— Men likopimni unga ovqat solaman deb pastga qo'ydim.

receive [v.] — olmoq, qabul qilib olmoq
🔺>> To receive something is to get it. >> Biror narsani receive qilish uni olish degani.

— I received a present on my birthday.
— Men tug'ilgan kunimga sovg'a oldim.

charge [n.] — narx
🔺>> A charge is the price to pay for something. >> Charge biror narsaga to'lanadigan narx.

— The charge for the shirts was $15.00.
— Ko'ylakning narxi $15.000 edi.
Unit 23:
athlete [n.] — sportchi
🔺>> An athlete is a person who plays sports. >> Athlete sport bilan shug'ullanadigan shaxs.

— Some athletes can play many sports very well.
— Ba'zi sportchilar ko'p sport bilan yaxshi shug'ullanishadi.

sound [v.] — tovush chiqazmoq
🔺>> To sound means to make a noise. >> Sound tovush chiqarish degani.

— The alarm clock sounded and woke us all up.
— Budilnik tovush chiqardi va hammamizni uyg'otdi.

behind [prep.] — orqasida
🔺>> Behind means to be at the back of something. >> Behind biror narsaning orqasida bo'lish degani.

— The little girl was hiding behind a tree.
— Kichkina qizcha daraxtning orqasiga berkinayotgan edi.

shoot [v.] — otmoq, o'q uzmoq
🔺>> To shoot is to fire something like a bullet at someone or something. >> Shoot o'qga o'xshash narsani birovga yoki boshqa narsaga otish degani.

— The hunter raised his gun to shoot at the target.
— Ovchi nishonga otish uchun qurolini ko'tardi.

safety [n.] — xavfsizlik
🔺>> Safety means to be the condition of being safe and free from danger. >> Safety xavfdan holi va xavfsiz vaziyatda bo'lishni anglatadi.

— For his own safety, he was placed in a car seat.
— O'zining xavfsizligi uchun uni avtomobil o'rindig'iga joylashtirishdi.

course [n.] — dars, kurs
🔺>> A course is a class in school. >> Course maktabdagi dars.

— I took a Russian course in school this year.
— Men bu yil maktabda rus tili kursini oldim.

lower [v.] — pasaymog, pasaytirmoq
🔺>> To lower something is to make it go down. >> Biror narsani lower qilish uni pasaytirish degani.

— The chart shows how his production has lowered over the year.
— Chizma uning mahsulotlari yil davomida qay darajada pasayganini ko'rsatadi.

advance [v.] — oldinga yurmoq
🔺>> To advance is to go forward. >> Advance oldinga yurish degani.

— He advanced up the ladder slowly.
— U narvondan tepaga qarab sekin yurdi.

mental [adj.] — aqliy, faraziy
🔺>> If something is mental, it has to do with your mind. >> Agar biror narsa mental bo'lsa, u sizning aqlingiz bilan qilinadi.

— I made a mental picture of the room.
— Men xonaning faraziy rasmini yaratdim.

remove [v.] — olib tashlamoq
🔺>> To remove something is to take it away. >> Biror narsani remove qilish uni olib tashlash degani.

— I removed the nail from the board.
— Men taxtadan mixni olib tashladim.

web [n.] — o'rgimchak to'ri/uyasi
🔺>> A web is a home made by a spider. >> Web o'rgimchak tomonidan yasaladigan uy.

— Mom cleaned the spider webs out of the garage.
— Onam garaj tashqarisidagi o'rgimchak to'rlarini tozaladi.

average [adj.] — o'rtacha, o'rta tabaqali
🔺>> If something is average, it is at a normal level. >> Agar biror narsa average bo'lsa, u o'rtacha darajada.


— I’m not rich or poor. I’m average.
— Men boy ham kambag'al ham emasman. Men o'rta darajadaman.

behavior [n.] — xulq-atvor
🔺>> Your behavior is the way you act. >> Behavior siz harakat qiladigan usul, shakl.

— Their behavior was good this semester. They didn’t cause trouble.
— Ularning xulq-atvori bu semestr yaxshi bo'ldi. Ular qiyinchilik tug'dirmadi.

member [n.] — a'zo
🔺>> A member is a person who is part of a group. >> Member guruhning qismi bo'lgan shaxs.

— Julie is the newest member of our team.
— Juli jamoamizning eng yangi a'zosi.

match [v.] — mos kelmoq, tushmoq
🔺>> To match is to be the same or similar. >> Match qilish bu bir xil bo'lish degani.

— The two shoes matched. They looked the same.
— Ikki poyabzal mos keldi. Ular bir xil ko'rindi.

personality [n.] — shaxsiyat, o'zlik
🔺>> Your personality is what you are like and how you behave. >> Sizning personality bu siz nimaga o'xshashingiz va o'zingizni qanday tutishingiz.

— John has a bad personality.
— Jon yomon shaxsiyatga ega.

роеm [n.] — sher, to'rtlik
🔺>> A poem is a short kind of writing. >> Poem yozilmaning qisqa shakli.

— William Shakespeare wrote many poems.
— Uilyam Shekspir ko'plab she'rlar yozgan.

swim [v.] — suzmogq, cho'milmoq
🔺>> To swim is to move through water. >> Swim suv orqali harakatlanish degani.

— I love to swim in the ocean.
— Men okeanda suzishni yoqtiraman.

pole [n.] — ustun, xoda
🔺>> A pole is a long thin stick made of wood or metal that supports things. >> Pole narsalarni tirab turadigan, yog'och yoki metaldan qilinadigan uzun ingichka tayoq.

— The flag was hanging from the flag pole.
— Bayroq ustunga ilinib turar edi.

passenger [n.] — yo'lovchi
🔺>> A passenger is a person who rides in a car, train, or airplane. >> Passenger mashina, poyezd yoki samolyotda yuradigan shaxs.

— One passenger was standing in the subway train.
— Bir yo'lovchi metro poyezdida turar edi.
Unit 24:
guide [n.] — gid, yo'lboshchi
🔺>> A guide is someone who shows you where to go. >> Guide sizga qayerga borishni ko'rsatadigan odam.

— We followed a guide at the park.
— Biz parkda gidga ergashdik.

task [n.] — topshiriq, vazifa
🔺>> A task is work that someone has to do. >> Task birortasi qilishi kerak bo'lgan ish.

— Who has the task of building the brick wall?
— G'ishtli devorni buzish kimning topshirig'i?

critic [n.] — tanqidchi
🔺>> A critic is someone who give their opinions about movies, books, plays. >> Critic kino, kitoblar, pyesalar haqida o'z fikrini aytadigan shaxs.

— The wine critic tasted the wine so he could give his opinion.
— Vino tanqidchisi o'z fikrini aytish uchun vinoni tatib ko'rdi.

unite [v.] — birlashmoq
🔺>> To unite is to get together to do something. >> Unite biror narsa qilish uchun birlashish degani.

— If we unite, we can finish our project faster.
— Agar birlashsak, loyihamizni tezroq tugatamiz.

event [n.] — tadbir, voqea
🔺>> An event is something that happens, especially something important. >> Event sodir bo'ladigan biror muhim voqea.

— Finishing high school was a major event in his life.
— Katta maktabni tugatish uning hayotidagi muhim voqea bo'ldi.

complex [adj.] — murakkab, mushkul
🔺>> If something is complex, it has many small parts. It is hard to understand. >> Agar biror narsa complex bo'lsa, u juda ko'p mayda qismlarga ega. Uni tushunish qiyin.

— A jig-saw puzzle can be complex because it has so many pieces.
— Mayda bo'lakli puzzle murakkab bo'lsa kerak, chunki u juda ko'p qismlardan iborat.

exercise [v.] — mashq qilmoq
🔺>> To exercise is to run or play sports so that you can be healthy. >> Exercise sog'lom bo'lish uchun yugurish yoki sport bilan shug'ullanish.

— You should exercise every day.
— Siz har kuni mashq qilishingiz kerak.

strike [n.] — urmoq
🔺>> To strike someone or something is to hit them. >> Birortasi yoki biror nimani strike qilish uni urish degani.

— She struck the other girl in the face.
— U narigi qizning yuziga urdi.

support [v.] — qo'llab-quvvatlamoq
🔺>> To support something is to like it and help it be successful. >> Biror narsani support qilish uni yaxshi ko'rish va uni muvaffaqiyatli bo'lishiga yordam berish degani.

— Everyone at work supports the new plan.
— Ishdagi hamma yangi rejani qo'llab-quvvatlaydi.

cheer [v.] — qichqirmoq, ruhlantirmoq
🔺>> To cheer is to give a loud shout of approval or encouragement. >> Cheer ruhlantirish yoki ma'qullash bilan baland ovozda baqirish.

— The crowd all cheered when the home team won.
— Mahalliy jamoa yutganda olomondagi barcha qichqirdi.

probable [adj.] — ehtimol, bo'lishi mumkin bo'lgan
🔺>> If something is probable, it is likely to happen. >> Agar biror narsa probable bo'lsa, uning amalga oshish ehtimoli bo'ladi.

— It is probable that you will get a good grade if you study for the test.
— Agar testga tayyorlangan bo'lsang, yaxshi natijaga erishishing ehtimoli bo'ladi.

term [n.] — termin, so'z
🔺>> A term is a word for something. >> Term biror narsaning so'zi.

— I often use the term “oops” when I make a mistake.
— Men odatda xato qilganimda "oops" terminini ishlataman.

passage [n.] — yo'lak
🔺>> A passage is a long area with walls that goes from one place to another. >> Passage bir joydan boshqa joyga boruvchi uzun devorli joy.

— The long passage led us to the other side of the field.
— Uzun yo'lak bizni dalaning narigi tarafiga boshlab bordi.

fit [v.] — loyiq bo'lmog, mos kelmoq
🔺>> If something fits, it is small enough or the right size to go there. >> Agar biror narsa fit bo'lsa, unga kirish uchun yetarlicha kichkina yoki to'g'ri o'lchamda.

— The colorful eggs fit into the box.
— Rangli tuxumlar qutiga mos keladi.

block [n.] — bo'lak
🔺>> A block is a solid piece of wood, stone or ice. >> Block tosh, yog'och yoki muzning qattiq bo'lagi.

— I saw a block of ice on the floor.
— Men pol ustida muz bo'lagini ko'rdim.

pressure [n] — bosim
🔺>> Pressure is what you apply to make someone do something. >> Pressure birortasini biror narsa qilishini talab qilishingiz.

— They put pressure on him to change his mind.
— Ular fikrini o'zgartirishi uchun unga bosim qilishdi.

lack [n.] — yetishmovchilik, kamchilik
🔺>> lf there is a lack of something, there is not enough of it. >> Agar biror narsa lack bo'lsa, u yerda o'sha narsa yo'q bo'ladi.

— His only problem is a lack of money.
— Uning yagona muammosi pulining yo'qligi.

friendship [n.] — do'stlik
🔺>> Friendship is the relationship between people who are friends. >> Friendship do'stlar o'rtasidagi yaqin munosabat.

— Michael and Lisa have a very strong friendship with each other.
— Maykl va Liza juda yaqin do'stlik rishtalariga ega.

public [adi.] — ijtimoiy, hamma uchun, ommaga aloqador
🔺>> If something is public, it is meant for everyone to use. >> Agar biror narsa public bo'lsa, u hamma ishlatishi uchun bo'ladi. 

— I went to the public park to play with my friends.
— Men do'stlarim bilan o'ynagani jamoat parkiga bordim.

perform [v.] — ijro etmoq
🔺>> To perform is to do something in front of people who watch. >> Perform kuzatib turgan odamlar oldida biror narsa qilish.

— He will perform a song for the class.
— U sinf uchun qo'shiq ijro qiladi.
Unit 25:
medicine [v.] — dori-darmon
🔺>> Medicine is something you take to feel better or treat an illness. >> Medicine yaxshiroq bo'lish yoki kasaldan tuzalish uchun qabul qilinadigan narsa.

— The doctor gave me medicine for my cold.
— Shamollashimga doktor dori berdi.

factory [n.] — fabrika, zavod
🔺>> A factory is a building where things are made or put together. >> Factory narsalar yasaladigan yoki yig'iladigan bino.

— We have only one factory in our town.
— Bizning shahrimizda faqat bitta fabrika bor.

tip [n.] — uch
🔺>> A tip is a pointed end of something. >> Tip biror narsaning oxirgi qismi.

— The tip of his pen was very sharp.
— Uning ruchkasining uchi juda o'tkir edi.

feature [n.] — xususiyat, jihat
🔺>> A feature is an important part of something. >> Feature biror narsaning muhim qismi.

— The cell phone has many features.
— Telefonning juda ko'p xususiyatlari bor.

involve [v.] — jalb etmoq
🔺>> To involve means to be actively taking part in something. >> Involve biror narsaning biq qismini tashkil qilish degani.

— The whole family was involved in playing the game.
— Butun oila o'yin o'ynashga jalb qilingan edi.

environment [n.] — tabiat, atrof-muhit
🔺>> The environment is the place where people work or live. >> Environment odamlar yashaydigan yoki ishlaydigan joy.

— Keeping our environment clean is important to our health.
— Atrof-muhitni toza saqlash bizning sog'lig'imiz uchun muhim.

associate [v.] — bog'lamoq
🔺>> To associate means to connect something with a person or thing. >> Associate biror narsani shaxs yoki narsa bilan bog'lashni bildiradi.

— Most people associate birthday parties with having fun.
— Ko'p odamlar tug'ilgan kun bayramlarini zavqlanish bilan bog'lashadi.

produce [v.] — ishlab chiqarmoq
🔺>> To produce something is to make or grow it. >> Biror narsani produce qilish, uni yasash yoki o'stirish degani.

— This tree produces apples every year.
— Bu daraxt har yili olma yetishtiradi.

populate [v.] — yashamoq
🔺>> If people populate an area, they live there. >> Agar odamlar biror joyda populate qilishsa, demak ular o'sha joyda yashaydi.

— Billions of people populate the Earth.
— Yerda milliardlab odamlar yashaydi.

range [n.] — qator, miqdor
🔺>> A range is a number or a set of similar things. >> Range bu raqam yoki bir xil narsalar yig'indisi.

— I saw a range of cars to choose from.
— Men tanlash uchun bir qator mashinalarni ko'rdim.

instance [n.] — namuna, misol
🔺>> An instance is an example of something. >> Instance biror narsaning namunasi.

— I have never experienced an instance of hate. Have you?
— Men hech qachon nafratlanish namunasi bo'lmaganman. Sizchi?

mix [n.] — aralashma
🔺>> A mix is different things put together. >> Mix turli narsalarni birga qo'yish.

— The green mix we made in science class spilled onto the table.
— Ilmiy fanda biz tayyorlagan yashil aralashma stolga to'kilib ketdi.

wide [adj.] — keng
🔺>> If something is wide, it is large from side to side. >> Agar biror narsa wide bo'lsa, u bu tomondan u tomonga qarab katta bo'ladi. 

— The door was as wide as my arms.
— Eshik qo'llarimchalik keng edi.

regular [adj.] — muntazam
🔺>> If something is regular, it happens often and in equal amounts of time. >> Agar biror narsa regular bo'lsa, u tez-tez bir xil vaqt oralig'ida sodir bo'ladi.

— Our regular lunch time is around noon.
— Bizning muntazam tushlik vaqtimiz peshinda.

period [n.] — davr, zamon
🔺>> A period is an amount of time when something happens. >> Period biror narsa sodir bo'ladigan vaqt miqdori.

— In one period in Europe, there were many knights.
— Yevropada bir davrda, bir qancha qirollar bo'lgan.

recognize [v.] — tanimog, bilmoq
🔺>> To recognize something is to know it because you have seen it before. >> Biror narsani recognize qilish uni avval ko'rganingiz uchun tanib olish degani.

— I recognized an old friend from many years ago.
— Men bir necha yil oldingi eski do'stimni tanidim.

organize [v.] — tashkillashtirmoq
🔺>> To organize is to plan or get ready for an event. >> Organize biror voqeani rejalashtirish yoki unga tayyorgarlik ko'rish degani.

— Make a list to help you organize the things you need.
— Ro'yxatini yozib olish siz biror narsani tashkillashtirishingizda yordam beradi.

sign [n.] — belgi, ishora
🔺>> A sign is a notice giving information, directions, a warning, etc. >> Sign ma'lumot, yo'nalish, ogohlantirish beradigan ishora.

— The sign indicated that today would be a bad day.
— Haligi belgi bugun yomon kun bo'lishiga ishora qildi.

tradition [n.] — an'ana, udum
🔺>> A tradition is something people have been doing for a long time. >> Tradition odamlar uzoq vaqt dqvomida qilib kelgan ishi.

— Marriage is a tradition all over the world.
— Nikoh butun dunyo bo'ylab an'ana hisoblanadi.

trash [n.] — axlat, chiqindi
🔺>> Trash is waste material or unwanted or worthless things. >> Trash keraksiz material yoki xohlanmaydigan yoki foydasiz narsa.

— Please take out the trash; it smells bad.
— Iltimos, axlatni tashqariga tashla, yomon hid chiqaryapti.
Unit 26:
attention [n.] — diqqat, e'tibor
🔺>> Attention is the notice, thought, or consideration of someone. >> Attention biror narsa haqida ogohlantirish, mulohaza yoki fikr.

— His work got the attention of two of his co-workers.
— Uning ishi ikki hamkasbining e'tiboriga tushdi.

imply [v.] — nazarda tutmoq, ko'zda tutmoq
🔺>> To imply something is to suggest it without saying it. >> Biron narsani imply qilish uni aytmasdan taklif qilishdir.

— The man implied that he wanted the job, but he didn’t say so.
— Haligi erkak bu ishni xohlaganligini nazarda tutgan, ammo u buni aytmagan.

neither [adv.] — hech qaysisi, hech biri
🔺>> You use neither to connect two negative statements. >> Siz neither'ni ikki negativ gapni bog'lash uchun ishlatasiz.

— Neither the pass on the left nor the pass on the right will lead us home.
— Chapdagi dovon ham, o'ngdagi dovon ham bizni uyimizga olib bormaydi.

react [v.] — hodisaga munosabat bildirmoq
🔺>> To react is to act in a certain way because of something that happened. >> To react biror sodir bo'lgan narsaga nisbatan biror yo'l bilan harakat qilmoq degani.

— James reacted badly to the news.
— Jeyms yangilikka yomon munosabat bildirdi.

situated [adj.] — joylshgan, o'rnashgan
🔺>> If something is situated somewhere, it is in that place. >> Agar biror narsa biror joyda situated bo'lsa, u o'sha joyda hisoblanadi.

— The white board is situated between the two men.
— Oq doska ikki erkak o'rtasida joylashgan.

further [adj.] — uzunroq, uzoqroq
🔺>> Further is used to say something is from a distance or time. >> Further biror narsani masofadan yoki vaqtdan aytish uchun ishlatiladi.

— The escalator is further along than I thought.
— Eskalator men o'ylagandan ham uzunroq ekan.

prove [v.] — isbotlamoq, dalil keltirmoq
🔺>> To prove something is to show that it is true. >> Biror narsani prove qilish uning to'g'riligini ko'rsatish degani.

— My teacher proved the answer on the board.
— O'qituvchim javobni doskada isbotlab berdi.

society [n.] — jamiyat
🔺>> Society is people and the way that they live. >> Society odamlar vq ular yashash yo'li.

— Society expects people to be good and honest.
— Jamiyat odamlardan yaxshi va halol bo'lishlarini kutadi.

standard [n.] — standard, me'zon
🔺>> A standard is what people consider normal or good. >> A standard bu odamlar nimani normal va yaxshi deb hisoblashlari.

— This older model TV is below our store’s standards.
— Bu televizorning eski modeli do'konimiz me'zonlaridan pastda.

otherwise [adv.] — aks holda
🔺>> Otherwise means different or in another way. >> Otherwise boshqacha yoki boshqa yo'l bilan degani.

— It’s good to stay active; otherwise, you'll gain weight.
— Harakatda bo'lish yaxshi, aks holda ortiqcha vazn olishingiz mumkin.

climb [v.] — tirmashmog, chirmashmoq
🔺>> To climb means to use your hands and feet to go up on something. >> Climb biror narsani oshib o'tish uchun qo'l va oyoqlarni ishlatishni bildiradi.

— The girls climbed to the top of the mountain.
— Haligi qizlar tog'ning eng tepasiga chiqishdi.

final [adj.] — oxirgi, so'nggi
🔺>> If something is final, it is the last part. >> Agar biror narsa final bo'lsa, bu oxirgi qism bo'ladi.

— In the final part of the film, the man and the woman got married.
— Filmning yakuniy qismida erkak va ayol turmush qurishdi.

ride [v.] — haydamoq, minmoq
🔺>> To ride something is to travel on it. You can ride an animal, a bike, etc. >> Biror narsani ride qilish uning ustida sayohat qilish degani. Siz hayvonni, velosipedni yoki boshqa narsalarni ride qilishingiz mumkin.

— I will ride a horse for the first time today.
— Men bugun birinchi marta ot minaman.

attract [v.] — tortmog, jalb qilmoq
🔺>> To attract means to make a person or thing come closer or be interested. >> Attract biror narsa yoki birortasini yaqinlashtirish yoki qiziqtirishni bildiradi.

— The magnet attracted the metal.
— Magnit metalni o'ziga tortdi.

drop [v.] — tomchilamog, tommoq
🔺>> To drop is to fall or allow something to fall. >> To drop — tushish yoki biror narsaning tushishiga imkon berish.

— A small amount of water dropped from the bottle.
— Shishadan oz miqdordagi suv tushdi.

suggest [v.] — taklif qilmoq, tavsiya qilmoq
🔺>> To suggest something means to give an idea or plan about it. >> Biror narsani suggest qilish u haqda reja yoki g'oya aytish degani.

— He suggested that we go to see his boss.
— U bizga uning boshlig'ini ko'rishga borishni taklif qildi.

advice [n.] — maslahat
🔺>> Advice is an opinion about what to do. >> Advice biror narsa qilish haqidagi fikr.

— I don’t know how to study for my exams. Can you give me some advice?
— Men imtihonlarimga qanday tayyorlanishni bilmayapman. Maslahat bera olasanmi?

along [prep.] — bo'ylab
🔺>> Along means to move from one part of a road, river, etc. to another. >> Along yo'lning, daryoning bir qismidan narigi qismiga tomon harakatlanishni bildiradi.

— Walk along this tunnel for ten minutes, and you’ll see a door on the left.
— Tunel bo'ylab 10 daqiqa yurgin va chap tarafda eshikka duch kelasan.

physical [adj.] — jismoniy
🔺>> If something is physical, it is related to your body and not your mind. >> Agar biror narsa physical bo'lsa, u sizning aqlingizga emas tanangizga aloqador bo'ladi.

— Biking is good for your physical health.
— Velosiped minish sizning jismoniy sog'lig'ingiz uchun yaxshi.

maintain [v.] — ayni holda saqlamoq
🔺>> To maintain means to make something stay the same. >> To maintain — biron bir narsani bir xilda saqlashni anglatadi.

— The balls maintain constant movement.
— Haligi to'plar doimiy harakatni saqlab turadi.
Unit 27:
actually [adv.] — aslida, rosti
🔺>> Actually means in fact or really. >> Actually haqiqatan, rostdan degan ma’noni anglatadi. 

— My dad looks a little mean, but actually he’s very kind.
— Dadam biroz yomon ko'rinadi, lekin aslida u juda mehribon.

gift [n.] — sovg'a
🔺>> A gift is something you give someone. >> A gift siz birortasiga beradigan narsa.

— Dave received many gifts for Christmas.
— Deyv Yangi yilga juda ko'p sovg'a oldi.

puzzle [n.] — boshqotirma
🔺>> A puzzle is something that is hard to understand. >> A puzzle tushunish qiyin bo'lgan narsa.

— The question was a puzzle to him.
— Savol u uchun boshqotirma edi.

rather [adv.] — ma'qul ko'rmoq
🔺>> Rather is used when you want to do one thing but not the other. >> Rather siz bir narsani o'rniga boshqa bir narsani qilishni xohlaganingizda ishlatiladi.

— I would rather have the red one than the blue one.
— Men ko'kidan ko'ra qizilini ma'qul ko'raman.

examine [v.] — tekshirib ko'rmoq
🔺>> To examine something is to look at it carefully. >> Biror narsani examine qilish uni diqqat bilan ko'rish degani.

— The doctor examined my eyes today.
— Doktor bugun ko'zimni tekshirib ko'rdi.

desert [n.] — cho'l
🔺>> The desert is an area of land without many plants or water. >> The desert ko'p o'simliklarsiz va suvsiz yer maydoni.

— Not many plants grow in the desert.
— Cho'lda ko'p o'simliklar o'smaydi.

coast [n.] — sohil, qirg'oq
🔺>> The coast is the land by an ocean. >> The coast okean bo'yidagi yer.

— I stayed on the southern coast of Australia.
— Men Avstraliyaning janubiy qirg'og'ida turdim.

imagine [v.] — tasavvur qilmoq
🔺>> To imagine something is to think of it in your mind. >> Biror narsani imagine qilish u haqida miyangizda o'ylash degani.

— Sally imagined herself winning lots of money.
— Selli o'zini juda ko'p pul yutib olganday tasavvur qildi.

tour [n.] — safar, sayohat
🔺>> A tour is a short trip in which you see many sights. >> A tour bu diqqatga sazovor joylarni ko'rish mumkin bo'lgan qisqa sayohat.

— I took a tour of Asia and Europe.
— Men Osiyo va Yevropaga safar qildim.

journey [n.] — sayohat 
🔺>> A journey is a long trip. >> A journey uzoq safar degani.

— I went on a journey across the country with my parents.
— Men ota-onam bilan butun mamlakat bo'ylab sayohatga chiqdim.

bite [n.] — tishlash
🔺>> Bite is the act of using your teeth to cut and tear into something. >> Bite bu tishlaring yordamida biror narsani kesish va yirtish.

— The boy took a big bite out of his hamburger.
— Bola gamburgeridan katta tishladi.

specific [adj.] — aniq, muayyan
🔺>> If something is specific, it is precise or exact. >> Agar biror narsa specific bo'lsa, u ravon yoki aniq bo'ladi.

— Please choose a specific place on the map.
— Iltimos, xaritadan muayyan joyni tanlang.

quite [adv.] — juda, rosa
🔺>> Quite is used to say that something is complete or very much. >> Quite biror narsa to'liq yoki juda ko'p deb aytish uchun ishlatiladi.

— I think typing on a keyboard is quite easy.
— Menimcha klaviaturada yozish juda oson.

trip [n.] — sayohat, safar
🔺>> A trip is a journey to a certain place. >> A trip bu ma'lum bir joyga sayohat.

— Ken took a trip to the city yesterday.
— Ken kecha shaharga safar qildi.

value [n.] — qiymat, baho
🔺>> If something has value, it is worth a lot of money. >> Agar biror narsaning value'si bo'lsa, u juda ko'p pulga arziydi.

— Matthew found a treasure of very high value.
— Matto juda qimmatbaho xazinani topdi.

deal [n.] — kelishuv, shartnoma
🔺>> A deal is an agreement that you have with another person. >> A deal siz boshqa odam bilan tuzadigan kelishuv.

— I made a deal with the other company to give us some money.
— Men boshqa kompaniya bilan bir qancha miqdorda pul berishlari haqida kelishuv tuzdim.

hunger [n.] — ochlik
🔺>> Hunger is the feeling that you get when you need to eat. >> Hunger biror narsa yeyishingiz kerak bo'lgan paytdagi tuyg'u.

— After playing all day long, he was filled with hunger.
— Kun bo'yi o'ynagandan so'ng, u juda och qoldi.

false [n.] — noto'g'ri, xato
🔺>> If something is false, it is not correct. >> Agar biror narsa false bo'lsa, u noto'g'ri bo'ladi. 

— If you think the answer is false, press the red button.
— Agar siz javobni xato deb o'ylasangiz, qizil tugmani bosing.

earthquake [n.] — zilzila
🔺>> An earthquake is a shaking movement of the ground. >> An earthquake yerning silkinib harakatlanishi.

— The building shook during the earthquake.
— Zilzila paytida bino silkindi.

effective [adj.] — samarali
🔺>> If something is effective, it works well. >> Agar biror narsa effective bo'lsa, u yaxshi ishlaydi.

— Swimming is an effective way to stay healthy.
— Suzish — sog'lom bo'lishning samarali usuli.
Unit 28:
magic [n.] — sehr, jodu
🔺>> Magic is the power to do impossible things. >> Magic imkonsiz narsalarni qiladigan kuch.

— The magician used magic to pull a rabbit out of his hat.
— Sehrgar qalpog'idan quyonni chiqarish uchun sehr ishlatdi.

schedule [n.] — jadval
🔺>> A schedule is a plan that tells you when to do things. >> A schedule ishlarni qachon qilishingizni aytib turadigan reja.

— What is your class schedule for today?
— Bugungi sinf jadvalingiz (rejangiz) nima?

band [n.] — guruh
🔺>> A band is a group of people who play music. >> A band musiqa chaladigan odamlar guruhi.

— My brother is in a rock band.
— Mening akam rok guruhda.

within [prep.] — ichida
🔺>> You use within to say that something is inside another thing. >> Siz within'ni biror narsa boshqa bir narsaning ichidaligini aytish uchun ishlatasiz.

— Within the box, there was a pizza.
— Quti ichida pitsa bor edi.

own [v.] — egalik qilmoq
🔺>> To own something means to have it. That thing belongs to you. >> Biror narsani own qilish unga egalik qilish degani. U narsa sizga tegishli bo'ladi.

— My grandfather owns that house.
— Mening bobom haligi uyga egalik qiladi.

cancel [v.] — bekor qilmoq
🔺>> To cancel means to decide that an event or a request will not happen. >> To cancel biror voqea yoki talab sodir bo'lmasligi uchun qaror qabul qilish degani.

— She cancelled the rest of her plans because of the rain.
— U yomg'irni deb rejalarining qolgan qismini bekor qildi.

share [v.] — bo'lishmoq, baham ko'rmoq
🔺>> To share something is to give some of it to another person. >> Biror narsani share qilish u narsaning bir qanchasini boshqa odamga berish degani.

— Jimmy shared his apple with me.
— Jimi olmasini men bilan bo'lishdi.

list [n.] — ro'yxat
🔺>> A list is a record of information printed with an item on each line. >> A list — har bir satrga yozilgan ma'lumotlarning yozuvi.

— My mom makes a list of groceries to buy.
— Onam sotib olish uchun oziq-ovqat ro'yxatini tuzadi.

instrument [n.] — asbob
🔺>> An instrument is something designed to do a certain task like music. >> An instrument — bu musiqa chiqarish kabi muayyan vazifani bajarish uchun mo'ljallangan narsa.

— My favorite musical instrument is the piano.
— Mening sevimli musiqa asbobim bu pianino.

rush [v.] — yelmoq; shoshmoq
🔺>> To rush is to go somewhere or do something very quickly. >> To rush biror joyga tez borish yoki biror narsani tez bajarish degani.

— Nancy rushed to finish her homework.
— Nensi uy vazifasini tez bajarishga shoshdi.

barely [adv.] — arang; sal-pal
🔺>> Barely means by the smallest amount, almost not. >> Barely juda kam miqdorda, deyarli yo'q degani.

— I barely had enough money to pay for my bus ticket.
— Avtobus chiptasiga to'lagani arang pulim yetdi.

garbage [n.] — chiqindi, axlat
🔺>> Garbage is waste material like unwanted or spoiled food, bottles, paper, etc. >> Garbage — bu keraksiz yoki buzilgan oziq-ovqat, shisha, qog'oz va boshqalar kabi chiqindilar.

— The boy cleaned up the garbage around his house.
— Haligi bola uyining atrofidagi axlatlarni tozaladi.

predict [v.] — bashorat qilmoq, oldindan aytmoq
🔺>> To predict something is to say that it will happen. >> Biror narsani predict qilish uning sodir bo'lishini aytish degani.

— She predicted that I would get married next year.
— U men kelasi yil uylanishimni bashorat qildi.

driveway [n.] — tratuar, yo'lak
🔺>> A driveway is a short private road that leads to a person’s home. >> A driveway birortasining uyiga eltadigan shaxsiy qisqa yo'l.

— The long driveway led us to their new house.
— Uzun yo'lak bizni ularning yangi uyiga eltdi.

notice [v.] — payqamoq, sezmoq
🔺>> To notice something is to see it for the first time. >> Biror narsani notice qilish uni birinchi marta ko'rish degani.

— Did you notice the view?
— Haligi ko'rinishni payqadingizmi?

stage [n.] — sahna
🔺>> A stage is a place where actors or musicians act or sing. >> A stage aktyorlar yoki qo'shiqchilar ro'l ijro etadigan, kuylaydigan joy.

— A large screen was on the stage.
— Sahnada katta ekran bor edi.

storm [n.] — bo'ron, to'fon
🔺>> A storm is very bad weather. There is a lot of rain or snow. >> A storm juda yomon ob-havo. U payt juda ko'p yomg'ir yoki qor yog'adi.

— Did that storm wake you up last night?
— Kecha kechasi haligi bo'ron sizni uyg'otib yubordimi?

boring [adj.] — zeriklarli
🔺>> If something is boring, it is not fun. >> Agar biror narsa boring bo'lsa, u qiziqarli emas. 

— I think the Internet is boring.
— Menimcha, Internet zerikarli.

message [n.] — xabar
🔺>> A message is a set of words that you send to someone. >> A message — bu kimgadir yuboradigan so'zlar to'plami.

— I left a message for you in the envelope.
— Men sizga konvertda xabar qoldirdim.

professor [n.] — professor
🔺>> A professor is a person who teaches in college. >> A professor kollejda dars beruvchi shaxs.

— Mike’s science professor knows a lot about physics.
— Maykning ilmiy professori fizika haqida ko'p narsani biladi.
Unit 29:
cool [adj.] — salqin, jindak sovuq
🔺>> If the weather is cool, it is a little bit cold. >> Agar ob-havo cool bo'lsa, u bir oz sovuq bo'ladi.

— The weather is cool in the fall.
— Kuzda ob-havo bir oz sovuq bo'ladi.

major [adj.] — muhim, katta
🔺>> If something is major, it is big or important. >> Agar biror narsa major bo'lsa, u katta yoki muhim.

— I have a major problem. My boss wants me to redo my project!
— Menda katta muammo bor. Mening xo'jayinim loyihani qayta ishlashimni xohlayapti!

president [n.] — prezident
🔺>> A president is the leader of a country. >> A president mamlakat lideri.

— Тhе president of our country made an important announcement.
— Mamlakatimiz prezidenti muhim narsani e'lon qildi.

competition [n.] — musobaqa
🔺>> A competition is a contest to see who is the best at something. >> A competition bu kimdir biror narsada eng zo'rini ko'rish uchun o'tkaziladigan musobaqa.

— He won the running competition over the weekend.
— U hafta oxiri yugurish musobaqasida g'olib chiqdi.

gain [v.] — olmoq, oshirmoq
🔺>> If you gain something, you get more of it. >> Agar siz biror narsani gain qilsangiz, uni ko'proq yig'asiz.

— I gained some weight over the summer.
— Men yoz ichi bir oz vazn yig'dim.

advertise [v.] — reklama qilmoq
🔺>> To advertise is to tell people about something on TV, radio, etc. >> To advertise odamlarga biror narsa haqida televizor, radio yoki boshqa vosita orqali aytish.

— They used a rabbit to help them advertise their product.
— Ular mahsulotlarini reklama qilishda quyondan foydalanishdi.

audience [n.] — auditoriya
🔺>> An audience is a group of people who watch something together. >> An audience biror narsani birgalikda ko'rish uchun yig'ilgan odamlar jamoasi.

— There was a large audience at the game.
— O'yinda katta auditoriya bor edi.

skill [n.] — mahorat, qobiliyat
🔺>> A skill is the knowledge and ability that allows you to do something well. >> A skill sizga biror narsani yaxshi bajarishingizga yo'l qo'yadigan bilim va qobiliyat.

— A snowboarder must have the right skills to do well.
— Snoubordchi yaxshi uchishi uchun kerakli qobiliyatlarga ega bo'lishi kerak.

importance [n.] — ahamiyat
🔺>> Importance means the quality or condition of being needed or valued. >> Importance bu kerakli yoki baholanadigan sifat yoki holat.

— VIPs are people of great importance.
— VIPlar katta ahamiyatli kishilar.

breakfast [n.] — nonushta
🔺>> Breakfast is the first meal of the day. >> Breakfast kunning dastlabki ovqati.

— I eat breakfast at 8:00 every morning.
— Men har kuni ertalab 8:00 da nonushta qilaman.

assign [v.] — tayinlamoq, topshirmoq
🔺>> To assign something to someone is to tell them to do it. >> Biror narsani birortasiga assign qilish ularga ushbu narsani bajarishni aytish degani.

— I assigned the worker an important task.
— Men ishchiga muhim vazifa tayinladim.

progress [n.] — siljish, o'sish
🔺>> Progress is the act of getting closer to doing or finishing something. >> Progress biror narsa qilishga yoki biror narsani tugatishga qilingan yaqinlashish harakati.

— Our company made financial progress this year.
— Bizning kompaniya bu yil moliyaviy o'sish qildi.

strength [n.] — kuch, quvvat
🔺>> Strength is the physical power that you have. >> Strength bu sizdagi jismoniy quvvat.

— Exercising will increase your strength and give you more power.
— Mashq qilish kuchingizni oshiradi va sizga ko'proq quvvat beradi.

mean [adj.] — baxil, ziqna
🔺>> Mean describes someone who is unkind or cruel. >> Mean shafqatsiz yoki yovuz odamni tasvirlaydi.

— My co-worker is a very mean person. He gets angry very quickly.
— Mening hamkasbim juda ziqna odam. U juda tez g'azablanadi.

somehow [adv.] — bir amallab
🔺>> Somehow means in a way or by some means which is not known. >> Somehow qandaydir tarzda yoki noma'lum yo'l bilan degan ma'noni anglatadi.

— He somehow had to find a way to reach the life preserver.
— U qandaydir tarzda qutqaruvchiga erishish yo'lini topishi kerak edi.

respect [n.] — hurmat
🔺>> Respect is a good opinion of someone because they are good. >> Respect birortasi yaxshiligi uchun u haqidagi yaxshi fikr.

— I have great respect for firemen.
— Men o't o'chiruvchilarni juda hurmat qilaman.

vote [v.] — ovoz bermoq
🔺>> To vote is to officially choose between two or more things. >> To vote ikki yoki ko'proq narsalardan birini rasmiy tarzda tanlash.

— I voted for Billy to be our class president.
— Men Billiga sinfimiz prezidenti bo'lish uchun ovoz berdim.

rich [adj.] — boy, badavlat
🔺>> If you are rich, you have a lot of money. >> Agar rich bo'lsangiz, sizda ko'p pul bo'ladi.

— Не is rich. He can buy anything he wants.
— U badavlat. U xohlagan narsasini sotib ololadi.

knowledge [n.] — bilim
🔺>> Knowledge is information that you have about something. >> Knowledge bu sizda biror narsa borligi haqidagi ma'lumot.

— А music teacher should have good knowledge of music.
— Musiqa o'qituvchisi musiqa haqida yaxshi bilimga ega bo'lishi kerak.

prefer [v.] — ma'qul ko'rmoq
🔺>> If you prefer something, you want it more than something else. >> Agar siz biror narsani prefer qilsangiz, siz uni boshqa narsalardan ko'ra ko'proq xohlaysiz.

— I prefer to take the path that will lead me to a bright future.
— Meni porloq kelajakka olib boradigan yo'lni tanlashni afzal ko'raman.
Unit 30:
evidence [n.] — dalil, isbot
🔺>> Evidence is a fact or thing that you use to prove something. >> Evidence siz biror narsani isbotlash uchun ishlatadigan fakt yoki narsa.

— He used the pictures as evidence that UFOs are real.
— U rasmlarni noma'lum uchar jismlar haqiqiy ekanligiga dalil sifatida ishlatgan.

different [adj.] — turlicha, o'zgacha
🔺>> Different describes someone or something that is not the same as others. >> Different boshqa birortasi bilan bir xil bo'lmagan birortasi yoki biror narsani tasvirlaydi. 

— Each of my sisters has a different hair style from one another.
— Singillarimning har biri turlicha soch turmakka ega.

master [n.] — master, usta
🔺>> A master is a person who is very good at something. >> A master biror narsaning ustasi bo’lgan shaxs.

— My brother is a master of taekwondo.
— Akam tayekvando ustasi.

amount [n.] — miqdor
🔺>> An amount is how much there is of something. >> An amount biror narsa qancha miqdordaligini bildiradi.

— Can I use my card to pay for the entire amount?
— To'lov miqdorini to'lash uchun kartamdan foydalanishim mumkinmi?

common [adj.] — odatiy
🔺>> If something is common, it happens often or there is much of it. >> Agar biror narsa common bo'lsa, u tez-tez sodir bo'ladi yoki u ko'p degani.

— It is common for snow to fall in the winter.
— Qorning qishda yog'ishi odatiy hol.

scan [v.] — qarab chiqmoq
🔺>> To scan something is to look at it very carefully. >> Biror narsani scan qilish uni juda ehtiyotkorlik bilan qarab chiqish degani.

— You must scan each person closely.
— Siz har bir odamni yaqindan qarab chiqishingiz kerak.

independent [adj.] — mustaqil
🔺>> If something is independent, it is not controlled by something else. >> Agar biror narsa independent bo'lsa, u boshqa biror narsa tomonidan boshqarilmaydi.

— She chose to live an independent life in the country.
— U shaharda mustaqil yashashni tanladi.

above [prep.] — tepasida
🔺>> If something is above, it is at a higher level than something else. >> Agar biror narsa above bo'lsa, u biror boshqa narsadan balandroq darajada bo'ladi.

— He straightened the sign that was above the crowd.
— U olomon ustidagi belgini to'g'rilab qo'ydi.

honesty [n.] — odillik, oqillik
🔺>> Honesty means the quality of being truthful or honest. >> Honesty rostgo'y yoki halol bo'lish sifatini bildiradi.

— A courtroom should be a place of honesty.
— Sud zali odillik joyi bo'lishi kerak.

memory [n.] — xotira; yod
🔺>> A memory is something you remember. >> A memory siz eslaydigan narsa.

— The memory of my first time in the city will always be the best.
— Shaharda birinchi marta bo'lganim xotirasi har doim eng yaxshi bo'ladi.

demonstrate [v.] — ko'rsatmoq
🔺>> To demonstrate something is to show how it is done. >> Biror narsani demonstrate qilish u qanday qilinishini ko'rsatish degani.

— She demonstrated her plan to her co-workers.
— U rejasini hamkasblariga ko'rsatdi.

idiom [n.] — ibora
🔺>> An idiom is a phrase with a meaning different from its words. >> An idiom bu so'zlardan farqli ma'noga ega bo'lgan ibora. 

— The idiom “when pigs fly” means that something will never happen.
— "Cho'chqa uchganda" iborasi biror narsa umuman sodir bo'lmasligini bildiradi.

proper [adj.] — odobdan, o'rinli
🔺>> If something is proper, it is right. >> Agar biror narsa proper bo'lsa, u to'g'ri bo'ladi. 

— It is not proper to throw your garbage on the road.
— Axlatni yo'lga tashlash o'rinli emas.

cost [v.] — narx turmoq
🔺>> To cost is to require expenditure or payment. >> To cost bu xarajatlar yoki to'lovlarni talab qilish.

— These designer shoes cost more than the regular ones.
— Ushbu dizaynerlik poyafzallari odatdagidan qimmatroq.

inside [n.] — ichki qism
🔺>> Inside means the inner part, space or side of something. >> Inside biror narsaning ichki qismi, tarafi degan ma’noni anglatadi. 

— The inside of the box was empty.
— Qutining ichki tarafi bo'sh edi.

ahead [adv.] — old tarafida
🔺>> If something is ahead of something else, it is in front of it. >> Agar biror narsa biror boshqa narsaning ahead tarafida bo'lsa, u uning oldi tarafida bo'ladi.

— The blue car drove on ahead of us.
— Haligi ko'k mashinani oldi tarafimizda haydashdi.

belief [n.] — ishonch
🔺>> A belief is a strong feeling that something is correct or true. >> A belief biror narsa rost yoki to'g'riligi haqidagi kuchli tuyg'u.

— A preacher or priest should have a strong belief in God.
— Voiz yoki ruhoniyning Xudoga qattiq ishonchi bo'lishi kerak.

center [n.] — markaz
🔺>> The center of something is the middle of it. >> Biror narsaning center'i u narsaning o'rtasi degani.

— The center of a dart board is the most important spot.
— Dart taxtasining markazi - bu eng muhim joy. 🎯

surface [n.] — yuza, ust
🔺>> The surface of something is the top part or outside of it. >> Biror narsaning surface qismi, uning ustki yoki tashqi qismi degani.

— The surface of the moon is very rough.
— Oyning yuzasi juda notekis.

section [n.] — qism, bo'lim
🔺>> A section is a part of something larger. >> A section birorta kattaroq narsaning qismi.

— The green section of the graph is the most important part.
— Chizmaning yashil qismi eng muhim qism.

Unit 1:
load [v.] — yuklamoq
▪️>> To load is to put objects into something. >> To load bu narsalarni biror narsaga qo'yish degani.

— The man loaded the boxes into a truck.
— Haligi kishi qutilarni yuk mashinasiga yukladi.

spill [v.] — to'kmoq, to’kib yubormoq
▪️>> To spill is to have something fall out of its container. >> To spill bu uning idishidan biror narsa tushishi.

— I spilled the coffee on the table.
— Men kofeni stolga to'kib yubordim.

landscape [n.] — landshaft, manzara
▪️>> A landscape is how an area of land looks. >> A landscape biror yer joy qanday ko'rinishi.

— The landscape of the country is very green.
— Mamlakatning manzarasi juda yashil.

anxious [adj.] — xavotirlangan, tashvishlangan
▪️>> When a person is anxious, they worry that something bad will happen. >> Agar birortasi anxious bo'lsa, u birorta yomon narsa sodir bo'lishidan xavotirlanadi.

— She was anxious about not making her appointment on time.
— U uchrashuvni o'z vaqtida bajarmaslikdan xavotirda edi.

intent [n.] — niyat, maqsad
▪️>> An intent is a plan to do something. >> An intent biror narsa qilish uchun reja.

— Her intent is to visit Italy next summer.
— Uning niyati keyingi yozda Italiyaga tashrif buyurish.

motion [n.] — ishora, harakat
▪️>> A motion is a movement that someone makes. >> A motion birortasi qiladigan harakat.

— The police officer made a motion with his hand.
— Politsiya ofitseri qo'li bilan ishora qildi.

lift [v.] — ko'tarmoq
▪️>> To lift something is to move it higher. >> Biror narsani lift qilish uni balandroq harakatlantirish degani.

— The man tried to lift the box.
— Haligi kishi qutini ko'tarishga harakat qildi.

awful [adj.] — juda yomon
▪️>> When something is awful, it is very bad. >> Agar biror narsa anxious bo'lsa, u juda yomon.

— Her performance last night was awful.
— Uning kecha kechki paytgi ishtiroki juda yomon bo'ldi.

rapidly [adv.] — juda tez
▪️>> When something happens rapidly, it happens very fast. >> Agar biror narsa rapidly sodir bo'lsa, u juda tez sodir bo'ladi. 

— The train moved rapidly on the tracks.
— Poyezd relslarda tez harakatlana boshladi.

consist [v.] — iborat bo'lmoq
▪️>> To consist of is to be made of parts or things. >> To consist of qismlardan yoki narsalardan tashkil topmoq degani.

— Today’s choices for lunch consisted of pizza, hamburgers, and hot dogs.
— Bugungi tushlik uchun tanlovlar pitsa, gamburger va hot dogdan iborat bo'ldi.

eager [adj.] — chanqoq, sabrsiz
▪️>> When a person is eager about something, they are excited about it. >> Qachonki birortasi biror narsaga eager bo'lsa, u haqida sabrsiz bo'ladi. 

— The man was eager to talk about the good news.
— Haligi odam xushxabar haqida gapirishni juda xohlardi.

lung [n.] — o'pka
▪️>> A lung is the organ in the body that fills with air when breathing. >> A lung nafas olganda havo bilan to'ladigan tanadagi organ.

— Having strong lungs is necessary for a healthy life.
— Sog'lom hayot uchun mustahkam o'pkaga ega bo'lish muhim.

polite [adj.] — odobli, aql-xushli
▪️>> When someone is polite, they are acting in a thoughtful way. >> Agar birortasi polite bo'lsa, u g'amxo'r, e'tiborli yo'l bilan harakat qiladi.

— The boy was very polite: he behaved very thoughtfully.
— Haligi bola juda odobli esi: u o'zini juda g'amxo'r tutdi.

seek [v.] — qidirmoq, izlamoq
▪️>> To seek is to look for something. >> To seek biror narsani qidirish degani.

— If I have a problem, I seek my sister’s advice.
— Agar muammoga duch kelsam, men opamning maslahatini izlayman.

household [n.] — oila a'zolar
▪️>> A household is all the people who live in one house. >> A household bir uyda yashaydigan barcha odam.

— Our household is made up of my father, my mother and me.
— Bizning oila a'zolar otam, onam va mendan iborat.

shine [v.] — nur taratmoq/sochmoq
▪️>> To shine is to make a bright light. >> To shine yorqin yorug'lik sodir etish degani.

— Тhе candles are shining in the dark room.
— Qorong'i xonada shamlar porlayapti.

remark [v.] — ta'kidlamoq
▪️>> To remark is to say something. >> To remark biror narsani aytish degani.

— Тhе teacher remarked on how quickly the students were learning.
— O'qituvchi talabalar qanchalik tez o'rganayotganini ta'kidladi.

desire [v.] — xohlamoq, istamoq
▪️>> To desire is to want something. >> To desire biror narsani xohlash degani.

— My sister desires a big house and lots of money.
— Mening opam katta uy va ko'p pul xohlaydi.

расе [n.] — temp, sur'at 
▪️>> The pace of something is the speed at which it happens. >> Biror narsaning pace'si uning qanchalik tezlikda sodir bo'lishi.

— I ran the race at a slower pace than my friend.
— Men poygada do'stimdan sekinroq tempda yugurdim.

possess [v.] — egalik qilmoq, bor bo'lmoq
▪️>> To possess something is to have it or own it. >> Biror narsani possess qilish unga egalik qilish degani.

— My uncle possesses three sheep, a chicken, a cow and a dog.
— Mening tog'amda 3 ta qo'y, bitta jo'ja, sigir va it bor.
Unit 2:
land [v.] — qo'nmoq
▪️>> To land means to come to the ground usually from a ship or aircraft. >> To land odatda kemadan yoki samolyotdan yerga tushishni anglatadi.

— The parachutist landed safely on the ground.
— Parashutchi yerga xavfsiz qo'ndi.

meteor [n.] — meteorit
▪️>> A meteor is a rock from outer space that falls to Earth. >> A meteor yerga tashqi fazodan tushadigan tosh.

— We saw a meteor in the sky last night.
— Biz kecha kechki payt osmonda meteorit ko'rdik.

jewelry [n.] — taqinchoq
▪️>> Jewelry is something that people wear like earrings or necklaces. >> Jewelry odamlar sirg'a yoki marjon kabi taqadigan narsadir.

— The woman looked beautiful with her nice dress and jewelry.
— Haligi ayol ajoyib ko'ylagi va taqinchog'i bilan chiroyli ko'rindi.

steam [n.] — par, bug’
▪️>> Steam is water that has become hot and has turned into a misty gas. >> Steam issiq bo'lib tumanli gazga aylangan suv.

— We could see the steam rise from the boiling water.
— Biz qaynayotgan suvdan chiqayotgan bug'ni ko'rdik.

wing [n.] — qanot
▪️>> A wing is the part of an animal that lets it fly. >> A wing hayvonning uchishiga yordam beradigan qismi.

— The bird used its wings to fly across the water.
— Qush suvni kesib o'tishida qanotini ishlatdi.

northern [adj.] — shimoliy
▪️>> If something is northern, it is in the direction of north. >> Agar biror narsa northern bo'lsa, bu shimol tarafga yo'nalish bo'ladi. 

— It is much colder in northern countries than it is here.
— Bu yerdan ko'ra shimoliy mamlakatlar sovuqroq.

southern [adj.] — janubiy
▪️>> If something is southern, it is in the direction of south. >> Agar biror narsa southern bo'lsa, bu janub tarafga yo'nalish bo'ladi. 

— Taegu is located in the southern part of the Korean peninsula.
— Taegu Koreya yarim orolining janubiy qismida joylashgan.

temple [n.] — ibodatxona
▪️>> A temple is a building that is used for religious purposes. >> A temple diniy maqsadlarda ishlatiladigan bino.

— The people visited the temple to pray.
— Odamlar ibodatxonaga inodat qilish uchun tashrif buyurishdi.

explosion [n.] — portlash
▪️>> An explosion is a violent burst, usually with a loud sound. >> An explosion odatda yuqori ovozli portlash.

— A nuclear explosion can cause great damage.
— Atom portlash katta zarar keltirishi mumkin.

weed [n.] — begona o't
▪️>> A weed is a plant, especially one that is not useful or wanted. >> A weed foydasiz va keraksiz o'simlik.

— The yard of the house was full of ugly weeds.
— Uyning hovlisi begona o'tlarga to'la edi.

submit [v.] — bo'ysunmoq, aytganini qilmoq
▪️>> To submit to someone is to agree to do what they tell you to do. >> Birortasiga submit qilish sizga nima qilishni aytishgan bo'lsa unga rozi bo'lish degani.

— She submitted to her mother’s wishes and did her homework.
— U onasining istaklariga rozi bo'ldi va uy vazifalarini qildi.

castle [n.] — qasr, saroy
▪️>> A castle is a building with strong walls where royalty usually lives. >> A castle bu odatda qirollik oila a'zolari yashaydigan mustahkam devorlari bo'lgan bino.

— The castle was built many years ago.
— Haligi qasr bir necha yillar avval qurilgan.

remote [adj.] — olis, uzoq
▪️>> If something is remote, it is very far away and difficult to get to. >> Agar biror narsa remote bo'lsa, u juda uzoq va yetish qiyin bo'ladi. 

— It took many days to get to the remote island.
— Olis orolga yetish uchun juda ko'p kun kerak bo'ldi.

bring [v.] — keltirmoq, olib kelmoq
▪️>> To bring means to take someone or something to a person or place. >> To bring birortasi yoki biror narsani odamga yoki joyga olib borish degani.

— Oscar will bring in all the boxes.
— Oskar barcha qutilarni olib keladi.

monster [n.] — maxluq, monster
▪️>> A monster is any imaginary frightening creature that looks strange. >> A monster g'alati ko'rinishli istalgan tasavvuriy qo'rqinchli mavjudod.

— The monster scared everyone in the village.
— Maxluq qishloqdagi hammani qo'rqitdi.

command [v.] — buyruq bermoq, buyurmoq
▪️>> To command someone is to tell them to do something. >> Birortasiga command qilish unga biror narsa qilishni aytish degani.

— The general commanded his army to attack.
— General armiyasiga hujum qilishni buyurdi.

ensure [v.] — ta'minlamoq
▪️>> To ensure is to make certain that something happens. >> To ensure biror narsa sodir bo'lishini aniq qilish degani.

— Eating good food ensures that we stay healthy.
— Yaxshi ovqatlarni iste'mol qilish sog'lom bo'lishimizni ta'minlaydi.
