statue [n.] — haykal
▪️>> A statue is an image of a person or animal made of stone or metal. >> A statue metal yoki toshdan qilingan odam yoki hayvonning tasviri.

— I saw a beautiful statue of a lion today.
— Men bugun arslonning ajoyib haykalini ko'rdim.

upper [adj.] — yuqori, ustki
▪️>> Upper means higher in position or place. >> Upper joylashuvi yoki joyga nisbatan balandroq degani.

— A home’s attic is at the upper part of the structure.
— Uyning cherdagi binoning ustki qismi hisoblanadi.

counsel [v.] — maslahat bermoq
▪️>> To counsel someone is to listen and give advice about a problem. >> Birortasiga counsel qilish uni eshitish va uning muammosi haqida maslahat berish degani.

— The teacher counseled the girl about her troubles.
— O'qituvchi haligi qizga uning qiyinchiliklari haqida maslahat berdi.
Unit 3:
disadvantage [n.] — kamchilik, salbiy jihat
▪️>> A disadvantage is a situation where someone is likely to lose. >> A disadvantage bu yo'qolish ehtimoli bor vaziyat.

— Mike had a disadvantage in the race since he hurt his knee.
— Mayk tizzasini jarohatlab olganidan beri poygada kamchiligi bor.

log [n.] — g'o'la
▪️>> A log is a thick piece of wood that is cut from a tree. >> A log daraxtdan kesiladigan yog'ochning qalin bo'lagi.

— The fire was too small, so we added another log to it.
— Olov juda past edi, shuning uchun biz unga boshqa g'o'la soldik.

twist [v.] — aylantirib bog'lamoq
▪️>> To twist something is to wrap it around itself or another thing. >> Biror narsani twist qilish uni o'zini atrofiga yoki boshqa narsa bilan o'rash degani.

— She twisted the spaghetti around her fork.
— U spagettini vilkasi atrofiga o'radi.

bow [n.] — kamon
▪️>> A bow is a weapon made of curved wood and string that shoots arrows. >> A bow o'q otadigan qayrilgan yog'och va arondan yasalgan qurol.

— He went hunting with a bow and arrow.
— U kamon va o'q bilan ovga ketdi.

arrow [n.] — o'q, yoy 
▪️>> An arrow is a thin, straight stick shot from a bow. >> An arrow kamondan otiladigan ingichka, tekis tayoqcha.

— The arrow flew through the air and hit the target.
— O'q havodan o'tdi va nishonga urildi.

entrance [n.] — kirish yo'li
▪️>> An entrance is a place where someone can enteran area. >> An entrance birortasi biror joyga kira oladigan joy.

— The gate was locked, so Bill had to find a different entrance.
— Darvoza yopiq edi, shuning uchun Bil boshqa kirish yo'li topishga majbur bo'ldi.

enemy [n.] — dushman, g'anim
▪️>> An enemy is a country that is fighting another country during a war. >> An enemy urush vaqtida boshqa davlat bilan urushayotgan davlat.

— The enemy prepared to attack the kingdom.
— Dushman qirollikka hujum qilishga tayyorgarlik ko'rdi.

obey [v.] — bo'ysunmoq, itoat etmoq
▪️>> To obey means to follow what a law or a person says you must do. >> To obey qonun yoki biror shaxs nima qilish kerakligini aytsa, unga ergashish degani.

— My little sister did not obey my mother. Now she is in trouble.
— Singlim onamga itoat qilmagan. U hozir qiyin ahvolda.

military [n.] — armiya
▪️>> The military is the armed forces of a country. >> The military mamlakatning qurollangan kuchlari.

— I joined the military after I finished high school.
— Men katta maktabni tugatganimdan so'ng armiyaga qo'shildim.

weapon [n.] — qurol-yarog'
▪️>> A weapon is an object that can be used to hurt people. >> A weapon odamlarni jarohatlash uchun ishlatilishi mumkin bo'lgan narsa.

— Swords have been used as weapons for thousands of years.
— Ming yillar davomida qilich qurol sifatida ishlatilgan.

hardly [adv.] — arang, zo'rg'a
▪️>> If something hardly happens, it almost does not happen at all. >> Agar biror narsa hardly sodir bo'lsa, u deyarli sodir bo'lmaydi.

— I hardly saw the concert since I had to leave early.
— Ketishga majbur bo'lganimdan beri konsertni arang ko'rdim.

intend [v.] — niyat qilmoq
▪️>> To intend to do something means to plan to do it. >> Biror narsa qilishni intend qilish uni bajarishni rejalashtirishni anglatadi.

— I intend to finish college in three years.
— Men kollejni 3 yilda tugatishni niyat qilaman.

brave [adj.] — qo'rqmas, jasur
▪️>> When people are brave, they are not afraid to face pain or danger. >> Agar birortasi brave bo'lsa, u og'riq va xavf bilan yuzlashishdan qo'rqmaydi.

— The brave firefighter saved the girl from the burning building.
— Jasur o't o'chiruvchi yonayotgan binodan qizni qutqardi.

battle [n.] — urush, jang
▪️>> A battle is a fight between two armies during a war. >> A battle urush paytida ikki armiya o'rtasidagi jang.

— The battle lasted for many days.
— Jang bir necha kun davom etdi.

unless [con.] — -magan taqdirda
▪️>> Unless means if not or except when. >> Unless agar biror narsa bo'lmasa yoki biror narsadan tashqari degani. 

— Unless you clean your room, you cannot play with your friends.
— Agar xonangni tozalamasang, do'stlaring bilan o'ynamaysan.

chief [n.] — boshliq, sardor
▪️>> A chief is the leader of a group of people. >> A chief odamlar guruhining lideri.

— The chief led the people through the mountains.
— Haligi boshliq odamlarni tog'lar orqali boshlab bordi.

steady [adj.] — barqaror, muttasil
▪️>> When someone or something is steady, they are under control. >> Qachonki birortasi yoki biror narsa steady bo'lsa, u nazorat ostida bo'ladi. 

— The problem was hard but she remained steady and solved it.
— Muammo jiddiy edi lekin u barqaror davom etdi va uni yechdi.

trust [v.] — ishonmog, inonmoq
▪️>> To trust is to believe that someone is honest and will do what is right. >> To trust birortasi vijdonli ekaniga va nima to'g'ri bo'lsa shuni qilishiga ishonish degani.

— I trust my friends; they don’t tell my secrets to other people.
— Men do'stimga ishonaman; u mening sirlarimni boshqa odamlarga aytmaydi.

laughter [n.] ‎— kulgi, shodlik
▪️>> Laughter is the sound produced by laughing about something funny. >> Laughter birorta kulgili narsa ustidan kulganda chiqadigan tovush.

— Susan’s joke made her classmates burst into laughter.
— Syuzanning hazili uning sinfdoshlarini kulishga majbur qildi.

secure [v.] — olmoq, qo'lga kiritmoq
▪️>> To secure something means to get it after a lot of effort. >> Biror narsani secure qilish unga ko'p urinishdan so'ng erishish degani.

— I was able to secure a good grade on my test after weeks of studying.
— Bir necha hafta o'qiganimdan so'ng testimdan yaxshi natijani qo'lga kirita oldim.
Unit 4:
disaster [n.] — falokat, halokat
▪️>> A disaster is a really bad thing that happens. >> A disaster sodir bo'ladigan haqiqatdan yomon narsa.

— When the car crashed, it was a disaster.
— Mashina to'qnashganda, bu haqiqiy falokat bo'ldi.

terror [n.] — dahshat, qo'rquv
▪️>> When someone feels terror, they are scared. >> Agar birortasi terror'ni his qilsa, u qo'rqqan bo'ladi.

— I felt a sense of terror when the tiger chased me.
— Yo'lbars meni ta'qib qilganda, men dahshatni his qildim.

scream [v.] — baqirmoq, qichqirmoq
▪️>> To scream means to make a loud noise with your mouth. >> To scream og'zingiz bilan baland ovoz chiqarishni bildiradi. 

— The girl saw a spider and screamed.
— Qiz o'rgimchakni ko'rdi va baqirdi.

chest [n.] — bag'r, ko'ks
▪️>> The chest is the front part of a person's body under the neck. >> The chest bo'yin pastidagi inson tanasining old qismi.

— The water in the lake was as high as my chest.
— Ko'ldagi suv ko'ksimchalik balandlikda edi.

satisfy [v.] — qoniqtirmoq, mamnun qilmoq
▪️>> To satisfy someone means to make them happy. >> Birortasini satisfy qilish uni hursand qilish degani.

— It will satisfy my teacher if I finish all my homework.
— Agar hamma uy vazifalarimni tugatsam o'qituvchimni mamnun qilaman.

pale [adj.] — xira
▪️>> When something is pale, it does not have a bright color. >> Qachonki biror narsa pale bo'lsa, uning yorqin ranglari bo'lmaydi.

— The girl’s skin was very pale.
— Haligi qizning terisi juda xira edi.

narrow [adj.] — tor
▪️>> When something is narrow, it is very thin. >> Qachonki biror narsa narrow bo'lsa, u juda ingichka bo'ladi. 

— The bridge is too narrow for a car to drive over.
— Ko'prik mashinada o'tish uchun juda tor.

threat [n.] — xatar, xavf
▪️>> A threat is something bad that might happen. >> A threat sodir bo'lishi mumkin bo'lgan biror yomon narsa.

— Due to the dark clouds, there was a threat of a bad storm.
— Qora bulutlarga qaraganda u yerda yomon bo'ronning xavfi bor edi.

sensitive [adj.] — sezuvchan, ta'sirchan
▪️>> When someone or something is sensitive, they are easily hurt. >> Qachonki birortasi yoki biror narsa sensitive bo'lsa, u osongina jarohatlanadi.

— My teeth are sensitive to cold things.
— Tishlarim sovuq narsalarga ta'sirchan.

impress [v.] — lol qoldirmoq
▪️>> To impress someone means to make that person proud. >> Birortasini impress qilish u odamni mamnun qilishni anglatadi. 

— He was able to impress the girls with his new dance.
— U o'zining yangi raqsi bilan qizlarni lol qoldira oldi.

consequence [n.] — natija, oqibat
▪️>> A consequence is a result of a choice or action. >> A consequence biror tanlov yoki harakat natijasi.

— As a consequence of missing my bus, I had to find another way to work.
— Avtobusimga ulgurmaganim natijasida, ishga borgani boshqa yo'l topishga majbur bo'ldim.

shade [n.] — soya
▪️>> The shade is a dark area that something makes when it blocks the sun. >> The shade biror narsa quyoshni to'sib qo'yganda sodir bo'ladigan qora joy.

— It was hot outside, so the boy sat in the shade of a tree.
— Tashqari issiq edi, shuning uchun haligi bola daraxt soyasida o'tirdi.

honor [v.] — sharaflamoq, hurmat qilmoq
▪️>> When you honor people or things, you show respect for them. >> Qachonki siz odamlarni yoki narsani honor qilsangiz, siz ularga hurmat ko'rsatayotgan bo'lasiz.

— I honor my science teacher by working hard in class.
— Men ilmiy ustozimga sinfda qattiq ishlab hurmat ko'rsataman.

confidence [n.] — ishonch, dadillik
▪️>> If you have confidence about something, you are sure of it. >> Agar sizda biror narsa haqida confidence bo'lsa, siz unga amin bo'lasiz.

— I have confidence that I did well on the test.
— Testni yaxshi ishlaganimga ishonchim komil.

marathon [n.] — marafon
▪️>> A marathon is a very long foot race just over 42 kilometers. >> A marathon 42 kilometrdan sal ko'proq oyoq poygasi.

— I ran a marathon, and now my legs are tired.
— Men marafonda yugurdim, hozir esa oyoqlarim charchagan.

estimate [v.] — tahminan hisoblamoq
▪️>> To estimate something means to make a guess about it. >> Biror narsani estimate qilish u haqida tahmin qilishni anglatadi.

— The boy estimated that he was one meter tall.
— Haligi bola bo'yi bir metr ekanligini tahminan hisobladi.

disturb [v.] — tashvishga solmoq
▪️>> To disturb someone means to upset them. >> Birortasini disturb qilish uni ranjitish degani.

— The loud noise disturbed me while I was working.
— Ishlayotganimda baland ovoz meni bezovta qildi (yoki tashvishga soldi).

victim [n.] — qurbon
▪️>> A victim is a person that had something bad happen to them. >> A victim unga biror yomon narsa sodir bo'lgan shaxs.

— I was a victim of a robbery.
— Men o'g'irilik qurboni bo'ldim.

supplement [v.] — to'ldirmoq, qo'shmoq
▪️>> To supplement something is to add something else to it in a good way. >> Biror narsani supplement qilish unga boshqa narsani yaxshi yo'l bilan qo'shish degani.

— He supplements his diet with fresh fruits.
— U o'z dietasini yangi mevalar bilan to'ldiradi.

rough [adj.] — g'adir-budur, dag'al
▪️>> When something is rough, it is not even or smooth. >> Qachonki biror narsa rough bo'lsa, u tekis va yassi bo'lmaydi.

— The rough ground hurt my feet.
— G'adir-budur yer oyoqlarimni jarohatladi.
Unit 5:
surround [v.] — o'rab olmoq
▪️>> To surround something is to close in on it from all sides. >> Biror narsani surround qilish unga har tarafdan yaqinlashish degani.

— We surrounded the suspect on all four sides. 
— Biz gumon qilinuvchini to'rt tarafdan o'rab oldik.

boot [n.] — etik
▪️>> A boot is a heavy shoe that goes over your ankle. >> A boot to'piqdan tepaga chiqadigan og'ir poyabzal.

— He wore boots so that his feet wouldn’t get wet.
— U oyog'i ho'l bo'lmasin deb etiklarini kiydi.

sink [v.] — cho'kmoq
▪️>> To sink into something is to slowly fall into it. >> Biror narsa ichiga sink bo'lish uni ichiga sekin tushish degani.

— The boat had a hole in it, and it sank into the ocean. 
— Qayiqning ichida teshigi bor edi, va u okeanga cho'kib ketdi.

frame [n.] — ramka
▪️>> A frame is a border for a picture or mirror. >> A frame bu rasm yoki oynaning chegarasi.

— I have to get a frame for my friend’s picture.
— Men do'stimning surati uchun ramka olishim kerak.

border [n.] — chegara
▪️>> A border is the edge of an area. >> A border biror joyning qirg'og'i.

— The postcard had a pretty green border of pine needles.
— Pochtada qarag'ay ignalarining yashil chegarasi bor edi.

pure [adj.] — sof, musaffo
▪️>> If something is pure, it is very clear and beautiful. >> Agar biror narsa pure bo'lsa, u juda toza va chiroyli. 

— The rose was pure. It had no dirt or imperfections.
— Atirgul toza edi. Unda hech qanday kir yoki nuqson yo'q edi.

praise [v.] — maqtamoq
▪️>> To praise is to show that you like someone or something. >> To praise bu kimgadir yoki nimanidir yoqtirishingizni ko'rsatishdir.

— Тhе coach praised both athletes after a good practice.
— Murabbiy yaxshi mashg'ulotdan so'ng ikkala sportchini ham maqtadi.

proceed [v.] — bir yo'nalishdan bormoq
▪️>> To proceed is to go in a certain direction. >> To proceed ma'lum bir yo'nalishda bormoq degani.

— My son and I proceeded to the beach so we could go fishing.
— O'g'lim va men dengizga bordik, shuning uchun baliq ovlashga borishimiz mumkin edi.

silent [adj.] — jim, sokin, tinch
▪️>> If someone or something is silent, they make no sound. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa silent bo'lsa, u ovoz chiqarmaydi.

— Since no one was home, the house was silent.
— Uyda hech kim yo'qligi sababli, uy sokin edi.

senior [adj.] — katta yoshdagi
▪️>> If one is senior, they are the oldest or have been there the longest. >> Agar kimdir senior bo'lsa, ular eng keksa yoki u yerda eng uzoq bo'lgan bo'ladi.

— Because he got his job first, Bob is the senior chef.
— U o'z ishini birinchi bo'lib olganligi sababli, Bob katta oshpaz.

ancestor [n.] — ajdod
▪️>> An ancestor is a family member from the past. >> An ancestor bu o'tmishdan qolgan oila a'zosi.

— My ancestors came from Germany.
— Mening ajdodlarim Germaniyalik bo'lishgan.

wrap [v.] — o'ramoq
▪️>> To wrap is to cover something on all sides. >> To wrap biror narsani har tarafdan o'rash degani.

— I wrapped his gift and put a bow on it.
— Men uning sovg'asini o'rab, ustiga kamon qo'ydim.

thick [adj.] — qalin, keng
▪️>> If something is thick, it is wide and solid. >> Agar biror narsa thick bo'lsa, u keng va qalin.

— The fog was so thick that I couldn't see through it. 
— Tuman shunchalik qalin ediki, undan hech nima ko'ra olmasdim.

legend [n.] — afsona
▪️>> A legend is a story from the past. >> A legend bu o'tmishdagi hikoya.

— There is a well-known legend about a king and his queen.
— Shoh va uning malikasi haqida mashhur afsona bor.

superior [adj.] — ustun, yuqori
▪️>> If someone or something is superior, they are better than another. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa superior bo'lsa, u boshqa biror narsadan yaxshiroq.

— I think cooking outdoors is superior to cooking indoors. 
— Menimcha tashqarida ovqat pishirish ichkarida pishirishdan yaxshi.

angle [n.] — taraf, tomon, burchak
▪️>> An angle is the direction from which you look at something. >> An angle siz biror narsaga qaraydigan yo'nalish.

— The giraffe turned its head to see from another angle.
— Jirafa boshqa burchakdan ko'rish uchun boshini burdi.

relative [n.] — qarindosh
▪️>> A relative is a family member. >> A relative bu oila a'zosi.

— My relatives came by to see the new baby.
— Qarindoshlarim yangi chaqaloqni ko'rgani kelishdi.

incredible [adj.] — aqlga sig'mas
▪️>> If someone or something is incredible, it is hard to believe they are true. >> Agar kimdir yoki biror narsa incredible bo'lsa, uning haqiqatligiga ishonish qiyin.

— I have an incredible story to tell you about my vacation.
— Sizga ta'tilim haqida aytib beradigan aqlga sig'mas hikoyam bor.

congratulate [v.] — tabriklamoq, qutlamoq
▪️>> To congratulate someone is to tell them that you are happy for them. >> Birortasini congratulate qilish siz u uchun hursand ekanligingizni aytish degani.

— Bill and Angela congratulated each other on a job well done.
— Bil va Anjela yaxshi qilingan ish uchun bir birini tabriklashdi.

heaven [n.] — jannat
▪️>> Heaven is the place that some people believe people go when they die. >> Heaven bu ba'zi odamlar odamlar o'lganda borishadi deb ishonishadigan joy.

— When I die, I hope that I go to heaven.
— Men o'lganimda, jannatga tushaman deb umid qilaman.
Unit 6:
protest [prəˈtest] v. — norozilik bildirmoq
▪️>> To protest something is to argue about it with someone. >> Biror narsaga protest bildirish - bu kimdir bilan bahslashish.

— The people protested the decision of the president.
— Odamlar prezident qaroriga norozilik bildirdi.

tribe [traɪb] n. — qabila
▪️>> A tribe is a group of people who live in the same culture. >> A tribe bir xil madaniyat ostida yashaydigan odamlar guruhi.

— There’s a small tribe of people who live in the mountains of Spain.
— Ispaniya tog'larida odamlarning kichik qabilasi bor.

bride [braɪd] n. — kelinchak
▪️>> A bride is a woman who is getting married or has just gotten married. >> A bride turmushga chiqayotgan yoki endigina turmushga chiqqan ayol.

— The bride looked beautiful in her wedding dress.
— Kelinchak kelin-ko'ylakda juda chiroyli ko'rindi.

forever [fərˈevər] adv. — abadiy 
▪️>> If something lasts forever, it means it lasts for all time. >> Agar biror narsa forever davom etsa, u doimiy davom etadi.

— The young couple promised that they would love each other forever.
— Yosh juftlik bir-birini abadiy sevishga va'da berdi.

favor [feɪvər] n. — yordam, muruvvat
▪️>> A favor is something you do for someone to help them. >> A favor siz birortasiga yordam berish uchun qiladigan biror narsa.

— Can you do me a favor and turn off the lights?
— Menga yordam ko'rsatib chiroqni o'chirib qo'ya olasizmi?

anger [ˈæŋgər] v. — jahlini chiqarmoq
▪️>> To anger someone is to make them mad. >> Birortasini anger qilish uni aqldan ozdirish degani. 

— It angers me when people are rude.
— Odamlar qo'pol bo'lsa, bu mening jahlimni chiqaradi.

palace [pælɪs] n. — qasr, saroy
▪️>> A palace is a very large building. It is often the home of a royal family. >> A palace juda katta bino. U odatda qirol oilasi uyi hisoblanadi. 

— The king and queen live in a beautiful palace.
— Qirol va qirolicha chiroyli qasrda yashaydilar.

disappoint [dɪsəˈpɔɪnt] v. — hafa qilmoq
▪️>> To disappoint is to make one feel sad or unsatisfied. >> To disappoint bu odamni xafa qilish yoki qoniqtirmaslikdir.

— I do not want to disappoint my family, so I try to do well at school.
— Men oilamni hafa qilishni istamayman, shuning uchun maktabda yaxshi o'qishga harakat qilaman.

dive [daɪv] v. — suvga sakramoq, sho'ng'imoq
▪️>> To dive is to jump into water. >> To dive suv ichiga sakrash degani.

— I will dive into the lake once we get there.
— Biz o'sha yerga yetganimizda ko'lga bir marta sakrayman.

guy [gaɪ] n. — erkak kishi
▪️>> A guy is an informal way to call a man. >> A guy erkak kishini chaqirishning norasmiy yo'li. 

— The guy at the flower shop was really helpful today.
— Gul do'konidagi yigit bugun juda foydali bo'ldi.

exchange [ɪksˈtʃeɪndʒ] v. — ayirboshlamoq
▪️>> To exchange means to give something for another thing in return. >> To exchange birortasiga biror narsa evaziga biror boshqa narsani berish degani.

— I exchanged my foreign money for American dollars.
— Men xorijiy pullarimni AQSh dollariga ayirboshladim.

chase [tʃeɪs] v. — quvlamoq, quvmoq
▪️>> To chase someone or something is to follow them in order to catch them. >> Birortasini yoki biror narsani chase qilish uni tutish uchun ortidan taqib qilish degani.

— I was chased by an angry native.
— Meni g'azablangan mahalliy odam quvdi.

permit [pərˈmɪt] v. — ruxsat bermoq
▪️>> To permit something is to let someone do it. >> Biror narsaga permit qilish birortasiga u narsani qilishiga ruxsat berish degani.

— I was sick, so my mother permitted me to stay home from school.
— Men kasal edim, shuning uchun onam menga uyda qolishimga ruxsat berdi.

brief [briːf] adj. — qisqa
▪️>> If something is brief, it only lasts for a short time. >> Agar biror narsa brief bo'lsa, u bor yo'g'i qisqa vaqt davom etadi.

— The meeting this afternoon was very brief.
— Tushlik paytidagi uchrashuv juda qisqa bo'ldi.

fee [fiː] n. — to'lov, badal
▪️>> A fee is an amount of money that a person or company asks for a service. >> A fee bu shaxs yoki kompaniya xizmat ko'rsatgani uchun so'ragan pul miqdori.

— I had to pay an hourly fee to speak with my lawyer.
— Men huquqshunosim bilan gaplashish uchun soatlik to'lov to'layman.

lovely [lʌvlɪ] adj. — yoqimli, go'zal
▪️>> If people or things are lovely, they are good-looking or beautiful. >> Agar odamlar yoki narsalar lovely bo'lsa, ular yaxshi ko'rinishli yoki go'zal bo'ladi. 

— The trees look lovely in the fall.
— Daraxtlar kuzda chiroyli ko'rinadi.

mood [muːd] n. — kayfiyat
▪️>> A mood is the way someone is feeling. >> A mood birortasi o'zini his qilishi yo'li.

— I am in a good mood because I did well on my math test.
— Men yaxshi kayfiyatdaman, chunki matematikadan testni yaxshi bajardim.

abroad [əˈbrɔːd] adv. — xorij, chet el 
▪️>> If someone goes or travels abroad, they go to another country. >> Agar birortasi abroad ga borsa yoki sayohat qilsa, u boshqa davlatga boradi.

— My brother wants to go abroad next year.
— Mening akam kelasi yili chet elga ketishni xohlayapti.

youth [juːθ] n. — yoshlik payti
▪️>> Youth is a time in people’s lives when they are young. >> Youth bu odamlar hayotidagi yoshlik davri.

— My mother wanted to be a nurse in her youth.
— Onam yoshligida hamshira bo'lishni xohlagan.

sculpture [skʌlptʃə:r] n. — haykal
▪️>> A sculpture is a piece of art that is made from wood, clay, or stone. >> A sculpture - bu yog'och, loy yoki toshdan yasalgan san'at asari.

— We saw an old sculpture of Buddha at the museum.
— Biz muzeyda Buddaning eski haykalini ko'rdik.
Unit 7:
fascinate [fæsəˌneɪt] v. — maftun qilmoq, qiziqtirmoq
▪️>> To fascinate someone is to make them really like something. >> Birortasini fascinate qilish unga biror narsani chindan yaxshi ko'rdirish degani.

— The kitten was fascinated by the ball of yarn.
— Mushukchani ip to'pi hayratga soldi.

basis [beɪsɪs] n. — tartib, yo'nalish
▪️>> To do something on time’s basis is how often you do it. >> Biror narsani o'z basis'ida bajarish - bu qanchalik tez -tez qilish. 

—  My grandfather gets his hearing checked on a yearly basis.
— Mening bobom har yillik tartibda eshitishlarini tekshirtiradi.

colony [kɒlənɪ] n. — koloniya, mustamlaka
▪️>> A colony is a country controlled by another country. >> A colony boshqa davlat tomonidan boshqariladigan davlat.

— The USA was at one time a colony of Great Britain.
— AQSh bir paytlar Buyuk Britaniya mustamlakasi bo'lgan.

mission [mɪʃən] n. — missiya, topshiriq 
▪️>> A mission is an important job that is sometimes far away. >> A mission bu ba'zan uzoq bo'lgan muhim ish.

— The woman’s mission was to help sick people.
— Haligi ayolning missiyasi kasal odamlarga yordam berish edi.

persuade [pəˈsweɪd] v. — ko'ndirmoq
▪️>> To persuade someone is to make them agree to do something. >> Birortasini persuade qilish uni biror narsa qilishga rozi qilish degani.

— The children persuaded their parents to buy them gifts.
— Bolalar ota-onalarini ularga sovg'a sotib olishga ko'ndirishdi.

depart [dɪˈpɑːrt] v. — jo'namoq, ketmoq
▪️>> To depart is to leave some place so you can go to another place. >> To depart biror boshqa joyga borish uchun biror joyni tark etish degani.

— The plane departed for Italy at 3:00 this afternoon.
— Samolyot Italiyaga bugun 3:00 da jo'nab ketdi.

ruins [ruːɪnz] n. — xaroba
▪️>> Ruins are old buildings that are not used anymore. >> Ruins ortiq foydalanilmaydigan eski uylar.

— I visited some interesting ruins in Greece.
— Men Gretsiyadagi qiziqarli xarobalarga tashrif buyurdim.

depress [dɪˈpres] v. — dilini xufton qilmoq
▪️>> To depress someone is to make them sad. >> Birortasini depress qilish uni hafa qilish degani.

— The bad news from work depressed the man.
— Ishdagi yomon yangiliklar haligi odamning dilini xufton qildi.

occupation [ɒkjʊˈpeɪʃən] n. — kasb
▪️>> An occupation is a person’s job. >> An occupation biror shaxsning ishi.

— My father’s occupation is a dentist.
— Otamning kasbi stomatolog.

factual [fæktjʊəl] adj. — asosli, dalilga boy
▪️>> When something is factual, it is true. >> Qachonki biror narsa factual bo'lsa, u to'g'ri bo'ladi. 

— John learns about history from factual books.
— Jon tarixni asosli kitoblardan o'rganadi.

significant [sɪgˈnɪfɪkənt] adj. — muhim, ahamiyatli 
▪️>> When someone or something is significant, they are important. >> Qachonki birortasi yoki biror narsa significant bo'lsa, u muhim bo'ladi. 

— I read many significant novels as a literature major in university.
— Men universitetda adabiyotshunos sifatida ko'plab muhim romanlarni o'qidim.

cage [keɪdʒ] n. — qafas
▪️>> A cage is something that holds an animal so it cannot leave. >> A cage hayvon qochib ketmasligi uchun ushlab turiladigan narsa.

— We put the parrots in their cage at night.
— Biz tunda to'tiqushlarni qafasiga qo'yamiz.

volcano [vɒlˈkeɪnəʊ] n. — vulqon
▪️>> A volcano is a mountain with a hole on top where hot liquid comes out. >> A volcano tepasidagi teshikdan qaynoq suyuqlik chiqib turadigan tog'.

— When the volcano erupted, smoke and heat filled the air.
— Vulqon otilganda, tutun va issiqlik atrofni to'ldirdi.

overseas [əʊvəˈsiːz] adv. — okean orti
▪️>> If you go overseas, you go to a country on the other side of an ocean. >> Agar siz overseas ga ketayotgan bo'lsangiz, siz okean ortidagi davlatga ketayotgan bo'lasiz.

— John often goes overseas for vacations.
— Jon ko'pincha okean ortiga ta'tilga chiqadi.

route [ruːt] n. — marshrut, yo'nalish
▪️>> A route is the way you go from one place to another. >> A route siz bir joydan boshqa joyga boradigan yo'l.

— I saw many new houses along the route to the city.
— Men shahar yo'nalishi bo'ylab juda ko'p yangi uylarni ko'rdim.

nevertheless [nevəðəˈles] adv. — shunga qaramay
▪️>> You use nevertheless to show that something goes against a fact. >> Siz nevertheless ni biror narsa bitta faktga qarshi ekanligini ko'rsatish uchun ishlatasiz.

— He is usually friendly. Nevertheless, he wasn’t this afternoon.
— U odatda do'stona. Shunga qaramay bugun kunduzi unaqa emas edi.

biology [baɪˈɒlədʒɪ] n. — biologiya 
▪️>> Biology is the study of living things. >> Biology tirik narsalarni o'rganish fani.

— We learned about the human heart in biology class.
— Biz inson yuragi haqida biologiya darsida o'rgandik.

scholar [skɒlə:r] n. — bilimdon 
▪️>> A scholar is a person who studies something and knows much about it. >> A scholar biror narsa o'rganadigan va u haqida ko'p narsa biladigan shaxs.

— The scholar knew much about art history.
— Bilimdon san'at tarixi haqida ko'p narsa bilar edi.

colleague [kɒliːg] n. — hamkasb
▪️>> A colleague is somebody you work with. >> A colleague siz birga ishlaydigan birortasi.

— My colleague helped me finish the job.
— Mening hamkasbim ishimni tugatishimga yordam berdi.

debate [dɪˈbeɪt] v. — muhokama qilmoq
▪️>> To debate is to seriously discuss something with someone. >> To debate birortasi bilan biror narsani jiddiy muhokama qilish degani.

— The husband and wife debated over which TV to buy.
— Er va xotin qaysi televizorni sotib olishni muhokama qilishdi.
Unit 8:
bush [bʊʃ] n. — buta
▪️>> A bush is a plant with many thin branches. It is smaller than a tree. >> A bush ingichka shoxli o'simlik. U daraxtdan kichikroq bo'ladi.

— My dad and I planted some small bushes around the house.
— Dadam va men uyimiz atrofiga bir qancha kichik butalar ekdik.

capable [keɪpəbəl] adj. — qobiliyatli, o'quvli
▪️>> If someone or something is capable of something, they can do it. >> Agar kimdir yoki biror narsa biror narsa qilishda capable bo'lsa, u o'sha narsani qila oladi.

— The Olympic athlete is capable of lifting a lot of weight.
— Olimpiya sportchisi juda ko'p og'irlikni ko'tarishga qodir.

succeed [səkˈsiːd] v. — muvaffaqiyat qozonmoq
▪️>> To succeed is to complete something that you planned or tried to do. >> To succeed siz rejalashtirgan yoki harakat qilgan biror narsani tamomlash degani.

— He will continue to work on the robot until he succeeds.
— U muvaffaqiyat qozonguncha robot ustida ishlashni davom ettiradi.

edge [edʒ] n. — chet, qirra, qirg'oq
▪️>> The edge of something is the part of it that is farthest from the center. >> Biror narsaning edge qismi uning markazdan eng uzoq qismi degani.

— He ran to the edge of the cliff.
— U jarlik chetiga yugurdi.

considerable [kənˈsɪdərəbl] adj. — sezilarli, salmoqli
▪️>> If something is considerable, it is large in size, amount or extent. >> Agar biror narsa considerable bo'lsa, u katta hajm yoki darajada.

— They paid a considerable amount of money for that car.
— Ular mashina uchun katta pul to'lashgan.

definite [dɛfənɪt] adj. — aniq, yaqqol
▪️>> If something is definite, it is certain or sure to be true. >> Agar biror narsa definite bo'lsa, bu aniq yoki haqiqat.

— There is a definite connection between hard work and success.
— Qattiq mehnat va muvaffaqiyat o'rtasida aniq bog'liqlik bor.

dictate [dɪkˈteɪt] v. — aytib yozdirmoq
▪️>> To dictate something is to read it aloud so it can be written down. >> Biror narsani dictate qilish u yozib olinishi uchun ovozini chiqarib o'qish degani.

— He dictated his speech so his secretary could write it down.
— U o'z kotibasi yozib olishi uchun o'z nutqini ovoz chiqarib o'qib berdi.

suspect [səsˈpekt] v. — -deb hisoblamoq
▪️>> To suspect something is to believe that it is true. >> Biror narsani suspect qilish u to'g'ri ekanligiga ishonish degani.

— I suspect that those kids stole the money.
— Menimcha, o'sha bolalar pulni o'g'irlagan.

broad [brɔːd] adj. — keng, katta
▪️>> If something is broad, it is wide. >> Agar biror narsa broad bo'lsa, u keng bo'ladi. 

— The river is very long and broad.
— Haligi daryo juda uzun va keng.

confident [kɒnfɪdənt] adj. — o'ziga ishongan
▪️>> Confident means that one believes they can do something without failing. >> Confident degani, kimdir nimanidir tinimsiz qila olishiga ishonishi degani.

— She was confident she could climb the mountain due to her training.
— U mashg'ulotlar tufayli toqqa chiqa olishiga ishonardi.

valley [vælɪ] n. — vodiy
▪️>> A valley is a low area of land between two mountains or hills. >> A valley ikki tog' yoki qir orasidagi pastlik maydon.

— We looked at the valley below from the top of the mountain.
— Biz tog' ustidan pastlikdagi vodiyga qaradik.

shadow [ʃædəʊ] n. — soya, ko'lanka
▪️>> A shadow is the dark area that is made when something blocks light. >> A shadow yorug'lik to'silganda paydo bo'ladigan qorong'u maydon.

— The man’s shadow was taller than he was.
— Haligi odamning soyasi o'zidan uzunroq edi.

destination [destɪˈneɪʃən] n. — manzil
▪️>> A destination is the place where someone or something is going to. >> A destination birortasi yoki biror narsa ketayotgan joy.

— The destination of this plane is Munich, Germany.
— Bu samolyotning boradigan manzili - Myunxen, Germaniya.

resort [rɪˈzɔːt] v. — asos qilib olmoq, asoslanmoq
▪️>> To resort to something is to depend on it in order to solve a problem. >> Biror narsaga resort qilish muammoni yechish uchun unga suyanish degani.

— I hope they don’t resort to violence to end the argument.
— Umid qilamanki, ular bahsni tugatish uchun zo'ravonlikka qo'l urishmaydi.

delight [dɪˈlaɪt] n. — zavq, shavq
▪️>> Delight is a feeling of being very happy with something. >> Delight biror narsa bilan juda hursand bo'lish tuyg'usi.

— He felt such delight after getting a promotion at work.
— Ishda ko'tarilganidan keyin u juda xursand bo'ldi.

path [pɑːθ] n. — so'qmoq
▪️>> A path is a way from one place to another that people can walk along. >> A path odamlar u bo'ylab yura oladigan, bir joydan boshqa joyga olib boradigan yo'l.

— We followed a path through the woods.
— Biz o'rmonda so'qmoq bo'ylab yurdik.

concentrate [kɒnsəntreɪt] v. — diqqatini jamlamoq
▪️>> To concentrate on someone or something is to give your full attention. >> Biror narsaga yoki birortasiga concentrate qilish bu butun diqqatni shu narsaga berish degani.

— I could not concentrate on my homework because the room was so loud.
— Men uy vazifasiga diqqatimni jamlay olmadim, chunki xonada juda ovoz baland edi.

cheat [tʃiːt] v. — g'irromlik qilmoq
▪️>> To cheat is to be dishonest so that you can win or do well. >> To cheat g'olib bo'lish uchun yoki yaxshi bajarish uchun vijdonsiz bo'lish degani.

— They cheated on the test by sharing answers.
— Ular javoblarni bir birlariga berish orqali testda g'irromlik qilishdi.

convey [kənˈveɪ] v. — ifodalamoq
▪️>> To convey is to communicate or make ideas known. >> To convey bu fikrlarni bildirish yoki ifodalash.

— That picture of a crying child conveys a feeling of sadness.
— Yig'layotgan bolaning tasviri qayg'u tuyg'usini bildiradi.

conclude [kənˈkluːd] v. — deb xulosa qilmoq
▪️>> To conclude is to arrive at a logical end by looking at evidence. >> To conclude dalillarga qarab, mantiqiy yakun topishni anglatadi.

— I saw crumbs on my dog’s face, so I concluded that he ate my cookie.
— Men itimning yuzida bo'laklarni ko'rdim, shuning uchun u mening pechenyemni yedi degan xulosaga keldim.
Unit 9:
admire [ədˈmaɪə:r] v. — qoyil qolmoq
▪️>> To admire someone is to like them for what they do. >> Birortasini admire qilish uning biror qilgan ishi uchun yoqtirish degani.

— I admire my brother for his hard work.
— Men akamning qattiq ishi uchun qoyil qoldim.

defend [dɪˈfend] v. — mudofaa qilmoq
▪️>> To defend someone or something is to protect them from attack. >> Birortasini yoki biror narsani defend qilish ularni hujumdan himoya qilish degani.

— The soldiers defended the town from the invaders.
— Askarlar shaharni bosqinchilardan himoya qildilar.

slave [sleɪv] n. — qul
▪️>> A slave is a person who is not free and must work for someone else. >> A slave erkin bo'lmagan va boshqa birov uchun ishlashi kerak bo'lgan shaxs.

— The slave worked very hard all day long.
— Qul kun bo'yi juda qattiq ishladi.

destruction [dɪsˈtrʌkʃən] n. — vayrona
▪️>> Destruction is damage to something so bad that it can’t be fixed. >> Destruction biror narsaga qilingan tuzatib bo'lmas ziyon.

— After the big fire, there was much destruction in the city.
— Katta yong'indan so'ng, shaharda ko'p vayrona bo'ldi.

reputation [repjəˈteɪʃən] n. — obro', reputatsiya 
▪️>> Reputation is the opinion that people have about someone. >> Reputation birortasi haqidagi odamlarning fikri.

— The doctor had a reputation for helping people.
— Shifokor odamlarga yordam berish obro'siga ega edi.

govern [gʌvən] v. — nazorat qilmoq, boshqarmoq
▪️>> To govern is to control the public business of a country, state, or city. >> To govern bu mamlakat, shtat yoki shaharning davlat biznesini nazorat qilish. 

— The United States is governed from the White House.
— Qo'shma Shtatlar Oq Uydan turib boshqariladi.

plenty [plentɪ] n. — ko'p miqdorda
▪️>> To have plenty of something is to have more than you need. >> Biror narsaga plenty miqdorda ega bo'lish unga ehtiyojdagidan ko'p miqdorda ega bo'lish degani.

— The school had plenty of books for the students to read.
— Maktabda o'quvchilar o'qishi uchun ko'p kitoblar bor.

relieve [rɪˈliːv] v. — og'rig'ini yengillashtirmoq
▪️>> To relieve someone is to make them feel less pain. >> Birortasini relieve qilish uning kam og'riq sezishini ta'minlash degani.

— The medicine relieved the sick boy.
— Dori kasal bolaning og'rig'ini yengillashtirdi.

disorder [dɪsˈɔːrdər] n. — tartibsizlik
▪️>> Disorder is a lack of order, or a complete mess. >> Disorder tartibning yo'qligi yoki to'liq tartibsizlik.

— The teacher’s desk had many papers in disorder.
— O'qituvchining stolida ko'plab tartibsiz qog'ozlar bor edi.

authority [əˈθɒːrətɪ] n. — vakolat, huquq
▪️>> Authority is the power that someone has because of their position. >> Authority birortasining mansabi sabab ega bo'lgan kuchi.

— The policeman has authority on the streets.
— Politsiyachining ko'chalarda vakolati bor.

stupid [stjuːpɪd] adj. — ahmoq, tentak
▪️>> When someone is stupid, they lack intelligence. >> Qachonki birortasi stupid bo'lsa, uning bilimi yetarli bo'lmaydi.

— He said something stupid that made everyone angry at him.
— U undan hammaning jahlini chiqargan ahmoqona gap aytdi.

attempt [əˈtempt] v. — urinmoq, harakat qilmoq 
▪️>> To attempt something is to try to do that thing. >> Biror narsaga attempt qilish u narsani qilishga urinish degani.

— I am attempting to learn English.
— Men ingliz tilini o'rganishga harakat qilyapman.

division [dɪˈvɪʒən] n. — bo'lish, taqsimlash
▪️>> A division is the act of making smaller groups out of a larger one. >> A division bu kattaroq guruhdan kichik guruhlarni yaratish harakati.

— The chart had six divisions which all had different colors.
— Diagrammada oltita bo'linma bor edi, ularning hammasi har xil rangda edi.

capital [kæpɪtl] n. — poytaxt
▪️>> A capital is an important city where a country’s leaders live and work. >> A capital davlatning liderlari yashab ishlaydigan muhim shahar.

— We will visit the capital to learn about our government.
— Biz hukumat haqida o'rgangani poytaxtga tashrif buyuramiz.

enable [ɪˈneɪbl] v. — imkoniyat bermoq 
▪️>> To enable a person is to make it possible for them to do something. >> Biror kishiga enable qilish bu unga biror narsa qilish imkoniyatini berish.

— Having the key enabled us to open the door.
— Kalitning borligi bizga eshikni ochishga imkoniyat berdi.

struggle [strʌgəl] v. — kurashmoq, yoqalashmoq
▪️>> To struggle is to fight against someone or something. >> To struggle birortasi yoki biror narsaga qarshi kurashish degani.

— The kids struggled with each other for the toy.
— Bolalar o'yinchoq uchun bir-birlari bilan kurashishdi.

royal [rɔɪəl] adj. — qirollikka aloqador
▪️>> Royal describes something that belongs to a king or queen. >> Royal qirol yoki qirolichaga tegishli narsani tasvirlaydi.

— The king sat upon the royal throne.
— Podshoh qirollik taxtiga o'tirdi.

frustrate [frʌsˈtreɪt] v. — umidsizlantirmoq
▪️>> To frustrate is to prevent someone from fulfilling their desire. >> To frustrate kimningdir xohishini bajarishiga to'sqinlik qilish.

— The machine frustrated me because I could not fix it.
— Mashina meni umidsizlantirdi, chunki men uni tuzata olmadim.

aid [eɪd] v. — yordam bermoq
▪️>> To aid someone is to help them when they need something. >> Birortasiga aid qilish u biror narsaga muhtoj bo'lganda unga yordam berish degani.

— The doctor aided the boy after his accident.
— Falokatdan keyin doktor haligi bolaga yordam berdi.

cooperate [koʊˈɒpəreɪt] v. — hamkorlik qilmoq
▪️>> To cooperate is to work together to do something. >> To cooperate biror narsa qilish uchun birgalikda ishlash degani.

— The students cooperated to clean up the classroom.
— O'quvchilar sinfni tozalashda hamkorlik qilishdi.
Unit 10:
resist [rɪˈzɪst] v. — qarshilik ko'rsatmoq
▪️>> To resist something is to fight against it. >> Biror narsaga resist qilish unga qarshi kurashish degani.

— He resisted the treatment at the hospital.
— U kasalxonada davolanishga qarshilik ko'rsatdi.

enormous [ɪˈnɔːrməs] adj. — ulkan, juda katta
▪️>> When people or things are enormous, they are very large. >> Agar odamlar yoki narsalar enormous bo'lsa, ular juda katta bo'ladi. 

— My dog looks enormous next to yours.
— Mening itim senikining oldida juda katta ko'rinadi.

trial [traiəl] n. — sud jarayoni
▪️>> A trial is the way a court discovers if a person is guilty or innocent. >> A trial bu odamning aybli yoki aybsizligini aniqlash usuli.

— He went on trial for robbing the bank.
— U bankni talaganlikda ayblanib sudga tortildi.

impression [ɪmˈpreʃən] n. — taassurot 
▪️>> An impression is the way of thinking about someone or something. >> An impression birortasi yoki biror narsa haqida o'ylash yo'li.

— Most people’s first impression of Dr. Giani is that he is mean.
— Doktor Giani haqida ko'pchilikning birinchi taassuroti shundaki, u yomon.

giant [dʒaɪənt] adj. — bahaybat, gigant 
▪️>> When people or things are giant, they are very big. >> Qachonki odamlar yoki narsalar giant bo'lsa, ular juda katta bo'ladi. 

— The giant truck got in my way.
— Gigant yuk mashinasi mening oldimga keldi.

trap [træp] v. — tutqunlikda saqlamoq
▪️>> To trap people or animals is to capture them so they cannot get away. >> Odamlarni yoki hayvonlarni trap qilish ularni qochib ketmasligi uchun ushlab turish degani.

— We trapped butterflies in a net.
— Kapalaklarni to'rga qamab qo'ydik.

sword [sɔːrd] n. — qilich, shamshir
▪️>> A sword is a long sharp weapon. >> A sword uzun o'tkir qurol.

— They used to use swords in battles in ancient times.
— Qadimda ular janglarda qilichdan foydalanishgan.

declare [dɪˈklɛər] v. — aytmoq, bildirmoq
▪️>> To declare is to say something officially. >> To declare biror narsani rasmiy tarzda aytish degani.

— I declared my love for him.
— Men unga sevishimni bildirdim.

income [ɪnkʌm] n. — daromad 
▪️>> Income is how much money a person or business makes. >> Income biror shaxs yoki biznes qancha miqdorda pul topishi.

— Her company pays her a fairly good income.
— Uning kompaniyasi unga yaxshi daromad to'laydi.

council [kaunsəl] n. — kengash, ko'nsullik
▪️>> A council is a group of people who run a city or town. >> A council shaharni boshqaradigan odamlar guruhi.

— The council met to discuss the new laws for the city.
— Shahar uchun qabul qilingan yangi qonunni muhokama qilish uchun kengash yig'ildi.

extraordinary [ikˈstroːrdənəri] adj. — g'ayritabiiy, turfa
▪️>> When someone or something are extraordinary, they are amazing. >> Qachonki birortasi yoki biror narsa extraordinary bo'lsa, u ajoyib bo'ladi. 

— The fireman who rescued the girl was extraordinary.
— Qizni qutqargan o't o'chiruvchi g'ayrioddiy edi.

reveal [rɪˈviːl] v. — ko'rsatmoq
▪️>> To reveal is to show something. >> To reveal biror narsani ko'rsatmoq degani.

— I will reveal where I hid the candy bar.
— Men konfetni qayerga yashirganimni oshkor qilaman (ko'rsataman).

ought [ɔːt] aux. v. — kerak, lozim
▪️>> If someone ought to do something, then it is the right thing to do. >> Agar kimdir biror narsa qilishi ought bo'lsa, demak bu to'g'ri.

— I ought to take my library books back.
— Men kutubxonadan olgan kitoblarimni joyiga qaytarishim kerak.

citizen [sɪtəzən] n. — fuqaro
▪️>> A citizen is someone who lives in a certain town or city. >> A citizen ma'lum bir shaharda yashovchi birortasi.

— Carlos was born in Spain. He is a Spanish citizen.
— Karlos Ispaniyada tug'ilgan. U Ispaniya fuqarosi.

funeral [fjuːnərəl] n. — dafn marosimi 
▪️>> A funeral is a ceremony that takes place after a person dies. >> A funeral biror odam o'lgandan so'ng amalga oshiriladigan marosim.

— They had a funeral for the soldier who died during the war.
— Ular urush vaqtida halok bo'lgan askarga dafn marosimi o'tkazishdi.

mad [mæd] adj. — badjahl, jahldor
▪️>> When someone is mad, they are angry. >> Qachonki birortasi mad bo'lsa, u jahli chiqqan bo'ladi. 

— Mother got mad when I didn’t listen to her.
— Onamga quloq solmaganimda uning jahli chiqdi.

rid [rɪd] v. — xalos qilmoq
▪️>> To rid is to make a place free from something or someone. >> To rid bu joyni biror narsadan yoki birovdan xoli qilish.

— We rid our home of mice by using traps.
— Biz tuzoq yordamida uyimizni sichqonlardan tozalaymiz.

violent [vaɪələnt] adj. — zo'ravon, quturgan
▪️>> When people are violent, they want to hurt someone. >> Qachonki odamlar violent bo'lsa, ular birortasini jarohatlashni xohlashadi.

— The man was put into jail because he was violent.
— Erkak zo'ravonlik qilgani uchun qamoqqa tashlandi.

fog [fo(:)g] n. — tuman
▪️>> Fog is a thick cloud that is near the ground or water. >> Fog yer yoki suvga yaqin qalin bulut. 

— I did not want to drive in the thick fog.
— Men qalin tumanda mashina haydashni xohlamadim.

tale [teɪl] n. — ertak, hikoya
▪️>> A tale is a story. >> A tale bu hikoya.

— She told her two friends about the wild tale of her day.
— U ikki do'stiga o'z zamonasining ertaklarini aytib berdi.
Unit 11:
wet [wet] adj. — nam, ho'l
▪️>> If something is wet, it has water on it. >> Agar biror narsa wet bo'lsa, unda suv bo'ladi. 

— Since my dog was wet, he tried to shake all the water off his body.
— Mening itim ho'l bo'lgani uchun, u butun tanadagi suvni silkitishga urindi.

despite [dɪsˈpaɪt] prep. — ga qaramasdan
▪️>> If something happens despite what you do, it happens anyway. >> Agar siz qilayotgan ishingizga despite biror narsa ro'y bersa, u baribir sodir bo'ladi.

— We still played the game despite the cold weather.
— Biz sovuq ob-havoga qaramasdan haligacha o'ynardik.

lightly [laɪtlɪ] adv. — muloyimlik bilan
▪️>> To do something lightly is to not push very hard. >> Biror narsani lightly qilish - bu juda qattiq bosmaslik.

— Draw lightly so you do not tear your paper.
— Qog'ozni yirtib qo'ymaslik uchun muloyimlik bilan chizing.

interfere [ɪntəˈfɪər] v. — xalaqit bermoq
▪️>> To interfere is to cause problems and keep something from happening. >> To interfere muammolar sodir etish va biror narsaning sodir bo'lishining oldini olish.

— My little sister always interferes when I’m trying to study.
— Men doim o'qishga harakat qilayotganimda singlim xalaqit beradi.

blame [bleɪm] v. — ayblamoq
▪️>> To blame someone for something bad is to say they did it. >> Birortasini yoki biror yomon narsani blame qilish ularning shu yomon ishni qilganini aytish degani.

— My mom blamed me for something I didn’t do.
— Onam meni qilmagan ishim uchun aybladi.

gentle [dʒentl] adj. — muloyim, yuvosh
▪️>> Someone who is gentle is kind and calm. >> Gentle odam xotirjam va mehribon bo'ladi. 

— He is very gentle with the baby.
— U chaqaloq bilan juda muloyim muomala qiladi.

fame [feɪm] n. — shon-shuhrat, obro'
▪️>> Fame is reputation one has gained among the public. >> Fame birortasining omma oldida erishgan obro'si.

— He had fame and fortune, but he was not happy.
— Uning shon-shuhrati va boyligi bor edi, lekin u baxtli emas edi.

spite [spaɪt] n. — (out of spite) qasddan, jo'rttaga, ataylab
▪️>> If you do something out of spite, you want to be mean. >> Agar siz biror narsani out of spite qilsangiz, siz yomon bo'lishni xohlaysiz.

— He snuck into his sister’s room and stole her bag out of spite.
— U singlisining xonasiga kirdi va ataylab sumkasini o'g'irladi.

exhibit [ɪgˈzɪbɪt] n. — ko'rgazma, eksponat 
▪️>> An exhibit is a display of interesting things. >> An exhibit bu qiziqarli narsalarni namoyish qilish.

— There was an animal exhibit at the fair.
— Yarmarkada hayvonlar ko'rgazmasi bor edi.

principal [prɪnsəpəl] n. — maktab direktori 
▪️>> A principal is a person in charge of a school. >> A principal bu maktab uchun mas'ul shaxs.

— My school’s principal can be very strict with the rules.
— Maktabim direktori qoidalarga juda qattiqqo'l bo'lishi mumkin.

row [rou] n. — qator, saf
▪️>> A row is a line of things. >> A row narsalar qatori.

— James put all of his toy soldiers into neat rows.
— Jeyms o'zining o'yinchoq askarlarini tartibli qatorlarga qo'ydi.

forecast [fɔrˌkæst] n. — ob-havo ma'lumoti
▪️>> A forecast is an idea about what the weather will be like in the future. >> A forecast ob-havo kelajakda qanday bo'lishi haqidagi g'oya.

— The forecast says that it will rain all week.
— Ob-havo ma'lumotining aytishicha, hafta davomida yomg'ir yog'adi.

super [suːpər] adj. — juda yaxshi
▪️>> Super means really good. >> Super juda yaxshi degan ma'noni bildiradi. 

— My dad said I did a super job cleaning the house.
— Otam uyni tozalab juda yaxshi ish qilganimni aytdi.

chemistry [kemɪstrɪ] n. — kimyo
▪️>> Chemistry the study of and reaction to substances. >> Chemistry moddalarni va ularga reaktsiyalarni o'rganish fani.

— In chemistry class, the professor taught us about chemical reactions.
— Kimyo darsida professor bizga kimyoviy reaksiyalar haqida aytib berdi.

admission [ədˈmɪʃən] n. — ruxsat, kirish
▪️>> Admission is the act of allowing to enter a place. >> Admission biror joyga kirish uchun ruxsat berish harakati.

— The admission ticket to the movie was $5.
— Kino uchun kirish bileti $5 edi.

dinosaur [daɪnəsɔːr] n. — dinozavr 
▪️>> A dinosaur is a very big animal that lived millions of years ago. >> A dinosaur million yillar avval yashagan juda katta hayvon.

— I like to see the dinosaur bones at the museum.
— Men muzeyda dinozavr suyaklarini ko'rishni yaxshi ko'raman.

shelf [ʃelf] n. — tokcha
▪️>> A shelf is a place on a wall where you put things. >> A shelf siz narsalarni qo'yadigan devordagi joy.

— I keep my clothes on a shelf in my closet.
— Men kiyimlarimni shikafimdagi tokchada saqlayman.

astronomy [əsˈtrɒnəmɪ] n. — astronomiya
▪️>> Astronomy is the study of the stars and planets. >> Astronomy yulduzlar va sayyoralar haqidagi fan.

— Harold loved watching the stars, so he decided to study astronomy.
— Garold yulduzlarni tomosha qilishni yaxshi ko'rar edi, shuning uchun u astronomiyani o'rganishga qaror qildi.

genius [dʒiːnjəs] n. — juda aqlli, ziyrak
▪️>> A genius is a very smart person. >> A genius juda aqlli shaxs.

— Since she was a genius, she easily passed all of her school exams.
— U juda aqlliligi sababli barcha maktab imtihonlaridan oson o'tdi.

geography [dʒɪˈɒgrəfɪ] n. — geografiya 
▪️>> Geography is the study of where things are. >> Geography bu narsalarning qayerdaligini o'rganish fani.

— I had to draw a map for geography class. 
— Men geografiya darsi uchun xarita chizishga majbur bo'ldim.
Unit 12:
candle [kændl] n. — sham
▪️>> A candle is a stick of wax that is lit on fire for light or heat. >> A candle bu nur yoki issiqlik uchun olovda yoqilgan mum tayog'i.

— When the lights went out, we lit some candles.
— Chiroqlar o'chganda, biz sham yoqdik.

fault [fɔːlt] n. — ayb, xato
▪️>> A fault is a mistake. >> A fault xato degani.

— It is my fault that the cat ran away. I left the door open.
— Mushukning qochib ketishi mening aybim. Eshikni ochiq qoldirgan edim.

abuse [əˈbjuːz] v. — haqorat qilmoq, so'kmoq
▪️>> To abuse someone or something means to hurt them on purpose. >> Biror kishini yoki biror narsani abuse qilish, uni ataylab xafa qilish degani.

— The mean man abused his dog when it barked too loudly.
— Pastkash odam itini juda baland ovozda hurganida haqorat qildi.

metal [metl] n. — metal, temir
▪️>> Metal is a strong material people use to build things. >> Metal odamlar narsalarni qurish uchun ishlatadigan kuchli materialdir.

— Steel is a common metal that is used to build buildings.
— Po'lat bu binolarni qurishda ishlatiladigan oddiy metall.

ingredient [ɪnˈgriːdɪənt] n. — tarkibiy qism, ingrediyent 
▪️>> An ingredient is something that is part of a food dish. >> An ingredient bu taomning bir qismi.

— The main ingredients in cake are eggs, sugar and flour.
— Kekning asosiy tarkibiy qismlari tuxum, shakar va undir.

generous [dʒenərəs] adj. — sahiy, qo'li ochiq
▪️>> When someone is generous, they like to give things to people. >> Qachonki birortasi generous bo'lsa, u odamlarga biror narsa berishni yoqtiradi.

— The generous man donated several new computers to our school.
— Saxiy odam maktabimizga bir nechta yangi kompyuter sovg'a qildi.

convert [kənˈvəːrt] v. — ga aylantirmoq, ga o'zgartirmoq
▪️>> To convert something means to change it into something else. >> Biror narsani convert qilish uni boshqa biror narsaga o'zgartirish degani.

— The man converted his messy field into a garden of flowers.
— Haligi odam o'zining betartib maydonini gullar bog'iga aylantirdi.

monitor [mɒnɪtər] v. — kuzatib bormoq
▪️>> To monitor people or things is to watch them closely. >> Odamlarni yoki narsalarni monitor qilish ularni yaqindan kuzatish degani.

— The teacher monitors the students when they take tests.
— O'qituvchi talabalar test topshirayotganda ularni kuzatib turadi.

bean [bi:n] n. — no'xat, loviya
▪️>> A bean is a plant seed that is good to eat. >> A bean bu yesa bo'ladigan o'simlik urug'i.

— There are many different kinds of beans to eat.
— Iste'mol qilish uchun no'xatning juda ko'p turlari mavjud.

mess [mes] n. — kir, tartibsizlik
▪️>> A mess is a condition that is not clean or neat. >> A mess bu ozoda yoki toza bo'lmagan holat.

— Heather’s room was a complete mess.
— Xizerning xonasi butunlay tartibsiz edi.

bake [beɪk] v. — pishirmoq
▪️>> To bake means to cook food with heat. >> To bake ovqatni issiqda pishirishni anglatadi.

— My sister is a good cook. She bakes delicious cakes.
— Mening singlim yaxshi oshpaz. U mazali piroglar pishiradi.

decrease [diːkriːs] v. — kamaytirmoq, pasaymoq
▪️>> To decrease something is to make it less than it was before. >> Biror narsani decrease qilish uning avvalgi holatidan ko'ra ozroq holatga keltirish degani.

— Hiring more police officers has decreased crime in the city.
— Ko'proq politsiya ofitserlarini ishga yollash shahardagi jinoyatchilikni kamaytirdi.

fund [fʌnd] n. — fond
▪️>> A fund is an amount of money that people have. >> A fund odamlar egalik qilayotgan pul miqdori.

— We all put money into our club’s fund.
— Hammamiz klubimiz fondiga pul o'tkazdik.

oppose [əˈpəʊz] v. — qarshi chiqmoq, yomon ko'rmoq
▪️>> To oppose something means to dislike it or act against it. >> Biror narsaga oppose qilish uni yomon ko'rish yoki unga qarshi harakat qilish degani.

— I want to be a police officer because I oppose crime.
— Men politsiya ofitseri bo'lishni xohlayman, chunki men jinoyatchilikka qarshiman.

quantity [kwɒntətɪ] n. — miqdor
▪️>> A quantity is a certain amount of something. >> A quantity biror narsaning ma'lum miqdori.

— I have a small quantity of milk in my glass.
— Mening stakanimda oz miqdorda sut bor.

insist [ɪnˈsɪst] v. — talab qilmoq
▪️>> To insist means to be firm in telling people what to do. >> To insist odamlarga nima qilish kerakligini aytishda qat'iy bo'lish demakdir.

— I insist that you try some of these cookies.
— Men shuni talab qilamanki, siz ushbu pirogni sinab ko'rishingiz kerak.

passive [pæsɪv] a. — passiv, sust
▪️>> If a person is passive, they do not take action to solve problems. >> Agar birortasi passive bo'lsa, u muammolarni yechish uchun harakat qilmaydi.

— Marcie is so passive that she never solves her own problems.
— Mersi shunchalik passivki, u hech qachon o'z muammolarini hal qilmaydi.

afford [əˈfɔːrd] v. — qurbi yetmoq
▪️>> To afford something means you have enough money to pay for it. >> Biror narsani afford qilish, buning uchun pulingiz etarli ekanligini anglatadi.

— I’ve been saving my money, so I can afford to buy a new bike.
— Men pulimni tejadim, shuning uchun endi yangi velosiped sotib ola olaman.

debt [det] n. — qarz
▪️>> A debt is an amount of money that a person owes. >> A debt bu odam qarzdor bo'lgan pul miqdori.

— I have not paid my gas bill. I owe a debt to the gas company.
— Men gaz uchun to'lovimni to'lamadim. Men gaz kompaniyasiga qarzdorman.

sue [su:] v. — sudga bermoq
▪️>> To sue someone is to take them to court for something wrong they did. >> Birortasini sue qilish ularning biror qilgan noto'g'ri ishi uchun sudga berish degani.

— I sued the company after I slipped on a banana peel in their hallway.
— Men koridorda banan qobig'ini sirg'alib tashlaganimdan keyin kompaniyani sudga berdim.
Unit 13:
initial [ɪˈnɪʃəl] adj. — birinchi, dastlabki
▪️>> When something is initial, it is the first thing. >> Qachonki biror narsa initial bo'lsa, u birinchisi bo'ladi. 

— The initial step when writing a paper is to find a good topic.
— Maqolani yozishda birinchi qadam yaxshi mavzuni topishdir.

guarantee [gærənˈtiː] v. — kafolat bermoq
▪️>> To guarantee means to know something will happen. >> To guarantee biror narsa sodir bo'lishini bilish degani.

— I guarantee that the sun will come up in the morning.
— Men kafolat beramanki, quyosh ertalab chiqadi.

spin [spɪn] v. — aylanmoq
▪️>> To spin is to turn around in circles. >> To spin doira bo'lib aylanish degani.

— The boy kept spinning until he fell down.
— Bola yiqilguncha aylanishda davom etdi.

emergency [ɪˈməːrdʒənsɪ] n. — favqulodda holat
▪️>> An emergency is a time when someone needs help right away. >> An emergency bu kimdir darhol yordamga muhtoj bo'lishi.

— There is a huge fire in my house! This is an emergency!
— Mening uyimda katta yong'in chiqdi! Bu favqulodda holat!

lend [lend] v. — berib turmoq
▪️>> To lend something is to give it to someone for a short time. >> Biror narsani lend qilish uni qisqa muddatga birortasiga berish degani.

— My sister lost her pen, so I will lend her mine.
— Opam ruchkasini yo'qotib qo'ydi, shuning uchun men unga o'zimnikini berib turaman.

pride [praɪd] n. — mamnuniyat, qoniqish
▪️>> When you have pride, you are happy with yourself. >> Qachonki pride bo'lsangiz, o'zingizdan hursand bo'lasiz.

— I take pride in getting good grades.
— Men yaxshi baho olganimdan mamnunman.

intense [ɪnˈtens] adj. — jadal, juda kuchli
▪️>> If something is intense, it is very strong. >> Agar biror narsa intense bo'lsa, u juda kuchli bo'ladi. 

— The skunk made an intense odor that filled the air.
— Skunk atrofga kuchli hid chiqardi.

quit [kwɪt] v. — to'xtatmoq
▪️>> To quit something means to stop doing it. >> Biror narsani quit qilish uni qilishni to'xtatish degani. 

— I quit running because I got tired.
— Men yugurishni to'xtatdim, chunki charchagan edim.

army [ɑːrmɪ] n. — armiya
▪️>> An army is a large group of people who fight in wars. >> An army urushlarda jang qiladigan odamlarning juda katta guruhi.

— The army protects all the people in the country.
— Armiya mamlakatdagi barcha odamlarni himoya qiladi.

billion [bɪljən] n. — milliard
▪️>> A billion is a very large number: 1,000,000,000. >> A billion juda katta raqam: 1,000,000,000.

— There are billions of stars in outer space.
— Tashqi fazoda milliardlab yulduzlar bor.

potential [pəˈtenʃəl] adj. — potensial, ehtimoldagi
▪️>> Potential means capable of being but not yet in existence. >> Potential mavjud bo'lishga qodir, lekin hali mavjud emas narsalarni anglatadi.

— I’ve thought of some potential problems with your idea.
— Men sizning fikringiz bilan bog'liq ba'zi ehtimoliy muammolar haqida o'yladim.

carve [kɑːrv] v. — kesmoq, to'g'ramoq
▪️>> To carve means to cut into something. >> To carve biror narsani kesish degani.

— My father usually carves the turkey for Thanksgiving.
— Otam, odatda, minnatdorchilik kuni uchun kurkani so'yadi.

fortune [fɔːrtʃən] n. — omad
▪️>> When someone has good fortune, it means they have luck. >> Qachonki kimdadir fortune bo'lsa, demak u omadli bo'ladi.

— I have good fortune when I play cards.
— Men karta o'ynaganimda omadim bor.

proof [pruːf] n. — isbot, dalil
▪️>> Proof is a fact that shows something is real. >> Proof biror narsaning haqiqiyligini ko'rsatadigan fakt.

— They used his fingerprint as proof for the crime he committed.
— U sodir etgan jinoyat isboti sifatida ular uning barmoq izlaridan foydalanishdi.

hike [haɪk] v. — piyoda safarga chiqmoq
▪️>> To hike means to walk in the mountains or forest. >> To hike tog'da yoki o'rmonda piyoda yurish degani. 

— I always bring plenty of equipment with me when I hike.
— Men piyoda safarga chiqqanimda har doim o'zim bilan ko'p jihozlarni olaman.

tiny [taɪnɪ] adj. — jajji, kichkina
▪️>> When people or things are tiny, they are very small. >> Qachonki odamlar yoki narsalar tiny bo'lsa, ular juda kichkina bo'ladi.

— A baby’s hand is tiny.
— Chaqaloqning qo'li kichkinagina bo'ladi.

anxiety [æŋˈzaɪətɪ] n. — tashvish, xavotir
▪️>> When someone has anxiety, they have a lot of worries and fear. >> Qachonki birortasida anxiety bo'lsa, unda juda ko'p xavotirlar va qo'rquv bo'ladi. 

— When I have to climb to high places, I’m filled with anxiety.
— Qachonki baland joylarga ko'tarilishim kerak bo'lsa, men xavotirga to'lib ketaman.

tutor [tjuːtər] n. — repetitor
▪️>> A tutor is someone who gives lessons in a certain subject. >> A tutor ma'lum fandan dars beradigan biror shaxs.

— My sister is bad at math. So my mother hired a tutor to help her.
— Mening singlim matematikadan yomon. Shuning uchun onam unga yordam berish uchun repetitor yolladi.

consult [kənˈsʌlt] v. — yordam so'ramoq
▪️>> To consult someone means to ask them for help. >> Birortasini consult qilish undan yordam so'rash degani. 

— I will consult my accountant to find a way to pay for my bills.
— Men buxgalterimga hisob-kitoblarimni to'lash usulini topishga yordam beraman.

peak [piːk] n. — cho'qqi
▪️>> The peak is the very top of a mountain. >> The peak tog'ning eng baland qismi.

— There is snow on the peaks of those mountains.
— Anavi tog'larning cho'qqisida qor bor.
Unit 14:
apparent [əˈpærənt] adj. — aniq, muqarrar 
▪️>> If something is apparent, it is easy to see. >> Agar biror narsa apparent bo'lsa, uni ko'rish oson bo'ladi. 

— Her happiness was apparent from the smile on her face.
— Uning hursandligi yuzidagi kulgidan ma'lum edi.

secretary [sekrəterɪ] n. — kotib, kotiba
▪️>> A secretary is a person who works in an office. >> A secretary offisda ishlaydigan shaxs.

— Rebecca asked her secretary to type a report.
— Rebekka kotibasidan hisobot yozishni so'radi.

chat [tʃæt] v. — suhbatlashmoq, gaplashmoq
▪️>> To chat is to talk with someone. >> To chat birortasi bilan gaplashmoq degani.

— Even though they were far apart, the couple chatted every day.
— Ular bir-biridan uzoqda bo'lishsa ham, juftlik har kuni suhbatlashishardi.

obvious [ɒbvɪəs] adj. — aniq, ravshan 
▪️>> If something is obvious, it is clear and easily seen. >> Agar biror narsa obvious bo'lsa, u aniq va oson ko'rinadigan bo'ladi. 

— It was obvious that he was tired. He kept falling asleep.
— Uning charchaganligi aniq edi. U uxlab qolishda davom etdi.

ignore [ɪgˈnɔːr] v. — e'tiborsiz qoldirmoq
▪️>> To ignore something is to act like you do not see or hear it. >> Biror narsani ignore qilish huddi siz uni ko'rmayotgandek yoki eshitmayotgandek harakat qilish degani.

— I ignored the message he was making and kept studying.
— Men uning xabarini e'tiborsiz qoldirdim va o'qishni davom ettirdim.

severe [sɪˈvɪə:r] adj. — qattiq, jiddiy
▪️>> If something is severe, it is very bad or serious. >> Agar biror narsa severe bo'lsa, u juda yomon yoki jiddiy bo'ladi. 

— After hitting his hand with the hammer, Sam was in severe pain.
— Bolg'a bilan qo'lini urganidan keyin Sem qattiq og'riy boshladi.

commit [kəˈmɪt] v. — va'da bermoq 
▪️>> To commit to something is to promise to do it. >> Biror narsani commit qilish u ishni qilishni va'da qilish degani.

— Seth wanted to go home, but he had committed to finishing the job.
— Set uyga qaytmoqchi edi, lekin u ishni tugatishni va'da qilgan edi.

blind [blaɪnd] adj. — ko'zi ojiz, ko'r
▪️>> When people are blind, they cannot see. >> Qachonki birortasi blind bo'lsa, u ko'ra olmaydi.

— The blind man didn’t see the hole and almost fell in.
— Ko'zi ojiz odam teshikni ko'rmadi va deyarli tushib ketdi.

remind [rɪˈmaɪnd] v. — eslatmoq
▪️>> To remind someone is to tell them to remember to do something. >> Biror kishiga remind qilish bu unga biror narsa qilishni eslashni aytish degani.

— Nick’s dad reminded him to do his homework.
— Nikning dadasi unga uy vazifasini qilishini eslatdi.

vision [vɪʒən] n. — ko'rish qobiliyati
▪️>> Vision is the act of seeing. >> Vision bu ko'rish harakati.

— The eye doctor tested my vision.
— Ko'z doktori ko'rish qobiliyatimni tekshirdi.

physics [fɪzɪks] n. — fizika
▪️>> Physics is a science that deals with energy and how it affects things. >> Physics bu energiya va u narsalarga qanday ta'sir qilishini o'rganadigan fan.

— In physics class, we used Newton’s Cradle to learn about energy.
— Fizika darsida biz Nyuton belanchagidan foydalanib, energiya haqida bilib oldik.

portion [pɔːrʃən] n. — qism, bo'lak
▪️>> A portion of something is a part of it. >> Biror narsaning portion i uning bir qismi degani.

— I only ate a small portion of the pizza.
— Men pitssaning ozgina qismini yeb qo'ydim.

thesis [θiːsɪs] n. — tezis
▪️>> A thesis is an idea that needs to be proved. >> A thesis bu isbotlanishi kerak bo'lgan fikr.

— She did not support her thesis very well.
— U tezisni unchalik yaxshi qo'llab-quvvatlamadi.

talent [tælənt] n. — iqtidor, talant 
▪️>> If someone has a talent, they are naturally able to do it well. >> Agar birortasida talent bo'lsa, u biror narsani tabiiy ravishda qila oladi.

— Maria has a talent for playing the piano.
— Mariyaning pianino chalish talanti bor.

greenhouse [griːnhaʊs] n. — issiqxona
▪️>> A greenhouse is a small glass building that is used to grow plants. >> A greenhouse o'simliklar o'stirish uchun ishlatiladigan kichik oynali bino.

— We have a small greenhouse in our backyard where we grow plants.
— Bizning hovlimizda kichik issiqxona bor, u erda biz o'simliklar ekamiz.

exhaust [ɪgˈzɔːst] v. — holdan toydirmoq, charchatmoq
▪️>> To exhaust someone is to make them tired. >> Birortasini exhaust qilish uni charchatish degani. 

— John exhausted himself by swimming all day.
— Jon kun bo'yi suzib o'zini charchatdi.

compose [kəmˈpəʊz] v. — tuzmoq, yaratmoq
▪️>> To compose something is to make it from smaller parts. >> Biror narsani compose qilish uni kichik qismlardan yasash degani. 

— Tonya composed her report using many sources of information.
— Tonya ko'plab ma'lumot manbalaridan foydalangan holda o'z hisobotini tuzdi.

dormitory [dɔːrmətɔ:rɪ] n. — yotoqxona
▪️>> A dormitory is a school building where students live. >> A dormitory o'quvchilar yashaydigan maktab binosi.

— I will move into the dormitory at the beginning of the school year.
— Men maktab o'quv yili boshlanganda yotoqxonaga ko'chaman.

uniform [juːnəfɔːrm] n. — forma, maxsus kiyim
▪️>> A uniform is a piece of clothing worn by people of the same group. >> A uniform bu bir guruh odamlari kiyadigan kiyim. 

— All the members of our marching band wear matching uniforms.
— Bizning yurish guruhimizning barcha a'zolari match formasini kiyadilar.

calculate [kælkjəleɪt] v. — hisoblamoq
▪️>> To calculate is to find an answer using math. >> To calculate matematik hisob-kitobni ishlatib javobni topish degani.

— I calculated how much money I would need to buy the car.
— Men yangi mashina sotib olish uchun qancha pul kerak bo'lishini hisobladim.
Unit 15:
foundation [faʊnˈdeɪʃən] n. — jamg'arma
▪️>> A foundation is a group that provides money for research. >> A foundation tadqiqotni pul bilan taminlaydigan guruh.

— The foundation raised money to give scholarships to students.
— Jamg'arma talabalarga stipendiya berish uchun pul yig'di.

dine [daɪn] v. — tushlik qilmoq
▪️>> To dine means to eat dinner. >> To dine tushlikni tanavvul qilmoq degani.

— The young couple dined at their home.
— Yosh juftlik uylarida tushlik qilishdi.

generation [dʒenəˈreɪʃən] n. — avlod 
▪️>> A generation is a group of people who live at the same time. >> A generation bir vaqtda yashaydigan odamlar guruhi.

— My grandparents are from a different generation than me.
— Mening bobom va buvim mendan boshqa avloddan.

boss [bɔ(:)s] n. — xo'jayin
▪️>> A boss is a person in charge of other people at work. >> A boss bu ishda boshqa odamlarni boshqaradigan odam.

— My boss is a nice person.
— Mening xo'jayinim yaxshi inson.

handle [hændl] n. — band, tutqich
▪️>> A handle is the part of an object people hold while using it. >> A handle bu odamlar uni ishlatganda ushlab turadigan, biror narsaning bir qismi.

— The pot is very hot. So pick it up by the handle.
— Idish juda issiq. Shuning uchun uni dastagidan ko'taring.

dig [dɪg] v. — yer kovlamoq
▪️>> To dig is to make a hole in the ground. >> To dig yerda kovak hosil qilmoq degani.

— My dog digs in the yard so he can hide his bones.
— Mening itim suyaklarini yashirish uchun hovlida qazadi.

soil [sɔɪl] n. — tuproq
▪️>> Soil is the top layer of land on the Earth. >> Soil Yerning ustki qatlami.

— The boy planted flowers in the soil and watered them every day.
— Bola tuproqqa gul ekdi va har kuni sug'ordi.

double [dʌbəl] adj. — ikki hissa
▪️>> If something is double, it is twice as much, or twice as many. >> Agar biror narsa double bo'lsa, u ikki karra ko'p bo'ladi. 

— I paid almost double the amount for that shirt.
— Men bu ko'ylak uchun qariyb ikki baravar ko'p pul to'ladim.

elevate [eləveɪt] v. — balandroqqa qo'ymoq
▪️>> To elevate something is to put it at a higher level. >> Biror narsani elevate qilish uni balandroq darajaga ko'tarish degani.

— The man elevated the picture so he could see it better.
— Haligi odam rasmni yaxshiroq ko'rish uchun uni balandroq qilib ko'rdi.

mud [mʌd] n. — loy
▪️>> Mud is soft, wet dirt. >> Mud yumshoq, ho'l tuproq.

— My brother played rugby in the mud. Now he’s dirty.
— Ukam loyda regbi o'ynadi. Endi u iflos.

committee [kəˈmɪtɪ] n. — qo'mita, komitet
▪️>> A committee is a group of people who meet together to make decisions. >> A committee qaror qabul qilish uchun yig'iladigan odamlar guruhi.

— The school’s committee agreed on a new dress code for students.
— Maktab qo'mitasi o'quvchilar uchun yangi kiyim kodini qabul qildi.

layer [leɪə:r] n. — qatlam, qat
▪️>> A layer covers over something or is between two things. >> A layer biror narsani qoplaydi yoki ikki narsaning o'rtasida bo'ladi.

— There was a layer of snow on the tops of the houses this morning.
— Bugun ertalab uylarning tepasida qor qatlami bor edi.

donate [douneit] v. — in'om qilmoq, hadya qilmoq
▪️>> To donate is to give something to a charity or organization. >> To donate bu xayriya yoki tashkilotga biror narsa berish.

— We donate money to Christmas charities every year.
— Biz har yili Yangi yil hayriyasiga pul hadya qilamiz.

flavor [fleivər] n. — ta'm, maza
▪️>> A flavor is the taste of food or drinks. >> A flavor taom yoki ichimliklarning ta'mi.

— The flavor of the ice cream was very good.
— Muzqaymoqning ta'mi juda yaxshi edi.

contract [kɒntrækt] n. — shartnoma
▪️>> A contract is a written agreement between two people. >> A contract ikki shaxs o'rtasidagi yozma kelishuv.

— The woman signed a contract when she bought the house.
— Haligi ayol uy sotib olganida shartnomani imzoladi.

unique [juːˈniːk] adj. — o'zgacha, g'ayrioddiy
▪️>> If people or things are unique, they are not like the others. >> Agar odamlar yoki narsalar unique bo'lsa, ular boshqalariga o'xshamaydi.

— Her dog is unique. I’ve never seen one quite like it.
— Uning iti o'zgacha. Men hech qachon shunga o'xshashini ko'rmaganman.

crew [kruː] n. — brigada
▪️>> A crew is a group of workers. >> A crew ishchilar guruhi.

— My father has a crew. They help him build houses.
— Otamning brigadasi bor. Ular otamga uy qurishga yordam beradi.

devote [dɪˈvəʊt] v. — bag'ishlamoq, sarf etmoq
▪️>> To devote time to something means to spend a lot of time doing it. >> Biror narsaga vaqtni devote qilish u narsaga ko'p vaqt sarflash degani.

— She devotes two hours a day to playing the piano.
— U pianino chalishga bir kunda ikki soat vaqt ajratadi.

absorb [əbˈzɔːrb] v. — so'rmoq, shimmoq
▪️>> To absorb a liquid means to take it inside. >> Suyuqlikni absorb qilish uni iste'mol qilish degani.

— He used a sponge to absorb the water on the floor.
— U yerdagi suvni shimish uchun shimgichdan foydalandi.

smooth [smuːð] a. — tekis
▪️>> If something is smooth, it has no bumps. >> Agar biror narsa smooth bo'lsa, uning shishgan joylari bo'lmaydi.

— The baby’s skin felt very smooth.
— Bolaning terisi juda silliq edi.
Unit 16:
fever [fiːvər] n. — isitma
▪️>> A fever is a high body temperature that people get when they are sick. >> A fever odam kasal bo'lganda sodir bo'ladigan tananing baland harorati.

— Lydia had a high fever so she didn’t go to school.
— Lindaning baland isitmasi bor edi, shuning uchun u maktabga bormadi.

last [læst] v. — davom etmoq 
▪️>> To last is to continue or go on for an amount of time. >> To last biror vaqt mobaynida davom etish degani.

— The football match lasted for nearly two hours.
— Futbol o'yini qariyb ikki soat davom etdi.

moreover [mɔːˈrəʊvər] adv. — bundan tashqari 
▪️>> Moreover means besides or in addition to something. >> Moreover biror narsadan tashqari yoki biror narsaga qo'shimcha ravishda degani.

— It’s cold outside. Moreover, the wind is very strong.
— Tashqari sovuq. Bundan tashqari, shamol juda kuchli.

stare [stɛə:r] v. — tikilmoq
▪️>> To stare at something is to look at it for a long time. >> Biror narsaga stare qilish unga uzoq vaqt qarab turish degani.

— The young couple stared into each other’s eyes.
— Yosh juftlik bir-birining ko'ziga tikilib turdi.

shy [ʃaɪ] adj. — uyatchan, tortinchoq
▪️>> When people are shy, they are nervous around people strange to them. >> Odamlar shy bo'lganda, ular begona odamlar oldida asabiylashadi.

— The girl was too shy to try out for the play.
— Qiz spektaklda rol o'ynab ko'rgani juda uyatchan edi.

rational [ræʃənl] adj. — idrokli, ongli
▪️>> When something is rational, it is normal or practical. >> Agar biror narsa rational bo'lsa, bu normal yoki amaliy bo'ladi. 

— It is hard to think in a rational way when you are scared.
— Qo'rqqaningizda aql bilan o'ylash qiyin.

emphasize [emfəsaɪz] v. — ta'kidlamoq 
▪️>> To emphasize is to give importance or attention to something. >> To emphasize biror narsaga ahamiyat berish yoki e'tibor berish.

— She emphasized the key points by circling them in red ink.
— U asosiy fikrlarni qizil siyoh bilan aylantirib ta'kidladi.

recover [rɪˈkʌvə:r] v. — qayta tiklanmoq
▪️>> To recover is to go back to normal after something bad happens. >> To recover biror yomon narsa sodir bo'lganidan so'ng yana normal holatga qaytish degani.

— I hope the city will recover soon after the flood.
— Umid qilamanki, shahar toshqindan keyin tez orada yana qayta tiklanadi.

freeze [fri:z] v. — sovuqdan qotib qolmoq
▪️>> To freeze is to become very cold. >> To freeze juda sovuq bo'lib ketish degani.

— If you don’t wear your coat in winter, you will freeze.
— Agar siz qishda palto kiymasangiz, muzlab qolasiz.

gesture [dʒestʃər] n. — imo-ishora
▪️>> A gesture is a movement of the hands or body. >> A gesture qo'llar yoki tana harakati.

— My teacher makes a lot of gestures when she speaks.
— O'qituvchim gapirganda ko'p ishoralar qiladi.

flu [flu:] n. — gripp
▪️>> The flu is a type of sickness that makes you feel weak or your body hurt. >> The flu bu kasallikning bir turi bo'lib, u sizni kuchsizlantiradi yoki tanangizni og'ritadi.

— Since he had the flu, he felt miserable.
— U grippga chalingani uchun o'zini g'amgin his qildi.

chamber [tʃeɪmbər] n. — yotoqxona 
▪️>> A chamber is an old word for a bedroom. >> A chamber yotoqxona uchun ishlatilgan eski so'z.

— The girl was tired. She went to her chamber for a nap.
— Qiz charchagan edi. U xonasiga uxlash uchun ketdi.

interrupt [ɪntəˈrʌpt] v. — bezovta qilmoq 
▪️>> To interrupt is to briefly stop someone when they are doing something. >> To interrupt bu kimdir biror narsa qilayotganda uni to'xtatish.

— My mother interrupted me when I was trying to listen to music.
— Musiqa tinglamoqchi bo'lganimda onam meni bezovta qildi.

perspective [pə:rspektɪv] n. — nuqtai nazar
▪️>> A perspective is the way you think about something. >> A perspective siz biror narsa haqida o'ylaydigan yo'l.

— The man’s speech gave me a new perspective on our country.
— Haligi odamning nutqi menga mamlakatimiz haqida yangi nuqtai nazar berdi.

shock [ʃɒk] v. — hayratda qoldirmoq
▪️>> To shock people is to surprise them. >> Odamlarni shock qilish ularni hayratlantirish qilish degani. 

— The man was shocked by the news.
— Haligi odam yangiliklardan hayratda qoldi.

deny [dɪˈnaɪ] v. — inkor qilmoq 
▪️>> To deny something is to say it is not true. >> Biror narsani deny qilish uning noto'g'ri ekanligini aytish degani.

— The boy denied that he broke the window.
— Haligi bola oynani sindirganini inkor qildi.

rely [rɪˈlaɪ] v. — suyanmoq, tayanmoq
▪️>> To rely on something or someone is to trust or depend on them. >> Biror narsaga yoki birortasiga rely qilish unga ishonish yoki unga tayanish degani.

— The boy relied on his older brother to help him.
— Haligi bola unga yordam berishida akasiga tayandi.

document [dokjəmənt] n. — hujjat
▪️>> A document is an official piece of writing. >> A document rasmiy yozuvdir.

— He was given an official document proving he was a citizen.
— Unga fuqaroligini tasdiqlovchi rasmiy hujjat topshirildi.

thus [ðʌs] adv. — shuning uchun 
▪️>> Thus means as a result or for that reason. >> Thus shuning uchun degan ma'noni bildiradi. 

— The sun was shining. Thus, I wore my sunglasses.
— Quyosh charaqlayotgan edi. Shuning uchun men ko'zoynagimni taqdim.

likeness [laɪknɪs] n. — o'xshashlik
▪️>> Likeness means the state of being like, or resemblance. >> Likeness o'xshashlik holatini bildiradi.

— Michelle bears a strong likeness to her older sister Kate.
— Mishel opasi Keytga juda o'xshaydi.
Unit 17:
junior [dʒuːnjər] adj. — kichik mansabli
▪️>> If someone is junior in their job, they do not have a lot of power. >> Agar birortasi ishida junior bo'lsa, u ko'p qudratga ega emas.

— When she started at the company, she was only a junior manager.
— U kompaniyada ish boshlaganida, kichik menejer edi xolos.

shift [ʃɪft] v. — joyini o'zgartirmoq
▪️>> To shift to something is to move into a new place or direction. >> Biror narsaga shift qilish bu yangi joyga yoki yo'nalishga o'tish.

— He shifted to the other side of the table to eat his breakfast.
— U nonushtasini yeyish uchun stolning narigi tarafiga o'tdi.

height [haɪt] n. — bo'y
▪️>> Height is how tall someone or something is. >> Height birortasi yoki biror narsa qanchalik balandligi.

— My height is 168 centimeters.
— Mening bo'yim 168 santimetr.

mechanic [məˈkænɪk] n. — mexanik
▪️>> A mechanic is someone who fixes vehicles or machines. >> A mechanic mashina yoki transportlarni tuzatadigan shaxs.

— We took the car to the mechanic to be fixed.
— Biz mashinani mexanikka tuzatgani olib bordik.

formal [fɔːrməl] adj. — rasmiy 
▪️>> If something is formal, it is done in an official way. >> Agar biror narsa formal bo'lsa, u rasmiy tarzda qilingan bo'ladi. 

— It was a formal dinner, so we wore our best clothes.
— Bu rasmiy kechki ovqat edi, shuning uchun biz eng yaxshi kiyimimizni kiydik.

labor [leɪbər] n. — mehnat
▪️>> Labor is the act of doing or making something. >> Labor biror narsani bajarish yoki yasash harakati.

— Building the house took a lot of labor.
— Uy qurish ko'p mehnat talab qiladi.

signal [signəl] n. — signal, belgi
▪️>> A signal is a sound or action that tells someone to do something. >> A signal birortasiga biror narsa qilishni aytadigan ovoz yoki harakat.

— The coach blew his whistle as a signal to begin the game.
— Murabbiy o'yinni boshlash uchun signal sifatida hushtak chaldi.

criticize [krɪtɪsaɪz] v. — tanqid qilmoq
▪️>> To criticize is to say you do not like someone or something. >> To criticize birortasi yoki biror narsani yomon ko'rishingizni aytish.

— He criticized his wife for spending too much money.
— U xotinining juda ko'p pul sarflaganini tanqid qildi.

carriage [kærɪdʒ] n. — ot arava 
▪️>> A carriage is a vehicle pulled by a horse. >> A carriage ot bilan tortiladigan transport.

— We took a carriage ride in the park.
— Biz bog'da ot aravada sayohat qildik.

classic [klæsɪk] adj. — odatiy 
▪️>> If something is classic, it is typical. >> Agar biror narsa classic bo'lsa, u odatiy bo'ladi. 

— The athlete made a classic mistake - he started running too soon.
