— Sportchi odatiy xato qildi - u juda kech yugurishni boshladi.

commute [kəˈmjuːt] v. — ishgacha uzoq yo'l yurmoq
▪️>> To commute is to travel a long distance to get to work. >> To commute ishga borish uchun uzoq yo'l yurish degani.

— I usually commute to work on the train.
— Men odatda ishga poezdda boraman.

sincere [sɪnˈsɪər] adj. — samimiy 
▪️>> When people are sincere, they tell the truth. >> Qachonki odamlar sincere bo'lsa, ular rostini aytishadi.

— He sounded sincere when he apologized to me.
— U mendan kechirim so'raganda samimiy tuyilgan edi.

prime [praɪm] adj. — eng asosiy, bosh
▪️>> If something is prime, it is the most important one. >> Agar biror narsa prime bo'lsa, u muhim narsalardan biri bo'ladi. 

— Dirty air is a prime cause of illness.
— Iflos havo kasallikning asosiy sababi hisoblanadi.

invent [ɪnˈvent] v. — ixtiro qilmoq 
▪️>> To invent something is to create something that never existed before. >> Biror narsani invent qilish avval mavjud bo'lmagan narsani yaratish degani.

— My grandfather has invented some interesting things.
— Mening bobom ba'zi narsalar ixtiro qilgan.

differ [dɪfər] v. — farq qilmoq, o'xshamaslik
▪️>> To differ is to not be the same as another person or thing. >> To differ birorta boshqa narsa yoki shaxs kabi bir xil bo'lmaslik.

— I differ from my brother: he is short, while I am tall.
— Men akamdan farq qilaman: u kalta, men esa uzunman.

expense [ɪksˈpens] n. — chiqim, xarajat
▪️>> An expense is the money that people spend on something. >> An expense odamlar biror narsaga sarflaydigan pul.

— She wrote down all the expenses for her trip.
— U sayohati uchun barcha chiqimlarni yozib oldi.

confirm [kənˈfəːrm] v. — tasdiqlamoq 
▪️>> To confirm is to make sure something is correct. >> To confirm biror narsa to'g'riligiga ishonch hosil qilish degani.

— Winning the game confirmed that James was a good player.
— O'yindagi g'alaba Jeyms yaxshi o'yinchi ekanligini tasdiqladi.

attach [əˈtætʃ] v. — mahkamlamoq
▪️>> To attach is to put two things together. >> To attach bu ikkita narsani birlashtirish degani.

— I attached the socks to the clothesline to dry.
— Quritish uchun paypoqlarni dorga ildim.

aim [eim] n. — maqsad
▪️>> An aim is a goal someone wants to make happen. >> An aim bu kimdir amalga oshirmoqchi bo'lgan maqsad.

— My aim is to become a helicopter pilot.
— Mening maqsadim vertolyot uchuvchisi bo'lish.

bet [bet] v. — pul tikmoq
▪️>> To bet is to risk money on the result of a game or a business. >> To bet bu o'yin yoki biznes natijasi uchun tavakkal qilib pul tikish.

— How much will you bet that your horse will win?
— Sizning otingiz g'alaba qozonishiga qancha pul tikasiz?
Unit 18:
label [leɪbəl] n. — etiketka, yorliq
▪️>> A label is a tag that tells about something. >> A label bu biror narsa haqida gapiradigan belgi.

— The label on the back of your shirt will tell you what size it is.
— Ko'ylagingizning orqa qismidagi yorliq sizga uning o'lchamini ko'rsatadi.

diary [daɪərɪ] n. — kundalik
▪️>> A diary is a book in which people write their personal experiences. >> A diary odamlar shaxsiy kechinmalarini yosib boradigan kitob.

— I do not let anybody read my diary.
— Men hech kimni kundaligimni o'qishiga qo'ymayman.

ceiling [siːlɪŋ] n. — shift, patalok 
▪️>> The ceiling is the top of a room. >> The ceiling bu xonaning yuqori qismi.

— He painted the ceiling with a special roller.
— U shiftni maxsus rolik bilan bo'yadi.

faith [feɪθ] n. — ishonch 
▪️>> When people have faith in something, they believe in it and trust it. >> Qachonki odamlarda biror narsaga nisbatan faith bo'lsa, ular u narsaga ishonishadi.

— The sick girl had faith in doctors. She knew they would make her better.
— Kasal qizning doktorlarga ishonchi bor edi. U doktorlar uni tuzatishlarini bilar edi.

grain [greɪn] n. — don
▪️>> Grain is food crops such as wheat, corn, rice or oats. >> Grain bug'doy, makkajo'xori, guruch yoki jo'xori kabi oziq-ovqat ekinlari.

— The farmer planted two fields of grain this year.
— Fermer bu yil ikkita dalaga don-dun ekdi.

monk [mʌŋk] n. — rohib
▪️>> A monk is a religious person who lives a simple life. >> A monk oddiy hayot kechiradigan diniy odam.

— The monks knew a lot about religion.
— Haligi rohiblar din haqida ko'p narsa bilishar edi.

cartoon [kɑːrˈtuːn] n. — multfilm
▪️>> A cartoon is a funny drawing. >> A cartoon bu kulgili chizma, rasm.

— Sometimes, people draw cartoons for the newspaper.
— Ba'zida odamlar gazeta uchun multfilmlar chizishadi.

convince [kənˈvɪns] v. — ishontirmoq
▪️>> To convince someone means to make them sure of something. >> Birortasini convince qilish unga biror narsaga ishonch hosil qilish degani.

— She convinced me to buy the house.
— U meni uy sotib olishga ishontirdi.

odd [ɒd] adj. — g'alati, g'ayrioddiy 
▪️>> When something is odd, it is unusual. >> Qachonki biror narsa odd bo'lsa, u noodatiy bo'ladi. 

— Her cat is odd. It walks on two feet.
— Uning mushugi g'ayrioddiy. U ikki oyoqda yuradi.

joy [dʒɔɪ] n. — shodlik, hursandchilik
▪️>> Joy is a feeling you get when you are really happy. >> Joy siz haqiqatdan hursand bo'lganingizda his qiladigan tuyg'u.

— I love baseball. I feel joy when I play.
— Men beyzbolni yaxshi ko'raman. O'ynaganimda shodlikni his qilaman.

curious [kjʊərɪəs] adj. — qiziquvchan, qiziqqon
▪️>> When you are curious about something, you want to know more about it. >> Qachonki siz biror narsa haqida curious bo'lsangiz, siz u haqida ko'proq bilgingiz keladi.

— I opened up the clock because I was curious about how it worked.
— Men soatni ochdim, chunki u qanday ishlashini qiziqtirgan edim.

profession [prəˈfeʃən] n. — kasb
▪️>> A profession is a person’s job. >> A profession biror shaxsning kasbi, ishi.

— He loved sailing, so he chose to work on ships as a profession.
— U suzishni yaxshi ko'rar edi, shuning uchun u kemada ishlashni kasb sifatida tanladi.

agriculture [ægrɪkʌltʃər] n. — qishloq xo'jaligi
▪️>> Agriculture is the growing of food and animals. >> Agriculture bu oziq-ovqat va hayvonlarning o'sishi.

— The farmer studied agriculture in college.
— Fermer kollejda qishloq xo'jaligini o'rgandi.

delay [dɪˈleɪ] v. — qoldirmoq, kechiktirmoq
▪️>> To delay means to wait to do something. >> To delay biror narsa qilishni kutish degani.

— I was delayed at the airport for over two hours.
— Men aeroportda ikki soatdan ko'proq kechikdim.

ability [əˈbiləti] n. — qobiliyat, iste'dod
▪️>> Ability is the quality of a person being able to do something well. >> Ability bu odamning biror narsani yaxshi bajarishga qodirligi.

— His swimming abilities let him cross the entire lake.
— Uning suzish qobiliyati unga butun ko'ldan o'tishga imkon berdi.

element [eləmənt] n. — element, tarkibiy qism
▪️>> An element of something is a particular part of it. >> Biror narsaning element'i uning o'ziga xos qismi.

— Tackling an opponent is Johnny’s favorite element of American footbal.
— Raqib bilan kurashish - Jonning amerika futbolidagi sevimli elementi.

investigate [ɪnˈvestəgeɪt] v. —  o'rganib chiqmoq
▪️>> To investigate means to search for something or learn about it. >> To investigate biror narsani qidirish yoki u haqida o'rganish degani.

— The detective went to investigate the crime.
— Detektiv jinoyatni o'rganib chiqishga ketdi.

pause [pɔːz] v. — to'xtatmoq 
▪️>> To pause means to stop doing something for a while. >> To pause biror narsa qilishni bir lahza to'xtatishni anglatadi.

— Since she was so hungry, she paused to make a snack.
— U juda och bo'lgani uchun, ovqat tayyorlash uchun to'xtadi.

greet [griːt] v. — salomlashmoq
▪️>> To greet someone means to meet and welcome them. >> Birortasi bilan greet qilish, uni kutib olishni anglatadi.

— When my friend came over, I greeted him at the door.
— Do'stim kelganida, men uni eshik oldida kutib oldim.

priest [priːst] n. — ruhoniy 
▪️>> A priest is a person trained to perform religious duties. >> A priest diniy vazifalarni bajarishga o'rgatilgan odam.

— The priest taught us about God.
— Ruhoniy bizga Xudoni o'rgatdi.
Unit 19:
adopt [əˈdɒpt] v. — farzandlikka olmoq
▪️>> To adopt someone is to make them as a part of one’s own family. >> Birortasini adopt qilish uni o'z oila a'zosi sifatida qabul qilish degani.

— The girl was adopted by the couple when she was three.
— Haligi qiz uch yoshligida bir juftlik tomonidan farzandlikka olingan.

silence [saɪləns] n. — jimlik, sukunat 
▪️>> Silence is complete quiet. >> Silence mutlaq jimlik.

— The man asked for silence while he worked on the problem.
— Haligi kishi muammo ustida ishlayotganda jimlik saqlashni so'radi.

origin [ɒrədʒɪn] n. — kelib chiqish
▪️>> The origin of someone or something is where they come from. >> Birortasi yoki biror narsaning origin'i ularning qayerdan kelib chiqqani.

— The origin of the honey that we eat is from a beehive.
— Biz yeyayotgan asalning kelib chiqishi asalari uyasi.

fool [fuːl] n. — ahmoq, esi past
▪️>> A fool is someone who makes unwise choices. >> A fool aqlsiz tanlovlar qiladigan shaxs.

— The girl was a fool for playing too close to the water.
— Qiz suvga juda yaqin o'ynagani uchun ahmoq edi.

beg [beg] v. — sadaqa so'ramoq
▪️>> To beg is to ask for something one really wants. >> To beg bu haqiqatdan ham xohlagan narsani so'rash.

— The man begged for some money.
— Haligi kishi biroz pul so'radi.

stream [striːm] n. — daryocha
▪️>> A stream is a small river. >> A stream bu kichik daryo.

— The boy caught a fish in the stream.
— Haligi bola daryochadan baliq ovladi.

reception [rɪˈsepʃən] n. — to'y marosimi
▪️>> A reception is a party to welcome a person or celebrate an event. >> A reception birortasini kutib olish yoki biror voqeani nishonlash bazmi. 

— We all danced and had a good time at the wedding reception.
— Biz hammamiz to'y marosimida raqsga tushdik va yaxshi vaqt o'tkazdik.

tone [təʊn] n. — ovoz, ton
▪️>> Tone is the sound of someone’s voice. It shows how they feel. >> Tone birortasining ovozi. Bu ular qanday o'zini his qilishini ko'rsatadi.

— My father’s tone told me I had broken the rule.
— Otamning ohangi menga qoidani buzganimni aytdi.

motive [moutiv] n. — sabab
▪️>> A motive is the reason someone does something. >> A motive bu kimdir nimadir qilishining sababidir.

— His motive for studying so hard is to get into a good college.
— Uning qattiq o'qish maqsadi - yaxshi kollejga kirish.

exclaim [ɪksˈkleɪm] v. — xitob qilmoq
▪️>> To exclaim is to say something loudly, usually due to being excited. >> To exclaim odatda hursand bo'lganda, biror narsani baland ovozda aytish.

— “Look at her dress!” Sara exclaimed.
— "Uning ko'ylagini qara!" deb Sara xitob qildi.

reject [rɪˈdʒekt] v. — rad etmoq 
▪️>> To reject is to refuse something because you do not want it. >> To reject siz biror narsani xohlamaganingiz uchun undan bosh tortish degani.

— The girl rejected the broken cup.
— Haligi qiz siniq stakanni rad etdi.

beyond [bɪˈjɒnd] prep. — narigi tarafida
▪️>> If A is beyond B, A is farther away. >> Agar A B ning beyond tarafida bo'lsa, A uzoqroqda joylashgan bo'ladi.

— John’s house is beyond that lake.
— Jonning uyi haligi ko'lning yonida.

illustrate [ɪləstreɪt] v. — ko'rsatmoq
▪️>> To illustrate is to show something by drawing a picture. >> To illustrate rasm chizish orqali biror narsani ko'rsatish degani.

— The executive illustrated the decreasing profits of the company.
— Ijrochi kompaniyaning daromadlari kamayishini tasvirlab berdi.

extend [ɪksˈtend] v. — qo'l cho'zmoq
▪️>> To extend is to stretch out or reach. >> To extend bu cho'zish degani.

— The boy extended his hand to catch the ball.
— Haligi bola ko'ptokni ushlab olish uchun qo'lini cho'zdi.

costume [kɒstjuːm] n. — kiyim 
▪️>> A costume is a set of clothes people wear for a particular occasion. >> A costume bu odamlar ma'lum bir kun uchun kiyadigan kiyimlar to'plami.

— The woman wore a mask with her costume.
— Haligi ayol kostyumi bilan niqob taqib olgan edi.

nest [nest] n. — uya, in
▪️>> A nest is a place where a bird lays its eggs. >> A nest bu qush tuxum qo'yadigan joy.

— The bird laid her eggs in the nest that she made.
— Qush tuxumlarini uyaga qo'ydi.

interpret [inˈtəːrprit] v. — izohlamoq, tushuntirib bermoq
▪️>> To interpret is to explain what something means. >> To interpret biror narsa nimani anglatishini tushuntirish.

— The woman interpreted what her co-worker was trying to say.
— Ayol hamkasbi aytmoqchi bo'lgan narsani tushuntirib berdi.

forbid [fəˈbɪd] v. — taqiqlamoq
▪️>> To forbid is to tell someone they cannot do something. >> To forbid birortasiga biror narsa qila olmasligini aytish.

— My father forbids watching TV while we’re eating dinner.
— Otam tushlik qilayotganimizda televizor ko'rishni taqiqlaydi.

kindly [kaɪndlɪ] adv. — muloyimlik bilan
▪️>> If people do something kindly, they do it in a nice way. >> Agar odamlar biror narsani kindly qilsa, ular bu ishni yaxshi yo'l bilan qiladi.

— The stranger kindly cared for the hurt man.
— Notanish odam zarar ko'rgan kishiga mehr bilan g'amxo'rlik qildi.

indeed [ɪnˈdiːd] adv. — haqiqatan
▪️>> Indeed means truly or really. >> Indeed rostdan ham yoki haqiqatan ham degan ma'noni anglatadi.

— The birthday party was indeed fun last night.
— Kecha tug'ilgan kun haqiqatan ham qiziqarli o'tdi.

▪️>> To insert something means to put it in something else. >> Biror narsani insert qilish uni boshqa biror narsaning ichiga qo'yish degani.

poverty [pɒvətɪ] n. — qashshoqlik

rent [rent] n. — ijara haqi

refrigerate [rɪˈfrɪdʒəreɪt] v. — muzlatgichda saqlamoq
▪️>> To refrigerate something means to make it cold. >> Biror narsani refrigerate qilish uni sovutish degani.

— Grocery stores refrigerate fruit to make it last long.

failure [feɪljər] n. — muvaffaqiyatsizlik
▪️>> A failure happens when you do not do something right. >> A failure siz biror narsani to'g'ri bajarmaganingizda sodir bo'ladi.

accomplish [əˈkʌmplɪʃ] v. — bajarmoq, ado etmoq
▪️>> To accomplish something means to finish it. >> Biror narsani accomplish qilish uni tugatish degani.

— He accomplished his goal of running ten miles.

gradual [grædjʊəl] adj. — bosqichma-bosqich, asta-sekin
▪️>> When something is gradual, it happens slowly. >> Qachonki biror narsa gradual bo'lsa, u sekin sodir bo'ladi. 

— Children learn to read at a gradual pace. They do not learn right away.

detect [dɪˈtekt] v. — sezmoq, bilib qolmoq
▪️>> To detect something means to notice or find something. >> Biror narsani detect qilish biror narsani payqash yoki sezish degani.

— The boy ran to the kitchen when he detected the smell of cookies.
— Haligi bola pechenyelarning hidini sezganidan so'ng oshxonaga yugurdi.

approve [əˈpruːv] v. — yoqtirmoq, to'g'ri deb qabul qilmoq 
▪️>> To approve of something means you like it or are happy about it. >> Biror narsani approve qilish siz uni yaxshi ko'rishingizni yoki u haqida hursand ekanligingizni bildiradi.

— Her co-workers approved her new plan.
— Uning hamkasblari uning yangi rejasini to'g'ri deb qabul qilishdi.

elementary [əlɪˈmentərɪ] adj. — boshlang'ich
▪️>> When something is elementary, it is the first or most simple thing. >> Agar biror narsa elementary bo'lsa, u birinchi yoki juda oddiy narsa.

— Children go to elementary school before high school.
— Bolalar katta maktabga borishdan avval boshlang'ich maktabga borishadi.

rank [ræŋk] n. — martaba, unvon 
▪️>> A person’s rank is their place in an order of people. >> Insonning rank'i bu odamlarning tartibidagi o'rni.

— The man got to the rank of captain in the navy.
— Haligi odam dengiz flotida kapitan unvonini olgan.

approximate [əˈprɒksəmɪt] adj. — deyarli to'g'ri, taxminiy
▪️>> Approximate means to be close to an exact amount, number or time. >> Approximate aniq miqdor, raqam yoki vaqtga yaqin bo'lishni anglatadi.

— My approximate height is two meters.
— Mening taxminiy balandligim ikki metr.

retire [rɪˈtaɪər] v. — iste'foga chiqmoq
▪️>> To retire is to leave a job, usually because of old age. >> To retire asosan yoshi katta bo'lganligi sababli ishni tark etish.

— My father is sixty-five years old. He is about to retire from work.
— Mening dadam 65 yoshda. U ishdan nafaqaga chiqish arafasida.

recognition [rekəgˈnɪʃən] n. — hurmat
▪️>> Recognition is getting praise from other people. >> Recognition boshqa odamning hurmatiga ega bo'lish.

— The hero got recognition for his brave deed.
— Qahramon jasorati uchun hurmat qilindi.

pretend [prɪˈtend] v. — dek tutmoq
▪️>> To pretend means to make believe something is real. >> To pretend biror narsaning haqiqiy ekanligiga ishontirishni anglatadi.

— The boy liked to pretend he was a king.
— Bola o'zini shohdek tutishni yaxshi ko'rardi.

immigrant [ɪmɪgrənt] n. — imigrant 
▪️>> An immigrant is a person who moves to a different country. >> An immigrant boshqa davlatga boradigan shaxs.

— My parents were immigrants. They came from Poland.
— Mening ota-onam imigrant. Ular Polshadan kelgan.

instant [ɪnstənt] n. — on, lahza

— A microwave oven cooks food in an instant.

statistic [stəˈtɪstɪk] n. — statistika
▪️>> A statistic is a number that tells a fact about something. >> A statistic biror narsa haqida fakt aytadigan raqam.

— The statistics showed that we did just as well this year as last year.

barrier [bærɪər] n. — to'siq, g'ov
▪️>> A barrier is something that is in your way. >> A barrier yo'lingizdagi biror narsa.

duty [djuːtɪ] n. — burch, vazifa
▪️>> A duty is something that a person has to do. >> A duty biror shaxs qilishi shart bo'lgan narsa. 

— It is parents’ duty to take care of their children.
— Farzandlariga g'amxo'rlik qilish ota-onalarning burchidir.

raw [rɔː] adj. — xom, pishmagan

participate [pɑ:rtɪsəpeɪt] v. — ishtirok etmoq

jewel [dʒuːəl] n. — qimmatbaho tosh

awake [əˈweɪk] adj. — uyg'oq
▪️>> When you are awake, you are not asleep. >> Qachonki siz awake bo'lsangiz, siz uxlamayotgan bo'lasiz.

grant [grænt] v. — bermoq
▪️>> To grant something is to allow someone to have it. >> Biror narsani grant qilish uni olishga ruxsat berish degani.

underground [ʌndəgraʊnd] adv. — yer ostida
▪️>> When something is underground, it is below the surface of the Earth. >> Qachonki biror narsa underground bo'lsa, u Yer yuzasidan pastda bo'ladi.

courage [kə:rɪdʒ] n. — dovyuraklik, botirlik
▪️>> When you have courage, you are not afraid. >> Qachonki sizda courage bo'lsa, siz qo'rqmaysiz.

— The man had the courage to touch the lion.

astronaut [æstrənɔːt] n. — astronavt 
▪️>> An astronaut is a person that goes into outer space. >> An astronaut fazoga chiqadigan shaxs.

— The astronaut was walking on the moon.

permission [pə:rmɪʃən] n. — ruxsat
▪️>> Permission means the act of allowing the doing of something. >> Permission biror narsa qilish uchun ruxsat berishni anglatadi.

miner [maɪnər] n. — konchi, shaxtyor
▪️>> A miner is a person who works in a mine. >> A miner konda ishlaydigan shaxs.

gravity [grӕvəti] n. — gravitatsiya
▪️>> Gravity is the force that makes things fall to Earth. >> Gravity Yerga tortuvchi kuch.

— There is no gravity in space.

telescope [tɛləskoʊp] n. — teleskop
▪️>> A telescope is a tool people use to look at the stars. >> A telescope odamlar yulduzlarni kuzatish uchun ishlatadigan asbob.

— With a telescope, you can see the moon and stars easily.
— Siz teleskop bilan oy va yulduzlarni osongina ko'ra olasiz.

skip [skɪp] v. — bajarmaslik, qilmaslik
▪️>> To skip something is to not do it. >> Biror narsani skip qilish uni qilmaslik degani.

presence [prɛzəns] n. — bor bo'lish, mavjudlik

— The presence of dark clouds meant it would rain.

pour [pɔːr] — quymoq
▪️>> To pour a liquid means to make it come out of a container. >> Suyuqlikni pour qilish uni idishdan chiqarib yuborish degani.

— I poured some milk into my sister’s cup.

scale [skeɪl] n. — kattalik, ko'lam

— I was surprised by the scale of the buildings in the downtown area.

mineral [mɪnərəl] n. — mineral

bucket [bʌkɪt] n. — chelak, paqir
▪️>> A bucket is a round container to put things in. >> A bucket bu narsalarni solish uchun dumaloq idish.

somewhat [sʌmwɒt] adv. — bir oz, andak
▪️>> Somewhat means to some degree, but not to a large degree. >> Somewhat ma'lum darajada, lekin katta darajada emas degani.

rob [rɒb] v. — o'g'irlamoq

— A thief has robbed me of my passport.

breed [briːd] n. — zot, nasl

pup [pʌp] n. — kuchuk

— All the girl wanted for her birthday was a pup.

arrest [əˈrest] v. — hibsga olmoq
▪️>> To arrest someone means to catch them for doing something bad. >> Birortasini arrest qilish uni biror yomon qilgan ishi uchun ushlashni anglatadi.

— The man was arrested for breaking the law.
— Haligi kishi qonunni buzganligi uchun hibsga olindi.

contest [kɒntest] n. — musobaqa
▪️>> A contest is a game or a race. >> A contest bu o'yin yoki poyga.

— The girls had a contest to see who could jump higher.

tissue [tɪʃuː] n. — salfetka

— There was a box of tissue on the table.
— Stol ustida salfetka qutisi bor edi.

slip [slɪp] v. — sirpanib ketmoq
▪️>> To slip means to slide and fall down. >> To slip - sirg'anib yiqilish degani.

— The man slipped on the wet floor.

repair [rɪˈpɛə:r] v. — ta'mirlamoq, tuzatmoq
▪️>> To repair something is to fix it. >> Biror narsani repair qilish uni tuzatish degani.

— I repaired the flat tire on my car.

yard [jɑːrd] n. — ochiq maydoncha

— The girls jumped rope in the yard.

qualify [kwɒləfaɪ] v. — keyingi bosqichga o'tmoq
▪️>> To qualify is to get, or to be declared, adequate or good enough. >> To qualify bu yetarlicha yaxshi bo'lish.

— He qualified to go to the final match by beating the opponent.

convict [kənˈvikt] v. — hukm qilmoq

— He was convicted of the crime and sent to jail.

apart [əˈpɑːrt] adv. — alohida
▪️>> When people or things are apart, they are not close together. >> Qachonki odamlar yoki narsalar apart bo'lsa, ular bir-biriga yaqin emas.

— The couple decided to live apart from each other.
— Haligi juftlik bir-biridan alohida yashashga qaror qilishdi.

resume [rɪˈzuːm] v. — davom ettirmoq

— I put the newspaper down to eat breakfast. Then I resumed reading.

stable [steɪbl] adj. — mustahkam
▪️>> When something is stable, it will not fall over. >> Agar biror narsa stable bo'lsa, u qulab tushmaydi.

▪️>> A chain is a series of connected loops often used to keep things in place. >> A chain bu odatda narsalarni joyida ushlab turish uchun ishlatiladigan bir-biriga bog'langan halqalar.

— Qo'rqinchli it zanjir bilan mahkamlangan edi.

dust [dʌst] n. — chang 
▪️>> Dust is very tiny pieces of dirt or other matter. >> Dust bu kir yoki boshqa narsalarning juda mayda bo'laklari.

— In the old house, the dust was thick on the floor and chairs.
— Eski uyda pol va stullarning ustidagi chang qalin edi.

alike [əˈlaɪk] adj. — o'xshash
▪️>> If two things or people are alike, they are similar in some way. >> Agar narsalar yoki odamlar alike bo'lsa, ular o'xshash bo'ladi. 

— People often think my sister and I look alike.
— Odamlar ko'pincha opam va meni o'xshash ko'rinadi deb o'ylashadi.

architecture [ɑːrkətektʃər] n. — arxitektura
▪️>> Architecture is the style or way a building is made. >> Architecture qurilish uslubi yoki usuli.

— The architecture of the church is amazing.
— Haligi cherkovning arxitekturasi ajoyib edi.

mount [maʊnt] v. — ko'paymoq, ortib ketmoq
▪️>> Something mounts when it becomes stronger over time. >> Qachonki biror narsa vaqt o'tishi bilan kuchaysa u mount bo'lgan bo'ladi.

— His fear mounted as the monster crawled out from under his bed.
— Yirtqich karavot ostidan sudralib chiqqach, uning qo'rquvi avj oldi.

stock [stɒk] n. — zahira 
▪️>> A stock is a stored amount of something. >> A stock bu biror narsaning saqlanadigan miqdori.

— They keep a stock of rice so they’ll always have something to eat.
— Ular guruch zaxirasini saqlaydilar, shuning uchun ularning har doim yeyishga biror narsasi bor.

substance [sʌbstəns] n. — modda
▪️>> A substance is any specific material or mixture of materials. >> A substance bu har qanday o'ziga xos material yoki materiallar aralashmasi.

— Water is an important substance for all living things.
— Suv barcha tirik mavjudotlar uchun muhim moddadir.

artificial [ɑːrtəˈfɪʃəl] adj. — sun'iy, yasama
▪️>> If something is artificial, it is made to look like something natural. >> Agar biror narsa artificial bo'lsa, u biror tabiiy narsaga o'xshatib yasalgan bo'ladi. 

— That soccer field has artificial grass, but it looks real.
— Haligi futbol maydonida sun'iy o't bor, lekin u haqiqiydek ko'rinadi.

excitement [ɪkˈsaɪtmənt] n. — hursandchilik 
▪️>> Excitement means to feel a lot of happiness about something. >> Excitement biror narsa haqida juda ko'p hursandchilikni his qilishni anglatadi. 

— Did you see the excitement in her when the team scored?
— Jamoa gol urganida uning hursandchiligini ko'rdingizmi?

roof [ruːf] n. — tom
▪️>> A roof is the outside top part of a building. >> A roof binoning tashqi tepagi qismi.

— The roof was covered with snow.
— Tom qor bilan qoplangan edi.

solid [sɒlɪd] adj. — qattiq
▪️>> If something is solid, it is made of firm material. >> Agar biror narsa solid bo'lsa, u qattiq materialdan qilingan bo'ladi. 

— The safe looked to be quite solid.
— Seyf juda mustahkam ko'rinardi.

shortage [ʃɔːrtɪdʒ] n. — tanqislik
▪️>> A shortage is a lack of something you need or want. >> A shortage sizga kerak bo'lgan yoki siz xohlagan biror narsaning yetishmasligi.

— Since there was a shortage of food, people were hungry.
— Oziq-ovqat tanqisligi sababli odamlar och edi.

inherit [ɪnˈherɪt] v. — meros qilib olmoq
▪️>> To inherit is to get something from someone who has died. >> To inherit birorta o'lgan insondan biror narsani meros qilib olish degani.

— She inherited her mother’s gold earrings.
— U onasining oltin sirg'alarini meros qilib oldi.

wound [wuːnd] n. — jarohat, yara
▪️>> A wound is an injury to the body. >> A wound badanga yetkazilgan jarohat.

— He had many wounds after the car accident.
— U avtohalokatdan keyin ko'p jarohat olgan.

manner [mænə:r] n. — o'zini tutish tarzi
▪️>> A manner is the way someone does something. >> A manner birortasining biror narsa qilish yo'li.

— His manner of not looking at someone while speaking, is a bit rude.
— Uning gapirayotganda kimgadir qaramaslik uslubi biroz qo'pol.

annoy [əˈnɔɪ] v. — achchiqlantirmoq, jonga tegmoq
▪️>> To annoy someone means to bother them. >> Birortasini annoy qilish uni bezovta qilish degani.

— The flies buzzing around John’s head annoyed him very much.
— Jonning boshi atrofidagi pashshalar uni g'azablantirdi.

distinct [dɪsˈtɪŋkt] adj. — farqli
▪️>> If something is distinct, it is easily noticed or different from other things. >> Agar biror narsa distinct bo'lsa, u oson payqaladi yoki boshqa narsalardan o'zgacha bo'ladi. 

— That girl has distinct pink hair.
— Haligi qiz farqli pushti sochga ega edi.

heal [hiːl] v. — tuzalmoq
▪️>> To heal means to make a part of the body healthy again after injury. >> To heal tananing biror qismining jarohatdan so'ng yana sog'ayishiga aytiladi.

— After my broken arm heals, I can play baseball again.
— Singan qo'lim sog'ayganidan so'ng men yana beysbol o'ynay olaman.

distinguish [dɪsˈtɪŋgwɪʃ] v. — ajratmoq, farqiga bormoq
▪️>> To distinguish is to recognize differences between things. >> To distinguish narsalar orasidagi farqni anglash degani.

— The twins look exactly the same. It is hard to distinguish between them.
— Egizaklar juda bir xil ko'rinadi. Ularning farqiga borish juda qiyin.
Unit 24:
sufficient [səˈfɪʃənt] adj. — yetarli
▪️>> When something is sufficient, you have enough of it. >> Qachonki biror narsa sufficient bo'lsa, u yetarli bo'ladi.

— After eating a sufficient amount of food, I left the table.
— Ovqatning yetarli miqdorini yegandan so'ng men stolni tark etdim.

journal [dʒəːrnəl] n. — jurnal
▪️>> A journal is a type of magazine that deals with an academic subject. >> A journal bu ilmiy mavzuga bag'ishlangan jurnal turi.

— Mi-young was busy working on an article for an art journal.
— Mi-Young badiiy jurnal uchun maqola ustida ishlash bilan band edi.

regret [rɪˈgret] v. — afsuslanmoq, pushaymon qilmoq
▪️>> To regret something is to wish that it didn’t happen. >> Biror narsaga regret qilish, uning sodir bo'lmaganini xohlashdir.

— I regret that I was mean to my sister.
— Men singlimga yomon munosabatda bo'lganimdan afsusdaman.

tube [tjuːb] n. — quvur
▪️>> A tube is a pipe through which water or air passes. >> A tube ichidan suv yoki havo o'tadigan truba.

— The pile of tubes was going to be put in the ground.
— Yig'ilgan quvurlar yerga qo'yilishi kerak edi.

fantastic [fænˈtæstɪk] adj. — ajoyib
▪️>> If something is fantastic, it is really good. >> Agar biror narsa fantastic bo'lsa, u chindan ham zo'r bo'ladi. 

— The student did a fantastic job on his project and got an award.
— Talaba o'z loyihasida ajoyib ish qildi va mukofotga sazovor bo'ldi.

disabled [dɪsˈeɪbəld] adj. — nogiron 
▪️>> When a person is disabled, they cannot do what a normal person can do. >> Agar odam disabled bo'lsa, u oddiy odam qila oladigan ishni qila olmaydi.

— The disabled man used a wheelchair to move around.
— Imkoniyati cheklangan shaxs harakatlanish uchun nogironlar aravachasidan foydalandi.

recall [rɪˈkɔːl] v. — eslamoq
▪️>> To recall something is to remember it. >> Biror narsani recall qilish uni eslash degani.

— She was trying to recall what she had told her friend.
— U do'stiga nima degani eslashga harakat qilayotgan edi.

bath [bæθ] n. — vanna 
▪️>> A bath is water in a tub. People take a bath to get clean. >> A bath tog'oradagi suv. Odamlar toza bo'lish uchun vanna qabul qiladi.

— After playing in the dirt, the boy took a bath.
— Tuproqda o'ynab, bola vanna qabul qilishga kirdi.

inspect [ɪnˈspekt] v. — tekshirmoq
▪️>> To inspect is to look at something carefully. >> To inspect biror narsaga diqqat bilan qarash.

— The mechanic inspected our car to see if it had any problems.
— Mexanik biror muammo bormikin deb mashinamizni tekshirdi.

fiction [fɪkʃən] n. — fantastik asar 
▪️>> Fiction is a story that is not true. >> Fiction haqiqat bo'lmagan hikoya.

— I enjoy reading works of fiction because they are very entertaining.
— Men fantastik asarlarni o'qishni yaxshi ko'raman, chunki ular juda qiziqarli.

marvel [mɑːrvəl] v. — hayron qolmoq
▪️>> To marvel at something is to feel surprise and interest in it. >> Biror narsadan marvel bo'lish undan hayron qolish va qiziqishni his qilish degani.

— We marveled at her excellent piano playing.
— Biz uning ajoyib pianino chalishidan hayron qoldik.

chew [tʃuː] v. — chaynamoq
▪️>> To chew is to move your mouth to break up food. >> To chew bu ovqatni maydalash uchun og'zingizni qimirlatish.

— I always chew my food carefully before swallowing it.
— Men ovqatni yutishdan oldin har doim ehtiyotkorlik bilan chaynayman.

surgery [səːrdʒərɪ] n. — jarrohlik
▪️>> Surgery is medical treatment when the doctor cuts open your body. >> Surgery doktor tanani kesib qiladigan tibbiy davolash.

— I needed surgery to repair my leg after the accident.
— Menga avtohalokatdan so'ng oyog'imni tuzatish uchun jarrohlik operatsiyasi kerak bo'ldi.

tough [tʌf] adj. — qiyin
▪️>> If something is tough, it is difficult. >> Agar biror narsa tough bo'lsa, u qiyin bo'ladi. 

— The man passed his driving test even though it was very tough.
— Qiyin bo'lishiga qaramay haligi kishi haydovchilik testidan o'tdi.

bend [bend] v. — bukmoq
▪️>> To bend is to move something so it is not straight. >> To bend biror narsa to'g'ri bo'lmasligi uchun uni siljitish.

— Lee bent over and picked up the paper on the ground.
— Li egilib, yerdagi qog'ozni oldi.

soul [soʊl] n. — ruh
▪️>> A soul is a person’s spirit. >> A soul insonning ruhi.

— Some people believe that the soul lives after the body dies.
— Ba'zi odamlar tana o'lganidan so'ng ruh yashashiga ishonishadi.

flag [flæg] n. — bayroq
▪️>> A flag is a piece of colored cloth that represents something. >> A flag biror narsani ifodalovchi rangli mato.

— Our country has a beautiful flag.
— Mamlakatimizning go'zal bayrog'i bor.

nutrient [njuːtrɪənt] n. — ozuqa
▪️>> A nutrient is something that a living thing needs to keep it alive. >> A nutrient bu tirik mavjudotning tirik qolishi uchun zarur bo'lgan narsa.

— Vegetables are full of important nutrients.
— Sabzavotlar muhim ozuqalarga to'la.

overcome [əʊvəˈkʌm] v. — ustun kelmoq, yengib o'tmoq
▪️>> To overcome a problem is to successfully fix it. >> Biror muammoni overcome qilish uni muvaffaqiyatli tuzatish degani.

— She overcame her shyness and spoke in front of the class.
— U uyatchanligini yengib o'tdi va sinf oldida so'zga chiqdi.

liquid [lɪkwɪd] n. — suyuqlik
▪️>> A liquid is a substance that is neither solid nor gas. >> A liquid qattiq holatda ham gaz holatida ham bo'lmagan modda.

— Water is the most important liquid for life.
— Suv hayot uchun eng muhim suyuqlik.
Unit 25:
criminal [krɪmənl] n. — jinoyatchi
▪️>> A criminal is a person who does something against the law. >> A criminal qonunga qarshi ish qiladigan shaxs.

— The police made sure the criminal couldn’t move his hands.
— Politsiya jinoyatchi qo'llarini qimirlatmasligiga ishonch hosil qildi.

penalty [pɛnəltɪ] n. — jarima
▪️>> A penalty is a punishment, given when someone breaks a rule or law. >> A penalty birortasi qonun yoki qoidani buzganda qo'llaniladigan jazo.

— I had to pay a $100 penalty for parking in the wrong spot.
— Men mashinamni noto'g'ri joyga parkovka qilganim uchun $100 jarima to'lashga majbur bo'ldim.

dozen [dʌzən] n. — o'n ikkita
▪️>> A dozen is a group of twelve things. >> A dozen o'n ikki narsaning guruhi.

— Mom brought home a dozen donuts for us as a treat.
— Onam biz uchun uyga o'n ikkita teshik kulcha olib keldi.

cash [kæʃ] n. — naqd pul
▪️>> Cash is money in the form of paper or coins. >> Cash qog'oz yoki tanga ko'rinishidagi pul.

— I was able to save up enough cash to buy my mother a gift.
— Men onamga sovg'a sotib olish uchun yetarlicha pul yig'a oldim.

admit [ədˈmɪt] v. — tan olmoq 
▪️>> To admit something means to say that it is true. >> Biror narsani admit qilish uning to'g'ri ekanligini aytish degani.

— I had to admit that I stole his idea.
— Men uning g'oyasini o'g'irlaganimni tan olishga majbur bo'ldim.

neat [niːt] adj. — toza, ozoda
▪️>> If something is neat, it is very clean or organized well. >> Agar biror narsa neat bo'lsa, u juda toza yoki yaxshi tashkil etilgan.

— My sister always keeps her bedroom very neat.
— Opam xonasini doim ozoda saqlaydi.

cabin [kæbɪn] n. — kulba
▪️>> A cabin is a small house made of wood. >> A cabin yog'ochdan yasalgan kichik uy.

— My grandfather owns a small cabin in the country.
— Mening bobom qishloqda kichkina kulbaga egalik qiladi.

wallet [wɒlɪt] n. — karmon, hamyon 
▪️>> A wallet is a thing that holds money and fits in a pocket. >> A wallet bu pul turadigan va cho'ntakka sig'adigan narsa.

— I keep my money in a wallet.
— Men pullarimni hamyonda saqlayman.

vehicle [vi:ɪkəl] n. — transport vositasi 
▪️>> A vehicle is a thing that moves people or things to another place. >> A vehicle odamlar yoki narsalarni boshqa joyga olib boradigan narsa.

— A ferry is a vehicle that takes people from one island to another.
— Parom (ya'ni solsimon yassi kema) odamlarni bir oroldan boshqasiga olib o'tadigan transport.

settle [setl] v. — hal qilmoq, bir yoqli qilmoq
▪️>> To settle a problem means to end it by finding a solution. >> Biror muammoni settle qilish uning javobini topish orqali tugatish.

— It took three of our best executives all day to settle the problem.
— Muammoni hal qilish uchun kun bo'yi uchta eng yaxshi menejerimiz kerak bo'ldi.

bowl [boul] n. — kosa
▪️>> A bowl is a deep, round dish that holds food or liquid. >> A bowl ovqat yoki suv solinadigan chuqur aylana idish.

— I ate a bowl of cereal for breakfast.
— Men nonushtaga bir kosa donli taom yedim.

inspire [ɪnˈspaɪər] v. — ilhomlantirmoq
▪️>> To inspire means to make a person want to do something. >> To inspire odamni biror narsa qilishga undash demakdir. 

— I was inspired to write a poem after watching the sunrise.
— Men quyosh chiqishini ko'rib, she'r yozishga ilhom oldim.

rude [ruːd] adj. — qo'pol, odobsiz
▪️>> When someone is rude, they are mean and not polite. >> Qachonki biror narsa rude bo'lsa, u baxil va muloyim emas.

— The children at the bus stop were very rude.
— Avtobus bekatidagi bolalar juda odobsiz edi.

occasion [əˈkeɪʒən] n. — tadbir, voqea
▪️>> An occasion is a time when something important happens. >> An occasion biror muhim narsa sodir bo'ladigan vaqt.

— Her graduation was an occasion to have a good time.
— Uning bitirishi yaxshi vaqt o'tkazish uchun imkoniyat bo'ldi.

elder [eldər] adj. — yoshi ulug'roq
▪️>> An elder is a person who is older than the people around them. >> An elder atrofidagilardan yoshi kattaroq bo'lgan shaxs.

— Uncle Ray is my elder so I always try to be respectful.
— Rey amakining mendan yoshi ulug' shuning uchun men doim unga hurmatda bo'lishga harakat qilaman.

yell [jel] v. — dodlamoq, dod solmoq
▪️>> To yell is to say something very loudly. >> To yell biror narsani baland ovozda aytish.

— The coach yelled at his team for their poor performance.
— Murabbiy jamoasining yomon ishtiroki uchun ularga baqirdi.

bin [bin] n. — quti, yashik
▪️>> A bin is a container that holds things. >> A bin narsalar turadigan quti.

— He put his trash in the bin.
— U axlatni qutiga tashladi.

mere [mɪər] adj. — arzimagan
▪️>> When something is mere, it is small or not important. >> Qachonki biror narsa mere bo'lsa, u kichik yoki muhim emas bo'ladi. 

— We lost the game by a mere two points.
— Biz o'yinni arzimagan ikki ochkoga yutqizdik.

fence [fens] n. — devor, to'siq
▪️>> A fence is a structure around a house or field. >> A fence hovli yoki dala atrofidagi to'siq.

— The farmer put up a fence so that no one could walk on her field.
— Fermer dalasiga hech kim kira olmasin deb uning atrofiga to'siq qo'ydi.

facial [feɪʃəl] adj. — yuzdagi
▪️>> If something is facial, it is related to a person’s face. >> Agar biror narsa facial bo'lsa, u inson yuzi bilan aloqador bo'ladi. 

— I could tell from his facial features that he was angry.
— Men uning yuzidagi xususiyatlardan uning jahli chiqayotganini ayta olar edim.
Unit 26:
shut [ʃʌt] v. — yopib qo'ymoq
▪️>> To shut something means to close it tightly. >> Biror narsani shut qilish uni qattiq yopish degani.

— Please shut the door; the air outside is cold.
— Iltimos, eshikni yopib qo'ying; tashqarida havo sovuq.

hurricane [hə:rəkein] n. — kuchli dovul
▪️>> A hurricane is a bad storm that happens over the ocean. >> A hurricane okean bo'ylab sodir bo'ladigan yomon bo'ron.

— The wind from the hurricane bent the palm tree.
— Kuchli dovulning shamoli palma daraxtini egdi.

firm [fə:rm] adj. — mustahkam, qattiq
▪️>> When something is firm, it is solid but not too hard. >> Qachonki biror narsa firm bo'lsa, u qattiq bo'ladi, lekin juda ham qattiq emas.

— He sleeps better on a firm bed.
— U qattiq yotoqda yaxshi uxlaydi.

engage [enˈgeɪdʒ] v. — band bo'lmoq 
▪️>> To engage in something means to do it. >> Biror narsani engage qilish uni bajarish degani.

— Dad was engaged in sawing a piece of wood in half.
— Dadam bir bo'lak yog'ochni yarmida arralash bilan shug'ullanardi.

grand [grænd] adj. — hashamatli
▪️>> When something is grand, it is big and liked by people. >> Qachonki biror narsa grand bo'lsa, u katta va odamlar uni yoqtiradi.

— The grand mountain rose high into the sky.
— Hashamatli tog' osmongacha balandlikda o'sdi.

zone [zoun] n. — hudud, zona 
▪️>> A zone is an area that has different qualities from the ones around it. >> A zone bu atrofdagilardan farqli fazilatlarga ega bo'lgan maydon.

— Firefighters often work in danger zones.
— O't o'chiruvchilar ko'pincha xavfli hududlarda ishlaydi.

surf [səːrf] v. — syorfing uchmoq
▪️>> To surf means to use a special board to ride on waves in the ocean. >> To surf bu maxsus taxtadan foydalanib, okeandagi to'lqinlarda uchishni anglatadi.

— The students went to the beach to surf during their vacation.
— O'quvchilar ta'tillari davomida syorfing uchish uchun sohilga borishdi.

coral [kɒ:rəl] n. — marjon 
▪️>> Coral is the hard, colorful material formed by the shells of animals. >> Coral bu hayvonlarning qobig'idan hosil bo'lgan qattiq, rang-barang material.

— The diver admired the beautiful coral under the water.
— G'avvos suv ostidagi go'zal marjonga qoyil qoldi.

adjust [əˈdʒʌst] v. — o'zgartirmoq 
▪️>> To adjust something means to change it so it is better. >> Biror narsani adjust qilish uni yaxshiroq bo'lishi uchun o'zgartirish degani.

— He adjusted the old guitar to make it sound better.
— U eski gutarani yaxshiroq ishlashi uchun o'zgartirdi.

reef [riːf] n. — cho'g'irtosh, rif
▪️>> A reef is a group of rocks or coral that rise to or near the ocean. >> A reef bu okeanga yoki uning yaqinida ko'tarilgan toshlar yoki marjonlar guruhi.

— He walked along the reef and looked at the water below.
— U qoyatosh bo'ylab yurib, pastdagi suvga qaradi.

amuse [əˈmjuːz] v. — kuldirmoq
▪️>> To amuse someone means to do something that is funny or entertaining. >> Birortasini amuse qilish kulgili yoki zavqli biror narsa qilish degani.

— The singer was very good. She amused the crowd.
— Qo'shiqchi juda yaxshi edi. U olamonni hursand qildi.

crash [kræʃ] v. — avariya bo'lmoq, to'qnashmoq
▪️>> To crash means to hit and break something. >> To crash biror narsani urib sindirishni anglatadi.

— There was a loud noise when the car crashed into the tree.
— Mashina daraxtga to'qnashganda baland ovoz eshitildi.

deck [dek] n. — paluba
▪️>> A deck is a wooden floor built outside of a house or the floor of a ship. >> A deck bu uyning tashqarisida yoki kema tagida qurilgan yog'och zamin.

— A ship will store many supplies below its deck.
— Kema palubaning tagida ko'plab materiallarni saqlaydi.

fuel [fjʊ:əl] n. — yonilg'i, yoqilg'i
▪️>> Fuel is something that creates heat or energy. >> Fuel bu issiqlik yoki energiya hosil qiladigan narsa.

— Heat is the fuel that comes from fire.
— Issiqlik - bu olovdan keladigan yoqilg'i.

cotton [kɒtn] n. — paxta 
▪️>> Cotton is a cloth made from the fibers of the cotton plant. >> Cotton bu paxta o'simlikining tolalaridan tayyorlangan mato.

— I like to wear clothes made from cotton in the summer.
— Men yozda paxtadan tikilgan kiyimlarni kiyishni yaxshi ko'raman.

loss [lɒ(:)s] n. — yo'qotish, boy berish
▪️>> A loss means the act or an instance of losing something. >> A loss biror narsani yo'qotish harakati.

— I suffered a big loss while I was gambling.
— Men qimor o'ynab yurganimda katta yo'qotishlarga duch keldim.

plain [pleɪn] adj. — oddiy
▪️>> If something is plain, it is simple and not decorated. >> Agar biror narsa plain bo'lsa, u oddly va bezatilmagan bo'ladi.

— He bought a pair of plain white shoes over the weekend.
— U hafta oxirida bir juft oddiy oq oyoq kiyim oldi.

task [tæsk] n. — vazifa, ish
▪️>> A task is a piece of work to be done that is usually difficult. >> A task odatda qiyin bo'lgan, bajariladigan ishning bir qismi. 

— My task for the weekend was to clean the entire back yard.
— Dam olish kunidagi vazifam butun orqa hovlini tozalash edi.

strict [strɪkt] adj. — qattiqqo'l, talabchan
▪️>> When someone is strict, they make sure others follow rules. >> Qachonki kimdir strict bo'lsa, ular boshqalarga qoidalarga rioya qilishlariga ishonch hosil qilishadi.

— The teacher is strict. She does not let students talk in class.
— Haligi o'qituvchi qattiqqo'l. U o'quvchilar sinfda gaplashishiga yo'l qo'ymaydi.

accuse [əˈkjuːz] v. — ayblamoq
▪️>> To accuse someone of something is to blame them for doing it. >> Birortasini biror narsa qilgani uchun accuse qilish uni shu ishni qilgani uchun ayblash degani.

— She accused her brother of breaking her computer.
— U akasini uning kompyuterini sindirganlikda aybladi.
Unit 27:
hire [haɪər] v. — yollamoq
▪️>> To hire someone is to pay them money to work for you. >> Birortasini hire qilish unga siz uchun biror ish qilishi uchun pul to'lash degani.

— We hired a man to paint our house.
— Biz hovlimizni bo'yash uchun bir kishini yolladik.

resemble [rɪˈzembəl] v. — o'xshamoq
▪️>> To resemble someone is to look like them. >> Birortasiga resemble bo'lish unga o'xshash bo'lish degani.

— The baby resembles his father a great deal.
— Chaqaloq ko'p jihatdan otasiga o'xshaydi.

jail [dʒeɪl] n. — turma, qamoq
▪️>> Jail is a place where criminals go to be punished. >> Jail jinoyatchilar jazoga tortilib jo'natiladigan joy.

— The thief was caught and sent to jail for ten years.
— Haligi o'g'ri ushlandi va 10 yilga qamoqqa yuborildi.

expose [ɪksˈpəʊz] v. — oshkor qilmoq 
▪️>> To expose is to make known something that is hidden. >> To expose biror yashirilgan narsani boshqalarga bildirish degani.

— He took off his shirt exposing his costume.
— U ko'ylagini yechib, kostyumini ko'rsatdi.

guilty [gɪltɪ] adj. — aybdor
▪️>> If people feel guilty, they feel bad for what they did. >> Agar odamlar o'zlarini guilty his qilsalar, ular qilgan ishlari uchun o'zlarini yomon his qilishadi.

— I felt guilty for taking my sister’s cookies.
— Men singlimning pechenelarini olganim uchun o'zimni aybdor his qildim.

capture [kæptʃər] v. — ushlamoq, tutmoq
▪️>> To capture someone or something is to catch them. >> Birortasi yoki biror narsani capture qilish uni tutish degani.

— James tried to capture the bubbles in his hands.
— Jeyms qo'lidagi pufakchalarni ushlashga urindi.

symptom [simptəm] n. — simptom, alomat
▪️>> A symptom of a bad condition or illness is a sign that it is happening. >> Biror yomon vaziyat yoki kasallikning symptom'i uning sodir bo'layotgani belgisi.

— Sneezing and a high fever are symptoms of the common cold.
— Aksirish va yuqori isitma umumiy shamollashning alomatidir.

cardinal [kɑːrdənl] adj. — eng muhim 
▪️>> If a rule or quality is cardinal, then it is the most important one. >> Agar biror qoida yoki sifat cardinal bo'lsa, u eng muhimi bo'ladi. 

— Raising your hand in the classroom before you speak is a cardinal rule.
— Sinfda gapirishdan oldin qo'lni ko'tarish eng muhim qoida hisoblanadi.

preserve [priˈzəːrv] v. — ehtiyot qilmoq, saqlamoq
▪️>> To preserve is to protect something from harm. >> To preserve biror narsani zarardan himoya qilish degani.

— Dad sprayed a chemical on the house to help preserve its looks.
— Dadam tashqi ko'rinishini saqlab qolish uchun uyga kimyoviy modda sepdi.

ordinary [ɔːrdənerɪ] adj. — odatiy 
▪️>> If someone or something is ordinary, they are not special in any way. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa ordinary bo'lsa, u maxsus emas.

— Today was just an ordinary day. Nothing unusual happened.
— Bugun odatiy kun bo'ldi. Noodatiy hech narsa sodir bo'lmadi.

tobacco [təˈbækou] n. — tamaki
▪️>> Tobacco is a plant whose leaves are smoked, such as in cigarettes. >> Tobacco uning barglari chekiladigan daraxt, masalan sigaretning ichida bo'ladi. 

— The tobacco in cigarettes is bad for your health.
— Sigaretdagi tamaki sog'lik uchun yomon.

witch [wɪtʃ] n. — jodugar
▪️>> A witch is a woman with magical powers. >> A witch sehrli qudratga ega ayol.

— People think that witches fly around on broomsticks.
— Odamlar jodugarlar supurgi ustida uchib yurishadi deb o'ylashadi.

pronounce [prəˈnaʊns] v. — talaffuz qilmoq 
▪️>> To pronounce is to say the sounds of letters or words. >> To pronounce harflar yoki so'zlarning tovushlarini aytish.

— Young children often have trouble pronouncing words right.
— Yosh bolalar ko'pincha so'zlarni to'g'ri talaffuz qilishga qiynalishadi.

permanent [pəːrmənənt] adj. — o'zgarmas, abadiy
▪️>> If something is permanent, it lasts for a long time or forever. >> Agar biror narsa permanent bo'lsa, u uzoq yoki abadiy davom etadi.

— We don’t know if Aunt Mildred’s visit will be a permanent one.
— Mildred xolaning tashrifi doimiy bo'ladimi yo'qmi bilmaymiz.

apology [əˈpɒlədʒɪ] n. — uzr, kechirim
▪️>> An apology is something someone says to show that they are sorry. >> An apology bu kimdir kechirim so'rash uchun aytadigan so'zidir.

— After arguing with her teacher, the girl wrote the teacher an apology.
— O'qituvchisi bilan janjallashgach, qiz o'qituvchidan uzr so'radi.

minister [mɪnɪstər] n. — vazir
▪️>> A minister is an important person in government with many duties. >> A minister ko'p burchlari bo'lgan, mamlakatdagi muhim shaxs.

— The minister of education controls the country’s schools.
— Ta'lim vaziri mamlakat maktablarini nazorat qiladi.

innocent [ɪnəsnt] adj. — aybsiz, beayb
▪️>> If someone is innocent, they are not guilty of a crime. >> Agar birortasi innocent bo'lsa, u biror jinoyatda aybdor emas.

— The judge said that the woman was innocent of the crime.
— Sudya jinoyat sodir etishda haligi ayol beayb ekanligini aytdi.

twin [twɪn] n. — egizaklar
▪️>> Twins are two children born at the same time. >> Twins bir vaqtda tug'ilgan ikki bola.

— My sister and I are twins. We look exactly the same.
— Mening opam va men egizaklarmiz. Biz juda bir xil ko'rinamiz.

duke [djuːk] n. — gersog 
▪️>> A duke is a man of high social rank but below a king or queen. >> A duke yuqori ijtimoiy mavqega ega lekin qirol yoki qirolichadan past darajadagi shaxs.

— The duke ruled over the land.
— Gersog yerni boshqargan.

bold [bould] adj. — qo'rqmas
▪️>> If someone is bold, they are not afraid of doing something. >> Agar birortasi bold bo'lsa, u biror narsa qilishdan qo'rqmaydi.

— The bold man climbed the high mountain.
— Haligi qo'rqmas kishi baland tog'ga chiqdi.
Unit 28:
accompany [əˈkʌmpənɪ] v. — sherik bo'lmoq, hamroh bo'lmoq
▪️>> To accompany other people means to join them or go with them. >> Birortasini accompany qilish unga qo'shilish yoki u bilan birga yurish degani.

— My brothers accompanied me to the movie.
— Akalarim menga kinoga borgani hamrohlik qilishdi.

pot [pɒt] n. — qozon
▪️>> A pot is a deep, round metal container used for cooking. >> A pot ovqat pishirish uchun ishlatiladigan aylana, chuqur metal idish.

— Don’t touch the pot on the stove. It’s hot.
— Pechdagi qozonga tegmang. U issiq.

net [net] n. — to'r
▪️>> A net is a bag made of strong thread. It is used to catch animals. >> A net bu kuchli ipdan yasalgan halqa shaklidagi to'r. U hayvonlarni tutish uchun ishlatiladi.

— The boy caught butterflies in his net.
— Haligi bola to'rida kapalak tutdi.

sharp [ʃɑːrp] adj. — o'tkir, keskir
▪️>> When something is sharp, it has a thin edge that cuts things easily. >> Qachonki biror narsa sharp bo'lsa, uning yupqa qirg'og'i bo'ladi va u narsalarni kesadi.

— That knife is very sharp. Be careful not to hurt yourself.
— Haligi pichoq juda o'tkir. O'zingni jarohatlab olmaslikka ehtiyot bo'l.

philosophy [fɪˈlɒsəfɪ] n. — falsafa
▪️>> A philosophy is a way to think about truth and life. >> A philosophy haqiqat va hayot haqida o'ylash yo'li.

— My philosophy is “live and enjoy".
— Mening falsafam "yasha va zavqlan".

inn [ɪn] n. — mehmonxona
▪️>> An inn is a place where travelers can rest and eat. >> An inn sayohatchilar dam olishi va ovqatlanishi mumkin bo'lgan joy.

— The visitor got a room at the inn.
— Tashrif buyuruvchi mehmonxonadan xona oldi.

bridge [brɪdʒ] n. — ko'prik
▪️>> A bridge is something that is built over a river so people can cross it. >> A bridge odamlar undan o'tishi uchun daryo ustiga qurilgan narsa.

— The old bridge fell into the river.
— Eski ko'prik daryoga quladi.

cast [kæst] v. — otmoq, uloqtirmoq 
▪️>> To cast something means to throw it. >> Biror narsani cast qilish uni uloqtirish degani.

— The fisherman cast his line into the water.
— Baliqchi qarmog'ini suvga otdi.

electronic [ɪlekˈtrɒnɪk] adj. — elektron 
▪️>> When something is electronic, it uses electricity to do something. >> Qachonki biror narsa electronic bo'lsa, u biror narsa qilish uchun elektrdan foydalanadi.

— I like having electronic devices such as an MP3 player.
— Menda MP3 player kabi elektron qurilmalar bo'lishini yoqtiraman.

branch [bræntʃ] n. — shox
▪️>> A branch is the part of a tree with leaves. >> A branch daraxtning bir qismi, barglari bilan.

— The monkey was hanging from a branch on the tree.
— Maymun daraxt shoxiga osilib turgandi.

sort [sɔːrt] n. — tur, nav
▪️>> A sort of something is a type of it. >> Biror narsaning sort'i uning turi degani.

— What sort of instrument do you want to learn to play?
— Qaysi cholg'u asbob turini chalishni o'rganmoqchisan?

seed [siːd] n. — urug'
▪️>> A seed is the hard part of a plant or fruit that trees grow from. >> A seed bu undan daraxtlar o'sadigan o'simlik yoki mevaning qattiq qismi.

— I planted the seed in the dirt hoping that it would grow into a tree.
— Men bundan daraxt o'sadi deb umid qilib tuproqqa urug' ekdim.

subtract [səbˈtrækt] v. — ayirmoq
▪️>> To subtract means to take something away. >> To subtract biror narsani qaytarib olish degani.

— We learned how to subtract numbers from each other in class.
— Biz sinfda raqamlarni qanday qilib bir-biridan ayirishni o'rganib oldik.

dare [dɛər] v. — jur'at etmoq
▪️>> To dare means to be brave enough to try something. >> To dare biror narsa qilish uchun yetarlicha botir bo'lish degani. 

— He dared to jump out of the airplane and skydive.
— U samolyotdan sakrab tushishga jur'at etdi.

virtual [vəːrtʃuəl] adj. — virtual, haqiqiyga o'xshash
▪️>> If something is virtual, then it is very close to being true or accurate. >> Agar biror narsa virtual bo'lsa, u haqiqat bo'lishiga juda yaqin.

— Because he’s popular, Joe is the virtual leader of the group.
— U mashhur bo'lgani uchun, Jo guruhning virtual rahbari.

tight [taɪt] adj. — tarang, qattiq
▪️>> When something is tight, it is fixed or fastened firmly in place. >> Qachonki biror narsa tight bo'lsa, u joyiga mahkamlanadi.

— The knots were too tight to untie.
— Tugunlar yechish uchun juda qattiq edi.

whisper [wɪspə:r] v. — pichirlamoq, pichirlab gapirmoq
▪️>> To whisper means to say very quietly. >> To whisper juda sekin gapirish degani.

— We have to whisper in the library so people can focus on reading.
— Biz odamlar kitob o'qishga diqqatlarini jamlashlari uchun kutubxonada pichirlab gapirishga majburmiz.

breath [breθ] n. — nafas
▪️>> A breath is the air that goes into and out of one’s lungs. >> A breath birortasining o'pkasiga kirib chiqadigan havo.

— You can’t take a breath under water.
— Siz suv ostida nafas ololmaysiz.

bare [bɛər] adj. — yalang'och
▪️>> When something is bare, it is plain. It has no covering. >> Qachonki biror narsa bare bo'lsa, u oddiy. U o'ralmagan bo'ladi. 

— He likes to walk around in his bare feet.
— U yalang oyoq yurishni yaxshi ko'radi.

weigh [weɪ] v. — vaznga ega bo'lmoq 
▪️>>To weigh something means to see how heavy it is. >> Biror narsani weigh qilish uning og'irligi qancha ekanligini ko'rish degani. 

— The little dog weighed exactly 3kgs.
— Kichkina it naqd 3 kg og'irlikka ega chiqdi.
Unit 29:
deserve [dɪˈzəːrv] v. — sazovor bo'lmoq 
▪️>> To deserve is to be worthy of something as a result of one’s actions. >> To deserve bu o'z harakatlari natijasida biror narsaga loyiq bo'lish.

— The dog deserved a bone for behaving very well.
— Haligi it o'zini yaxshi tutgani uchun suyakka sazovor bo'ldi.

cloth [klɔ(:)θ] n. — gazlama
▪️>> Cloth is material used to make clothes. >> Cloth kiyim tikish uchun ishlatiladigan material.

— His shirt is made of a very soft type of cloth.
— Uning ko'ylagi juda yumshoq matodan tikilgan.

feather [feðər] n. — pat
▪️>> Feathers are the things covering birds’ bodies. >> Feathers qushlar tanasini o'rab turadigan narsalar.

— That bird has orange feathers on its chest.
— Haligi qushning ko'kragida sabzirang pati bor edi.

obtain [əbˈteɪn] v. — qo'lga kiritmoq
▪️>> To obtain is to get something you want or need. >> To obtain siz xohlagan yoki sizga kerak bo'lgan narsaga ega bo'lish degani.

— After I passed the test, I obtained my driver’s license.
— Testdan o'tganimdan so'ng, haydovchilik guvohnomasini qo'lga kiritdim.

nowadays [naʊədeɪz] adv. — hozirda, hozirgi paytda
▪️>> If something happens nowadays, it happens at the present time. >> Agar biror narsa nowadays sodir bo'lsa, u hozirgi vaqtda sodir bo'ladi. 

— In the past people walked everywhere. Nowadays, they use cars.
— Qadimda odamlar hamma joyga yurib borishgan. Hozirda ular mashinadan foydalanadi.

romantic [roʊˈmæntɪk] adj. — romantik, ishqiy
▪️>> When something is romantic, it has to do with love. >> Qachonki biror narsa romantic bo'lsa, u sevgi bilan qilinishi kerak. 

— The young couple went to see a romantic movie.
— Yosh juftlik romantik kino ko'rgani ketishdi.

furniture [fəːrnɪtʃə:r] n. — mebel 
▪️>> Furniture is the things used in a house such as tables and chairs. >> Furniture stol va stulga o'xshagan uyda ishlatiladigan narsalar.

— His living room only had a few simple pieces of furniture.
— Uning yashash xonasida bir nechta oddiy mebel bor edi.

grave [greɪv] n. — qabr
▪️>> A grave is the place where a dead person is buried. >> A grave vafot etgan inson dafn qilinadigan joy.

— We visit our grandfather’s grave each year.
— Biz har yili bobomning qabrlariga boramiz.

annual [ænjʊəl] adj. — yillik
▪️>> If something is annual, it happens once a year. >> Agar biror narsa annual bo'lsa, u yilda bir martta sodir bo'ladi. 

— The only time I see my aunts and uncles is at our annual family picnic.
— Men ammam va amakilarimni faqatgina har yili o'tkaziladigan oilaviy piknikimizda ko'rishim mumkin.

fertile [fəːrtl] adj. — unumdor, hosildor
▪️>> If land is fertile, it is able to produce good crops and plants. >> Agar yer fertile bo'lsa, u yaxshi meva va o'simliklar yetishtira oladi.

— The farmer grew many vegetables in the fertile soil.
— Fermer o'zining unumdor tuprog'ida ko'p sabzavotlar yetishtirdi.

ideal [aɪˈdɪ:əl] adj. — ideal, bekamiko'st
▪️>> If something is ideal, it is the best that it can possibly be. >> Agar biror narsa ideal bo'lsa, u bo'lishi mumkin bo'lgan eng zo'ri bo'ladi. 

— This house is an ideal place for my family. It has everything we need.
— Bu hovli oilamiz uchun ideal joy. Bu yerda bizga kerakli hamma narsa bor.

clay [kleɪ] n. — gil 
▪️>> Clay is a type of heavy, wet soil used to make pots. >> Clay bu idishlar tayyorlash uchun ishlatiladigan og'ir, nam tuproq.

— She made a bowl out of the clay.
— U loy (gil)dan piyola yasadi.

wheel [wi:l] n. — g'ildirak
▪️>> A wheel is a round thing on a vehicle that turns when it moves. >> A wheel transport harakatlanganda aylanadigan dumaloq narsa.

— A car has four wheels.
— Mashinaning 4 g'ildiragi (baloni) bor.

curtain [kəːrtən] n. — parda 
▪️>> A curtain is a cloth hung over a window or used to divide a room. >> A curtain derazaga ilinadigan yoki xonani bo'lish uchun ishlatiladigan material.

— She opened the curtains to let light into the room.
— Xonaga yorug'lik kirishi uchun u pardalarni ochdi.

shore [ʃɔːr] n. — qirg'oq, sohil
▪️>> A shore is the edge of a large body of water. >> A shore katta suvning qirg'oq qismi.

— All of the boats were floating near the shore.
— Barcha qayiqlar sohil yaqinida suzayotgan edi.

shell [ʃel] n. — chig'anoq
▪️>> A shell is a hard covering that protects the body of some sea creatures. >> A shell ba'zi dengiz jonzotlarini himoya qiladigan qattiq qobiq. 

— There were many pretty shells on the beach.
— Sohilda juda ko'p chiroyli chig'anoqlar bor edi.

flood [flʌd] n. — suv toshqini
▪️>> A flood is an event in which water covers an area which is usually dry. >> A flood suv odatda quruq bo'lgan joyni qamrab oladigan hodisa.

— After three days of rain, there was a flood in the city.
— Uch kunlik yomg'irdan so'ng, shaharda suv toshqini yuzaga keldi.

abstract [æbstrækt] adj. — mavhum
▪️>> If ideas are abstract, they are based on general ways of thinking. >> Agar g'oyalar abstract bo'lsa, ular umumiy fikrlashga asoslangan bo'ladi.

— The idea of beauty is abstract and changes over time.
— Chiroy haqidagi g'oya mavhumdir va vaqt o'tishi bilan o'zgaradi.

religious [rɪˈlɪdʒəs] adj. — diniy
▪️>> When something is religious, it has to do with religion. >> Qachonki biror narsa religious bo'lsa, u din bilan qilinishi kerak.

— The holy man spoke about religious topics.
— Muqaddas odam diniy mavzular haqida gapirdi.

intelligence [ɪnˈtelədʒəns] n. — o'qimishlilik, ziyolilik
▪️>> Intelligence is the ability to learn and understand things. >> Intelligence narsalarni o'rganish va tushunish qobiliyati.

— Because of his high intelligence, he finished school early.
— Uning yuqori o'qimishliligi sababli, u maktabni erta tugatdi.
Unit 30:
urge [əːrdʒ] v. — undamoq
▪️>> To urge someone is to try very hard to get them to do something. >> Birortasini urge qilish ularni biror narsa qildirish uchun qattiq urinish degani. 

— He urged them to believe his story.
— U ularni hikoyasiga ishonishga undadi.

borrow [bɔ(:)roʊ] v. — qarzga olmoq
▪️>> To borrow something is to take it and then give it back later. >> Biror narsani borrow qilish, uni olish va keyinroq qaytarib berish degani.

— Can I borrow a pencil to use today? I’ll give it back to you tomorrow.
— Qalamingni bugun foydalanishga olib tursam maylimi? Ertaga qaytarib beraman.

scholarship [skɒlə:rʃɪp] n. — stipendiya, grand
▪️>> A scholarship is money given to one so they can go to school. >> A scholarship bu maktabga borishlari uchun berilgan pul.

— I got a scholarship to help me pay for university.
— Men universitetga to'lashga grand yutdim.

downtown [daʊnˈtaʊn] n. — shahar markazi
▪️>> The downtown is the center of most cities. >> The downtown ko'p shaharlarning markazi.

— The downtown is filled with many tall buildings.
— Shahar markazi ko'p baland binolar bilan to'la.

found [faund] v. — asos solmoq
▪️>> To found a company or organization means to start it. >> Biror kompaniya yoki tashkilotni found qilish uni boshlash degani.

— The pilgrims founded one of the first colonies in the United States.
— Ziyoratchilar AQShda birinchi koloniyalardan biriga asos solishgan.

practical [præktɪkəl] adj. — foydali
▪️>> If something is practical, it is useful in normal life. >> Agar biror narsa practical bo'lsa, u odatiy hayotda foydali bo'ladi. 

— Learning English is practical; you can use it in many places.
— Ingliz tilini o'rganish foydali; siz uni ko'p joylarda ishlata olasiz.

loan [loun] n. — qarz berish
▪️>> A loan is the act of lending something, usually money. >> A loan biror narsani, odatda pulni qarzga berish harakati.

— I got a loan from the bank.
— Men bankdan qarz (kredit) oldim.

salary [sælərɪ] n. — maosh
▪️>> A salary is how much money a person makes at his or her job. >> A salary birortasi ishda qancha pul topishi.

— He got a new job with a better salary.
— U yaxshiroq maoshli ishga kirdi.

treasure [treʒə:r] n. — xazina
▪️>> A treasure is a collection of valuable things, especially jewels or gold. >> A treasure asosan taqinchoq yoki oltindan iborat qimmatli narsalar yig'indisi.

— They became very rich when they found the buried treasure.
— Ular ko'milgan xazinani topib boyib ketishdi.

quarter [kwɔːrtər] n. — 25 sentlik tanga
▪️>> A quarter is 25 cents. >> A quarter 25 sent degani.

— He paid a quarter for the candy.
— U shirinlik uchun 25 sent to'ladi.

embarrass [ɪmˈbærəs] v. — hijolat qilmoq, uyaltirmoq
▪️>> To embarrass someone is to make them feel ashamed or foolish. >> Birortasini embarrass qilish, uni uyaltirish degani.

— He was embarrassed when he couldn’t remember her name.
— U qizning ismini eslolmaganda uyaldi.

invest [ɪnˈvest] v. — pul sarf qilmoq
▪️>> To invest means to use money in a way that will bring a profit later. >> To invest keyinroq foyda keltirishi uchun pul sarf qilish degani.

— I invested money in a new building that should bring me a profit.
— Men pulni menga foyda olib keladigan yangi binoga sarfladim.

temporary [tempərərɪ] adj. — vaqtinchalik
▪️>> If something is temporary, it exists for a short time. >> Agar biror narsa temporary bo'lsa, u kam vaqt davom etadi.

— This car is only temporary; I’ll get a new one soon.
— Bu mashina vaqtinchalik; tez orada yangisini olaman.

former [fɔːrmər] adj. — oldingi, sobiq
▪️>> Former describes something that used to be but is not any more. >> Former avval foydalanilgan va ortiq foydalanilmayotgan narsani tasvirlaydi.

— The hotel, a former castle, was built over 200 years ago.
— Mehmonxona, ya'ni sobiq qasr, 200 yil avval qurilgan.

formula [fɔːrmjələ] n. — formula
▪️>> A formula is a set mathematical way or method of solving a problem. >> A formula muammoni, masalani yechishning matematik yo'li yoki usuli.

— I learned a new formula that may help us with our problem.
— Men bizning misolni yechishda yordam berishi mumkin bo'lgan yangi formula o'rgandim.

client [klaɪənt] n. — mijoz
▪️>> A client is a person or business that pays another to do a service. >> A client bu xizmat ko'rsatish uchun boshqasiga pul to'laydigan shaxs yoki korxona.

— She has many clients who enjoy coming to her salon.
— Unda uning saloniga kelishdan zavqlanadigan mijozlari ko'p.

appeal [əˈpiːl] v. — qiziqtirmoq, jalb qilmoq
▪️>> To appeal to someone is to be interesting or attractive to them. >> Birortasiga appeal bo'lish u uchun qiziqarli yoki jalb qiluvchi bo'lish degani.

— Sleeping all day appeals to me, but I have to go to school.
— Kun bo'yi uxlash meni jalb qiladi, lekin men maktabga borishim kerak.

fare [fɛər] n. — yo'l haqi
▪️>> A fare is an amount of money paid to use a bus, train, or taxi. >> A fare avtobus, poyezd yoki taksidan foydalanganlik uchun to'lanadigan pul miqdori.

— Since he is a senior, my grandfather pays a low fare for the bus.
— Yoshi katta bo'lgani uchun, bobom avtobus uchun arzon yo'l haqi to'laydi.

dull [dʌl] adj. — zerikarli
▪️>> If something is dull, it is not exciting. >> Agar biror narsa dull bo'lsa, u qiziqarli emas.

— The movie was very dull. I fell asleep watching it.
— Kino juda zerikarli edi. Ko'rayotib uxlab qoldim.

assume [əˈsjuːm] v. — tahmin qilmoq
▪️>> To assume something is to think that it is true, even with no proof. >> Biror narsani appeal qilish uni to'g'ri deb bilish degani, garchi isbot bo'lmasa ham.

— I assume you are both familiar with this plan.
— Tahminimcha ikkalangiz ham bu reja bilan tanishsizlar.

Unit 1:
modest [mɒdɪst] adj. — kamtar, kamtarin
🔻>> If people are modest, they do not think that they are too important. >> Agar birortasi modest bo'lsa, u o'zining juda muhimligi haqida o'ylamaydi.

— Derek is very modest for someone who is so rich.
— Derek juda boy odam uchun juda kamtarin.

ladder [lædə:r] n. — narvon, shoti
🔻>> A ladder is an object that is used to climb up and down things. >> A ladder narsalarga chiqish va tushish uchun ishlatiladigan narsa.

— He used a ladder to climb to the top of his tree house.
— U narvondan foydalanib, daraxt uyining tepasiga ko'tarildi.

satisfaction [sætɪsˈfækʃən] n. — qoniqish, mamnuniyat
🔻>> Satisfaction is a feeling you get when you do or receive something good. >> Satisfaction bu yaxshilik qilganda yoki olganda paydo bo'ladigan tuyg'u.

— Brad was filled with satisfaction when he saw what was for dinner.
— Bred kechki ovqat uchun tayyorlangan narsani ko'rib, mamnun bo'ldi.

blacksmith [blæksmɪθ] n. — temirchi
🔻>> A blacksmith is a person who makes things out of metal. >> A blacksmith temirdan narsalar yasovchi shaxs.

— The blacksmith pounded the piece of metal until it was flat.
— Temirchi metal yupqa bo'lguncha bolg'a bilan urdi.

province [prɒvɪns] n. — viloyat, provinsiya 
🔻>> A province is a small area that is controlled by a country. >> A province bu mamlakat tomonidan boshqariladigan kichik hudud.

— Canada is divided into several different provinces.
— Kanada bir nechta viloyatlarga bo'lingan.

forge [fɔːrdʒ] v. — munosabatlarni yo'lga qo'ymoq
🔻>> To forge is to make or produce, especially with difficulty. >> To forge asosan qiyinchilik bilan biror narsani yasash yoki ishlab chiqarish.

— Stacy and Heather forged their friendship when they were teenagers.
— Steysi va Xezer o'smirlik chog'larida do'stligini mustahkamlagan.

occupy [ɒkjəpaɪ] v. — yashamoq, turmoq
🔻>> To occupy a place is to live, work, or be there. >> Biror joyni occupy qilish u yerda yashash, ishlash yoki o'sha yerda bo'lish degani.

— Kevin and Alice occupied the chairs and had a long discussion.
— Kevin va Elis stullarni egallab, uzoq munozara qilishdi.

iron [aɪərn] n. — metal, temir
🔻>> Iron is a strong metal that is used to make many objects. >> Iron ko'p narsalar yasashda ishlatiladigan qattiq metal.

— The horse had shoes made of iron.
— Otning poyafzallari temirdan edi.

penny [penɪ] n. — sent
🔻>> A penny is a coin worth one cent. >> A penny 1 sentga teng tanga.

— U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is on the penny.
— Bir sentli tanganing ustida Avraam Linkolnning tasviri bor.

prosper [prɒspər] v. — muvaffaqiyatli rivojlanmoq
🔻>> To prosper is to be successful or make a lot of money. >> To prosper muvaffaqiyat qozonish yoki ko'p pul topish.

— Frank’s new business finally prospered after many years of hard work.
— Frankning yangi biznesi ko'p yillik tinimsiz mehnatidan so'ng nihoyat muvaffaqiyat qozondi.

compensate [kɒmpənseɪt] v. — pul to'lamoq
🔻>> To compensate is to pay someone for the time they spent doing something. >> To compensate birortasiga biror ish qilish uchun sarflaydigan vaqtga pul to'lash.

— Her boss compensated her for the extra work she did last week.
— Uning xo'jayini u o'tgan hafta qilgan ishi uchun qo'shimcha to'ladi.

encounter [ɪnˈkaʊntər] v. — ro'baro kelmoq, duch kelmoq
🔻>> If you encounter something, you meet or come close to it. >> Agar siz biror narsaga encounter qilsangiz, siz u bilan uchrashasiz yoki unga yaqin kelasiz.

— I encountered a sea turtle while I was swimming.
— Men suzayotganimda dengiz toshbaqasiga duch keldim.

sustain [səsˈteɪn] v. — ta'minlamoq
🔻>> To sustain something is to keep it going. >> Biror narsani sustain qilish uni davom ettirish degani.

— Wind power is a clean way to sustain a city with energy.
— Shamol energiyasi - shaharni energiya bilan ta'minlashning toza usuli.

preach [priːtʃ] v. — va'z o'qimoq
🔻>> To preach is to talk about and promote a religious idea. >> To preach bu diniy g'oya haqida gapirish va uni targ'ib qilish.

— Aaron often preached about living an honest life.
— Horun ko'pincha halol hayot haqida va'z qilardi.

benefactor [benəfӕktər] n. — muruvvat ko'rsatuvchi
🔻>> A benefactor is a person who gives money to help someone. >> A benefactor birortasiga yordam berish uchun unga pul beruvchi shaxs.

— The student’s benefactor gave him money to spend on his studies.
— Talabaning xayrixoh insoni unga o'qishga sarflash uchun pul berdi.

arise [əˈraɪz] v. — paydo bo'lmoq, tug'ilmoq
🔻>> To arise is to happen. >> To arise bu sodir bo'lmoq degani.

— Difficulties arose with his computer because it was old.
— Uning kompyuteri bilan qiyinchiliklar sodir bo'ldi, chunki u eski edi.

chimney [tʃɪmnɪ] n. — mo'ri 
🔻>> A chimney is a tall pipe used to carry smoke out of a building. >> A chimney bu binodan tutun chiqarish uchun ishlatiladigan baland quvur.

— The cat was on the roof sitting next to the chimney.
— Haligi mushuk tomda, mo'rining yonida o'tirgan edi.

exceed [ɪkˈsiːd] v. — oshirib yubormoq
🔻>> To exceed is to be more than something. >> To exceed biror narsadan ko'ra ko'proq bo'lish degani.

— Since I exceeded my limit, I decided to get rid of my credit cards.
— Limitdan oshganim uchun kredit kartalarimdan voz kechishga qaror qildim.

charitable [tʃærətəbəl] adj. — marhamatli
🔻>> When someone is charitable, they help people who are in need. >> Qachonki birortasi charitable bo'lsa, u muhtoj odamlarga yordam beradi.

— My sister was charitable enough to help me buy my first house.
— Opam menga birinchi uyimni sotib olishga yordam beradigan darajada marhamatli edi.

humble [hʌmbl] adj. — kamtar, tavozeli
🔻>> People who are humble do not believe that they are better than other people. >> Humble bo'lgan odamlar qolganlardan yaxshiroq ekanligiga ishonishmaydi.

— Even though Bob is the smartest boy in his class, he is humble.
— Bob sinfida eng aqlli bo'lishiga qaramasdan, u kamtar.
Unit 2:
caretaker [kɛərteɪkər] — qarovchi, g'amxo'r
🔻>> A caretaker is a person who takes care of very young, old, or sick people. >> A caretaker juda yosh, qari yoki kasal odamga g'amxo'rlik qiladigan shaxs.

— My grandmother’s caretaker helps her get around the house.
— Buvimning qarovchisi hovli atrofida aylanishiga yordam beradi.

awkward [ɔːkwərd] adj. — noqulay, hijolatli
🔻>> If something is awkward, it is embarrassing and uncomfortable. >> Agar biror narsa awkward bo'lsa, u hijolat qiladigan va noqulay bo'ladi. 

— After dropping his coffee cup, Robbie felt awkward.
— Kofe idishini tashlab yuborgandan so'ng, Robbi noqulay ahvolga tushdi.

overlook [əuvəˈluk] v. — ahamiyat bermaslik 
🔻>> To overlook something is to not notice it, or to not realize that it is important. >> Biror narsani overlook qilish bu uning ahamiyatini sezmaslik yoki anglamaslik.

— Brenda overlooked the last step and had a bad fall.
— Brenda oxirgi qadamni e'tiborsiz qoldirdi va yiqilib tushdi.

hut [hʌt] n. — kulba, chayla
🔻>> A hut is a house made of wood, grass, or mud that has only one or two rooms. >> A hut yog'och, pohol yoki loydan yasalgan bitta yoki ikkita xonasi bor uy.

— We all went into the hut to sleep.
— Biz hammamiz uxlash uchun kulbaga kirdik.

ridiculous [rɪˈdɪkjələs] adj. — bema'ni, kulguli
🔻>> If something is ridiculous, it is silly or strange. >> Agar biror narsa ridiculous bo'lsa, u ahmoqona yoki g'alati.

— Steve looked ridiculous with those huge blue sunglasses.
— Stiv katta ko'k ko'zoynak bilan g'alati ko'rinardi.

venture [ventʃər] v. — xatarli joyga bormoq
🔻>> To venture is to go to a place that may be dangerous. >> To venture xatarli bo'lishi mumkin bo'lgan joyga borish degani.

— Even though it was dangerous, they ventured up the mountain.
— Bu xavfli bo'lsa ham, ular tog'ga ko'tarilishdi.

satisfactory [sætɪsˈfæktərɪ] adj. — qoniqarli
🔻>> If something is satisfactory, it is good enough. >> Agar biror narsa satisfactory bo'lsa, u yetarlicha yaxshi bo'ladi. 

— Mina often received satisfactory grades since she studied so hard.
— Mina qattiq o'qigani sababli odatda qoniqarli baho olar edi.

repay [riːˈpeɪ] v. — qarzni to'lamoq
🔻>> To repay is to pay back or to reward someone or something. >> To repay bu kimgadir yoki biror narsaga pul to'lash yoki mukofotlash.

— She repaid her friend for all of his hard work with a small gift.
— U do'stining barcha mehnatlari uchun kichik sovg'a bilan to'ladi.

discourage [dɪsˈkə:rɪdʒ] v. — umidsizlantirmoq, fikridan qaytarmoq 
🔻>> To discourage someone is to make them feel less excited about something. >> Birovni discourage qilish bu uning biror narsadan unchalik qiziqmasligini his qilishdir.

— Mr. Perry discouraged the students from quitting school.
— Janob Perri o'quvchilarni maktabni tashlab ketish fikridan qaytardi.

acquire [əˈkwaɪər] v. — topib olmoq, orttirmoq
🔻>> To acquire something is to gain possession of it. >> Biror narsaga acquire qilish unga egalik qilish.

— Tina acquired a strange package yesterday.
— Kecha Tina g'alati paketga ega bo'ldi.

newcomer [njuːˌkʌmə:r] n. — yangi kelgan kishi
🔻>> A newcomer is a person who has recently arrived at a place or a group. >> A newcomer yaqinda biror joyga yoki guruhga kelgan odam.

— The students happily welcomed the newcomer to the school.
— O'quvchilar maktabga yangi kelganni xursandchilik bilan kutib olishdi.

deceive [dɪˈsiːv] v. — aldamoq, yolg'on gapirmoq
🔻>> To deceive someone is to make them believe something that is not true. >> Birortasini deceive qilish uni biror yolg'on narsaga ishontirish degani.

— He tried to deceive his friends as they were playing a game.
— U do'stlarini o'yin o'ynayotgan paytda aldashga urindi.

wheat [hwiːt] n. — bug'doy
🔻>> Wheat is a plant which makes grain. Wheat grain is used to make bread. >> Wheat don solasigan o'simlik. Bug'doy doni non qilish uchun foydalaniladi.

— The field of golden wheat was ready to be harvested.
— Oltin bug'doy dalasi o'rim-yig'imga tayyor edi.

hatred [heɪtrɪd] n. — nafrat, yoqtirmaslik
🔻>> Hatred is a strong feeling of not liking someone or something. >> Hatred birortasi yoki biror narsani yoqtirmaslik tuyg'usi.

— I have a hatred for the taste of medicine.
— Menda dori hidiga yoqtirmaslik tuyg'usi bor.

fake [feɪk] adj. — sun'iy, yasama
🔻>> If something is fake, it is made to look real in order to trick people. >> Agar biror narsa fake bo'lsa, u odamlarni chalg'itish uchun haqiqiyga o'xshab yasalgan bo'ladi. 

— The model was wearing fake eyelashes.
— Model yasama kiprik taqayotgan edi.

lodge [lɒdʒ] n. — ovchilar uyi
🔻>> A lodge is a house in the mountains, used by people who hunt or fish. >> A lodge ovchi va baliqchilar tomonidan ishlatiladigan tog'lardagi uy.

— During our ski trip, we stayed at a lodge.
— Chang'i sayohati paytida biz ovchilar uyida qoldik.

inferior [ɪnˈfɪərɪər] adj. — past sifatli, sifati yomon. 
🔻>> If something is inferior, it is not as good as something else. >> Agar biror narsa inferior bo'lsa, u boshqa biror narsachalik yaxshi emas.

— Cars built a hundred years ago are inferior to ones built today.
— Yuz yil oldin qurilgan mashinalar hozirgi qurilganlardan past sifatli.

offense [əfens] n. — jinoyat, qonunbuzarlik
🔻>> An offense is behavior that is wrong or breaks a law. >> An offense bu noto'g'ri yoki qonunni buzgan xatti-harakatlar.

— Stealing a car is a very serious offense.
— Mashinani o'g'irlash - o'ta og'ir jinoyat.

shepherd [ʃepə:rd] n. — cho'pon, podachi 
🔻>> A shepherd is a person who protects and cares for sheep. >> A shepherd qo'ylarga g'amxo'rlik qiladigan va ularni himoya qiladigan shaxs.

— The shepherd moved the sheep to another field.
— Cho'pon qo'ylarni boshqa dalaga ko'chirib o'tkazdi.

neglect [nɪˈglekt] v. — mensimay qaramoq, beparvo bo'lmoq 
🔻>> To neglect someone or something is to not take care of it properly. >> Biror kishini yoki biror narsani neglect qilish bu unga to'g'ri g'amxo'rlik qilmaslik.

— William neglected his room, so it is a complete mess.
— Uilyam o'z xonasini e'tiborsiz qoldirdi, shuning uchun u butunlay tartibsiz.
Unit 3:
offend [əˈfend] v. — xafa qilmoq, ranjitmoq
🔻>> To offend someone means to make them angry or upset. >> Birortasini offend qilish uni xafa qilish yoki jahlini chiqarishni anglatadi.

— They were both offended by what they had said to each other.
— Ikkalasi ham bir-birlariga aytgan gaplaridan ranjishdi.

alley [ælɪ] n. — tor ko'cha
🔻>> An alley is a narrow road behind houses or buildings. >> An alley uylar va binolar ortidagi tor yo'l. 

— The alley behind my house looks dirty.
— Uyim ortidagi tor ko'cha iflos ko'rinadi.

irritate [ɪrəteɪt] v. — g'azablantirmoq
🔻>> To irritate means to annoy someone. >> To irritate birortasini jahlini chiqarish degani.

— She was irritated when her brother told her that he had lost her camera.
— Akasi kamerasini yo'qotib qo'yganini aytganda, u g'azablandi.

sensation [senˈseɪʃən] n. — his, tuyg'u
🔻>> A sensation is a feeling a person gets from their senses. >> A sensation bu odamning his-tuyg'ularidan kelib chiqqan tuyg'u.

— Mom got a painful sensation in her head from the loud noise.
— Onam baland ovozdan boshida og'riqli tuyg'uni his qildi.

disgrace [dɪsˈgreɪs] n. — uyat, sharmandalik
🔻>> Disgrace is a feeling of shame. >> Disgrace sharmandalik tuyg'usi.

— He felt a sense of disgrace after failing his big exam.
— U katta imtihonidan yiqilganidan so'ng, sharmandalik tuyg'usini his etdi.

ax [ӕks] n. — bolta
🔻>> An ax is a tool used to cut wood. >> An ax yog'och kesish uchun ishlatiladigan uskuna.

— She used an ax to cut some wood for the fire.
— U olovga yog'och kesish uchun boltani ishlatdi.

scar [skɑːr] n. — chandiq 
🔻>> A scar is a mark on the skin after a wound heals. >> A scar yara bitganidan keyin teridagi iz.

— The monster had horrible scars on his cheek and forehead.
— Yirtqichning yonoqlari va peshonalarida dahshatli chandiqlari bor edi.

grateful [greɪtfəl] adj. — minnatdor
🔻>> When you are grateful for something, you are happy that it happened. >> Agar siz biror narsadan grateful bo'lsangiz, siz uning sodir bo'lganidan hursand bo'lasiz.
