— The girls were grateful to have a chance to spend time with their grandfather.
— Qizlar bobosi bilan vaqt o'tkazish imkoniyatidan minnatdor bo'lishdi.

tease [tiːz] v. — mazax qilmoq, ermak qilmoq
🔻>> To tease someone means to laugh at or make fun of them. >> Birortasini tease qilish uni ustidan kulish yoki uni ermak qilish degani.

— Jake teased Charlie because he was the new student.
— Jek Charlini ustidan kuldi, chunki u yangi o'quvchi edi.

valentine [væləntaɪn] n. — mashuqa, yor
🔻>> A valentine is someone you love or admire with great affection. >> A valentine bu siz sevgan yoki katta muhabbat bilan qoyil qoldirgan odam.

— Harry wanted Molly to be his valentine.
— Garri Mollini uning sevgilisi bo'lishini xohlardi.

sled [sled] n. — chana 
🔻>> A sled is a small vehicle that you use on snow. >> A sled siz qorda foydalanadigan kichik transport.

— Marvin likes to ride his sled down the hill in winter.
— Marvin qishda chanasida tepalikdan pastga tushishni yaxshi ko'radi.

decent [diːsənt] adj. — qoniqarli, juda yaxshi
🔻>> When something is decent, it is OK or good enough. >> Qachonki biror narsa decent bo'lsa, u yetarlicha yaxshi bo'ladi. 

— Eric did a decent job painting the fence.
— Erik devorni bo'yab juda yaxshi ish qildi.

pine [paɪn] n. — qarag'ay
🔻>> A pine is a type of tree that is tall and thin. >> A pine qalin va uzun bo'lgan daraxtning bir turi.

— There were many beautiful pine trees in the forest.
— O'rmonda juda ko'p ajoyib qarag'ay daraxtlari bor edi.

overnight [ouvərnait] adv. — tuni bilan
🔻>> When something happens overnight, it happens during the night. >> Qachonki biror narsa overnight sodir bo'lsa, u tun payti sodir bo'ladi. 

— The campers stayed in the tent overnight.
— Sayyohlar tuni bilan chodirda qolishdi.

persist [pə:rsɪst] v. — davom ettirmoq, qat'iy turmoq
🔻>> To persist means to keep doing something even when it is hard. >> To persist biror narsani qiyin bo'lishiga qaramay davom ettirish degani. 

— Even though the lesson was difficult, he persisted until he understood.
— Dars qiyin bo'lishiga qaramay, u tushunguncha davom etdi.

elbow [elbou] n. — tirsak
🔻>> The elbow is the middle part of a person’s arm that lets you bend it. >> The elbow egilishga yordam beradigan inson qo'lining o'rta qismi.

— She pointed to her elbow to show me where she hurt herself.
— U menga qayerda zarar etkazganini ko'rsatish uchun tirsagiga ishora qildi.

loose [luːs] adj. — bo'sh, mahkamlanmagan
🔻>> When something is loose, it is not held in place well. >> Agar biror narsa loose bo'lsa, u yaxshi ushlab turilmaydi.

— The bolt was loose, so I tightened it with the wrench.
— Bolt bo'shab qoldi, shuning uchun uni kalit bilan mahkamladim.

chore [tʃɔːr] n. — majburiy yumush
🔻>> A chore is a job that you have to do but don’t like. >> A chore siz yoqtirmaydigan lekin qilishingiz kerak bo'lgan ish.

— It’s Nikki’s chore to do the dishes every Tuesday and Wednesday night.
— Har seshanba va chorshanba kechasi idishlarni yuvish Nikkining vazifasi.

kid [kid] v. — hazillashmoq
🔻>> To kid is to make a joke to make someone believe something which is not true. >> To kid biror to'g'ri bo'lmagan narsaga ishontirib hazl qilish degani.

— I am not really mad. I was kidding when I said I was angry.
— Men, albatta, aqldan ozgan emasman. Men jahlim chiqqanini aytganimda hazillashgandim.

bunch [bʌntʃ] n. — bir bosh, bir dasta
🔻>> A bunch is a group of the same things. >> A bunch bir xil narsalar guruhi.

— She was hungry, so she ate the entire bunch of grapes.
— U och edi, shuning uchun u butun uzumni yedi.
Unit 4:
sneeze [sniːz] v. — aksirmoq, chuchkirmoq
🔻>> To sneeze is to suddenly blow air out of your nose and mouth. >> To sneeze to'satdan burun va og'izdan havo chiqarib yuborish.

— He sneezed after smelling the flower.
— Gulni hidlaganidan so'ng u aksirdi.

passion [pæʃən] n. — kuchli ehtiros
🔻>> Passion is a very strong feeling of wanting to do something. >> Passion biror narsa qilishni xohlashning juda kuchli tuyg'usi.

— She had a passion for dancing.
— Uning raqsga ishtiyoqi baland edi.

whistle [hwɪsəl] v. — hushtak chalmoq
🔻>> To whistle is to make a sound by putting your lips together and blowing. >> To whistle lablaringizni bir-biriga bog'lab, puflab ovoz chiqarish.

— Ashe was listening to music, Daryl whistled.
— Esh musiqa tinglayotgan edi, Deril hushtak chaldi.

pulse [pʌls] n. — puls, yurak urishi
🔻>> A pulse is the beat of the heart. >> A pulse bu yurak urishi.

— The doctor checked the patient’s pulse by feeling his wrist.
— Shifokor bilagini his qilib bemorning pulsini tekshirdi.

refresh [rɪˈfreʃ] v. — tetiklashtirmoq
🔻>> To refresh someone is to make them feel less hot or tired. >> Biror kishini refresh qilish bu uning isishi yoki charchashini kamaytiradi.

— The baby was refreshed after taking a cool bath.
— Chaqaloq sovuq dushdan keyin tetiklandi.

mankind [mænˈkaɪnd] n. — insoniyat
🔻>> Mankind is all of the world’s people. >> Mankind butun dunyo odamlari.

— All of mankind has to work to make this a better world.
— Bu dunyoni yaxshiroq qilish uchun butun insoniyat ishlashi kerak.

dip [dip] v. — botirmoq
🔻>> To dip something is to put part of it into a liquid for a short time. >> Biror narsani dip qilish uning bir qismini suyuqlikka bir muddat solish degani.

— Laurel dipped her strawberry into the chocolate.
— Laurel qulupnayini shokoladga botirdi.

compact [kəmˈpækt] adj. — ixcham
🔻>> If something is compact, it is smaller than normal. >> Agar biror narsa compact bo'lsa, u odatdagidan kichik bo'ladi. 

— A laptop computer is much more compact than a desktop model.
— Laptop kompyuter desktopdan ancha kichikroq.

bloom [bluːm] v. — gullamoq
🔻>> When a plant blooms, it makes flowers. >> Qachonki o'simlik bloom qilsa, u gullaydi.

— Roses look so pretty when they bloom.
— Atirgul gullaganda chiroyli ko'rinadi.

spice [spaɪs] n. — ziravor
🔻>> A spice is a flavor for food and drinks. >> A spice bu taom va ichimliklar uchun maza, lazzat.

— Two common spices found in many homes are salt and pepper.
— Ko'p uylarda uchraydigan ikkita oddiy ziravor - tuz va murch.

wool [wʊl] n. — jun, yung 
🔻>> Wool is the hair that a sheep has. >> Wool qo'ylarda bo'ladigan jun.

— Grandma wants to use the blue wool to knit me a sweater.
— Buvim ko'k jundan foydalanib, menga sviter to'qimoqchi.

curl [kɜːrl] n. — zulf, gajak
🔻>> A curl is a small piece of something with a round shape. >> A curl aylana shakldagi biror narsaning kichik bo'lagi.

— The colorful ribbons were bent into curls.
— Rangli lentalar jingalaklarga bukilgan.

leisure [liːʒə:r] n. — bo'sh vaqt
🔻>> Leisure is time when you do not have to do work. >> Leisure biror ish qilishingiz kerak bo'lmaydigan vaqt.

— Tom likes to listen to music in her leisure time.
— Tom bo'sh vaqtida musiqa tinglashni yaxshi ko'radi.

fairy [fɛərɪ] n. — elf
🔻>> A fairy is a small, magic creature with wings. >> A fairy kichik, qanotli mavjudot.

— There are usually fairies in fantasy stories.
— Fantastik hikoyalarda odatda elflar bo'ladi.

dessert [diˈzəːrt] n. — desert
🔻>> Dessert is a sweet food that you eat after a meal. >> Dessert ovqatdan keyin yeyiladigan shirin taom.

— Kayla wants ice cream for dessert.
— Keyla desert uchun muzqaymoq xohlayapti.

pillow [pɪlou] n. — yostiq
🔻>> A pillow is something that you put your head on when you sleep. >> A pillow uxlaganda boshingizni qo'yadigan narsa.

— When I travel, I usually take along my favorite pillow.
— Sayohat qilganimda, odatda yoqtirgan yostig'imni olib olaman.

eclipse [ɪˈklɪps] n. — quyosh (yoki oy) tutilishi
🔻>> An eclipse is an occasion when the moon moves in front of the sun. >> An eclipse oy quyosh ro'parasiga keladigan vaziyat. 

— A complete eclipse of the sun is a very rare occurrence.
— Quyoshning to'liq tutilishi juda kamdan-kam sodir bo'ladigan hodisa.

distant [dɪstənt] adj. — uzoq, olisdagi
🔻>> If something is distant, it is far away. >> Agar biror narsa distant bo'lsa, u juda uzoq bo'ladi. 

— Michael could barely see the distant island.
— Maykl olisdagi orolni arang ko'ra oldi.

decay [dɪˈkeɪ] v. — chirimoq, yemirilmoq
🔻>> To decay is to be destroyed naturally. >> To decay tabiiy ravishda barbod bo'lish degani.

— The old wooden house was slowly decaying.
— Eski yog'och uy sekin asta yemirilayotgan edi.

grace [greɪs] n. — silliq va jozibali harakat 
🔻>> Grace is a quality of moving in a smooth, relaxed and attractive way. >> Grace - silliq va jozibali tarzda harakatlanish sifati.

— The ballerina danced with grace.
— Balerina jozibali harakatlar bilan raqsga tushdi.
Unit 5:
scare [skɛə:r] v. — qo'rqitmoq
🔻>> To scare means to cause one to feel frightened. >> To scare birortasiga qo'rquvni his qildirish degani.

— I was scared by the sight of the monster.
— Men yirtqichni ko'rib qo'rqib ketdim.

riddle [rɪdl] n. — topishmoq
🔻>> A riddle is a question that is difficult to answer but meant to be funny. >> A riddle bu javob berish qiyin, lekin kulgili bo'lishi kerak bo'lgan savol.

— I could not answer Wendy’s riddle, but it made me laugh.
— Men Vendining topishmog'iga javob bera olmadim, lekin u meni kuldirdi.

rot [rɒt] n. — chirimoq
🔻>> When something rots, it slowly gets softer and is destroyed. >> Qachonki biror narsa rot bo'lsa, u sekin asta yumshoqlashib boradi va barbod bo'ladi. 

— The old log began to rot in the forest.
— Eski yog'och o'rmonda chiriy boshladi.

acquaint [əˈkweɪnt] v. — tanishtirmoq 
🔻>> To acquaint is to get to know something or someone. >> To acquaint birortasi yoki biror narsani tanishtirish degani.

— Nancy acquainted herself with the new computer.
— Nensi yangi kompyuter bilan tanishdi.

shortly [ʃɔːrtlɪ] adv. — tez orada
🔻>> If something will happen shortly, it will happen very soon. >> Agar biror narsa shortly sodir bo'lsa, u tez orada sodir bo'ladi. 

— My workday will end shortly.
— Mening ish kunim tez orada tugaydi.

pirate [paɪərət] n. — dengiz qaroqchisi
🔻>> A pirate is a sailor who steals things from other boats. >> A pirate boshqa qayiqlardan narsalarni o'g'irlaydigan dengizchi.

— Pirates are very scary characters.
— Qaroqchilar juda qo'rqinchli obrazlar.

cemetery [seməteri] n. — qabriston, mozor
🔻>> A cemetery is where people are buried when they die. >> A cemetery odamlar vafot etgandan so'ng dafn etiladigan joy.

— Some people are scared of cemeteries.
— Ba'zi odamlar qabristonlardan qo'rqishadi.

publication [pʌbləˈkeɪʃən] n. — nashr qilingan asar
🔻>> A publication is something printed, like a newspaper or book. >> A publication gazeta yoki kitobga o'xshagan nashr qilingan narsa.

— She’s been a subscriber to that publication for over ten years.
— U o'n yildan oshiq ushbu nashrga obuna bo'lgan.

nourish [nə:rɪʃ] v. — ovqatlantirmoq
🔻>> To nourish something is to give it food that it needs to live. >> Biror narsani nourish qilish unga yashash uchun zarur bo'lgan ovqatni berish.

— A good mother will nourish her baby every day.
— Yaxshi ona chaqalog'ini har kuni ovqatlantiradi.

wicked [wɪkɪd] adj. — yovuz, vaxshiy
🔻>> If something is wicked, it is very bad or evil. >> Agar biror narsa wicked bo'lsa, u juda yomon yoki yovuz.

— My boss is a very wicked man.
— Mening xo'jayinim juda yovuz inson.

starve [stɑːrv] v. — och qolmoq, ochdan o'lmoq
🔻>> If a person starves, they do not get enough to eat and sometimes die. >> Agar biror inson starve bo'lsa, unda yegani yetarli narsa bo'lmaydi va ba'zida o'ladi.

— During the war, many people starved.
— Urush mobaynida ko'p odam ochdan o'ldi.

disguise [dɪsˈgaɪz] n. — niqob, maska
🔻>> A disguise is something you wear so people cannot tell who you are. >> A disguise odamlar tanib qolmasin deb taqiladigan narsa.

— Everyone knew that it was Dad in the Santa disguise.
— Hamma bu Qorbobo niqobidagi ularning otasi ekanligini bilardi.

curse [kə:rs] v. — qarg'amoq, la'natlamoq
🔻>> To curse someone or something is to hope that bad things happen to them. >> Birortasi yoki biror narsani curse qilish unga yomon narsa sodir bo'lishini xohlash degani.

— The witch cursed the village.
— Yalmog'iz qishloqni la'natladi.

spoil [spɔɪl] v. — achimoq, aynimoq
🔻>> If something spoils, it turns bad or rots. >> Agar biror narsa spoil bo'lsa,  u yomonlashadi yoki chiriydi.

— We left the fruit out too long, and it spoiled.
— Biz mevani uzoq vaqt tashqarida saqladik va u aynib qoldi.

fancy [fænsɪ] adj. — antiqa, ajoyib
🔻>> If something is fancy, it is nicer than normal. >> Agar biror narsa fancy bo'lsa, u odatdagidan yaxshiroq. 

— Their table was all set for a fancy dinner.
— Stullar ajoyib kechki ovqat uchun tayyorlangan edi.

thrill [θrɪl] n. — hayajon
🔻>> A thrill is an exciting feeling. >> A thrill hayajon tuyg'usi.

— The boys enjoy the thrill of surfing a big wave.
— Bolalar katta to'lqinda sayr qilish hayajonidan zavqlanishadi.

flashlight [flæʃlaɪt] n. — fonar, fonus 
🔻>> A flashlight is a small electric light that you carry in your hand. >> A flashlight qo'lingizda olib yuradigan kichik elektron yoritgich.

— We took a flashlight when we went camping.
— Lagerga borganimizda o'zimiz bilan fonar oldik.

skeleton [skelətn] n. — skelet 
🔻>> A skeleton is the bones of a body. >> A skeleton tananing suyaklari.

— There is a skeleton in the science classroom.
— Ilmiy xonada skelet bor.

inhabitant [ɪnˈhæbətənt] n. — istiqomat qiluvchi
🔻>> An inhabitant is a person who lives in a certain place. >> An inhabitant ma'lum joyda yashovchi shaxs.

— The number of inhabitants in the countryside is increasing.
— Qishloq aholisining soni ortib bormoqda.

hood [hʊd] n. — kapyushon
🔻>> A hood is part of a coat that goes over your head. >> A hood boshingizga kiyadigan, paltoning bir qismi.

— She put on her hood to keep her head warm.
— U boshini issiq tutishi uchun kapyushonini kiydi.
Unit 6:
bulletin [bulətin] n. — qisqa yangiliklar
🔻>> A bulletin is a news report that talks about very recent and important events. >> A bulletin juda yaqinda sodir bo'lgan va muhim voqealar haqida aytiladigan yangiliklar.

— There was a live bulletin reporting on the economy of the city.
— Shahar iqtisodiyoti haqida jonli qisqa yangiliklar bo'layotgan edi.

chop [tʃɒp] v. — tog'ramoq
🔻>> To chop something means to cut it into pieces with a tool. >> Biror narsani chop qilish uni mayda bo'laklarga bo'lish degani.

— Mom chopped some vegetables to put into the stew.
— Onam sho'rva qo'yish uchun bir nechta sabzavotlarni to'g'radi.

district [dɪstrɪkt] n. — tuman, okrug
🔻>> A district is a small part of a city, county, state, or country. >> A district bu shahar, tuman, shtat yoki mamlakatning kichik qismi.

— I live in a residential district of Seattle, Washington.
— Men Vashington shtatining Sietl tumanida yashayman.

stir [stəːr] v. — aralashtirmoq
🔻>> To stir something means to mix it using something small, like a spoon. >> Biror narsani stir qilish biror qoshiqqa o'xshagan kichkina narsadan foydalanib uni aralashtirish degani.

— Mom stirred the batter until it was smooth.
— Onam xamirni silliq bo'lguncha aralashtirdi.

senator [senətər] n. — senator 
🔻>> A senator is someone who makes laws for a state. >> A senator davlat uchun qonunlar qabul qiladigan shaxs.

— The young senator promised to make laws that would help the people.
— Yosh senator odamlarga yordam beradigan qonun qabul qilishga va'da berdi.

console [kənˈsoul] v. — taskin bermoq, yupatmoq
🔻>> To console someone who is sad means to make them comforted. >> Birorta hafa insonni console qilish uni yupatish degani.

— When my dog ran away, my dad consoled me.
— Kuchugim qochib ketganda, dadam meni yupatdi.

drawer [drɔːər] n. — g'aladon, tortma
🔻>> A drawer is a small part in furniture that is used to store things. >> A drawer narsalar saqlash uchun ishlatiladigan mebel ichidagi kichik qism.

— I put my clothes into the empty drawers.
— Men kiyimlarimni bo'sh g'aladonlarga soldim.

tremendous [triˈmendəs] adj. — juda katta, ulkan
🔻>> When something is tremendous, it is very large. >> Qachonki biror narsa tremendous bo'lsa, u juda katta bo'ladi. 

— The Earth’s oceans are filled with a tremendous amount of water.
— Yerning okeanlari juda katta miqdordagi suv bilan to'lgan.

tap [tæp] v. — asta urmoq, bosmoq
🔻>> To tap something is to hit it lightly. >> Biror narsani tap qilish uni sekinlik bilan urish degani.

— He tapped the keys of the keyboard to write a short word.
— U qisqa so'z yozish uchun klaviatura tugmachalarini bosdi.

closet [klɒzɪt] n. — devoriy shkaf, garderob 
🔻>> A closet is a small room used to store things. >> A closet narsalar saqlash uchun ishlatiladigan kichik xona.

— Marie has many clothes inside o f her closet.
— Marida devoriy shkafining ichida ko'p kiyimlari bor.

worm [wəːrm] n. — chuvalchang
🔻>> A worm is a small animal with a long, thin body. >> A worm uzun, ingichka tanali kichik hayvon.

— Worms are often used to help catch fish.
— Chuvalchanglar odatda baliq ovlashga yordam berish uchun ishlatiladi.

underneath [ʌndərniːθ] prep. — tagida, ostida
🔻>> When something is underneath something else, it is below or lower than it. >> Qachonki biror narsa boshqa narsaning underneath qismida bo'lsa, u undan pastda bo'ladi. 

— The roots of a tree are located underneath the ground.
— Daraxtning ildizi yer ostida joylashgan bo'ladi.

bump [bʌmp] n. — g'urra, shish
🔻>> A bump is a small raised area on a surface. >> A bump tekis yuzadagi azgina ko'tarilgan joy.

— The monkey got a bump on his head because he was hit by a rock.
— Maymun boshini qoyaga urib olganligi uchun boshi shish bo'ldi.

skull [skʌl] n. — bosh suyagi
🔻>> A skull is the hard part of your head. Your brain is inside of it. >> A skull boshingizning qattiq qismi. Miyangiz uning ichida bo'ladi. 

— The brain is protected by the skull.
— Miya bosh suyagi bilan himoya qilinadi.

grasp [græsp] v. — ushlamoq, tutmoq
🔻>> To grasp something means to hold it. >> Biror narsani grasp qilish uni ushlash degani.

— He grasped the bag of money tightly.
— U puli bor sumkani mahkam ushladi.

broadcast [brɔ:dkæst] n. — teleko'rsatuv, radioeshittirish
🔻>> A broadcast is a television or radio show. >> A broadcast tele yoki radio ko'rsatuv.

— We watched the broadcast of the local news on TV.
— Biz televizorda mahalliy yangiliklar haqidagi teleko'rsatuvni ko'rdik.

rear [rɪə:r] n. — orqa taraf 
🔻>> When something is in the rear of something, it is in the back. >> Qachonki biror narsa boshqa biror narsaning rear tarafida bo'lsa, u orqa tarafida bo'ladi. 

— The man loaded the rear of his truck with boxes.
— Bu odam yuk mashinasining orqa qismiga qutilar yuklagan.

execute [eksɪkjuːt] v. — qatl etmoq
🔻>> To execute someone means to kill them as a legal punishment. >> Birortasini execute qilish jazo sifatida uni o'ldirish degani.

— Some people are executed for serious crimes.
— Ba'zi odamlar jiddiy jinoyatlar uchun qatl etiladi.

endure [enˈdjuər] v. — chidamoq, sabr qilmoq
🔻>> To endure something tough means to do or go through it. >> Qattiq narsaga endure qilish  - bu sabr qilish yoki undan o'tish degani.

— She had to endure her husband shouting all day long.
— Erining kun bo'yi baqir-chaqiriga chidashga majbur bo'ldi.

alert [əˈləːrt] — ogohlantirmoq
🔻>> To alert someone is to tell or warn them about something. >> Birortasini alert qilish unga biror narsa haqida aytish yoki ogohlantirish.

— The fire alarm alerted us that there was a problem.
— Yong'in signalizatsiyasi muammo borligi haqida bizni ogohlantirdi.
Unit 7:
mutual [mjuːtʃuəl] adj. — o'zaro, ikki taraflama
🔻>> If something is mutual, it is felt in the same way by two or more people. >> Agar biror narsa mutual boʻlsa, uni ikki yoki undan ortiq kishi bir xil tarzda his qiladi.

— Robert likes Sarah. The feeling is mutual.
— Robert Sarani yaxshi ko'radi. Ularning tuyg'ulari o'zaro.

brilliant [brɪljənt] adj. — aqlli, intelligent 
🔻>> If someone is brilliant, they are very smart. >> Agar birortasi brilliant bo'lsa, u juda aqlli bo'ladi.

— My younger sister is brilliant for someone her age.
— Mening kichik singlim uning yoshidagilarga qaraganda juda aqlli.

deaf [def] adj. — kar, qulog'i og'ir
🔻>> When someone is deaf, they cannot hear. >> Qachonki birortasi deaf bo'lsa, u eshita olmaydi.

— Susan was born deaf.
— Syuzan kar bo'lib tug'ilgan.

restore [rɪsˈtɔːr] v. — oldingi joyiga qo'ymoq
🔻>> To restore something is to put it back the way it was. >> Biror narsani restore qilish o'sha narsani eski joyiga qaytarib qo'yish degani.

— Victor restored the old car.
— Viktor eski mashinani tikladi.

refuge [refjuːdʒ] n. — pana joy, xavfsiz joy
🔻>> A refuge is a place where you go to be safe. >> A refuge xavfsiz bo'lish uchun boradigan joy.

— When it started to rain, she found refuge in the house.
— Yomg'ir yog'ishni boshlaganda, u uyda pana joy topdi.

senses [sensiz] n. — sezgi
🔻>> Your senses are how you see, taste, hear, feel and smell. >> Sizning senses qanday ko'rish, ta'm, eshitish, his qilish va hidlashdir.

— It would be hard to live without your five senses.
— Sizning 5 sezgingizsiz yashash qiyin bo'lar edi.

expedition [ekspədɪʃən] n. — ekspeditsiya
🔻>> An expedition is a long trip, usually to a place very far away. >> An expedition odatda juda uzoq joyga bo'lgan uzoq sayohat.

— They got into their spaceship to begin their expedition.
— Ular o'z ekspeditsiyasini boshlash uchun kosmik kemasiga o'tirishdi.

ambitious [æmˈbɪʃəs] adj. — shuhratparast
🔻>> If someone is ambitious, they want to be rich or successful. >> Agar birortasi ambitious bo'lsa, ular boy yoki muvaffaqiyatli bo'lishni xohlaydi.

— Kendra had to be ambitious to get into medical school.
— Kendra tibbiyot fakultetiga kirish uchun shijoatli bo'lishi kerak edi.

horizon [həˈraɪzən] n. — ufq
🔻>> The horizon is where the sky looks like it meets the ground. >> The horizon  bu osmon yer bilan uchrashganday koʻrinadigan joy.

— The sun clipped below the horizon.
— Quyosh ufqning ostiga tushdi.

loyal [lɔɪəl] adj. — sodiq, vafodor
🔻>> To be loyal to something or someone is to agree to always help them. >> Biror narsaga yoki kimgadir loyal bo'lish - ularga doim yordam berishga rozi bo'lish degani.

— The three friends are very loyal to each other.
— Uch do'st bir-biriga juda sodiq.

mayor [meiə:r] n. — hokim
🔻>> The mayor is the person in charge of a city. >> The mayor bu shahar uchun mas'ul shaxs.

— The mayor o f my hometown is quite a powerful speaker.
— Mening tug‘ilib o‘sgan shahrimning hokimi juda kuchli ma’ruzachi.

bark [bɑːrk] v. — vovullamoq
🔻>> When a dog barks, it makes a short, loud noise. >> Qachonki it bark qilsa, u qisqa baland ovoz chiqaradi.

— The dog barked loudly and frighteningly.
— Haligi it baland va qo'rqitadigan qilib vovulladi.

bay [beɪ] n. — qo'ltiq, ko'rfaz
🔻>> A bay is an area near the ocean where the land goes inward. >> A bay okean yaqinidagi quruqlik ichkariga kiradigan hudud.

— The Golden Gate Bridge crosses San Francisco Bay.
— Oltin Darvoza Ko'prigi San Fransisko Qo'ltig'ini kesib o'tadi.

enthusiastic [eneu:ziæstik] adj. — zavqlangan
🔻>> To be enthusiastic about something is to be excited by or interested in it. >> Biror narsadan enthusiastic bo'lish, undan zavqlanish yoki unga qiziqish.

— The man was enthusiastic about his job.
— Haligi odam ishidan zavqlangan edi.

complaint [kəmˈpleɪnt] n. — shikoyat, arz 
🔻>> A complaint is something you say to tell people that you don’t like something. >> A complaint siz biror narsani yoqtirmasligingizni birortasiga aytish.

— Mom said she didn’t want to hear my brother’s complaints.
— Onam akamning arzlarini eshitishni xohlamayotganini aytdi.

veterinarian [vetərənɛərɪən] n. — veterinar 
🔻>> A veterinarian is a doctor that takes care of animals. >> A veterinarian hayvonlarga g'amxo'rlik qiladigan doktor.

— Wanda became a veterinarian because she loves dogs.
— Vanda veterinar bo'ldi, chunki u itlarni yaxshi ko'radi.

overweight [ouvərweit] adj. — juda semiz
🔻>> If someone is overweight, they are very fat. >> Agar birortasi overweight bo'lsa, ular juda semiz bo'ladi. 

— Roger eats too much, so now he’s overweight.
— Rojer juda ko'p ovqat yeydi, shuning uchun endi u ortiqcha vaznga ega.

chin [tʃɪn] n. — jag', chakak
🔻>> Your chin is the hard part at the bottom of your face. >> Sizning chin'ingiz bu yuzingizning pastki qattiq qismi.

— Luke pointed to the hair on his chin.
— Luke iyagidagi sochlarga ishora qildi.

abandon [əˈbændən] v. — tashlab ketmoq, tark etmoq
🔻>> To abandon something is to leave it forever or for a long time. >> Biror narsani abandon qilish bu uni butun umr yoki uzoq vaqt tark etish degani.

— The old room had been abandoned years before.
— Eski xona bir necha yillar avval tark etilgan.

rub [rʌb] v. — ishqalamoq
🔻>> To rub something is to push on it and move your hand back and forth. >> Biror narsani rub qilish uni bosib, qo'lingizni oldinga va orqaga siljitish.

— Mom’s feet were sore, so she rubbed them.
— Onamning oyoqlari og'ridi, shuning uchun u ularni ishqaladi.
Unit 8:
sew [sou] v. — tikmoq
🔻>> To sew means to put pieces of cloth together using string. >> To sew mato bo'laklarini ip yordamida birlashtirish.

— I learned to sew when I was a little girl.
— Men tikishni kichkina qizligimda o'rganganman.

ashamed [əˈʃeɪmd] adj. — uyalgan
🔻>> To be ashamed is to feel upset because you did something wrong or bad. >> To be shamed biror yomon yoki noto'g'ri qilgan ishingiz uchun hafa bo'lish.

— He was ashamed when he found out that I knew about his past.
— Men uning o'tmishini bilishimni bilganidan so'ng u uyaldi.

fabric [fæbrɪk] n. — mato, gazlama
🔻>> Fabric is cloth used to make clothes, furniture, etc. >> Fabric kiyim, mebel va boshqa narsalar yasash uchun ishlatiladigan mato.

— The towels were made from a soft fabric.
— Sochiqlar yumshoq matodan qilingan edi.

couch [kaʊtʃ] n. — kushetka, divan
🔻>> A couch is a long, soft seat that many people can sit on. >> A couch ko'pchilik o'tirishi mumkin bo'lgan uzun yumshoq o'rindiq.

— Kim and Martin’s new couch was very expensive.
— Kim va Martinning yangi divani juda qimmat edi.

upwards [ʌpwərdz] adv. — yuqoriga, tepaga
🔻>> If something goes upwards, it moves vertically higher. >> Agar biror narsa upwards tarafga yursa, u yuqoriga qarab yuradi.

— The kite went upwards further and further.
— Varrak tobora yuqoriga ko'tarildi.

arithmetic [əˈrɪθmətɪk] n. — arifmetika 
🔻>> Arithmetic is math. >> Arithmetic bu matematika degani.

— I like to study arithmetic at school.
— Men maktabda arifmetika o'qishni yoqtiraman.

mill [mil] n. — tegirmon
🔻>> A mill is a building where flour is made. >> A mill un ishlab chiqariladigan bino.

— The farmer took his wheat to the mill to make it into flour.
— Fermer un qilish uchun bug'doyni tegirmonga tashladi.

ivory [aɪvərɪ] n. — muguz
🔻>> Ivory is a white, hard substance that comes from elephants. >> Ivory filda bo'ladigan oq, qattiq modda.

— The elephant’s long ivory tusks looked very impressive.
— Filning uzun muguz tishi juda katta ta'sir qoldiradigan edi.

elegant [elɪgənt] adj. — orasta, xushbichim
🔻>> If something is elegant, it is very fancy and pleasing. >> Agar biror narsa elegant bo'lsa, u juda chiroyli va yoqimli.

— In Japan, women wear elegant kimonos on special occasions.
—Yaponiyada ayollar maxsus tadbirlar uchun xushbichim kimano kiyishadi.

coal [koul] n. — ko'mir
🔻>> Coal is a hard black rock that you burn for heat. >> Coal bu siz isitish uchun yoqadigan qora qattiq tosh.

— Many power stations burn coal to produce energy.
— Ko'pgina elektr stantsiyalari energiya ishlab chiqarish uchun ko'mir yoqishadi.

burst [bəːrst] v. — portlamoq
🔻>> To burst is to suddenly break open or apart. >> To burst  to'satdan ochilib yoki parchalanib ketishdir.

— The bomb burst over the city.
— Bomba shahar uzra portladi.

trim [trim] v. — ozroq kesmoq
🔻>> To trim something is to cut it a little bit. >> Biror narsani trim qilish uni bir oz kesish degani.

— I had my hair trimmed this afternoon.
— Bugun tushda sochimni kestirdim.

needle [niːdl] n. — igna, nina 
🔻>> A needle is a small, sharp piece of metal that you use to make or fix clothes. >> A needle siz kiyim tikish uchun ishlatadigan o'tkir temir parchasi. 

— I used a needle to fix the hole in my pants.
— Men shimimdagi teshikni igna bilan tuzatdim.

thread [θred] n. — ip 
🔻>> A thread is a thin piece of string. >> A thread bu ingichka ip.

— I have many different colors of thread at home.
— Uyda mening har xil rangli iplarim bor.

highlands [haɪlənd] n. — yassi tog'lik
🔻>> The highlands are high areas of land, usually with mountains. >> The highlands asosan tog'li baland yerli joylar.

— The man had a small home in the highlands.
— Haligi odamning yassi tog'likda uyi bor edi.

drip [drɪp] v. — tommoq, tomchilamoq
🔻>> When a liquid drips, just a little bit falls at a time. >> Qachonki suyuqlik drip bo'lsa, bir vaqtda juda oz miqdori tomadi.

— I heard water dripping from the faucet.
— Men jo‘mrakdan suv tomayotganini eshitdim.

anniversary [ænəˈvəːrsərɪ] n. — yillik, yubiley
🔻>> An anniversary is a day that celebrates something from the past. >> An anniversary  bu oʻtmishdagi biror narsani nishonlaydigan kun.

— My parents went out to eat for their wedding anniversary.
— Ota-onam to'y yubileylari sababli ko'chaga ovqatlangani chiqishdi.

shed [ʃed] n. — omborxona
🔻>> A shed is a small building where you store things like tools. >> A shed uskunalarga o'xshash narsalar saqlanadigan bino.

— We have a small shed in the backyard for storage.
— Hovlida saqlash uchun kichik omborimiz bor.

carpenter [kɑːrpəntər] n. — duradgor 
🔻>> A carpenter is a person who builds things with wood. >> A carpenter narsalarni yog'ochdan yasovchi shaxs.

— We hired a carpenter to make a cupboard.
— Biz shkaf yasash uchun duradgor yolladik.

polish [pɒlɪʃ] v. — pardoz bermoq
🔻>> To polish something is to rub it in order to make it shiny. >> Biror narsani polish qilish, uni porloq qilish uchun uni ishqalashdir.

— Mark spent all morning polishing his shoes for the wedding.
— Mark ertalab to'y uchun oyoq kiyimlarini sayqallash bilan o'tkazdi.
Unit 9:
ail [eɪl] v. — bezovta qilmoq, og'ritmoq
🔻>> To ail a person or group is to cause difficulty or pain. >> Biror odamni yoki guruhni ail qilish unga qiyinchilik yoki og'riq keltirib chiqarish degani.

— My brother went to the doctor to see what was ailing him.
— Akam uni nima bezovta qiynayotganini bilish uchun shifokorga bordi.

crawl [krɔːl] v. — emaklamoq
🔻>> To crawl is to move slowly on your hands and knees. >> To crawl qo'lingiz va tizzangizda sekin harakatlanish degani.

— The baby crawled across the floor.
— Chaqaloq polda emaklab ketdi.

wrestle [resəl] v. — kurashmoq, bel olishmoq
🔻>> To wrestle is to play a game where you try to push someone to the floor. >> To wrestle  bu kimnidir polga yiqitmoqchi boʻlib oʻyin oʻynashdir.

— My dad loved to wrestle when he was in high school.
— Dadam o‘rta maktabda o‘qib yurganlarida kurashni yaxshi ko‘rardi.

bully [bulɪ] n. — bezori
🔻>> A bully is a person who is mean to others. >> A bully  bu boshqalarga nisbatan yomon munosabatda boʻladigan odam.

— The two bullies always picked on the smaller, weaker kids.
— Ikki bezori har doim kichikroq, zaifroq bolalarni tanlab olishardi.

mercy [məːrsi] n. — rahm-shavqat
🔻>> If you show mercy, you choose not to punish or harm someone. >> Agar siz mercy ko'rsatsangiz, siz birortasini jazolamaslikni yoki unga ziyon yetkazmaslikni tanlagan bo'lasiz.

— He asked his boss for mercy and to not fire him.
— U xo'jayinidan rahm-shafqat so'radi va uni ishdan bo'shatmaslikni so'radi.

carbohydrate [kɑːrbouˈhaɪdreɪt] n. — uglevod
🔻>> Carbohydrates are substances in foods like bread that give you energy. >> Carbohydrates sizga energiya beradigan nonga o'xshash ozuqalardagi moddalar.

— Carbohydrates like rice are a good source of energy for active people.
— Guruch kabi uglevodlar faol odamlar uchun yaxshi energiya manbai hisoblanadi.

bounce [bauns] v. — uchirib yubormoq
🔻>> To bounce is to move something up and away from a surface after hitting it. >> To bounce bu biror narsani urgandan keyin sirtdan yuqoriga va uzoqqa siljitishdir.

— Owen bounced the ball on the ground.
— Ouen yerdagi to‘pni uchirib yubordi.

nod [nɒd] v. — bosh qimirlatmoq
🔻>> To nod is to move your head up and down. >> To nod boshingizni tepaga va pastga qimirlatish degani.

— I nodded my head as I listened to the song.
— Men qo'shiqni eshitayotgandek boshimni qimirlatdim.

sore [sɔːr] adj. — nosog'lom, hasta
🔻>> When a part of your body is sore, it hurts. >> Qachonki tanangizning bir qismi sore bo'lsa, u hasta bo'ladi.

— After lifting the heavy box, Mona’s back was sore.
— Og'ir qutini ko'targanidan so'ng, Monaning orqasi og'rib qoldi.

torture [tɔːrtʃə:r] n. — azob, qiynoq
🔻>> Torture is something that causes you physical or mental pain. >> Torture sizga jismoniy yoki aqliy og'riq beradigan narsa.

— Greg thought that writing the essay was torture.
— Greg esse yozishni azob deb o'yladi.

boast [boust] v. — maqtanmoq
🔻>> To boast is to talk about how good you are. >> To boast siz qanchalik yaxshi ekanligingizni aytish degani.

— We all became tired of listening to him boast about himself all day.
— Hammamiz uning kun bo'yi o'zi haqida maqtanishini eshitishdan charchadik.

quarrel [kwɔ:rəl] v. — janjallashmoq, tortishmoq
🔻>> To quarrel is to argue or fight. >> To quarrel bahslashish yoki jang qilishdir.

— Billy quarreled with his wife about buying a new house.
— Billi rafiqasi bilan yangi uy sotib olish masalasida tortishdi.

dominant [dɒmənənt] adj. — hukmron, ustun
🔻>> When someone or something is dominant, they are stronger than others. >> Qachonki birortasi yoki biror narsa dominant bo'lsa, ular qolganlardan kuchliroq bo'ladi. 

— The gorilla is one of the dominant animals in the jungle.
— Gorilla junglidagi hukmron hayvonlardan biri.

strain [streɪn] v. — zo'r bermoq, qattiq urinmoq
🔻>> To strain is to try very hard. >> To strain juda qattiq harakat qilmoq degani.

— Casey strained to lift the heavy box.
— Kesi og'ir qutini ko'targani zo'r berdi.

dial [daɪəl] n. — tsiferblat
🔻>> A dial is the front of a clock. >> A dial soatning old tarafi.

— I looked at the dial to see what time it was.
— Men soat necha boʻlganini bilish uchun tsiferblatga  qaradim.

rival [raɪvəl] n. — musobaqadosh, raqib
🔻>> A rival is someone that is trying to keep you from getting what you want. >> A rival bu siz xohlagan narsangizga erishishingizga xalaqit beradigan kimsadir.

— The three rivals were all competing for the same job.
— Uch raqib bir xil ish uchun raqobatlashayotgan edi.

ally [ælaɪ] n. — ittifoqchi
🔻>> An ally is someone who agrees to help or support you. >> An ally sizga yordam berishga yoki qo'llashga rozi bo'ladigan shaxs.

— I was happy to find many allies who shared the same opinion as me.
— Men bilan bir xil fikrda bo'lgan ko'plab ittifoqchilarni topganimdan xursand bo'ldim.

defeat [dɪˈfiːt] v. — mag'lub etmoq
🔻>> To defeat someone is to beat them in a game or battle. >> Birortasini defeat qilish uni o'yin yoki bahsda yengish degani.

— The champion defeated the challenger in the boxing match.
— Chempion boks bahsida raqibni mag'lub etdi.

opponent [əˈpounənt] n. — raqib
🔻>> An opponent is someone who fights against you. >> An opponent sizga qarshi urushadigan shaxs.

— On the field, our opponents were too good for us.

sting [stɪŋ] v. — sanchmoq, sanchilmoq
🔻>>To sting is to cause pain by pushing a sharp part into the skin. >> To sting teriga o'tkir qismni sanchish degani.

— The needle stung my arm and made me say, “Ouch!”
— Igna qo‘limga sanchilib, “Of!” deyishga majbur qildi.
Unit 10:
kidnap [kɪdnæp] v. — odam o'g'irlamoq
🔻>> To kidnap someone is to take them illegally. >> Birortasini kidnap qilish, uni noqonuniy olib ketish degani.

— She was terrified to find out her son was kidnapped.
— U o'g'lining o'g'irlab ketilganini bilib qo'rqib ketdi.

rhyme [raɪm] n. — qofiya
🔻>> To rhyme is to have the same sounds at the end of a word. >> To rhyme so'z oxirida bir xil tovushlarga ega bo'lish.

— Humpty Dumpty is an old rhyme that children learn in school.
— Humpty Dumpty - bu bolalar maktabda o'rganadigan eski qofiya.

relief [rɪˈliːf] n. — yengillik
🔻>> Relief is a feeling you get when something bad or challenging ends. >> Relief siz qachonki biror yomon yoki noxush narsa tugaganda his qiladigan tuyg'u.

— I felt a sense of relief when I heard the good news.
— Men yaxshi yangiliklarni eshitganimda yengillik his qildim.

nowhere [nouhwɛə:r] adv. — hech qayerda
🔻>> You use nowhere to say that a place or thing does not exist. >> Biz nowhere'ni biror narsa yoki joy mavjud bo'lmaganda ishlatamiz.

— Unfortunately, water was nowhere to be found.
— Afsuski, suv hech qayerda topilmadi.

vanish [vænɪʃ] v. — g'oyib bo'lmoq, yo'qolmoq
🔻>> To vanish is to go away suddenly. >> To vanish to'satdan yo'q bo'lish degani.

— All the passengers vanished from the train station.
