reproduce [riːprəˈdjuːs] v. — nusxasini yaratmoq
🔻>> To reproduce is to make something exactly how someone else did it. >> To reproduce huddi biror boshqa shaxs qilgandek boshqa biror narsa yasash.

— The children tried to reproduce their house using toy blocks.
— Bolalar o'yinchoq bloklari yordamida uylarining nusxasini yasashga harakat qilishdi.

wrinkle [rɪŋkəl] n. — ajin
🔻>> A wrinkle is a line on a person’s face that happens as they get old. >> A wrinkle inson qarigani sababli paydo bo'ladigan yuzidagi chiziqlar.

— My grandfather has some wrinkles on his face.
— Bobomning yuzida bir qancha ajinlari bor.

urgent [əːrdʒənt] adj. — shoshilinch, muhim
🔻>> If something is urgent, it is important and needs to be done now. >> Agar biror narsa urgent bo'lsa, u juda muhim va darhol qilinishi kerak bo'ladi. 

— He had to leave now; it was urgent.
— Men darhol ketishim kerak bo'ldi; bu shoshilinch edi.

bald [bɔːld] adj. — kal 
🔻>> If someone is bald, they have no hair. >> Agar birortasi bald bo'lsa, uning sochi bo'lmaydi.

— My oldest brother is bald.
— Mening katta akam kal.

nap [næp] n. — qisqa uyqu
🔻>> A nap is a short sleep, usually during the day. >> A nap odatda kunduzgi qisqa uyqu.

— I took a short nap because I stayed up late last night.
— Kecha kech uxlaganim uchun qisqa uxladim.

pat [pæt] v. — sekin-sekin urib ko'rmoq
🔻>> To pat something is to hit it softly with your hand. >> Biror narsani pat qilish uni qo'l bilan sekin urish degani.

— I patted some lotion onto my face.
— Men yuzimga loson surtdim.

aloud [əˈlaud] adv. — ovoz chiqarib, baralla 
🔻>> If you say something aloud, you say it so that others can hear you. >> Agar siz biror narsani aloud aytsangiz, siz uni boshqalar eshita oladigan qilib aytgan bo'lasiz.

— My father often reads stories aloud to me and my sister.
— Otam menga va opamga hikoyalarni odatda ovozini chiqarib o'qiydi.

divorce [dɪˈvɔːrs] n. — ajrashish
🔻>> Divorce is an event in which a marriage is ended. >> Divorce nikoh tugaydigan holat.

— Divorce rates have increased in the past twenty years.
— Oxirgi 20 yilda ajrashish ko'rsatgichi o'sdi.

absence [æbsəns] n. — yo'qlik, mavjud bo'lmaslik
🔻>> Absence is the state of something being away. >> Absence biror narsaning yo'qlik holati.

— There is an absence of sand in the hourglass.
— Qum soatida qum yoʻq.

blanket [blæŋkɪt] n. — adyol
🔻>> A blanket is a piece of cloth that you use to keep warm or to sit upon. >> A blanket  bu siz isinish yoki oʻtirish uchun ishlatiladigan mato boʻlagi.

— I laid a blanket on the ground so that we could have a picnic.
— Piknik qilishimiz uchun men adyolni yerga yoydim.

wagon [wæɡən] n. — arava
🔻>> A wagon is a cart you use to carry heavy things. >> A wagon siz og'ir narsalarni tashish uchun ishlatadigan arava.

— He used his wagon to carry some of his gifts.
— U ba'zi sovg'alarini tashish uchun aravasidan foydalandi.

imitate [ɪmɪteɪt] v. — taqlid qilmoq
🔻>> To imitate someone is to do exactly what they do. >> Birortasiga imitate qilish, u nima qilsa aynan shu ishni qilish degani.

— He imitated his favorite superhero by putting on a costume.
— U kostyum kiyib, sevimli superqahramoniga taqlid qildi.

infant [ɪnfənt] n. — go'dak, chaqaloq
🔻>> An infant is a baby. >> An infant chaqaloq degani.

— The infant cried all night.
— Chaqaloq tun bo'yi yig'ladi.

creep [kriːp] v. — asta o'rmalamoq
🔻>> To creep is to move quietly and slowly. >> To creep sokin va sekin harakat qilishdir.

— The cat slowly crept down the tree.
— Mushuk sekin daraxtdan pastga tushdi.

suck [sʌk] v. — so'rmoq, shimmoq
🔻>> To suck is to put something in your mouth and try to get flavor out of it. >> To suck — og‘zingizga biror narsa solib, undan lazzat olishga harakat qilishdir.

— The baby sucked milk from her bottle.
— Chaqaloq shishadagi sutni shimdi.
Unit 11:
abnormal [æbˈnɔ:rməl] adj. — g'ayrioddiy 
🔻>> If something is abnormal, it is strange or not normal. >> Agar biror narsa abnormal bo'lsa, u g'alati yoki noodatiy bo'ladi. 

— Her idea of art is a bit too abnormal for me.
— Uning san'at haqidagi g'oyasi men uchun biroz g'ayritabiiy.

ecosystem [i:kousɪstəm] n. — ekotizim, flora va fauna
🔻>> An ecosystem is a group of plants and animals in an area. >> An ecosystem o'simliklar va hayvonlar guruhi.

— The river’s ecosystem not only includes fish but other insects and plants too.
— Daryoning ekotizimi nafaqat baliqlarni, balki hasharot va o'simliklarni ham o'z ichiga oladi.

manuscript [mӕnjəskript] n. — qadimiy qo'lyozma
🔻>> A manuscript is an old book or paper written by hand. >> A manuscript qo'lda yozilgan eski kitob yoki qog'oz.

— The manuscript was written over 150 years ago.
— Qadimiy qo'lyozma 150 yil avval yozilgan edi.

recite [rɪˈsaɪt] v. — bayon qilmoq
🔻>> To recite something means to repeat or say aloud in front of a group. >> Biror narsani recite qilish uni qaytarish yoki ko'pchilik oldida baland aytish degani.

— Katie recited the Pledge of Allegiance in class.
— Keti sinfda sodiqlik qasamini bayon qildi.

pursuit [pərsuːt] n. — ta'qib, ketidan quvish
🔻>> A pursuit is a chase. >> A pursuit bu ketidan quvish degani.

— The dinosaur was in pursuit of the caveman.
— Dinozavr g'or odamini ta'qib qilgan.

dwarf [dwɔːrf] n. — gnom, pakana odam
🔻>> A dwarf is a creature from stories that often looks like a short, hairy man. >> A dwarf odatda kichkina, junli odamga o'xshash hikoyalardagi mavjudod.

— The dwarf had a pleasant look on his face.
— Gnom yuzida mamnuniyat bor edi.

dialect [daɪəlekt] n. — sheva 
🔻>> A dialect is a regional variety of language showing where you are from. >> A dialect bu sizning qayerdan ekanligingizni koʻrsatadigan mintaqaviy tildir.

— People from the U.K. have a different dialect of English from those in the U.K.
— Birlashgan Qirollikdagi odamlar ingliz tilining Buyuk Britaniyadagidan farqli lahjasiga ega.

patience [peɪʃəns] n. — sabr, toqat
🔻>> Patience is the ability to wait for something without becoming upset. >> Patience hafa bo'lmasdan biror narsani kutish qobiliyati.

— Sue’s patience was rewarded by catching her very first fish.
— Syuning sabri uning birinchi balig'ini tutish bilan mukofotlandi.

proverb [prɒvəːrb] n. — maqol
🔻>> A proverb is a short saying that tells you something important. >> A proverb sizga muhim biror narsa aytuvchi narsa.

— The proverb “egg on your face” means you’ve done something embarrassing.
— “Yuzingda tuxum” maqoli siz sharmandali ish qilganingizni bildiradi.

fatal [feɪtl] adj. — halokatli, mash'um
🔻>> If something is fatal, it causes death. >> Agar biror narsa fatal bo'lsa, u o'limga olib keladi.

— They passed away in a fatal car crash.
— Ular halokatli avtohalokatda vafot etdilar.

dishonest [dɪsˈɒnɪst] adj. — vijdonsiz, noinsof
🔻>> If someone is dishonest, they do not tell the truth. >> Agar birortasi dishonest bo'lsa, u haqiqatni aytmaydi.

— She was being dishonest when she copied the answers from his test.
— Uning testidan javoblarni ko‘chirib olayotganda, u insofsiz edi.

impatient [ɪmˈpeɪʃənt] adj. — sabrsiz, toqatsiz
🔻>> If someone is impatient, they are not able to wait for things. >> Agar birortasi impatient bo'lsa, u biror narsani kutishga qodir emas.

— Bob was so impatient that he could barely wait for the light to turn green.
— Bob shu qadar sabrsiz ediki, u chiroqning yashil yonishini arang kutdi.

perfume [pəˈ:rfjuːm] n. — atir, duxi 
🔻>> Perfume is a good-smelling liquid that girls wear. >> Perfume qizlar ishlatadigan shirin hidli suyuqlik.

— When she wore her perfume, everyone said she smelled great.
— U atirini surganida, hamma uning hidi ajoyib ekanini aytishdi.

compass [kʌmpəs] n. — kompas
🔻>> A compass is a device used to tell what direction one is going. >> A compass  bu qaysi tomonga ketayotganini aniqlash uchun ishlatiladigan qurilma.

— A compass is an important tool to have when you are traveling.
— Kompas sayohat paytida boʻlishi kerak boʻlgan muhim vositadir.

pond [pɒnd] n. — hovuz
🔻>> A pond is a very small area of water. >> A pond suvning juda oz qismi.

— The ducks swam in the pond.
— O'rdaklar hovuzda suzishdi.

bamboo [bæmˈbu:] n. — bambuk 
🔻>> Bamboo is a hard plant with thin branches and leaves. >> Bamboo ingichka shoxlari va barglari bo'lgan qattiq o'simlik.

— Outside his home, there is a lot of bamboo.
— Uning uyi tashqarisida juda ko'p bambuk bor.

wilderness [wɪldə:rnɪs] n. — chakalakzor
🔻>> A wilderness is an area where no people live. >> A wilderness hech kim yashamaydigan joy.

— If you are not careful, you can get lost in the wilderness.
— Agar hushyor bo'lmasangiz chakalakzorda adashib qolishingiz mumkin.

blossom [blɑsəm] n. — gul
🔻>> A blossom is a flower or group of flowers. >> A blossom gul yoki gullar guruhi.

— There were colorful blossoms in the yard.
— Hovlida rang-barang gullar bor edi.

leaf [li:f] n. — barg
🔻>> A leaf is the flat green thing on trees or bushes. >> A leaf bu daraxtlar yoki butalar ustidagi tekis yashil narsa.

— In the fall, the leaves on the trees change colors.
— Kuzda daraxtlardagi barglarning rangi o'zgaradi.

marsh [mɑːrʃ] n. — botqoq
🔻>> A marsh is a type of wet land covered with grasses and short plants. >> A marsh — oʻtlar va kalta oʻsimliklar bilan qoplangan nam yer turi.

— The marsh looked so lovely against the mountains.
— Botqoq tog'lar oldida juda go'zal ko'rinardi.
Unit 12:
puff [pʌf] n. — tutun parchasi
🔻>> A puff is a little bit of smoke or steam. >> A puff tutunning ozgina qismi.

— A puff of smoke came from the burnt match.
— Kuygan gugurtdan tutun chiqdi.

explode [ɪksˈploud] v. — portlamoq
🔻>> When something explodes, it blows up. >> Agar biror narsa explode bo'lsa, u portlaydi.

— My new radio exploded when I plugged it in.
— Yangi radioim uni rozetkaga ulaganimda portlab ketdi.

contrary [kɒntrərɪ] adj. — zid, teskari
🔻>> If something is contrary to something else, it is the opposite. >> Agar biror narsa contrary bo'lsa, u zid bo'ladi. 

— It isn’t warm outside at all. On the contrary, it is quite cold.
— Tashqari umuman issiq emas. Aksincha, juda sovuq.

anticipate [ӕnˈtisəpeit] v. — oldindan his qilmoq, oldindan bilmoq
🔻>> To anticipate something is to think that it will happen. >> Biror narsani anticipate qilish u sodir bo'ladi deb o'ylash degani.

— Carrie anticipated the arrival of her baby.
— Kerri chaqalog'ining kelishini kutdi.

scent [sent] n. — hid, is
🔻>> A scent is a smell. >> A scent bu hid.

— Julie enjoyed the scent of the flowers.
— Juli gullarning hididan rohatlandi.

fasten [fæsn] v. — bog'lamoq, mahkamlamoq
🔻>> To fasten something is to close it or put it in the correct place. >> Biror narsani fasten qilish, uni yaqinlashtirish yoki uni to'g'ri joyga qo'yish degani.

— Elizabeth fastened her seat belt.
— Elizabet xavfsizlik kamarini bog'ladi.

dissolve [dɪˈzɒlv] v. — eritmoq, erimoq
🔻>> To dissolve something is to mix it into a liquid and disappear. >> Biror narsani dissolve qilish, uni suyuqlik bilan aralashtirib yo'qotish degani.

— I dissolved the pill in a glass of water.
— Men tabletkani bir stakan suvda eritib yubordim.

beam [biːm] n. — to'sin, sinch 
🔻>> A beam is a heavy bar. >> A beam og'ir to'sin.

— Modern skyscrapers are made with several beams.
— Zamonaviy osmono'parlar bir necha sinchdan quriladi.

deliberate [dɪˈlɪbərɪt] adj. — uyushtirilgan
🔻>> If you are deliberate, you do something on purpose. >> Agar Siz deliberate bo'lsangiz, biror narsani maqsad bilan qilasiz.

— Bernie made a deliberate attempt to injure Andy.
— Berni Endini jarohatlash uchun uyushtirilgan harakat qildi.

scatter [skætə:r] v. — sochib yubormoq
🔻>> To scatter something is to make it go in many places. >> Biror narsani scatter qilish uni har xil joyga tarqatish degani.

— I accidentally scattered all of my pills.
— Men barcha tabletkalarimni tasodifan sochib yubordim.

steel [sti:l] n. — po'lat 
🔻>> Steel is a shiny gray metal. >> Steel yaltiroq kulrang metal.

— The new apartment building was made with steel.
— Yangi turar joy binosi po'latdan qurilgan.

barrel [bærəl] n. — bochka
🔻>> A barrel is a round thing that you can keep liquids in. >> A barrel siz ichida suyuqlik saqlaydigan aylana narsa.

— There was an empty barrel outside the house.
— Uy tashqarisida bo'sh bochka bor edi.

caution [kɔːʃən] n. — ehtiyotkorlik 
🔻>> Caution is care and attention in order to avoid danger. >> Caution  xavfni oldini olish uchun ehtiyotkorlikdir.

— Please use the power saw with caution. It is very dangerous.
— Ehtiyotkorlik bilan elektr arradan foydalaning. Bu juda xavfli.

rag [ræg] n. — latta 
🔻>> A rag is a small towel. >> A rag kichkina sochiq.

— Please use a rag to clean the dust off the table.
— Stol changini artish uchun, iltimos, lattadan foydalaning.

toss [tɔ:s] v. — irg'itmoq
🔻>> If you toss something, you throw it softly. >> Agar Siz biror narsani toss qilsangiz, siz uni yengil irg'itasiz.

— He tossed a coin into the air.
— U tangani havoga irg'itdi.

kit [kit] n. — zarur buyumlar sumkasi, aptechka
🔻>> A kit is a set of all the things needed to do something. >> A kit biror narsa qilish uchun kerak bo'ladigan narsalar yig'indisi.

— Is there a first aid kit in your office?
— Ofisingizda birinchi yordam to'plami bormi?

triumph [traɪəmf] n. — zafar, g'alaba
🔻>> Triumph is what you feel when you win or finish something. >> Triumph qachonki yutganingizda yoki biror narsani tugatganingizda his qiladigan tuyg'u.

— He raised the award in triumph at the end of his speech.
— U nutqining oxirida g'alaba sovrinini ko'tardi.

swift [swift] adj. — tezop, jadal
🔻>> If something is swift, it is fast. >> Agar biror narsa swift bo'lsa, u tez bo'ladi. 

— The swift horse easily jumped over the hurdle.
— Tezkor ot to'siqdan osongina sakrab o'tdi.

casual [kæʒjuəl] adj. — norasmiy, oddiy
🔻>> If something is casual, it is relaxed or simple. >> Agar biror narsa casual bo'lsa, u oddiy bo'ladi.

— You can wear casual clothes to the party like jeans.
— Siz ziyofatga jinsiga o'xshash oddiy kiyim kiysangiz bo'ladi.

germ [dʒəːrm] n. — mikrob
🔻>> A germ is something that makes you sick. >> A germ sizni kasal qiladigan narsa.

— Germs are on everything that you touch.
— Mikroblar siz tegadigan hamma narsada bor.
Unit 13:
inhabit [ɪnˈhæbɪt] v. — yashamoq, istiqomat qilmoq
🔻>> To inhabit means to live in a certain place. >> To inhabit biror ma'lum joyda yashash degani.

— No one inhabits the ancient city.
— Eski shaharda hech kim yashamaydi.

unify [juːnəfaɪ] v. — birlashtirmoq
🔻>> To unify means to bring people or things together. >> To unify odamlarni yoki narsalarni birlashtirish degani.

— With their good deeds, the children tried to unify the world.
— Bolalar o'zlarining xayrli ishlari bilan dunyoni birlashtirishga  harakat qilishdi.

bullet [bulit] n. — o'q
🔻>> A bullet is a small metal object that is shot out of guns. >> A bullet qurollardan otiladigan kichik metal narsa.

— Bullets come in different sizes for different guns.
— O'qlar har xil qurollarga har xil o'lchamda bo'ladi.

sheriff [ʃerɪf] n. — sherif 
🔻>> A sheriff is a police officer who is in charge of a large area. >> A sheriff katta joyga hukmi o'tadigan politsiya ofitseri.

— It was the sheriff’s job to make the city safe.
— Shaharni xavfsiz saqlash sherifning ishi edi.

worship [wəːrʃip] v. — toat-ibodat qilmoq
🔻>> To worship means to like and honor a person, thing, or religious figure. >> To worship bu odam, narsa yoki diniy shaxsni yoqtirish va hurmat qilish demakdir.

— Many people around the world worship in a church.
— Dunyo bo'ylab ko'p odamlar cherkovda ibodat qilishadi.

march [mɑːrtʃ] v. — marsh qilmoq
🔻>> To march means to walk at a steady pace together with others. >> To march qolganlar bilan birga bir xil maromdagi qadam bilan yurish degani.

— The soldiers marched in straight rows.
— Askarlar tekis qatorlar bilan marsh qilishdi.

enforce [enˈfɔːrs] v. — joriy qilmoq, tatbiq qilmoq
🔻>> To enforce means to make a person follow a rule. >> To enforce birortasini qonunga rioya qildirish degani.

— Police enforce traffic laws to keep everyone safe.
— Politsiya hammaning xavfsizligini taʼminlash uchun yoʻl harakati qoidalarini qoʻllaydi.

fountain [fauntɪn] n. — fontan, favvora 
🔻>> A fountain is a source of water made by people. >> A fountain odamlar tomonidan qilingan suv manbayi. 

— There was a beautiful fountain in the middle of the park.
— Park markazida chiroyli favvora bor edi.

voyage [vɔidʒ] n. — safar, sayohat
🔻>> A voyage is a long journey made on a boat or an aircraft. >> A voyage kema yoki samolyotda qilinadigan uzoq sayohat.

— The astronauts took off on a long voyage to the moon.
— Kosmonavtlar Oyga uzoq safarga chiqishdi.

vessel [vesəl] n. — kema
🔻>> A vessel is a large ship or boat. >> A vessel juda katta kema yoki qayiq.

— We toured the area aboard a luxury vessel.
— Biz hashamatli kemada hududni aylanib chiqdik.

devil [devl] n. — shayton
🔻>> The devil is a powerful evil spirit in some religions. >> The devil baʼzi dinlarda kuchli yovuz ruhdir.

— The church promised protection from the devil.
— Cherkov shaytondan himoya qilishga va'da berdi.

startle [stɑːrtl] v. — qo'rqitib yubormoq
🔻>> To startle means to scare someone suddenly. >> To startle birortasini to'satdan qo'rqitmoq degani.

— The loud crash startled the sleeping woman.
— Baland to'qnashuv ovozi uxlayotgan ayolni qo'rqitib yubordi.

aboard [əˈbɔːrd] prep. — bortda
🔻>> When someone is aboard a ship or plane, they are on or in it. >> Qachonki birortasi kema yoki samolyotning aboard qismida bo'lsa, u uning ichida bo'ladi. 

— They climbed aboard the kayak and paddled through the river.
— Ular baydarkaga chiqishdi va daryo bo'ylab sayr qilishdi.

drift [drɪft] v. — oqib ketmoq
🔻>> To drift means to be moved slowly by wind or water. >> To drift havo yoki suv tomonidan sekin harakatlantirish degani.

— The large chunk of ice drifted in the water.
— Katta muz boʻlagi suvda suzdi.

port [pɔːrt] n. — port, bandargoh
🔻>> A port is a place where ships stop to load and unload things. >> A port kemalar narsalarni yuklash va tushirish uchun to'xtaydigan joy.

— The ship was being loaded with materials at the port.
— Portda kemaga materiallar yuklanayotgan edi.

bitter [bɪtər] adj. — achchiqlangan, g'azablangan
🔻>> When a person is bitter, they are upset with someone or a situation. >> Qachonki biror shaxs bitter bo'lsa, u borortasi yoki biror vaziyatdan jahli chiqqan bo'ladi. 

— He was extremely bitter when his computer crashed.
— Kompyuteri singanda u juda g'azablandi.

harbor [haːrbər] n. — gavn, liman, port 
🔻>> A harbor is an area of water along a shore where boats land. >> A harbor — qayiqlar qoʻnadigan qirgʻoq boʻylab joylashgan suv maydoni.

— There were a few small boats in the harbor.
— Portda bir nechta kichik qayiqlar bor edi.

sweat [swet] v. — terlamoq
🔻>> To sweat means to lose liquid from the body through the skin. >> To sweat teri orqali suyuqlik chiqishi degani.

— Whenever I workout, I sweat quite a bit.
— Har safar mashg‘ulot o‘tkazsam, biroz terlayman.

millionaire [mɪljənɛər] n. — millioner 
🔻>> A millionaire is a person who has at least a million dollars. >> A millionaire kamida million dollar puli bor shaxs.

— He became a millionaire because he was smart with his money.
— U pullari bilan aqlli ish tutgani uchun millionerga aylandi.

trigger [trɪgə:r] n. — miltiq tepkisi
🔻>> A trigger is the part of the gun that a person pulls to make it fire. >> A trigger birortasi o't ochish uchun bosadigan qurolning bir qismi.

— The man had his finger on the trigger of the gun.
— Erkak barmog'i qurol tepkisida edi.
Unit 14:
diligent [dɪlədʒənt] adj. — tirishqoq, quntli
🔻>> If someone is diligent, they work hard and are careful. >> Agar birortasi diligent bo'lsa, u qattiq ishlaydi va juda hushyor bo'ladi. 

— Craig has always been a very diligent person at work.
— Craig ishda doim juda tirishqoq inson bo'lgan.

luxury [lʌkʃərɪ] n. — dabdabali
🔻>> A luxury is an expensive thing that you do not need. >> A luxury siz muhtoj bo'lmagan qimmat narsa.

— We stayed at a luxury resort for our honeymoon.
— Biz asal oyi uchun hashamatli kurortda qoldik.

apprentice [əˈprentɪs] n. — shogirt 
🔻>> An apprentice is a person who learns how to do a job from a skilled  person. >> An apprentice biror ishni qanday qilishni malakali shaxsdan o'rganuvchi shaxs.

— Mark is an apprentice chef at the restaurant.
— Mark restoranda bosh oshpazning shogirdi.

bleed [bliːd] v. — qon yo'qotmoq, qonamoq
🔻>> To bleed is to lose blood. >> To bleed qon yo'qotish degani.

— If you are not careful, you will cut your finger and bleed.
— Agar ehtiyotkor bo'lmasangiz, qo'lingizni kesasiz va qon ketadi.

emperor [empərər] n. — imperator 
🔻>> An emperor is the leader of a group of countries. >> An emperor mamlakatlar guruhi lideri.

— The emperor Julius Caesar was in control of ancient Rome.
— Imperator Yuliy Sezar Qadimgi Rimni boshqargan.

assure [əˈʃuər] v. — kafolat bermoq, ishontirmoq
🔻>> To assure someone is to tell them something is true to make them less worried. >> Birortasini assure qilish uni kamroq havotirlanishi uchun biror narsaga ishontirish.

— He assured the boss that the building would be done on time.
— U boshliqni bino vaqtida qurilishiga ishontirdi.

chef [ʃef] n. — bosh oshpaz
🔻>> A chef is a person who cooks in a restaurant. >> A chef restoranlarda ovqat pishiradigan odam.

— Tom is a chef at the restaurant near my house.
— Tom uyimning oldidagi restoranda bosh oshpaz.

bond [bɔnd] v. — do'stlashmoq
🔻>> To bond with someone is to become friends with them. >> Birortasi bilan bond qilish u bilan do'stlashish degani.

— The women bonded after several hours of conversation.
— Ayollar bir necha soatlik suhbatdan so'ng do'stlashishdi.

bandage [bændɪdʒ] n. — bint
🔻>> A bandage is a piece of cloth used to stop bleeding. >> A bandage qon oqishini to'xtatish uchun ishlatiladigan mato bo'lagi.

— If you cut yourself, please get a bandage from the first-aid kit.
— Agar siz o'zingizni kessangiz, birinchi tibbiy yordam to'plamidan bint oling.

priority [praɪɔ(:)rətɪ] n. — muhim vazifa
🔻>> A priority is something that is more important than other things. >> A priority boshqa narsalardan muhim bo'lgan narsa.

— My priority is to get good grades in school.
— Maktabda yaxshi baho olish mening muhim vazifam.

fiber [faibər] n. — tola
🔻>> Fiber is a thread of a substance used to make clothes or rope. >> Fiber mato yoki arqon qilish uchun ishlatiladigan biror moddaning ipi.

— The mat was made from tiny fibers.
— Mato mayda tolalardan qilingan edi.

panic [pænɪk] v. — sarosimaga tushmoq
🔻>> To panic is to feel so nervous or afraid that you cannot think clearly. >> To panic bu shunday asabiylashish yoki qo‘rquvni his qilish, aniq o‘ylay olmaslik.

— Everyone panicked when the house caught on fire.
— Uyni yong'in olganda hamma sarosimaga tushdi.

impolite [impəˈlait] adj. — odobsiz, beodob
🔻>> If someone is impolite, they are rude. >> Agar biror narsa impolite bo'lsa, u qo'pol bo'ladi. 

— Roger is impolite to everyone he meets.
— Rojer u bilan uchrashgan hamma bilan odobsiz munosabatda bo'ladi.

kneel [niːl] v. — cho'kkalamoq
🔻>> To kneel is to put one or both knees on the ground. >> To kneel bir yoki ikkala tizzani yerga qo'yish degani. 

— Daryl got down on one knee and asked Nina to marry him.
— Daril bir tiz cho‘kib Ninadan unga turmushga chiqishni iltimos qildi.

crown [kraun] n. — toj 
🔻>> A crown is the hat worn by a king or queen. >> A crown qirol yoki qirolicha kiyadigan bosh kiyim.

— The crown is made of gold.
— Toj oltindan yasaladi.

horrible [hɔ:rəbəl] adj. — daxshatli, mudhish
🔻>> If something is horrible, it is very bad. >> Agar biror narsa horrible bo'lsa, u juda yomon bo'ladi. 

— The assignment was horrible. I hated it.
— Topshiriq dahshatli edi. Men buni yomon ko'rardim.

scold [skould] v. — so'kmoq, koyimoq
🔻>> To scold means to criticize one angrily because they have done wrong. >> To scold birortasini noto'g'ri qilgan ishi uchun jahl bilan tanqid qilish.

— Jesse was scolded by the teacher for not paying attention.
— Jessi e'tiborsizlik qilgan uchun o'qituvchi tomonidan so'kildi.

departure [dɪˈpɑːrtʃər] n. — jo'nab ketish
🔻>> A departure is the act of leaving a place. >> A departure biror joyni tark etish harakati.

— They were excited about their departure back home.
— Ular uyga jo'nab ketishdan hursand bo'lishdi.

robe [roub] n. — mantiya 
🔻>> A robe is a long, loose piece of clothing. >> A robe — uzun, keng kiyim.

— Many people wear robes in the morning.
— Ko'p odamlar ertalab xalat kiyishadi.

massive [mæsɪv] adj. — juda katta
🔻>> If something is massive, it is very big. >> Agar biror narsa massive bo'lsa, u juda katta bo'ladi. 

— The wheels on his truck were massive.
— Uning yuk mashinasi balonlari juda katta edi.
Unit 15:
assembly [əˈsemblɪ] n. — assambleya
🔻>> An assembly is a group that is together for the same reason. >> An assembly bir xil sababda birlashgan guruh.

— The students had an assembly to talk about their interests.
— Talabalar qiziqishlari haqida gaplashish uchun assambleya tuzishdi.

theft [θeft] n. — o'g'rilik
🔻>> A theft is a criminal act that involves someone stealing something. >> A theft birortasi biror narsani o'g'irlashini taqozo etadigan jinoiy harakat.

— The theft of his TV took place when he was at work.
— Uning televizori o'g'irlanishi u ishdaligida sodir bo'ldi.

cheerful [tʃɪəfəl] adj. — hursand, quvnoq
🔻>> If someone is cheerful, they are happy or feel good. >> Agar birortasi cheerful bo'lsa, u hursand yoki o'zini yaxshi his qiladi.

— The children were cheerful because they didn’t have to go to school.
— Bolalar hursand edi, chunki ular maktabga borishga majbur emas edi.

exploit [iksplɔɪt] v. — ekspluatatsiya qilmoq, foydalanmoq
🔻>> To exploit something is to use it for greedy reasons rather than good reason. >> Biror narsani exploit qilish uni yaxshi maqsaddan ko'ra ochko'z maqsadlarda foydalanish.

— The company exploits their workers and makes them stay 12 hours a day.
— Kompaniya o'z ishchilarini ekspluatatsiya qiladi va ularni kuniga 12 soat qolishga majbur qiladi.

pardon [pɑːrdn] v. — kechirmoq Pardon me! - Kechirasiz!
🔻>> To pardon is a way to ask someone to repeat what was said before. >> To pardon birortasidan biror narsani qayta aytishini so'rash yo'li.

— Pardon me teacher, but could you repeat what you just said?
— Kechirasiz ustoz, hozir aytgan gapingizni qaytarib ayta olasizmi?

affair [əˈfɛər] n. — marosim
🔻>> An affair is an event or a thing that happened. >> An affair sodir bo'lgan voqea yoki biror narsa.

— My wife and I attended a formal affair over the weekend.
— Men hamda rafiqam hafta davomida rasmiy marosimda ishtirok etdik.

ripe [raɪp] adj. — pishgan, yetilgan
🔻>> When a fruit is ripe, it is ready to be eaten. >> Qachonki meva ripe bo'lsa, u yeyish uchun juda tayyor bo'ladi. 

— The cherries were nice and ripe.
— Olchalar zo'r va pishgan edi.

diameter [daɪˈæmɪtər] n. — diametr 
🔻>> The diameter of a round thing is the length across its center. >> Aylana narsaning diameter'i uning markazi bo'ylab uzunligi.

— The diameter of the tree was about 22 centimeters.
— Daraxtning diametri 22 santimetr atrofida edi.

routine [ruːˈtiːn] n. — belgilangan tartib
🔻>> A routine is a way of doing things that is the same every time. >> A routine har safar bir xil bo'ladigan biror narsa qilish yo'li.

— My father’s daily routine includes shaving right before breakfast.
— Otamning kunlik tartibi nonushtadan oldin soqol olishni o'z ichiga oladi.

scheme [skiːm] n. — loyiha, reja
🔻>> A scheme is a plan or design. >> A scheme bu reja yoki dizayn. 

— Mickey and Minnie came up with a scheme to solve the problem.
— Mikki va Minni muammoni hal qilish sxemasini o'ylab topishdi.

cereal [sɪərɪəl] n. — boshoqli taom
🔻>> Cereal is a food that you mix with milk and eat for breakfast. >> Ceneal sut bilan aralashtiriladigan va nonushtaga yeyiladigan taom.

— Cereal is a fast and common breakfast food enjoyed in the U.S.
— Boshoqli taom AQShda sevib yeyiladigan tez va umumiy nonushta.

famine [fæmɪn] n. — ocharchilik
🔻>> A famine is a long time with little or no food. >> A famine ovqatsiz yoki juda kam ovqatli uzoq vaqt.

— The farmers couldn’t grow any food on the dry soil, so there was a famime.
— Dehqonlar quruq tuproqda hech qanday oziq-ovqat yetishtira olmadilar, chunki ocharchilik paydo bo'lgan edi.

slim [slim] adj. — ingichka, yupqa
🔻>> If something or someone is slim, they are thin. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa slim bo'lsa, u ingichka bo'ladi. 

— Look at my new cell phone. It’s very slim.
— Yangi telefonimga qara. U juda ingichka.

bless [bles] v. — duo qilmoq
🔻>> To bless is to ask God for protection or help. >> To bless Xudodan himoya yoki yordam so'rash.

— The angel blessed the newborn baby to keep it safe.
— Farishta yangi tug'ilgan chaqaloqni xavfsiz saqlash uchun duo qildi.

merry [merɪ] adj. — shod, hursand 
🔻>> If someone is merry, they are very happy. >> Agar birortasi merry bo'lsa, u juda hursand bo'ladi. 

— They felt merry because the weather was great.
— Men o'zimni juda hursand his qildim, chunki ob-havo juda zo'r edi.

pharaoh [fɛərou] n. — fir'avn
🔻>> A pharaoh was a king in ancient Egypt. >> A pharaoh qadimgi Misrda qirol bo'lgan. 

— The pharaohs ruled Egypt for thousands of years.
— Fir'avnlar Misrni ming yillar mobaynida boshqarishgan.

nut [nʌt] n. — yong'oq
🔻>> A nut is a hard seed or fruit that comes from some trees and bushes. >> A nut bu baʼzi daraxtlar va butalardan olinadigan qattiq urugʻ yoki meva.

— To eat a nut, first you have to crack its shell.
— Yong'oq yeyish uchun avval uning postini yorishingiz kerak.

harvest [hɑːrvɪst] n. — hosil, o'rim
🔻>> A harvest is the act of collecting food from farming. >> A harvest dehqonchilikdan oziq-ovqat yigʻish harakatidir.

— They had a lot of wheat from the last harvest.
— Ularda so‘nggi o‘rim-yig‘imdan ko‘p bug‘doy bor edi.

stove [stouv] n. — pech, pechka
🔻>> A stove is a device used to cook food. >> A stove ovqat pishirish uchun ishlatiladigan qurilma.

— Our new stove helps us to cook food much faster than before.
— Yangi pechimiz avvalgisidan ko'ra ovqatlarni yaxshiroq pishirishga yordam beryapti.

roast [roust] v. — kabob qilmoq
🔻>> To roast something is to cook it in an oven or over a fire. >> Biror narsani roast qilish, uni pechkada yoki olovda pishirish.

— Mom roasted a turkey for the holiday dinner.
— Onam bayram dasturxoni uchun kurka pishirdi.
Unit 16:
compliment [kɒmpləmənt] v. — maqtab qo'ymoq
🔻>> To compliment is to say a nice thing about someone or something. >> To compliment birortasi yoki biror narsa haqida yaxshi narsa aytish degani.

— Her co-worker complimented her for doing a good job.
— Uning hamkasbi yaxshi ish qilayotgani uchun uni maqtadi.

journalism [dʒəːrnəlɪzəm] n. — jurnalistika
🔻>> Journalism is the work of collecting the news to put in newspapers or on TV. >> Journalism gazeta yoki televizorda qo'yish uchun yangiliklarni yig'ish kasbi.

— Before becoming a teacher, she worked in journalism.
— O'qituvchi bo'lishidan oldin, u jurnalistika sohasida ishlagan.

swell [swel] v. — kattalashmoq
🔻>> To swell is to become larger and rounder. >> To swell kattaroq va yumaloqroq bo'lib borish degani.

— My sister’s stomach began to swell after she got pregnant.
— Opam homilador bo'lganidan so'ng qorni kattalasha boshladi.

straw [strɔː] n. — naycha
🔻>> A straw is a thin tube that is used to suck liquid into the mouth. >> A straw suyuqlikni ichish uchun ishlatiladigan ingichka naycha.

— I drank the orange juice through a straw.
— Men naycha orqali apelsin sharbati ichdim.

sensible [sensəbl] adj. — aqlli, mulohazali
🔻>> If someone is sensible, they make good decisions. >> Agar birortasi sensible bo'lsa, u yaxshi qaror qabul qiladi.

— It was sensible for her to save some money each month.
— Har oy bir oz pul yig'ish u uchun aqlli ish bo'ldi.

slice [slaɪs] n. — burda, bo'lak
🔻>> A slice is a piece from something larger, such as a cake. >> A slice pirogga o'xshagan biror narsaning kattaroq bo'lagi.

— The girl enjoyed a slice of cake at her birthday party.
— Haligi qiz uning tug'ilgan kun bazmidagi pirog bo'lagidan bahra oldi.

literary [lɪtərərɪ] adj. — adabiyotga oid, adabiy, badiiy 
🔻>> If someone or something is literary, it is involved with literature in some way. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa literary bo'lsa, u ba'zi yo'l bilan adabiyotga aloqador bo'ladi.

— He worked hard to create a successful literary career.
— U adabiyotga oid karyerasini yaratish uchun qattiq ishladi.

pill [pil] n. — hapdori, (kapsula)
🔻>> A pill is a small object that has medicine inside. >> A pill ichida dorisi bo'lgan kichik narsa.

— She took a pill for her headache.
— U bosh og'rig'ini qoldirgani hapdori ichdi.

tidy [taɪdɪ] adj. — tartibli
🔻>> When something is tidy, it is clean and in order. >> Qachonki biror narsa tidy bo'lsa, u toza va tartibli bo'ladi. 

— Leon has always been a very tidy boy.
— Leon doim tartibli bola bo'lgan.

adolescent [ӕdəˈlesənt] n. — o'spirin
🔻>> An adolescent is a young person or a teenager. >> An adolescent yosh odam yoki o'spirin.

— The adolescent was excited about getting a skateboard for his birthday.
— O'spirin tug'ilgan kuniga skeytbord olganidan hursand bo'ldi.

aptitude [æptɪtjuːd] n. — tug'ma iqtidor
🔻>> Aptitude is a natural ability or skill. >> Aptitude tabiiy qobiliyat yoki malaka.

— He has a natural aptitude for water skiing.
— Unda suvda suzish bo'yicha tug'ma iqtidori bor edi.

sorrow [sɒrou] n. — qayg'u, g'am-g'ussa
🔻>> Sorrow is a very sad feeling. >> Sorrow juda yomon tuyg'u.

— The girl felt sorrow after her best friend moved away.
— Uning eng yaqin do'sti ko'chib ketgandan so'ng qiz qayg'uga botdi.

punishment [pʌnɪʃmənt] n. — jazo
🔻>> A punishment is something that one must endure for any wrong doing. >>  A punishment  bu har qanday noto'g'ri ish uchun bardosh berishi kerak bo'lgan narsadir.

— He was given a punishment for being rude to the teacher.
— U o'qituvchiga qo'pol munosabatda bo'lgani uchun jazolandi.

hinder [hindər] v. — to'sqinlik qilmoq
🔻>> To hinder is to keep someone or something from doing something. >> To hinder birortasi yoki biror narsani biror narsa qilishdan saqlash degani.

— All the traffic hindered me from getting to work on time.
— Hamma tirbandlik mega oʻz vaqtida ishga borishimga toʻsqinlik qildi.

presume [prɪˈzuːm] v. — -deb o'ylamoq
🔻>> To presume is to believe something is true without being certain. >> To presume biror narsa to'g'riligiga ishonish.

— Since he raised his hand, the teacher presumed he knew the answer.
— U qo'lini ko'targani sababli o'qituvchi uni javobni biladi deb o'yladi.

liberty [libə:rti] n. — ozodlik
🔻>> Liberty is freedom to do what you want. >> Liberty nimani xohlasangiz shuni qilish erkinligi.

— To many people, the Statue of Liberty is a symbol of freedom.
— Ko'pchilik uchun ozodlik haykali ozodlik timsoli hisoblanadi.

pharmacy [fɑːrməsɪ] n. — dorixona
🔻>> A pharmacy is a place where medicine is sold. >> A pharmacy dori sotiladigan joy.

— My mother sells medicine to people at the pharmacy.
— Onam dorixonada odamlarga dori sotadi.

jury [dʒuəri] n. — sud maslahatchilari hay'ati
🔻>> A jury is a group of people that listen to a trial and say if someone is guilty. >> A jury sud jarayonini tinglaydigan va kimdir aybdor yoki yoʻqligini aytadigan odamlar guruhidir.

— The jury listened closely to the attorney before they made their decision.
— Sud maslahatchilari hay'ati qaror qabul qilishdan oldin advokatni diqqat bilan tingladi.

privacy [praɪvəsɪ] n. — yolg'izlik, xolilik
🔻>> To have privacy is to be away from other people. >> Privacy ga ega bo'lish, qolgan odamlardan holi bo'lish degani.

— Please hang the sign on the door so we can have some privacy.
— Holi qolishimiz uchun belgini eshikka osib qoʻying.

justice [dʒʌstɪs] n. — adolat
🔻>> Justice is fairness in the way that you treat other people. >> Justice bu boshqalarga qanday munosabatda bo'lsangiz.

— People turn to the court system when they are seeking justice.
— Odamlar adolat qidirayotganda sudga yuzlanishadi.
Unit 17:
navigate [nævəgeɪt] v. — boshqarmoq
🔻>> To navigate something is to control the way it moves or goes. >> Biror narsani navigate qilish bu uning harakatini yoki borishini boshqarishdir.

— She navigated the ship across the ocean.
— U okean bo'ylab kemani boshqardi.

dismiss [dɪsˈmɪs] v. — rad etmoq, e'tiborsiz qoldirmoq 
🔻>> To dismiss something is to say it is not important. >> Biror narsani dismiss qilish uni muhim emasligini aytish degani.

— He quickly dismissed my idea about a new project.
— U mening yangi loyiha haqidagi g'oyamni darhol rad etdi.

agency [eɪdʒənsɪ] n. — agentlik
🔻>> An agency is a business or service set up to act for others. >> An agency bu boshqalar uchun faoliyat yuritish uchun tashkil etilgan biznes yoki xizmatdir.

— I went to a travel agency to help me arrange a flight home.
— Men uyga parvozni tashkil qilishda yordam berish uchun sayyohlik agentligiga bordim.

fate [feɪt] n. — taqdir, qismat
🔻>> Fate is a power that causes some things to happen. >> Fate bu ba'zi narsalarni sodir bo'lishiga olib keladigan kuch.

— Some people believe that a person’s hand can tell their fate.
— Ba'zi odamlar, insonning qo'li uning taqdirini aytib berishiga ishonishadi.

remainder [rɪˈmeɪndə:r] n. — qolgan, qoldiq
🔻>> The remainder of something is what is left. >> Biror narsaning remainder'i uning qolgan qismi.

— He took a bite of the apple, then gave me the remainder of it.
— U olmadan bir tishlab oldi, keyin qolganini menga berdi.

originate [əˈrɪdʒəneɪt] v. — paydo bo'lmoq, vujudga kelmoq
🔻>> To originate somewhere is to start there. >> Biror joyda originate qilish o'sha joyda boshlash degani.

— The idea of democracy originated in Ancient Greece.
— Demokratiya g'oyasi Qadimgi Yunonistonda vujudga kelgan.

ash [æʃ] n. — kul
🔻>> Ash is the grey or black powder created when something is burned. >> Ash biror narsa yonganda paydo bo'ladigan kulrang yoki qora kukun.

— The end of his cigar was full of ashes.
— Sigaretining uchi kulga to‘la edi.

confine [kənˈfaɪn] v. — qamamoq, kichik joyda saqlamoq
🔻>> To confine something is to keep it in one place. >> Biror narsani confine qilish uni bir joyda saqlash degani.

— The elephant is confined to a cage in the zoo.
— Haligi fil hayvonot bog'idagi qafasga qamaldi.

lava [lɑːvə] n. — lava
🔻>> Lava is the hot substance made of melted rock that shoots from volcanoes. >> Lava bu vulqonlardan otiladigan erigan toshdan paydo bo'lgan issiq moddadir.

— The red hot lava poured from the volcano.
— Vulqondan qizil issiq lava otildi.

retrieve [rɪˈtriːv] v. — topmoq, qaytarib olmoq
🔻>> To retrieve something is to find it and get it back. >> Biror narsani retrieve qilish, uni topish va qaytarish degani. 

— She retrieved her mail from the mail box.
— U pochta qutisidan xatini oldi.

shallow [ʃælou] adj. — sayoz
🔻>> If something is shallow, it is not deep. >> Agar biror narsa shallow bo'lsa, u chuqur bo'lmaydi.

— The kids were playing in the shallow water.
— Bolalar sayoz suvda o'ynashayotgan edi.

erupt [ɪˈrʌpt] v. — toshmoq, qaynab chiqmoq
🔻>> To erupt is for a volcano or something to shoot a hot substance. >> To erupt bu vulqon yoki biror narsa issiq moddani otishni anglatadi.

— The volcano erupted for the first time in ten years.
— Vulqon 10 yilda birinchi marta otildi.

slope [sloup] n. — qiyalik, nishab 
🔻>> A slope is ground that is not flat. >> A slope tekis bo'lmagan yer.

— The slope to the top of the mountain was very steep.
— Togʻ tepasidagi qiyalik juda tik edi.

miserable [mɪzərəbəl] adj. — g'amgin, xafa
🔻>> If someone is miserable, they are very unhappy. >> Agar birortasi miserable bo'lsa, u xafa bo'ladi. 

— He was miserable after his dog died.
— U iti o'lgandan so'ng xafa bo'ldi.

affection [əˈfekʃən] n. — sevgi, muhabbat
🔻>> Affection is a feeling of liking someone or something. >> Affection birortasi yoki biror narsani yoqtirish tuyg'usi.

— Amanda has a lot of affection for her little sister Sarah.
— Amanda singlisi Saraga juda yaxshi ko'radi.
Unit 18:
knight [nait] n. — ritsar
🔻>> A knight is a soldier of high rank and skill who usually serves a king. >> A knight odatda qirolga xizmat qiladigan yuqori daraja va mahoratli askar.

— He was the best soldier, so the king made him a knight.
— U eng yaxshi askar edi, shuning uchun qirol uni ritsar qilib tayinladi.

blaze [bleɪz] v. — alanga olmoq
🔻>> To blaze means to burn brightly or powerfully. >> To blaze yorqin yoki kuchli yonishni anglatadi.

— The small fire soon blazed into a large dangerous one.
— Kichik olov keyinroq katta xavfli alangaga aylandi.

invasion [ɪnˈveɪʒən] n. — istilo, okkupatsiya
🔻>> An invasion is an attack by a group from another country. >> An invasion boshqa davlatdan bir guruhning hujumi.

— In Korea, walls were built around cities to protect them from invasions.
— Koreyada shaharlar atrofidagi devorlar istilodan himoya qilish uchun qurilgan.

withdraw [wɪθˈdrɔː] v. — chekinmoq, ortga qaytmoq
🔻>> To withdraw means to leave a place, usually during war. >> To withdraw odatda urush vaqtida ortga qaytishni anglatadi.

— After losing the battle, the enemy withdrew back to its own country.
— Jangda yutqazgandan so'ng, dushman ortga, o'z davlatiga chekindi.

steep [stiːp] adj. — tik, tikka 
🔻>> If something is steep, then its slope or angle rises or falls sharply. >> Agar biror narsa steep boʻlsa, uning qiyaligi yoki burchagi keskin koʻtariladi yoki tushadi.

— He rode his bike up the steep hill to reach the top.
— U cho'qqiga chiqish uchun velosipedda tik tepalikka chiqdi.

warrior [wɔ(:)riə:r] n. — jangchi, askar
🔻>> A warrior is a brave soldier or fighter. >> A warrior jasur askar yoki jangchi.

— The samurai were some of the most skilled warriors in the ancient world.
— Samuraylar qadimgi davrda eng malakali jangchilardan bo'lishgan.

troops [truːps] n. — qo'shin, askarlar
🔻>> Troops are soldiers that fight in groups in a battle. >> Troops urushda guruhlarda jang qiladigan askarlar.

— The troops were all prepared to go into battle.
— Askarlarning hammasi jangga kirishishga tayyor edi.

yield [jiːld] v. — yon bermoq, o'tkazib yubormoq
🔻>> To yield something means to give up control of it or to give it away. >> Biror narsaga yield qilish uni nazorat qilishdan voz kechish yoki undan voz kechish demakdir.

— He had to yield his turn because he was in checkmate.
— U o'z navbatini berishiga to'g'ri keldi, chunki u matda edi.

spear [spɪə:r] n. — nayza
🔻>> A spear is a long stick with a blade on one end that is used as a weapon. >> A spear — qurol sifatida ishlatiladigan, bir uchi tig'li uzun tayoq.

— The soldier was holding a spear in his hand.
— Askarning qo'lida nayza bor edi.

flame [fleɪm] n. — alanga, olov
🔻>> A flame is part of fire. >> A flame olov qismi. 

— The torch was filled with yellow and orange flames.
— Mash'al sariq va to'q sariq olov bilan to'ldirilgan edi.

rebel [rebəl] n. — isyonchi, muxolifatchi
🔻>> A rebel is a person who fights the government in order to change it. >> A rebel uni o'zgartirish uchun hukumat bilan kurashadigan shaxs.

— The rebel had enough of the government’s unfair polices.
— Hukumatning adolatsiz siyosatidan qoʻzgʻolonchilar yetarli edi.

lightning [laɪtnɪŋ] n. — chaqmoq, yashin
🔻>> Lightning is the bright light seen during a storm. >> Lightning dovul vaqti ko'rinadigan yorqin yorug'lik.

— The lightning flashed above the water.
— Chaqmoq suv ustida chaqdi.

boom [buːm] v. — baland ovoz chiqarmoq
🔻>> To boom means to make a loud, deep sound. >> To boom baland ovoz chiqarishni anglatadi.

— The firecrackers made a loud boom when they exploded.
— Petardalar portlagandan so‘ng kuchli shovqin ko‘tardi.

independence [indiˈpendənt] adj. — mustaqillik, ozodlik
🔻>> Independence is the state of being free from the control of others. >> Independence boshqalar nazoratidan ozod bo'lish holati.

— After leaving home, Sophia had a great feeling of independence.
— Uyni tark etganidan so'ng, Sofiya ozodlik tuyg'usini his qildi.

thunder [θʌndə:r] n. — chaqmoq ovozi
🔻>> Thunder is the loud noise heard during a storm. >> Thunder chaqmoq vaqti eshitiladigan baland ovoz.

— The sound of the thunder startled me. 
— Chaqmoq ovozi meni qo'rqitib yubordi.

armor [aːrmər] n. — sovut
🔻>> Armor is metal worn by soldiers to protect the body. >> Armor badanni himoya qilish uchun kiyiladigan askarlarning metal kiyimi.

— The soldier wore armor to protect his body.
— Askar badanini himoya qilish uchun sovut kiydi.

summit [sʌmɪt] n. — cho'qqi
🔻>> A summit is the highest part of a hill or mountain. >> A summit tog' yoki qirning eng baland qismi.

— Snow covered the summit of the mountain even during the summer.
— Yozda ham tog‘ cho‘qqisini qor qoplagan edi.

retreat [rɪˈtriːt] v. — chekinmoq
🔻>> To retreat means to run away because you have been beaten in a fight. >> To retreat bu urushda kaltaklanganingiz uchun qochib ketish demakdir.

— The army retreated because they were losing the battle.
— Armiya jangda yutqazayotgani uchun chekindi.

revolution [revəˈluːʃən] n. — inqilob
🔻>> A revolution is a change to the political system by a group of people. >> A revolution bu bir guruh odamlar tomonidan siyosiy tizimni oʻzgartirishdir.

— The revolution in Russia led to the creation of the Soviet Union.
— Rossiyadagi inqilob Sovet Ittifoqining vujudga kelishiga olib keldi.

cliff [klɪf] n. — tik qoya
🔻>> A cliff is a high and often flat wall of rock. >> A cliff baland va odatda yupqa qoya devori.

— The wolf stood at the cliff and howled.
— Bo'ri tik qoyada turdi va uvilladi.
Unit 19:
tender [tendə:r] adj. — yumshoq, barra 
🔻>> When something is tender, it is soft and easy to chew. >> Qachonki biror narsa tender bo'lsa, u yumshoq va chaynashga oson bo'ladi. 

— The meat was so tender they didn’t need knives to cut it with.
— Go'sht shunchalik yumshoq ediki, ularni kesish uchun pichoq kerak emas edi.

revenge [rɪˈvendʒ] n. — qasos, o'ch 
🔻>> Revenge is what you do to hurt or punish someone who hurts you. >> Revenge bu sizni xafa qilgan odamni xafa qilish yoki jazolash uchun qiladigan narsadir.

— He broke his sister’s doll as revenge after she lost his favorite book.
— U o'zining sevimli kitobini yo'qotib qo'yganidan keyin qasos sifatida singlisining qo'g'irchog'ini sindirib tashladi.

supper [sʌpər] n. — kechki taom
🔻>> Supper is a meal that is eaten in the evening. >> Supper kechki payt yeyiladigan taom.

— We usually have supper around 6 o’clock at my house.
— Biz odatda soat 6 atrofida kechki ovqatni yeymiz.

spare [spɛə:r] v. — berib yubormoq
🔻>> To spare something is to give it because you have more than you need. >> Biror narsani spare qilish sizda undan keragidan ortiqcha borligi uchun birortasiga berish degani.

— I wanted to help him but I couldn’t spare a tire.
— Men unga yordam bermoqchi edim, lekin shinamni berib yubora olmadim.

stem [stem] n. — poya
🔻>> The stem of a plant is the stick that grows leaves or flowers. >> O'simlikning stem'i undan barg yoki gul o'sadigan tayoq.

— The rose had a long thin stem.
— Atirgulda uzun ingichka poya bor.

dispute [diˈspjuːt] n. — bahs, tortishuv
🔻>> A dispute is an argument or disagreement that people have. >> A dispute bu odamlar oʻrtasida yuzaga keladigan bahs yoki kelishmovchilikdir.

— Karen and Brian often have disputes about silly things.
— Karen va Brian ko'pincha ahmoqona narsalar ustida bahslashishadi.

bench [bentʃ] n. — skameyka 
🔻>> A bench is a long seat for two or more people. >> A bench 2 yoki undan ortiq odam uchun mo'ljallangan uzun o'rindiq.

— Most parks have benches for citizens to relax upon.
— Ko'pchilik parklarda tashrif buyuruvchilar dam olishi uchun skameyka bor.

horror [hɔ:rər] n. — qo'rquv
🔻>> Horror is a feeling of being very afraid or shocked. >> Horror juda qo'rqish tuyg'usi.

— The audience screamed in horror when the ghost appeared in the movie.
— Filmda sharpa paydo bo‘lganida tomoshabinlar dahshatdan baqirib yuborishdi.

pregnant [pregnənt] adj. — homilador
🔻>> When a female is pregnant, she is going to have a baby. >> Qachonki biror ayol yoki urg'ochi pregnant bo'lsa, u bola ko'rish arafasida bo'ladi. 

— The pregnant woman was shopping for baby clothes.
— Homilador ayol bola uchun xarid qilayotgan edi.

sneak [sniːk] v. — sezdirmay ketmoq
🔻>> To sneak is to move quietly so that no one hears or sees you. >> To sneak hech kim ko'rmasligi yoki eshitmasligi uchun asta harakatlanish.

— The thief snuck out of the house without anyone noticing him.
— O‘g‘ri hech kimga sezdirmay, uydan yashirinib chiqib ketdi.

daisy [deɪzɪ] n. — dastorgul (ромашка)
🔻>> A daisy is a small flower with white petals and a yellow center. >> A daisy oq gulbarg va sariq markazga ega kichik gul.

— There were a few daisies growing in the field.
— Dalada bir necha dastorgul oʻsar edi.

sigh [saɪ] v. — xo'rsinmoq
🔻>> To sigh is to breathe out loudly and show that you are tired or sad. >> To sign baland ovoz bilan nafas olish va charchagan yoki xafa ekanligini ko'rsatishdir.

— Molly sighed when she looked at all the information she had to research.
— Molli tadqiqot qilishi kerak boʻlgan barcha maʼlumotlarni koʻrib chiqib, xoʻrsinib qoʻydi.

shame [ʃeɪm] n. — uyat, sharmandalik
🔻>> Shame is a bad feeling about things you have done wrong. >> Shame bu notoʻgʻri qilgan ishlaringizdan yomon tuygʻu.

— The boy felt shame about misplacing his clothes.
— Bola kiyimini noto'g'ri joylashtirganidan uyaldi.

rage [reɪdʒ] n. — g'azab, qahr
🔻>> Rage is a very angry feeling. >> Rage juda ham darg'azablik tuyg'usi.

— The chef was filled with rage when his helpers ruined the meal.
— Oshpazning yordamchilari ovqatni buzib tashlashganda, uning g'azabiga to'lib ketdi.

confront [kənˈfrʌnt] v. — tik qaramoq, qarshi turmoq
🔻>> To confront a hard situation or person is to deal with it. >> Qiyin vaziyatga yoki odamga confront qilish u bilan kurashish degani.

— The couple has to confront each other about their problems.
— Er-xotin o'z muammolari haqida bir-biriga qarshi turishlari kerak.
Unit 20:
pile [paɪl] n. — uyum, g'aram 
🔻>> A pile is a large group of things on top of one another. >> A pile bir birining ustiga chiqqan narsalarning katta guruhi.

— The pile of cups was beginning to tilt.
— Kosalar uyumi qiyshaya boshladi.

seize [siːz] v. — changallamoq
🔻>> To seize something means to grab it quickly or strongly. >> Biror narsani seize qilish uni tez yoki qattiq ushlash degani.

— The man seized as much money as he could before anyone could see him.
— Erkak uni hech kim ko‘rmaguncha imkoni boricha pulni changallab oldi.

supreme [suˈpriːm] adj. — oliy, yuqori
🔻>> When something is supreme, it is the highest or best. >> Qachonki biror narsa supreme bo'lsa, u eng balandi yoki yaxshisi.

— The supreme officer was in charge of keeping the citizens calm.
— Oliy amaldor fuqarolarni tinchlantirishga mas'ul edi.

terrific [təˈrɪfɪk] adj. — juda yaxshi 
🔻>> When something is terrific, it is very good. >> Qachonki biror narsa terrific bo'lsa, u juda yaxshi bo'ladi. 

— My youngest daughter is a terrific painter.
— Mening kenja qizim ajoyib rassom.

outcome [autkʌm] n. — natija, samara
🔻>> An outcome is the end of an action or event. >> An outcome biror harakat yoki voqeaning so'ngi.

— The outcome of his latest business plan was a complete failure.
— Uning so'nggi biznes-rejasining natijasi butunlay muvaffaqiyatsiz bo'ldi.

profound [prəˈfaund] adj. — teran
🔻>> When something is profound, it is very intelligent. >> Qachonki biror narsa profound bo'lsa, u juda aqlli bo'ladi. 

— For a little boy, Jeremy has some profound thoughts.
— Kichkina bola uchun Jeremi juda teran fikrlarga ega.

vital [vaɪtl] adj. — muhim, zarur, kerakli
🔻>> When something is vital, it is necessary for life. >> Qachonki biror narsa vital bo'lsa, u hayot uchun zarur bo'ladi. 

— The heart is a vital organ.
— Yurak muhim organ.

evident [evɪdənt] adj. — ayon, ma'lum
🔻>> When something is evident, it is easy to see or understand. >> Qachonki biror narsa evident bo'lsa, u ko'rish yoki tushunishga oson bo'ladi. 

— It was evident from the look on his face that he was unhappy.
— Uning yuzidagi qarashdan hursand emasligi ma'lum edi.

dawn [dɔːn] n. — tong, sahar 
🔻>> Dawn is the time of day when the sun rises. >> Dawn quyosh chiqadigan kunning vaqti.

— At dawn, the sun gently rose over the farm.
— Tongda quyosh ferma ustidan ohista ko‘tarildi.

trait [treɪt] n. — o'ziga xoslik
🔻>> A trait is part of someone’s personality. >> A trait birortasi shaxsiyatining bir qismi.

— One trait of Salvador’s personality is his cheerfulness.
— Salvador shaxsiyatining bir o'ziga xosligi bu quvnoqlik.

necessity [nɪˈsesətɪ] n. — zaruriyat, ehtiyoj
🔻>> A necessity is something that is needed. >> A necessity kerak bo'ladigan biror narsa.

— Fresh water is a necessity for life.
— Yangi suv hayot uchun birinchi zarurat hisoblanadi.

howl [haul] v. — uvillamoq
🔻>> To howl means to make a long, loud sound like a wolf or a dog. >> To howl it yoki bo'riga o'xshab uzun, baland ovoz chiqarish degani.

— The wolf howled at the moon.
— Bo'ri oyga qarab uvilladi.

leap [liːp] v. — sakrab o'tmoq, saqlamoq
🔻>> To leap means to jump a long distance. >> To leap uzoq masofaga sakrash degani.

— He had to leap over the gap to reach the other side of the hill.
— U tepalikning narigi tomoniga yetib borish uchun boʻshliqdan sakrab oʻtishi kerak edi.

hail [heɪl] n. — do'l
🔻>> Hail is ice that falls from the sky when rain freezes. >> Hail osmondan yomg'ir muzlaganda tushadigan muz.

— The hail from the storm was the size of golf balls.
— Bo'rondagi do'lning kattaligi golf ko'ptogichalik edi.

ease [iːz] n. — osonlik, yengillik
🔻>> When something is done with ease, it is not hard to do. >> Qachonki biror narsa ease bilan qilingan bo'lsa, u qiyin emas.

— The monkey climbed the tree with ease.
— Maymun daraxtda osonlik bilan sakradi.

magnificent [mægˈnɪfəsənt] adj. — ajoyib, zo'r 
🔻>> When something is magnificent, it is beautiful and grand. >> Qachonki biror narsa magnificent bo'lsa, u chiroyli va zo'r. 

— The man gave his wife a pair of magnificent diamond earrings.
— Erkak xotiniga bir juft ajoyib olmos sirg'alarini sovg'a qildi.

beneath [bɪˈniːθ] prep. — ostida, tagida
🔻>> If something is beneath something else, it is under it. >> Agar biror narsa boshqa biror narsaning beneath qismida bo'lsa, u uning ostida bo'ladi. 

— The largest part of an iceberg lies beneath the waterline.
— Aysbergning eng katta qismi suv satxidan pastda yotadi.

dissatisfied [dɪsˈsætɪsfaɪd] adj. — qoniqmagan, norozi
🔻>> If you are dissatisfied, you are not happy with something. >> Agar siz dissatisfied bo'lsangiz, siz biror narsadan hursand emassiz.

— I was dissatisfied with their decision to work on Sunday.
— Men ularning yakshanba kuni ishlash haqidagi qaroridan norozi bo'ldim.

squeeze [skwiːz] v. — siqmoq, qismoq
🔻>> To squeeze something means to press it together and hold it tightly. >> Biror narsani squeeze qilish uni bosish va mahkam ushlash degani.

— When Clara saw her cat, she gave it a big squeeze.
— Klara mushukini ko'rgach, uni qattiq siqib qo'ydi.

cub [kʌb] n. — hayvon bolasi
🔻>> A cub is a baby animal, such as a bear or lion. >> A cub ayiq yoki sher kabi hayvonlarning bolasi.

— The lion cub was crying for its mother.
— Arslon bolasi onasi uchun yig‘lardi.
Unit 21:
stiff [stɪf] adj. — egilmaydigan, qattiq
🔻>> When something is stiff, it is hard to move. >> Qachonki biror narsa stiff bo'lsa, uni harakatlantirish qiyin.

— The bird was standing on the tree’s stiff branch.
— Qush daraxtning qattiq shoxida turgan edi.

accustomed [əˈkʌstəmd] adj. — odatlangan, o'rgangan
🔻>> When you become accustomed to something, you are in the habit of it. >> Qachonki siz biror narsaga  accustomed bo'lsangiz, siz unga odatlangansiz.

— Grandfather is accustomed to reading the newspaper every morning.
— Bobom har kuni ertalab gazeta o'qishga o'rgangan.

stroke [strouk] v. — silamoq, siypamoq
🔻>> To stroke is to move a hand over something or someone. >> To stroke biror narsa yoki birortasi uzra qo'lni yurgizmoq degani.

— She stroked her cheek to see if there was something on it.
— U yonoqlarida biror narsa bor-yo‘qligini bilish uchun yuzini silab qo‘ydi.

hollow [hɒlou] adj. — kavak, g'ovak
🔻>> When something is hollow, it has an empty space inside. >> Qachonki biror narsa hollow bo'lsa, uning ichida bo'sh joy bo'ladi. 

— Straws are hollow, so liquid can flow through them.
— Somonlar ichi bo'sh, shuning uchun ular orqali suyuqlik oqishi mumkin.

bang [æŋ] v. — dang'illatmoq
🔻>> To bang is to hit something to make a noise. >> To bang shovqin qilish uchun biror narsani urish degani.

— The drummer banged on his drum as he marched in the parade.
— Barabanchi paradda yurganida barabanini chaldi.

affirm [əˈfəːrm] v. — tasdiqlamoq
🔻>> To affirm is to say that something is true. >> To affirm biror narsa to'g'riligini aytish degani.

— Using a graph, Malcolm affirmed the success o f the company.
— Chizmadan foydalanib Malkolm kompaniyaning muvaffaqiyatini tasdiqladi.

astonished [əstɒnɪʃt] adj. — hayratda qolgan, lol qolgan
🔻>> If someone is astonished, they are very surprised or shocked. >> Agar birortasi astonished bo'lsa, u juda hayratda qolgan bo'ladi. 

— I was astonished when he pulled the live rabbit out of his hat.
— U shlyapadan quyonni chiqarganda juda hayratlandim.

clan [klæn] n. — urug'-aymoq 
🔻>> A clan is a group of relatives or friends. >> A clan qarindoshlar yoki do'stlar guruhi.

— The Lee clan meets every year to celebrate the New Year.
— Li oilasi har yili Yangi yilni nishonlash uchun yig‘iladi.

tragic [trædʒɪk] adj. — fojeali
🔻>> When something is tragic, it is connected with death and suffering. >> Qachonki biror narsa tragic bo'lsa, u o'lim yoki jabrlanish bilan bog'liq.

— The airplane crashed in a tragic accident.
— Fojeali halokatda aeroplan to'qnashdi.

fable [feibəl] n. — masal
🔻>> A fable is a short story that teaches a lesson. >> A fable dars o'qitadigan qisqa hikoya.

— In the fable about the tortoise and the hare, the lesson is consistency.
— Toshbaqa va quyon haqidagi masalda saboq izchillikdir.

instinct [ɪnstɪŋkt] n. — instinkt 
🔻>> Instinct is the natural way that people behave without thinking about it. >> Instinct odamlar u haqida o'ylamasdan tabiiy ravishda o'zini tutishi.

— Cats hunt mice because of instinct.
— Mushuklar instinkt sabab sichqonlarni ovlaydi.

sacrifice [sækrəfaɪs] v. — fido qilmoq, bahridan o'tmoq
🔻>> To sacrifice something valuable is to give it up to get something else. >> Biror qadrli narsani sacrifice qilish, biror boshqa narsadan voz kechish degani.

— Her parents sacrificed a lot of money in order for her to go to college.
— Uning ota-onasi uning kollejga borishi uchun ko'p pulning bahridan o'tdi.

leak [liːk] v. — sizib chiqmoq, oqmoq
🔻>> To leak is to let a liquid or gas pass through a flaw. >> To leak bu suyuqlik yoki gazni biror narsadan o‘tkazib yuborishdir.

— The pipe leaks from many places.
— Quvur koʻp joydan oqadi.

emphasis [emfəsis] n. — alohida e'tibor 
🔻>> Emphasis is special attention or importance. >> Emphasis alohida e'tibor yoki muhimlik.

— The students put special emphasis on chapter 4 because it will be on the test.
— Talabalar 4-bobga alohida e'tibor berishdi, chunki u testda bo'ladi.

feast [fiːst] n. — ziyofat, bazm
🔻>> A feast is a large meal for many people. >> A feast ko'p odamga katta ovqat.

— At Thanksgiving, I enjoy a wonderful feast with my family.
— Shukrona kunida men oilam bilan ajoyib ziyofatdan zavqlanaman.

tune [tjuːn] n. — kuy, musiqa
🔻>> A tune is a song. >> A tune bu musiqa.

— The students played a familiar tune for the audience.
— O'quvchilar auditoriya uchun qadrli kuy chalishdi.

joint [dʒɔɪnt] n. — bo'g'im
🔻>> A joint is a place of the body where the bones meet, such as the knee. >> A joint tanadagi suyaklar to'qnashadigan joy, masalan, tizza.

— Two important bones in your leg meet at a joint in your knee.
— Oyog'ingizdagi ikkita muhim suyak tizzangizdagi bo'g'imda uchrashadi.

physician [fɪzɪʃən] n. — doktor
🔻>> A physician is a doctor. >> A physician bu doktor degani.

— The physician said I would feel better if I took my medicine.
— Shifokor dori ichsam, o‘zimni yaxshi his qilishimni aytdi.

dim [dɪm] adj. — nursiz, xira
🔻>> When something is dim, it does not give out much light. >> Qachonki biror narsa dim bo'lsa, u ortiq yorug'lik bermaydi.

— Working in a dim room is bad for your eyes.
— Nursiz xonada ishlash ko'zingiz uchun yomon.

glow [glou] v. — nur sochmoq 
🔻>> To glow is to make a soft light. >> To glow biroz nur chiqarmoq degani.

— The small flame glowed softly.
— Kichkina alanga ohista porladi.
Unit 22:
extent [ɪksˈtent] n. — daraja
🔻>> The extent of something is how large, important, or serious it is. >> Biror narsaning extent'i uning qanchalik katta, muhim yoki jiddiy ekanligi.

— He ate to such an extent that he became overweight.
— U shunchalik ovqatlandiki, ortiqcha vaznga ega bo'ldi.

tempt [tempt] v. — undamoq
🔻>> To tempt people is to offer them something they want but shouldn’t have. >> To tempt odamlarga ular istagan, lekin ularga kerak emas narsani taklif qilish degani.

— I wasn’t hungry, but she tempted me with a piece of my favorite cake.
— Men och emasdim, lekin u meni sevimli tortimdan bir parcha bilan vasvasaga soldi.

dye [daɪ] v. — bo'yamoq
🔻>> To dye something is to make it a certain color by using a special chemical. >> Biror narsani dye qilish maxsus ximikatdan foydalanib uni rangli qilish degani.

— Valery got her hair dyed at the salon yesterday.
— Valeriya kecha sochini bo'yatdi.

stripe [straɪp] n. — yo'l-yo'l chiziq
🔻>> A stripe is a thick line. >> A stripe ingichka yo'l. 

— The flag of the United States has red and white stripes.
— Qo'shma Shtatlarning bayrog'ida qizil va oq yo'l-yo'l chiziq bor.

commission [kəˈmɪʃən] v. — topshiriq bermoq, majburiyat yuklamoq
🔻>> To commission someone to do something is to pay them to do it. >> Kimgadir biror narsani commission qilmoq, bu ishni bajarish uchun unga pul to'lashdir.

— The artist was commissioned to create a picture.

headline [hedlaɪn] n. — sarlavha
🔻>> A headline is the title of a newspaper story. >> A headline gazeta hikoyasining mavzusi.

dose [dous] n. — doza, miqdor
🔻>> A dose is a certain amount of medicine that you take at one time. >> A dose siz bir marta qabul qiladigan dorining ma'lum miqdori.

— My mother gave me a dose of medicine before I went to bed.
— Uxlashga yotishimdan oldin onam menga dori dozasini berdi.

gender [dʒendər] n. — jins
🔻>> Gender is a category that describes being either a boy or a girl. >> Gender qiz yoki o'g'il bola tasvirlaydigan kategoriya.

— Do you know the gender of her new baby?

messenger [mesəndʒər] n. — xabarchi, darakchi
🔻>> A messenger is one who carries information from one place to another. >> A messenger ma'lumotni bir joydan boshqa joyga tashiydigan odam. 

— The messenger delivered an important document to the office.

tame [teɪm] adj. — qo'lga o'rgangan
🔻>> When an animal is tame, it is not afraid to be near people. >> Qachonki hayvon tame bo'lsa, u odamlar oldida bo'lishdan qo'rqmaydi.

— The tame bird rested on his hand.
— Qo'lga o'rgangan qush uning qo'lida dam oldi.

pose [pouz] v. — qimirlamay turmoq
🔻>> To pose is to stay in one place without moving. >> To pose qimirlamay bir joyda turmoq degani.

— The kids and their dog posed for a picture.

steer [stɪə:r] v. — boshqarmoq
🔻>> To steer something is to control where it goes. >> Biror narsani steer qilish uning qayerga ketayotganini boshqarish degani.

— He steered the go-cart around the track.
— U aravani yo‘l bo‘ylab boshqardi.

circus [səːrkəs] n. — sirk
🔻>> A circus is a traveling show with animals and people. >> A circus hayvonlar va odamlar bor sayyor shou.

— I like to go to the circus to see the animals do tricks.
— Men sirkka hayvonlar tryuk qilishini tomosha qilgani borishni yaxshi ko'raman.

ranch [ræntʃ] n. — rancho, ferma
🔻>> A ranch is a large farm where animals are kept. >> A ranch hayvonlar saqlanadigan katta ferma.

— My uncle has many horses on his ranch.
— Tog'amning ranchosida ko'p otlari bor.

informal [ɪnˈfɔːrməl] adj. — norasmiy
🔻>> When something is informal, it is not official. >> Qachonki biror narsa informal bo'lsa, u rasmiy bo'lmaydi. 

— They had an informal meeting to talk about their experiences.
— Ular tajribalari haqida gaplashish uchun norasmiy uchrashuv o'tkazishdi.

accommodate [əˈkɒmədeɪt] v. — joy bilan ta'minlamoq
🔻>> To accommodate is to have enough room. >> To accommodate yetarli xonaga ega bo'lmoq degani.

— The meeting room can accommodate nine people.
— Uchrashuv xonasi to'qqiz kishini sig'dira oladi.

inquire [ɪnˈkwaɪər] v. — so'ramoq, so'rab bilmoq
🔻>> To inquire about something is to ask about it. >> Biror narsa haqida inquire qilish u haqida so'rash degani.

— Dad called to inquire about the price of tickets for the show.
— Dadam shou uchun bilen narxlarini so'rash uchun telefon qildi.

peer [pɪər] v. — diqqat bilan qaramoq
🔻>> To peer at something is to watch it carefully. >> Biror narsaga peer qilish u narsani diqqat bilan kuzatish degani.

— She peered at people through the window.
— U deraza orqali odamlarga diqqat bilan qaradi.

coincide [kouinˈsaid] v. — ayni bir vaqtda sodir bo'lmoq 
🔻>> If two things coincide, they happen at the same time. >> Agar ikki narsa coincide bo'lsa, ular ayni bir vaqtda sodir bo'ladi. 

— My birthday coincides with Christmas.
— Mening tug'ilgan kunim Kristmas bilan bir vaqtda sodir bo'ladi.

portrait [pɔːrtrɪt] n. — portret, surat
🔻>> A portrait is a painting or photograph of someone. >> A portrait birortasining chizilgan yoki olingan rasmi.

— I saw many religious portraits when I went to the museum.
— Men muzeyga borganimda ko'p diniy portretlar ko'rdim.
Unit 23:
desperate [despərɪt] adj. — ilojsiz
🔻>> If you are desperate, you will try anything to do or change something. >> Agar siz desperate bo'lsangiz, siz biror narsa qilish yoki biror narsani o'zgartirish uchun istalgan narsa qilishga harakat qilasiz.

— I’m desperate to find a new job.

rod [rɔd] n. — qalmoq

— Dam olish vaqtida ishlatish uchun yangi qalmoq sotib oldim.

cautious [kɔːʃəs] adj. — ehtiyotkor
🔻>> If you are cautious, you are careful in a dangerous situation. >> Agar siz cautious bo'lsangiz, hatarli vaziyatda ehtiyotkorsiz.

fierce [fɪərs] adj. — yirtqich, vaxshiy
🔻>> If a person or animal is fierce, they are angry or violent. >> Agar odam yoki hayvon fierce bo'lsa, u jahldor yoki vaxshiy bo'ladi. 

— Wolves are fierce animals. Do not disturb them.
— Bo'rilar yirtqich hayvonlar. Ularni bezovta qilmang.

daytime [deɪtaɪm] n. — kunduz kuni
🔻>> Daytime is the time of the day when the sky is light. >> Daytime osmon yorug' bo'ladigan kunning vaqti.

— I only allowed my kids to play outside in the daytime.
— Farzandlarimga faqat kunduzi tashqarida oʻynashga ruxsat berdim.

Aborigine [ӕbəˈridʒəni:] n. — aborigen
🔻>> An Aborigine is a native of Australia before Europeans lived there. >> An Aborigine Yevropaliklar kelishidan oldingi Avstraliyaning mahalliylari.

— The Aborigines created beautiful artwork.
— Aborigenlar chiroyli sanʼat asarlarini yaratdilar.

outlaw [autlɔː] n. — quvg'indi, qidiruvdagi shaxs
🔻>> An outlaw is a criminal who hides from the police. >> An outlaw politsiyadan yashirinadigan jinoyatchi.

— The police passed out posters of the outlaw to all the people.
— Politsiya barcha odamlarga qidiruvdagi shaxsning plakatlarini tarqatdi.

prospect [prɒspekt] n. — maqsad, niyat
🔻>> A prospect is a possibility that something will happen. >> A prospect biror narsa sodir bo'lish ehtimoli.

— He wakes up every morning with the prospect of having a good day.
— U har tong yaxshi kun o'tkazaman degan maqsad bilan uyg'onadi.

shave [ʃeɪv] v. — soqol olmoq
🔻>> To shave means to cut the hairs on your face with a sharp tool. >> To shave o'tkir uskuna bilan yuzdagi soqolni olish degani. 

— My father shaves his face every day because he doesn’t want a beard.
— Otam soqolini har kuni oladi, chunki u soqol qo'yishni xohlamaydi.

ban [bæn] v. — taqiqlamoq
🔻>> To ban something is to not let people do it. >> Biror narsani ban qilish odamlarga uni qilishiga yo'l qo'ymaslik degani.

— Smoking is banned in this building.
— Bu binoda chekish taqiqlangan.

purse [pəːrs] n. — karmon
🔻>> A purse is a bag where women keep money, makeup and keys. >> A purse ayollar pul, atir-upa va kalitlarni saqlaydigan sumka.

— My sister likes to buy designer purses.
— Singlim dizaynerlik hamyonlarini sotib olishni yaxshi ko'radi.

gamble [gæmbəl] v. — qumor o'ynamoq
🔻>> To gamble means to play a game that involves winning or losing money. >> To gamble yutmoq yoki pul yoʻqotish bilan bogʻliq oʻyin oʻynashni bildiradi.

— Many people like to go to casinos to gamble.
— Ko'p odamlar qimor o'ynash uchun kazinolarga borishni yaxshi ko'radilar.

terrified [terəfaid] adj. — juda qo'rqqan
🔻>> If you are terrified, you are extremely scared. >> Agar siz terrified bo'lsangiz, siz juda qo'rqqan bo'lasiz. 

— When I saw the ghost, I was absolutely terrified!
— Sharpani ko'rganimda, rostanam qo'rqib ketdim.

cottage [kɒtɪdʒ] n. — qishloq uyi, kotedj
🔻>> A cottage is a small, old house in the countryside. >> A cottage shahar tashqarisidagi kichik, eski uy.

— My aunt lives in a pretty cottage in the mountains.
— Xolam tog'lardagi ajoyib kotedjda yashaydi.

wizard [wɪzə:rd] n. — sehrgar
🔻>> A wizard is a man who can do magic. >> A wizard sehr qila oladigan odam.

— The wizard made gold fall from the sky.
— Sehrgar osmondan oltin yog'dirdi.

seldom [seldəm] adv. — kamdan-kam 
🔻>> If something seldom happens, it doesn’t happen very often. >> Agar biror narsa seldom sodir bo'lsa, u juda tez-tez sodir bo'lmaydi.

— It seldom rains in southern Arizona.
— Janubiy Arizonada kamdan-kam yomg'ir yog'adi.

mow [mou] v. — o't o'rmoq
🔻>> To mow grass is to cut it to make it very short. >> Maysani mow qilish, uni juda kalta qilish uchun qirqish degani.

— I mow our lawn every weekend.
— Men har hafta oxirida maysazorimizni o'raman.

confess [kənˈfes] v. — tan olmoq
🔻>> To confess something is to say that you did it. >> Biror narsani confess qilish uni qilganingizni aytish degani.

— He confessed that he was responsible for choosing the winning story.
— U g'olib hikoyani tanlash uchun mas'ul ekanini tan oldi.

fade [feɪd] v. — rangini yo'qotmoq
🔻>> If something fades, it gets quieter or darker. >> Agar biror narsa fade bo'lsa, u sokinroq yoki qoraroq bo'lib boradi.

— The piece of cloth I found was old and faded.
— Men topgan mato eskirgan va rangi o‘chib ketgan.

lawn [lɔːn] n. — maysazor 
🔻>> A lawn is an area covered in grass. >> A lawn maysa bilan o'ralgan joy.

— My dad keeps the lawn in front of our house very neat.
— Dadam uyimiz oldidagi maysazorni juda toza tutadi.

lane [leɪn] n. — yo'lak
🔻>> A lane is a small road. >> A lane kichik yo'l.

baggage [bægɪdʒ] n. — yuk
🔻>> Baggage is the set of bags that people take with them when they travel. >> Baggage odamlar sayohat qilayotganda olib yuradigan sumkalar yig'indisi.

initiate [ɪˈnɪʃɪeɪt] v. — ishga tushirmoq, yoqmoq
🔻>> To initiate something means to start it. >> Biror narsani initiate qilish uni boshlash degani.

— You have to turn the switch on to initiate the computer system.
— Kompyuter tizimini ishga tushirish uchun kalitni yoqishingiz kerak.

bundle [bʌndl] n. — pochka, dasta
🔻>> A bundle is a number of things that are tied together. >> A bundle bitta qilib bog'langan bir qancha narsalar.

— I was shocked when he showed me a bundle of money.
— U menga bir pochka pulni ko'rsatganda shokka tushib qoldim.

phantom [fæntəm] n. — arvoh, sharpa
🔻>> A phantom is a ghost or spirit. >> A phantom bu sharpa yoki ruh.

— A scary phantom appeared from out of the darkness.
— Qorong‘ulikdan qo‘rqinchli arvoh paydo bo‘ldi.

symphony [sɪmfənɪ] n. — simfoniya
🔻>> A symphony is a long piece of music performed by many musicians. >> A symphony koʻp musiqachilar tomonidan ijro etilgan uzun musiqa asaridir.

— Alex, a violin player, has always dreamt of playing a symphony.
— Skripkachi Aleks doim simfoniya chalishni orzu qilgan.

graze [greɪz] v. — o't, maysa yemoq
🔻>> To graze means to eat grass. >> To graze maysa yemoq degani.

— The cows grazed in the field.

nerve [nəːrv] n. — jasorat
🔻>> Nerve is bravery or the belief that you can do something. >> Nerve bu jasorat yoki biror narsa qilish mumkinligiga ishonishdir.

— He has the nerve to think that he can actually wrestle with a lion.
— U sher bilan kurasha olaman deb o'ylash uchun jasorati bor edi.

flee [fliː] v. — qochmoq, qochib qutulmoq
🔻>> To flee means to run away from trouble or danger. >> To flee xavf yoki qiyinchilikdan qochish degani.

— The crowd of men tried to flee from the danger.

portable [pɔːrtəbəl] adj. — ixcham, ko'tarib yurishga qulay
🔻>> Something that is portable is able to be moved or carried easily. >> Biror portable bo'lgan narsa olib yurishga yoki siljitishga qulay.

— Since computers are portable, people can use them anywhere.
— Kompyuterlar portable bo'lgani sababli odamlar ularni istalgan joyda ishlatishlari mumkin.

optimist [ɔptəmɪst] n. — optimist, nekbin 
🔻>> An optimist is somebody who sees the good parts of a situation. >> An optimist vaziyatning yaxshi tarafini ko'radigan shaxs.

— Even though he has physical problems, my brother is an optimist.
— Jismoniy muammolari bo'lishiga qaramay, akam optimist odam.

greed [griːd] n. — ochko'zlik
🔻>> Greed is a desire to have more than the things that you need. >> Greed sizga kerak bo'lgan narsadan ham ko'pini xohlamoq degani.

— She ate all the cookies out of her greed.
— U ochko'zligidan hamma pechenyelarni yedi.

poster [poustər] n. — plakat, afisha 
🔻>> A poster is a written announcement that is used to advertise something. >> A poster bu biror narsani reklama qilish uchun ishlatiladigan yozma eʼlondir.

— I saw a poster about a free concert in the park.
— Men parkdagi bepul konsert haqidagi plakatni ko'rdim.

parade [pəˈreɪd] n. — parad, namoyish
🔻>> A parade is a celebration when groups of people walk in the same direction. >> A parade odamlar guruhi bir yo'nalishda yuradigan bayram.

— There were many marching bands in the spring parade.
— Bahorgi paradda koʻplab marshlar bor edi.

herd [həːrd] n. — poda
🔻>> A herd is a large group of the same type of animals that live together. >> A herd birga yashaydigan, bir xil turdagi hayvonlarning katta to'dasi.

— The herd of cows moved slowly across the ranch.
— Sigirlar podasi rancho bo'ylab sekin harakatlandi.

pave [peɪv] v. — tosh yotqizmoq
🔻>> To pave the ground is to lay material on it to make it easier to walk or drive on. >> Yerni pave qilish yurish yoki mashinada yurish oson bo'lishi uchun unga biror material yotqizish degani.

— The path was paved with yellow bricks.
— Yo'lga sariq g'isht yotqizilgan edi.

scratch [skrætʃ] v. — qashimoq
🔻>> To scratch is to make small cuts with a claw or fingernail. >> To scratch tirnoq bilan mayda kesmalar qilishdir.

— I used a stick to scratch my back.
— Men belimni qashish uchun tayoq ishlatdim.

widow [wɪdou] n. — beva, tul
🔻>> A widow is a woman whose husband has died. >> A window eri o'lgan ayol.

— The widow had no children and was very lonely.
— Beva ayol farzandi yo'q va juda yolg'iz edi.

cattle [kætl] n. — chorva mollari 
🔻>> Cattle are cows and bulls, especially on a farm. >> Cattle asosan fermadagi sigir va buqalar.

— The rancher’s cattle were eating the grass in the field.
— Chorvadorning qoramollari daladagi o‘tni yeyayotgan edi.

bulb [bʌlb] n. — lampochka
🔻>> A bulb is the glass part of an electric light. >> A bulb elektr yoritgichning shisha qismi.

— I had to change the light bulb in my bedroom.
— Men xonamdagi lampochkani almashtirishga majbur bo'ldim.
Unit 25:
navy [neɪvɪ] n. — harbiy dengiz kuchlari
🔻>> A navy is the part of a country’s military that fights at sea. >> A navy davlat harbiylarining dengizda jang qiladigan qismi.

— My country is known for our strong navy.
— Mening davlatim o'zining kuchli dengiz harbiy kuchlari bilan mashxur.

tremble [trembəl] v. — sovuqdan titramoq 
🔻>> To tremble is to shake as a result of cold weather. >> To tremble sovuq ob-havo sabab qaltirash degani.

— Harry was not used to the cold, so he trembled most of the day.
— Garri sovuqqa o'rganmagan, shuning uchun u kunning ko'p qismida qaltirab turardi.

fraction [frækʃən] n. — bo'lak, parcha
🔻>> A fraction is a small part of something. >> A fraction biror narsaning kichik qismi.

— Only a fraction of the cake was gone.

derive [dɪˈraɪv] v. — kelib chiqmoq, hosil bo'lmoq 
🔻>> To derive something from another source means to get it from that thing. >> Biror narsani boshqa manbadan derive qilish, uni o'sha narsadan kelib chiqqan degani. 

— Red’s nickname was derived from the color of her hair.
— Qizilning laqabi uning sochi rangidan kelib chiqqan.

underlying [ʌndərlaɪɪŋ] adj. — yashirin, pinhoniy
🔻>> When something is underlying, it is a hidden cause of something else. >> Qachonki biror narsa underlying bo'lsa, u biror boshqa narsa sabab yashiringan bo'ladi. 

— Her underlying fear of flying reduced her traveling options.
— Uning uchishdan qo‘rqish qo‘rquvi sayohat qilish imkoniyatlarini kamaytirdi.

illusion [ɪˈluːʒən] n. — illyuziya
🔻>> An illusion is something that looks real, but doesn’t actually exist. >> An illusion haqiqiy ko'rinadigan narsa, lekin aslida mavjud emas.

— Some pictures create an illusion for the eyes.
— Ba'zi rasmlar ko'zlar uchun illyuziya yaratadi.

lieutenant [luːˈtenənt] n. — leytenant
🔻>> A lieutenant is a rank in the military or police, or a person with that rank. >> A lieutenant bu harbiy yoki politsiyadagi unvon yoki shu darajaga ega bo'lgan shaxs.

— The lieutenant was a good leader, and his soldiers respected him.
— Leytenant yaxshi rahbar edi va askarlari uni hurmat qilishardi.

dynasty [dainəstɪ] n. — sulola
🔻>> A dynasty is a series of rulers who are all from the same family. >> A dynasty bu bir oiladan boʻlgan hukmdorlar turkumidir.

— The ancient Egyptians had a dynasty that lasted for many years.
— Qadimgi Yunonliklarda uzoq yillar davom etgan sulola bo'lgan.

circulate [səːrkjəleit] v. — tarqatmoq, yoymoq
🔻>> To circulate something is to spread it quickly. >> Biror narsani circulate qilish, uni tezlik bilan yoyish degani. 

— The fan helped to circulate cool air through the room.
— Ventilyator xonada salqin havo aylanishiga yordam berdi.

merit [merɪt] n. — taqdirlashga loyiq xizmat
🔻>> The merit of something or someone is their good qualities. >> Birortasi yoki biror narsaning merit'i bu ularning yaxshi hislatlari.

— The actor received an award for his merits in the movie.
— Aktyor filmdagi xizmatlari uchun mukofot oldi.

ray [reɪ] n. — nur
🔻>> A ray is a line of light that comes from a bright object. >> A ray bu yorqin obyektdan keladigan yorug'lik chizig'idir.

— The sun’s warm rays covered the beach.
— Quyoshning iliq nurlari sohilni qopladi.

marine [məˈriːn] adj. — dengizga aloqador
🔻>> The word marine describes something related to the sea. >> Merine so'zi dengiz bilan aloqador narsani tasvirlaydi. 

— A healthy ocean is full of marine animals.
— Sog'lom okean dengiz jonzotlari bilan to'la.

drown [draun] v. — cho'kib o'lmoq
🔻>> To drown is to die from not being able to breathe underwater. >> To drown suv ostida nafas ola olmaslik sabab o'lish degani.

— He would have drowned if the sailors would not have rescued him.
— Agar dengizchilar uni qutqarmaganida, u cho'kib ketgan bo'lardi.

frost [frɔ:st] n. — qirov
🔻>> Frost is a white layer of ice that forms during very cold weather. >> Frost — juda sovuq havoda hosil boʻladigan oq muz qatlami.

— In the morning, the trees were all covered with frost.
— Ertalab daraxtlarning hammasini qirov qoplagan edi.

suicide [suːəsaid] n. — o'z joniga qasd qilish
🔻>> Suicide is the act of killing oneself. >> Suicide birortasini o'ldirish harakati.

— Some people feel so sad that they think suicide is the only answer.
— Ba'zi odamlar shu qadar xafa bo'lishadiki, ular o'z joniga qasd qilish yagona javob deb o'ylashadi.
