polar [poulər] adj. — qutbdagi
🔻>> Polar relates to the cold places on Earth’s north and south ends. >> Polar Yerning shimoliy va janubiy uchlaridagi sovuq joylarga tegishli.

— Only a few people live in the Earth’s northern polar region.
— Yerning shimoliy qutb hududida faqat bir necha kishi yashaydi.

via [vi:ə] prep. — orqali
🔻>> To travel via something means to travel through or using something. >> Biror narsa orqali (via) sayohat qilish, undan foydalanish demakdir.

— We arrived in the city from the airport via the train.
— Biz shaharga aeroportdan poyezd orqali yetib keldik.

invade [ɪnˈveɪd] v. — kirib vayron qilmoq
🔻>> To invade is to take over a place by force. >> To invade bir joyni zoʻrlik bilan egallashdir.

— The enemy forces tried to invade our country through the air.
— Dushman kuchlari havo orqali yurtimizga bostirib kirishga urindi.

resign [rɪˈzaɪn] v. — ishdan bo'shamoq
🔻>> To resign means to quit a job. >> To resign ishdan bo'shashni anglatadi.

— After I officially resigned from work, I said goodbye to my boss.
— Rasmiy ravishda ishdan ketganimdan so‘ng, xo‘jayinim bilan xayrlashdim.

consequent [kɒnsɪkwənt] adj. — oqibatda, natijada
🔻>> Consequent means happening because of a different situation. >> Consequent har xil vaziyat sabab sodir bo'lgan narsa tushuniladi.

— Her consequent rash came after she touched the poison ivy.
— Uning toshmasi zaharli pechakka tegib ketganidan keyin paydo bo‘lgan.
Unit 26:
aside [əˈsaɪd] adv. — chekkada 
🔻>> If someone stands aside, they are on or to one side. >> Agar birortasi aside tursa, u bir tarafda bo'ladi. 

— The man stood aside and opened the door for me.
— Haligi kishi narigi tarafda turardi va eshikni menga ochdi.

fireworks [faɪərwəːrks] n. — mushakbozlik
🔻>> Fireworks are objects that create colored lights when they are lit. >> Fireworks bu yoqilganda rangli chiroqlar yaratadigan obyektlardir.

— The display of fireworks was so beautiful.
— Salyutlar namoyishi juda chiroyli edi.

curve [kəːrv] v. — egilmoq, bukilmoq
🔻>> To curve is to move in a line that bends and does not go straight. >> To curve bukilgan va toʻgʻri ketmaydigan chiziq boʻylab harakatlanishdir.

— The road curves to the left and to the right.
— Yoʻl chapga va oʻngga  buriladi.

disgusting [dɪsˈgʌstɪŋ] adj. — jirkanch, qo'lansa
🔻>> If something is disgusting, it is very unpleasant. >> Agar biror narsa disgusting bo'lsa, u juda yoqimsiz bo'ladi.

— After running all day, Greg’s feet had a disgusting odor.
— Kun bo'yi yugurgandan so'ng, Gregning oyoqlari jirkanch hidga ega edi.

wire [waɪə:r] n. — sim 
🔻>> A wire is a thin string made out of metal. >> A wire metalldan yasalgan yupqa ip.

— The wires were connected to towers that brought electricity to the city.
— Simlar shaharga elektr energiyasi olib kiruvchi minoralarga ulangan edi.

receipt [rɪˈsiːt] n. — kvitansiya, tasdiq hujjati
🔻>> A receipt is a paper that proves that something was received or bought. >> A receipt biror narsa olingan yoki sotib olinganligini tasdiqlovchi qog‘ozdir.

— After looking at my receipt, I realized that I had spent too much money.
— Kvitansiyamga qarab, juda ko‘p pul sarflaganimni angladim.

envy [envɪ] v. — hasad qilmoq, ko'ra olmaslik
🔻>> To envy someone is to wish that you had something that they have. >> Biror kishiga envy qilish, sizda ularda bor narsa bo‘lishini orzu qilish demakdir.

— Sally envied the happy couple.
— Selli baxtli juftlikka hasad qildi.

wipe [waip] v. — artmoq
🔻>> To wipe something is to slide a piece of cloth over it to clean it. >> Biror narsani wipe qilish uni tozalash uchun uning ustiga mato bo‘lagini surtishdir.

— She wiped the dust from the windows.
— U derazalardagi changni artdi.

autumn [ɔːtəm] n. — kuz
🔻>> Autumn is the season of the year between summer and winter. >> Autumn yoz va qish o'rtasidagi yil fasli.

— I love when the leaves fall in autumn because I can play in them.
— Men barglar kuzda tushganini yaxshi ko'raman, chunki ularda o'ynashim mumkin.

jealous [dʒeləs] adj. — hasadgo'y
🔻>> If you are jealous, you think someone might take something from you. >> Agar siz jealous bo'lsangiz, siz birortasi sizdan narsa olib qo'yishi mumkin deb o'ylaysiz.

— Miriam was jealous because Sue was paying too much attention to Jim.
— Miriam rashkchi edi, chunki Syu Jimga haddan tashqari e'tibor berardi.

fuse [fjuːz] n. — peredoxranitel
🔻>> A fuse is a string that you light on fireworks to make them explode. >> A fuse bu mushaklarni portlatish uchun yoqiladigan simdir.

— The boy litthe fuse on the rocket and waited for it to burst in the sky.
— Bola raketada sigortani yoqdi va uning osmonda otilishini kutdi.

drain [dreɪn] n. — kanalizatsiya trubasi 
🔻>> A drain is a pipe that carries away water from a building, such as in a kitchen. >> A drain bu oshxonadagi kabi binodan suv olib ketadigan quvur.

— The water in the sink goes down the drain as you wash your hands.
— Qo'lingizni yuvayotganda lavabodagi suv drenajga tushadi.

flour [flauər] n. — un
🔻>> Flour is a powder made from plants that is used to make foods like bread. >> Flour bu oʻsimliklardan tayyorlangan kukun boʻlib, non kabi taomlarni tayyorlash uchun ishlatiladi.

— I wanted to bake a pie, but I needed flour.
— Men pirog pishirmoqchi edim, lekin menga un kerak edi.

crush [krʌʃ] v. — bosmoq, preslamoq 
🔻>> To crush something is to press it together so its shape is destroyed. >> Biror narsani crush qilish, uning shakli o'zgarishi uchun bosmoq.

— Selena’s new car was crushed when something fell on top of it.
— Selenaning yangi mashinasi ustiga biror narsa tushganda, ezilib qoldi.

paste [peɪst] n. — kley, yelim
🔻>> A paste is a thick and smooth substance. >> A paste qalin va silliq moddadir.

— My son needed some paste for a school project.
— O‘g‘limga maktab loyihasi uchun yelim kerak edi.

alter [ɔ:ltər] v. — o'zgartirmoq
🔻>> To alter something means to make a small change to it. >> Biror narsani alter qilish uni bir oz o'zgartirish degani.

— I altered the color of my nails to match my hair.
— Tirnoqlarim rangini sochlarimga moslashtirib oʻzgartirdim.

ginger [dʒɪndʒər] n. — zanjabil
🔻>> Ginger is a spice from the root of a plant. It tastes spicy and sweet. >> Ginger o'simlik ildizidan olingan ziravordir. Uning ta'mi achchiq va shirin.

— Ginger is a common ingredient in many dishes from India.
— Zanjabil Hindistondagi ko‘plab taomlarning umumiy tarkibiy qismidir.

embrace [ɪmˈbreɪs] v. — quchoqlamoq, quchoqlashmoq
🔻>> To embrace is to hug. >> To embrace bu quchoqlamoq degani.

— When they saw each other again, the happy couple embraced.
— Ular yana bir-birlarini ko'rishganda, baxtli er-xotin quchoqlashdi.

blend [blend] v. — aralashtirmoq
🔻>> To blend is to mix two or more things together so that they become one thing. >> To blend ikki yoki undan ortiq narsalar bir narsa bo'lishi uchun ularni aralashtirish.

— My wife blended together all of the ingredients to make a delicious stew.
— Xotinim barcha masalliqlarni aralashtirib, mazali qaynatma sho'rva tayyorladi.

collapse [kəˈlæps] v. — qulab tushmoq
🔻>> To collapse is to fall down suddenly. >> To collapse birdan qulab tushmoq.

— The tree collapsed right in front of our house.
— Uy oldidagi daraxt birdan qulab tushdi.
Unit 27:
tin [tɪn] n. — metal idish
🔻>> Tin is a cheap white metal. >> Tin arzon oq metal.

— Soup is a common food that is often sold in tin cans.
— Sho‘rva oddiy taom bo‘lib, ko‘pincha metal qutilarda sotiladi.

heritage [herɪtɪdʒ] n. — ma'daniy meros
🔻>> Heritage is the collection of features of a society, such as language and religion. >> Heritage jamiyatning o'ziga xos jihatlari jamlanmasi, masalan, til va din.

— Teepees are part of the heritage of the American Indians of the plains.
— Teeplar tekislikdagi amerikalik hindularning madaniy merosiga kiradi.

exaggerate [ɪgˈzædʒəreɪt] v. — bo'rttirmoq
🔻>> To exaggerate is to say that something is bigger or better than it really is. >> To exaggerate biror narsa aslidan ko'ra yaxshiroq yoki kattaroq ekanligini aytish degani.

— Jimmy wasn’t exaggerating about the seriousness of his injury.
— Jimi jarohati jiddiyligi haqida bo'rttirmayotgan edi.

drag [dræg] v. — sudramoq
🔻>> To drag something means to pull it across the ground. >> Biror narsani drag qilish — uni yer boʻylab tortishni anglatadi.

— The dog was dragging his owner down the street.
— It ko'chada egasini sudrab ketayotgan edi.

acknowledge [əkˈnɒlɪdʒ] v. — tan olmoq 
🔻>> If you acknowledge something, you accept that it is true or that it exists. >> Agar siz biror narsani acknowledge qilsangiz, u haqiqat yoki uning mavjudligini qabul qilasiz.

— The teacher acknowledged that the young student was hungry.
— O‘qituvchi yosh o‘quvchining qorni och qolganini tan oldi.

spectacle [spektəkəl] n. — manzara 
🔻>> A spectacle is an amazing sight. >> A spectacle bu ajoyib manzara.

— Niagara Falls is quite a spectacle.
— Niagara Sharsharasi ajoyib manzara.

precious [preʃəs] adj. — qadrli, ardoqli
🔻>> When something is precious, it is valuable and important. >> Qachonki biror narsa precious bo'lsa, u qimmatli va muhim bo'ladi. 

— In a desert, water can be more precious than money.
— Cho'lda, suv puldan ko'ra qadrli narsa hisoblanadi.

necklace [neklɪs] n. — marjon
🔻>> A necklace is a piece of jewelry that people wear around their necks. >> A necklace odamlar bo'yni atrofiga taqadigan taqinchoq bo'lagi.

— Joyce received a lovely pearl necklace for her wedding anniversary.
— Joys nikoh yubileyi munosabati bilan chiroyli marvarid marjonlarni oldi.

vase [veis] n. — vaza
🔻>> A vase is an attractive container where people keep flowers. >> A vase odamlar gullarni saqlaydigan ajoyib idish.

— The vase was filled with such lovely flowers.
— Vaza ajoyib gullar bilan to'la edi.

meanwhile [miːnhwaɪl] adv. — shu paytda
🔻>> Meanwhile means until something happens or while something is happening. >> Meanwhile biror narsa sodir boʻlguncha degan maʼnoni bildiradi

— He wants to be a doctor in the future, but meanwhile, he works a regular job.
— U kelajakda shifokor bo'lishni xohlaydi, lekin bu orada u oddiy ishda ishlaydi.

noble [noubəl] n. — zodagon, oqsuyak
🔻>> A noble is a rich and powerful person. >> A noble boy hamda kuchli shaxs.

— The Queen invited a noble from a nearby country to dinner.
— Qirolicha yaqin shahardagi zodagonni tushlikka taklif qildi.

insult [ɪnsʌlt] v. — haqorat qilmoq
🔻>> To insult someone is to say things that will hurt their feelings. >> Birortasini insult qilish ularning his-tuyg'ularini jarohatlaydigan gaplarni aytish degani.

— The girls insulted each other all afternoon.
— Qizlar tushdan keyin bir-birlarini haqorat qilishdi.

rumor [ruːmə:r] n. — mish-mish
🔻>> A rumor is a story that may not be true. >> A rumor to'g'ri bo'lmasligi mumkin bo'lgan hikoya.

— Carla was spreading rumors around the office.
— Karla ofis atrofida mish-mishlarni tarqatardi.

suspicious [səsˈpɪʃəs] adj. — ishonmaydigan, gumonsiraydigan
🔻>> If someone is suspicious of someone else, they do not trust that person. >> Agar birortasi boshqa birortasiga suspicious bo'lsa, u o'sha odamga ishonmaydi.

— Dad was suspicious of the caller on the line.
— Dadam liniyada qo‘ng‘iroq qilgan kishidan shubhalanardi.

sin [sin] n. — gunoh
🔻>> A sin is something that is wrong for religious reasons. >> A sin diniy sabablarga ko'ra noto'g'ri bo'lgan narsa.

— Taking something that doesn’t belong to you is a sin.
— O'zingga tegishli bo'lmagan narsani olish bu gunoh.

blonde [blɒnd] adj. — mallasoch ayol
🔻>> If someone is a blonde, they have light-colored hair. >> Agar birortasi blonde bo'lsa, u yorqin rangli sochi bor.

— My cousin is different from me. She is a blonde with blue eyes.
— Mening amakivachcham mendan farq qiladi. U koʻk koʻzli sargʻish ayol.

stack [stæk] n. — uyum, g'aram
🔻>> A stack is a pile of different things. >> A stack har xil narsalar yig'indisi.

— There was a stack of paperwork on his desk to complete.
— Uning stolida to'ldirish uchun bir to'p qog'oz bor edi.

prejudice [predʒudɪs] n. — noto'g'ri fikr
🔻>> A prejudice is an unfair opinion about someone before you get to know them. >> A prejudice bu kimnidir tanishidan oldin unga nisbatan adolatsiz fikr bildirishdir.

— The company’s rules against gender prejudice must be enforced.
— Kompaniyaning gender noto'g'ri qarashlariga qarshi qoidalari qo'llanilishi kerak.

conquer [kɒŋkər] v. — zabt etmoq, egallab olmoq
🔻>> To conquer a country means to attack and take control of it. >> Mamlakatni conquer qilish, unga hujum qilish va uni nazorat qilish demakdir.

— The soldiers were trying to conquer the world.
— Askarlar dunyoni zabt etishga harakat qilishdi.

ambassador [æmˈbæsədər] n. — elchi
🔻>> An ambassador is a government worker who works in another country. >> An ambassador boshqa davlatda ishlaydigan davlat xizmatchisidir.

— The ambassador from Korea was in charge ofthe conference.
— Konferensiyaga Koreyadan kelgan elchi rahbarlik qildi.
Unit 28:
tide [taɪd] n. — suv sathi
🔻>> The tide is the level of the water in the sea. >> The tide dengizdagi suv sathi.

— The tide continued to crawl upon the beach little by little.
— Suv sathi sohil boʻylab asta-sekin oʻrmalashda davom etdi.

postpone [poustˈpoun] v. — keyinga qoldirmoq, kechiktirmoq
🔻>> To postpone something is to make it happen later than planned. >> Biror narsani postpone qilish u narsani rejalashtirilganidan keyin sodir etish degani.

— They postponed the meeting until Elena arrived.
— Ular majlisni Yelena kelguncha kechiktirishdi.

descend [dɪˈsend] v. — pastga tushmoq
🔻>> To descend is to go downward. >> To descend pastga qarab tushish degani.

— I descended the stairs to get out of the building.
— Men binodan chiqish uchun zinadan pastga tushdim.

congress [kɔŋgris] n. — Kongres
🔻>> Congress is a group of leaders in a government. >> Congress hukumatdagi davlat liderlari guruhi.

— Congress makes laws for people to follow.
— Kongress odamlar amal qilishi uchun qonunlar ishlab chiqadi.

tragedy [trædʒədɪ] n. — fojia
🔻>> A tragedy is a very sad event. >> A tragedy juda ko'ngilsiz hodisa.

— It was a tragedy when his house was struck by lightning and burned.
— Uning uyi chaqmoq urib, yonib ketganida, bu fojia edi.

suburb [sʌbəːrb] n. — shaharga tutashgan posyolka
🔻>> A suburb is a small part of a large city. >> A suburb katta shaharning kichik qismi.

— I grew up in the suburbs only a few minutes outside of the city.
— Men shahar chekkasida shahardan bir necha daqiqa tashqarida o'sganman.

jog [dʒɔg] v. — yengil yugurmoq
🔻>> To jog is to run slowly. >> To jog sekin yugurish degani.

— He jogs every day so he can be healthier.
— U har kuni yengil yuguradi, shuning uchun u sog'lomroq bo'lsa kerak.

splash [splæʃ] v. — sochilmoq
🔻>> When a liquid splashes, it bursts and hits something. >> Qachonki suyuqlik splash bo'lsa, u yorilib, biror narsaga tegib ketadi.

— Some green paint splashed upon the floor.
— Yashil bo‘yoq polga sochildi.

institution [ɪnstəˈtjuːʃən] n. — tashkilot, muassasa 
🔻>> An institution is an organization that works to help a city or group of people. >> An institution shahar yoki shaxslar guruhiga yordam berish uchun ishlaydigan tashkilot.

— Banks are vital institutions that businesses and people use every day.
— Banklar biznes va odamlar har kuni foydalanadigan muhim institutlardir.

merchant [məːrtʃənt] n. — savdogar
🔻>> A merchant is a person who sells things. >> A merchant narsalar sotadigan shaxs.

— The merchant was selling used cars.
— Savdogar eski mashinalarni sotardi.

chemist [kemɪst] n. — kimyogar
🔻>> A chemist is a scientist who works with chemicals. >> A chemist kimyoviy moddalar bilan ishlaydigan olimdir.

— My mother is a successful chemist who helps invent new products.
— Onam muvaffaqiyatli kimyogar bo'lib, yangi mahsulotlarni ixtiro qilishga yordam beradi.

poke [pouk] v. — itarmoq
🔻>> To poke something is to push it with your finger. >> Biror narsani poke qilish uni barmoqlar bilan itarish degani.

— I poked my finger on a thumb tack.
— Men barmog‘imni tirgak ustiga qo‘ydim.

chill [tʃɪl] n. — sovuq, izg'irin
🔻>> A chill is a feeling of cold. >> A chill sovuqlik tuyg'usi.

— The chill from the cold wind made Bill shiver.
— Sovuq shamol Billni titratdi.

hesitate [hezəteɪt] v. — ikkilanmoq
🔻>> To hesitate is to wait for a short time before doing something. >> To hesitate biror narsa qilishdan oldin qisqa vaqt kutishdir.

— He hesitated for a moment before he decided which choice to make.
— U qaysi tanlovni qilishdan oldin bir lahza ikkilandi.

arctic [ɑːrktɪk] adj. — juda sovuq
🔻>> If something is arctic, it is from far north near the North Pole. >> Agar biror narsa arctic boʻlsa, u Shimoliy Qutb yaqinidagi shimoldan.

— It is cold when the arctic winds blow.
— Arktika shamollari esganda sovuq bo'ladi.

canal [kəˈnæl] n. — kanal
🔻>> A canal is a path for water to travel through. >> A canal bu suv oʻtadigan yoʻldir.

— The city of Venice, Italy, has many canals.
— Italiyaning Venetsiya shahrida juda ko'p kanallar bor.

grocer [grousər] n. — oziq-ovqatfurush
🔻>> A grocer is a person who sells food. >> A grocer oziq-ovqat sotadigan shaxs.

— Our grocer, Mr. Smith, is a very kind man.
— Bizning baqqol janob Smit juda mehribon odam.

ache [eɪk] v. — og'rimoq
🔻>> If something aches, it hurts. >> Agar biror narsa ache bo'lsa, u og'riydi.

— Mindy’s head ached because she bumped it against the wall.
— Mindi devorga urilgani uchun boshi og‘ridi.

dairy [dɛərɪ] adj. — sutli, sutdan qilingan
🔻>> If something is dairy, it is made from milk. >> Agar biror narsa dairy bo'lsa, u sutdan qilingan bo'ladi. 

— Things like milk and cheese are dairy foods.
— Sut va pishloqqa o'xshagan narsalar sut mahsulotlari hisoblanadi.

stubborn [stʌbə:rn] adj. — qaysar, o'jar
🔻>> If people are stubborn, they don’t change their minds easily. >> Agar birortasi stubborn bo'lsa, u fikrini osonlikcha o'zgartirmaydi.

— Both of my parents are stubborn. They never give in to each other.
— Ota-onamning ikkalasi ham qaysar. Ular hech qachon bir-biriga taslim bo'lmaydilar.
Unit 29:
submarine [sʌbməˈriːn] n. — suv osti kemasi
🔻>> A submarine is a boat that can go underwater for long periods of time. >> A submarine uzoq vaqt suv ostida yuradigan kema.

— The submarine dove under the sea so the enemy couldn’t see it.
— Suv osti kemasi dengiz ostida uchib ketdi, shuning uchun dushman uni ko'ra olmadi.

grief [griːf] n. — qayg'u
🔻>> Grief is the feeling of deep sadness, usually when a person dies. >> Grief chuqur xafalik tuyg'usi, odatda inson o'lganda bo'ladi. 

— The grief caused by losing her parents was very difficult for her.
— Ota-onasini yo'qotganlik qayg'usi u uchun juda og'ir edi.

circumstance [səːrkəmstӕns] n. — sharoit, vaziyat
🔻>> A circumstance is an event that makes a situation what it is. >> A circumstance bu vaziyatni oʻz holiga keltiradigan hodisadir.

— There were many circumstances behind their success like hard work.
— Ularning muvaffaqiyati ortida mashaqqatli mehnat kabi ko'plab holatlar bor edi.

microscope [maɪkrəskoup] n. — mikroskop 
🔻>> A microscope is a device that makes small objects look bigger. >> A microscope kichik narsalarni katta qilib ko'rsatuvchi qurilma.

— Germs cannot be seen without a microscope.
— Mikroskopsiz mikroblarni ko'rish mumkin emas.

criticism [kritisizəm] n. — tanqid
🔻>> Criticism is the act of saying that you don’t like or approve of something. >> Criticism bu sizga biror narsani yoqtirmasligingizni yoki ma'qullamasligingizni aytish harakatidir.

— She had a lot of criticism about their new plan.
— U ularning yangi rejasi haqida juda ko'p tanqidlarga uchradi.

portray [pɔːrtreɪ] v. — suratini chizmoq
🔻>> To portray something means to describe it or show it in a picture. >> Biror narsani portray qilish uni tasvirlash yoki rasmda ko'rsatish degani.

— Her picture portrayed the house she grew up in when she was little.
— Uning suratida u kichkinaligida o'sgan uy tasvirlangan.

nuclear [njuːklɪə:r] adj. — yadroviy 
🔻>> When something is nuclear, it relates to the division or joining of atoms. >> Agar biror narsa nuclear boʻlsa, u atomlarning boʻlinishi yoki qoʻshilishi bilan bogʻliq.

— Nuclear power plants provide inexpensive energy to cities.
— Atom elektr stantsiyalari shaharlarni arzon energiya bilan ta'minlaydi.

groom [gruːm] n. — kuyov
🔻>> A groom is a man who is going to be married. >> A groom uylanmoqchi bo'lgan erkak.

— The groom looked happy as he walked with his new wife.
— Kuyov yangi kelini bilan ketayotgani uchun hursand ko'rinardi.

rotate [rouˈteɪt] v. — aylantirmoq, aylanmoq
🔻>> To rotate something means to turn it around in a circle. >> Biror narsani rotate qilish uni aylana bo'ylab aylantirish degani.

— An airplane’s propellers rotate quickly to help it fly.
— Samolyotning parvonalari uchib ketishiga yordam berish uchun tez aylanadi.

frown [fraun] v. — xo'mraymoq, qovog'ini solmoq
🔻>> To frown is to make an unhappy look with your face. >> To frown bu yuzingizga baxtsiz ko‘rinish berishdir.

— Melissa frowned when she found out that the party had been cancelled.
— Ziyofat bekor qilinganini bilganidan so'ng Melissa qovog'ini soldi.

bomb [bɒm] n. — bomba 
🔻>> A bomb is an object that explodes and destroys large areas. >> A bomb portlaydigan va katta maydonni vayron qiladigan obyekt.

— The bomb will destroy anything that is near.
— Bomba yaqinidagi istalgan narsani vayron qiladi.

certificate [sərtɪfəkɪt] n. — sertifikat,  guvohnoma
🔻>> A certificate is a document that says that something is true or happened. >> A certificate biror narsa to'g'ri yoki sodir bo'lganini aytadigan hujjat.

— I was given a certificate after completing the computer course.
— Kompyuter kursini tugatganimdan so'ng menga sertifikat berildi.

devastate [devəsteɪt] v. — vayron qilmoq, xarob qilmoq
🔻>> To devastate something means to completely destroy it. >> Biror narsani devastate qilish uni butunlay vayron qilish degani.

— The entire wall was devastated.
— Butun boshli devor vayron qilingan.

license [laɪsəns] n. — litsenziya, guvohnoma
🔻>> A license is an official document that gives one permission to do something. >> A license biror narsa qilish uchun ruxsat beruvchi rasmiy hujjat.

— In the United States you need a driver’s license to drive legally.
— AQShda siz mashinani qonunan boshqarish uchun haydovchilik guvohnomasini olishingiz kerak.

souvenir [su:vəniə:r] n. — souvenir, esdalik sovg'a
🔻>> A souvenir is something you buy to remind you of a place or event. >> A souvenir biror voqea yoki joyni eslatib turadigan, siz sotib oladigan narsa.

— I bought a Russian doll as a souvenir from my trip to Moscow.
— Men Moskvaga sayohatimdan esdalik sifatida rus qo'g'irchog'i sotib oldim.

coffin [kɔ:fɪn] n. — tobut
🔻>> A coffin is a box used to bury dead people. >> A coffin vafot etgan odamni dafn etish uchun ishlatiladigan quti.

— When a person passes away, they are usually buried inside of a coffin.
— Biror kishi vafot etganida, ular odatda tobut ichiga dafn qilinadi.

glance [glæns] v. — nazar tashlamoq
🔻>> To glance at something means to look at it quickly. >> Biror narsaga glance qilish unga tez qarash degani.

— She glanced behind her to see if he was looking at her.
— U unga qarayaptimi yoki yo‘qligini bilish uchun orqasiga qaradi.

trace [treɪs] v. — andoza olmoq
🔻>> To trace something means to follow over it with the eyes or a finger. >> Biror narsani trace qilish, uni koʻz yoki barmoq bilan kuzatib borish demakdir.

— He traced over the graph with his finger.
— U barmog‘i bilan grafikni kuzatdi.

gaze [geɪz] v. — tikilib qaramoq
🔻>> To gaze at something means to look at it for a long time. >> Biror narsaga gaze qilish unga uzoq vaqt qarab turish degani.

— We used a telescope to gaze at the stars for over an hour.
— Biz teleskop yordamida yulduzlarga bir soatdan koʻproq tikildik.

cope [koup] v. — yengmoq
🔻>> To cope with a difficult or stressful situation means to deal with it. >> Qiyin yoki stressli vaziyatda cope qilish uni yengish degani.

— He copes with work stress by exercising three or four times a week.
— U haftasiga uch-to‘rt marta mashq qilish orqali ishdagi stressni yengadi.
Unit 30:
strip [strɪp] n. — tasma
🔻>> A strip is a long, narrow piece of material or land. >> A strip bu uzun, tor material qismidir.

— He had long strips of film that held images of his trip abroad.
— Uning chet elga qilgan sayohati tasvirlari bo'lgan uzun tasmalari bor edi.

swing [swɪŋ] v. — urmoq, silkitmoq
🔻>> To swing something means to move it back and forth or from side to side. >> Biror narsani swing qilish uni oldinga va orqaga yoki u yoqdan bu yoqqa siljitish demakdir.

— He can swing a golf club very powerfully.
— U golf soppasini juda kuchli tebrata oladi.

swear [swɛər] v. — ont ichmoq
🔻>> To swear means to promise to do something. >> To swear biror narsa qilishga va'da berish degani.

— I will put my hand on the Bible and swear to do my best for the country.
— Men Injilga qo‘limni qo‘yaman va mamlakat uchun bor kuchimni ishga solishga qasam ichaman.

delicate [deləkɪt] adj. — nozik, nimjon 
🔻>> If something or someone is delicate, they are easy to break or harm. >> Agar biror narsa yoki birortasi delicate bo'lsa, uni sindirish yoki unga zarar yetkazish oson.

— You should hold the baby carefully because she’s very delicate.
— Siz chaqaloqni ehtiyotkorlik bilan ushlashingiz kerak, chunki u juda nozik.

reluctant [rɪˈlʌktənt] adj. — xohlamaydigan
🔻>> If someone is reluctant, they do not want to do something. >> Agar birortasi reluctant bo'lsa, u biror narsa qilishni xohlamaydi.

— She was reluctant to eat the meager breakfast.
— U arzimas nonushta qilishni istamasdi.

handicap [hændɪkæp] n. — kamchilik, nuqson 
🔻>> A handicap is a condition that limits someone’s mental or physical abilities. >> A handicap birortasining ruhiy yoki jismoniy qobiliyatlarini cheklaydigan holat.

— Joe has a slight handicap, so he uses a walker to get around.
— Joning ozgina nogironligi bor, shuning uchun u aylanib yurish uchun piyodalardan foydalanadi.

hook [huk] n. — ilgak
🔻>> A hook is a sharp curved piece of metal used for catching or holding things. >> A hook bu narsalarni ushlash yoki ushlab turish uchun ishlatiladigan oʻtkir qayrilgan metall boʻlagi.

— The fish went after the sharp hook.
— Baliq oʻtkir ilgakning orqasidan ketdi.

emerge [ɪˈməːrdʒ] v. — paydo bo'lmoq
🔻>> To emerge from something means to come out of it. >> Biror narsadan emerge bo'lish, o'sha narsadan paydo bo'lish degani.

— The hand suddenly emerged from the grave.
— Qo'l to'satdan qabrdan chiqdi.

spine [spaɪn] n. — umurtqa
🔻>> The spine is the bone that runs up and down the middle of the back. >> The spine orqaning oʻrtasidan yuqoriga va pastga qarab harakatlanuvchi suyakdir.

— Our spine helps us to stand up nice and straight.
— Bizning umurtqa pog'onasi bizga chiroyli va to'g'ri turishimizga yordam beradi.

pursue [pərjuː] v. — ketidan quvmoq
🔻>> To pursue someone or something is to chase or follow them. >> Biror narsani yoki birortasini pursue qilish uni ketidan quvish degani.

— The mother pursued her young child down the hill.
— Ona yosh bolasini tepalikdan quvib tushdi.

laundry [lɔːndrɪ] n. — kir, kirlar 
🔻>> Laundry is clothes that have been or need to be washed. >> Laundry yuvilishi kerak bo'lgan kiyimlar.

— He folded the clean laundry and put the dirty laundry in a basket.
— U toza kirlarni taxladi va iflos kirlarni savatga soldi.

broom [bruːm] n. — supurgi
🔻>> A broom is a brush with a long handle used for cleaning floors. >> A broom polni tozalash uchun ishlatiladigan uzun sopli cho'tka.

— My father usually uses a broom to sweep away dust in the basement.
— Otam odatda podvaldagi changni supurish uchun supurgidan foydalanadi.

basin [beɪsən] n. — rakovina
🔻>> A basin is large bowl for washing things. A sink is sometimes called a basin. >> A basin buyumlarni yuvish uchun katta idish. Rakovina ba'zan basin deb ataladi.

— She filled the basin with water and washed her face.
— U rakovinani suv bilan to'ldirdi va yuzini yuvdi.

stain [steɪn] n. — dog'
🔻>> A stain is a dirty mark that is difficult to clean. >> A stain tozalash qiyin bo'lgan kir belgi.

— He had a red stain on the collar of his shirt.
— Uning ko'ylagi yoqasida qizil dog' bor edi.

utilize [juːtəlaiz] v. — foydalanmoq, ishlatmoq
🔻>> To utilize something means to use it for a specific purpose. >> Biror narsani utilize qilish uni ma'lum maqsadda ishlatish degani. 

— They utilized a pair of scissors to cut the ribbon.
— Ular lentani kesish uchun qaychidan foydalanishdi.

hop [hɔp] v. — sakramoq
🔻>> To hop means to jump a short distance. >> To hop qisqa masofaga sakrash degani.

— The kangaroo quickly hopped away from danger.
— Kenguru xavfdan tezda sakrab qochdi.

appliance [əˈplaɪəns] n. — asbob, anjom 
🔻>> An appliance is a piece of equipment used for jobs in the home. >> An appliance uydagi ishlar uchun ishlatiladigan asbob.

— Many homes have appliances like ovens, toasters and refrigerators.
— Ko'pgina uylarda pechlar, tosterlar va muzlatgichlar kabi jihozlar mavjud.

sleeve [sliːv] n. — yeng
🔻>> Sleeves are the part of a shirt where your arms go. >> Sleeves ko'ylakning qo'llaringiz boradigan qismidir.

— Ryan bought a new shirt with long sleeves to keep his arms warm.
— Rayan qo'llarini issiq tutish uchun uzun yengli yangi ko'ylak sotib oldi.

caterpillar [kætərpɪlər] n. — kapalak qurti
🔻>> A caterpillar is a small insect that looks like a worm and eats plants. >> A caterpillar qurtga o'xshaydigan va o'simliklarni yeydigan kichik hasharot.

— After eating a lot of leaves, caterpillars change into butterflies.
— Ko'pgina barglarni yegandan so'ng kapalak qurtlari kapalakka aylanadi.

cupboard [kʌbərd] n. — shkaf
🔻>> A cupboard is a piece of furniture that is used to store food or household items. >> A cupboard bu oziq-ovqat yoki uy-ro'zg'or buyumlarini saqlash uchun ishlatiladigan mebel.

— We put all of our dishes and food in the cupboards.
— Biz barcha idishlar va yeguliklarni shkafga qo'yamiz.

Unit 1:
divine [dɪˈvaɪn] adj. — ilohiy 
⚜>> When something is divine, it is related to gods. >> Agar biror narsa divine bo'lsa, u Xudo bilan aloqador bo'ladi. 

— Legends say that music was given to men as a divine gift from the gods.
— Afsonalarda aytilishicha, musiqa odamlarga Xudolarning ilohiy sovg'asi sifatida berilgan.

odor [oudər] n. — hid, bo'y, is
⚜>> An odor is a very distinct smell. >> An odor aniq bilib turadigan hid.

— He knew there was a leak when he noticed the strong odor of natural gas.
— U tabiiy gazning kuchli hidini payqagach, sizib chiqqanini bildi.

soothing [suːðɪŋ] adj. — tinchlantiruvchi, ovuntiruvchi
⚜>> When something is soothing, it makes you calm or relaxed. >> Agar biror narsa soothing bo'lsa, u sizni tinchlantiradi yoki dam oldiradi.

— The soothing music helped the baby fall asleep.
— Tinchlantiruvchi musiqa chaqaloqning uxlashiga yordam berdi.

cluster [klʌstər] n. — bog', shingil
⚜>> A cluster of things is a small group of them placed close together. >> A cluster bir-biriga yaqin joylashtirilgan narsalarning kichik guruhi.

— She held a large cluster of grapes in her hand.
— U qo‘lida katta bir to‘plam uzum tutdi.

contemporary [kənˈtempərərɪ] adj. — zamonaviy, hozirgi
⚜>> When something is contemporary, it is related to the present time. >> Agar biror narsa contemporary bo'lsa, u hozirgi zamon bilan aloqador bo'ladi. 

— Contemporary scientists have learned quite a bit about DNA.
— Zamonaviy olimlar DNK haqida bir oz maʼlumotga ega boʻlishdi.

paradise [pærədaɪs] n. — jannatmakon joy, jannat
⚜>> Paradise is the place or condition of happiness where things are perfect. >> Paradise narsalar mukammal bo'ladigan hursandchilik joyi yoki vaziyati.

— My vacation in Hawaii was like being in paradise.
— Gavayidagi ta’tilim jannatda bo‘lgandek edi.

aroma [əˈroumə] n. — xushbo'y hid
⚜>> An aroma is a scent or smell. >> An aroma bu hid degani.

— I love the aroma of coffee in the morning.
— Men ertalabgi qahva hidini yaxshi ko'raman.

subtle [sʌtl] adj. — ko'z ilg'amas, bilinar-bilinmas
⚜>> When something is subtle, it is not easy to see or notice. >> Agar biror narsa subtle bo'lsa, uni ko'rish yoki payqash oson emas.

— The handsome man has a subtle smile.
— Kelishgan erkakning nozik tabassumi bor.

plantation [plænˈteɪʃən] n. — plantatsiya
⚜>> A plantation is a big farm that only grows certain kinds of crops. >> A plantation faqat ma'lum turdagi o'simliklar o'sadigan katta ferma.

— In the 1800s, there were many cotton plantations in the southern US.
— 1800-yillarda janubiy AQShda ko'plab paxta plantatsiyalari bo'lgan.

cultivate [kʌltəveɪt] v. — o'stirmoq, yetishtirmoq
⚜>> To cultivate plants is to care for them and help them grow. >> O'simliklarni cultivate qilish, ularga g'amxo'rlik qilish va o'sishiga yordam berish degani.

— A research company is cultivating new kinds of rice to aid poor countries.
— Tadqiqot kompaniyasi qashshoq mamlakatlarga yordam berish uchun guruchning yangi turlarini yetishtirmoqda.

vary [vɛərɪ] v. — farq qilmoq, farqlanmoq
⚜>> To vary means to be different from another thing in size or amount. >> To vary boshqa biror narsadan hajm yoki miqdor bilan farqli degani.

— The heights of the people in my class vary by a large amount.
— Mening sinfimdagi odamlarning bo'yi katta miqdorda farq qiladi.

beverage [bevərɪdʒ] n. — ichimlik
⚜>> A beverage is a drink. >> A beverage bu ichimlik degani.

— The waiter brought our beverages first. Then he brought our food.
— Ofitsiant birinchi bo'lib ichimliklarimizni olib keldi. Keyin ovqatimizni olib keldi.

rapid [ræpɪd] adj. — tez, jadal
⚜>> When something is rapid, it moves or changes very quickly. >> Agar biror narsa rapid bo'lsa, u juda tez harakatlanadi yoki o'zgaradi.

— His mother was surprised by her son’s rapid growth.
— Uning onasi o'g'lining tez o'sishidan hayratlandi.

palate [pælɪt] n. — tanglay
⚜>> The palate is the top part of the mouth. >> The palate og'izning tepagi qismi.

— You can touch your palate with your tongue.
— Siz tanglayingizga tilingiz bilan tegishingiz mumkin.

combine [kəmˈbaɪn] v. — birlashtirmoq
⚜>> To combine is to join together to make a single thing or group. >> To combine bitta narsa yoki guruh qilish uchun birlashtirish degani.

— Mina combined peanut butter and jelly to make a sandwich.
— Mina yeryong‘oq moyi va jeleni birlashtirib sendvich tayyorladi.

condensed [kənˈdenst] adj. — quyuq
⚜>> When a liquid is condensed, it is made thicker. >> Suyuqlik condensed bo'lganda, u qalinroq bo'ladi.

— One way to make a dessert thick and sweet is to use condensed milk.
— Shirinlikni qalin va shirin qilishning bir usuli quyultirilgan sutdan foydalanishdir.

toxic [tɒksɪk] adj. — zaharli
⚜>> When something is toxic, it is poisonous. Toxic things are very dangerous. >> Agar biror narsa toxic bo'lsa, u zaharli bo'ladi. Toxic narsalar juda xavfli.

— Please check the label to see if the product is toxic.
— Mahsulot zaharli yoki yoʻqligini bilish uchun yorliqni tekshiring.

texture [tekstʃə:r] n. — tekstura
⚜>> The texture of something is the way its surface looks and feels. >> The texture bu uning yuzasi koʻrinishi va hissiyotidir.

— The texture of a rock found in the water is typically very smooth.
— Suvda topilgan toshning teksturasi odatda juda silliqdir.

rate [reɪt] n. — tezlik, sur'at
⚜>> A rate is the speed at which something happens. >> A rate biror narsa sodir bo'ladigan tezlik.

— Grass tends to grow at a very slow rate.
— Maysa juda sekin sur'atda o'sishga moyil.

humid [hjuːmɪd] adj. — nam
⚜>> When it is humid, there is a lot of water in the air. >> Agar humid bo'lsa, havoda juda ko'p suv bo'ladi. 

— It is very humid inside of a sauna.
— Saunaning ichi juda nam.
Unit 2:
string [strɪŋ] n. — kanop ip
⚜>> String is a thin piece of fabric or rope. >> String bu yupqa mato yoki arqon boʻlagi.

— I found a large ball of string.
— Men katta to‘p ip topdim.

arc [ɑːrk] n. — ark
⚜>> An arc is a curved shape. >> An arc bukilgan, egilgan shakl.

— A rainbow has the shape of an arc.
— Kamalak arksimon shaklga ega.

stake [steɪk] n. — tirgak, ustun, qoziq
⚜>> A stake is a small, sharp piece of wood or metal that is put into the ground. >> A stake yerga qoʻyilgan kichik, oʻtkir yogʻoch yoki metall boʻlagidir.

— We marked our property by placing stakes into the ground.
— Biz mulkimizni yerga qoziq qoqish orqali belgiladik.

admiral [ædmərəl] n. — admiral
⚜>> An admiral is someone who controls many military ships. >> An admiral ko'plab harbiy kemalarni boshqaradigan shaxs.

— They won the sea battle because of the admiral’s great leadership.
— Ular admiralning buyuk rahbarligi tufayli dengiz jangida g'alaba qozonishdi.

loop [luːp] n. — sirtmoq
⚜>> A loop is a line made into the shape of a circle. >> A loop bu doira shaklida qilingan liniya.

— He made a loop with the rope and placed it over the post.
— U arqon bilan sirtmoq yasadi va uni ustun ustiga qo'ydi.

kerosene [kerəsiːn] n. — kerosin 
⚜>> Kerosene is a type of oil. It is used in some lamps and stoves. >> Kerosene moyning bir turi. Ba'zi lampalar va pechlarda ishlatiladi.

— Many people in poor countries cook on kerosene stoves.
— Kambag'al mamlakatlardagi ko'p odamlar kerosinli pechlarda ovqat pishirishadi.

fiery [faɪərɪ] adj. — olovli, alangali
⚜>> If something is fiery, it is burning strongly. >> Agar biror narsa fiery bo'lsa, u kuchli yonayotgan bo'ladi. 

— The fiery blaze burned all night long.
— Olovli alanga tun boʻyi yondi.

hay [heɪ] n. — somon, pichan
⚜>> Hay is dry grass used to feed animals or used as a covering. >> Hay bu hayvonlarni boqish yoki biror narsani o'rash uchun ushlatiladigan quruq maysa.

— I need to buy some more hay for the horse to sleep on.
— Ot uxlashi uchun yana pichan sotib olishim kerak.

grapefruit [greɪpfruːt] n. — greypfrut
⚜>> A grapefruit is a fruit similar to an orange, but bigger and not as sweet. >> A grapefruit bu apelsinga o'xshash, lekin undan kattaroq va unchalik shirin bo'lgan meva.

— Would you like a grapefruit with your breakfast?
— Nonushta bilan greypfrut xohlaysizmi?

horrified [hɔ:rəˌfaɪd] adj. — yomon qo'rqqan
⚜>> If you are horrified, you are very shocked and feel upset. >> Agar siz horrified bo'lsangiz, siz juda shokka tushgan va xafalik tuyg'usini tuygan bo'lasiz.

— I was horrified when I read about the old lady who was attacked.
— Hujumga uchragan kampir haqida o‘qiganimda dahshatga tushdim.

paddle [pædl] n. — eshkak
⚜>> A paddle is a piece of wood or plastic that moves a boat across water. >> A paddle qayiqni suv uzra harakatlantiradigan yog'och yoki plastik bo'lagi.

— We need a paddle to help us move across the water.
— Suv bo'ylab harakatlanishimizga yordam berishi uchun bizga eshkak kerak.

steward [stjuːərd] n. — styuardessa
⚜>> A steward is a person like a waiter who serves food on planes and ships. >> A steward kema yoki samolyotda xizmat qiladigan ofitsiantga o'xshagan shaxs.

— The steward is bringing some tea.
— Styuardessa choy olib kelyapti.

character [kærɪktər] n. — xarakter, fe'l-atvor
⚜>> Your character is your personality. >> Sizning character'ingiz bu sizning shaxsiyatingiz demakdir.

— My sister’s character is fun and very outgoing.
— Opamning xarakteri hushchaqchaq va juda kirishimli.

wreck [rek] v. — vayron qilmoq
⚜>> To wreck something means to destroy or ruin it. >> Biror narsani wreck qilish bu uni vayron qilish degani.

— The teenagers wrecked the house for no reason at all.
— O'smirlar hech qanday sababsiz uyni vayron qilishdi.

thorn [θɔːrn] n. — tikan
⚜>> A thorn is a sharp part of a plant. >> A thorn o'simlikning o'tkir qismi.

— Be careful of the thorns when you pick the roses!
— Atirgullarni uzayotganda tikanlariga hushyor bo'ling.

flesh [fleʃ] n. — badan, tana
⚜>> Flesh is the skin, muscle and fat on your body. >> Flesh bu tanangizdagi teri, mushak va yog'.

— The zebra’s flesh has black and white stripes.
— Zebraning tanasida qora va oq yo'llar bor.

accident [æksɪdənt] n. — falokat
⚜>> An accident is an unexpected undesirable event. >> An accident bu kutilmagan va xohlanmagan hodisa.

— She had to go to the hospital after she was in a serious car accident.
— U jiddiy avtohalokatga uchraganidan keyin kasalxonaga borishga majbur boʻlgan.

raft [ræft] n. — sol
⚜>> A raft is a floating platform made from pieces of wood tied together. >> A raft – bir-biriga bog‘langan yog‘och bo‘laklaridan yasalgan suzib yuruvchi platforma.

— The man made a raft out of bamboo and floated out to sea.
— Haligi erkak bambukdan sol yasadi va dengizga suzib ketdi.

conscience [kɒnʃəns] n. — vijdon
⚜>> Your conscience is your inner sense of what is right and wrong. >> Sizning conscience'ingiz nima to'g'ri yoki nima noto'g'ri ekanligi haqidagi ichki his tuyg'u.

— I recycle everything I can, so my conscience is clear!
— Men hamma narsani qayta ishlayman, shuning uchun vijdonim toza!

sour [sauə:r] adj. — nordon 
⚜>> When something is sour, it has a sharp and unpleasant taste. >> Agar biror narsa sour bo'lsa, u o'tkir va yoqimsiz ta'mga ega bo'ladi.

— I don’t like lemons because I think they are too sour.
— Men limonni yoqtirmayman, chunki ular juda nordon deb o'ylayman.
Unit 3:
switch [swɪtʃ] v. — alishtirmoq, o'zgartirmoq
⚜>> To switch means to change something to something else. >> To switch biror narsani boshqa biror narsaga o'zgartirish degani.

— Mom switched the TV station from the news to her favorite show.
— Onam televizordagi kanalni yangiliklardan sevimli shousiga almashtirdi.

echo [ekou] v. — exo, aks-sado bermoq 
⚜>> To echo means that a sound repeats itself because it bounced off an object. >> To echo tovush biror narsaga urilib qaytish degani.

— The child yelled over the canyon, and the wall echoed the sound.
— Bola kanyon ustida qichqirdi va devor ovozni aks-sado qildi.

awesome [ɔːsəm] adj. — hayajonga soluvchi 
⚜>> If something or someone is awesome, they are impressive or frightening. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa awesome bo'lsa, u ta'sirli va qo'rqitadigan bo'ladi. 

— The huge military plane was an awesome sight.
— Ulkan harbiy samolyot ajoyib manzara edi.

admonish [ədˈmɒnɪʃ] v. — ogohlantirmoq, dakki bermoq
⚜>> To admonish someone is to tell them you disapprove of their behavior. >> Biror kishiga admonish qilish, uning xatti-harakatlarini yoqtirmasligingizni bildirishdir.

— The teacher admonished Mark because he was chewing gum in class.
— O'qituvchi Markka dakki berdi, chunki u sinf xonasida saqich chaynayotgan edi.

disagree [dɪsəgriː] v. — norozi bo'lmoq, rad etmoq
⚜>> To disagree with someone means to have a different opinion from them. >> Birortasi bilan disagree bo'lish, undan farq qiluvchi fikrga ega bo'lish degani. 

— The lawyers disagreed about the best way to settle the case.
— Advokatlar ishni hal qilishning eng yaxshi yo'li borasida kelisha olmadilar.

pastime [pæstaɪm] n. — ermak, ovunchoq
⚜>> A pastime is an activity done for fun that you do often. >> A pastime siz odatda ko'ngilocharlik uchun qilinadigan faoliyat.

— In the US, baseball is considered the national pastime.
— AQShda beysbol milliy o'yin-kulgi, ya'ni ermak hisoblanadi.

hint [hint] n. — ishora
⚜>> A hint is information that suggests something will happen or is true. >> A hint bu nimadir sodir boʻlishini yoki haqiqat ekanligini koʻrsatuvchi maʼlumotdir.

— I quietly passed on a hint to my sister about the test.
— Sinov haqida singlimga sekingina ishora qildim.

thorough [θə:rou] adj. — to'liq
⚜>> If something or someone is thorough, then they are complete in every way. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa thorough bo'lsa, ular har tomondan to'liq bo'ladi. 

— Tina did a thorough job of cleaning the stains out of the carpet.
— Tina gilamdagi dog‘larni yaxshilab tozaladi.

brag [bræg] v. — maqtanmoq
⚜>> To brag means to talk of one’s abilities or achievements in a proud way. >> To brag birovning qobiliyatlari yoki yutuqlari haqida mag‘rurlanib gapirishni anglatadi.

— He had strong muscles and bragged about it to the entire class.
— U kuchli mushaklarga ega edi va bu haqda butun sinfga maqtanardi.

conscious [kɒnʃəs] adj. — sezadigan
⚜>> If someone is conscious of something, then they are aware of it. >> Agar birortasi biror narsadan conscious bo'lsa, u o'sha narsadan xabardor bo'ladi. 

— The new student was conscious of the other students staring at her.
— Yangi talaba boshqa talabalarning unga qarab turishini sezdi.

pinpoint [pɪnpɔɪnt] v. — turgan joyni aniqlamoq
⚜>> To pinpoint something means to locate it exactly. >> Biror narsani pinpoint qilish uning aniq manzilini aniqlamoq degani. 

— The navigation system in my car is able to pinpoint my exact location.
— Avtomobilimdagi navigatsiya tizimi mening aniq joylashuvimni aniqlay oladi.

immense [iˈmens] adj. — juda katta, ulkan
⚜>> If something is immense, it is very large. >> Agar biror narsa immense bo'lsa, u juda katta bo'ladi. 

— An immense amount of money was needed to buy such a large boat.
— Bunday katta qayiqni sotib olish uchun juda katta pul kerak edi.

audible [ɔːdəbl] adj. — eshitiladigan 
⚜>> If something is audible, then it is able to be heard. >> Agar biror narsa audible bo'lsa, uni eshitish imkoni bo'ladi. 

— The sound of the drums was audible from miles away.
— Nog‘ora sadosi chaqirimlar uzoqdan ham eshitilardi.

idiot [ɪdɪət] n. — ovsar, tentak
⚜>> An idiot is a person who is not smart or who has done something silly. >> An idiot aqlli bo'lmagan yoki biror ahmoqona ish qilgan shaxs.

— Because he got lost in the forest, the man felt like an idiot.
— U o'rmonda yo'qolib qolganligi sabab, o'zini tentakdek his qildi.

option [ɒpʃən] n. — tanlash imkoniyati
⚜>> An option is a choice between two or more things. >> An option ikki yoki ko'p narsa o'rtasidagi tanlov.

— The children were given the option of three houses to pick from.
— Bolalarga uchta uydan tanlash imkoniyati berildi.

perfect [pəːrfɪkt] adj. — mukammal
⚜>> If something is perfect, then it is without any mistakes. >> Agar biror narsa perfect bo'lsa, u biror xatosiz bo'ladi. 

— She got all the questions right, so her score was perfect.
— U hamma savollarga to'g'ri javob berdi, shuning uchun uning natijasi mukammal edi.

beware [bɪˈwɛər] v. — ehtiyot bo'lmoq
⚜>> To beware means to be careful of something or someone that is dangerous. >> To beware xavfli bo'lgan biror narsa yoki birortasidan ehtiyot bo'lish degani.

— You should beware of driving fast on wet roads.
— Siz nam yo'lda tez yurishdan ehtiyot bo'lishingiz kerak.

eventual [iˈventʃuəl] adj. — oxirgi, yakuniy
⚜>> If something is eventual, it will happen at the end of a series of events. >> Agar biror narsa eventual bo'lsa, u bir qator voqealar oxirida sodir bo'ladi. 

— The constant training and planning led the team to an eventual victory.
— Doimiy tayyorgarlik va rejalashtirish jamoani yakuniy g'alabaga olib keldi.

indirect [indiˈrekt] adj. — aylanma, to'g'ri emas
⚜>> If something is indirect, then it is not the easiest or straightest way. >> Agar biror narsa indirect bo'lsa, u juda oson yoki to'g'ri yo'l emas.

— He chose to take the most indirect route to the coast.
— U qirg'oqqa eng aylanma yo'lni tanladi.

torment [tɔːrment] v. — azob bermoq
⚜>> To torment someone means to cause them to suffer on purpose. >> To torment kimdir vositalarini birortasiga ataylab azob berishni anglatadi. 

— She tormented her little brother by taking his favorite toy.
— U ukasining sevimli o‘yinchog‘ini olib, uni qiynadi.
Unit 4:
moan [moun] v. — ingramoq 
⚜>> To moan is to make a low sound when feeling pain or sadness. >> To moan bu og'riq yoki qayg'u his qilganda past ovoz chiqarishdir.

— The sick man moaned from his bed.
— Kasal to'shagidan ingradi.

typical [tɪpɪkəl] adj. — odatiy
⚜>> If something is typical, it is normal for a certain type of thing. >> Agar biror narsa typical bo'lsa, u o'sha narsaning biror turi uchun odatiy.

— Barking is typical behavior for dogs.
— Hurish itlar uchun odatiy xatti-harakatlardir.

roost [ruːst] n. — qo'noq
⚜>> A roost is a place where birds can land and rest or sleep. >>  A roost qushlar qo'nishi, dam olishi yoki uxlashi mumkin bo'lgan joy.

— The family of doves made a roost at the top of the tree.
— Kabutarlar oilasi daraxt tepasida joylashdi.

ivy [aivi] n. — pechak
⚜>> Ivy is a plant with long vines that grows upward typically on walls. >> Ivy bu uzun tokli oʻsimlik boʻlib, odatda devorlarda yuqoriga qarab oʻsadi.

— The walls of the castle are covered with ivy.
— Qasr devorlari pechak bilan o'ralgan.

soar [sɔːr] v. — baland uchmoq
⚜>> To soar means to fly high in the air. >> To soar havoda baland uchishni anglatadi.

— As the sun rose, two eagles soared through the sky.
— Quyosh ko'tarilishi bilan osmonda ikkita burgut uchib ketdi.

pit [pit] n. — o'ra, chuqurlik
⚜>> A pit is a big hole in the ground. >> A pit yerdagi katta teshik.

— Michael fell into the pit and needed some help to get out.
— Maykl chuqurga yiqildi va chiqish uchun yordam kerak edi.

trivial [trɪvɪəl] adj. — arzimas, ahamiyatsiz
⚜>> If something is trivial, it is not important or meaningful. >> Agar biror narsa trivial bo'lsa, u muhim yoki ahamiyatli emas.

— Television is trivial, but learning to read is very important.
— Televizor ahamiyatsiz, lekin o'qishni o'rganish juda muhim.

utterly [ʌtəlɪ] adv. — butkul
⚜>> If something is utterly a way, it is completely that way. >> Agar biror narsa utterly bo'lsa, u to'laligicha o'sha yo'lda bo'ladi. 

— When the sun was blocked by the moon, it was utterly dark outside.
— Quyoshni oy to'sib qo'yganida, tashqarida butunlay qorong'i edi.

damp [dæmp] adj. — nam, ho'l
⚜>> If something is damp, it is somewhat wet. >> Agar biror narsa damp bo'lsa, u nam bo'ladi. 

— My hair is still damp from my shower.
— Mening sochlarim hali ham dushdan nam.

except [ɪkˈsept] prep. — ...dan tashqari
⚜>> You use except to talk about the only thing that a statement does not apply to. >> Bayonot amal qilmaydigan yagona narsa haqida gapirish uchun except dan foydalanasiz.

— Everyone had fun on the trip except Jim, who felt ill the whole time.
— Sayohatda hamma xursand bo'ldi, Jimdan tashqari, u doimo o'zini yomon his qildi.

beak [beak] n. — tumshuq
⚜>> A beak is the hard curved part of a bird’s mouth. >> A beak qush og'zidagi qattiq qayrilgan qism.

— The bird used her beak to dig a small hole in the ground.
— Qush tumshug‘i bilan yerga kichik bir teshik qazdi.

flight [flaɪt] n. — reys, parvoz 
⚜>> A flight is an act of flying, often in an airplane. >> A flight koʻpincha samolyotda uchish harakatidir.

— The airplane made a flight around the world.
— Samolyot butun dunyo bo'ylab parvoz qildi.

oblivious [əˈblɪvɪəs] adj. — unutgan, 
⚜>> If someone is oblivious of something, they are unaware of it. >> Agar birortasi biror narsadan obvious bo'lsa, u o'sha narsadan xabardor emas.

— I was late to school because I was oblivious of the time.
— Vaqtni unutganim uchun maktabga kechikdim.

weep [wiːp] v. — yig'lamoq
⚜>> To weep means to cry. >> To weep yig'lash degan ma'noni bildiradi.

— My sister told me the dramatic movie would make me weep.
— Singlim dramatik film meni yig‘latib yuborishini aytdi.

disapprove [disəˈpruːv] v. — norozi bo'lmoq 
⚜>> To disapprove of something is to think that it is wrong. >> Biror narsadan disapprove bo'lish, uni noto'g'ri deb o'ylash degani.

— Alex, disapproved of his son’s behavior.
— Aleks o'g'lining xatti-harakatidan norozi bo'ldi.

perish [perɪʃ] v. — o'lmoq, vafot etmoq
⚜>> To perish means to die, usually because of bad conditions or bad events. >> To perish odatda yomon  vaziyatlarda yoki yomon hodisalarda vafot etmoq degani.
 
— Many people perish in wars.
— Ko'p odamlar urushlarda halok bo'ladi.

rim [rim] n. — to'g'in, tegarchik
⚜>> The rim is the outside edge of a round thing, like a cup or bottle. >> The rim krujka yoki shisha idishga o'xshagan aylana narsaning tashqi qismi.

— I put my lips to the rim of the bottle and took a drink.
— Men lablarimni shishaning chetiga qoʻyib, ichimlik oldim.

slippery [slɪpərɪ] adj. — sirg'anchiq, sirpanchiq
⚜>> If something is slippery, it is wet or smooth and causes people to slip. >> Agar biror narsa slippery bo'lsa, u nam yoki tekis va odamlar sirpanishiga olib keladi.

— The repairman fell down on the floor because it was too slippery.
— Ta'mirchi polga yiqilib tushdi, chunki u juda silliq edi.

immoral [ɪˈmɔ(:)rəl] adj. — axloqsiz, xilof
⚜>> When something or someone is immoral, they are evil or do bad things. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa immoral bo'lsa, ular yovuz yoki yomon ishlar qiladi.

— Stealing money from one’s mother is an immoral act.
— Birortasining onasidan pul o'g'irlash axloqsizlikdir.

fond [fɒnd] adj. — ishqiboz, yoqtiradigan
⚜>> When someone is fond of something, they like it. >> Agar birortasi biror narsaga fond bo'lsa, u o'sha narsani yaxshi ko'radi. 

— I am very fond of chocolate cake.
— Men shokoladli tortni juda yaxshi ko'raman.
Unit 5:
recent [riːsənt] adj. — yaqinda sodir bo'lgan
⚜>> When something is recent, it happened a short time ago. >> Agar biror narsa recent sodir bo'lsa, u qisqa vaqt avval sodir bo'lgan bo'ladi.

— I did not know what caused his recent behavior.
— Uning yaqindagi xatti-harakatlariga nima sabab bo'lganini bilmasdim.

edit [edɪt] v. — tuzatishlar kiritmoq, tahrir qilmoq
⚜>> To edit means to correct a piece of writing so that it is suitable to be published. >> To edit bu yozuvni chop etishga yaroqli qilib tuzatishni bildiradi.

— She asked her brother to edit her paper before she submitted it to her teacher.
— U akasidan oʻqituvchisiga qogʻozni tahrir qilishini soʻradi.

moral [mɔ(:)rəl] n. — xulosa, qissadan hissa
⚜>> A moral is a message at the end of a story that teaches you something. >> A moral sizga biror narsa o'rgatadigan hikoya oxiridagi xabar.

— At the end of the story, Mother explained the moral to the children.
— Hikoyaning oxirida onam bolalarga xulosani tushuntirdi.

highlight [haɪlaɪt] v. — marker bilan ustidan chizmoq
⚜>> To highlight something means to mark it with a color so that it is easy to see. >> Biror narsani highlight qilish, koʻrish oson boʻlishi uchun uni rang bilan belgilash demakdir.

—  I read my vocabulary list and highlighted the most difficult words.
— Men lug'at ro'yxatini o'qib chiqdim va eng qiyin so'zlarni ajratib ko'rsatdim.

lecture [lektʃə:r] n. — maruza
⚜>> A lecture is a long, educational speech. >> A lecture uzun, ilmiy nutq.

— His lecture on world hunger was very informative.
— Uning dunyodagi ochlik haqidagi maʼruzasi juda maʼlumotli boʻldi.

evaluate [iˈvӕljueit] v. — o'rganib chiqmoq
⚜>> To evaluate something means to study it, so a decision can be made. >> Biror narsani evaluate qilish qaror qabul qilish uchun uni o'rganish degani.

— Joe and Ken evaluated the plan and agreed that it would work.
— Jo va Ken rejani o'rganib chiqishdi va u ish berishiga ishonch hosil qilishdi.

gymnasium [dʒɪmˈneɪzɪəm] n. — gimnastika zali
⚜>> A gymnasium is a building with equipment that you can use to get exercise. >> A gymnasium bu siz mashq qilish uchun foydalanishingiz mumkin bo'lgan jihozlar bilan jihozlangan bino.

— When I go to the gymnasium, I use the treadmill for 20 minutes.
— Gimnaziyaga borganimda, 20 daqiqa yugurish yo‘lakchasidan foydalanaman.

typewritten [taɪpˌrɪtn] adj. — kompyuterda yozilgan
⚜>> If something is typewritten, it is written on a computer or typewriter. >> Agar biror narsa typewritten bo'lsa, u kompyuterda yozilgan bo'ladi. 

— This is an important, formal project and must be typewritten.
— Bu muhim, rasmiy loyiha boʻlib, matn terib yozilishi kerak.

private [praɪvɪt] adj. — shaxsiy
⚜>> If something is private, it is only used by one person or group. >> Agar biror narsa private bo'lsa, u faqat bir inson yoki guruh tomonidan ishlatiladi.

— Don’t look at my diary! It’s private!
— Kundaligimga qarama! U shaxsiy!

index [ɪndeks] n. — ilova, mundarija
⚜>> An index is a list of words at the end of a book that gives information. >> An index ma'lumot beruvchi kitob oxiridagi so'zlar jamlanmasi.

— If you look in the index, you’ll find the right page number.
— Ilovaga qarasangiz, kerakli sahifa raqamini topasiz.

ignorant [ɪgnərənt] adj. — bexabar, o'quvsiz
⚜>> If someone is ignorant about something, they have no knowledge about it. >> Agar birortasi biror narsadan ignorant bo'lsa, u o'sha narsa haqida ma'lumotga ega emas.

—  I’m a bit ignorant about his theories. Can you explain them to me?
— Men uning nazariyalari haqida biroz bexabarman. Menga ularni tushuntirib bera olasizmi?

operate [ɒpəreɪt] v. — ishlamoq, vazifasini bajarmoq
⚜>> To operate means to work or function. >> To operate ishlamoq yoki vazifa bajarmoq degan ma'noni anglatadi.

— I’m sorry, but the trains are not operating today.
— Kechirasiz, lekin bugun poyezdlar ishlamayapti.

essay [eseɪ] n. — insho
⚜>> An essay is a short piece of writing on a certain subject. >> An essay ma'lum bir mavzudagi qisqa yozma ish.

— She had to write a two-page essay for her English class.
— Ingliz tili darsi uchun u ikki betli insho yozishga majbur bo'ldi.

faint [feɪnt] v. — xushidan ketmoq, xushini yo'qotmoq
⚜>> To faint means to go unconscious and fall down. >> To faint xushini yo'qotish va yiqilish degani.

— Carol fainted because she hadn’t eaten in over a day.
— Karol xushini yo'qotdi chunki u kun bo'yi hech narsa yemagan edi.

resolution [rezəˈluːʃən] n. — qat'iy qaror
⚜>> A resolution is a personal decision. >> A resolution shaxsiy qaror degani.

— At New Year, I made a list of resolutions to help me have a better year.
— Yangi yilda men yilni yaxshiroq o'tkazishimga yordam beradigan qarorlar ro'yxatini tuzdim.

semester [sɪˈmestər] n. — semestr 
⚜>> A semester is a portion of a school year. >> A semester maktab o'quv yilining bir qismi.

— Jack is in his second semester of college.
— Jek kollejning ikkinchi semestrida o'qiydi.

weird [wiə:rd] adj. — g'ayritabiiy, qo'rqinchli
⚜>> When something is weird, it is very strange. >> Agar biror narsa weird bo'lsa, u juda g'alati bo'ladi. 

— My best friend’s dad is a bit weird.
— Eng yaqin do'stimning otasi biroz g'ayritabiiy.

awhile [əˈwaɪl] adv. — biroz vaqtga
⚜>> If you do something awhile, you do it for a short time. >> Agar siz biror narsani awhile qilsangiz, siz uni qisqa vaqtda qilasiz.

— Wait here awhile, and I’ll bring some tea.
— Shu yerda biroz kutib turing, men choy olib kelaman.

global [gloubəl] adj. — global
⚜>> If something is global, it happens all around the world. >> Agar biror narsa global bo'lsa, u butun dunyo bo'ylab sodir bo'ladi. 

— Pollution is a global problem.
— Atrof muhitning ifloslanishi global muammodir.

cyberspace [saɪbərspeɪs] n. — kiber bo'shliq, kibermakon
⚜>> Cyberspace is the imaginary place of the Internet where activities occur. >> Cyberspace harakatlar sodir bo'ladigan internetning tasavvuriy joyi.

— I didn’t receive your email. It probably got lost in cyberspace.
— Men sizning elektron pochtangizni olmadim. U kibermakonda yoʻqolgan boʻlishi mumkin.
Unit 6:
melt [melt] v. — erimoq
⚜>> To melt means to turn from a solid to a liquid. >> To melt qattiq narsadan suyuqlikka aylanishni anglatadi.

— The snowman that we made yesterday melted in the sun.
— Biz kecha yasagan qorbobo quyoshda erib ketdi.

role [roul] n. — vazifa, maqsad
⚜>> A role is the normal purpose or function of a person or thing. >> A role biror narsa yoki shaxsning odatiy maqsad yoki vazifasi.

— My role at work is to check the quality of the products.
— Mening vazifam mahsulotlar sifatini tekshirishdan iborat.

cape [keɪp] n. — nakidka, yoping'ich
⚜>> A cape is a large cloth that covers one’s back and is tied around the neck. >> A cape yelkadan boylanadigan va orqasini yopib turadigan katta mato.

— The superhero wore a long red cape.
— Super qahramon uzun qizil yoping'ich kiygan edi.

spirit [spirit] n. — ruhiyat
⚜>> A spirit is someone’s feelings and personality, but not a physical body part. >> A spirit bu kimningdir his-tuyg'ulari va shaxsiyati, lekin jismoniy tana qismi emas.

— He has a very outgoing spirit. He can make friends with anyone.
— U juda ochiq ruhda ega. U har kim bilan do'stlasha oladi.

soak [souk] v. — ivitmoq, namlamoq
⚜>> To soak something means to make it very wet. >> Biror narsani soak qilish uni ho'l qilish degani.

— You need to soak these beans overnight before you cook them.
— Pishirishdan oldin ularni bir kechaga namlash kerak.

suit [suːt] n. — kostyum 
⚜>> A suit is a set of clothes. It usually includes a jacket with pants or a skirt. >> A suit kiyimlar toʻplamidir. Odatda shim bilan ko'ylakni o'z ichiga oladi.

— I wore my new suit on my date with Melissa.
— Men Melissa bilan uchrashganimda yangi kostyumimni kiydim.

recipe [resəpi:] n. — retsep
⚜>> A recipe is a set of instructions to make food. >> A recipe bu ovqat tayyorlash boʻyicha koʻrsatmalar toʻplamidir.

— The apple cake that you made is really tasty. Can I have the recipe, please?
— Siz tayyorlagan olmali pirog juda mazali. Retseptini olsam maylimi?

pop [pop] n. — paqillagan ovoz, paq
⚜>> A pop is a short, loud sound. >> A pop qisqa, baland ovoz.

— I heard a loud pop; then my computer screen shattered.
— Men baland ovozni eshitdim; keyin mening kompyuterim ekrani sinib ketdi.

folk [fouk] n. — odamlar
⚜>> Folk are common or average people. >> Folks umumiy oddiy odamlardir.

— I’ve invited all the folks from our street to a gathering at my place.
— Men ko'chamizdagi barcha yaqin odamlarni o'z joyimdagi yig'ilishga taklif qildim.

spark [spɑːrk] n. — uchqun
⚜>> A spark is a small, quick flash of fire. >> A spark kichik, tez chiqadigan olov uchquni.

— As he welded the two pieces of metal together, sparks flew everywhere.
— U ikki bo‘lakni bir-biriga payvandlaganda, hamma joyda uchqunlar uchib ketdi.

pudding [pudiŋ] n. — shirin desert
⚜>> A pudding is a sweet dessert. >> A pudding shirin desert degani.

— Would you like some chocolate pudding and coffee for dessert?
— Desert uchun shokoladli shirinlik va kofe istaysizmi?

alas [əˈlæs] int. — afsus, attang 
⚜>> Alas is a word that people say when something bad happens. >> Alas odamlar biror yomon narsa sodir bo'lganda aytadigan so'z.

— I looked everywhere for my purse, but alas, I couldn’t find it.
— Men hammayoqdan hamyonimni qidirdim, lekin afsus topa olmadim.

rail [reɪl] n. — zinapoya panjarasi
⚜>> A rail is a horizontal bar made of metal or wood. >> A rail metall yoki yogʻochdan yasalgan gorizontal to'siqdir.

— The cat was sitting on the rail of the fence.
— Mushuk zinapoya panjarasida o'tirgan edi.

envision [ɪnˈvɪʒən] v. — tasavvur qilmoq, faraz qilmoq
⚜>> To envision something means to imagine that it may happen. >> Biror narsani envision qilish u sodir bo'lishi mumkinligini tasavvur qilishni anglatadi.

— I can envision my mom’s face when I give her this present!
— Men onamga sovg'ani berganimda uning yuzini tasavvur qilaman!

evenly [iːvənlɪ] adv. — bir xilda, teng
⚜>> When something happens evenly, it happens at the same rate or level. >> Agar biror narsa evenly sodir bo'lsa, u bir xil vaqtda sodir bo'ladi. 

— The food was handed out evenly among the hungry people.
— Ovqat och qolganlarga teng taqsimlandi.

patch [pætʃ] n. — yamoq, parcha
⚜>> A patch is a part of a surface that is different in appearance from the rest. >> A patch ko'rinishidan boshqalardan farq qiluvchi yuza qismi.

— There was one small patch of grass in the sand-covered desert.
— Qum bilan qoplangan sahroda bitta kichik o'tloq parchasi bor edi.

shrink [ʃriŋk] v. — kichraymoq, toraymoq
⚜>> To shrink means to get smaller. >> To shrink kichikroq bo'lib borishni anglatadi.

— If you stick to a healthy diet, your stomach will shrink!
— Sog'lom parhezga rioya qilsangiz, oshqozoningiz kichrayadi!

attentive [əˈtentɪv] adj. — diqqatli, e'tiborli
⚜>> If you are attentive, you are careful and you pay attention. >> Agar siz attentive bo'lsangiz, hushyor va e'tibor qaratadigan odams

— He is a good student because he is attentive to every detail on his work.
— U yaxshi talaba, chunki u o'z ishining har bir detaliga diqqat bilan qaraydi.

pleasure [pleʒər] n. — mamnuniyat
⚜>> Pleasure is a feeling of happiness. >> Pleasure hursandchilik tuyg'usi.

— The student smiled with pleasure when she received the prize.
— Talaba sovrinni olganda mamnuniyat bilan kuldi.

absolute [æbsəluːt] adj. — mutlaq
⚜>> If something is absolute, it is total or complete. >> Agar biror narsa absolute bo'lsa, u butunlay yoki mutlaq bo'ladi. 

— My presentation was an absolute disaster! It was terrible!
— Mening taqdimotim mutlaq falokat bo'ldi! Bu dahshatli edi!
Unit 7:
deed [diːd] n. — dalolatnoma
⚜>> A deed is a certificate that proves that someone owns something. >> A deed birovning biror narsaga egaligini tasdiqlovchi guvohnomadir.

— When she bought the car, she was given a deed to show the car was hers.
— U mashinani sotib olgach, unga mashina oʻziniki ekanligini koʻrsatuvchi hujjat berildi.

landmark [lændmɑːrk] n. — orientir, nishon
⚜>> A landmark is an object that helps people find or remember a location. >> A landmark odamlar topishi uchun yordam beradigan obyekt hisoblanadi.

— The tall tree was used as a landmark for people to find the road to the inn.
— Uzun bo'yli daraxt odamlarning mehmonxonaga yo'l topishlari uchun nishon sifatida ishlatilgan.

gratitude [grӕtətjuːd] n. — minnatdorchilik
⚜>> Gratitude is a feeling of being thankful. >> Gratitude minnatdor bo'lish tuyg'usi.

— The kids showed Aunt Tess much gratitude for visiting them.
— Bolalar Tessa xolaga tashrif buyurgani uchun minnatdorchilik bildirishdi.

proclaim [prouˈkleim] v. — tantanali ravishda e'lon qilmoq
⚜>> To proclaim something means to say it in public. >> Biror narsani proclaim qilish uni jamoat oldida aytish degani.

— The army general proclaimed that the war was won.
— Armiya generali urushda g'alaba qozonilganini e'lon qildi.

crime [kraɪm] n. — jinoyat 
⚜>> A crime is something bad that a person does that can be punished by law. >> A crime bu qonun bilan jazolanishi mumkin boʻlgan odam sodir etgan yomon narsadir.

— Police quickly arrived at the scene of the crime.
— Tez orada politsiya jinoyat joyiga yetib keldi.

legal [liːgəl] adj. — qonuniy
⚜>> If something is legal, it is related to the law or allowed by the law. >> Agar biror narsa legal bo'lsa, u qonun bilan aloqador yoki qonun bilan ruxsat berilgan bo'ladi. 

— It was not legal for him to drive until he was eighteen years old.
— Uning o'n sakkiz yoshga to'lgunga qadar mashina haydashi qonuniy emas edi.

memorable [memərəbəl] adj. — esda qolarli
⚜>> If something is memorable, then it is remembered for a special reason. >> Agar biror narsa memorable bo'lsa, u ma'lum bir sababga ko'ra eslanadi.

— The party was memorable; people were still talking about it years later.
— Ziyofat esda qolarli bo'lgan; odamlar bir necha yildan keyin ham u haqida gapirishardi.

account [əˈkaunt] n. — hisob raqami
⚜>> An account with a bank is an arrangement to keep one’s money there. >> Bankdagi account — bu oʻz pullarini u yerda saqlash kelishuvidir.

— After I paid for the new car, my bank account was nearly empty.
— Yangi mashina uchun pul to‘laganimdan so‘ng, bankdagi hisobim deyarli bo‘shab qoldi.

oblige [əˈblaɪdʒ] v. — majbur qilmoq
⚜>> To oblige someone means to require them to do something. >> Birortasini oblige qilish uning biror narsa qilishini talab qilish degani.

— If I wanted to have playtime, I was obliged to clean my room once a week.
— Agar men o'yin vaqtini o'tkazmoqchi bo'lganimda, haftada bir marta xonamni tozalashga majbur bo'lardim.

habitat [hӕbətӕt] n. — makon, joy
⚜>> A habitat is the natural home of animals or plants. >> A habitat hayvonlar va o'simliklarning tabiiy uyi.

— Frogs are often found in a wet habitat, such as near a lake, river, or pond.
— Baqalar odatda ko'l, daryo yoki hovuz kabi nam joylarda bo'ladi.

intervene [intərviːn] v. — ajratmoq, o'rtasiga tushmoq
⚜>> To intervene means to help stop a problem between two people or groups. >> To intervene ikki odam yoki guruh o'rtasidagi muammoni to'xtatishga yordam berish degani.

— The students argued until the teacher intervened.
— O‘qituvchi gapga aralashguncha o‘quvchilar tortishib qolishdi.

architect [ɑːrkɪtekt] n. — arxitektor
⚜>> An architect is a person who designs buildings. >> An architect binolarni loyihalashtiruvchi kishidir.

— The plans for building the new home were drawn by a famous architect.
— Yangi uy qurish rejalari mashhur arxitektor tomonidan chizilgan.

conceal [kənˈsiːl] v. — yashirmoq, berkitmoq
⚜>> To conceal something means to hide it. >> Biror narsani conceal qilish uni yashirishni anglatadi.

— You should conceal your money so no one can take it from you.
— Hech kim sizdan tortib ololmasligi uchun pulingizni yashirishingiz kerak.

offense [əˈfens] n. — jinoyat 
⚜>> An offense is an action that breaks the law and requires punishment. >> An offense bu qonunni buzadigan va jazo talab qiladigan harakatdir.

— He was put in jail for two days for the offense.
— U sodir etgan jinoyati uchun ikki kunga qamoqqa tashlandi.

rally [rӕli] n. — yig'ilish, ralli, miting 
⚜>> A rally is a large public meeting in order to support something. >> A rally biror narsani qo'llab quvvatlash uchun katta jamoat yig'ilishi.

— The school had a rally in the gym to support the basketball team.
— Maktabning sport zalida basketbol jamoasini qo‘llab-quvvatlash uchun miting o‘tkazildi.
Unit 8:
constant [kɒnstənt] adj. — doimiy
⚜>> When an event or action is constant, it happens a lot or all the time. >> Agar biror voqea yoki harakat constant bo'lsa, u ko'p marotaba yoki doim sodir bo'ladi. 

— The television at home is in constant use.
— Uydagi televizor doimiy ravishda ishlatiladi.

mode [moud] n. — sharoit, muhit
⚜>> A mode is a setting or condition on a machine. >> A mode – bu mashinadagi sozlama yoki shart.

— Mother turned the TV to quiet mode while she talked on the phone.
— Onam telefonda gaplashayotganda televizorni jim rejimga o'tkazdi.

sly [slai] adj. — ayyor
⚜>> If a person or animal is sly, they are sneaky or good at tricking people. >> Agar biror kishi yoki hayvon sly boʻlsa, ular ayyor yoki odamlarni aldashda yaxshi.

— The sly fox stole the eggs from the nest.
— Ayyor tulki indagi tuxumlarni o'g'irladi.

device [diˈvais] n. — qurilma, asbob
⚜>> A device is an object or a machine. >> A device qurilma yoki mashina.

— A thermometer is a device that tells temperature.
— Termometr haroratni aytadigan qurilma.

crack [kræk] n. — darz, yoriq
⚜>> A crack is a narrow space between the parts of something broken. >> A crack biror singan narsa qismlari o'rtasidagi tor bo'shliq.

— The old window was covered with cracks.
— Eski oyna yoriqlar bilan qoplangan edi.

valid [vælid] adj. — yaroqli
⚜>> When something is valid, it is correct or based on good reasoning. >> Agar biror narsa valid bo'lsa, u to'g'ri yoki yaxshi sababga asoslangan bo'ladi. 

— The expert’s opinion on the subject was more valid than others.
— Mutaxassisning fikri qolganlarnikiga qaraganda ko'proq to'g'ri edi.

snap [snæp] v. — sindirmoq, qarsillab sindirmoq
⚜>> To snap something means to break it suddenly, which causes a loud noise. >> Biror narsani snap qilish, uni to'satdan baland ovoz chiqaradigan qilib sindirish degani.

— I took the stick and snapped it with my hands.
— Men tayoqni oldim va qo‘llarim bilan sindirdim.

whatsoever [hwɒtsouˈevər] adj. — deyarli
⚜>> You use whatsoever after a noun to emphasize that there is nothing of that thing. >> Biror narsaning hech narsasi yo‘qligini ta’kidlash uchun o'sha otdan keyin whatsoever dan foydalanasiz.

— The boy had no idea whatsoever how to solve the story problem.
— Bola hikoya muammosini qanday hal qilishni deyarli bilmas edi.

grip [grɪp] v. — mahkam ushlab olmoq
⚜>> To grip something is to hold it very tightly. >> Biror narsani grip qilish uni juda mahkam ushlamoq degani.

— I was scared, so I gripped my older sister’s hand.
— Men qo'rqib ketdim, shuning uchun opamning qo'lini mahkam ushlab oldim.

law [lɔː] n. — qonun
⚜>> A law is a rule made by the legislative body. >> A law qonun chiqaruvchi organ tomonidan qabul qilinadigan qoida.
 
— The students learned about different laws during social studies class.
— Talabalar ijtimoiy fanlar darsi davomida turli qonunlar bilan tanishdilar.

enclose [inˈklouz] v. — panjara bilan o'ramoq
⚜>> To enclose something is to contain it. >> Biror narsani enclose qilish, uni o'z ichiga olish degani.

— The cows in the field were enclosed by a fence.
— Daladagi sigirlar panjara bilan o'ralgan edi.

conduct [kɒndʌkt] n. — xulq-atvor
⚜>> Conduct is the way that someone acts. >> Conduct birortasining harakat qilish yo'li.

— She was punished for her bad conduct.
— U yomon xatti-harakati uchun jazolandi.

perspire [pəsˈpaɪər] v. — terlamoq
⚜>> To perspire means to sweat. >> To perspire terlamoq degan ma'noni anglatadi. 

— I usually perspire a lot when I am at practice.
— Men odatda mashq qilayotganimda ko'p terlayman.

impending [ɪmˈpendɪŋ] adj. — yaqinlashayotgan
⚜>> If something is impending, it is going to happen soon. >> Agar biror narsa impending bo'layotgan bo'lsa, u yaqinda sodir bo'ladi.

— The student was nervous about his impending test.
— Talaba yaqinlashib kelayotgan testidan asabiylashdi.

influence [influəns] v. — ta'sir ko'rsatmoq
⚜>> To influence someone or something is to have an effect over them. >>  Birortasi yoki biror narsaga influence qilish, ular ustidan ta'sirga ega bo'lish degani.

— My friend influenced my decision to attend Terrance University.
— Terrans universitetiga o‘qishga kirishimga do‘stim ta’sir ko‘rsatdi.

access [ækses] n. — kirish/foydalanish imkoniyati
⚜>> Access is the right to enter or use something. >> Access biror narsaga kirish yoki undan foydalanish huquqi.

— The manager was the only person with access to the password.
— Menejer parolga kirish huquqiga ega boʻlgan yagona shaxs edi.

version [vəːrʒən] n. — variant, boshqacha ko'rinish
⚜>> A version is an account of something that differs slightly from the original. >> A version  bu asl nusxadan biroz farq qiladigan narsaning hisobidir.

— She read the students British version of the Chinese fairy tale.
— U talabalarga xitoy ertagining inglizcha versiyasini o'qidi.

replace [riˈpleis] v. — joyiga qo'ymoq
⚜>> To replace something is to put it in the place of something else. >> Biror narsani replace qilish, uni biror boshqa narsa o'rniga qo'yish degani.

— I replaced the tire on my car because it was flat.
— Mashinamning shinasini almashtirdim, chunki u tekis edi.

tend [tend] v. — moyil bo'lmoq
⚜>> To tend to do something is to be likely to do it or to do it often. >> Biror narsaga tend bo'lish bu ishni qilishga moyil bo'lish yoki tez-tez qilishdir.

— My mom tends to buy me the perfect gift each Christmas.
— Onam har Rojdestvoda menga eng zo'r sovg'a sotib olishga intiladi.

halt [hɔːlt] v. — to'xtatmoq
⚜>> To halt is to stop moving. >> To halt harakatlanishdan to'xtash degani.

— The criminal halted when he saw the police coming.
— Jinoyatchi politsiya kelayotganini ko'rib to'xtadi.
Unit 9:
display [disˈplei] v. — ko'rsatmoq, namoyish qilmoq
⚜>> To display something is to show it, especially by putting it in a certain place. >> Biror narsani display qilish, asosan uni biror joyga qo'yish orqali ko'rsatish degani.

— The museum displayed many wonderful paintings.
— Muzeyda ko'plab ajoyib rasmlar namoyish etilgan.

rumor [ruːmər] n. — mish-mish
⚜>> A rumor is something people talk about even though it may not be true. >> A rumor bu haqiqat boʻlmasa ham, odamlar gapiradigan narsadir.

— Kevin was spreading rumors about Marcia to everyone.
— Kevin Marsia haqidagi mish-mishlarni hammaga tarqatayotgan edi.

subject [sʌbdʒɪkt] n. — mavzu
⚜>> A subject is the topic that is being discussed or taught. >> A subject muhokama qilinayotgan yoki o'rgatilyotgan mavzu.

— The subject of Marco’s speech was the economy.
— Marko nutqining mavzusi iqtisod haqida edi.

slap [slæp] v. — tarsaki solmoq
⚜>> To slap someone means to hit them with the palm of the hand. >> Birortasini slap qilish uni kafti yoki qo'li bilan urish degani.

— Out of anger, Helen slapped Eunice on the face.
— Jahli chiqqani sabab Helen Yunisning yuziga tarsaki bilan urdi.

breeze [briːz] n. — shabada
⚜>> A breeze is a soft wind. >> A breeze yengil shamol.

— The breeze caused the leaves to fall off the tree.
— Shabada barglar daraxtdan to'kilishiga sabab bo'ldi.

efficient [iˈfiʃənt] adj. — epchil, chaqqon
⚜>> If something or someone is efficient, they do not waste energy. >> Agar biror narsa yoki birortasi efficient bo'lsa, u energiya sarf qilmaydi.

— My car is very efficient. I rarely have to buy gas.
— Mening mashinam juda samarali. Men kamdan-kam benzin sotib olishim kerak.

majestic [məˈdʒestik] adj. — dabdabali, hashamatli
⚜>> If something is majestic, it is large and beautiful. >> Agar biror narsa majestic bo'lsa u katta va chiroyli bo'ladi. 

— The rich people lived in a big, majestic house.
— Boy odamlar dabdabali uyda yashar edi.

outraged [autreɪdʒ] adj. — g'azablangan
⚜>> If someone is outraged, they are very angry. >> Agar birortasi outraged bo'lsa, u juda darg'azab bo'ladi. 

— My father was outraged when he saw that I had crashed his car.
— Men dadamning mashinasini urib olganimni bilib qolganida u g'azablandi.

assist [əˈsist] v. — yordam bermoq, yordamlashmoq
⚜>> To assist someone is to help them. >> Birortasiga assist qilish unga yordam berish degani.

— Andrew assisted me with my homework.
— Andrey menga uyga vazifa qilishga yordam berdi.

nor [nɔːr] conj — na ... na 
⚜>> You use nor to connect two negative ideas. >> Siz nor'ni ikki negativ fikrni bog'lash uchun ishlatasiz.

— I eat neither apples nor oranges. I don’t like either one.
— Men na olma, na apelsin yeyman. Men har ikkisini ham yaxshi ko'rmayman.

feeble [fiːbəl] adj. — kuchsiz, nimjon
⚜>> If someone is feeble, they are small or weak. >> Agar birortasi feeble bo'lsa, u kichik yoki nozik bo'ladi. 

— The boy was too feeble to carry the object very far.
— Haligi bola boyagi narsani uzoqqa ko'targani juda nimjon edi.

alongside [əˈlɒŋˈsaɪd] adv. — yonma-yon
⚜>> If something is alongside another thing, then it is next to it. >> Agar biror narsa boshqa biror narsaning alongside tarafida bo'lsa, u undan keyin, ya'ni yonma-yon turgan bo'ladi. 

— We work alongside each other in the office.
— Biz ofisda yonma-yon ishlaymiz.

smash [smæʃ] v. — sindirmoq, chil-chil qilmoq
⚜>> To smash something is to break it into many small pieces. >> Biror narsani smash qilish uni juda ko'p mayda bo'laklarga bo'lish degani.

— Jacob smashed the window with a rock.
— Yakob oynani tosh bilan sindirdi.

forgive [fə:rgɪv] v. — kechirmoq
⚜>> To forgive someone is to stop being angry with them. >> Birortasini forgive qilish, undan ortiq jahli chiqmaslik degani.

— Sandra forgave Peter after he said he was sorry.
— Sandra Butrusni kechirganini aytganidan keyin  kechirdi.

whereas [hwɛərˈæz] conj. — modomiki, zotan
⚜>> You use whereas to show how two things are different. >> Siz whereas'ni ikki narsa qanchalik farqli ekanligini aytish uchun ishlatasiz.
 
— My sister loves horror movies, whereas I prefer comedies.
— Opam qo'rqinchli filmlarni yaxshi ko'radi, zotan men komediyani afzal ko'raman.

lively [laivli] adj. — quvnoq, jo'shqin
⚜>> If someone is lively, they have a lot of energy. >> Agar birortasi lively bo'lsa, unda juda ko'p energiya bo'ladi. 

— Jennifer is very lively: she’s always running and playing.
— Jennifer juda jo'shqin: u doim yuguradi va o‘ynaydi.

appetite [æpitait] n. — ishtaha
⚜>> Your appetite is your hunger for food. >> Sizning appetite'ingiz, bu sizning ovqatga och ekanligingizdir.

— Tom has a big appetite. He eats all the time.
— Tomning ishtahasi karnay. U doim yeb yuradi.

pessimistic [pesəˈmistik] adj. — pessimistik 
⚜>> If someone is pessimistic, they believe that the worst will happen. >> Agar birortasi pessimistic bo'lsa, u yomon narsa sodir bo'lishiga ishonadi.

— John is pessimistic. He always thinks something bad will happen.
— Jon pessimist odam. U doim biror yomon narsa sodir bo'ladi deb o'ylaydi.

wage [weɪdʒ] n. — maosh
