— Veterinar kasal kuchukchaga rahm-shafqat ko'rsatdi.

grind [graind] v. — tuymoq, yanchmoq
⚜>> To grind something means to break it into very small pieces or powder. >> Biror narsani grind qilish, uni juda mayda bo'laklarga yoki kukun qilib maydalashni anglatadi. 

— She wanted to grind the beans, so she could brew some coffee.
— U qahva qaynatish uchun qahva donini maydalamoqchi bo'ldi.

growl [graul] v. — irillamoq
⚜>> To growl means to make a deep, angry sound. >> To growl chuqur, darg'azab ovoz chiqarishni anglatadi. 

— The dog started to growl at the man walking by.

foster [fɔ(:)stər] v. — tarbiyalamoq
⚜>> To foster a feeling or a skill means to help it develop. >> Biror tuyg'u yoki mahoratni foster qilish, uni rivojlantirishga yordam berishni anglatadi. 

— She helped foster a sense of calm in the little boy.

withhold [wiθˈhould] v. — berishdan bosh tortmoq
⚜>> To withhold something is to not give it to someone. >> Biror narsani withhold qilish, uni boshqasiga bermaslik degani.

equilibrium [iːkwəˈlibriəm] n. — muvozanat

⚜>> To nurture something means to care for it as it grows or develops. >> Biror narsani nurture qilish, u o'sayotganligi yoki rivojlanayotganligi sabab unga g'amxo'rlik qilishni anglatadi.

⚜>> If plants or animals are extinct, there are none left. >> Agar o'simliklar yoki hayvonlar extinct bo'lsa, ular yo'q bo'lgan bo'ladi.

— The farmer is a hardy man and doesn’t mind working outside.

⚜>> If a place is secluded, it is far away from any other place. >> Agar biror joy secluded bo'lsa, u boshqa joylardan uzoqda bo'ladi.

decisive [diˈsaisiv] adj. — ikkilanmaydigan, tezkor qarorga ega

promptly [prɒmptli] adv. — o'z vaqtida, darhol
⚜>> If something happens promptly, it happens quickly or on time. >> Agar biror narsa promptly sodir bo'lsa, u tez yoki o'z vaqtida sodir bo'ladi.

— It is important to pay attention to nutrition if you want to be an athlete.

— I went to the cafeteria on the assumption that everyone would be there.

⚜>> To cure means to cause an illness or injury to end or disappear. >> To cure biror kasallik yoki jarohat oxiriga yetishi yoki yo'qolishiga sabab bo'lishni anglatadi. 

— My dentist cured me of my toothache.

federal [fedərəl] adj. — federativ, federal

⚜>> To conserve something is to protect it from being ruined or used completely. >> Biror narsani conserve qilish uni vayron bo'lishdan yoki butunlay foydalanishdan himoya qilish hisoblanadi.

— The teacher gave us a comprehensive review for the exam.

— Ekvator Janubiy Amerikaning shimoliy qismini kesib oʻtadi.

rainforest [reinˌfɔ(:)rist] n. — seryog'in o'rmon
⚜>> A rainforest is a forest that is in a place where it rains very often. >> A rainforest tez-tez yomg'ir yog'adigan o'rmon.

— The rainforest is home to many animals.
— Yomg'irli o'rmon ko'plab hayvonlar uchun uy hisoblanadi.

comparative [kəmˈpærətiv] adj. — solishtirma, qiyosiy
⚜>> If something is comparative, it is being judged based on something else. >> Agar biror narsa comparative bo'lsa, u boshqa biror narsaga asoslangan holda muhokama qilinadi.

— The money that John has is comparative to most other adults.
— Jonning puli boshqa kattalarnikiga nisbatan qiyosiy hisoblanadi.

deposit [diˈpɒzit] v. — bankka pul qo'ymoq
⚜>> To deposit something is to put it into a place or another thing. >> Biror narsani deposit qilish, uni boshqa joyga yoki boshqa narsaga qo'yishdir.

— I deposited the money into my bank account.
— Men pulni bank hisobvarag'imga qo'ydim.

frequency [friːkwənsi] n. — sodir bo'lish darajasi
⚜>> The frequency of something is the number of times that it happens. >> Biror narsaning frequency'si u sodir bo'lish vaqtlari soni.

— The frequency of rainstorms is very high, especially during the spring.
— Yomg'irning chastotasi juda yuqori, ayniqsa bahorda.

strategy [strӕtədʒi] n. — strategiya 
⚜>> A strategy is a plan for how to do something. >> A strategy biror narsani qanday qilish uchun reja.

— The team came up with a strategy to win the game.
— Jamoa o'yinda g'alaba qozonish strategiyasini ishlab chiqdi.

capacity [kəˈpæsəti] n. — hajm
⚜>> The capacity of something is the amount of things that can be put in it. >> Biror narsaning capacity'si bu unga qo'yish mumkin bo'lgan narsalarning miqdoridir.

— The parking lot has reached its full capacity.
— Avtoturargoh to‘liq hajmdagi quvvatiga yetdi.

wooded [wudid] adj. — serdaraxt
⚜>> If an area is wooded, it is covered with trees. >> Agar biror joy wooded bo'lsa, u daraxtlar bilan o'ralgan bo'ladi. 

— Jim and Ben decided to go hiking in the wooded area by the river.
— Jim va Ben daryo bo'yidagi o'rmonli hududda sayrga chiqishga qaror qilishdi.

beneficial [benəˈfiʃəl] adj. — foydali
⚜>> If something is beneficial, it is good for you. >> Agar biror narsa beneficial bo'lsa, u Siz uchun yaxshi.

— Drinking milk everyday is beneficial to your bones.
— Har kuni sut ichish suyaklaringiz uchun foydali.

exotic [igˈzotik] adj. — ekzotik, g'alati
⚜>> Exotic describes something unusual because it is from far away. >> Exotic g'ayritabiiy narsani tasvirlaydi, chunki u uzoqdan kelgan bo'ladi. 

— Rebecca tried many exotic foods on her trip to Africa.
—Afrikaga sayohati davomida Rebekka ko'plab ekzotik taomlarni tatib ko'rdi.

objective [əbˈdʒektiv] adj. — maqsad, niyat
⚜>> An objective is a goal or plan that someone has. >> An objective birortasining maqsad yoki rejasi.

— My objective this week is to finish my homework by 7:30 every night.
— Mening bu haftaga maqsadim har kuni kechki soat 7:30gacha uy vazifamni tugatish.

oxygen [ɒksidʒən] n. — kislorod
⚜>> Oxygen is a gas that all living things need to breathe. >> Oxygen barcha tirik jonzotlar nafas olishi uchun kerak bo'ladigan gaz.

— My aunt believes that the oxygen in the countryside is cleaner than in the city.
— Xolam qishloqdagi kislorod shahardagidan tozaroq ekanligiga ishonadi.

formation [fɔːrˈmeiʃən] n. — tuzilish
⚜>> A formation is the way that something is made. >> A formation biror narsa yasalish usuli.

— The formation of ice happens when water freezes.
— Muzning hosil boʻlishi suv muzlaganda sodir boʻladi.
Unit 28:
horrifying [hɔ:rəfaiŋ] adj. — daxshatli, qo'rqinchli
⚜>> If something is horrifying, it is frightening and very unpleasant. >> Agar biror narsa horrifying bo'lsa, u qo'rqinchli va juda yoqimsiz bo'ladi. 

— There was a horrifying car accident today.
— Bugun juda dahshatli avariya sodir bo'ldi.

paraphrase [pærəfreiz] v. — qaytadan aytib bermoq
⚜>> To paraphrase is to make someone else’s writing or speech shorter. >> To paraphrase bu birovning yozishi yoki nutqini qisqartirishdir.

— The students were asked to paraphrase the story they just heard.
— Talabalardan eshitgan voqeani qaytadan aytish so'ralgan.

stark [stɑːrk] adj. — sezilarli
⚜>> If a contrast is stark, then the things being compared are utterly different. >> Agar hilma-xillik stark bo'lsa, solishtirilayotgan narsalar butkul farqli bo'ladi. 

— There is a stark contrast between their test scores.
— Ularning test ballari oʻrtasida keskin farq bor.

summon [sʌmən] v. — chaqirmoq
⚜>> To summon a person is to ask them to come to you. >> Birortasini summon qilish, uni sizning oldingizga kelishini so'rash degani. 

— We summoned the doctor as soon as we noticed she was sick.
— U kasal ekanligini bilishimiz bilan doktorni chaqirdik.

worsen [wəːrsən] v. — yomonlashmoq
⚜>> To worsen is to get worse. >> To worsen yomonroq bo'lish degani. 

— The weather suddenly worsened, and we had to stay inside.
— Ob-havo to'satdan yomonlashdi, va biz uyda turishga majbur bo'ldik.

organism [ɔːrgənizəm] n. — tirik hujayra
⚜>> An organism is a living thing, especially a very small one. >> An organism, asosan juda mayda bo'lgan, tirik narsa.

— We studied the organism on the microscope.
— Biz mikroskopda tirik hujayrani o'rgandik.

dread [dread] v. — vahima bosmoq
⚜>> To dread is to be afraid of something that could, or is going to, happen. >> To dread sodir bo'lishi mumkin bo'lgan biror narsadan qo'rqish hisoblanadi. 

— I dread the idea that I will not get into college.
— Men kollejga kirmayman, degan fikrdan qo‘rqaman.

shrine [ʃrain] n. — ziyoratgoh
⚜>> A shrine is a religious building built to honor a person, event, or god. >> A shrine biror shaxs, voqea yoki Xudoni sharaflash uchun qurilgan diniy bino.

— He prayed at the shrine for an hour.
— U bir soat davomida ziyoratgohda ibodat qildi.

scribble [skribəl] v. — shoshib-pishib yozmoq 
⚜>> To scribble is to write something quickly without caring about how it looks. >> To scribble u qanday ko'rinishi haqida o'ylamasdan biror narsani tez yozish.

— I scribbled a rough diagram of our plan and gave it to him.
— Men rejamizning taxminiy diagrammasini yozdim va unga berdim.

incredulous [inˈkredjələs] adj. — ishonmaydigan, gumoni bor
⚜>> If someone is incredulous about something, they do not believe that it is true. >> Agar birortasi biror narsa haqida incredulous bo'lsa, u odam o'sha narsa to'g'riligiga ishonmaydi.

— She was incredulous that monkeys could ever drive a car.
— U maymunlar hatto mashina hayday olishiga gumoni bor edi.

avail [əˈveil] n. — samara
⚜>> Avail is help. It is often used in the achievement of a goal. >> Avail bu yordam. Bu odatda biror maqsadga erishishda foydalaniladi.

— His studying was to no avail because he failed the test.
— Uning o'qishi hech qanday natija bermadi, chunki u imtihondan o'ta olmadi.

define [diˈfain] v. — ta'riflamoq
⚜>> To define means to clearly state, show, or explain what something is. >> To define biror narsa nimaligini aniq aytish, ko'rsatish yoki ta'riflashni anglatadi. 

— People define success in many different ways.
— Odamlar muvaffaqiyatni turlicha ta'riflaydilar.

solitude [sɒlitjuːd] n. — yolg'izlik
⚜>> Solitude is the state of being totally alone. >> Solitude butunlay yolg'iz bo'lish holati.

— John lives a life of solitude because he doesn’t get along well with people.
— Jon odamlar bilan yaxshi munosabatda bo'lmagani uchun yolg'izlikda yashaydi.

expand [iksˈpænd] v. — kengaymoq, kattalashmoq
⚜>> To expand is to become bigger in size. >> To expand hajm jihatdan katta bo'lishni anglatadi. 

— A balloon will expand as you blow air into it.
— Balonga havo puflaganingizda kengayadi.

presently [prezəntli] adv. — hozirda, hozirgi kunlarda
⚜>> If something happens presently, it is happening right now. >> Agar biror narsa presently sodir bo'lsa, u aynan hozir sodir bo'ladi. 

— Presently, our profits are good, but by next year we can do even better.
— Hozirda daromadimiz yaxshi, ammo keyingi yilga kelib bundan ham yaxshiroq ish qilishimiz mumkin.

fundamental [fʌndəˈmentl] adj. — fundamental, asosiy
⚜>> If something is fundamental, it is a basic part of something. >> Agar biror narsa fundamental bo'lsa, u biror narsaning asosiy qismi hisoblanadi. 

— The fundamental rules of basketball are easy.
— Basketbolning asosiy qoidalari oson.

riot [raiət] n. — isyon
⚜>> A riot is a crowd that reacts to bad news by violently breaking laws. >> A riot bu yomon xabarlarga qonunlarni zo‘ravonlik bilan buzish orqali munosabat bildiradigan olomondir.

— A riot broke out after the candidate lost the election.
— Nomzod saylovda magʻlub boʻlganidan keyin tartibsizliklar boshlandi.

plague [pleig] n. — o'lat
⚜>> A plague is a serious disease that quickly spreads to many people. >> A plague ko'plab odamlarga tez tarqaladigan jiddiy kasallik.

— A plague in Europe killed millions of people.
— Yevropadagi o'lat millionlab odamlarni o'ldirdi.

linger [liŋgər] v. — uzoq qolib ketmoq
⚜>> To linger is to last for a long time. >> To linger uzoq vaqt qolib ketish hisoblanadi. 

— The smell of fresh cookies lingered in the bakery.
— Nonvoyxonada yangi pishiriqlarning hidi anqib turardi.

random [rændəm] adj. — tasodifiy
⚜>> If something is random, it happens without any pattern or reason. >> Agar biror narsa random bo'lsa, u hech qanday sababsiz sodir bo'ladi. 

— Young children often ask random questions.
— Yosh bolalar ko'pincha tasodifiy savollar so'rashadi.
Unit 29:
phenomenon [fiˈnɒmənɒn] n. — voqea, hodisa
⚜>> A phenomenon is something that can be seen as it is happening. >> A phenomenon u sodir bo'lishini ko'rish mumkin bo'lgan narsa.

— I was amazed when I saw the phenomenon of shooting stars.
— Yulduzlarning uchish hodisasini ko‘rib, hayratda qoldim.

enhance [enhæns] v. — oshirmoq, yaxshilamoq
⚜>> To enhance something is to make it better. >> Biror narsani enhance qilish, uni yaxshiroq qilish hisoblanadi. 

— Amy’s blue shirt really enhances the color of her eyes.
— Emi ko‘k ko‘ylagi uning ko‘z rangini yanada yaxshilaydi.

era [erə] n. — era, davr
⚜>> An era is a period of time that has something special about it. >> An era bu oʻziga xos xususiyatga ega boʻlgan davrdir.

— During the medieval era, knights wore protective armor.
— O'rta asrlarda ritsarlar himoya zirhlarini kiyib yurishgan.

parallel [pærəlel] adj. — parallel
⚜>> If two things are parallel, they are the same distance away from each other. >> Agar ikki narsa parallel bo'lsa, ular bir-biridan bir xil masofa uzoqlikda bo'ladi. 

— There are two yellow parallel lines dividing both sides of traffic.
— Har ikki tomonni ajratuvchi ikkita sariq parallel chiziq mavjud.

territory [terətɔ:ri] n. — hudud
⚜>> A territory is a piece of land that belongs to a country but isn’t a state. >> A territory bu davlatga tegishli boʻlgan, lekin davlat hisoblanmaygan yer.

— Gibraltar is a territory of Great Britain.
— Gibraltar Buyuk Britaniya hududidir.

tournament [tuə:rnəmənt] n. — turnir, musobaqa
⚜>> A tournament is a competition, usually with many people participating. >> A tournament, odatda ko'pgina ishtirokchilar qatnashadigan musobaqa. 

— My dad is playing in a golf tournament tomorrow.
— Dadam ertaga golf turnirida o'ynaydi.

candidate [kændideit] n. — kandidat
⚜>> A candidate is a person who is competing to win something such as a job. >> A candidate bu ish kabi narsalarda yutib chiqish uchun baxslashadigan shaxs.

— Alice is the best candidate for the job.
— Alisa ish uchun eng yaxshi kandidat.

ridicule [ridikjuːl] v. — masxara qilmoq
⚜>> To ridicule is to make fun of something in a mean way. >> To ridicule biror narsani yomon yo‘l bilan masxara qilishdir.

— The other students ridicule Peter’s foreign accent.
— Boshqa talabalar Peterning xorijiy aksentini masxara qilishadi.

confidential [kɒnfɪˈdenʃəl] adj. — maxfiy 
⚜>> If something is confidential, it must be kept secret. >> Agar biror narsa confidential bo'lsa, u sir saqlanishi kerak bo'ladi. 

— The information from the meeting is confidential.
— Uchrashuvdan olingan ma'lumot maxfiydir.

solar [soulə:r] adj. — quyoshga oid, quyosh ...
⚜>> If something is solar, it is related to the sun. >> Agar biror narsa solar bo'lsa, u Quyosh bilan aloqador bo'ladi. 

— Using solar energy is good for the environment.
— Quyosh energiyasidan foydalanish atrof-muhit uchun yaxshi.

transportation [trænspəːrˈteɪʃən] v. — transport vositasi
⚜>> Transportation is any type of vehicle that can carry people or things. >> Transportation odamlar va narsalarni tashiydigan istalgan turdagi transport vositasi. 

— I don’t have a car, so my normal transportation is the train.
— Mening mashinam yo'q, shuning uchun mening odatdagi transport vositam bu poyezd.

guideline [gaidlain] n. — yo'riqnoma, ko'rsatma
⚜>> A guideline is a rule about how to do something. >> A guideline bu biror narsani qanday qilish to'g'risidagi qoida.

— Before they began the project, the teacher gave them some guidelines.
— Ular proyektni boshlashlaridan oldin, o'qituvchi ularga bir qancha ko'rsatmalar berdi.

pollute [pəˈluːt] v. — ifloslamoq, zaharlamoq
⚜>> To pollute means to make air, water, or land dirty, unclean, or foul. >> To pollute bu havo, suv yoki yerni iflos, harom qilish demakdir.

— The careless factory polluted the river with chemicals.
— Ehtiyotsiz zavod daryoni kimyoviy moddalar bilan ifloslantirdi.

interact [intərˈӕkt] v. — suhbatlashmoq
⚜>> To interact is to talk to or do something with another person. >> To interact boshqa shaxs bilan biror narsani bajarish yoki u haqida gaplashish.

— The kids began to interact when the adults left the room.
— Kattalar xonani tark etgach, bolalar o'zaro muloqot qila boshladilar.

automobile [ɔːtəməbiːl] n. — avtomobil 
⚜>> An automobile is a car. >> An automobile bu mashina.

— The first automobiles were very different from the ones that exist today.
— Birinchi avtomobillar bugungi avtomobillardan juda ham farq qilar edi.

mobile [moubail] adj. — oson harakatlanadigan
⚜>> If something is mobile, it can be moved easily. >> Agar biror narsa mobile bo'lsa, u oson harakatlana oladi.

— Mobile phones are popular because you can take them anywhere.
— Mobil telefonlar mashhur, chunki ularni istalgan joyga olib ketishingiz mumkin.

corporate [kɔːrpərit] adj. — korporativ
⚜>> If something is corporate, it is related to a large business. >> Agar biror narsa corporate bo'lsa, u ulkan biznes bilan aloqador bo'ladi. 

— Tom enjoys working in the corporate world.
— Tom korporativ dunyoda ishlashdan zavqlanadi.

interval [intərvəl] n. — tanaffus
⚜>> An interval is the time between two things happening. >> An interval sodir bo'ladigan ikki narsa o'rtasidagi vaqt.

— Tony rested for brief intervals while he worked in the yard.
— Toni hovlida ishlaganda qisqa vaqt dam oldi.

incorporate [inˈkɔːrpəreit] v. — qo'shmoq
⚜>> To incorporate is to add something to another thing. >> To incorporate biror narsani boshqa narsaga qo'shish hisoblanadi. 

— I decided to incorporate a new ingredient into my cake recipe.
— Men tort retseptimga yangi ingredient qo‘shishga qaror qildim.

modify [mɒdəfai] v. — xiyol o'zgartirmoq
⚜>> To modify something is to change it a little bit. >> Biror narsani modify qilish, uni biroz o'zgartirishdir.

— I modified my outfit by adding a belt to it.
— Men kiyimga kamar qoʻshish orqali oʻzgartirdim.
Unit 30:
martial [mɑːrʃəl] n. — jangovar, harbiy
⚜>> If something is martial, it is related to fighting or war. >> Agar biror narsa martial bo'lsa, u jang qilish yoki urushga aloqador bo'ladi. 

— Karate is a martial art that began many years ago in Japan.
— Karate ko'p yillar avval Yaponiyada boshlangan jangovar san'at.

heir [ɛər] n. — merosxo'r, voris 
⚜>> An heir is a person who receives money or property of someone who dies. >> An heir birorta vafot etgan odamning puli yoki mol-mulkini oluvchi shaxs.

— The princess was the heir to the king and queen’s throne.
— Malika qirol va malika taxtining vorisi edi.

consistent [kənˈsistənt] adj. — barqaror 
⚜>> If a person is consistent, they keep the same behavior or attitude. >> Agar biror shaxs consistent bo'lsa, u bir xil xulq-atvor yoki munosabatni saqlaydi.

— Sara comes in every day and is our most consistent worker.
— Sara har kuni keladi va u bizning eng barqaror ishchimizdir.

stance [stæns] n. — munosabat
⚜>> A stance is an attitude about an issue that someone states clearly. >> A stance bu kimdir aniq bayon qilgan masalaga munosabatdir.

— My stance is that using oil and gas is bad for the environment.
— Mening pozitsiyam, neft va gazdan foydalanish atrof-muhit uchun yomon.

boundary [baundəri] n. — chegara
⚜>> A boundary is the line where one area of land stops, and another begins. >> A boundary bu bir yer maydoni tugab, boshqasi boshlanadigan liniya.

— This fence shows the boundary between our yard and yours.
— Bu panjara bizning hovlimiz bilan sizniki o'rtasidagi chegarani ko'rsatadi.

tornado [tɔːrˈneidou] n. — quyun
⚜>> A tornado is a tube-shaped formation of air that spins very quickly. >> A tornado juda tez aylanadigan, truba shaklidagi havo. 

— During a tornado, the safest place to be is underground.
— Tornado vaqtida eng xavfsiz joy metro hisoblanadi.

bill [bil] n. — to'lov varag'i
⚜>> A bill is a statement of money owed for goods or a service. >> A bill bu tovar yoki xizmat uchun qarzdorlik toʻgʻrisidagi hisobotdir.

— I have so many bills that I do not know how to pay for them all.
— Menda shunchalik koʻp toʻlovlar borki, hammasini qanday toʻlashni bilmayman.

sheer [ʃiə:r] adj. — mutlaq
⚜>> If you describe something as sheer, it is complete and very strong. >> Agar Siz biror narsani sheer sifatida tasvirlasangiz, u butunlay va juda kuchli bo'ladi. 

— I was impressed by her sheer dedication to jogging.
— Uning yugurishga bo'lgan sadoqati meni hayratda qoldirdi.

wardrobe [wɔːrdroub] n. — garderob
⚜>> A wardrobe is the collection of all of a person’s clothing. >> A wardrobe biror shaxsning barcha kiyimlari yig'indisi. 

— She bought some new clothes to expand her wardrobe.
— U garderobini kengaytirish uchun bir qancha yangi kiyimlar sotib oldi.

sergeant [sɑːrdʒənt] n. — serjant
⚜>> A sergeant is a soldier or police officer of middle rank. >> A sergeant o'rta darajadagi askar yoki politsiya.

— He was promoted to sergeant after a year in the army.
— U armiyada bir yil xizmat qilganidan so‘ng serjant unvoniga ko‘tarildi.

poultry [poultri] n. — go'shti uchun boqiladigan parranda
⚜>> Poultry is a bird, such as a chicken, that is used for meat and eggs. >> Poultry go'shti va tuxumi uchun boqiladigan jo'ja kabi qushlar.

— He raises poultry and sells their meat for extra money.
— U parranda yetishtirib, go‘shtini qo‘shimcha pul evaziga sotadi.

telegraph [teləgræf] n. — telegraf 
⚜>> A telegraph is a method of sending electric messages on wires. >> A telegraph bu elektron xabarlarni simlar orqali yuborish usuli.

— In the 1900s, the telegraph was the fastest way to send a message.
— 1900-yillarda telegraf xat jo'natishning eng tez usuli bo'lgan.

organic [ɔːrˈgænik] adj. — tabiiy
⚜>> If food is organic, it is grown without adding chemicals to it. >> Agar taom organic bo'lsa, u ximikatlar qo'shmasdan o'stirilgan bo'ladi. 

— The organic carrots are more expensive, but they’re better for you.
— Tabiiy sabzilar qimmatroq, lekin u Siz uchun yaxshiroq.

wail [weil] v. — dod solmoq 
⚜>> To wail is to show sadness by crying loudly. >> To wail qattiq baqirish orqali hafalikni ko'rsatish hisoblanadi.

— The baby wailed because it was hungry.
— Chaqaloq dod soldi, chunki u och edi.

cyclone [saikloun] n. — siklon 
⚜>> A cyclone is a large storm with heavy rain and winds that spin in a circle. >> A cyclone bu aynaladigan, og'ir yomg'ir va shamolli katta to'fon.

— Hundreds of homes were damaged by the cyclone.
— Yuzlab uylarga siklon tomonidan zarar yetkazildi.

typhoon [taiˈfuːn] n. — to'fon
⚜>> A typhoon is a large tropical storm that moves in circles. >> A typhoon aylana bo'lib harakatlanadigan katta tropik quyun.

— Thousands of people lost electricity after a typhoon hit Australia.
— Avstraliyada yuz bergan to‘fondan keyin minglab odamlar elektr energiyasidan mahrum bo‘ldi.

scramble [skræmbl] v. — qo'li bilan sakrab o'tmoq
⚜>> To scramble is to move somewhere quickly and desperately. >> To scramble bir joyga tez va jiddiy harakat qilishdir.

— The hikers scrambled down the side of the hill.
— Sayohatchilar tog‘ning yonboshidan pastga tushishdi.

chaos [keiɒs] n. — tartibsizlik
⚜>> Chaos is a situation that is confusing and not ordered. >> Chaos bu chalg'ituvchi va tartibsiz bo'lgan vaziyat.

— His presentation was in chaos. I couldn’t understand what he meant.
— Uning taqdimoti tartibsiz edi. U nimani nazarda tutganini tushunolmadim.

textile [tekstail] n. — gazlama, mato
⚜>> Textile is cloth that has been woven or knitted. >> Textile toʻqilgan yoki trikotaj qilingan matodir.

— The blue textile was going to be used to make blouses.
— Moviy mato koftalar tikishda foydalanilar edi.

doomed [duːmd] adj. — chatoq, dabdala
⚜>> If someone or something is doomed, they are going to fail or be destroyed. >> Agar birortasi yoki biror narsa doomed bo'lsa, ular muvaffaqiyatsizlikka uchraydi yoki yo'q qilinadi.

— Since I spent all my money, my date with Jane is doomed.
— Men butun pulimni sarflaganim uchun Jeyn bilan uchrashishim mahkum.

Unit 1:
elapse [iˈlæps] v. — o'tmoq, o'tib ketmoq 
🔸>> To elapse means to pass, as in seconds, minutes, or hours. >> To elapse soniyalar, daqiqalar yoki soatlar kabi oʻtishni bildiradi.

— A few seconds must elapse before you can take another picture.
— Boshqa suratga olishdan oldin bir necha soniya oʻtishi kerak.

mundane [mʌnˈdein] adj. — zerikarli
🔸>> When something is mundane, it is boring, common, or ordinary. >> Agar biror narsa mundane bo'lsa, u zerikarli, umumiy yoki oddiy bo'ladi. 

— The man had the mundane chore of raking thousands of leaves into piles.
— Bu odam minglab barglarni uyum qilib yig'ishdek zerikarli yumush bilan shug'ullangan.

deliberate [diˈlibərit] adj. — rejalashtirilgan, rejali
🔸>> If a thing you do is deliberate, you intend to do it. >> Agar Siz qiladigan ish deliberate bo'lsa, Siz uni bajarishni niyat qilgan bo'lasiz.

— She made a deliberate effort to save money each month.
— U har oy pul tejash uchun rejali harakat qilardi.

dire [daiər] adj. — qo'rqinchli, daxshatli 
🔸>> When something is dire, it is terrible and very serious. >> Agar biror narsa dire bo'lsa, u daxshatli va juda jiddiy bo'ladi. 

— The tornado created a dire situation for the small town.
— Tornado kichik shahar uchun daxshatli vaziyat yaratdi.

convenience [kənˈviːnjənt] n. — qulaylik
🔸>> Convenience is a state of being able to do something with little effort. >> Convenience biror narsani ozgina harakat bilan qila olish holati.

— The Internet allows consumers to shop at their own convenience.
— Internet iste'molchilarga o'zlariga qulay vaqtda xarid qilish imkonini beradi.

fanciful [fænsifəl] adj. — g'alati, antiqa 
🔸>> When something is fanciful, it is unusual or unrealistic. >> Agar biror narsa fanciful bo'lsa, u g'ayrioddiy yoki g'ayritabiiy bo'ladi. 

— The girl had fanciful ideas about doing well in school without studying.
— Qizda o'qimay maktabda yaxshi o'qish haqida antiqa g'oyalar bor edi.

allot [əˈlɒt] v. — bermoq
🔸>> To allot something means to give it to someone. >> Biror narsani allot qilish, uni birortasiga berishni anglatadi. 

— The coach allotted each team five minutes to prepare a strategy.
— Murabbiy har ikki jamoaga strategiya tayyorlash uchun 5 minut berdi.

appall [əˈpɔ:l] v. — qo'rqitmoq
🔸>> To appall means to horrify, shock, or disgust someone. >> To appall birortasini qo'rqitish, hayratlantirish yoki nafratlantirishni anglatadi. 

— The boy was appalled when he saw the accident.
— Yigit baxtsiz hodisani ko‘rib, dahshatga tushdi.

dearth [dəːrθ] n. — tanqislik
🔸>> A dearth is an amount or supply which is not large enough. >> A dearth bu yetarlicha katta boʻlmagan miqdor yoki zaxiradir.

— There is a dearth of money in my bank account. I can’t afford a new car.
— Bankdagi hisobimda pul yetishmayapti. Men yangi mashina sotib ololmayman.

resourceful [riˈsɔːrsfəl] adj. — ijodkor
🔸>> When someone is resourceful, they are good at dealing with hard situations. >> Agar birortasi resourceful bo'lsa, u qiyin vaziyatlarni yengishga usta bo'ladi. 

— After his boat sunk, Matt was resourceful enough to build a raft.
— U kemasi cho'kkanidan so'ng, Matt sol yasashga yetarlicha ijodkor edi.

outrage [autreidʒ] n. — darg'azablik
🔸>> Outrage is a very strong emotion of anger or shock. >> Outrage bu juda kuchli g'azab yoki shok hissi.

— Tommy was feeling outrage when his parents said he couldn’t go to the dance.
— Ota-onasi uning raqsga bora olmasligini aytishganida, Tommi g'azablangan edi.

cache [kæʃ] n. — maxfiy joy
🔸>> A cache is a hiding place for valuable things. >> A cache bu qimmatli narsalar uchun berkitiladigan joy.

— The pirates kept their jewelry in a cache hidden in a cave.
— Qaroqchilar o'z taqinchoqlarini g'orga berkitilgan maxfiy joyda saqlashdi.

grueling [gru:əliŋ] adj. — sermashaqqat
🔸>> When something is grueling, it is very hard to do. >> Agar biror narsa grueling bo'lsa, u bajarishga juda qiyin bo'ladi. 

— The climber faced the grueling task of reaching the top of the steep mountain.
— Alpinist tik tog' cho'qqisiga chiqishdek mashaqqatli vazifani oldi.

sustenance [sʌstənəns] n. — oziq, yemish
🔸>> Sustenance is food and water needed to keep a person, animal, or plant alive. >> Sustenance inson, hayvon yoki o'simlikni tirik saqlash uchun kerak bo'ladigan ovqat va suv.

— Without the proper sustenance, the man will starve.
— To'g'ri ozuqa bo'lmasa, odam och qoladi.

rectify [rektəfai] v. — xatoni to'g'rilamoq 
🔸>> To rectify something means to correct it. >> Biror narsani rectify qilish, uni to'g'rilashni anglatadi. 

— I quickly rectified the spelling mistakes that I had on my essay.
— Men inshodagi imlo xatolarimni tezda tuzatdim.

paltry [pɔːltri] adj. — arzimagan
🔸>> When an amount of something is paltry, it is very small. >> Agar biror narsaning miqdori paltry bo'lsa, u juda kichik bo'ladi. 

— The poor man had a paltry sum of money.
— Kambag'al odamda arzimagan pul summasi bor edi.

empathy [empəθi] n. — hamdardlik
🔸>> Empathy is sharing or understanding another person’s feelings. >> Empathy boshqa odamning his-tuyg'ularini bo'lishish yoki tushunish.

— The caring nurse had empathy for her patients.
— G'amxo'r hamshira o'z bemorlariga hamdard edi.

opt [ɒpt] v. — tanlamoq
🔸>> To opt is to make a choice, especially when deciding in favor of something. >> To opt bu tanlov qilishdir, ayniqsa biror narsa foydasiga qaror qilganda.

— My brother likes chocolate ice cream, but I always opt for vanilla.
— Akam shokoladli muzqaymoqni yaxshi ko'radi, lekin men doim vanilni tanlayman.

gripe [graip] v. — tinmay nolimoq
🔸>> To gripe means to complain constantly. >> To gripe doimiy shikoyat qilishni anglatadi. 

— Lawrence always gripes when he has to do chores.
— Lourens har doim uy ishlarini bajarishi kerak bo'lganda qiynaladi.

tedious [tiːdiəs] adj. — zerikarli 
🔸>> When something is tedious, it is long, frustrating, and boring. >> Agar biror narsa tedious bo'lsa, u uzun, ko'ngilni qoldiradigan va zerikarli. 

— His job involved a lot of tedious typing, filing, and organizing.
— Uning ishi juda ko'p zerikarli matn terish, hujjatlarni topshirish va tartibga solishni o'z ichiga olgan.
Unit 2:
cathedral [kəˈθiːdrəl] n. — bosh cherkov, sobor 
🔸>> A cathedral is an important and often large and beautifully built church. >> A cathedral muhim va koʻpincha katta va chiroyli qurilgan cherkovdir.

— The large cathedral is full of people on Sunday mornings.
— Katta sobor yakshanba kuni ertalab odamlar bilan to'la bo'ladi.

ragged [rægid] adj. — eski, juldurvaqa
🔸>> If something is ragged, then it is old, torn, and falling apart. >> Agar biror narsa ragged boʻlsa, u eski, yirtilgan va parchalanib ketgan bo'ladi. 

— They could see his toes through the holes in his ragged shoes.
— Ular uning oyoq barmoqlarini eski tuflisining teshiklaridan ko‘rishardi.

oath [ouθ] n. — qasam, ont
🔸>> An oath is a formal, often public, promise. >> An oath bu rasmiy, ko'pincha ochiq, va'da berishdir.

— Judges must take an oath to be fair to everyone in court.
— Sudyalar sudda hammaga adolatli bo‘lishga qasamyod qilishi kerak.

arid [ærid] adj. — juda quruq, kam yog'in
🔸>> If a place is arid, then it is hot and dry and gets very little or no rain. >> Agar biror joy arid bo'lsa, u juda issiq va quruq hamda juda kam yoki umuman yomg'ir yog'maydi.

— Not many plants grow in the arid desert.
— Qurg'oqchil cho'lda ko'p o'simliklar o'smaydi.

grumble [grʌmbəl] v. — javramoq, vaysamoq
🔸>> To grumble means to complain. >> To grumble shikoyat qilishni anglatadi. 

— He grumbled about having to work late on Friday.
— U juma kuni kech ishlashga majbur boʻlganidan nolidi.

moisture [mɔistʃər] n. — namlik
🔸>> Moisture is small drops of water in the air or on a surface. >> Moisture bu havodagi yoki yuzadagi kichik suv tomchilari.

— If you breathe on a window, moisture from your breath collects on the glass.
— Agar siz derazada nafas olsangiz, nafasingizdagi namlik oynaga to'planadi.

drought [draut] n. — qurg'oqchilik
🔸>> A drought is a long period of time in which little or no rain falls. >> A drought bu juda kam yoki umuman yomg'ir yog'maydigan uzoq vaqt davri.

— After three months of drought, the vegetation and trees started dying.
— Uch oylik qurg‘oqchilikdan keyin o‘simliklar va daraxtlar nobud bo‘la boshladi.

abbey [æbi] n. — abbatlik
🔸>> An abbey is a house or group of houses where monks or nuns live. >> An abbey — rohiblar yoki rohibalar yashaydigan uy yoki uylar guruhi.

— When the monk returned to the abbey, he went immediately to his bedroom.
— Rohib abbatlikka qaytib kelgach, u darhol yotoqxonasiga ketdi.

speculate [spekjəleit] v. — taxmin qilmoq 
🔸>> To speculate means to guess about something. >> To speculate biror narsa haqida taxmin qilishni anglatadi. 

— My sister looked at the sky and speculated that it would rain tomorrow.
— Opam osmonga qaradi va ertaga yomg'ir yog'ishi mumkinligini taxmin qildi.

nonetheless [nʌnðəˈles] adv. — shunga qaramay, shunday bo'lsa ham
🔸>> If something happens nonetheless, then it occurs despite some other thing. >> Agar biror narsa nonetheless sodir bo'lsa, u biror boshqa narsaga qaramay sodir bo'ladi. 

— She tried to keep the dog out of the mud, but it got dirty nonetheless.
— U itni loydan saqlamoqchi bo‘ldi, lekin baribir u iflos bo‘lib qoldi.

eligible [elidʒəbəl] adj. — haqli, huquqli
🔸>> If someone is eligible, then they are permitted to do or have something. >> Agar birortasi eligible bo'lsa, unga biror narsa qilish yoki biror narsaga egalik qilishiga ruxsat beriladi.

— Only people who bought tickets were eligible to win a prize.
— Sovrinni yutib olishga faqat chiptalarni sotib olganlargina haqli edi.

scarce [skɛə:rs] adj. — tanqis, taqchil
🔸>> If something is scarce, then it is in a very small amount. >> Agar biror narsa scarce bo'lsa, u juda kam miqdorda bo'ladi. 

— When gasoline was scarce, we rode our bikes, instead of driving, to school.
— Benzin taqchil bo'lganida, maktabga mashinada emas, velosipedda borardik.

inland [inlənd] adv. — markaziga
🔸>> If someone goes inland, they travel into the center of a country or land. >> Agar birortasi inland tomonga yursa, u biror yer yoki mamlakat markaziga sayohat qiladi.

— The river curved inland near the campground.
— Daryo lager yaqinida markaz tomonga qiyshaydi.

adjoin [əˈdʒɔin] v. — yonma-yon bo'lmoq, qo'shni bo'lmoq 
🔸>> To adjoin something means to be next to or attached to something else. >> Biror narsaga adjoin bo'lish boshqa biror narsaning yonida yoki unga bogʻlangan boʻlishni anglatadi.

— She can listen to her brother’s conversations because her room adjoins his.
— U akasining suhbatlarini tinglashi mumkin, chunki uning xonasi unikiga tutashgan.

fast [fæst] v. — ro'za tutmoq
🔸>> To fast means to go without food or drink for a period of time. >> To fast ma'lum davr mobaynida ovqat va suvsiz yurishni anglatadi. 

— In her religion, they fast for five days and then have a big feast.
— Uning dinida ular besh kun ro‘za tutib, keyin katta ziyofat qilishadi.

deprive [diˈpraiv] v. — mahrum etmoq
🔸>> To deprive someone of something means to not let them have it. >> Birortasini biror narsadan deprive qilish, unga o'sha narsaga ega bo'lishiga qo'ymaslikni anglatadi. 

— Because the child was bad, she was deprived of her dessert after dinner.
— Bola yomon bo'lgani uchun kechki ovqatdan keyin shirinligidan mahrum bo'ldi.

ample [æmpl] adj. — yetarli, ko'p 
🔸>> If something is ample, then it is enough or more than enough. >> Agar biror narsa ample bo'lsa, u yetarli yoki yetarlidan ko'p bo'ladi. 

— There was an ample supply of oats to feed the horses.
— Otlarni boqish uchun jo‘xori yetarli edi.

rugged [rʌgid] adj. — g'adir-budur, dag'al
🔸>> If an area of land is rugged, then it is rocky and difficult to travel through. >> Agar yerning biror maydoni rugged bo'lsa, u toshli va yurishga qiyin bo'ladi. 

— Their car couldn’t make it far along the rugged roads.
— Ularning mashinasi g'adir-budur yo‘llardan uzoqqa chiqa olmadi.

prairie [prɛəri] n. — dasht, yovon
🔸>> A prairie is a large flat area of grassland. >> A prairie bu oʻtloqlarning katta tekis maydoni.

— The prairie was perfect for a farm because there were hills and trees.
— Dasht ferma uchun juda mos edi, chunki u yerda tepaliklar va daraxtlar bor edi.

abundant [əˈbʌndənt] adj. — mo'l, serob 
🔸>> If something is abundant, then it is available in large quantities. >> Agar biror narsa abundant bo'lsa, u katta miqdorda mavjud bo'ladi. 

— Cakes, cookies, and candy were so abundant that the child was very happy.
— Keklar, pechene va konfetlar shunchalik ko'p ediki, bola juda xursand edi.
Unit 3:
calculus [kælkjələs] n. — hisob-kitob
🔸>> Calculus is an advanced type of mathematics. >> Calculus matematikaning ilg'or turidir.

— By using calculus, scientists determined small changes in the stars’ brightness.
— Hisob-kitoblar yordamida olimlar yulduzlar yorqinligidagi kichik o'zgarishlarni aniqladilar.

collision [kəˈliʒən] n. — to'qnashuv
🔸>> A collision is the act of two things hitting into each another. >> A collision ikki bir-biriga to'qnashayotgan narsalar harakati.

— The collision between the two cars created a loud noise.
— Ikki mashina o'rtasidagi to'qnashuv baland ovoz keltirib chiqardi.

diploma [diˈploumə] n. — diplom 
🔸>> A diploma is a certificate proving that someone has completed their studies. >> A diploma birortasi o'qishini tugatganligini isbotlovchi sertifikat. 

— After four years of college, Mary finally had a diploma.
— To'rt yillik kollejda o'qiganidan so'ng, Meri nihoyat diplomga ega bo'ldi.

excel [ikˈsel] v. — biror narsada zo'r bo'lmoq
🔸>> To excel at a subject or activity means to be very good at it. >> Mavzu yoki faoliyatda excel qilish, buni juda yaxshi bilishni anglatadi.

— Jenny excels at playing the piano.
— Jenni pianino chalishni yaxshi biladi.

celestial [səˈlestʃəl] adj. — samoviy, osmon bilan bog'liq
🔸>> If something is celestial, it is related to the sky or to outer space. >> Agar biror narsa celestial bo'lsa, u osmon yoki tashqi fazo bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— Comets are celestial objects that are rarely seen.
— Kometalar kamdan-kam uchraydigan samoviy jismlardir.

keen [kiːn] adj. — aqlli, o'tkir
🔸>> If someone is keen, they are intelligent. >> Agar birortasi keen bo'lsa, u aqlli bo'ladi. 

— Only the keenest of students could have solved that math problem.
— Bu matematik masalani faqat eng zehnli talabalar yecha olardi.

mythology [miˈθɒlədʒi] n. — mifologiya 
🔸>> Mythology is a group of stories from a particular country or region. >> Mythology bu muayyan mamlakat yoki mintaqaga oid hikoyalar guruhidir.

— Egyptian mythology was the basis for a religion.
— Misr mifologiyasi dinning asosi boʻlgan.

analytic [ænəˈlitik] adj. — tahliliy
🔸>> If something is analytic, it is related to logic and reasoning. >> Agar biror narsa analytic bo'lsa, u mantiq va sabab bilan aloqador bo'ladi. 

— The analytic article criticized the new plan and presented one of its own.
— Tahliliy maqola yangi rejani tanqid qildi va oʻzining rejasini taqdim etdi.

harness [hɑːrnis] v. — biror narsadan elektr to'ki olmoq
🔸>> To harness something means to control and use it, usually to make energy. >> Biror narsani harness qilish, odatda quvvat olish uchun, uni nazorat qilish va undan foydalanishni anglatadi.

— The sails harness the wind in order to move.
— Yelkanlar harakatlanish uchun shamoldan foydalanadi.

bachelor [bætʃələr] n. — bo'ydoq
🔸>> A bachelor is an unmarried man. >> A bachelor bu uylanmagan erkak degani.

— Since he was a bachelor, Jason did his shopping by himself.
— Bo'ydoq bo'lgani uchun, Jeson o'zi harid qildi.

assert [əˈsəːrt] v. — tasdiqlamoq
🔸>> To assert a fact or belief means to state it with confidence. >> Haqiqat yoki e'tiqodni assert qilish buni ishonch bilan aytishni anglatadi.

— He asserted that his mother’s cooking was better than his best friend’s.
— Uning tasdiqlashicha, onasining taomi eng yaqin doʻstinikidan yaxshiroq edi.

intellect [intəlekt] n. — intellekt, idrok 
🔸>> An intellect is a person’s ability to understand things easily. >> An intellect bu insonning narsalarni oson tushunish qobiliyati.

— She was known for her quick and strong intellect as well as her beauty.
— U oʻzining tez va kuchli intellekti hamda goʻzalligi bilan mashhur edi.

cognitive [kɒgnətiv] adj. — bilish, o'rganish bilan bog'liq 
🔸>> If something is cognitive, it is related to learning and knowing things. >> Agar biror narsa cognitive bo'lsa, u narsalarni o'rganish va bilish bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— After her physical examination, her cognitive strengths were tested.
— Jismoniy tekshiruvdan so'ng uning aqliy qobiliyatlari sinovdan o'tkazildi.

geology [dʒiˈɒlədʒi] n. — geologiya
🔸>> Geology is the study of the Earth’s natural structures and how they change. >> Geology Yerning tabiiy tuzilmalari va ularning oʻzgarishini oʻrganadigan fan.

— Because he studied geology, he knew how the mountains were formed.
— U geologiyani oʻrgangani uchun togʻlar qanday paydo boʻlganini bilar edi.

competent [kɒmpətənt] adj. — puxta bilimli
🔸>> If someone is competent, they are able to think or act successfully. >> Agar birortasi competent bo'lsa, u muvaffaqiyatli o'ylay yoki hakat qila oladi.

— Competent employees are much better than unknowledgeable ones.
— Puxta bilimli ishchilar bilimsizlardan ancha yaxshi.
Unit 4:
automate [ɔːtəmeit] v. — avtomatlashtirmoq
🔸>> To automate a company means to install machines or computers to do the work. >> Kompaniyani automate qilish, mashina yoki kompyuterlarni ishga tushirish uchun o'rnatishni anglatadi. 

— When the bank automated, it started installing ATM machines.
— Bank avtomatlashtirilgandan so'ng bankomatlarni o'rnatishni boshladi.

rubbish [rʌbiʃ] n. — axlat, chiqindi
🔸>> Rubbish is trash or waste. >> Rubbish bu axlat yoki chiqindi. 

— The floor around the garbage can was covered with all kinds of rubbish.
— Chiqindixona atrofidagi pol har xil axlat bilan qoplangan.

bribe [braib] v. — pora bermoq
🔸>> To bribe someone means to illegally persuade them for a favor with money. >> Birortasiga bribe qilish, uni pul bilan iltifotga noqonuniy ishontirishni anglatadi.

— The judge was bribed so that she would set the suspect free.
— Sudya gumonlanuvchini ozod qilish uchun pora oldi.

affluent [æflu(:)ənt] adj. — boy, badavlat
🔸>> If someone is affluent, they are wealthy. >> Agar birortasi affluent bo'lsa, u boy bo'ladi. 

— People in the city are usually more affluent than people in the countryside.
— Shahar aholisi odatda qishloqdagilarga qaraganda boyroqdir.

legitimate [liˈdʒitəmit] adj. — qonuniy, qonunga muvofiq
🔸>> If something is legitimate, then it is acceptable according to the law. >> Agar biror narsa legitimate bo'lsa, u qonunga ko'ra muvofiq bo'ladi. 

— She found a legitimate plan to raise extra funds for her vacation.
— U taʼtil uchun qoʻshimcha mablagʻ toʻplash uchun qonuniy reja topdi.

corrupt [kəˈrʌpt] adj. — poraxo'r
🔸>> If someone is corrupt, they break the law for money or fame. >> Agar birortasi corrupt bo'lsa, u pul yoki mashxurlik uchun qonunni buzadi. 

— The corrupt policemen didn’t arrest the man because he gave them money.
— Poraxo'r politsiyachilar haligi kishini hibsga olmadi, chunki u ularga pul berdi.

dispose [diˈspouz] v. — qutulmoq, xalos bo'lmoq 
🔸>> To dispose of something means to get rid of it. >> Biror narsani dispose qilish, undan qutulish demakdir.

— He disposed of the can by throwing it into the recycle bin.
— U konservani axlat qutisiga tashlab tashladi.

incentive [inˈsentiv] n. — stimul, undovchi omil
🔸>> An incentive is what makes a person want to do something. >> An incentive birortasiga biror narsa qilishni xohlattiradigan narsa.

— The chance of winning a prize was incentive to get people to play the game.
— Sovrin yutib olish imkoniyati odamlarni o'yin o'ynashga undash uchun turtki bo'ldi.

manipulate [məˈnipjəleit] v. — mohirona boshqarmoq, ta'sir o'tkazmoq
🔸>> To manipulate something means to skillfully or unfairly control or affect it. >> Biror narsani manipulate qilish, uni mohirona yoki nohaqlik bilan boshqarish yoki unga taʼsir qilish demakdir.

— The Dr. manipulated the data to make it look like the cure was working.
— Doktor ma'lumotlarni manipulyatsiya qilib, davolanish ishlayotgandek ko'rsatdi.

transaction [trænˈsækʃən] n. — kelishuv, bitim
🔸>> A transaction is an act of buying or selling something. >> A transaction bu biror narsani sotish yoki sotib olish harakati. 

— Because the clerk was new at the job, the simple transaction took a long time.
— Kotib ishda yangi boʻlganligi sababli, oddiy kelishuv uzoq davom etdi.

revenue [revənjuː] n. — daromad
🔸>> Revenue is the income made by a company. >> Revenue bu kompaniya orqali qilinadigan daromad.

— The new products really increased the business’s monthly revenue.
— Yangi maxsulotlar oylik daromadni haqiqatan oshirdi.

headquarters [hedˈkwɔːrtərz] n. — bosh ofis, idora
🔸>> A headquarters is a building where the bosses of a company work. >> A headquarters kompaniyaning boshliqlari ishlaydigan bino.

— He drove the long route to headquarters because it was a nice day.
— U uzoq yo'lda haydab, bosh ofisga bordi, chunki bu yaxshi kun edi.

legislate [ledʒisleit] v. — qonun chiqarmoq 
🔸>> To legislate means to make laws. >> To legislate qonun chiqarishni anglatadi. 

— Senators have to legislate fairly, so most people will enjoy the benefits.
— Senatorlar adolatli qonun chiqarishlari kerak, shunda ko'pchilik imtiyozlardan bahramand bo'ladi.

retail [riːteil] n. — chakana savdo
🔸>> Retail is the activity of selling goods to the public, often for personal use. >> Retail bu koʻpincha shaxsiy foydalanish uchun tovarlarni ommaga sotish faoliyatidir.

— Though cheap to make, once a t-shirt reaches retail, it costs ten times as much.
— Tayyorlanishi arzon boʻlsa-da, chakana savdoga yetib borgach, futbolkaning narxi oʻn baravar qimmat bo'ladi.

violate [vaiəleit] v. — qonunni buzmoq
🔸>> To violate a law, rule, or agreement means to break it. >> Qonun, qoida yoki kelishuvni violate qilish, uni buzishni anglatadi. 

— I was given a ticket because the policeman said I violated the speed limit.
— Politsiyachi tezlikni buzganim uchun menga chipta berildi.

audit [ɔːdit] v. — tekshirmoq, taftish qilmoq
🔸>> To audit means to inspect financial records from a person or business. >> To audit bu shaxs yoki korxonaning moliyaviy hisobotlarini tekshirishni anglatadi.

— The government usually audits companies that report lower than usual incomes.
— Hukumat odatda odatdagidan pastroq daromad keltirgan kompaniyalarni tekshiradi.

merchandise [məːrtʃəndaiz] n. — tovarlar
🔸>> Merchandise is goods ready to be purchased or sold. >> Merchandise bu sotishga yoki sotib olishga tayyor bo'lgan maxsulotlar.

— The store added more merchandise because there were more shoppers.
— Do'kon ko'proq tovarlar qo'shdi, chunki xaridorlar ko'proq edi.

infrastructure [infrəˌstrʌtʃər] n. — infratuzilma
🔸>> An infrastructure is a collection of services needed to run a society or business. >> An infrastructure jamiyat yoki biznesni boshqarishga kerak bo'ladigan xizmatlar yig'indisi. 

— Power lines are important parts of a city’s infrastructure.
— Elektr tarmoqlari shahar infratuzilmasining muhim qismidir.

subsidy [sʌbsidi] n. — subsidiya, yordam puli
🔸>> A subsidy is money given by the government to companies to assist them. >> A subsidy bu kompaniyalarga yordam berish uchun davlat tomonidan beriladigan pul.

— The official gave the company a subsidy, so it could open two new factories.
— Rasmiy kompaniyaga subsidiya berdi, endi u ikkita yangi zavod ochishi mumkin edi.

administrator [ædˈminəstreitər] n. — administrator
🔸>> An administrator is a person who controls a business, company, or organization. >> An administrator biznes, kompaniya yoki tashkilotni nazorat qiladigan shaxs.

— Everyone in the store did whatever the administrator asked them to do.
— Do‘kondagilarning hammasi administrator nima talab qilsa, shuni bajarardi.
Unit 5:
proximity [prɒkˈsiməti] n. — yaqinlik
🔸>> Proximity is closeness in time, space, or relationships. >> Proximity vaqt, bo'shliq yoki aloqalarda yaqinlikni anglatadi. 

— All the trees in the proximity of the beach had been cut down.
— Sohil yaqinidagi barcha daraxtlar kesilgan.

pharmaceutical [fɑːrməˈsuːtikəl] adj. — farmatsevtik
🔸>> If something is pharmaceutical, then it is related to the development of drugs. >> Agar biror narsa pharmaceutical bo'lsa, u dori ishlab chiqarish bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— Pharmaceutical companies discover new cures to illnesses all the time.
— Farmatsevtika kompaniyalari har doim kasalliklarni davolashning yangi usullarini topadilar.

astonish [əˈstɒniʃ] v. — hayratda qoldirmoq
🔸>> To astonish someone means to greatly surprise them. >> Birortasini astonish qilish, uni hayratda qoldirishni anglatadi. 

— The amount of people that came to her party astonished her.
— Uning ziyofatiga kelgan odamlar miqdori uni hayratda qoldirdi.

commence [kəˈmens] v. — boshlamoq
🔸>> To commence something means to begin it. >> Biror narsani commence qilish, uni boshlashni anglatadi. 

— His speech commenced with a “thankyou” to all who had helped him succeed.
— Uning nutqi muvaffaqiyatga erishishda yordam bergan barchaga “rahmat” bilan boshlandi.

extract [ikˈstrӕkt] v. — sug'urib olmoq
🔸>> To extract something means to remove it. >> Biror narsani extract qilish, uni olib qo'yishni anglatadi. 

— The dentist extracted the woman’s damaged tooth and put in a fake one.
— Tish shifokori ayolning shikastlangan tishini sug'urib, soxta tish qo'ydi.

fabulous [fæbjələs] adj. — juda yaxshi
🔸>> If something is fabulous, it is extremely good. >> Agar biror narsa fabulous bo'lsa, u juda ham yaxshi bo'ladi. 

— This strawberry is the best I’ve ever had. It’s fabulous.
— Bu qulupnay men ega bo'lgan eng yaxshisidir. Bu ajoyib.

publicity [pʌbˈlisəti] n. — jamoatchilik e'tibori
🔸>> Publicity is public attention given to someone or something by the media. >> Publicity OAV orqali birortasi yoki biror narsaga berilgan omma e'tibori.

— She received a lot of publicity after her performance in the film.
— Filmdagi rolidan so‘ng u ko‘p e’tirofga sazovor bo‘ldi.

impulse [impʌls] n. — impuls, turtki
🔸>> An impulse is a sudden thoughtless urge to do something. >> An impulse biror narsa qilishga to‘satdan o‘ylamay intilish degani. 

— Because of the scary noise, she had an impulse to run somewhere and hide.
— Qo'rqinchli shovqin tufayli uning qayoqqadir yugurib yashirinishi uchun turtki bor edi.

molecule [mɒləkjuːl] n. — molekula 
🔸>> A molecule is the smallest basic unit that makes up a physical substance. >> A molecule fizik moddalarni tashkil etuvchi eng kichik asosiy birlikdir.

— A tiny drop of water is made up of thousands of molecules of water.
— Kichik bir tomchi suv minglab molekulalardan iborat.

essence [esəns] n. — mohiyat, ma'no
🔸>> The essence of something is its important qualities or basic characteristics. >> Biror narsaning essence'i uning muhim sifatlari yoki asosiy belgilaridir.

— The essence of the argument was that both sides felt they had lost money.
— Bahsning mohiyati shundaki, har ikki tomon ham pul yo‘qotganini his qilgan.

assess [əˈses] v. — baholamoq, tekshirmoq
🔸>> To assess something means to judge the structure, purpose, or quality of it. >> Biror narsani assess qilish, biror struktura, maqsad yoki sifatni baholashni anglatadi. 

— She assessed the condition of the toy car before buying it.
— U o'yinchoq mashinani sotib olishdan oldin uning vaziyatini tekshirdi.

latter [lætə:r] adj. — oxirgi, so'nggi
🔸>> Latter describes something last in a series or the second choice of two things. >> Latter bir qanchaning oxirgisi yoki ikkitaning ikkinchisini tasvirlaydi. 

— In the latter minutes of the game, the visitors scored the winning goal.
— O'yinning so'nggi daqiqalarida mehmonlar g'alaba to'pini kiritishdi.

ongoing [ɒnˌgouiŋ] adj. — davom etayotgan
🔸>> If something is ongoing, then it is still happening or still growing. >> Agar biror narsa ongoing bo'lsa, u hali ham davom etayotgan yoki o'sayotgan bo'ladi. 

— The development of plants is ongoing because it takes time for them to mature.
— O'simliklarning rivojlanishi davom etmoqda, chunki ularning yetilishi uchun vaqt kerak.

precise [priˈsais] adj. — sinchkov
🔸>> If someone is precise, then they are exact and careful about their work. >> Agar birortasi precise bo'lsa, u ishi haqida tartibli va ehtiyotkor bo'ladi. 

— The builder was very precise about where he placed the nails.
— Quruvchi mixlarni qayerga qo'yishi borasida juda sinchkov edi.

haste [heist] n. — shoshish
🔸>> Haste is speed in movement or action. >> Haste bu harakatdagi tezlik.

— In order to get to the meeting in time, he proceeds with haste.
— Uchrashuvga vaqtida yetib borish uchun u shoshqaloqlik bilan davom etadi.
Unit 6:
thrust [θrʌst] v. — zarba bermoq
🔸>> To thrust means to push or move something quickly with a lot of force. >> To thrust katta kuch bilan biror narsani tez itarish yoki siljitishni anglatadi. 

— The boxer thrust his fist into the punching bag.
— Bokschi mushtini qopga zarba berdi.

proficient [prəˈfiʃənt] adj. — malakali, tajribali
🔸>> When a person is proficient at something, they can do it well. >> Agar biror shaxs biror narsada proficient bo'lsa, u o'sha narsani juda yaxshi bajara oladi.

— Secretaries are proficient at typing quickly.
— Kotiblar tez yozishda malakali bo'ladi.

quest [kwest] n. — qidirish, izlash
🔸>> A quest is a long and difficult search for something. >> A quest biror narsani uzoq va murakkab qidirish.

— The treasure hunter went on a quest to find an ancient gold necklace.
— Xazina ovchisi qadimiy tilla marjonlarni topish uchun izlanishga chiqdi.

migraine [maiːgrein] n. — migren, kuchli bosh og'rig'i 
🔸>> A migraine is a painful headache that makes one feel sick. >> A migraine bu odamni kasal qiladigan kuchli bosh og'rig'i. 

— My sister gets a migraine every time she has a lot of stress.
— Singlim har safar juda ko'p stressga duch kelganida migren bilan kasallanadi.

fracture [fræktʃə:r] n. — singan joy
🔸>> A fracture is a crack or break in something. >> A fracture bu biror narsadagi yoriq yoki siniq.

— Don’t stand on that teg because there is a fracture. It might get worse.
— Bu tegda turmang, chunki singan bor. Bu yomonlashishi mumkin.

altitude [ӕltətjuːd] n. — balandlik
🔸>> The altitude of a place is its height above sea level. >> Biror joyning altitude'i bu uning dengiz sathidan qanchalik balandlikda ekanligidir.

— The air was thin at such a high altitude on the mountain.
— Tog'ning shunday balandligida havo siyrak edi.

expertise [ekspə:rtiːz] n. — bilim va tajriba
🔸>> Expertise is the knowledge and skills to do something well. >> Expertise biror narsani yaxshi bajarish uchun bilim va ko‘nikmadir.

— John has a lot of advertising expertise. He can sell anything!
— Jon juda ko'p reklama tajribasiga ega. U hamma narsani sota oladi!

optimism [optəmizəm] n. — optimizm, kelajakka umid qilish 
🔸>> Optimism is the feeling of being hopeful about the future or success of something. >> Optimism bu biror narsaning kelajagi yoki muvaffaqiyati haqida umidli bo'lish tuyg'usi. 

— The mother had optimism about her children’s futures.
— Ona farzandlarining kelajagiga optimizm bilan qarardi.

coastline [koustlain] n. — sohilning tuzilishi
🔸>> A coastline is the outline of a country’s coast. >> A coastline mamlakat qirgʻoqlarining ko'rinishidir.

— He noticed that most of the cities in Australia are on the coastline.
— U Avstraliyadagi shaharlarning koʻpchiligi qirgʻoq boʻyida joylashganini payqadi.

peculiar [piˈkjuːliər] adj. — g'alati 
🔸>> When something is peculiar, it is strange, sometimes in a bad way. >> Agar biror narsa peculiar bo'lsa, u g'alati bo'ladi, odatda yomon yo'l bilan.

— That peculiar smell coming from the kitchen reminds me of rotten eggs.
— Oshxonadan kelayotgan g'alati hid menga chirigan tuxumni eslatadi.

devise [diˈvaiz] v. — o'ylab topmoq
🔸>> To devise something means to have an idea or plan about it in the mind. >> Biror narsani devise qilish bu haqdagi gʻoya yoki rejaga ega boʻlishni bildiradi.

— The thieves devised a plan to steal the diamonds.
— O'g'rilar olmoslarni o'g'irlash rejasini o'ylab topdilar.

deter [diˈtəːr] v. — yo'lidan qaytarmoq
🔸>> To deter means to prevent or discourage someone from doing something. >> To deter birortasi biror narsa qilishining oldini olish yoki undan qaytarmoq  demakdir.

— Icy roads deter people from driving their cars.
— Muzli yo'llar odamlarni mashinalarini haydashdan to'xtatadi.

tolerate [tɒləreit] v. — chidamoq, bardosh bermoq
🔸>> To tolerate something means to be able to accept it even when it is unpleasant. >> Biror narsaga tolerate qilish, hatto u yoqimsiz bo'lsa ham uni qabul qila olishni anglatadi.

— When you are in a hurry, it can be hard to tolerate traffic signals.
— Shoshayotganingizda svetoforlarga toqat qilish qiyin bo'lishi mumkin.

implement [impləment] v. — amalga oshirmoq, joriy qilmoq
🔸>> To implement something means to ensure that what has been planned is done. >> Biror narsani implement qilish rejalashtirilgan narsaning bajarilishini taʼminlash demakdir.

— The school decided to implement a new teaching strategy.
— Maktab yangi oʻqitish strategiyasini amalga oshirishga qaror qildi.

impair [imˈpɛər] v. — zarar yetkazmoq, yomonlashtirmoq
🔸>> To impair something means to damage it or make it worse. >> Biror narsani impair qilish unga zarar yetkazish yoki uni yomonlashtirishni anglatadi. 

— Drinking coffee impairs my ability to go to sleep.
— Kofe ichish mening uxlash qobiliyatimni yomonlashtiradi.

insight [insait] n. — tushuncha, tushunish
🔸>> Insight is a deep and accurate understanding of something. >> Insight bu biror narsani chuqur va aniq tushunishdir.

— The physics textbook gave the student new insight about gravity.
— Fizika darsligi talabaga tortishish haqida yangi tushuncha berdi.

limb [lim] n. — katta shox-shabba 
🔸>> A limb is a large branch on a tree. >> A limb bu daraxtning katta shoxi. 

— The monkey sat on the tree limb and enjoyed a piece of fruit.
— Maymun daraxt shoxiga o‘tirib, bir bo‘lak mevadan zavqlandi.

indigenous [inˈdidʒənəs] adj. — mahalliy, yerli
🔸>> If something is indigenous, it is originally from, or native to, a place. >> Agar biror narsa indigenous bo'lsa, u asl joydan yoki mahalliy joydandir.

— Tomatoes are indigenous to the Americas.
— Pomidorlar Amerika qit'asiga xosdir.

ridge [ridʒ] n. — qirra
🔸>> A ridge is a long, narrow piece of raised land. >> A ridge bu ko'tarilgan yerning uzun va tor qismi.

— The brown bear walked along the edge of the mountain ridge.
— Qo‘ng‘ir ayiq tog‘ tizmasi qirg'og'i bo‘ylab yurdi.

spouse [spaus] n. — turmush o'rtoq
🔸>> A spouse is the person to whom someone is married. >> A spouse birortasi turmush qurgan inson.

— I live in a home with my spouse and our two children.
— Men turmush o'rtog'im va ikki farzandimiz bilan uyda yashayman.
Unit 7:
coarse [kɔːrs] adj. — dag'al
🔸>> If something is coarse, that means it has a rough texture. >> Agar biror narsa coarse bo'lsa, u dag'al tuzilishga egaligini anglatadi. 

— The coarse sweater made my skin itch.
— Dag'al sviter terimni qichishtirdi.

parasite [pӕrəsait] n. — parazit 
🔸>> A parasite is a tiny animal or plant that attaches to another animal to get food. >> A parasite bu oziq-ovqat olish uchun boshqa hayvonga yopishib oladigan mayda hayvon yoki oʻsimlik.

— The sick dog was covered in parasites.
— Kasal it parazitlar bilan qoplangan edi.

reproductive [riːprəˈdʌktiv] adj. — reproduktiv
🔸>> If something is reproductive, it has to do with a living thing producing young. >> Agar biror narsa reproductive bo'lsa, bu tirik mavjudotning yosh dunyoga kelishi bilan bog'liq.

— The reproductive system of a plant is simple.
— O'simlikning reproduktiv tizimi oddiy.

aquatic [əˈkwætik] adj. — suvda yashaydigan, suv ...
🔸>> If a plant or animal is aquatic, it lives or grows in water. >> Agar o'simlik yoki hayvon aquatic bo'lsa, u suvda yashaydi yoki o'sadi.

— The dolphin is an aquatic mammal.
— Delfin suvda yashaydigan sut emizuvchi hisoblanadi.

feat [fiːt] n. — mahorat, san'at 
🔸>> A feat is an impressive or difficult achievement or action. >> A feat bu ta’sirli yoki qiyin yutuq yoki harakatdir.

— The elephant’s standing up on one leg was a feat.
— Filning bir oyog'ida turishi mahorat edi.

prominent [prɒmənənt] adj. — mashhur, taniqli
🔸>> When something is prominent, it is important and well known. >> Agar biror narsa prominent bo'lsa, u muhim va taniqli bo'ladi. 

— Queen Victoria was a prominent person in history.
— Qirolicha Viktoriya tarixda mashhur shaxs bo'lgan.

temperate [tempərit] adj. — mo'tadil
🔸>> When a place is temperate, it never gets too hot or cold. >> Agar biror joy temperate bo'lsa, u hech qachon juda issiq va sovuq bo'lib ketmaydi. 

— In Peru, the weather is temperate and rarely gets too hot or cold.
— Peruda ob-havo mo'tadil va kamdan-kam juda issiq va sovuq bo'ladi.

companion [kəmˈpænjən] n. — hamroh, sherik
🔸>> A companion is a person that someone spends a lot of time with. >> A companion bu birortasi birga ko'p vaqtini o'tkazadigan shaxs.

— I always walk to school with my companion Frank.
— Men maktabga doim hamrohim Frenk bilan boraman.

infinite [infənit] adj. — cheksiz, adog'i yo'q 
🔸>> If something is infinite, it has no limit or end. >> Agar biror narsa infinite bo'lsa, uning chegarasi yoki oxiri yo'q bo'ladi. 

— Many scientists believe that the universe is infinite.
— Ko'p olimlar koinot cheksiz ekanligiga ishonishadi.

vulnerable [vʌlnərəbəl] adj. — zaif, himoyasiz
🔸>> When someone is vulnerable, they are weak and without protection. >> Agar biror narsa vulnerable bo'lsa, u kuchsiz va himoyasiz bo'ladi. 

— He felt very vulnerable when he was stranded in the desert.
— U sahroda qolib ketganida o'zini juda zaif his qildi.

ecology [i:kɒlədʒi] n. — ekologiya 
🔸>> Ecology is the study of the environment and living things. >> Ecology bu atrof-muhit va tirik mavjudotlarni o'rganadigan fan.

— We study ecology to learn how to help improve the Earth. 
— Biz yerni yaxshilashga yordam berish uchun ekologiyani o'rganamiz.

Celsius [selsiəs] n. — Selsiy shkalasi
🔸>> Celsius is a scale for measuring temperature. >> Celsius bu haroratni o'lchash shkalasi.

— Water freezes at zero degrees Celsius.
— Suv nol daraja Selsiyda muzlaydi.

digest [diˈdʒest] v. — hazm qilmoq, hazm bo'lmoq 
🔸>> To digest means to swallow food and pass it through the body. >> To digest ovqatni yutib, uni tana bo'ylab o‘tkazishni anglatadi. 

— Allow some time for food to be digested before going swimming.
— Suzishga borishdan oldin ovqat hazm bo'lishi uchun biroz vaqt ajrating.

tolerance [tɒlərəns] n. — chidam, bardosh
🔸>> Tolerance is the ability to accept something painful or unpleasant. >> Tolerance bu biror og'riqli yoki yoqimsiz narsani qabul qilish qobiliyati.

— Boxers have a high tolerance for pain.
— Bokschilar og'riqqa chidamliligi yuqori bo'ladi.

undergo [ʌndərˈgou] v. — boshdan kechirmoq 
🔸>> To undergo an action means to have it happen to you. >> Biror voqeaning undergo bo'lishi bu uni sizning boshingizga tushishini bildiradi.

— The cancer patient undergoes treatments twice a week. 
— Saraton bilan kasallangan bemor haftasiga ikki marta davolanishni boshdan o'tkazadi.

repetitive [riˈpetətiv] adj. — zerikarli
🔸>> When something is repetitive, it is repeated many times and becomes boring. >> Agar biror narsa repetitive bo'lsa, u ko'p marotaba qaytariladi va zerikarliga aylanadi.

— Working on an assembly line making cars every day is a repetitive job.
— Har kuni avtomobil ishlab chiqaradigan konveyerda ishlash - zerikarli ish.

bizarre [biˈzaːr] adj. — g'ayritabiiy, ajoyib 
🔸>> When something is bizarre, it is very strange. >> Agar biror narsa bizarre bo'lsa, u juda g'alati bo'ladi. 

— My bizarre dreams make no sense to me when I am awake.
— Uyg'onganimda g'alati tushlarim menga ma'no bermaydi.

nucleus [njuːkliəs] n. — yadro 
🔸>> The nucleus is the central part of an atom or cell. >> The nucleus bu atom yoki hujayraning markaziy qismi.

— The nucleus is made up of many tiny particles.
— Yadro koʻplab mayda zarrachalardan tashkil topgan.

duration [djuəˈreiʃən] n. — davom etish miqdori
🔸>> The duration of an event is the time during which it happens. >> Biror voqeaning duration'i bu uning sodir bo'ladigan vaqtidir.

— The girls watched television for the duration of the evening.
— Kechqurun qizlar televizor tomosha qilishdi.

biosphere [baiəsfiər] adj. — biosfera, hayot qobig'i
🔸>> The biosphere is the earth’s surface and atmosphere where there are living things. >>

— Birds, trees, and worms all thrive in the biosphere.
— Qushlar, daraxtlar va qurtlar biosferada ko'payadi.
Unit 8:
respirator [respəˈreitə:r] n. — respirator
🔸>> A respirator is a machine that helps weak or sick people breathe. >> A respirator nimjon yoki kasal odamlar nafas olishiga yordam beradigan mashina.

— The man needed a respirator to breathe.
— Haligi odam nafas olishiga respirator kerak edi.

hostile [hɒstəl] adj. — adovatli, dushman
🔸>> If someone is hostile, they are angry and unfriendly. >> Agar birortasi hostile bo'lsa, u badjahl va adovatli bo'ladi. 

— We were happy to move away from our hostile neighbor.
— Biz dushman qo‘shnimizdan uzoqlashganimizdan xursand edik.

intake [inteik] n. — iste'mol qilish
🔸>> Your intake of food is the amount of food you take into your body. >> Sizning ovqatni intake qilishingiz tanangizga qabul qilingan ovqat miqdorini anglatadi. 

— The doctor said I needed to increase my intake of fruits and vegetables.
— Shifokor meva va sabzavotlar iste'molini koʻpaytirishim kerakligini aytdi.

dense [dens] adj. — zich, qalin
🔸>> If something is dense, it has a lot of things close together. >> Agar biror narsa dense bo'lsa, unda ko'plab bir-biriga yaqin narsalar bo'ladi. 

— I easily became lost in the dense forest.
— Men zich o'rmonda osongina adashib qoldim.

obscure [əbˈskjuər] adj. — notanish, noma'lum
🔸>> If something is obscure, it is not well-known. >> Agar biror narsa obscure bo'lsa, u taniqli bo'lmaydi.

— The old man travels the world in search of obscure books.
— Yoshi ulug' kishi noaniq kitoblarni izlab dunyo bo‘ylab sayohat qiladi.

strive [straiv] v. — intilmoq, tirishmoq
🔸>> To strive is to struggle to achieve something. >> To strive biror narsaga erishish uchun urinish hisoblanadi. 

— People who strive to succeed often do.
— Muvaffaqiyat qozonishga intiladigan odamlar odatda bunga erishadi.

adept [əˈdept] adj. — bilimdon, mutaxassis
🔸>> If someone is adept at something, they are very good at doing it. >> Agar birortasi biror narsada adept bo'lsa, u o'sha narsani bajarishga usta bo'ladi. 

— The carpenter is very adept at building houses.
— Duradgor uy qurishda juda mohir.

prescription [priˈskripʃən] n. — retsept 
🔸>> A prescription is permission from a doctor to get medicine. >> A prescription dori olish uchun doktordan olingan ruxsat hisoblanadi. 

— The doctor gave me a prescription for my medication.
— Shifokor menga dori-darmonlarim uchun retsept berdi.

peel [piːl] v. — archmoq
🔸>> To peel fruits and vegetables is to remove their skin. >> Mevalar va sabzavotlarni peel qilish, ularni po'stidan ajratish degani.

— We peeled the apple before eating it.
— Biz olmani yeyishdan oldin, po'stini archdik.

ceramic [səˈrӕmik] adj. — keramik, sopol
🔸>> If something is ceramic, it is made of baked clay. >> Agar biror narsa ceramic bo'lsa, u pishgan loydan tayyorlangan bo'ladi. 

— The house’s roof was made of ceramic tiles.
— Uyning tomi keramik plitkalardan qilingan.

dominate [dɒməneit] v. — ustunlik qilmoq, o'zi olib bormoq
🔸>> To dominate someone or something is to control them. >> Birortasi yoki biror narsani dominate qilish, uni boshqarish hisoblanadi. 

— The loud man dominated the conversation.
— Baland ovozli odam suhbatda hukmronlik qildi.

edible [edəbəl] adj. — yesa bo'ladigan
🔸>> If something is edible, you can eat it. >> Agar biror narsa edible bo'lsa, uni yesa bo'ladi. 

— We learn about edible plants when we go camping.
— Biz lagerga borganimizda yesa bo'ladigan oʻsimliklar haqida bilib olamiz.

dignity [dignəti] n. — salobat, salvat; bosiqlik
🔸>> Dignity is the ability to be calm and worthy of respect. >> Dignity bu xotirjam va hurmatga loyiq bo'lish qobiliyatidir.

— When his company went out of business, he faced it with dignity.
— Uning kompaniyasi ishdan chiqqanida, u buni bosiqlik bilan qabul qildi.

likewise [laikwaiz] adv. — shunday
🔸>> If someone does something likewise, they do the same thing as someone else. >> Agar birortasi biror narsani likewise bajarsa, u boshqa birov bilan bir xil ishni qilgan bo'ladi. 

— If Joe is staying away from school to go swimming, I want to do likewise.
— Agar Jo suzish uchun maktabdan uzoqlashsa, men ham shunday qilmoqchiman.

medication [medəˈkeiʃən] n. — dori-darmon
🔸>> Medication is medicine or drugs given to people who are sick. >> Medication bu kasal odamlarga beriladigan dori.

— The doctor gave me medication to treat my illness.
— Doktor kasalimni davolash uchun menga dori-darmon berdi.

culinary [kʌləneri] adj. — oshpazlik, pazandalik 
🔸>> If something is culinary, it is related to cooking. >> Agar biror narsa culinary bo'lsa, u pishirish bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— I gained culinary skills after working in a restaurant for many years.
— Ko'p yil restoranda ishlab, oshpazlik mahoratini orttirdim.

oppress [əˈpres] v. — jabr-zulm qilmoq, ezmoq
🔸>> To oppress someone means to rule over them in a cruel and unfair way. >> Birortasini oppress qilish, uning ustidan shavqatsizlik va adolatsizlik bilan boshqarishni anglatadi. 

— Free speech had been oppressed in his country.
— Uning mamlakatida so'z erkinligi tazyiq ostida edi.

barren [bӕrən] adj. — unumsiz
🔸>> If land is barren, it has no plants growing on it. >> Agar yer barren bo'lsa, unda o'sadigan o'simlik bo'lmaydi.

— People cannot farm in barren lands.
— Odamlar taqir yerlarda dehqonchilik qila olmaydi.

misconception [miskənˈsepʃən] n. — noto'g'ri tasavvur
🔸>> A misconception is a wrong idea about something. >> A misconception bu biror narsa haqidagi noto'g'ri fikr.

— People once believed the misconception that the Earth is flat.
— Odamlar bir paytlar Yerning yassi ekanligi haqidagi noto'g'ri tushunchaga ega bo'lishgan.

malnutrition [mӕlnjuˈtriʃən] n. — to'yib ovqatlanmaslik
🔸>> Malnutrition is the condition of not getting enough nutrients. >> Malnutrition yetarli ozuqa olmaslik holati.

— After eating only a meager amount of food, she suffered from malnutrition.
— Ozgina ovqat iste'mol qilgach, u to'yib ovqatlanmaslikdan aziyat chekdi.
Unit 9:
peninsula [pəˈninsələ] n. — yarim orol 
🔸>> A peninsula is a large piece of land that is surrounded by the sea on three sides. >> A peninsula uch tomondan dengiz bilan o'ralgan yer hisoblanadi. 

— The state of Florida is an example of a peninsula.
— Florida shtati yarim orolga misoldir.

obsolete [ɒbsəliːt] adj. — urfdan qolgan, iste'moldan chiqqan, eskirgan
🔸>> If something is obsolete, it is not used anymore because something better exists. >> Agar biror narsa obsolete bo'lsa, u boshqa ishlatilmaydi, chunki undan yaxshirog'i mavjud bo'ladi. 

— Since computers became inexpensive, typewriters have become obsolete.
— Kompyuterlar arzonlashgandan beri yozuv mashinkalari eskirgan holga keldi.

component [kəmˈpounənt] n. — tarkibiy qism, komponent
🔸>> A component is a part of a larger machine. >> A component kattaroq mashinaning bir qismidir.

— Computers have many different components, so they are complicated to build.
— Kompyuterlar juda ko'p turli xil komponentlarga ega, shuning uchun ularni ishlab chiqarish qiyin.

managerial [mænəˈdʒiəriəl] adj. — menejerlik bilan bog'liq
🔸>> Managerial describes something related to a manager or management. >> Managerial menejment yoki menejer bilan bog'liq narsani tasvirlaydi.

— Nancy has a managerial position at the bank.
— Nensi bankda menejerlik lavozimida ishlaydi.

refute [riˈfjuːt] v. — rad etmoq, tan olmaslik
🔸>> To refute something means to prove that it is false or incorrect. >> Biror narsani refute qilish, uning xato yoki noto'g'riligini isbotlashni anglatadi. 

— The bank manager has refuted the claims that he lied to his customers.
— Bank menejeri o‘z mijozlariga yolg‘on gapirgani haqidagi iddaolarni rad etdi.

prestige [presˈtiːrdʒ] n. — obro', nufuz
🔸>> If a person has prestige, people admire or respect them. >> Agar biror shaxsda prestige bo'lsa, odamlar unga qoyil qoladi yoki hurmat qiladi.

— The young actress gained much prestige after she won an award.
— Yosh aktrisa mukofotni qo'lga kiritganidan keyin katta obro'-e'tibor qozondi.

weave [wiːv] v. — to'qimoq
🔸>> To weave means to make cloth using horizontal and vertical threads. >> To weave gorizontal va vertikal iplar yordamida mato yasashni bildiradi.

— We saw a woman weave a blanket on our vacation to South America.
— Biz Janubiy Amerikaga ta’tilda bir ayolning adyol to‘qib yurganini ko‘rdik.

radical [rædikəl] adj. — juda yangi; katta
🔸>> If something is radical, it is very new or different. >> Agar biror narsa radical bo'lsa, u juda yangi yoki farqli bo'ladi. 

— The president is planning to make some radical changes to the law.
— Prezident qonunga tubdan o‘zgartirishlar kiritishni rejalashtirmoqda.

drawback [drɔːbæk] n. — kamchilik, salbiy jihat
🔸>> A drawback is a disadvantage. >> A drawback bu kamchilik degani.

— The drawback of having a car is that it is very expensive to maintain.
— Avtomobilga ega bo'lishning kamchiligi shundaki, uni saqlash juda qimmat.

spectacular [spekˈtækjələr] adj. — ta'sirchan
🔸>> If something is spectacular, it looks or sounds very impressive. >> Agar biror narsa spectacular bo'lsa, u ta'sirli ko'rinadi yoki eshitiladi.

— There was a spectacular fireworks display in the park at New Year.
— Yangi yil arafasida bog‘da ta'sirli salyut namoyishi bo‘lib o‘tdi.

medieval [mi:diˈiːvəl] adj. — O'rta asrlar
🔸>> If something is medieval, it comes from the period between 650 and 1500 CE. >> Agar biror narsa medieval bo'lsa, u milodiy 650 — 1500 yillar oralig'idan kelgan bo'ladi. 

— We visited a castle that was built during medieval times.
— Biz O'rta asrlar davomida qurilgan qasrga tashrif buyurdik.

capitalism [kæpitəlizəm] n. — kapitalizm
🔸>> Capitalism is an economic system where private companies make goods for profit. >> Capitalism xususiy kompaniyalar foyda olish uchun mahsulot ishlab chiqaradigan iqtisodiy tizimdir.

— Most industries in the world today are based on capitalism.
— Bugungi kunda dunyodagi aksariyat sanoatlar kapitalizmga asoslangan.

benevolent [bəˈnevələnt] adj. — mehribon, saxiy 
🔸>> If someone is benevolent, they are kind and generous. >> Agar birortasi benevolent bo'lsa, u xushfe'l va saxiy bo'ladi. 

— My father was a benevolent man and gave lots of money to charity.
— Mening otam xayrixoh odam edi va xayriya ishlariga ko'p pul sarflardi.

impose [imˈpouz] v. — hukmini o'tkazmoq, zo'rlamoq
🔸>> To impose means to interrupt or force your ideas on other people. >> To impose o'z fikrlaringizni boshqa odamlarga etkazish yoki majburlash vositasini joriy qilishni anglatadi. 

— He imposes on his wife every morning by expecting her to make breakfast.
— U har kuni ertalab xotiniga nonushta qilishga majburlaydi.

diminish [dəˈminiʃ] v. — kamaymoq, qisqartirmoq
🔸>> To diminish means to reduce or get smaller. >> To diminish ozayish yoki kichrayishni anglatadi. 

— As the economy got worse, my savings diminished.
— Iqtisodiyot yomonlashgani sari jamg'armalarim kamayib ketdi.

brass [bræs] n. — sariq mis
🔸>> Brass is a metal that is used to make musical instruments and ornaments. >> Brass bu musiqa asboblari va bezaklar yasashda ishlatiladigan metall.

— Brass is used to make musical instruments like trumpets.
— Sariq mis karnay kabi musiqa asboblarini yasashda ishlatiladi.

dependence [diˈpendəns] n. — qaramlik, tobelik 
🔸>> Dependence is a situation in which somebody relies on something else. >> Dependence bu kimningdir boshqa narsaga tayanishi holatidir.

— Young children have a dependence on their parents.
— Yosh bolalar ota-onalariga qaram bo'lishadi.

proportion [prəˈpɔːrʃən] n. — qism, bo'lak
🔸>> A proportion is an amount that shows the link between the parts and the whole. >> A proportion bu qismlar va butun oʻrtasidagi bogʻliqlikni koʻrsatadigan miqdordir.

— Only a small proportion of the people in this town actually work here.
— Bu shaharcha aholisining ozgina qismigina ishlaydi.

fad [fæd] n. — o'tkinchi hoyu-havas 
🔸>> A fad is something that is popular for a short time. >> A fad bu qisqa vaqtga mashhur bo'lgan biror narsa.

— The hula hoop was a fad for a few years, but it soon lost its popularity.
— Hula-halqa bir necha yil davomida moda edi, lekin tez orada u mashhurligini yo'qotdi.

archaic [ɑːrˈkeik] adj. — arxaik, eskirgan
🔸>> If something is archaic, it is very old or outdated. >> Agar biror narsa archaic bo'lsa, u juda eskirgan bo'ladi. 

— To be competitive, we must update our archaic equipment.
— Raqobatbardosh bo'lish uchun biz eski jihozlarimizni yangilashimiz kerak.
Unit 10:
soy [sɔi] n. — soya qaylasi
🔸>> Soy is a food made from soybeans, such as flour or butter. >> Soy bu un yoki sariyogʻ kabi soyadan tayyorlangan taomdir.

— Soy can be made into tofu, sauce, and also milk.
— Soyadan tofu, sous va sut tayyorlanishi mumkin.

simplicity [simˈplisəti] n. — soddalik, osonlik
🔸>> The simplicity of something is the fact that it is easy to do or understand. >> Biror narsaning simplicity'si u bajarishga yoki tushunishga osonligi fakti hisoblanadi. 

— We were able to find the house thanks to the simplicity of the directions.
— Yoʻnalishlarning soddaligi tufayli uyni topa oldik.

precaution [priˈkɔːʃən] n. — ehtiyot chorasi
🔸>> A precaution is an action that is meant to stop something bad from happening. >> A precaution biror yomon narsa sodir bo'lishini to'xtatishni anglatadigan harakatdir.

— As a precaution, you should put on a heavy coat before going out in cold weather.
— Ehtiyot chorasi sifatida sovuq havoda ko'chaga chiqishdan oldin qalin palto kiyishingiz kerak.

irrigate [irəgeit] v. — sug'ormoq
🔸>> To irrigate means to supply water to land so that crops can grow. >> To irrigate hosil o'sishi uchun yerni suv bilan ta'minlashni anglatadi. 

— In dry climates, it is important to irrigate fields of crops.
— Quruq iqlim sharoitida ekin maydonlarini sug'orish muhim ahamiyatga ega.

dedicate [dedikeit] v. — bag'ishlamoq
🔸>> To dedicate oneself to something means to put a lot of time and effort into it. >> O'zini biror narsaga dedicate qilish, unga ko'p vaqt va kuch sarflashni anglatadi.

— The nun dedicated herself to helping people in need.
— Rohiba o'zini muhtoj odamlarga yordam berishga bag'ishladi.

monetary [manəteri] adj. — monetar, pul bilan bog'liq 
🔸>> When something is monetary, it relates to money. >> Agar biror narsa monetary bo'lsa, u pul bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— A strong monetary policy is important for a country to be successful.
— Kuchli pul siyosati mamlakat muvaffaqiyatli boʻlishi uchun muhimdir.

enterprise [entərpraiz] n. — biznes, korxona
🔸>> An enterprise is a company or business. >> An enterprise bu kompaniya yoki biznes hisoblanadi. 

— My father owns an advertising enterprise.
— Dadamning reklama korxonasi bor.

capitalist [kæpitəlist] n. — kapitalist
🔸>> A capitalist is a business person who invests in trade and industry for profit. >> A capitalist bu savdo va sanoatga sarmoya kiritadigan biznes odami.

— The capitalist invested in a factory that made wheat into cereal.
— Kapitalist bug'doydan don ishlab chiqaradigan zavodga sarmoya kiritdi.

accountant [əˈkauntənt] n. — buxgalter, hisobchi
🔸>> An accountant is a person whose job is to keep financial accounts. >> An accountant bu moliyaviy hisoblarni yuritadigan shaxs.

— The accountant helped me keep track of my money.
— Buxgalter pullarimni hisobga olishimga yordam berdi.

ditch [ditʃ] n. — ariq, zovur 
🔸>> A ditch is a narrow hole cut into the ground by a road or a field. >> A ditch — yoʻl yoki dala bo'yiga yerga oʻyilgan tor suv yo'li.
