— When the car slid off of the road, it fell into the ditch.
— Mashina yo‘ldan sirg‘alib ketganida, zovurga qulab tushdi.

contempt [kənˈtempt] n. — mensimaslik, hurmatsizlik
🔸>> Contempt is the feeling of having no respect for something. >> Contempt bu biror narsa uchun hurmatsizlik tuyg'usi. 

— The judge had contempt for the wicked criminal.
— Sudya yovuz jinoyatchiga hurmatsizlik bilan qaradi.

spade [speid] n. — belkurak, lapotki 
🔸>> A spade is a tool used for digging. >> A spade bu kavlash uchun ishlatiladigan asbob.

— The gardener used her spade to make a hole for the seed.
— Bog‘bon belkurak bilan urug‘ uchun kavak ochdi.

saturate [sӕtʃəreit] v. — ho'l qilmoq, bo'ktirmoq
🔸>> To saturate something means to completely soak it with a liquid. >> Biror narsani saturate qilish, uni suyuqlik bilan namlashni anglatadi.

— The sponge was saturated with soapy water and dripped all over the floor.
— Shimgich sovunli suv bilan namlangan va butun polga tomizilgan edi.

indifferent [inˈdəfrənt] adj. — beparvo, loqayd
🔸>> When someone is indifferent toward something, they have a lack of interest in it. >> Agar birortasi biror narsaga nisbatan indifferent bo'lsa, u o'sha narsaga qiziqishi bo'lmaydi.

— Lisa is indifferent toward school. She doesn’t care what her final grades are.
— Liza maktabga befarq. U yakuniy baholari qanday ekanligiga ahamiyat bermaydi.

exquisite [iksˈkwizit] adj. — go'zal, latofatli
🔸>> When something is exquisite, it is very beautiful or pleasant. >> Agar biror narsa exquisite bo'lsa, u juda go'zal yoki yoqimli bo'ladi. 

— The artist made exquisite watercolor paintings.
— Rassom akvarel bo'yoqlari bo'yicha nafis rasmlar yaratdi.

sow [sou] v. — sepmoq, ekmoq
🔸>> To sow seeds means to plant them in the ground. >> Urug'larni sow qilish, uni yerga ekishni anglatadi. 

— He always sows his garden seeds in the springtime.
— U har doim bahorda bog‘iga urug‘ sepadi.

preliminary [priˈliməneri] adj. — dastlabki, oldingi
🔸>> Preliminary describes something that happens before a more important event. >> Preliminary biror muhimroq voqeadan oldin sodir bo'ladigan narsani tasvirlaydi. 

— The runners must do well in the preliminary races to qualify for the final race.
— Yuguruvchilar final poygasiga chiqish uchun dastlabki poygalarda yaxshi natija ko'rsatishlari kerak.

upcoming [ʌpkʌmiŋ] adj. — yaqinlashayotgan
🔸>> When something is upcoming, that means it will happen in the near future. >> Agar biror narsa upcoming bo'lsa, u yaqin kelajakda sodir bo'lishini anglatadi. 

— The kids were worried about their upcoming exam.
— Bolalar yaqinlashib kelayotgan imtihondan xavotirda edilar.

finance [fiˈnæns] v. — mablag' bilan ta'minlamoq 
🔸>> To finance someone or something means to provide money for them. >> Birortasi yoki biror narsani finance qilish ularni pul bilan ta'minlashni anglatadi. 

— The government financed the scientist’s experiments with new weapons.
— Hukumat olimning yangi qurollar bilan tajribalarini moliyalashtirdi.

maximize [mæksəmaiz] v. — maksimallashtirmoq
🔸>> To maximize something is to make it as great in amount, size, or importance. >> Biror narsani maximize qilish, uni miqdor, hajm yoki muhimlik jihatdan kattalashtirish hisoblanadi. 

— You should exercise regularly to maximize a healthy lifestyle.
— Sog'lom turmush tarzini maksimal darajada oshirish uchun siz muntazam ravishda mashq qilishingiz kerak.
Unit 11:
compel [kəmˈpel] v. — majbur qilmoq
🔸>> To compel someone to do something means to force them to do it. >> Birortasini biror narsa qilishga compel qilish, uni o'sha ishni qilishga majburlashni anglatadi. 

— Traffic signs compel drivers to drive safely.
— Yoʻl belgilari haydovchilarni xavfsiz haydashga majbur qiladi.

banquet [bæŋkwit] n. — banket
🔸>> A banquet is a grand formal dinner. >> A banquet bu hashamatli rasmiy ziyofat.

— Both families brought a lot of food for the wedding banquet.
— To'y ziyofati uchun ikkala oila ham ko'p yegulik sotib oldi.

masterpiece [mæstərpiːs] n. — shoh asar
🔸>> A masterpiece is a very good painting, novel, movie, or other work of art. >> A masterpiece bu juda yaxshi rasm, roman, kino yoki boshqa sanʼat asaridir.

— The Arc de Triomphe is considered a masterpiece in the world of architecture.
— Arc de Triomphe arxitektura olamining durdona asari hisoblanadi.

legacy [leɡəsi] n. — meros
🔸>> A legacy is an effect that exists because of a person or thing in the past. >> A legacy bu oʻtmishdagi shaxs yoki narsa tufayli mavjud boʻlgan ta'sirdir.

— The legacy of the ancient Egyptians can be seen in their monuments.
— Qadimgi misrliklarning merosini oʻz yodgorliklarida koʻrish mumkin.

virtue [vəːrtʃuː] n. — yaxshi xislat, fazilat
🔸>> A virtue is a good quality or way of behaving. >> A virtue bu yaxshi sifat yoki o'zini tutish yo'li.

— My best virtue is forgiveness.
— Mening eng yaxshi fazilatim bu kechiruvchanlik.

outdated [autˈdeitid] adj. — urfdan qolgan, eskirgan
🔸>> When something is outdated, it is old and no longer useful in modern time. >> Agar biror narsa outdated bo'lsa, u eski va hozirgi vaqtda foydali emas.

— Tape players are becoming outdated because of digital music.
— Raqamli musiqa tufayli lenta pleyerlari eskirib bormoqda.

overall [ouvərɔːl] adv. — umuman, umumiy olganda
🔸>> When a thing is talked about overall, the whole thing is considered. >> Biror narsa haqida overall gap ketganda, hamma narsa ko'rib chiqiladi.

— Overall, the party was a huge success.
— Umuman olganda, partiya katta muvaffaqiyatga erishdi.

clap [klæp] v. — qarsak chalmoq
🔸>> To clap means to hit one’s hands together to express pleasure or get attention. >> To clap bu zavqlanish yoki eʼtiborni jalb qilish uchun qoʻllarini bir-biriga urish demakdir.

— After the speech, everyone in the crowd clapped their hands for the speaker.
— Nutqdan so‘ng olomondagilarning barchasi ma’ruzachi uchun qarsak chalishdi.

gorgeous [gɔːrdʒəs] adj. — ko'rkam, ajoyib, go'zal
🔸>> When something is gorgeous, it is very pleasing and attractive. >> Agar biror narsa gorgeous bo'lsa, u juda quvontiradigan va maftunkor bo'ladi. 

— The girl picked out a gorgeous dress to wear to the dance.
— Qiz raqsga kiyish uchun ajoyib libos tanladi.

spontaneous [spɒnˈteiniəs] adj. — tasodifiy 
🔸>> When an act is spontaneous, it is not planned. It happens suddenly. >> Agar biror harakat spontaneous bo'lsa, u rejalashtirilmagan bo'ladi. U to'satdan sodir bo'ladi. 

— My wife made a spontaneous decision to buy a new sofa while I was at work.
— Ishda bo'lganimda xotinim o'z-o'zidan yangi divan sotib olishga qaror qildi.

dominance [dɒmənəns] n. — hukmronlik
🔸>> The dominance of a person is their state of being more powerful than others. >> Shaxsning dominance'i- bu uning boshqalarga qaraganda kuchliroq bo'lgan holatidir.

— Large gorillas hit their chests to express their dominance over others.
— Yirik gorillalar boshqalar ustidan hukmronlik qilish uchun ko‘kragiga urishadi.

notorious [nouˈtɔːriəs] adj. — yomon nom chiqargan, yomon otliq bo'lgan 
🔸>> When something is notorious, it is well-known because of something bad. >> Agar biror narsa notorious bo'lsa, u biror yomon narsani deb mashhur hisoblanadi. 

— This area of town is notorious for gang activity.
— Shaharning bu hududi jinoiy guruh faoliyati bilan mashhur.

biography [baiˈɒgrəfi] n. — tarjimai hol
🔸>> A biography is an account of someone’s life that is written by someone else. >> A biography bu boshqa birov tomonidan yozilgan birovning hayoti haqidagi hikoyadir.

— We read a biography about Charles Darwin in science class.
— Biz ilmiy fan darsida Charlz Darvin haqidagi tarjimai holni oʻqib chiqdik.

narrate [næˈreit] v. — hikoya qilmoq, gapirib bermoq 
🔸>> To narrate a story means to write about it or read it aloud. >> Biror hikoyani narrate qilish, u haqida yozish yoki uni ovoz chiqarib o'qishni anglatadi. 

— This story was written by John, but Aaron is narrating it to the crowd.
— Bu hikoya Jon tomonidan yozilgan, lekin Aron uni olomonga hikoya qilyapti.

boost [buːst] v. — oshirmoq, ko'paytirmoq
🔸>> To boost something means to increase or improve it. >> Biror narsani boost qilish, uni koʻpaytirish yoki yaxshilashni anglatadi. 

— Lowering prices boosts customers’ interest in shopping.
— Narxlarni tushirish xaridorlarning sotib olishga bo'lgan qiziqishini oshiradi.

acute [əˈkjuːt] adj. — qattiq, o'tkir, og'ir
🔸>> When a bad thing is acute, it is very severe and intense. >> Agar biror yomon narsa acute bo'lsa, u og'ir mashaqqatli va jadal bo'ladi. 

— When she fell out of the tree, the girl felt an acute pain in her arm.
— Haligi qiz daraxtdan yiqilganida qo'lida kuchli og'riq his qildi.

multiple [mʌltəpəl] adj. — ko'p sonli, ko'plab 
🔸>> If there are multiple things, there are many of them. >> Agar multiple narsalar bo'lsa, o'sha narsalar ko'p bo'ladi. 

— When the stunt went wrong, the man suffered multiple injuries.
— Kaskadyor noto'g'ri harakat qilganida, erkak ko'plab jarohatlar olgan.

aggression [əˈgreʃən] n. — agressiya, tajovuz
🔸>> Aggression is behavior that is mean or violent to others. >> Aggression bu boshqalarga nisbatan baxil yoki yovuz bo'ladigan xulq-atvor. 

— The problem was only made worse by Mark’s aggression.
— Markning tajovuzkorligi muammoni yanada kuchaytirdi.

inevitable [inˈevitəbəl] adj. — muqarrar
🔸>> When something is inevitable, it is certain to happen or cannot be avoided. >> Agar biror narsa inevitable bo'lsa, u albatta sodir boʻladi yoki undan qochib boʻlmaydi.

— It is inevitable that the days will get longer in the summer.
— Yozda kunlar uzayishi muqarrar.

partiality [pɑːrʃiˈæləti] n. — moyillik 
🔸>> A partiality is a tendency to prefer one thing to another. >> A partiality bir narsani boshqa narsadan ustun qo'yishga moyillik hisoblanadi. 

— She has a partiality for walking to school instead of driving.
— Uning mashina haydashdan ko'ra maktabga borishga moyilligi bor.
Unit 12:
muscular [mʌskjələ:r] adj. — mushakdor, baquvvat
🔸>> When someone is muscular, they are very fit and strong. >> Agar birortasi muscular bo'lsa, u juda baquvvat va kuchli bo'ladi. 

— He exercised regularly so that his body could become muscular.
— U muntazam ravishda jismoniy mashqlar qildi, shunda uning tanasi mushaklarga aylanishi mumkin edi.

posture [pɒstʃər] n. — yurish-turish, gavdaning pozitsiyasi
🔸>> A person’s posture is the position in which they stand or sit. >> Shaxsning posture'si bu uning turgan yoki o‘tirgan holatidir.

— Your back will feel better if you improve your posture.
— Sizning holatingizni yaxshilasangiz, orqangiz yaxshilanadi.

feedback [fiːdbæk] n. — fikr-mulohaza
🔸>> Feedback is comments to a person about how they are doing something. >> Feedback bu odamning biror narsa qilayotgani haqidagi sharhi yozi izohidir.

— I asked my boss for feedback on my work.
— Men xo‘jayinimdan ishim haqida fikr-mulohazalarini so‘radim.

compatible [kəmˈpætəbəl] adj. — bir-biriga mos, bir-birini tushunadigan
🔸>> When things are compatible, they work well or exist together successfully. >> Agar narsalar compatible bo'lsa, ular yaxshi ishlaydi yoki birgalikda muvaffaqiyatli tarzda mavjud.

— Jan and Fred are too different. They will never be compatible.
— Jan va Fred juda boshqacha. Ular hech qachon mos kelmaydi.

crude [kruːd] adj. — ishlov berilmagan
🔸>> When something is crude, it is not exact or detailed, but it can still be useful. >> Agar biror narsa crude boʻlsa, u aniq yoki batafsil koʻrsatilmaydi, lekin u baribir foydali boʻlishi mumkin.

— She drew crude hearts on the ground to show how much she loved him.
— U uni qanchalik sevishini ko'rsatish uchun yerga qo'pol yuraklarni chizdi.

symmetry [simətri] n. — simmetriya
🔸>> Symmetry is the state of having two halves that are exactly the same. >> Symmetry bir xil boʻlgan ikkita yarmiga ega boʻlish holatidir.

— The artist made sure to use perfect symmetry when painting the butterfly.
— Rassom kapalakni chizishda mukammal simmetriyadan foydalanishga ishonch hosil qilgan.

applaud [əˈplɔːd] v. — olqishlamoq
🔸>> To applaud means to clap in order to show approval. >> To applaud ma'qullashni ko'rsatish uchun qarsak chalishni anglatadi. 

— Everyone cheered and applauded Manny’s efforts.
— Hamma Menining harakatlarini olqishladi va hursand bo'ldi.

undergraduate [ʌndərˈgrædjuit] n. — bakalavr
🔸>> An undergraduate is a student at a college who is studying fora bachelor’s degree. >> An undergraduate bakalavr darajasida tahsil olayotgan kollej talabasidir.

— She was excited to finish high school and enroll as an undergraduate in the fall.
— U o'rta maktabni tugatib, kuzda bakalavrga o'qishga kirishidan hayajonlandi.

ignorance [ignərəns] n. — bilmaslik, bilimsizlik
🔸>> Ignorance of something is lack of knowledge about it. >> Biror narsaning ignorance'i bu u haqida bilimga ega emaslik.

— When he failed the test, his ignorance of math was obvious.
— Sinovdan o‘ta olmaganida, uning matematikani bilmasligi yaqqol ko‘rinib turardi.

consecutive [kənˈsekjətiv] adj. — izchil, ketma-ket
🔸>> When things are consecutive, they happen one after another without interruption. >> Agar narsalar consecutive bo'lsa, ular halal berishsiz biridan keyin boshqasi sodir bo'ladi. 

— The king ruled for ten consecutive years.
— Podshoh o‘n yil ketma-ket hukmronlik qildi.

tattoo [tæˈtuː] n. — tatuirovka
🔸>> A tattoo is a design that is drawn permanently on the skin with needles. >> A tattoo bu ignalar yordamida teriga doimiy ravishda chizilgan dizayndir.

— The surfer had tattoos on both his arms.
— Serferning ikkala qo'lida ham tatuirovka bor edi.

cube [kjuːb] n. — kubik, kub
🔸>> A cube is a solid object with six square surfaces that are all the same size. >> A cube bu bir xil oʻlchamdagi oltita kvadrat yuzali qattiq jismdir.

— Please get me some ice cubes to put in my soda.
— Iltimos, gazlangan suvimga qo'yishim uchun muz kublarini olib bering.

monument [mɒnjəmənt] n. — haykal, monument 
🔸>> A monument is a structure that is built to remind people of a person or event. >> A monument bu odamlarga biror shaxs yoki hodisani eslatish uchun qurilgan inshootdir.

— A large monument was built to honor the brave soldiers.
— Jasur askarlar sharafiga katta yodgorlik qurilgan.

supervise [suːpərvaiz] v. — nazorat qilmoq 
🔸>> To supervise something means to make sure that it is done correctly. >> Biror narsani supervise qilish uning toʻgʻri bajarilganligiga ishonch hosil qilishni anglatadi.

— Allen supervised the construction workers to ensure everyone’s safety.
— Allen barchaning xavfsizligini taʼminlash uchun qurilish ishchilarini kuzatib boʻldi.

situate [sitjueit] v. — joylashmoq, joylashtirmoq
🔸>> To situate something means to place or build it in a certain place. >> Biror narsani situate qilish, uni ma'lum joyga joylashtirish yoki qurishni anglatadi. 

— The road was situated between the forest and the lake.
— Yo'l o'rmon va ko'l o'rtasida joylashgan edi.

masculine [mæskjəlin] adj. — erkaklarga xos
🔸>> When something is masculine, it is a quality or thing related to men. >> Agar biror narsa masculine bo'lsa, unda erkaklarga aloqador sifat yoki narsa bo'ladi. 

— American football is usually considered a masculine sport.
— Amerika futboli asosan erkaklar sporti hisoblanadi.

confer [kənˈfəːr] v. — maslahatlashmoq
🔸>> To confer with someone means to discuss something with them to make a decision. >> Birortasi bilan confer qilish, qaror qilish uchun biror narsani u bilan muhokama qilishni anglatadi. 

— I will have to confer with my wife before I can purchase a new car.
— Yangi mashina sotib olishimdan oldin xotinim bilan maslahatlashishim kerak.

anthropology [ænθrəˈpɒlədʒi] n. — antropologiya 
🔸>> Anthropology is the study of people, society, and culture. >> Anthropology bu odamlar, jamiyat va madaniyatni o'rganadigan fan. 

— In anthropology class, I learned about simple tools that ancient cultures used.
— Anrtopologiya darsida men qadimgi madaniyatlarda ishlatilgan oddiy qurol-aslahalarni o'rgandim.

competence [kɒmpətəns] n. — mahorat, iste'dod
🔸>> Competence is the ability to do something well or effectively. >> Competence bu biror narsani yaxshi yoki effektiv bajarish qobiliyatidir.

— The job was easy because the group had enough competence to do it well.
— Ish oson edi, chunki guruh buni yaxshi bajarish uchun yetarli malakaga ega edi.

appoint [əˈpɔint] v. — tayinlamoq
🔸>> To appoint someone to a job means to give the job to them. >> Birortasini biror ishga appoint qilish, unga o'sha ishni berishni anglatadi. 

— Two students were appointed to help the scientists with their research.
— Ikki talaba olimlarga tadqiqotida yordam berish uchun tayinlandi.
Unit 13:
ornament [ɔːrnəmənt] n. — bezak, naqsh 
🔸>> An ornament is an attractive object that people display in their homes. >> An ornament bu odamlar o‘z uylarida ko‘rsatadigan jozibali buyumdir.

— The woman kept some colorful ornaments on the shelves.
— Ayol javonlarda bir nechta rang-barang bezaklarni saqlab turardi.

considerate [kənˈsidərit] adj. — o'zgalarga e'tiborli, jonkuyar
🔸>> When someone is considerate, they pay attention to the needs of others. >> Agar birortasi considerate bo'lsa, u boshqalarning ehtiyojlariga e'tibor qaratadi.

— The considerate boy gave a present to his girlfriend on Valentine’s Day.
— Jonkuyar bola sevishganlar kunida sevgilisiga sovg'a berdi.

facility [fəˈsiləti] n. — muassasa
🔸>> A facility is a building that exists for a particular purpose. >> A facility ma'lum maqsad uchun mavjud bo'lgan bino.

— There are many educational facilities in big cities.
— Katta shaharlarda ko'plab ta'lim muassasalar bo'ladi.

sanctuary [sӕŋktʃuəri] n. — boshpana, pana
🔸>> A sanctuary is a place where people in danger can go to be safe. >> A sanctuary bu xavf ostidagi odamlar xavfsiz bo'lish uchun boradigan joy.

— The church was made into a sanctuary for homeless people in the winter.
— Cherkov qishda uysizlar uchun boshpanaga aylantirildi.

degrade [diˈgreid] v. — kamsitmoq, yerga urmoq
🔸>> To degrade someone means to cause people to have shame. >> Birortasini degrade qilish, uning uyalishiga sabab bo'lishni anglatadi. 

— The teacher degraded Bob when she announced his poor performance to the class.
— Oʻqituvchi Bobning darsga yomon qatnashishini sinfga eʼlon qilganida, uning qadr-qimmatini kamsitdi.

external [ikˈstəːrnəl] adj. — tashqi, tashqaridagi
🔸>> When something is external, it is connected to an outer part. >> Agar biror narsa external bo'lsa, u tashqi qism bilan aloqador bo'ladi. 

— It is warm inside my house, but the external temperature is freezing.
— Uyimning ichi issiq, lekin tashqi harorat juda sovuq.

consumption [kənˈsʌmpʃən] n. — iste'mol 
🔸>> The consumption of food or drink is the act of eating or drinking it. >> Taom yoki ichimlik consumption'i bu ularni yeyish yoki ichish harakatidir.

— These apples are too rotten for consumption.
— Bu olma iste'mol qilish uchun juda chirigan.

heap [hiːp] n. — to'plam, uyum
🔸>> A heap of things is a large pile of them. >> Narsalarning heap'i ularning katta uyumidir.

— After the building was torn down, all that was left was a heap of bricks.
— Bino buzib tashlanganidan keyin bir uyum g‘isht qolgan xolos.

pedestrian [pəˈdestriən] n. — piyoda
🔸>> A pedestrian is a person who is walking on a street. >> A pedestrian bu ko'chada yurib ketayotgan odamdir.

— Cars should be careful when pedestrians are walking around.
— Mashinalar atrofda piyodalar yurayotganda ehtiyot bo'lishi kerak.

impersonal [imˈpəːrsənəl] adj. — jozibasiz, ko'rksiz
🔸>> If something is impersonal, it is not friendly and makes people feel unimportant. >> Agar biror narsa impersonal bo'lsa, u do'stona emas va odamlarni ahamiyatsiz his qildiradi.

— The boy felt scared on his first day at the big, impersonal high school.
— Haligi bola katta, jozibasiz o'rta maktabdagi birinchi kunida qo'rquvni his qildi.

brook [bruk] n. — soy, anhor
🔸>> A brook is a small stream. >> A brook bu kichik daryo hisoblanadi.

— Water flows down several brooks on the mountain.
— Tog'dagi bir nechta ariqlardan suv quyiladi.

escort [eskɔːrt] v. — qo'riqlab bormoq
🔸>> To escort people means to safely accompany them to a place. >> Odamlarni escort qilish, ularni biror joyga xavfsiz kuzatib borish demakdir.

— Her bodyguards escorted her to the movie theater.
— Uning tan soqchilari uni kinoteatrgacha qo'riqlab borishdi.

faculty [fӕkəlti] n. — qobiliyat, iste'dod 
🔸>> A faculty is a mental or physical ability. >> A faculty bu aqliy yoki jismoniy qobiliyatdir.

— The boy’s mental faculties impressed all of his teachers.
— Haligi bolaning aqliy qobiliyati uning barcha o'qituvchilarini hayron qoldirdi.

criteria [kraiˈtiəriə] n. — mezon, kriteriya
🔸>> Criteria are factors on which a person judges or decides something. >>

— Before she got the job, she had to meet all the necessary criteria.
— Ishga kirishdan oldin u barcha kerakli mezonlarga javob berishi kerak edi.

entitle [enˈtaitl] v. — huquq bermoq
🔸>> To entitle someone means to give them the rights to have or do something. >> Birortasini entitle qilish, unga biror narsaga ega bo'lish yoki biror narsa qilishga huquq berishni anglatadi. 

— His golden ticket entitled him to sit in the front row at the concert.
— Uning oltin chiptasi unga konsertda oldingi qatorda o'tirishga huquq berdi.

hemisphere [hemisfiər] n. — yarimshar
🔸>> A hemisphere is one half of the earth. >> A hemisphere bu Yer sharining yarmi hisoblanadi. 

— In the northern hemisphere, the weather is usually warmest in July and August.
— Shimoliy yarim sharda ob-havo odatda iyul va avgust oylarida eng issiq bo'ladi.

crust [krʌst] n. — nonning sirti
🔸>> Crust is the tough outer part of a loaf of bread. >> Crust bu buxanka nonning qattiq ustki qismi.

— The little boy never ate the crust of his pizza.
— Kichkina bola hech qachon pitssaning ustki qismini yemagan.

hound [haund] n. — tozi it
🔸>> A hound is a type of dog that is often used for racing or hunting. >> A hound bu odatda poyga yoki ov uchun boqiladigan it zoti.

— The men took their hounds with them when they went on the hunting trip.
— Haligi erkaklar ovga chiqqanda tozi itlarini o'zlari bilan olib ketishdi.

cater [keitər] v. — ta'minlamoq, yetkazib bermoq
🔸>> To cater to someone means to provide them with all the things needed or wanted. >> Birortasini cater qilish, uni barcha istagan yoki kerak bo'lgan narsalar bilan ta'minlashni anglatadi. 

— Bill was too sick to get out of bed, so his nurse catered to his needs.
— Bill juda kasal edi, yotoqdan turolmadi, shuning uchun hamshira uning ehtiyojlarini ta'minladi.

spectator [spekˈteitə:r] n. — tomoshabin
🔸>> A spectator is someone who watches something, especially a sports event. >> A spectator bu biror narsa, asosan sport o'yinlarini tomosha qiluvchi shaxs.

— There were thousands of spectators at the big game.
— Katta o'yinda minglab tomoshabinlar bor edi.
Unit 14:
imprint [imˈprint] n. — unutilmas ta'sir 
🔸>> An imprint is an effect or lesson from an experience that is hard to forget. >> An imprint bu unutish qiyin boʻlgan tajribadan olingan effekt yoki saboqdir.

— The experience ofwarleftan imprint on his mind that troubled him.
— Urushdan keyingi tajriba uning ongiga muhrlanib, uni bezovta qildi.

disprove [disˈpruːv] v. — rad qilmoq, noto'g'riligini isbotlamoq
🔸>> To disprove something means to show that it is not true. >> Biror narsani disprove qilish, u noto'g'ri ekanligini ko'rsatishni anglatadi. 

— The scientist disproved the theory that the sun moved around the Earth.
— Olim Quyoshning Yer atrofida harakatlanishi haqidagi nazariyani inkor etdi.

Renaissance [reˈnəsɑːns] n. — XIV - XVII asrlar, Renessans 
🔸>> The Renaissance was a period between the 14th and 17th centuries. >> The Renaissance 14- va 17-asrlar o'rasidagi davr bo'lgan.

— Leonardo Da Vinci was a popular artist of the Renaissance.
— Leonardo Da Vinchi Renessans davrining mashxur rassomi bo'lgan.

rack [ræk] n. — tokcha 
🔸>> A rack is an object with shelves that holds things. >> A rack bu narsalarni ushlab turadigan javonli buyum.

— He stored his tools on a rack.
— U uskunalarini tokchada saqlar edi.

premise [premis] n. — g'oya, tub mohiyat
🔸>> A premise is an idea on which something is based. >> A premise bu biror narsaga asoslangan g'oya.

— The premise of the movie that Bobbi and I watched was unrealistic.
— Bobbi va men tomosha qilgan filmning asosiy mazmuni real emas edi.

revere [riviə:r] v. — e'zozlamoq, qadrlamoq
🔸>> To revere something is to admire it greatly. >> Biror narsani revere qilish, uni yaxshilab qadrlash hisoblanadi. 

— The students revere their teacher, who has taught them a lot.
— Talabalar ularga ko'p narsalarni o'rgatgan o'qituvchilarini e'zozlashadi.

simultaneous [saiməlˈteiniəs] adj. — bir vaqtda, sinxron 
🔸>> When something is simultaneous, it occurs at the same time as something else. >> Agar biror narsa simultaneous bo'lsa, u boshqa biror narsa bilan bir vaqtda sodir bo'ladi. 

— The movement of the gears inside the watch was simultaneous.
— Soat ichidagi viteslarning harakati sinxron sodir bo'ldi.

specify [spesəfai] v. — aniq ifoda etmoq, tasvirlamoq 
🔸>> To specify is to describe something clearly. >> To specify biror narsani aniq tasvirlash degani.

— The poster didn’t specify where the concert was taking place.
— Plakatda kontsert qayerda boʻlayotganiga aniqlik kiritilmagan.

hypothesis [haiˈpɒθəsis] n. — gipoteza
🔸>> A hypothesis is an idea for something that has not been proved yet. >> A hypothesis bu biror narsa haqidagi hali isbotlanmagan g'oya.

— The teacher did an experiment to prove whether his hypothesis was right.
— O'qituvchi o'z gipotezasi to'g'ri yoki yo'qligini isbotlash uchun tajriba o'tkazdi.

Braille [breil] n. — Brayl yozuvi 
🔸>> Braille is a system of raised patterns on paper that allows the blind to read. >> Braille bu qog‘ozdagi baland naqshlar tizimi bo‘lib, u ko‘zi ojizlarga o‘qish imkonini beradi.

— The boy enjoyed reading his favorite books written in Braille.
— Bola Brayl alifbosida yozilgan sevimli kitoblarini o'qishni yoqtirardi.

aspect [æspekt] n. — tomon, jihat
🔸>> An aspect is one part or feature of something. >> An aspect bu biror narsaning bir qismi yoki jihati.

— I thought about the different aspects of owning two dogs.
— Men ikkita itga ega bo'lishning turli jihatlari haqida o'yladim.

spatial [speiʃəl] adj. — fazoga oid 
🔸>> When something is spatial, it relates to the position and size of things. >> Agar biror narsa spatial bo'lsa, u narsalarning hajmi va joylashuvi bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— He was asked where the books were located to test his spatial ability.
— Uning fazoviy qobiliyatini sinab ko'rish uchun undan kitoblar qayerda joylashganligi so'raldi.

coordinate [kouˈɔːrdəneit] v. — o'zaro moslashmoq, uyg'unlashtirmoq
🔸>> To coordinate things is to make different parts work together. >> Narsalarni coordinate qilish, turli qismlarni birgalikda ishlatishni anglatadi.

— Each skating team had to coordinate their movements for the show.
— Har bir konkida uchish jamoasi shou uchun harakatlarini uyg'unlashtirishi kerak edi.

informative [inˈfɔːrmətiv] adj. — informatsion, axborot beradigan
🔸>> When something is informative, it provides a lot of information. >> Agar biror narsa informative bo'lsa, u ko'plab axborotlar bilan ta'minlaydi.

— The travel guide had a lot of informative facts about the region.
— Sayohat qo'llanmasida mintaqa haqida juda ko'p ma'lumot beruvchi faktlar mavjud edi.

humanitarian [hjuːˌmænəˈtɛəriən] adj. — gumanitar
🔸>> If something is humanitarian, it is connected to helping people’s lives. >> Agar biror narsa humanitarian bo'lsa, u odamlar hayotiga yordam berish bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— After the flood, several humanitarian organizations offered help.
— Toshqindan so'ng bir nechta gumanitar tashkilotlar yordam taklif qilishdi.

bud [bʌd] n. — g'uncha, kurtak
🔸>> A bud is a part of a plant that turns into a flower or a leaf. >> A bud gul yoki bargga aylanadigan o'simlik qismi.

— Two weeks after planting the seed, a small bud appeared.
— Urug'ni ekishdan ikki hafta o'tgach, kichik kurtak paydo bo'ldi.

skeptic [skeptik] n. — shubhalanuvchi shaxs 
🔸>> A skeptic is a person who does not believe something. >> A skeptic bu biror narsaga ishonmaydigan shaxs.

— The scientist showed the skeptic that dinosaurs did exist by providing evidence.
— Olim skeptiklarga dinozavrlarning haqiqatan ham borligiga dalil keltirish orqali ko‘rsatdi.

asset [æset] n. — foydali qobiliyat 
🔸>> An asset is a skill or quality that is useful or valuable. >> An asset bu foydali yoki qimmatli bo'lgan malaka yoki qobiliyat. 

— The coach realized the boy’s speed was an asset to the team.
— Murabbiy bolaning tezligi jamoa uchun foydali ekanini tushundi.

optic [ɒptik] adj. — optik
🔸>> When something is optic, it relates to the eyes or light. >> Agar biror narsa optic bo'lsa, u ko'zlar yoki yorug'lik bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— Her blindness was caused by a problem with her optic nerve.
— Uning ko'zi ojizligiga optik nervidagi muammo sabab bo'lgan.

wax [wæks] n. — mum, parafin 
🔸>> Wax is a substance that is slightly shiny and melts when heated. >> Wax bu biroz yaltiroq va isitganda eriydigan modda.

— The candles are made of wax.
— Shamlar mumdan qilingan.
Unit 15:
accessory [ækˈsesəri] n. — aksessuar 
🔸>> An accessory is a thing that is added to another thing to make it look better. >> An accessory bu boshqa biror narsani yaxshiroq ko'rsatish uchun unga qo'shiladigan narsa.

— The store sold colorful accessories like bags, sunglasses, and makeup.
— Do'konda sumkalar, quyoshdan saqlaydigan ko'zoynaklar va bo'yanish kabi rangli aksessuarlar sotilgan.

saturated [sætʃəreitid] adj. — shalabbo, xo'l
🔸>> If something is saturated, it is completely wet. >> Agar biror narsa saturated bo'lsa, u butkul xo'l bo'ladi. 

— Leigh’s hair became saturated in the rain storm.
— Leyning sochlari yomg‘irdan nam bo'lgan edi.

naval [neivəl] adj. — harbiy-dengiz
🔸>> When something is naval, it relates to a country’s navy or military ships. >> Agar biror narsa naval bo'lsa, u biror mamlakatning harbiy dengiz floti bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— The country sent all of its naval forces to protect them.
— Mamlakat ularni himoya qilish uchun barcha dengiz kuchlarini yubordi.

inflate [inˈfleit] v. — havo bilan shishirmoq
🔸>> To inflate something means to fill it up with air. >> Biror narsani inflate qilish, uni havo bilan shishirishni anglatadi. 

— I helped him inflate the balloons.
— Men unga sharlarni shishirishiga yordam berdim.

adequate [ædikwit] adj. — talabga javob beradigan
🔸>> When something is adequate, it is good enough for something else. >> Agar biror narsa adequate bo'lsa, u boshqa biror narsa uchun yetarlicha yaxshi bo'ladi. 

— Without adequate notice of the road block, they will have to turn around.
— Yo‘l to‘sig‘i haqida yetarlicha ogohlantirilmasa, ular burilishga majbur bo‘ladi.

facilitate [fəˈsiləteit] v. — osonlashtirmoq
🔸>> To facilitate something is to make it easier. >> Biror narsani facilitate qilish, bu uni osonroq qilish degani.

— To facilitate the meeting, Melissa used a simple computer program.
— Uchrashuvni osonlashtirish uchun Melissa oddiy kompyuter dasturidan foydalandi.

nausea [nɔːziə] n. — ko'ngil aynish
🔸>> Nausea is the feeling of being sick to your stomach. >> Nausea bu qorningiz kasal bo'lishi tuyg'usi. 

— The doctor said the medicine would help get rid of her nausea.
— Shifokorning aytishicha, dori uning ko'ngil aynishidan xalos bo'lishga yordam beradi.

innate [iˈneit] adj. — tug'ma
🔸>> When something is innate, it is something that one is born with, it is not learned. >> Agar biror narsa innate bo'lsa, u o'sha narsa bilan tug'ilgan bo'ladi, u o'rganilmaydi. 

— He had the innate desire to please his teachers.
— U o'z ustozlarini rozi qilish istagida edi.

fleet [fliːt] n. — flot
🔸>> A fleet is a group of ships. >> A fleet bu kemalar guruhi.

— The fleet of ships spent a few days at the dock.
— Kemalar floti bir necha kunni dokda o'tkazdi.

marble [mɑːrbəl] n. — marmar 
🔸>> Marble is a type of rock that feels cold and is smooth when cut. >> Marble togʻ jinsi boʻlib, u sovuq va kesilganda silliq boʻladi.

— The large house had floors made of marble.
— Katta uyning pollari marmardan yasalgan edi.

mast [mæst] n. — ustun, machta
🔸>> A mast is a long pole on a ship that holds the sail. >> A mast kemadagi yelkanni ushlab turadigan uzun ustundir.

— The mast held both sails of the ship upright.
— Ustun kemaning ikkala yelkanini tik holda ushlab turardi.

infer [inˈfəːr] v. — xulosa qilmoq
🔸>> To infer something is to decide it is true based on other information one has. >> Biror narsani infer qilish, boshqa maʼlumotlarga asoslanib, uning toʻgʻriligini aniqlashdir.

— By the position of the sun in the sky, she inferred that it was noon.
— Quyoshning osmondagi holatiga ko'ra, u kunduzi ekanligini aniqladi.

pouch [pautʃ] n. — xalta
🔸>> A pouch is a small, flexible bag that is usually made of cloth. >> A pouch bu odatda matodan yasaladigan kichkina, egiluvchan qop.

— I keep my money in a small pouch.
— Men pulimni kichik sumkada saqlayman.

acquisition [ækwəziʃən] n. — sotib olingan buyum, olingan narsa
🔸>> An acquisition is something that a person buys or gets in some way. >> An acquisition bu biror shaxs sotib oladigan yoki boshqa yo'l bilan qo'lga kiritadigan narsa.

— Marty was happy with his new acquisition: a very fast bicycle.
— Marti o'zining yangi xarididan xursand edi: juda tez velosiped.

cardboard [kɑːrdbɔːrd] n. — karton 
🔸>> Cardboard is a material made out of stiff paper. It is often used to make boxes. >> Cardboard bu qattiq qog'ozdan qilinadigan material. U odatda qutilar, korobkalar yasash uchun foydalaniladi.

— We packed our things into cardboard boxes and moved to our new home.
— Biz narsalarimizni karton qutilarga solib, yangi uyimizga ko'chib o'tdik.

elaborate [iˈlæbərit] adj. — mufassal
🔸>> When something is elaborate, it contains a lot of details. >> Agar biror narsa elaborate bo'lsa, u ko'plab detallardan tashkil topgan bo'ladi. 

— She gave the teacher an elaborate explanation of her project.
— U o'qituvchiga o'z loyihasini batafsil tushuntirib berdi.

update [ʌpˈdeit] n. — zamonaviylashtirish
🔸>> An update is an act of making something more modern. >> An update bu biror narsani yana ham zamonaviy qilish harakati.

— I’m doing an update on my personal phone directory.
— Men shaxsiy telefon katalogimni yangilayapman.

dilemma [diˈlemə] n. — dilemma
🔸>> A dilemma is a difficult situation in which a choice has to be made. >> A dilemma - bu tanlov qilish kerak bo'lgan qiyin vaziyat.

— Choosing either the tastier or healthier drink proved to be quite a dilemma.
— Mazali yoki foydali ichimlikni tanlash juda qiyin bo'ldi.

import [impɔːrt] v. — import qilmoq
🔸>> To import means to bring in a product from another country. >> To import bu boshqa davlatdan maxsulotni olib kelishni anglatadi. 

— Foods that have been imported are usually more expensive.
— Import qilingan oziq-ovqat odatda qimmatroq bo'ladi.

grid [grid] n. — koordinatalar, katakcha
🔸>> A grid is a pattern of squares with numbers and letters to find places on a map. >> A grid bu xaritadagi joylarni topish uchun raqamlar va harflardan iborat kvadratchalar naqshidir.

— We located our town using the grid.
— Biz shaharchamizni koordinatalar orqali aniqladik.
Unit 16:
estate [isˈteit] n. — hudud
🔸>> An estate is a large area of land owned by a family or organization. >> An estate bu oila yoki tashkilotga tegishli boʻlgan katta yer maydonidir.

— He lived on his father’s estate in the country.
— U otasining mamlakatdagi mulkida yashagan.

chaotic [keiˈɒtik] adj. — tartibsiz, chalkash
🔸>> When something is chaotic, it is crazy, confused, and hectic. >> Agar biror narsa chaotic bo'lsa, u aqldan ozgan, chalkash va notinch bo'ladi.

— The first day of school can be chaotic for a new student.
— Maktabning birinchi kuni yangi o'quvchi uchun chalkash bo'lishi mumkin.

outlook [autluk] n. — munosabat, qarash
🔸>> An outlook is a person’s opinion or way of thinking about something. >> An outlook bu biror narsa haqida odamning fikri yoki fikrlash tarzidir.

— He changed his outlook about rats after he read a book about them.
— U kalamushlar haqidagi kitobni o‘qiganidan keyin ular haqidagi qarashlarini o‘zgartirdi.

budget [bʌdʒit] n. — xarajat, byudjet 
🔸>> A budget is the amount of money available to spend on something. >> A budget bu biror narsa uchun sarflaydigan mavjud pul miqdori.

— His budget for food was very tight.
— Uning oziq-ovqat uchun byudjeti juda qat'iy edi.

courtyard [kɔːrtjɑːrd] n. — hovli
🔸>> A courtyard is an outdoor area that is surrounded by the walls of a building. >> A courtyard bu binoning devorlari bilan oʻralgan tashqi maydon.

— During the summer, the courtyard is a nice place to have lunch.
— Yozda hovli tushlik qilish uchun yaxshi joy.

hydrogen [haidrədʒən] n. — vodorod
🔸>> Hydrogen is a gas that has no taste, color, or smell. >> Hydrogen bu hidi, rangi yoki ta'mi yo'q bo'lgan gaz.

— Balloons filled with hydrogen can easily float away if you aren’t careful.
— Ehtiyot bo'lmasangiz, vodorod bilan to'ldirilgan sharlar osongina suzib ketishi mumkin.

restrict [risˈtrikt] v. — cheklamoq
🔸>> To restrict is to limit something and prevent it from getting bigger. >> To restrict bu biror narsani cheklash va kattaroq bo'lib ketishini oldini olishdir.

— The club restricted the amount of members.
— Klub aʼzolar sonini cheklab qoʻydi.

refine [riˈfain] v. — takomillashtirmoq
🔸>> To refine something is to make it better by making changes. >> Biror narsani refine qilish, o'zgarishlar qilish orqali uni yaxshiroq qilishni anglatadi. 

— The principal refined his method of controlling students over the years.
— Direktor yillar davomida talabalarni nazorat qilish uslubini takomillashtirdi.

fraud [frɔːd] n. — firibgarlik, tovlamachilik
🔸>> Fraud is the crime of gaining money by lying or by tricking people. >> Fraud bu odamlarni aldash yoki chalg'itish orqali pul olish jinoyati.

— Experts say that credit card fraud increases around the holidays.
— Mutaxassislarning ta'kidlashicha, bayram kunlari kredit kartalaridagi firibgarlik ko'payadi.

correspond [kɔ:rəsˈpɒnd] v. — mos kelmoq, muvofiq kelmoq
🔸>> To correspond is to match or to be similar to something. >> To correspond biror narsaga mos yoki oʻxshash boʻlish demakdir.

— The boy’s story didn’t correspond with his mother’s version.
— Bolaning hikoyasi onasining versiyasiga mos kelmadi.

proponent [prəˈpounənt] n. — tarafdor
🔸>> A proponent is a person who supports an idea or a plan. >> A proponent bu biror g'oya yoki rejani qo'llab-quvvatlaydigan shaxs.

— He was a proponent of using environmentally friendly products.
— U ekologik toza mahsulotlardan foydalanish tarafdori edi.

archeological [ɑːrkiəˈlɒdʒikəl] adj. — arxeologik 
🔸>> When something is archeological, it relates to archeology. >> Agar biror narsa archeological bo'lsa, u arxeologiya bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— They found archeological evidence that proved an ancient species of man.
— Ular odamlarning qadimgi turini tasdiqlovchi arxeologik dalillarni topdilar.

knit [nit] v. — to'qimoq
🔸>> To knit is to make fabric by connecting strings together. >> To knit bu iplarni bir-biriga bog'lash orqali mato yasash.

— My grandmother knitted me a sweater.
— Buvim menga sviter to'qidi.

archeology [ɑːrkiˈɒlədʒi] n. — arxeologiya
🔸>> Archeology is the study of ancient people through their artifacts. >> Archeology bu qadimgi odamlarni ularning qoldiqlariga ko'ra o'rganish fani. 

— He studied archeology to learn more about ancient Egyptian culture.
— U Qadimgi Yunon madaniyati haqida ko'proq narsa o'rganish uchun arxeologiyani o'qidi.

integrity [inˈtegrəti] n. — rostgo'ylik
🔸>> Integrity is honesty and good morals. >> Integrity bu halollik va yaxshi axloqdir.

— The principal had a lot of integrity.
— Direktor juda rostgo'y edi.

addict [ædikt] n. — ishqiboz, shinavanda, bog'lanib qolgan
🔸>> An addict is a person who cannot stop doing or having something. >> An addict biror narsaga ega bo'lish yoki biror narsa qilishni to'xtata olmaydigan shaxs.

— She was a coffee addict. She had more than three cups each day.
— U qahvaxo'r edi. U har kuni uch stakandan ko'proq ichardi.

brainstorm [breinstɔːrm] v. — fikr yuritmoq, fikrlashmoq
🔸>> To brainstorm is to have a lot of ideas about a certain topic. >> To brainstorm bu ma'lum mavzu haqida ko'plab g'oyalarga ega bo'lish hisoblanadi. 

— The students met after school to brainstorm ideas for their assignment.
— Talabalar maktabdan so'ng o'z topshiriqlari bo'yicha fikr almashish uchun uchrashdilar.

parachute [pærəʃuːt] n. — parashut
🔸>> A parachute is a device that helps people and things fall to the ground safely. >> A parachute bu odamlar va narsalarga yerga xavfsiz qo'nishi uchun yordam beradigan qurilma.

— They used parachutes dropped from airplanes to send supplies to the civilians.
— Ular tinch aholiga yuk jo‘natish uchun samolyotlardan tushgan parashyutlardan foydalangan.

prehistoric [priːhisˈtɔ:rik] adj. — tarixdan ilgari, tarixgacha
🔸>> When something is prehistoric, it is from a time when there was no written history. >> Agar biror narsa prehistoric bo'lsa, u yozilgan tarix yo'q bo'lgan davrdan bo'ladi. 

— The scientists found prehistoric pots used by the people in the area.
— Olimlar ushbu hududda odamlar ishlatgan tarixdan oldingi idishlarni topdilar.

cite [sait] v. — misol keltirmoq
🔸>> To cite something is to mention it as an example or as proof of something. >> Biror narsani cite qilish, uni biror narsaning isboti yoki misoli sifatida belgilash hisoblanadi. 

— She cited six reasons that the school needed to build new classrooms.
— U maktabning yangi o'quv xonalarini qurish uchun zarur bo'lgan oltita sababni keltirdi.
Unit 17:
suspicion [səsˈpiʃən] n. — shubha, gumon
🔸>> A suspicion is a feeling that something is possible or true in a crime. >> A suspicion bu jinoyatda biror narsaning mumkin yoki haqiqat ekanligini his qilish.

— The police had a suspicion that the driver had stolen the purse.
— Politsiya haydovchining hamyonni o'g'irlaganiga shubha qildi.

guardian [gɑːrdiən] n. — posbon, qo'riqchi
🔸>> A guardian is someone who protects somebody or something. >> A guardian bu birortasi yoki biror narsani himoya qiladigan shaxs.

— The librarians are the guardians of the books.
— Kutubxonachilar kitoblarning qo'riqchilaridir.

donor [dounər] n. — donor, xadya beruvchi
🔸>> A donor is somebody who gives something to an organization. >> A donor bu biror tashkilotga biror narsa beruvchi shaxs. 

— He was proud to be a blood donor.
— U qon donori ekanligidan faxrlanardi.

graduate [grædjueit] v. — bitirmoq, tamomlamoq
🔸>> To graduate from a school means to complete and pass all courses of study there. >> Maktabni graduate qilish, u yerda barcha o‘qish kurslarini tamomlash va tugatish demakdir.

— At the end of the spring, my friends and I will graduate from high school.
— Bahor oxirida men va do‘stlarim maktabni bitiramiz.

terminate [təːrməneit] v. — yakunlamoq, to'xtatmoq
🔸>> To terminate something means to stop or end it. >> Biror narsani terminate qilish, uni to'xtatish yoki tugatishni anglatadi. 

— The trip was terminated after the car broke down.
— Sayohat mashina buzilganidan keyin toʻxtatildi.

graffiti [grəˈfiːti:] n. — devoriy yozuv/rasm
🔸>> Graffiti is words or drawings in public places. >> Graffiti bu jamoat joylaridagi soʻzlar yoki chizmalardir.

— The wall was covered with colorful graffiti.
— Devor rang-barang graffiti bilan qoplangan.

sever [sevə:r] v. — kesmoq, qirqmoq
🔸>> To sever something is to cut through it completely. >> Biror narsani sever qilish, uni butunlay kesish hisoblanadi. 

— He severed the string using scissors.
— U qaychi yordamida ipni uzdi.

kin [kin] n. — oila a'zolar; urug'-aymoqlar
🔸>> Kin is a person’s family and relatives. >> Kin bu biror shaxsning oilasi va qarindoshlari.

— His kin were all farmers.
— Uning barcha qarindoshlari dehqon edi.

tuition [tju:iʃən] n. — ta'lim narxi
🔸>> Tuition is the amount of money paid to go to a school. >> Tuition bu maktabga borish uchun to'lanadigan pul miqdori.

— University tuitions have increased by fifty percent in the last five years.
— Soʻnggi besh yil ichida universitetlarda oʻqish toʻlovlari ellik foizga oshdi.

gossip [gɒsip] n. — g'iybat, ig'vo
🔸>> Gossip is information that might be untrue but is still discussed anyway. >> Gossip bu noto'g'ri bo'lishi mumkin bo'lgan, lekin bari bir muhokama qilinadigan axborot.

— The friends exchanged gossip about the people they knew in school.
— Do'stlar maktabda tanish bo'lgan odamlar haqida g'iybat qilishdi.

stab [stæb] v. — sanchmoq, suqmoq
🔸>> To stab means to cut someone or something with a sharp object like a knife. >> To stab pichoq kabi o'tkir narsa bilan birortasi yoki biror narsani kesishni anglatadi. 

— He stabbed the fork into the potato and passed it to his daughter.
— U vilkani kartoshkaga sanchib, qiziga uzatdi.

stimulus [stimjələs] n. — stimul, turtki
🔸>> A stimulus is something that causes growth or activity. >> A stimulus bu o'sish yoki harakatga sabab bo'ladigan narsa.

— Having a lot of money is a stimulus for people to buy more things.
— Ko'p pulga ega bo'lish odamlarni ko'proq narsalarni sotib olishga undaydi.

implicate [impləkeit] v. — jalb qilmoq, aralashtirmoq
🔸>> To implicate someone is to show that they have done a crime or something bad. >> Birortasini implicate qilish, u biror jinoyat yoki biror yomon ish qilishini ko'rsatish.

— The man was implicated in the theft at the store.
— Erkak do‘kondagi o‘g‘irlikda ishtirok etgan.

referee [refəˈriː] n. — hakam
🔸>> A referee is a person who makes sure that the rules are followed in sports. >> A referee bu sportda qoidalarga rioya qilinishini nazorat qiluvchi shaxs.

— The soccer player didn’t agree with the referee.
— Futbolchi hakamning fikriga qo'shilmadi.

shaft [ʃæft] n. — dasta, sop, tutqich
🔸>> A shaft is a handle of a tool or weapon. >> A shaft bu biror uskuna yoki qurolning dastasi.

— The golf club had a long wooden shaft that he held in his hands.
— Golf klubida uning qo'lida ushlab turgan uzun yog'och mil bor edi.

attorney [əˈtəːrni] n. — advokat, huquqshunos
🔸>> An attorney is one who gives others advice about the law. >> An attorney bu boshqalarga qonun haqida maslahat beradigan shaxs.

— The attorney appeared in front of the judge for me.
— Men uchun advokat sudyaning qarshisiga chiqdi.

theme [θiːm] n. — mavzu
🔸>> A theme is the main subject of a book, movie, or painting. >> A theme bu kitob, kino yoki rasmning asosiy mavzusi.

— The students discussed the book’s theme in class.
— Talabalar darsda kitob mavzusini muhokama qildilar.

fellow [felou] n. — o'rtoq, birodar
🔸>> A fellow is someone who shares a job or quality with someone else. >> A fellow bu biror ish yoki sifatni birorta boshqa shaxs bilan bo'lishadigan shaxs.

— All of my fellow patients at the hospital have also complained about the food.
— Kasalxonadagi barcha bemorlarim ham ovqatdan shikoyat qilishgan.

discipline [disəplin] n. — tartib-intizom
🔸>> Discipline is training that helps people follow the rules. >> Discipline bu odamlar qoidalarga rioya qilishiga ko'maklashuvchi tartib.

— One of the teacher’s jobs is to teach her students discipline.
— O‘qituvchining vazifalaridan biri o‘quvchilariga intizomni o‘rgatishdir.

chronic [krɒnik] adj. — xronik, surunkali 
🔸>> When something is chronic, it happens over and over again over time. >> Agar biror narsa chronic bo'lsa, u vaqt o'tishi bilan yana va yana sodir bo'ladi. 

— He had chronic pain in his chest and needed to see a doctor.
— Uning ko'kragida surunkali og'riq bor edi va shifokorga murojaat qilish kerak edi.
Unit 18:
auditorium [ɔːdiˈtɔːriəm] n. — auditoriya 
🔸>> An auditorium is a large building used for public events. >> An auditorium bu jamoaviy voqealar uchun ishlatiladigan katta bino.

— People have gathered at the school auditorium to watch the play.
— Xalq spektaklni tomosha qilish uchun maktab auditoriyasiga yig‘ilgan.

dumb [dʌm] adj. — soqov
🔸>> If someone is dumb, they are unable to speak. >> Agar birortasi dumb bo'lsa, u gapira olmaydi.

— She did not share the secret. She remained silent as if she were dumb.
— U sirni ayta ko'rmadi. U xuddi soqovday jim qoldi.

aggressive [əˈgresiv] adj. — tajovuzkor
🔸>> If someone is aggressive, then they constantly want to fight. >> Agar biror narsa aggressive bo'lsa, u doimiy ravishda urushishni xohlaydi.

— Nobody liked to play games with him because he was always too aggressive.
— Hech kim u bilan o'yin o'ynashni yoqtirmasdi, chunki u har doim juda tajovuzkor edi.

captive [kæptiv] n. — mahbus
🔸>> A captive is a prisoner. >> A captive bu mahbusdir.

— The guards told the captive that there was no way he could escape the prison.
— Soqchilar asirga qamoqxonadan qochib qutulib qolishning iloji yo‘qligini aytishdi.

reign [rein] n. — hukmronlik davri
🔸>> A reign is the period of time in which a ruler rules. >> A reign bu biror boshqaruvchi boshqaradigan vaqt davri.

— The emperor’s reign lasted for only two years.
— Imperator hukmronligi atigi ikki yil davom etdi.

foe [fou] n. — dushman, g'anim
🔸>> A foe is an enemy or opponent. >> A foe bu dushman yoki raqib.

— It was hard to believe that anyone could be his foe.
— Kimdir uning dushmani bo'lishi mumkinligiga ishonish qiyin edi.

combat [kɒmbæt] n. — jang, olishuv
🔸>> Combat is fighting between two people or groups. >> Combat bu ikki inson yoki guruh o'rtasidagi jang.

— The two warriors were locked in combat.
— Ikki jangchi jangda qulflangan edi.

realm [relm] n. — soha, sfera 
🔸>> A realm is any area of activity or interest. >> A realm bu mashg'ulot yoki qiziqishning har qanday sohasi. 

— He was not very active in the realm of business.
— U biznes sohasida unchalik faol emas edi.

provoke [prəˈvouk] v. — g'ashiga tegmoq, qonini qaynatmoq
🔸>> To provoke someone means to annoy them on purpose to cause violence. >> Birortasini provoke qilish, zo'ravonlik qilish uchun uni ataylab bezovta qilishni anglatadi. 

— The older boy provoked Paul by calling him mean names.
— Kattaroq bola Polni yomon ismlar bilan chaqirib, g'azablantirdi.

nick [nik] v. — xiyol kesmoq
🔸>> To nick someone means to cut them slightly with a sharp object. >> Birortasini nick qilish, uni o'tkir narsa bilan biroz kesishni anglatadi. 

— While cutting the carrots, the cook nicked his finger with the edge of his knife.
— Sabzini kesayotganda oshpaz pichoqning uchi bilan barmog'ini biroz kesdi.

sacred [seikrid] adj. — ilohiy, muqaddas
🔸>> If something is sacred, then it is worshipped and respected. >> Agar biror narsa sacred bo'lsa, unga sigʻiniladi va hurmat qilinadi.

— One religion in India will not harm cows because it believes that they are sacred.
— Hindistondagi bir din sigirlarga zarar etkazmaydi, chunki u ularni muqaddas deb biladi.

compound [kɒmpaund] n. — atrofi o'ralgan hudud
🔸>> A compound is an enclosed area such as a prison or factory. >> A compound bu qamoqxona yoki zavodga o'xshash atrofi o'ralgan hudud. 

— The workers waited outside the compound for the gates to the factory to open.
— Ishchilar majmua tashqarisida zavod darvozalari ochilishini kutishdi.

distract [disˈtrækt] v. — fikrini bo'lmoq
🔸>> To distract someone means to stop them from concentrating on something. >> Birortasini distract qilish, uning biror narsaga fikrini jamlashini bo'lishni anglatadi. 

— The phone call distracted him so much that he forgot all about his homework.
— Telefon qo‘ng‘irog‘i uni shunchalik chalg‘itib yubordiki, u uy vazifasini unutib qo‘ydi.

amnesty [ӕmnəsti] n. — amnitsiya
🔸>> Amnesty is a pardon given to prisoners of war. >> Amnesty bu urush maxbuslariga beriladigan avf.

— She was denied amnesty for her involvement in the war.
— U urushda qatnashgani uchun amnistiyadan rad etildi.

commonplace [kɒmənpleis] adj. — oddiy, odmi
🔸>> If something is commonplace, then it is ordinary. >> Agar biror narsa commonplace bo'lsa, u oddiy bo'ladi. 

— There is nothing commonplace about the way Morris dresses.
— Morrisning kiyinishida oddiy narsa yo'q.

arena [əˈriːnə] n. — arena
🔸>> An arena is a building where people can watch sports and concerts. >> An arena bu odamlar sport musobaqalari yoki konsertlarni tomosha qiladigan joy.

— The new arena was all set to hold the championship match.
— Yangi arena chempionlik o‘yinini o‘tkazishga tayyor edi.

meditate [medəteit] v. — chuqur o'ylamoq
🔸>> To meditate means to focus or think deeply in silence. >> To meditate sokinlikda diqqatni qaratish yoki chuqur o'ylashni anglatadi. 

— She liked to meditate for several hours of each day.
— U har kuni bir necha soat meditatsiya qilishni yaxshi ko'rardi.

rust [rʌst] n. — zang 
🔸>> Rust is a red and brown coating on iron objects caused by water and air. >> Rust bu suv va havo ta'sirida temir buyumlar ustidagi qizil va jigarrang qoplama.

— The old metal gate would not swing because the hinges were covered in rust.
— Eski temir darvoza tebranib qolmasdi, chunki ilmoqlar zang bilan qoplangan edi.

hack [hæk] v. — yormoq
🔸>> To hack something means to cut it into uneven pieces. >> Biror narsani hack qilish, uni notekis bo‘laklarga bo‘lish demakdir.

— My uncle used the ax to hack the tree into many logs.
— Tog‘am daraxtni ko‘plab mayda o'tinga yorish uchun boltadan foydalandi.

corps [kɔːr] n. — korpus, bo'linma
🔸>> A corps is a division of a military force. >> A corps bu harbiy kuchlar bo'linmasi. 

— The army had a corps of archers who trained apart from the regular soldiers.
— Armiyada oddiy askarlardan tashqari kamonchilar korpusi ham bor edi.
Unit 19:
buoy [buːi] n. — buy, baken
🔸>> A buoy is a floating sign that warns boats of dangerous areas. >> A buoy bu qayiqlarni xavfli hududlar haqida ogohlantiruvchi suzuvchi belgi.

— Don’t steer the boat near those buoys. There are rocks underneath the water.
— Qayiqni o'sha kemalar yonida boshqarmang. Suv ostida toshlar bor.

secondhand [sekəndˈhænd] adj. — ishlatilgan, ikkinchi qo'l
🔸>> When something is secondhand, it has been owned by someone else. >> Agar biror narsa secondhand bo'lsa, u boshqa birov tomonidan egalik qilingan bo'ladi.

— Her secondhand jeans were a bit faded in the front.
— Uning ikkinchi qoʻl jinsi shimining old tomoni biroz xiralashgan edi.

slot [slɒt] n. — teshikcha, tirqish
🔸>> A slot is a narrow opening in a machine or container. >> A slot bu mashina yoki idishdagi tor teshikdir.

— To operate the machine, put your coins into the slot.
— Mashinani ishlatish uchun tangalaringizni tirqishga soling.

context [kɒntekst] n. — kontekst
🔸>> Context is the situations that form the background of an event. >> Context bu hodisaning fonini tashkil etuvchi vaziyatlar.

— They studied the context of the battle before giving their presentation.
— Taqdimot qilishdan oldin ular jang kontekstini oʻrganishdi.

dock [dɒk] n. — dok
🔸>> A dock is an enclosed area where ships go to be loaded, unloaded, and repaired. >> A dock bu kemalar yuklash, tushirish va taʼmirlash uchun ketadigan yopiq joy.

— The huge ship pulled into the dock, and the crew unloaded the cargo.
— Ulkan kema dokga chiqdi va ekipaj yukni tushirdi.

distort [disˈtɔːrt] v. — noto'g'ri talqin qilmoq
🔸>> To distort something means to lie about it. >> Biror narsani distort qilish, u haqida aldashni anglatadi. 

— His lawyer distorted the facts so that he would be set free.
— Uning advokati ozod bo'lishi uchun faktlarni buzib ko'rsatdi.

catastrophe [kəˈtæstrəfi] n. — fojea, halokat
🔸>> A catastrophe is an unexpected event that causes great suffering or damage. >> A catastrophe bu ulkan ziyon va zararga sabab bo'luvchi kutilmagan voqea.

— It was a catastrophe for my family when my dad lost his job.
— Otam ishdan ayrilganida, bu mening oilam uchun halokat edi.

overlap [ouvərlæp] v. — qisman yopmoq/to'smoq
🔸>> To overlap something means to cover a piece of it. >> Biror narsani overlap qilish, uning bir qismini qoplashni anglatadi.

— The gift on top overlaps the other gift on the bottom.
— Tepadagi sovg'a pastki qismidagi boshqa sovg'ani to'sib turadi.

fore [fɔːr] n. — old taraf
🔸>> The fore of something is the front part of it. >> Biror narsaning fore qismi, bu uning old qismidir.

— The teacher’s desk is at the fore of the classroom.
— Oʻqituvchining stoli sinfning old tomonida.

frequent [friːkwənt] adj. — tez-tez, takror
🔸>> If something is frequent, then it happens or is done often. >> Agar biror narsa frequent bo'lsa, u tez-tez sodir bo'ladi yoki bajariladi.

— While Dad was sick, the doctor made frequent visits to his house.
— Dadam kasal bo'lganida, shifokor uning uyiga tez-tez tashrif buyurdi.

submerge [səbˈməːrdʒ] v. — suvga botirmoq, suv ichiga tiqmoq
🔸>> To submerge something means to put it below the surface of a liquid. >> Biror narsani submerge qilish, uni suyuqlik tubiga solishni anglatadi. 

— The whale submerged its huge body into the ocean.
— Kit ulkan tanasini okeanga botirdi.

accordingly [əˈkɔːrdiŋli] adv. — shunga muvofiq ravishda 
🔸>> If someone acts accordingly, they act in a way that is suitable. >> Agar birortasi accordingly harakat qilsa, u mos ravishda harakat qiladi.

— He feels like he did a good job, and his boss should pay him accordingly.
— U o'zini yaxshi ish qilgandek his qiladi va xo'jayini unga mos ravishda maosh to'lashi kerak.

anchor [æŋkər] n. — langar 
🔸>> An anchor is a heavy object dropped from a boat to make it stay in one place. >> An anchor bu kema bir joyda turishi uchun undan tashlanadigan og'ir buyum.

— When the ship reached its destination, the crew dropped the anchor.
— Kema belgilangan manzilga yetib borgach, ekipaj langarni tushirib yubordi.

precipitate [priˈsipəteit] v. — tezlashtirmoq
🔸>> To precipitate an event means to cause it to happen sooner than normal. >> Biror voqeani precipitate qilish, uni odatdagidan tezroq sodir qilishni anglatadi. 

— The violent attack precipitated an all-out war.
— Shiddatli hujum keng qamrovli urushga olib keldi.

grease [griːs] n. — solidol 
🔸>> Grease is an oily substance put on moving parts, so they work smoothly. >> Grease moyli modda bo'lib, harakatlanuvchi qismlarga surtiladi, shuning uchun ular muammosiz ishlaydi.

— When I was done working on the car, I had grease all over my hands.
— Mashina ustida ishlashni tugatganimdan keyin qoʻllarimga moy surtilgan edi.

offset [ɔ:fset] v. — o'rnini to'ldirmoq, o'rnini qoplamoq
🔸>> To offset means to use one thing to cancel out the effect of another thing. >> To offset bir narsadan boshqa narsaning taʼsirini bekor qilish uchun foydalanishni bildiradi.

— Increased wages are offset by higher prices for goods.
— Oshgan ish haqi tovarlar narxining oshishi bilan qoplanadi.

intricate [intrəkit] adj. — aji-buji, chalkash
🔸>> When something is intricate, it has many small parts or details. >> Agar biror narsa intricate bo'lsa, u ko'plab mayda qism va detallarga ega bo'ladi. 

— The intricate painting on the quilt was very lovely.
— Ko‘rpachadagi murakkab rasm juda yoqimli edi.

designate [dezigneit] v. — belgilamoq, deb tayinlamoq
🔸>> To designate someone or something means to give them a particular description. >> Birortasi yoki biror narsani designate qilish, unga muayyan tavsif berishni anglatadi.

— The famous lighthouse was designated a historical monument.
— Mashhur mayoq tarixiy yodgorlik sifatida belgilandi.

genuine [dʒenjuin] adj. — asl nusxadagi
🔸>> When something is genuine, it is true or real. >> Agar biror narsa genuine bo'lsa, u to'g'ri yoki haqiqiy bo'ladi. 

— After the painting was determined to be genuine, it sold for a million dollars.
— Rasm haqiqiy ekanligi aniqlangach, u million dollarga sotildi.

tactic [tæktik] n. — puxta reja, taktika
🔸>> A tactic is a careful plan to achieve something. >> A tactic bu biror narsaga erishish uchun puxta reja.

— Sam thought of a good tactic in order to attract more business.
— Sem ko'proq biznesni jalb qilish uchun yaxshi taktikani o'ylab topdi.
Unit 20:
viral [vaiərəl] adj. — virusli
🔸>> When something is viral, it is a disease or infection that is caused by a virus. >> Agar biror narsa viral bo'lsa, bu virus sabab boʻlgan kasallik yoki infektsiyadir.

— The girl was in bed fora week when she had a viral infection.
— Qiz virusli infeksiyaga chalinganida bir hafta davomida yotoqda yotibdi.

equivalent [iˈkwivələnt] n. — ekvivalent
🔸>> An equivalent is an amount or value that is the same as another amount or value. >> An equivalent bu boshqa miqdor yoki qiymat bilan bir xil boʻlgan miqdor yoki qiymatdir.

— I worked the equivalent of sixty hours this week.
— Men bu hafta oltmish soatga teng ishladim.

antibiotic [æntibaiˈɒtik] n. — antibiotik 
🔸>> An antibiotic is a medical drug used to kill bacteria and treat infections. >> An antibiotic bu bakteriya va infeksiyalarni o'ldirish uchun ishlatiladigan tibbiy dori.

— The doctor gave me a shot of an antibiotic when I got the flu.
— Grippga chalinganimda shifokor menga antibiotik berdi.

prevalent [prevələnt] adj. — keng tarqalgan
🔸>> When something is prevalent, it is common. >> Agar biror narsa prevalent bo'lsa, u keng tarqalgan bo'ladi. 

— Growing a beard is more prevalent behavior in men than women.
— Soqol o'stirish ayollarga qaraganda erkaklarda keng tarqalgan xatti-harakatlardir.

intimate [intəmit] adj. — yaqin, sirdosh 
🔸>> When a relationship is intimate, the two things are very closely connected. >> Agar biror munosabat intimate bo'lsa, bu ikki narsa bir-biri bilan chambarchas bogʻliq boʻladi.

— I only tell my secrets to my most intimate friends.
— Men faqat eng yaqin do'stlarimga sirlarimni aytaman.

complement [kɒmpləment] v. — yaxshilamoq, yanada go'zal qilmoq
🔸>> To complement something or someone is to make them better. >> Biror narsa yoki birortasini complement qilish, ular yaxshiroq qilish hisoblanadi. 

— The wool scarf complemented her lovely eyes.
— Jun sharf uning ajoyib ko'zlarini to'ldirdi.

pinch [pintʃ] v. — chimchilab olmoq
🔸>> To pinch means to take a piece of skin between one’s fingers and squeeze. >> To pinch birortasining terisini barmoqlar orasiga olib siqishni anglatadi. 

— I pinched my nose, so I couldn’t smell the odor from the garbage.
— Men burunimni chimchiladim, shuning uchun axlatdan hidni sezmadim.

ratio [reiʃou] n. — nisbat
🔸>> A ratio is a relationship between two things expressed in numbers or amounts. >> A ratio bu raqamlar yoki miqdorlarda ifodalangan ikki narsa oʻrtasidagi munosabatdir.

— The boy to girl ratio is one to three.
— O'g'il va qiz nisbati birdan uchgacha.

spiral [spaiərəl] n. — burama, spiral
🔸>> A spiral is a shape which winds round and round in a larger and larger circle. >> A spiral bu kattaroq aylana boʻylab aylana va aylanib yuradigan shakldir.

— A strand of DNA looks like two interlocking spirals.
— DNK zanjiri bir-biriga bog'langan ikkita spiralga o'xshaydi.

magnet [mægnit] n. — magnit
🔸>> A magnet is a piece of iron or other material which attracts iron toward it. >> A magnet bu temirni o'ziga tortadigan temir yoki boshqa material bo'lagi.

— I used a magnet to pick up the nails that were scattered on the floor.
— Men magnit yordamida yerga sochilib qolgan mixlarni oldim.

compress [kəmˈpres] v. — siqmoq, bosmoq
🔸>> To compress something means to press or squeeze it so that it takes up less space. >> Biror narsani compress qilish, u kamroq joy egallashi uchun uni bosish yoki siqishni anglatadi. 

— I compressed my clothes to fit into a single suitcase.
— Liboslarimni bitta chamadonga sig‘dirish uchun bosdim.

metabolism [məˈtæbəlizəm] n. — metabolizm 
🔸>> A person’s metabolism is the way chemical processes in their body use energy. >> Insonning metabolism'i bu uning tanasidagi kimyoviy jarayonlarning energiyadan foydalanish usulidir.

— If you exercise every day, your metabolism speeds up.
— Har kuni mashq qilsangiz, metabolizm tezlashadi.

microchip [maikrouˌtʃip] n. — mikrochip 
🔸>> A microchip is a small device inside a computer that holds information. >> A microchip bu axborot saqlaydigan kompyuter ichidagi kichik qurilma.

— I can put more data on my computer if I buy a more powerful microchip.
—Men kuchliroq mikrochip sotib olsam kompyuterimga ko'proq ma'lumot solaman.

aggregate [ӕgrəgit] adj. — bir butun, agregat
🔸>> When a number is aggregate, it is made up of smaller amounts added together. >> Agar biror raqam aggregate bo'lsa, u mayda miqdorlar qo'shilishidan hosil bo'lgan bo'ladi. 

— The company totaled its aggregate sales for the entire year.
— Kompaniya butun yil davomida o'zining umumiy sotuvlarini jamladi.

quantum [kwɒntəm] adj. — kvant
🔸>> When something is quantum, it relates to the behavior of atomic particles. >> Agar biror narsa quantum bo'lsa, u atom zarralari harakati bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— The physics student studied quantum mechanics.
— Fizika talabasi kvant mexanikasini o‘rgangan.

circuit [səːrkit] n. — elektr zanjiri
🔸>> A circuit is a piece of an electronic device that allows electricity to flow. >> A circuit elektr tokining oqishiga imkon beruvchi elektron qurilmaning bir qismidir.

— Be very careful not to shock yourself when fixing an electrical circuit.
— Elektr zanjirini tuzatayotganda o‘zingizga tok urishidan ehtiyot bo‘ling.

input [input] n. — ma'lumot
🔸>> Input is information that is put into a computer. >> Input bu kompyuterga solinadigan axborot.

— Type the input into the computer program.
— Kiritilgan matnni kompyuter dasturiga kiriting.

database [deitəbeis] n. — ma'lumotlar bazasi 
🔸>> A database is a collection of data that is stored in a computer. >> A database bu kompyuterda to'planadigan ma'lumotlar to'plami.

— The company has a database of all the names and accounts of their customers.
— Kompaniyada o'z mijozlarining barcha ismlari va hisoblari haqidagi ma'lumotlar bazasi bor.

immune [iˈmjuːn] adj. — immunitetli, ta'sirlanmaydigan
🔸>> When someone is immune to a disease, they cannot be affected by it. >> Agar birortasi biror kasallikka nisbatan immune bo'lsa, u o'sha narsadan ta'sirlanmaydi.

— Children usually get shots to make them immune to certain diseases.
— Bolalar odatda ma'lum kasalliklarga qarshi immunitetni oshirish uchun emlanadi.

phase [feiz] n. — bosqich
🔸>> A phase is a stage in a process or the gradual development of something. >> A phase bu biror narsaning sekin-asta rivojlanishi yoki jarayonidagi bosqich.

— The first phase in the recycling project involves finding volunteers to help out.
— Qayta ishlash loyihasining birinchi bosqichi yordam berish uchun ko‘ngillilarni topishni o‘z ichiga oladi.
Unit 21:
linguist [liŋgwist] n. — lingvist, tilshunos
🔸>> A linguist is someone who studies languages. >> A linguist bu tillarni o'rganadigan shaxs.

— Tony is a good linguist and speaks four different languages.
— Toni yaxshi tilshunos va u 4 ta tilda gaplashadi.

dash [dæʃ] v. — yugurmoq
🔸>> To dash means to run or move quickly. >> To dash tez yugurish yoki harakatlanishni anglatadi. 

— Helen dashed up the stairs, so she wouldn’t be late for her appointment.
— Xelen uchrashuvga kechikmaslik uchun zinadan yugurib chiqdi.

knot [nɒt] n. — tugun
🔸>> A knot is made when you tie the ends of rope or cord together. >> A knot arqon yoki shnurning uchlarini bir-biriga bog'laganingizda hosil bo'ladi.

— He tied a knot in his shoelaces, so they wouldn’t come off during the race.
— U poyga paytida yechilib ketmasligi uchun tuflisining bog‘ichiga tugun bog‘ladi.

disgust [disˈgʌst] n. — nafrat, jirkanish
🔸>> Disgust is a feeling of distaste and anger caused by something rude or unpleasant. >> Disgust bu qoʻpol yoki yoqimsiz narsadan kelib chiqadigan norozilik va gʻazab hissi.

— He felt disgust toward his date because she had such terrible eating habits.
— U uchrashuvidan nafratlanardi, chunki u juda dahshatli ovqatlanish odatlariga ega edi.

furious [fjuəriəs] adj. — darg'azab, tutoqib turgan
🔸>> If you are furious, you are extremely angry. >> Agar Siz furious bo'lsangiz, Siz juda ham jahldor bo'lasiz. 

— My father was furious when he read my bad school report.
— Dadam mening yomon maktab hisobotimni o'qib, g'azablandi.

humanities [hju:mænətiz] n. — gumanitar fanlar 
🔸>> Humanities are subjects which analyze human ideas, such as history and literature. >> Humanities bu tarix va adabiyot kabi inson fikrlarini tahlil qiladigan fanlar.

— Jennifer has always been more interested in humanities than science.
— Jenifer doim ilmiy fanlardan ko'ra gumanitar fanlarga ko'proq qiziqqan.

sibling [sibliŋ] n. — tug'ishgan aka, uka, opa, singil
🔸>> A sibling is a brother or sister. >> A sibling bu aka-uka yoki opa-singil.

— Jane has two siblings, an older brother and a younger sister.
— Jeynning ikkita aka-ukasi, katta akasi va singlisi bor.

ritual [ritjuəl] n. — urf-odat 
🔸>> A ritual is a formal custom that people do regularly. >> A ritual bu odamlar muntazam bajaradigan rasmiy odat.

— Ken was very interested to learn about the religious rituals of the natives.
— Ken mahalliy aholining diniy urf-odatlarini oʻrganishga juda qiziqardi.

astounded [əˈstaundid] adj. — hayratda qolgan
🔸>> If you are astounded, you are very surprised. >> Agar Siz astounded bo'lsangiz, Siz juda hayratda qolgan bo'lasiz. 

— I was astounded that Monica won the art competition.
— Monika san'at tanlovida g'olib chiqqanidan hayratda qoldim.

participant [pɑːrˈtisəpənt] n. — ishtirokchi, qatnashchi
🔸>> A participant is someone who joins in a social event or competition. >> A participant bu biror ijtimoiy voqea yoki musobaqaga qo'shiladigan shaxs.

— There were thousands of participants in this year’s marathon.
— Bu yilgi marafonda minglab ishtirokchilar bor edi.

plausible [plɔːzəbəl] adj. — haqiqatga yaqin
🔸>> If something is plausible, it is reasonable or possible. >> Agar biror narsa plausible bo'lsa, bu mantiqiy yoki mumkin bo'ladi. 

— It is plausible that Jack isn’t here today because he is sick.
— Jek kasal bo'lgani uchun bugun bu yerda emasligi aniq.

vague [veig] adj. — xira, mujmal 
🔸>> If something is vague, it is not clear, and it gives very few details. >> Agar biror narsa vague bo'lsa, u aniq emas va u juda kam maʼlumot beradi.

— I asked him about his mother’s health, but he was very vague about it.
— Men undan onasining sog'lig'i haqida so'radim, lekin u bu haqda juda noaniq edi.

attribute [ætribjuːt] n. — fazilat, xususiyat
🔸>> An attribute is a characteristic of a person or thing. >> An attribute bu biror shaxs yoki narsaning harakteristikasi.

— He isn’t very clever, but he does have some other positive attributes.
— U juda aqlli emas, lekin uning boshqa ijobiy fazilatlari ham bor.

cosmetics [kɒzˈmetiks] n. — kosmetika maxsulotlari
🔸>> Cosmetics are substances that make the face and skin more beautiful. >> Cosmetics bu yuz va terini yanada chiroyli qiladigan moddalar.

— Girls often look nicer when they don’t use so many cosmetics.
— Qizlar ko'pincha juda ko'p kosmetikadan foydalanmasa, chiroyli ko'rinadi.

bilingual [baiˈliŋgwəl] adj. — ikki tilda gapira oladigan
🔸>> If someone is bilingual, then they can speak two languages. >> Agar birortasi bilingual bo'lsa, u ikki tilda gapira oladi.

— Since you already know English, after learning French you’ll be bilingual.
— Ingliz tilini allaqachon bilganingiz uchun, frantsuz tilini o'rganganingizdan so'ng siz ikki tilli bo'lasiz.

fluorescent [fluəˈresnt] adj. — nur tushganda yaltiraydigan
🔸>> If something is fluorescent, it is such a bright color that it seems to give off light. >> Agar biror narsa fluorescent bo'lsa, u shunchalik yorqin rangki, u yorug'lik chiqaradi.

— She highlighted the key words in the document with a fluorescent yellow pen.
— U hujjatdagi kalit so‘zlarni lyuminestsent sariq qalam bilan ajratib ko‘rsatdi.

gulf [gʌlf] n. — rahna, kelishmovchilik
🔸>> A gulf is a gap between people who do not understand each other. >> A gulf bu bir-birini tushunmaydigan odamlar orasidagi boʻshliqdir.

— There has been a gulf between James and Tony since their parents died.
— Jeyms va Toni o'rtasida ota-onalari vafot etganidan beri kelishmovchilik bo'lgan.

skinny [skini] adj. — oriq, ozg'in
🔸>> If someone is skinny, they are extremely thin. >> Agar birortasi skinny bo'lsa, u juda ham ozg'in bo'ladi. 

— Polly is very skinny. I think she needs to eat more.
— Polli juda oriq. Menimcha, u ko'proq ovqatlanishi kerak.

clone [kloun] n. — klon
🔸>> A clone is an identical copy of a living creature. >> A clone bu biror tirik jonning bir xil nusxasi.

— Scientists recently made a clone of a sheep.
— Yaqinda olimlar qo‘yning klonini yasashdi.

colloquial [kəˈloukwiəl] adj. — so'zlashuv usulidagi, og'zaki
🔸>> Colloquial describes informal words that are more suitable for speech than writing. >> Colloquial yozuvdan koʻra nutqqa koʻproq mos keladigan norasmiy soʻzlarni tavsiflaydi.

— I find it difficult to understand people if they use colloquial language.
— Agar odamlar soʻzlashuv tilidan foydalansa, ularni tushunishim qiyin.
Unit 22:
straightforward [streitˈfɔːrwərd] adj. — juda oddiy, sodda, jo'n
🔸>> When something is straightforward, it is good because it is easy to understand. >> Agar biror narsa straightforward bo'lsa, u yaxshi, chunki tushunishga oson.

— The teacher’s grading system was straightforward and fair.
— O'qituvchining baholash tizimi to'g'ri va adolatli edi.

coalition [kouəˈliʃən] n. — koalitsiya, ittifoq 
🔸>> A coalition is a group of people or organizations working for a common purpose. >> A coalition bu umumiy maqsad uchun ishlaydigan odamlar yoki tashkilotlar guruhi.

— The companies formed a coalition to make trade less expensive.
— Kompaniyalar savdoni arzonlashtirish uchun koalitsiya tuzdilar.

explicit [iksˈplisit] adj. — oydin, ro'yi-rost
🔸>> If something is explicit, it is very clear, open, and truthful. >> Agar biror narsa explicit bo'lsa, u juda ham aniq, ochiq va rost bo'ladi. 

— The man gave a very explicit account of the car accident.
— Haligi kishi avtohalokat haqida juda aniq ma'lumot berdi.

administrative [ədˈminəstrətiv] adj. — mamuriy
🔸>> Administrative describes anything related to managing a company or organization. >> Administrative kompaniya yoki tashkilotni boshqarish bilan bogʻliq barcha narsalarni tavsiflaydi.

— I work as an administrative assistant to the owner of the company.
— Men kompaniya egasining ma'muriy yordamchisi bo'lib ishlayman.

administration [ədˌminəsˈtreiʃən] n. — mamuriyat
🔸>> An administration is the group of people who manage a company or organization. >> An administration bu kompaniya yoki tashkilotni boshqaradigan odamlar guruhidir.

— She hoped she could be promoted to a job in the administration.
— U ma'muriyatdagi ishga ko'tarilishi mumkinligiga umid qildi.

deceptive [diˈseptiv] adj. — aldamchi
🔸>> When something is deceptive, it encourages one to believe something that is false. >> Agar biror narsa deceptive bo'lsa, u odamni yolgʻon narsaga ishonishga undaydi.

— The scary-looking man’s appearance is deceptive, but he is actually very nice.
— Qo'rqinchli ko'rinadigan odamning ko'rinishi aldamchi, u aslida juda yaxshi.

cholesterol [kəˈlestəroul] n. — xolesterin
🔸>> Cholesterol is a substance in fat, tissues, and blood of all animals. >> Cholesterol bu barcha hayvonlarning yog'lari, to'qimalari va qonidagi moddadir.

— When people have too much cholesterol, they are at a high risk for heart problems.
— Odamlarda juda ko'p xolesterin bo'lsa, ular yurak muammolari uchun yuqori xavf ostida bo'ladi.

mechanism [mekənizəm] n. — mexanizm, qurilma
🔸>> A mechanism is a part of a machine that performs a certain function. >> A mechanism bu ma'lum bir funktsiyani bajaradigan mashinaning bir qismidir.

— I can’t open my car door because the locking mechanism is broke.
— Men mashinamning eshigini ocholmayman, chunki qulflash mexanizmi buzilgan.

erosion [iˈrouʒən] n. — eroziya, nurash 
🔸>> Erosion is the destruction of rock or soil due to flowing water or weather. >> Erosion bu tosh yoki tuproqning suv oqimi yoki ob-havo ta'sirida vayron bo'lishi.

— Canyons are formed because rivers of fast-moving water caused erosion.
— Kanyonlar tez harakatlanuvchi daryolar eroziyaga olib kelganligi sababli paydo bo'lgan.

framework [freimwəːrk] n. — tuzilma
🔸>> A framework is a set of rules or ideas that people use to solve problems. >> A framework bu odamlar muammolarni hal qilish uchun foydalanadigan qoidalar yoki g'oyalar tizimi.

— His ideas fit into the framework of a successful business plan.
— Uning g'oyalari muvaffaqiyatli biznes-reja doirasiga mos keladi.

notion [nouʃən] n. — tushuncha
🔸>> A notion is an idea or belief about something. >> A notion bu biror narsa haqidagi fikr yoki eʼtiqoddir.

— I have a notion that this route would get us to the beach.
— Bu marshrut bizni sohilga olib chiqadi, degan fikrdaman.

ethics [eθiks] n. — etika, odob-axloq
🔸>> Ethics are moral beliefs or rules about right or wrong. >> Ethics bu toʻgʻri yoki notoʻgʻri haqidagi axloqiy eʼtiqod yoki qoidalardir.

— The act of stealing certainly doesn’t go against some people’s ethics.
— Oʻgʻirlik harakati, albatta, baʼzi odamlarning axloqiga zid kelmaydi.

manufacture [mænjəˈfæktʃə:r] v. — ishlab chiqarmoq
🔸>> To manufacture something means to make it in a factory. >> Biror narsani manufacture qilish, uni fabrikada yasashni anglatadi. 

— My father’s company manufactures steel building materials.
— Otamning kompaniyasi temir qurilish materiallari ishlab chiqaradi.

minimize [minəmaiz] v. — minimallashtirmoq
🔸>> To minimize means to reduce something to the lowest possible level. >> To minimize biror narsani imkon qadar eng pastki darajagacha kamaytirishni anglatadi. 

— I checked my homework twice to minimize errors I might have made.
— Men qilgan bo'lishim mumkin bo'lgan xatolarni kamaytirish uchun uy vazifamni ikki marta tekshirdim.

diabetes [daiəˈbiːtis] n. — qantli diabet 
🔸>> Diabetes is a medical condition where a person has too much sugar in their blood. >> Diabetes bu biror shaxs qonida juda ko'p shakar bo'ladigan tibbiy holat.

— Overweight people are more likely to suffer from diabetes than slimmer ones.
— Ortiqcha vaznli odamlar ingichka odamlarga qaraganda diabetga ko'proq moyil.

acid [æsid] n. — oksid
🔸>> An acid is a chemical that can burn or dissolve other substances. >> An acid bu boshqa moddalarni yoqishi yoki eritishi mumkin bo‘lgan kimyoviy moddadir.

— In chemistry class, we mixed two acids together and watched the reaction.
— Kimyo darsida biz ikkita kislotani aralashtirib, reaksiyani kuzatdik.

eliminate [iˈliməneit] v. — bartaraf etmoq
🔸>> To eliminate something that is unwanted means to completely remove it. >> Biror xohlanmayotgan narsani eliminate qilish, uni butunlay yo'qotishni anglatadi. 

— Wearing a seatbelt eliminates some of the dangers of driving a car.
— Xavfsizlik kamarini taqish avtomobil haydashdagi ba'zi xavflarni bartaraf qiladi.

nectar [nektər] n. — nektar 
🔸>> Nectar is a sweet liquid produced by flowers that bees and other insects collect. >> Nectar bu asalari va boshqa hasharotlar yig'adigan gullar ishlab chiqaradigan shirin suyuqlik.

— Bees use nectar to make their honey.
— Asalarilar asal tayyorlash uchun nektardan foydalanadilar.

prone [proun] adj. — moyil
🔸>> When things are prone to some bad bthing, they are likely affected by it. >> Agar narsalar biror yomon narsaga prone bo'lsa, ular ehtimol undan tasirlanadi.

— Some people are more prone to catching colds than others.
— Ba'zi odamlar boshqalarga qaraganda shamollashga ko'proq moyil bo'ladi.

biotechnology [baioutekˈnɒlədʒi] n. — biotexnologiya
🔸>> Biotechnology is the use of living parts, such as cells, in industry and technology. >> Biotechnology bu sanoat va texnologiyada hujayralar kabi tirik qismlardan foydalanishdir.

— Researchers at the biotechnology company use bacteria to make medicine.
— Biotexnologiya kompaniyasi tadqiqotchilari dori tayyorlash uchun bakteriyalardan foydalanadilar.
Unit 23:
spectrum [spektrəm] n. — spektr 
🔸>> The spectrum is the full range of color ranging from red to violet. >> The spectrum bu qizildan binafsha ranggacha boʻlgan ranglarning toʻliq diapazoni.
