— You can see the entire spectrum in a rainbow.
— Kamalakda butun spektrni koʻrishingiz mumkin.

status [steitəs] n. — status, maqom
🔸>> Status is the position of something or someone in relation to others. >> Status bu biror narsaning yoki kimningdir boshqalarga nisbatan pozitsiyasidir.

— She had achieved the status of being the smartest girl in the class.
— U sinfdagi eng aqlli qiz maqomiga erishdi.

debris [dəbriː] n. — parcha, bo'lak
🔸>> Debris is the small pieces scattered from something wrecked or destroyed. >> Debris bu payxon boʻlgan yoki vayron boʻlgan narsadan sochilgan mayda boʻlaklardir.

— The debris from the cube scattered on the floor.
— Kubning qoldiqlari polga sochilib ketdi.

fragment [frægmənt] n. — parcha, bo'lak
🔸>> A fragment is a small part of something. >> A fragment bu biror narsaning kichik qismidir.

— After the light broke, there were fragments of glass to clean up.
— Chiroq singanidan keyin tozalash uchun shisha parchalari bor edi.

comet [kɒmit] n. — kometa
🔸>> A comet is an object in space made of ice and rock with a tail of glowing dust. >> A comet bu kosmosdagi muz va toshdan yasalgan, dumi porlayotgan chang boʻlgan jismdir.

— Comets take many decades to complete an orbit around a star.
— Kometalar yulduz atrofida aylanib chiqishi uchun bir necha o‘n yillar kerak bo‘ladi.

gloom [gluːm] n. — zimiston
🔸>> Gloom is a state of being almost completely dark. >> Gloom bu deyarli butunlay qorong'u bo'lish holati.

— In the gloom of the morning, it was difficult to see the boat on the lake.
— Tong qorong'usida ko‘lda qayiqni ko‘rish qiyin edi.

crescent [kresənt] n. — yarim oy
🔸>> A crescent is the curved shape lit on the moon’s face during its early and late stages. >> A crescent bu oyning dastlabki va kech bosqichlarida yuzida yoritilgan egri shakldir.

— Ten days ago the entire moon was bright, but now only a small crescent is shining.
— O'n kun oldin butun oy yorqin edi, lekin hozir faqat kichik yarim oy porlamoqda.

atom [ætəm] n. — atom
🔸>> An atom is the smallest unit of a substance. >> An atom bu biror moddaning eng kichik qismi.

— A molecule consists of a combination of two or more atoms.
— Molekula ikki yoki undan ortiq atomlarning birikmasidan iborat.

gigantic [dʒaiˈgæntik] adj. — juda katta, gigant 
🔸>> If something is gigantic, then it is extremely large. >> Agar biror narsa gigantic bo'lsa, u juda ham ulkan bo'ladi. 

— Some dinosaurs were so gigantic that they were the size of buildings.
— Ba'zi dinozavrlar shunchalik ulkan ediki, ular binolarning kattaligichalik edi.

crater [kreitər] n. — krater
🔸>> A crater is a large hole in a planet’s or moon’s surface. >> A crater bu biror sayyora yoki Oyning yuzasidagi ulkan chuqur.

— They could clearly see the big crater on the moon through the telescope.
— Ular teleskop orqali Oydagi katta kraterni aniq ko'rishdi.

solitary [sɒliteri] adj. — yolg'iz, tanho
🔸>> If something is solitary, then it is lonely or the only one. >> Agar biror narsa solitary bo'lsa, u yolg'iz yoki bir dona bo'ladi. 

— The only thing in the room was a solitary chair.
— Xonadagi yagona narsa yolg'iz o'rindiq edi.

galaxy [gæləksi] n. — galaktika, koinot
🔸>> A galaxy is any extremely large collection of star systems. >> A galaxy bu yulduz tizimlarining juda ham ulkan yig'ilmasi.

— Our solar system is located in the outer area of our galaxy.
— Quyosh sistemamiz galaktikamizning tashqi hududida joylashgan.

embed [imˈbed] v. — o'yib o'rnatmoq, ichiga joylashtirmoq
🔸>> To embed something means to place it firmly within a surrounding thing. >> Biror narsani embed qilish, uni oʻrab turgan narsa ichiga mahkam joylashni anglatadi. 

— The logger embedded the ax into the wood after chopping several logs.
— Yogʻoch kesuvchi bir nechta ignabargli yogʻochlarni maydalagandan soʻng, boltani yogʻochga sanchdi.

breadth [bretθ] n. — kenglik, en
🔸>> Breadth is the distance from one side to the other side of something. >> Breadth bu biror narsaning bir tomonidan boshqa tomonigacha bo'lgan masofa.

— The breadth of the northern wall of the house is twenty meters.
— Uyning shimoliy devorining kengligi yigirma metr.

radiate [reidieit] v. — issiqlik chiqarmoq
🔸>> To radiate means to send out energy or heat. >> To radiate energiya yoki issiqlik chiqarishni anglatadi. 

— The heat from the fireplace radiated throughout the room.
— Kaminning issiqligi butun xonaga tarqaldi.

sphere [sfiə:r] n. — sfera, shar 
🔸>> A sphere is a three-dimensional round shape, like a ball. >> A sphere bu koptok kabi uch oʻlchamli dumaloq shakldir.

— The balloons were inflated into a variety of colorful spheres.
— Sharlar turli rang-barang sferalarga puflangan.

despair [disˈpɛər] n. — noumidlik
🔸>> Despair is the complete loss of hope. >> Despair bu umidning butkul yo'qolishi.

— After the other company won the account, our salespeople were filled with despair.
— Boshqa kompaniya hisobni qo'lga kiritgandan so'ng, bizning sotuvchilarimiz umidsizlikka to'lib ketishdi.

astronomical [æstrəˈnɒmikəl] adj. — astronomik
🔸>> If something is astronomical, then it is extremely large. >> Agar biror narsa astronomical bo'lsa, u juda ham katta bo'ladi. 

— It’s an astronomical distance between the Milky Way galaxy and the nearest galaxy.
— Bu Somon yoʻli galaktikasi bilan eng yaqin galaktika oʻrtasidagi astronomik masofa.

roam [roum] v. — darbadar kezmoq, gandiraklab yurmoq
🔸>> To roam means to move around without a plan or purpose. >> To roam biror reja yoki maqsadsiz atrofda aylanib yurishni anglatadi. 

— All day the cows roamed around the field eating grass.
— Sigirlar kun bo'yi dala atrofida o't yeyishdi.

circumference [səˈkʌmfərəns] n. — aylana uzunligi
🔸>> A circumference is the distance completely around a circular object. >> A circumference bu biror aylana narsaning atrofi bo'ylab uzunligi.

— The circumference of the Earth is obviously much larger than a baseball’s.
— Yerning aylanasi beysbolnikidan ancha kattaroq.
Unit 24:
tenant [tenənt] n. — ijarachi
🔸>> A tenant is a person who rents property from a landlord. >> A tenant bu ijaraga beruvchidan ijaraga mulk oladigan shaxs.

— The new tenants moved into the house across the street.
— Yangi ijarachilar ko'chaning narigi tomonidagi uyga ko'chib o'tishdi.

utility [juːˈtiləti] n. — kommunal xizmat, kommunal to'lov
🔸>> A utility is a business that supplies services such as water or electricity. >> A utility bu suv yoki elektr kabi xizmatlar bilan ta'minlaydigan biznes.

— If you don’t pay the utilities, you may have your electricity turned off.
— Agar kommunal toʻlovlarni toʻlamasangiz, elektr quvvati oʻchirilishi mumkin.

mortgage [mɔːrgidʒ] n. — ipoteka, uy sotib olish uchun olingan qarz
🔸>> A mortgage is a loan for property, especially homes and businesses. >> A mortgage bu mulk, xususan, uylar va korxonalar uchun beriladigan kreditdir.

— When they bought their new home, the married couple had to sign a mortgage.
— Yangi uy sotib olgach, er-xotin ipoteka shartnomasini imzolashlari kerak edi.

extension [iksˈtenʃən] n. — kengaytirish
🔸>> An extension is a part added to something to give it more time or space. >> An extension bu biror narsaga koʻproq vaqt yoki joy berish uchun qoʻshilgan qism.

— My parents decided to add an extension to our house for the new baby.
— Ota-onam yangi chaqaloq uchun uyimizga kengaytma qo'shishga qaror qilishdi.

personnel [pəːrsəˈnel] n. — kadrlar xodimlar
🔸>> Personnel are employees in a business. >> Personnel bu biror biznesdagi ishchilar. 

— When business increased, we had to hire more personnel.
— Biznes kuchaygach, biz ko'proq xodimlarni yollashga majbur bo'ldik.

hygienic [haiˈdʒinik] adj. — gigienik, ozodalik
🔸>> If something is hygienic, then it is clean and unlikely to cause disease. >> Agar biror narsa hygienic bo'lsa, u toza va kasallik keltirib chiqarishi dargumon.

— My sister works very hard to keep her entire home as hygienic as possible.
— Singlim butun uyini imkon qadar gigienik holatda saqlash uchun juda qattiq mehnat qiladi.

forthcoming [fɔːrθˈkʌmiŋ] adj. — bo'lajak, kelgusi
🔸>> If something is forthcoming, then it is about to happen in the future. >> Agar biror narsa forthcoming bo'lsa, u kelajakda sodir bo'lish arafasida bo'ladi. 

— Some economists predicted that the forthcoming world economy would be severe.
— Ba'zi iqtisodchilar bo'lajak jahon iqtisodiyoti og'ir bo'lishini bashorat qilishdi.

whereby [hwɛə:rˈbai] conj. — orqali, tufayli, ... uchun
🔸>> Whereby means by which or through which. >> Whereby biror narsa orqali degan ma'noni anglatadi. 

— The mayor had a new bridge built whereby the citizens could cross the river.
— Shahar hokimi fuqarolarning daryodan o'tishi mumkin bo'lgan yangi ko'prik qurdirdi.

plumbing [plʌmiŋ] n. — vodoprovod tizimi
🔸>> Plumbing is the system of pipes used in a home to supply water. >> Plumbing bu uyda suv taʼminoti uchun ishlatiladigan quvurlar tizimi.

— When the plumbing stopped working, no one was allowed to use the toilets.
— Santexnika ishlamay qolganda, hech kimga hojatxonadan foydalanishga ruxsat berilmadi.

hygiene [haidʒiːn] n. — gigiena, ozodalik
🔸>> Hygiene is the conditions or methods needed for health and cleanliness. >> Hygiene bu sog'lik va tozalik uchun kerak bo'ladigan holat yoki usullardir.

— People who brush their teeth at least twice a day are practicing good hygiene.
— Tishlarini kuniga kamida ikki marta yuvadigan odamlar gigiena qoidalariga rioya qilishadi.

trendy [trendi] adj. — rasm bo'lgan, urfga kirgan 
🔸>> If something is trendy, then it is very popular and new. >> Agar biror narsa trendy bo'lsa, u juda mashxur va yangi bo'ladi. 

— Carlo bought a trendy new car.
— Karlo zamonaviy yangi mashina sotib oldi.

expel [iksˈpel] v. — haydamoq, chiqarib yubormoq
🔸>> To expel someone means to force them to leave a place. >> Birortasini expel qilish, uni biror joyni tark etishga majbur qilishni anglatadi. 

— Since he would not follow the rules, the principal had to expel the student.
— U qoidalarga rioya qilmagani uchun direktor talabani haydab chiqarishga majbur bo'ldi.

conform [kənˈfɔːrm] v. — rioya qilmoq
🔸>> To conform to rules or laws is to obey them. >> Qoidalar yoki qonunlarga conform qilish, ularga itoat qilish hisoblanadi. 

— The new student had to conform to the school’s dress code.
— Yangi oʻquvchi maktabning kiyinish qoidalariga mos kelishi kerak edi.

employ [imˈplɔi] v. — ish bilan ta'minlamoq, ish bermoq
🔸>> To employ someone means to give work to them. >> Birortasini employ qilish, ularga ish berishni anglatadi. 

— The bookstore employed two full-time clerks.
— Kitob doʻkonida toʻliq stavkada ishlaydigan ikkita xodimni ishga oldi.

mend [mend] v. — tuzatmoq, yamamoq 
🔸>> To mend something means to fix it when it is broken or damaged. >> Biror narsani mend qilish, u singanda yoki unga zarar yetganda uni tuzatishni anglatadi. 

— Mother mended the rip in my pants with a piece of cloth.
— Onam ishtonimdagi yirtiqni latta bilan yamadi.

bankrupt [bæŋkrʌpt] adj. — bankrot
🔸>> If someone is bankrupt, then they are unable to pay their debts. >> Agar birortasi bankrupt bo'lsa, u qarzlarini to'lashga qodir bo'lmaydi.

— The store had few customers and soon went bankrupt.
— Do'konning xaridorlari kam edi va tez orada bankrot bo'ldi.

furnish [fəːrniʃ] v. — mebellar bilan jihozlamoq
🔸>> To furnish means to put furniture in a house or room. >> To furnish mebellarni uyga yoki xonaga qo'yish demakdir.

— Most homes are furnished with tables, chairs, and beds.
— Aksariyat uylar stol, stul va yotoqlar bilan jihozlangan.

landlord [lændlɔːrd] n. — ijaraga beruvchi
🔸>> A landlord is a man who rents property to a person. >> A landlord bu biror kishiga mulkni ijaraga beradigan kishi.

— The landlord collected everyone’s rent money on the first day of every month.
— Uy egasi har oyning birinchi kunida hammaning ijara pulini yig‘ib olardi.

lease [liːs] v. — ijaraga olmoq
🔸>> To lease means to rent property, usually an apartment or land. >> To lease mulkni, odatda kvartira yoki yerni ijaraga olishni anglatadi. 

— When the family first leased the apartment, the rent was very low.
— Oila birinchi marta kvartirani ijaraga olganida, ijara haqi juda past edi.

mandatory [mændətɔ:ri] adj. — qonunda belgilangan
🔸>> If something is mandatory, then it is required by law. >> Agar biror narsa mandatory bo'lsa, u qonunan talab qilingan bo'ladi. 

— It’s mandatory that everyone be at least sixteen to drive a car in the US.
— AQSHda mashina haydash uchun har bir kishi kamida oʻn olti yoshga toʻlishi majburiydir.
Unit 25:
drill [dril] n. — drel, parma 
🔸>> A drill is a tool with a point that spins in order to make a hole. >> A drill bu teshik ochish uchun aylanadigan nuqtasi boʻlgan asbobdir.

— The carpenter used the drill to make several holes in the wood.
— Duradgor burg‘u yordamida yog‘ochda bir nechta teshik ochdi.

primate [praimeit] n. — primat
🔸>> A primate is a type of mammal that includes monkeys, apes, and humans. >> A primate bu maymun va odamni o'z ichiga oladigan sut emizuvchi turi.

— Primates use their hands for such tasks as swinging from branches.
— Primatlar qo‘llaridan shoxlardan tebranish kabi vazifalarni bajarishda foydalanadilar.

sticky [stiki] adj. — yopishqoq
🔸>> If something is sticky, then it is covered with a substance that things stick to. >> Agar biror narsa sticky bo'lsa, u narsalar unga yopishadigan modda bilan qoplangan bo'ladi. 

— Place the sticky part of the tape against the paper, so it will cling to the wall.
— Lentaning yopishqoq qismini qog'ozga qo'ying, shunda u devorga yopishadi.

incline [inklain] n. — nishab
🔸>> An incline is a sharp rise in something, especially a hill or mountain. >> An incline bu biror narsaning, ayniqsa tepalik yoki tog‘ning keskin ko‘tarilishi.

— This mountain has one of the steepest inclines in the world.
— Bu togʻ dunyodagi eng tik qiyaliklardan biriga ega.

stereotype [steriətaip] n. — yanglish fikr
🔸>> A stereotype is a general but often incorrect idea about a person or thing. >> A stereotype bu odamlar yoki narsalar haqidagi umumiy lekin odatda noto'g'ri bo'lgan fikr.

— There’s a stereotype that pigs are dirty animals. But they are rather clean.
— Cho'chqalar iflos hayvonlar degan stereotip mavjud. Ammo ular ancha toza.

trail [treil] n. — yo'l
🔸>> A trail is a path through a wild area. >> A trail bu yovvoyi hududdan o‘tadigan yo‘l.

— A narrow trail cut through the field and over the hills.
— Tor so'qmoq dala orqali va adirlar ustidan o'tadi.

thereby [ðɛə:rˈbai] adv. — bu orqali
🔸>> If something happens thereby an action, then it is the result of that action. >> Agar biror narsa biror harakat thereby sodir bo'lsa, bu o'sha harakatning natijasidir.

— He didn’t score a goal, thereby ending his chance at setting a record.
— U gol urmadi va shu bilan rekord o'rnatish imkoniyatini yo'qotdi.

termite [təːrmait] n. — termit
🔸>> A termite is an insect that lives in groups and feeds on wood. >> A termite bu hasharotlar boʻlib, guruh boʻlib yashaydi va yogʻoch bilan oziqlanadi.

— The wood we found was full of termites.
— Biz topgan yog‘och termitlarga to‘la edi.

arrogant [ærəgənt] adj. — kekkaygan, gerdaygan 
🔸>> If someone is arrogant, they think that they are more important than others. >> Agar birortasi arrogant bo'lsa, ular o'zlarini boshqalardan muhimroq deb o'ylaydi.

— He is very arrogant. Even though he’s not the boss, he tells everyone what to do.
— U juda takabbur. U xo'jayin bo'lmasa ham, u hammaga nima qilish kerakligini aytadi.

aesthetic [esˈθetik] adj. — estetik 
🔸>> If something is aesthetic, then it is concerned with a love of beauty. >> Agar biror narsa aesthetic bo'lsa, u go'zallikka bo'lgan muhabbat bilan bog'liq bo'ladi. 

— The dresses were noteworthy for their aesthetic design.
— Ko'ylaklar o'zining estetik dizayni bilan e'tiborga loyiq edi.

creek [kriːk] n. — jilg'a, ariq
🔸>> A creek is a stream or small river. >> A creek bu soy yoki kichik daryo.

— Only small fish lived in the shallow waters of the creek.
— Daryoning sayoz suvlarida faqat mayda baliqlar yashar edi.

twig [twig] n. — shox, shabba 
🔸>> A twig is a short and thin branch from a tree or bush. >> A twig daraxt yoki butadan olingan kalta va ingichka shoxdir.

— They started the fire with a handful of dry twigs.
— Bir hovuch quruq novdalar bilan olov yoqishdi.

canyon [kænjən] n. — kanyon, dara 
🔸>> A canyon is a narrow valley with steep walls through which a river often flows. >> A canyon bu tik devorlarga ega tor vodiy boʻlib, undan koʻpincha daryo oqib oʻtadi.

— The canyon was so deep that the ground inside was covered in shadow.
— Kanyon shu qadar chuqur ediki, uning ichidagi yer soya bilan qoplangan edi.

executive [igˈzekjətiv] n. — bosh menejer
🔸>> An executive is the top manager of a business. >> An executive bu biror biznesning bosh menejeri.

— After twenty years at the company, he finally became the executive.
— Kompaniyada yigirma yil ishlagandan so'ng, u nihoyat boshqaruvchi bo'ldi.

welfare [welfɛə:r] n. — sihat-salomatlik
🔸>> Welfare is the health and happiness of a person or group. >> Welfare bu biror shaxs yoki guruhning sog'lik va baxtliligi.

— Having plenty of clean water is necessary for the welfare of people.
— Ko'p miqdorda toza suvga ega bo'lish odamlarning farovonligi uchun zarur.

fatigue [fəˈtiːg] n. — charchoq, horish
🔸>> Fatigue is a feeling of extreme tiredness. >> Fatigue bu haddan tashqari charchoq hissi.

— After three days with little sleep, she was feeling a lot of fatigue.
— Uch kunlik uyqudan keyin u juda charchagan.

bias [baiəs] n. — qiziqish, ishqibozlik
🔸>> A bias is a person’s likelihood to like one thing more than another thing. >> A bias bu odamning bir narsani boshqa narsadan ko'ra ko'proq yoqtirish ehtimoli.

— The mothers had a natural bias for their own child’s picture.
— Onalar o'z farzandlarining rasmiga nisbatan tabiiy yondashishga ega edilar.

primitive [primətiv] adj. — oddiy, sodda
🔸>> If something is primitive, then it is simple, basic, and not very developed. >> Agar biror narsa primitive bo'lsa, u oddiy, asosiy va juda muhim bo'lmagan bo'ladi. 

— The computers of the 1980s are primitive compared to those of todays.
— 1980-yillardagi kompyuterlar bugungi kunlarga nisbatan oddiy.

perceive [pərsiːv] v. — payqamoq 
🔸>> To perceive something means to be aware of it. >> Biror narsani perceive qilish undan xabardor bo'lishni anglatadi. 

— He was talking loudly, so he did not perceive that the music had stopped.
— U baland ovozda gapirar edi, shuning uchun u musiqa to'xtaganini sezmadi.

nasty [næsti] adj. — yoqimsiz
🔸>> If something is nasty, then it is not nice or pleasant. >> Agar biror narsa nasty bo'lsa, u yaxshi yoki yoqimli bo'lmaydi.

— The rotten apple left a nasty taste inside her mouth.
— Chirigan olma og'zida yoqimsiz ta'm qoldirdi.
Unit 26:
provide [prəˈvaid] v. — ta'minlamoq
🔸>> To provide something means to supply it. >> Biror narsani provide qilish, uni ta'minlashni anglatadi. 

— Each student was provided with a test and three sharp pencils.
— Har bir oʻquvchiga test sinovi va uchta oʻtkir qalam berildi.

supernatural [suːpərˈnætʃərəl] adj. — mo'jizaviy
🔸>> If something is supernatural, it is not real or explainable by natural law. >> Agar biror narsa supernatural bo'lsa, u haqiqiy emas yoki tabiiy qonun bilan tushuntirib boʻlmaydi.

— The dragon had supernatural powers such as flying and breathing fire.
— Ajdaho uchish va olovdan nafas olish kabi g'ayritabiiy kuchlarga ega edi.

overview [ouvərvjuː] n. — umumiy tasavvur
🔸>> An overview is a general description of a situation. >> An overview bu vaziyatning umumiy tavsifi.

— My brother gave me an overview of the important parts of the book.
— Akam menga kitobning muhim qismlari haqida umumiy ma'lumot berdi.

loaf [louf] n. — buxanka
🔸>> A loaf of bread is bread shaped and baked in one piece. >> A loaf bu non shaklidagi va bir bo‘lakda pishirilgan non.

— Could you please buy a loaf of bread for sandwiches?
— Iltimos, sendvichlar uchun bir bo‘lak non xarid qila olasizmi?

rite [rait] n. — an'anaviy marosim
🔸>> A rite is a traditional ceremony carried out by a particular group or society. >> A rite bu maʼlum bir guruh yoki jamiyat tomonidan oʻtkaziladigan anʼanaviy marosimdir.

— Special masks are worn during the rite when a new baby is born.
— Yangi chaqaloq tug'ilganda, marosim paytida maxsus niqoblar kiyiladi.

globe [gloub] n. — yer shari 
🔸>> The globe refers to the Earth. >> The globe Yerga ishora qiladi.

— Water covers most of the globe.
— Suv yer sharining katta qismini qamrab oladi.

horizontal [hɔ:rəˈzɒntl] adj. — gorizontal 
🔸>> When something is horizontal, it is flat and level with the ground. >> Agar biror narsa horizontal holatda boʻlsa, u yer bilan tekis boʻladi.

— The Russian flag has three horizontal stripes of white, blue, and red.
— Rossiya bayrog'ida oq, ko'k va qizil rangli uchta gorizontal chiziq mavjud.

behalf [biˈhæf] n. — o'riniga, nomidan 
🔸>> If something is done on one’s behalf, it is done for that person by another. >> Agar biror narsa birortasining behalf dan bajarilsa, u boshqa odam tomonidan uning o'rniga bajarilgan bo'ladi. 

— The original speaker was sick, so his son gave the speech on his behalf.
— Asl ma'ruzachi kasal edi, shuning uchun o'g'li uning nomidan nutq so'zladi.

flap [flæp] v. — silkitmoq, qoqmoq
🔸>> To flap means to move quickly up and down or from side to side. >> To flap bu tez yuqoriga-pastga yoki u yoqdan bu yoqqa harakatlanishni bildiradi.

— The tiny bird flapped its wings and ate from the flowers.
— Kichkina qush qanotlarini qoqib, gullardan yedi.

previous [priːviəs] adj. — oldingi, avvalgi
🔸>> If something is previous, then it happened earlier in time or order. >> Agar biror narsa previous bo'lsa, u vaqt yoki navbatdan oldinroq sodir bo'lgan bo'ladi. 

— He turned back to the previous page to read the paragraph again.
— U xatboshini qayta oʻqish uchun oldingi sahifaga qaytdi.

glacier [gleiʃər] n. — muzlik 
🔸>> A glacier is a large piece of ice that moves very slowly. >> A glacier bu juda sekin harakatlanadigan katta muz qismidir.

— The North Pole is covered by a huge glacier.
— Shimoliy qutb katta muzlik bilan qoplangan.

recur [riˈkəːr] v. — qayta-qayta sodir bo'lmoq 
🔸>> To recur means to happen more than once. >> To recur bir martadan oshiq sodir bo'lishni anglatadi. 

— Burglaries seem to recur over and over in our neighborhood.
— Mahallamizda oʻgʻirliklar qayta-qayta sodir boʻlayotganga oʻxshaydi.

inward [inwərd] adj. — ichki
🔸>> If a thought or feeling is inward, it is not expressed or shown to others. >> Agar biror fikr yoki hissiyot inward bo'lsa, u boshqalarga bildirilmaydi yoki ko'rsatilmaydi.

— She had an inward feeling of guilt when she lied to her mother.
— U onasiga yolg'on gapirganda, ichida aybdorlik hissi paydo bo'ldi.

preview [priːvjuː] n. — film yoki konsertni aholi orasida namoyish etilishidan oldin ko'rish
🔸>> A preview is an opportunity to see something before it is available to the public. >> A preview bu biror narsani ommaga taqdim etilishidan oldin koʻrish imkoniyatidir.

— The band played us a preview of their new song.
— Guruh bizga yangi qoʻshigʻining koʻrinishini taqdim etdi.

orbit [ɔːrbit] v. — orbita bo'ylab harakatlanmoq
🔸>> To orbit something means to move around it in a continuous, curving path. >> Biror narsani orbit qilish uning atrofida uzluksiz, egri chiziqda harakatlanishni anglatadi.

— The moon orbits the Earth.
— Oy Yer atrofida aylanadi.

relevant [reləvənt] adj. — muhim va foydali
🔸>> When something is relevant, it is important to a certain person or situation. >> Agar biror narsa relevant bo'lsa, u biror ma'lum shaxs yoki vaziyat uchun muhim hisoblanadi. 

— The thirty-year-old book about politics is still relevant to our society today.
— Siyosat haqidagi o'ttiz yillik kitob bugungi kunda ham jamiyatimiz uchun dolzarbdir.

stall [stɔːl] v. — o'chmoq, to'xtamoq
🔸>> To stall means to stop a process and continue it at a later time. >> To stall jarayonni toʻxtatib, keyinroq davom ettirishni bildiradi.

— If you give the car a push, it won’t stall.
— Agar siz mashinaga turtki bersangiz, u to'xtab qolmaydi.

hum [hʌm] v. — ming'irlamoq
🔸>> To hum means to make a low, continuous noise. >> To hum past, uzluksiz shovqin qilish demakdir.

— The man hummed his favorite song.
— Haligi erkak sevimli qoʻshigʻini ming'irladi.

oracle [ɔ(:)rəkəl] n. — munajjim
🔸>> An oracle is person who speaks with gods and gives advice about the future. >> An oracle bu xudolar bilan gaplashadigan va kelajak haqida maslahat beradigan kishi.

— The king went to the oracle to ask if going to war was a good idea.
— Podshoh urushga borish yaxshi fikrmi, deb so‘rash uchun munajjimga bordi.

inventory [invənˌtɔ:ri] n. — inventar, ro'yxat
🔸>> An inventory is a supply of something. >> An inventory bu biror narsaning taʼminlanishi.

— Gwen was checking the inventory to make sure we had what we needed.
— Gven bizda kerakli narsa borligiga ishonch hosil qilish uchun inventarni tekshirayotgan edi.
Unit 27:
substitute [sʌbstitjuːt] v. — o'rniga ishlatmoq
🔸>> To substitute something or someone means to have them take the place of another. >> Biror narsa yoki birortasini substitute qilish, ularni boshqasining o'rnini egallashini anglatadi.

— When I ran out of juice, I had to substitute water to drink in the morning.
— Sharbat tugagach, ertalab ichish uchun suvni almashtirishim kerak edi.

dynamic [daiˈnæmik] adj. — serharakat, ishchan
🔸>> When people are dynamic, they are lively and have creative ideas. >> Agar odamlar dynamic bo'lsa, ular jo'shqin va kreativ fikrlari bor bo'ladi. 

— The new, dynamic employee came up with a good way to juggle his work load.
— Yangi, ishchan xodim oʻz ish yukini oʻzgartirishning yaxshi usulini oʻylab topdi.

cellular [seljələr] adj. — hujayraviy
🔸>> When something is cellular, it relates to the cells of animals or plants. >> Agar biror narsa cellular bo'lsa, u hayvon yoki o'simliklar hujayralari bilan aloqador bo'ladi. 

— She used a microscope to see the activity at a cellular level.
— U hujayra darajasidagi faoliyatni ko‘rish uchun mikroskopdan foydalangan.

fantasy [fæntəzi] n. — fantaziya, xayolot
🔸>> A fantasy is a pleasant situation that people think about but is unlikely to happen. >> A fantasy bu odamlar o'ylaydigan, lekin sodir bo'lishi dargumon yoqimli holat.

— Becoming an astronaut is a fantasy shared by many children.
— Kosmonavt bo'lish ko'plab bolalarning hayolidir.

adapt [əˈdæpt] v. — moslashmoq, ko'nikmoq
🔸>> To adapt means to change in order to deal with a new situation or addition. >> To adapt yangi vaziyat yoki qoʻshimcha bilan shugʻullanish uchun oʻzgartirishni bildiradi.

— When he went to the new town, he had to adapt to all the weather changes.
— U yangi shaharga borganida, ob-havoning barcha o'zgarishlariga moslashishi kerak edi.

heredity [hiˈredəti] n. — irsiyat 
🔸>> Heredity is the process of passing on features from parents to children. >> Heredity bu xususiyatlarning ota-onadan bolalarga oʻtish jarayonidir.

— The boy’s face is similar to his father’s because of heredity.
— Bolaning yuzi irsiyat tufayli otasinikiga oʻxshaydi.

prescribe [priˈskraib] v. — yozib bermoq
🔸>> To prescribe medicine means to tell someone to take it. >> Dorini prescribe qilish bu kimgadir uni qabul qilishni aytishni anglatadi.

— When I was sick, the doctor prescribed me flu medicine.
— Kasal bo'lganimda shifokor grippga qarshi dori yozib berdi.

revive [riˈvaiv] v. — jonlantirmoq
🔸>> To revive someone or something means to restore health or life to them. >> Biror narsa yoki birortasini revive qilish, ularning salomatligi yoki hayotini tiklash demakdir.

— She revived the feeling of warmth in her leg by rubbing it softly.
— U oyog‘idagi iliqlik tuyg‘usini sekin ishqalab, jonlantirdi.

sequence [siːkwəns] n. — ketma-ketlik
🔸>> A sequence is a number of events or things that come one after another. >> A sequence bu biri ortidan boshqasi keladigan bir qancha voqea yoki narsalar. 

— The dominos fell in a sequence of one after another.
— Domino toshlari birin-ketin qulab tushdi.

rigid [ridʒid] adj. — qat'iy
🔸>> When rules or systems are rigid, they are severe because they cannot be changed. >> Agar qoidalar yoki sistemalar rigid bo'lsa, ular jiddiy boʻladi, chunki ularni oʻzgartirish mumkin emas.

— Societies often have rigid rules about the way that people are supposed to act.
— Jamiyatlarda ko'pincha odamlar qanday harakat qilishlari kerakligi haqida qat'iy qoidalar mavjud.

pioneer [paiəˈniər] — pioner 
🔸>> A pioneer is a person who is the first to discover or be involved in something. >> A pioneer bu birinchi boʻlib nimanidir kashf etgan yoki ishtirok etuvchi shaxsdir.

— He was a pioneer of computer programming.
— U kompyuter dasturlaydigan burinchi odam edi.

internal [inˈtəːrnl] adj. — ichki
🔸>> When something is internal, it exists or happens inside a person, object, or place. >> Agar biror narsa internal bo'lsa, u biror shaxs, narsa yoki joy ichida sodir bo'ladi yoki mavjud bo'ladi. 

— We removed the outer case to reveal the computer’s internal wires.
— Biz kompyuterning ichki simlarini aniqlash uchun tashqi korpusni olib tashladik.

minimal [minəməl] adj. — minimal, juda kam
🔸>> When something is minimal, it is very small. >> Agar biror narsa minimal bo'lsa, u juda kam bo'ladi. 

— My lazy husband does a minimal amount of work around the house.
— Mening dangasa erim uy atrofida minimal miqdordagi ishlarni bajaradi.

respective [risˈpektiv] adj. — tegishli
🔸>> When things are respective, they relate separately to each person just mentioned. >> Agar narsalar respective bo'lsa, ular yuqorida aytib oʻtilgan har bir kishiga alohida taalluqlidir.

— The boxers were told to return to their respective corners.
— Bokschilarga o'z burchaklariga qaytishlari aytildi.

biological [baiəˈlɒdʒikəl] adj. — biologik 
🔸>> Biological describes the process of life and living things. >> Biological tirik narsalar va hayot jarayonini tasvirlaydi.

— In science, we learned about the biological process of bacterial growth.
— Fanda biz bakteriyalar o'sishining biologik jarayoni haqida bilib oldik.
Unit 28:
philanthropy [fiˈlænθrəpi] n. — filantrofiya
🔸>> Philanthropy is the act of helping others, without wanting anything in return. >> Philanthropy bu evaziga biror narsa qaytishini xohlamasdan boshqalarga yordam berish harakati.

— The wealthy business owner is well known for his acts of philanthropy.
— Boy biznes egasi xayriya harakatlari bilan mashhur.

orangutan [ɔ:ˈræŋuˈtæn] n. — orangutan
🔸>> An orangutan is a large ape with red and brown hair and long arms. >> An orangutan bu qizil va jigarrang sochli, uzun qo'llari bo'lgan katta maymun.

— Orangutans use their long arms to swing from trees.
— Orangutanlar uzun qoʻllari bilan daraxtlarda osilib yurish uchun foydalanadilar.

insulate [insəleit] v. — izolyatsalamoq
🔸>> To insulate something means to protect it from heat, cold, or noise. >> Biror narsani insulate qilish, uni issiq, sovuq va shovqindan himoya qilishni anglatadi. 

— People can conserve energy by insulating their houses.
— Odamlar uylarini izolyatsiya qilish orqali energiyani tejashlari mumkin.

misplace [misˈpleis] v. — yo'qotmoq
🔸>> To misplace something means to lose it. >> Biror narsani misplace qilish, uni yo'qotishni anglatadi. 

— I misplaced my wallet, and I didn’t find it until a week later.
— Men hamyonimni yo'qotdim va bir hafta o‘tguncha uni topa olmadim.

thrive [θraiv] v. — yanada sog'lom, omadli, kuchli bo'lmoq
🔸>> To thrive means to do well and be successful, healthy, or strong. >> To thrive yaxshi bajarish va muvaffaqiyatli, sog'lom yoki kuchli bo'lishni anglatadi. 

— He may be an old man, but he continues to thrive.
— U keksa odam bo'lishi mumkin, lekin u gullab-yashnamoqda.

intrigue [inˈtriːg] v. — qiziqish uyg'otmoq
🔸>> To intrigue means to cause an interest in something or someone. >> To intrigue biror narsa yoki birortasiga qiziqishga sabab bo'lishni anglatadi. 

— Her mysterious past intrigued her new friend.
— Uning sirli o'tmishi yangi do'stini qiziqtirdi.

convention [kənˈvenʃən] n. — udum, odat
🔸>> A convention is behavior that is considered to be common or polite. >> A convention bu odatiy yoki xushmuomalalik sifatida qabul qilingan xatti-harakatlardir.

— In the US, a popular convention is to shake hands when you meet someone.
— AQSHda kimnidir uchratganda qoʻl berib koʻrishish mashhur odatdir.

overload [ouvərˈloud] v. — ortiqcha yuk yuklamoq
🔸>> To overload something means to put more things into it than it is meant to hold. >> Biror narsani overload qilish, unga ushlab turish uchun ko'proq narsalarni qo'yishni anglatadi. 

— If you overload the truck, it might crash.
— Agar yuk mashinasini haddan tashqari yuklasangiz, u halokatga uchrashi mumkin.

improve [imˈpruːv] v. — yaxshilamoq
🔸>> To improve something means to make it better. >> Biror narsani improve qilish, uni yaxshilashni anglatadi. 

— He studied hard to improve his test scores from the previous year.
— U oʻtgan yilgi sinov ballarini yaxshilash uchun qattiq oʻqidi.

reptile [reptail] n. — sudralib yuruvchilar, reptiliyalar
🔸>> A reptile is a cold-blooded animal that lays eggs and has skin covered with scales. >> A reptile bu tuxum tug'adigan, tangachalar bilan qoplangan teriga ega bo'lgan sovuqqon hayvon.

— Lizards are my favorite type of reptile.
— Kaltakesaklar mening sevimli sudralib yuruvchilarimdir.

probe [proub] v. — zond bilan tekshirmoq
🔸>> To probe into something means to ask questions to discover facts about it. >> Biror narsani probe qilish, u haqida faktlar topish uchun savol so'rashni anglatadi. 

— The bank probed into his financial history to see if he qualified for a loan.
— Bank uning kredit olish huquqiga ega yoki yo‘qligini bilish uchun uning moliyaviy tarixini o‘rgandi.

naughty [nɔːti] adj. — qaysar, injiq 
🔸>> When children are naughty, they behave badly or do not do what they are told. >> Agar bolalar naughty bo'lsa, ular o'zini yomon tutadi yoki aytilgan ishni qilmaydi.

— The boy had to go to his room because he was being naughty.
— Bola o'z xonasiga borishi kerak edi, chunki u yaramas edi.

longevity [lɒnˈdʒevəti] n. — uzoq umr ko'rish
🔸>> Longevity is the ability to live for a long time. >> Longevity bu uzoq vaqt yashash qobiliyati. 

— Sea turtles have an amazing longevity.
— Dengiz toshbaqalari ajoyib uzoq umr ko'rishadi.

recipient [riˈsipiənt] n. — qabul qiluvchi
🔸>> A recipient of something is the person who receives it. >> Biror narsaning recipient'i bu uni qabul qiluvchi shaxsdir.

— I was the recipient of four phone calls today.
— Bugun men to'rtta qo'ng'iroqni qabul qildim.

gracious [greiʃəs] adj. — marhamatli
🔸>> If someone is gracious, then they are kind and helpful to those who need it. >> Agar birortasi gracious bo'lsa, u muhtojlarga mehribon va yordam beradi.

— The operator was gracious enough to help me find his number.
— Operator menga uning raqamini topishga yordam berdi.

arbitrary [ɑːrbitreri] adj. — asossiz, o'zboshimchq
🔸>> If something is arbitrary, it is not based on any plan or system, so it seems random. >> Agar biror narsa arbitrary bo'lsa, u hech qanday reja yoki tizimga asoslanmagan, shuning uchun u tasodifiy koʻrinadi.

— The classroom had many arbitrary rules that made me confused.
— Sinf xonasida ko'plab o'zboshimchalik qoidalari bor edi, bu meni chalkashtirib yubordi.

ultimate [ʌltəmit] adj. — bosh, pirovard
🔸>> When something is ultimate, it is the final result or aim of a long series of events. >> Agar biror narsa ultimate bo'lsa, u yakuniy natija yoki bir qator uzun voqealarning maqsadi bo'ladi. 

— By trying hard in school, I will reach my ultimate goal of becoming a doctor.
— Maktabda qattiq harakat qilsam, shifokor bo'lishdek yakuniy maqsadimga erishaman.

autobiography [ɔːtəbaiˈɒgrəfi] n. — avtobiografiya, tarjimai hol
🔸>> An autobiography is a true story of a person’s life written by that person. >> An autobiography bu inson tomonidan yozilgan biror inson hayotining haqiqiy hikoyasidir.

— I read an autobiography about my favorite entertainer.
— Men oʻzimning sevimli aktyorim haqidagi avtobiografiyani oʻqidim.

aquarium [əˈkwɛəriəm] n. — akvarium 
🔸>> An aquarium is a building where fish and underwater animals are kept. >> An aquarium bu baliq va suv osti hayvonlari saqlanadigan qurilma.

— We took a trip to the aquarium and saw a scary shark.
— Biz akvariumga sayohat qildik va qo'rqinchli akulani ko'rdik.

norm [nɔːrm] n. — me'yor
🔸>> A norm is a way of behaving that is considered normal in a particular society. >> A norm bu muayyan jamiyatda odatiy deb hisoblangan oʻzini tutish usulidir.

— Wearing a heavy coat all summer is not considered a norm in the desert.
— Cho'lda yoz bo'yi og'ir palto kiyish odatiy hol hisoblanmaydi.
Unit 29:
lyric [lirik] adj. — lirik
🔸>> When a poem is considered lyric, it is written in a simple and direct style. >> Sheʼr lyric deb hisoblansa, u sodda va toʻgʻridan-toʻgʻri uslubda yozilgan bo'ladi.

— I enjoy reading and creating my own lyric poetry.
— Men o'qishni va o'z lirik she'rlarimni yaratishni yoqtiraman.

majesty [mædʒisti] n. — Hazrati oliylari
🔸>> Majesty is supreme greatness or authority. >> Majesty bu yuqori buyuklik yoki hokimiyatdir.

— You should address the king and queen as your majesty.
— Siz qirol va malikaga Hazrati oliylari sifatida murojaat qilishingiz kerak.

recruit [riˈkruːt] v. — tanlab olmoq, tayinlamoq
🔸>> To recruit people means to select them to join or work for an organization. >> Odamlarni recruit qilish, ularni o'zlariga qo'shilishlari yoki biror tashkilotga ishlashlari uchun tanlashni anglatadi. 

— We successfully recruited someone to be the new manager.
— Biz yangi menejer sifatida kimnidir ishga yolladik.

punctual [pʌŋktjuəl] adj. — mas'uliyatli
🔸>> When someone is punctual, they do something or arrive at the right time. >> Agar birortasi punctual bo'lsa, u o'z vaqtida biror narsani bajaradi yoki qaytib keladi.

— My mother hates being late. She is the most punctual person I know.
— Onam kechikishni yomon ko'radi. U men biladigan eng mas'uliyatli odam.

chronology [krəˈnɒlədʒi] n. — xronologiya
🔸>> The chronology of a series of past events is when they happened. >> Oʻtmishdagi bir qator voqealarning chronology'si ularning sodir boʻlgan paytidir.

— We learned the chronology of World War II in history class.
— Tarix darsida Ikkinchi jahon urushi xronologiyasi bilan tanishdik.

renown [riˈnaun] n. — shuhrat
🔸>> Renown is the quality of being well known due to having done good things. >> Renown bu yaxshi ishlarni qilganligi uchun mashxur bo'lish holati.

— Michael is a singer of great renown in New Zealand.
— Maykl Yangi Zelandiyada mashhur qo'shiqchi.

applicant [æplikənt] n. — da'vogar
🔸>> An applicant is someone who writes a request to be considered for a job or prize. >> An applicant bu ish yoki mukofot olish uchun ariza yozuvchidir.

— Lots of applicants came into the store when the job position became available.
— Ish o'rni mavjud bo'lganda do'konga ko'plab abituriyentlar kirishdi.

excerpt [eksəːrpt] n. — parcha, sitata 
🔸>> An excerpt is a short piece of writing or music taken from a larger piece. >> An excerpt bu kattaroq asardan olingan qisqa yozuv yoki musiqa.

— I didn’t listen to the entire symphony online, but I did play an excerpt.
— Men simfoniyani toʻliq onlayn tinglamadim, lekin parchani ijro etdim.

epic [epik] n. — poema, epos 
🔸>> An epic is a long book, poem, or movie about a period of time or a great event. >> An epic bu ma'lum bir davr yoki buyuk voqea haqidagi uzun kitob, she'r yoki film.

— The poet wrote an epic about the great discoveries of the past thousand years.
— Shoir o'tgan ming yillikning buyuk kashfiyotlari haqida doston yozgan.

tusk [tʌsk] n. — dandon, fil tishi
🔸>> A tusk is a long, curved, pointed tooth of an elephant, boar, or walrus. >> A tusk bu fil, to'ng'iz yoki morjning uzun, kavisli, uchli tishidir.

— Sadly, some people hunt elephants and remove their tusks to sell them.
— Afsuski, ba'zi odamlar fillarni ovlaydi va ularni sotish uchun tishlarini olib tashlaydi.

refund [riːfʌnd] n. — tovon, evaz
🔸>> A refund is money given back to a person when an item is returned to a store. >> A refund bu buyum doʻkonga qaytarilganda shaxsga qaytariladigan puldir.

— I asked for a refund because the shoes I bought were too tight.
— Men sotib olgan oyoq kiyimim juda tor boʻlgani uchun pulni qaytarib berishni soʻradim.

authentic [ɔːˈθentik] adj. — haqiqiy, asl
🔸>> When something is authentic, it is not false or a copy of the original. >> Agar biror narsa authentic bo'lsa, u sohta yoki aslining nusxasi bo'lmaydi. 

— We ate authentic Italian food on our vacation to Rome.
— Biz Rimga ta'tilda haqiqiy italyan taomlarini yedik.

antique [ænˈtiːk] adj. — antikvar
🔸>> If something is antique, it is very old and rare, and therefore valuable. >> Agar biror narsa antique bo'lsa, u juda eski va kamyob, shuning uchun qadrli bo'ladi. 

— My grandmother’s antique rocking chair is worth a lot of money.
— Buvimning antiqa tebranish kursisi katta pulga arziydi.

register [redʒəstə:r] n. — ro'yxat
🔸>> A register is an official list or record of people or things. >> A register bu odamlar yoki narsalarning rasmiy ro'yxat yoki yozuvi.

— At a wedding there is register for all of the guests to sign.
— To'yda barcha mehmonlar imzo chekishi uchun ro'yxatga olish kitobi mavjud.

humiliate [hjuːˈmilieit] v. — pastga urmoq, kamsitmoq
🔸>> To humiliate someone means to make them feel ashamed and embarrassed. >> Birortasini humiliate qilish, uni uyaltirish va xijolat qilish demakdir.

— I was humiliated when I tripped and fell down in front of the whole school.
— Butun maktab oldida qoqilib yiqilib tushganimda xo‘rlandim.

diplomat [dipləmæt] n. — diplomat, elchi
🔸>> A diplomat is a representative of a country who works with another country. >> A diplomat bu boshqa davlat bilan ishlaydigan davlat vakili.

— The Spanish diplomat discussed trade issues with officials in Peru.
— Ispaniyalik diplomat Peru rasmiylari bilan savdo masalalarini muhokama qildi.

fossil [fɒsl] n. — tosh qotgan hayvon qoldig'i
🔸>> A fossil is the hard remains of a prehistoric animal or plant. >> A fossil bu tarixdan oldingi hayvon yoki oʻsimlikning qattiq qoldiqlari.

— The expert arranged the fossils to build the skeleton of the dinosaur.
— Mutaxassis qazilmalarni dinozavr skeletini qurish uchun joylashtirgan.

monarch [mɒnark] n. — monarx 
🔸>> The monarch of a country is the king, queen, emperor, or empress. >> Biror davlatning monarch'i bu qirol, malika, imperatordir.

— The monarch lived in a beautiful palace with a grand gate.
— Monarx katta darvozali chiroyli saroyda yashar edi.

artifact [ɑːrtəfækt] n. — tarixiy yodgorlik
🔸>> An artifact is an old object made by humans that is historically interesting. >> An artifact bu odamlar tomonidan yasalgan, tarixiy qiziq bo'lgan eski narsa. 

— We studied artifacts from an ancient Chinese settlement.
— Biz qadimiy Xitoy manzilgohidagi tarixiy yodgorliklarni oʻrgandik.

precede [priˈsiːd] v. — oldin yuz bemoq
🔸>> To precede something means to come before it. >> Biror narsani precede qilish, undan avval kelishni anglatadi. 

— The hurricane was preceded by a moment of still wind and clear sky.
— Dovuldan oldin bir lahzalik tinch shamol va musaffo osmon edi.
Unit 30:
reunion [riːˈjuːnjən] n. — qayta ko'rishish
🔸>> A reunion is the meeting of people or things that have been separated. >> A reunion bu ajralgan odamlar yoki narsalarning uchrashuvi.

— Every summer we have a family reunion at the lake.
— Har yozda biz ko'lda oilaviy yig'ilish o'tkazamiz.

hybrid [haibrid] n. — duragay, chatishma 
🔸>> A hybrid is a mixture of different things or styles. >> A hybrid bu turli narsalar toki usullar aralashmasi.

— In Greek mythology, a centaur is a hybrid of a man and a horse.
— Yunon mifologiyasida kentavr - bu odam va otning gibrididir.

talkative [tɔːkətiv] adj. — vaysaqi
🔸>> When someone is talkative, they talk a lot. >> Agar birortasi talkative bo'lsa, u ko'p gapiradi.

— My aunt is very talkative whenever she is on the phone.
— Xolam telefonda gaplashayotganda juda vaysaqi bo'ladi.

overwhelm [ouvərhˈwelm] v. — mag'lub etmoq, yengmoq
🔸>> To overwhelm is to exist in such a large amount that someone cannot deal with it. >> To overwhelm bu shunday katta miqdorda mavjud bo'lishki, kimdir bunga bardosh bera olmaydi.

— The amount of homework her teacher assigned has overwhelmed her.
— O'qituvchisi bergan uy vazifalari uni haddan tashqari oshirib yubordi.

enigma [iˈnigmə] n. — jumboq 
🔸>> An enigma is someone or something that is mysterious or hard to understand. >> An enigma bu sirli yoki tushunish qiyin bo'lgan biror shaxs yoki biror narsa.

— The theft of the paintings is an enigma to the investigators.
— Rasmlarning o'g'irlanishi tergovchilar uchun jumboqdir.

craft [kræft] v. — o'yib ishlamoq
🔸>> To craft something is to make it using skill. >> Biror narsani craft qilish, malakani ishlatib uni yasashni anglatadi. 

— She crafted the bookcase out of solid pine wood and then painted it.
— U qattiq qarag'ay yog'ochidan kitob javonini yasadi va keyin uni bo'yadi.

compromise [kɒmprəmaiz] v. — o'zaro kelishmoq
🔸>> To compromise is to agree to something that is not exactly what you want. >> To compromise siz aynan xohlamagan biror narsaga rozi bo'lish hisoblanadi. 

— We both compromised about the game we decided to play.
— Biz ikkalamiz ham oʻynashga qaror qilgan oʻyin borasida murosaga keldik.

tramp [træmp] v. — og'ir-og'ir qadam tashlamoq
🔸>> To tramp is to put your feet down in a loud, heavy way as you walk. >> To tramp bu yurayotganingizda oyog'ingizni yerga baland ovozda va og'ir tushirish hisoblanadi. 

— The baby tramped across the floor as he was learning to walk.
— Go‘dak yurishni o‘rganayotganda og'ir-og'ir qadam tashladi.

sociable [souʃəbəl] adj. — chiqishimli, kirishimli
🔸>> When someone is sociable, they are friendly. >> Agar birortasi sociable bo'lsa, u do'stona bo'ladi. 

— Many of my good friends are sociable, but I am shy.
— Ko'plab yaxshi do'stlarim chiqishimli, lekin men uyatchanman.

crook [kruk] n. — firibgar, qallob
🔸>> A crook is someone who is not honest or who commits crimes. >> A crook bu vijdonli bo'lmagan yoki jinoyat sodir etadigan biror shaxs.

— The manager was arrested by the police for being a crook.
— Menejer firibgar sifatida politsiya tomonidan hibsga olindi.

currency [kə:rənsi] n. — valyuta
🔸>> Currency is the form of money used in a certain place. >> Currency bu ma'lum joyda ishlatiladigan pul shakli.

— Elizabeth had to exchange her dollars for foreign currency.
— Elizabet dollarlarini chet el valyutasiga almashtirishga majbur bo'ldi.

moderate [mɒdəreit] adj. — o'rtacha
🔸>> When something is moderate, it is not too big or too small in size or amount. >> Agar biror narsa moderate bo'lsa, uning miqdori yoki hajmi juda katta ham juda kichik ham bo'lmaydi. 

— It takes a moderate amount of patience to be around small children all day.
— Kichkina bolalar bilan kun bo'yi bo'lish uchun o'rtacha sabr-toqat kerak bo'ladi.

burden [bəːrdn] n. — og'ir tashvish
🔸>> A burden is a serious or difficult responsibility. >> A burden bu jiddiy yoki qiyin mas'uliyat.

— Children who do not behave are a burden to their parents.
— O'zini tutmagan bolalar ota-onalariga yuk bo'ladi.

rig [rig] v. — (o'z manfaatini ko'zlab) tashkillashtirmoq
🔸>> To rig something means to dishonestly arrange it. >> Biror narsani rig qilish, uni insofsiz tartibga kelishish demakdir.

— The bad politician rigged the election so that he would win.
— Yomon siyosatchi g'alaba qozonish uchun saylovni soxtalashtirdi.

merge [məːrdʒ] v. — qo'shilmoq, birlashmoq
🔸>> To merge two things is to combine them into one whole thing. >> Ikki narsani merge qilish bu ularni bir butun narsaga birlashtirishdir.

— The storm clouds merged into one large menacing cloud that filled the sky.
— Bo'ronli bulutlar osmonni to'ldirgan katta qo'rqinchli bulutga birlashdi.

innocence [inəsns] n. — soddalik, go'llik 
🔸>> Innocence is a lack of experience of difficult or complex things in life. >> Innocence bu hayotdagi qiyin yoki murakkab narsalarni boshdan kechirmaslikdir.

— Everyone who met her found her innocence to be charming.
— Uni uchratganlarning barchasi uning soddaligini maftunkor deb bilishardi.

perception [pərˈsepʃən] n. — tushuncha, qarash
🔸>> A perception of a situation is a way of thinking about it or understanding it. >> Biror vaziyatni perception etish bu u haqida fikr yuritish yoki uni tushunish usulidir.

— Since he couldn’t see, his perception of life was much different than mine.
— U ko'ra olmagani uchun uning hayot haqidagi tasavvuri menikidan ancha farq qilar edi.

tow [tou] v. — tortmoq, sudramoq
🔸>> To tow something is to pull it. >> Biror narsani tow qilish uni tortish degani.

— The truck was towing a trailer behind it.
— Yuk mashinasi orqasida tirkamani tortib kelayotgan edi.

fragile [frædʒəl] adj. — mo'rt
🔸>> When people or things are fragile, they are not strong and can be damaged easily. >> Agar odamlar yoki narsalar fragile bo'lsa, ular kuchli bo'lmaydi va ularga oson zarar yetadi.

— The fragile glassware was carefully packed into boxes.
— Nozik shisha idishlar ehtiyotkorlik bilan qutilarga qadoqlangan.

shiver [ʃivə:r] n. — titroq, qaltiroq
🔸>> A shiver is a shaking movement the body makes when someone is cold or scared. >> A shiver bu odam sovuqotganda yoki qo‘rqib ketganda tananing titrash harakatidir.

— I got shivers on my way home because it was so cold.
— Uyga ketayotib, havo juda sovuq boʻlgani uchun titrab ketdim.
